reviews.text: I'm not sure why everyone is so obsessed with this place. I thought I must've been missing something the first time I came here but it's been upwards of 6 times now and in this case, first impressions were accurate.

best asian fusion restaurant.. Sea boat scallops is a good start on appetizers and the entree I recommend is the seabAss on wasabi noodles... Very tender and smooth... The interior of the restaurant is like a ordinary living room in the house.. After all, the name of the place speaks for itself...
This is our favorite restaurant for a night out in San Francisco.
Love this place! It is always a palate pleaser for visiting friends and family.

I will just start by saying this was one of the best meals I ever had the pleasure of eating:) The House is a one of a kind, asian fusion restaurant that is a must try when in the city. Every dish comes out looking beautiful and has the taste to match! We took our friends from out of town here so got four appetizers to share: the deep fried salmon rolls, Maine crab cake, asparagus, and the barbecued pork rib special. They were all amazing but I have to say the salmon roll was probably my favorite. For our entrées I had the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delectable! My boyfriend had the warm wasabi house noodles and he loved it. Everything we ordered was so good and flavorful! And our waitress was so sweet, the service was great. Just make sure you make a reservation, it's a smaller restaurant.
As one of the most reviewed restaurants in the city, The House had a lot to live up to. Although my meal was great, my socks stayed snuggly on my feet. Too much hype unfortunately.
It's always a pleasure eating here, definitely on of my favorite restaurants of all time, the quality taste and texture is always on point! The process are reasonable as well!

AMAZINGLY GOOD to say the least. So hidden that we passed it twice looking for it - walking!  We came around lunch time and there was less than a five min wait. I'm not a fan of a lot of curry, but I'm always willing to try everything. The curry noodles with grilled chicken was simply mouth-watering. So good that I truly needed a bib; it splashed all over my shirt, but I wasn't going to let it hinder my taste bud's high. OH. SO. GOOD!!
Came here during my trip to San Francisco under the recommendation of  the high marks on Yelp. The reviews were pretty much spot on in both pros/cons.
Wow, I'm not a foodie but the food here was delicious! I was blown away. Parking may be a challenge!

This place!!  I keep ordering fish dishes at places that have no idea how to cook fish, but THIS place!  They are masters at cooking their fish.  Got the sea bass, and it was so juicy, perfectly flaky, and MELTED in your mouth.  PERFECT.  The dish also came with some tasty garlic noodles and garlic green beans!  To be honest, the sauce was a littttle too salty on the garlic noodles, but the fish more than made up for it.  Really decent proportions.

OBSESSED - This place is amazing. I've been three times and have never been let down. When they make something with truffle - DAMN. I would recommend ordering whatever they recommend. This place is delicious and not to be missed.

There were dishes I loved (sea bass entree and an off-menu hamachi appetizer) and other dishes that didn't sing to me the way they sing to other people. The crab cake was fine, but not out of this world. It had a very nice presentation, but it had average flavor. The blue lake bean tempura is just green bean tempura that, in my opinion, is not worth ordering. The hamachi appetizer, however, was delightful - a very fresh and vibrant dish that I wish they had on their permanent menu.
Pros:
Over 3k reviews and 4.5 stars is as legit as it gets. One of my favorite restaurants in the city that is actually sorta kinda reasonably priced (for SF anyway).
The most appropriate rating for me would be 3.5 stars. My meal was just ok, while my fiance's was fantastic.
Peter Buffett once said, "It didn't matter how big our house was; it mattered that there was love in it." And for me, love comes in the form of food. And at The House, there was A LOT of love!

All I wanted on BirthdAy was Ahi Tuna Steak, and it looks like I came to the right place.  It was the best Ahi I've had, considering both SF and San Diego. They didn't over do the sauce and let the Tuna speak for itself. My girlfriend had the Sea Bass, and my buddy had the Tri Tip. All were amazing.

Wait was well worth it! We ordered the pork chop with pomegranate sauce and the wasabi noodles holy mother! It is to die for it was really good! I'll be back with the rest of my peeps for sure. The only thing is the place is so small but who cares the food was excellent!!!

Visually artistic creations of skyscraper-like dishes that won't disappoint your taste buds. Beautiful mixture of taste, flavor, colors, and texture of the various ingredients. Very small place in simple casual decor.

We called before jumping in a taxi and were able to get a seat when we arrived.  Their menu is not very big but everything we had was very good.  I really liked my meal-the wasabi noodles with flat iron steak.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the noodles were a great texture and taste.  I liked the salmon roll too-not something I would normally order but glad we did.  The dishes are all very nice looking too.  My aunt had the pork chop-the bite I had was very tasty.  The service was very good also.
Aside the fact that this place is TINY, everything else is FANTASTIC!!! Their food, service are really superb.
This is one of our favorite restaurants in SF.  Every dish is excellent, we have tried everything in the menu and the flavors are outstanding.  Our only wish is if it weren't so difficult to get in.
Came here a while back, and wasn't too amazed. I had heard a lot about this place, and was looking forward to it. However, it was slightly underwhelming.

Place is tiny & cramp, no wonder you need to make reservations! Atmosphere is whatever. We were seated next to the door and I wish we weren't because I kept getting whiffs of l'eau de street outside. Luckily, the good aroma of the food soon masked the smell!

Fusion well executed. Dishes were very tasty and amazeballs! 4 stars only because the hostess was not friendly and wrote our reservation name wrong. Other than that must try at 3,158 reviews and 4 1/2 stars you gotta check out this place. Reservation is a must since its a small place.

I can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review of this place.  It's a special place for my wife and I, dating back to times even before we were married.  We've been there off and on for the past decade-and-a-half, and it's always been a delight.
It is so disappointing! The service in this restaurant is awful!!! However, the food is good, we would never go back because of the service and the attitude of the waitresses!!
I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant - it was just OK.
I had the most amazing experience here with my date. The food and the service were exceptional. I'm definitely coming back again and again and again. I had kobe beef and she had an amazing pork chop.

All I can say is perfection!!! The seabass just melts in your mouth. You don't even have to chew. One of my favorite restaurants on SF. You need to make reservations to get a seat. Call early!! Small place so not a lot of tables.

I have been here a few times by now, and I have had the following things: kurobuta pork chop, grilled sea bass with garlic ginger soy, warm wasabi house noodles with angus flatiron steak, as well as a variety of appetizers. Without exception, everything I have ever had from The House has been delicious, and I would recommend them all (perhaps the kurbota pork chop a smidgen more than the others, only because I am a gigantic pork lover).
Love the food. The steak is to die for. The wait and space is not as desirable, but any place good is worth waiting for and cramming into.
Best food and service in SF. Just make sure to make a reservation or you might not get in.

I've had The House a couple of times, and each experience has been progressively worse. The final straw was when my reservation was given to a pestering guest who was there on a first date, my table was extremely wobbly and the sea bass was too salty.

Small place but augh-mazing food. The wait was a bit much and God knows how I love to wait for anything. The staff was great and ensured we had a nice experience. I got to meet the chief after I sent a tip back to the kitchen staff.  Did I mention that the food was awesome!?
A neighborhood gem.

My new favorite place! Went on a spontaneous trip to the bay over the weekend. Wanted to eat somewhere new. I remembered I always wanted to try out The House and thought it would be a perfect place to have dinner. I looked at Yelp and it says it closes at 11pm. We got there around 10:15 and the place was packed. We stood at the door and the owner came up to us and was like 15min wait. I looked at my friend and was like heck yeah not bad of a wait at all. We decided to share the fried calamari and Rib eye steak over wasabi noodles. Steak was cooked to perfection and the wasibi noodles was delicious. We enjoyed every bite. Service was excellent too. They made sure our water was full. Will definitely come back here for sure!
Wonderful dishes!! Nothing more to say, except that we will be back!! :)
I love this place.

Went here with six other friends for a birthday celebration. Got seated almost immediately and had a fantastic experience and Nick was a very attentive waiter. The group was doing bottomless mimosas/margaritas/sangria for $17 so we went with it and ended up having an amazing experience. The wait staff and waiter were nothing short of outstanding. Would definitely come back here with a big group of friends.

This place is awesome! Our waiter, Nick, was great, he was just on top of it! Don pisto's should give him a raise. Bottomless mimosas is the way to go! Food was good, but you outta order a lot of it...portions are small.

Came here on the night I arrived in San Francisco last week. Kind of hard to find because there is no sign, just 3 red lights outside the door. The salsa they give you is fantastic. Just the right amount of heat. I had the chicken tacos for dinner and they were one of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place.
We came on a busy Saturday night without a reservation and waited about 40 minutes.  Luckily there are several places nearby to enjoy a beer while waiting.

Came here for brunch - the staff was fabulous, but everything was only okay. The music playing in the restaurant was super loud and made it hard to hear the waitress or carry on a conversation. The food was good, but the portions were small and I felt like they just tried to fill you up on chips. Good about gluten allergies.

It seemed like every twentysomething in the city was at Don Pisto's on Sat night.  Our group of 14 (all of whom definitely past the twentysomething stage) was bribed with free shots of tequila so we could mosey on outside of the restaurant after we had finished our meal and our pitchers of margaritas.  There was quite a crowd outside waiting for tables. I  didn't realize just how popular this place is!

At the bar, drinking amazing sangria, perfectly spicy green salsa and amazing ceviche.  Bartenders are super attentive, hostess super nice.  Just on the first 15 minutes of being here, I'm sold on coming back.
i cant say enough good things about this place, but here are some highlights:
This place is everything you would ask for in the optimal brunch experience. Here's why:
We had just finished a trip to Alcatraz, and were wondering where we could eat without getting sucked into a tourist trap.
Love this little joint so much! Their lobster dish is so exciting to eat! Love the space and love the vibe.
14.10.11           First Visit

Really good. For sure a cut above your normal Mexican place. Their green salsa is really nice. Just enough heat to get your attention but also tons of fresh flavor. Nice house made chips, almost pita-ish. The guacamole is super creamy and delish. I had the pork chop. It's a) huge and b) fantastic. Great char on the outside but just still pink on the inside. So, safe but super juicy. The cucumber salad was a nice surprise. I expected it to be a waste of space. But it really had a lot of flavor.
Good food and service, bass on the stereo was up too loud though. Made things a little too loud.
The fish tacos at this place are the best one I have tried in a long long time. The complementary nachos are unique and freshly made as well. Love this place

I LOVE this place! We came here for brunch. Bottomless orange and pineapple mimosas! Mexican food! What is there to not love? I ordered the ham and poblano scramble. So. Delicious. The eggs were so creamy. What amazed me was how hot my dish was throughout my meal. My food was perfectly warm until I couldn't eat any more (there had to have been 3-4 eggs in my dish!) and the cheese was melty and yummy. We were also served bottomless chips and green salsa. Our waitress was super attentive, and came over to refill our waters and mimosas several times and never let our glasses bottom out. This place bumps top 40 music, which I thought was fun. Not so loud that you can't have a conversation, but audible enough to feel happy on a Sunday morning. And with bottomless mimosas, who couldn't be happy?
Don Pistos I must say, coming from a Mexican family in Los Angeles, you have made me LOVE salsa once more! You know it's good when your nose is running!

OMMITY NOM NOM NOMITY! Can't believe some peeps are giving Don Pisto's bad reviews, but then again, I did go for brunch for my pals birthday, and my friends paid for me and all took turns giving me massages.

I've heard a lot about Don Pisto's but never made my way to north beach to actually try it out...until now. What a pleasant surprise! I went on a week night around 8pm and was able to be seated right away, no reservations. The hostess was super friendly from the get-go. And the service only got better as the night went on. Our server, her helper, the bartender, everyone seemed to really like working there! As well, the food is amazing. Everything from the complimentary chips and salsa to their tacos and pork dish... So yummy! Everything was well seasoned, perfectly cooked, and above and beyond my expectations. Thanks for a great meal!!

So I did end up getting to try the burger, and it is top notch. It has cooked bacon and grilled onions ground right into the beef, and it comes together perfectly. It is too bad that they only do it on Wednesdays.
I can't believe I haven't yelped this place sooner! Literally everything is amazing from the authentic street tacos to the chips guac and salsa that is completely addicting!

Ok, so as I just told the waiter, every time I think the Mexican food is improving in Vermont, all I have to do is come here for the superb carnitas and margaritas, and sorry Vermont, it just WON'T DO!!  Not going home.

The food here is absolutely delicious. It's truly outstanding and this would be a five-star review based on the food alone. However, the service and atmosphere were so unfavorable, they far outweigh the quality of the food itself.
Food is bland and way overpriced.  The drinks seem really weak to me and the others I've dined with here.
THE BEST GUACAMOLE EVERRRR!! I also tried all their tacos and I thought it was good, but not mind blowing...well, almost.

Amazing!! As a transplant to California from the farm in Iowa I was really skeptical about ordering the pork chops. Most chops are thin and void of flavor. This chop was so big it allowed for left overs. The flavor was simply amazing!!  The chop was cooked to perfection (don't let s little pink in the middle scare you). The service was good nothing outstanding but good. I will be back!!

Had an array of tacos:  snapper, shrimp, & chicken.  All were excellent and authentic.  The complimentary salsa verde was also very good.  Highly recommended place...easy to miss though since it is on a side street and not obviously marked...google maps on the phone is your friend.

Don Pisto's deserves its near-5-star rating.  The food is incredible and the service is great. The only downside is a function of its popularity: expect a wait if you come during a busy period. We went during senior citizen hour, ~6pm on a Sunday, and by the time we left the place was packed and people were spilling into the street waiting.
Really delicious salmon...tempted to give it 5 stars based on that. Fish and Carne Asada tacos were great but not mind blowing.
Oh, Don Pisto's, I will return.
Bumping rating down from 4 stars to 3.
this place is more tacolicious than tacolicious (or any other taco joint in this town).
Pretty good food and service. I couldn't decide between two items so they let me try one on the house.
Absolutely amazing! Extremely authentic and tasted like gourmet Mexican food. The staff was bet good as well.

The food is deeeeelicious, the service is good, the music is great. They give you freshly made tortilla chips and salsa verde when you sit down, and they refreshed it for us when we asked. Their Al Pastor tacos were amazing, as was their Pollo Asado, and their flour tortillas are freshly made in house right when you order.  They have Mexican diet cola which was delish.
It's super noisy in here! No sound buffer and they are playing music with a very heavy bass. So far the service is great. Hopefully our food will be also.

A new SF fave!  Came here a couple of weekends ago for the first time and would definitely come back.  We fell in love with the salsa there, so much that I've tried to recreate it at home.  We ordered the guac, ceviche, pork chop, and fish and carnitas/al pastor (can't remember, the margarita was strong) tacos.  What really made the dinner was the pork chop, WOW!  Super juicy and flavorful, probably the best pork chop I've had to date.  FYI: Expect a long wait and it's pretty loud inside, we had to yell across the table, but it's a fun vibe.  Lots of bars in the area to chill at while you're waiting for your table also.
Underwhelmed after hearing so many positive things about this place.  It almost feels like anytime you said "Don Pistos" the response you get is "OMG i LOVE that place".

What an amazing little hole in the wall discovery. Late night after going to the exploratorium and yelping around, we discovered this little gem. As packed as it was, we got seated right away and our server was awesome! She was well-knowledge in the food.
Don Pistos....

Great food.  I had the grill chicken sandwich for $10.  It was perfectly done.  Juicy and tasty.  Not much an atmosphere because it is a permanent food truck with outdoor seating arranged in an enclosed back "patio".

Do not be put off by the food truck facade. This is a hidden treasure in the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf. Family owned business with Argentinian roots, they are really great people. They do take some time to get the orders out but your wait will be rewarded, so relax. This is not a pre-made, turn and burn food truck. My favorites are the taguito burger and the arroz con pollo. Get the squeeze bottle of spicy guacamole and ask for some extra chimichurri sauce. They know how to grilled meats and you will not be disappointed with the flavors. I think their burger is one of the best in the city.

Great food!!! Reasonable prices!!! And very nice staff even though I don't know how to speak Spanish lol. The meat was very tender but I wished there was more flavors and seasoning but other than that it's great. Would definitely come back
Best Argentinean restaurant in SF
If you are looking for empanadas, this is the place to go. I wouldnt eat empanadas in a fancy restaurant, hidden spot in a highly touristic zone.

The roast beef and chicken part of the mixed grill and the empanadas with cheese in them are amazing. There's like this pesto sauce on the meats and they're done perfect. I liked the spanish tortilla as well. Need to come back for the paella.
Delicious! We had that huge meat platter- it was amazing. They have a nice back patio to eat at.

This place is great! A friend of mine had been here before and recommended we go back again, and we did. Boy, did we enjoy it. We both got empanadas to go, which I believe were both beef. They weren't necessarily cheap, like $4 or $5 each, but they were filling and delicious and frankly nobody should really eat more than one or two of them. So, if you're looking for good empanadas around the fisherman's wharf area, this is the place to go.
Tried out Tanguito near Fishermen's Wharf for a late lunch Sat 10/25/14.  It's a permanent food truck that's next to The Cod Mother and Carmel Pizza on Jones St.

Great food, reasonable prices and friendly staff.  Husband and I came to San Francisco on our honeymoon.  I'm an avid fan of finding local favorites and this placed filled the bill.  The food is fresh and flavorful. We had the empanadas the saffron rice with chicken and the burger.  Everything tasted great and portions were huge.  We ate here twice during our week in San Francisco and would have been back again had our flight not left at 6:30am.
Really great food and friendly service!!

Not bad. Not bad at all. The steak sandwich was a little pricier than I was used to but damn if it wasn't delicious. Usually food truck don't fill me up, but this sandwich was filled with a generous serving of meat.

I love Tanguito. I work in the Fisherman's Wharf area and they are by far my favorite lunch option here. Great empanadas. Great burgers. Great rice plates. The service is friendly and they do an outstanding job. Just do yourself a favor and call ahead if you hope to beat the lunch rush.

Damn how refreshing is it to find feel good food from someone who takes pride in there product. This spot has taste filled goods that r cooked when ordered so it takes a moment to get BUT don't worry about that cause the second the food touches your lips Mmmmmmm let the pleasure begin!

I must have passed Tanguito two or three times before I found it. It's a truck/stand that on first look is unobtrusive, on second look unattractive and as visually unappealing as the rest of the Fisherman's Wharf area. I ordered a corn & cheese empanada and an onion & cheese empanada. The corn & cheese empanada was ok...nowhere near as good as the humitas empanadas I've had in Northern Argentina. The onion & cheese empanada, however, was heaven. On my first bite, warm cheese flooded into my mouth and I was filled with nostalgia for my favorite pizza place in Buenos Aires where the pizza was cooked upside down and cheese gushed all over the place unless a cook put a wooden wedge in place to hold the pie together. The owner walking around the place saying "Bárbaro" (Argentina word for cool) reminded me of a king striding through his ramshackle kingdom. Any other place, he would have annoyed me, but at Tanguito I had to agree with the sign that said, "Yes we've seen the chipped paint, but have you tried the empanadas?"

A lot of people like scorched, over-salted meat.  If you're one of them, this is the place for you.  If not, do NOT imagine you can enjoy the delicious fish and chips next door and sit together with the meat-eaters in your party.  You will not be allowed sit down with their paying customers who came there with you.  These people are not interested in making their customers happy, they just sling hash.  The scorched, over-salted sausage we tried was even too much for my meat-eating husband.
I had about 4 burgers in my stay here in San Fran and this one was by far the best one. If you can get past the poor service then this place is definitely for you!
Found this place through yelp and we were very happy! The steak sandwich may be one if the best I've ever had and the empanadas were also great!
AMAZING!
The star rating is solely for the service, they banned me before I got the chance to try their food. How does one get banned from this lovely place, you ask?

the worst steak place I've ever been too .steak was awful.I ordered the steak sandwich and it was burned and the taste was not good at all.and my boyfriend ordered chicken sandwich that one was much better. I don't know why people their saying it's awesome place but trust me not  at all. it was pricy food but not good quality not recommended .
I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was amazing. Not the best looking place but food is amazing

Drove all the way from San Jose to the fisherman wharf after watching the review of this shack from "Check, please". Following suggestion from other yelpers, I called ahead of time to place my orders, Tanquito burger, Garlic fries, seafood paella, and beef empanadas. Got stuck in traffic so I arrived 1 hour late. The fries were soggy. My friend said the burger was good, flavorful with grilled peppers and onions. I had the paella and I was turned off by the imitation crab. The saffron rice was so overwhelming I couldn't taste the seafood.

Tanguito was one of those places I've had bookmarked for a loooong while. I even tried to go a few months ago, but thankfully called ahead because they were closed due to a fire! It took them a few months to get back on their feet, but now they're up and running again.
I thought the empanadas were moist, generous, and better than most places in the Bay Area.  (and yes, I loved them in Argentina).
Yelp 10-year Celebration UYE: SF Embarcadero Food Crawl!
Tanguito 2.0

This is a great place with lot of variety on the menu from empanadas, chorizo, steak, etc; You can't beat the price, size and quality for a steak dish in any place in the city. I would recommend anyone to come by and try it. It is served by their own owners, a very nice coiuple. Gotta love Argentinean food of course!
I'd give this place a solid 3.5 stars, but I'll round up because I would come back to try the platters.
Wow. Just our luck to find parking in front of this gem. The fact that they are in a tightly jammed area, it's easier to pay for parking then to find street parking.

In town on a little vacation and rather than eat at the touristy places on pier 39, came here (thanks Yelpers!). Delicious!!! Authentic and wonderful. Not a bad price- two people for $25. Cozy seating area in the back.

This is the only restaurant that serves real Argentinian food in the entire Bay Area. I have been to a few other Argentinian restaurants in the past but none of them could bring to the table the kind of flavor I was looking for. Tanguito reminded me of the my stay in Rosario in 2004. I have tried empanadas in many restaurants in the Bay Area and I can say the Tanguito is the only restaurant that makes real Argentine EMPANADAS. Not only that, they have empanadas with assorted fillings that are to die for. I also recommend the t-burger, it was terrific! Tanguito is ideal when it's hot because they have a nice patio where people can sit down and relax.
Get the T-Burger! Thick meat, lots of cheese. Will definitely fill you up.

Seeking out a lunch spot after an Alcatraz Island tour, Yelpers steered me to this 4.5 star gem among tourist chaos.  It was late afternoon, so my wife and I shared a spinach empanada and saffron rice with steak dish.  The rice and steak dish is absolutely worth sharing, given the two separate pieces of meat and plentiful rice, which had peppers, onions, and mushrooms mixed in.  The steak was flavorful and I could not be more pleased with that selection.

The best of the best! The food is always amazing and pretty authentic for being in the US and in San Francisco. The price its also very affordable and every time I bring someone here they absolutely love it.
Ordered:
The best argentine food ever!!!!!! Food is dope af, everyone should come and try it!!!
Just stopped in on a lark. Fabulous empanadas (very authentic and delicious)Highly recommend

Food truck in the *most* touristy neighboorhood in the city. I'm probably nit-picking but the food is amazing and you get enormous plate for the moderate price. It is a family run business and you can seat yourself at the back patio area.  Empanadas and steak & rice are a must try.

This place was a hidden gem. Empanadas were amazing, crepes were great. Etc etc. owners were super awesome and were eager to chat. Got there a little after 7 but still open bc people were still lining up. If you have the chance stop by you will not be disappointed.
I had an entirely pleasant evening at the bar.
What is an Italian restaurant without a wild boar ragu over pasta?  Baked penne with marinara sauce, ricotta and mozzarella was fantastic, eggplant rolletinni - not so good.

I went with my husband. I had the burrata salad (fresh mozzarella, tomatoes and arugula) and the capressa pizza.  My husband the bean soup and pesto pasta. We also had the family house wine.  All were outstanding. Only minor complaint is there were no meat dishes. We were hoping for wild boar pasta or other meats typically found in Italian Restaurants but none were offered. It might be vegetarian? Wait staff are terrific.  We greatly

A solid "meh - i've had better".  We went in with high hopes of a 4.5 star Italian spot.  Also with others saying they were blown away.. they seriously must have never eaten at an actually awesome Italian restaurant.
We just had dinner here again! Twice in 10 days! This place is addicting. The food is incredible. The kitchen is like a Magic Shop.......

Small, welcoming, great service, amazing food. What else can I say? I love how unpretentious this restaurant is: the name of the food is in Italian, as you'd expect in any self-respecting North Beach restaurant, but the descriptions are simple and to the point. The starter platters won't fill you up before your mains, which is good news considering the servings are generous. The tiramisu was really good.
Tasty Italian food. The lasagna was pretty okay, and the few pizzas were good. That being said, nothing flew my mind.
JUST GET THE LASAGNA!! I mean everything else here looks absolutely amazing but the lasagna - OH MY!
Beautiful, potent, questioning neighborhood Italian location. Household owned and the quality pizza I've had in SF. Make sure you are attempting the fruit and nutella pizza for dessert.
A picky eater thinks this is fantastic food!

I love this place.  The food was fresh and who doesn't love homemade noodles and pizza!!  The wonderful owners Stephania and Walter are from Lucca, where I have family, so I was extra critical and the food was fantastic.  I wish they had protein on the menu, but other than that the Wine List was good, we had a tasty Vermentino and sat outside.  The owners should come to the tables every night, they are charming and people want to meet the Chef and owner, and hear their beautiful Italian accent.

Thanks to Yelp for steering us to this authentic and unpretentious family-run Italian place in North Beach.  Mama Stefania and papa Walter are the real deal - from Lucca in Tuscany with old family recipes and their sons and other family members. The lasagna is the best I have ever had - with it's silky soft noodles, creamy ricotta and perfectly tangy/salty bolognese. The thin crust pizzas are fantastic - especially the Monte Verde and the salami. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is very welcoming. This has become one of our new favorites in San Francisco.
nice italian restaurant - i recommend the diavola pizza. 3-stars because i'm not blown away, but i might go back if im in the area. lovers of thin crust pizza will really enjoy this place.
Very good dinner

The service was the worst. The place was empty so I asked if we could sit at a four top so we could sit side by side. He sat us down but then insisted that I set a cross from my partner. I told him but I wanted to sit by her side and he continued to make a fuss. He began to tell me if I did not move I had to leave. I stood up and walked out. I understand if it was crowded and there was people waiting to sit, but the issue was that it was completely empty. If you like over pretentious assholes this is your place.
Found this through yelp.  Didn't look like much from the outside when we arrived, but the food was awesome.  great service and fun people working the place.  Definitely worth visiting

Fantastic family-owned restaurant. You'll be either served or be waited on by one of the two sons, the dad is behind the bar and mom is in the kitchen. Very good, true Italian food. Wonderful atmosphere, great owners, good food all around. You may have to wait in line and the parking in the area is horrible, but it's hard to find parking in San Francisco no matter what.

I recently ate here while in town for a Giants game.  I had no reservation, but the staff remembered me and got my group some seats.  The food was excellent as each and every time I've been here.  I love the thin crust pizza!!  It you are looking for a casual yet upscale place to enjoy some real Italian style pizza with a bottle of wine and nice service, go try this place.
Excellent service (very helpful Italian waiters). Pizza is delicious. The only downside is that it is super loud when the little restaurant is full.
I had the most amazing pizza at this place. Honestly, I don't recall anywhere that came even close to this place in my many years in California.
Charming and cozy place. The pizza's are delicious- don't miss the truffle salame pizza!

I'm giving the restaurant 3 stars primarily because of the competition in the area.  It is good food and you can't really go wrong.  I had the Lasagna and my wife had one of their thin Pizzas.  She loved it and considered it to be one of the best she's had.  She loves thin-crust pizza.  I didn't taste it, but it looked good.  My Lasagna was good, but it was one of those "white" type of lasagnas that didn't have a lot of tomato sauce flavoring.  It was good, but it is not my type.  It is worth considering if that is the style of Italian that they prepare there in their other dishes and it is what you like.

Made a day trip to SF, up from Orange County.  Walked from SoMa out here, which is always an enjoyable thing but particularly on a spectacular sunny day.  Great views of Alcatraz, Transam etc. nearby.
Amazing Italian food! The owners treat you like family but are very professional.

I will admit that I am basing this review on a single pizza (the mushroom, arugula) so that is probably less than fair.  Nevertheless, it was tasty but something was missing...the porcini mushrooms needed more seasoning to make them more assertive in the presence of the arugula and the shaved Parmesan.  It was an above average pie, hence the 3 stars but not excellent or earth-shattering.
This restaurant absolutely blew me away when I was in SF for work. Everything from the salumi plate, through mains, to the dessert pizza was top notch.

Very very good! The pizza is thin, just like they do in Lucca. Very authentic. The eggplant parm was outrageous; simple, fresh and packed with flavor. Good wine list. Slightly pricey, but outstanding italian food from the Tuscany region.
LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Decent, not awesome. Shocked at the outstanding reviews. Maybe I've lived here too long to think this place is amazing. Pasta was swimming in sauce. Table had a dirty film on it. Ambiance better than bleak, certainly not festive. Meh.

Love this place! The venue is small and quaint, the pasta is usually great, and the pizza is amazing. I've had one inconsistent visit where the pasta was slightly overcooked but the pizza is always great. They do better with the more authentic Italian stuff whereas the lasagna might not be something I would order here.
Best italian pizza in America. I LOVED their food and will come back to eat more
Loved it!! The staff is all family members and I got a hug from Mom when I left. Pizza is awesome.
Came here based on the reviews with some co-workers

This place is legit!  Run by an Italian family with the mother picking out the ingredients each day, the father running the dining room, and the sons as waiters.  My Italian mother-in-law almost cried saying this pizza was the closest thing she had had to her mother's since coming to North America.
Pretty good authentic (very) thin pizza.
Excellent menu, service and wine selection. Also was very impressed with the cost, particularly in San Fran. I'd recommend this and will visit again when we are in town!

Had a wonderful dinner at this delightful restaurant.  Hubby and I shared the apple and cheese salad - light and tasty.  We also shared an order of lasagne and a pizza that had sausage and thin sliced onions - all ingredients were fresh, light and even homemade pasta for the lasagne noodles.  We ended our evening with tiramisu and cannoli.  All was so good and tasty.  Our waiter was the owners son, and was friendly, nice and we really liked him.  The owner (Dad) came over and chatted with us.  We loved this place and will be back.  A good idea to have reservations.
loved this place too...pasta so fresh...had the pesto mmmm.

We arrived exactly on time for a table we booked at 6.30pm, ordered a salad and a couple of pizzas. The salad arrived when expected but by 7.20pm we still hadn't received our pizzas. After some gentle prompting they arrived and were great. The service was otherwise good.
Great thin crust pizza. Toppings were fresh, crust with crisp. Fantastic service as well. Sit outside on a warm day, but make sure not to sit in the tables that tilt too much.

Yum !!! I had the veggie potato. It was delish! Mushrooms, cheese, steamed broccoli, peas, corn, green onions and sour cream. Fresh and pretty healthy. Staff was nice. Actual place was way too hot inside to enjoy eating there but the food is yummy! It's like a cheap chipotle set up so if your looking for a nice sit down place, this isn't it.

This place is awesome. Came here before the firework show and I was very impressed. The pre made spuds were what we ordered. We got our order very quickly and employees did not hesitate to offer is sauces to try with our potatoes. Staff was excellent and friendly. We stayed in there for maybe 20 minutes but left blown away. Not bad for just randomly stumbling into this place for a quick bite
If you want a nice food at affordable price, this is the place. The salads that we ordered was delicious and fresh.  Close to major area attractions. Friendly staff ! Recommended!
This place is awesome! I only stopped by here because it was close to my hotel, but I'm so glad I did! I ordered the Shrimp Spud and it was delicious. They are fast and friendly!

The food and the service here is absolutely outstanding. You get top quality food and ingredients for a great price along with wonderful customer service. I work about a block away so we order food here pretty often and the quality is consistent. I would highly recommend eating here!

Before I was forced to go gluten free a year ago, I would have said a hot potato restaurant would be a horrible idea. Now that I am gluten free, this concept is the best idea since sliced bread (all puns intended).

Long story short the food here is great and staff is awesome. Can't recommend enough. I got the steak spud which is great as always and if they have the sweet potato brownies out I would recommend too.

Their potatoes are huge and honestly worth it's price. I wouldn't suggest getting your own if you just want a snack. The combinations a pretty weird but they work well together. I got the steak spud and I was just  couldn't really finish it by myself though.
Nice idea. Good food. Baked potato stuffed with your choice of veggies and meats and condiments. Location is great too, right next to Fisherman's Wharf.

Good food but service can be much better! Got the Wharf spud and the spud was cold, asked if they could reheat it somehow but would not accommodate us. Had to run next door to 7-eleven to use their microwave. Not cool!

Pretty impressed, fast service, nice guys. Great quick place to get a bite to eat. We got the number one seller. Chicken potatoe with hot wing sauce, that was delish. And then custom made one with cheese and broccoli for the girls.

Great spuds, but I only order from them about half as often as I want to.  Turns out drunk and tired me wants hot spuds... generally around 9:20pm, and they close at 9pm on weekends, and 8 during the week.  So, definitely not a late night place.  But super tasty!!  Really wish they were open until 10/10:30 on Friday/Saturday nights.
I reviewed this on FB. It was excellent the customer service was top notch! We were there for a cruise back in February.
Add on is 2 for $0.65 each my love and I added avo & mushrooms which are not a bad deal!
We were looking for a good yet cheap way to end our first night in San Francisco when I came across this place on yelp.
I love it. Who doesn't love potatoes? You'd seriously have to be a monster to hate on a good old fashioned baked potato.

My boyfriend and I have been regulars here for years. Back when we first started coming, every once in awhile we would arrive and they would be out of potatoes, which was super disappointing. Now, we usually order our veggie spuds in advance over the phone to ensure no mishaps and eat in. The order is always ready for us when we arrive, and we love finishing up with a sweet potato brownie.  I am a big fan of the various Tabasco sauce options and have noticed that the music is always great.  The manager is also excellent. Bottom line: Delicious, healthy, reasonably priced option in the Wharf.
Guys this is one great place!!  Healthy, tasty, and a great price!  What more could you ask for????
Read a bunch of very good reviews and thought to give it a shot. Tried a  seafood one and the veg one. Lacked flavor and seasoning.

One of the best baked potatoes I've ever had! I was walking from the parking garage to fishermans wharf and good thing I took the route I took because I discovered this gem! I ordered "the wharf" and it was perfectly cooked. There was corn cheese butter onions and green onions, with sour cream but what topped it off was the crab in the center ! The crab was not imitation either. It was sooooooo good. I will make sure I stop by everytime I hit the city. I'm so glad I found this place! I'm just a big fan of potatoes maybe that's why I like this place so much lol

The colors reminded me of Sbarros and the set up is basically a Subway/Chipotle...for potatoes.  I don't think this place is so good that you should go out of your way to visit but they definitely know how to make their potatoes! The potatoes they use are big and are cooked well. The guy making my baked potato didn't skimp on any of the toppings and stuffed it full.

I am not a fan of having a potato on its own but Hot Spud made me go WOW! We had a Veggie one and one chicken spud and i swear we did not speak for the 10-15 odd minutes that we were eating. Totally recommended! Oh and great service too.
I know.  It's weird.  Don't let that stop you from trying it.
Lots of topping choices for their huge baked potatoes.  For $7.45 you can choose four toppings and a sauce.  Salads and toppings are all fresh.  Friendly service.

What is there not to love about a potato?  Add some delicious toppings, and it's a bonus.  I already proclaim that potatoes alone are one, if not the ultimate, of my favorites foods.  Hot Spud catered lunch for my office so it was set up as a "build-your-own" baked potato bar.  Not sure what the setup is like at the restaurant location, but this was a hit.  They brought a variety of meats, veggies, and sauces to load up on top of the giant baked potatoes.  *Important to note that a giant supply of chopped up bacon was included.*  Anyway, moral of the story is that this was a rather tasty baked potato experience.
Whoa! This place gives you quite the meal! Glad I gave this a try,  coming back on my next visit for sure!

I go here about once a week.  Since I found out I have celiac disease about a year and a half ago, its one of the few places in SF that has NEVER made me sick.  I love the chicken spud and I always get extra chicken to make it a dinner sized portion.  The sweet potato brownies are awesome!  Very nice owner and friendly staff.  Its fun to get a spud and then go to Musée Mécanique..which is a couple blocks away.  Also nice to call ahead and get them to go for a picnic...
Best potatoes I've ever eaten. But then again, when you slather butter, sour cream, onions, cheese, and then top it off with crab meat, how can you ever go wrong?

Came across this place and decided to give it a try even though I just ate. The concept alone was worth giving this place a try in my opinion...how can you say no to a place that specializes in baked potatoes?!
This place is good! Just that it's around the corner on Mason. If they were more visible they would be really busy, but Hey. Word of mouth they are good!

Service is very bad. Staffs are unfriendly and place is dirty. There was no napkin instead a toilet paper towel was placed at the counter in exchange of the napkin. Rude middle eastern guy. Unpolite and uncourteous. Wiping the counter with a dirty cloth.

Hot Spud is like a Chipotle but for potatoes instead of burritos. The idea seems cool but in reality it is still just baked potatoes with toppings (lots of toppings). It is just not something to get too excited about unless you are a real potato lover.

Thank heavens for this place cause I could never satisfy my baked potato food craving in SF unless I happened to go to a steakhouse. So awesome in every way from the menu offerings, to the staff, to the location. I've started to make it a lunchtime habit here on my days off - hopping on the Muni 47 inbound, and afterwards I take a walk through Pier 39 down to the Ferry Bldg. Love the friendliness of the staff - they offered me a discount on my last visit even though I didn't work around the area. My fave spud is the veggie which I add shrimp, jalapeno, and chipotle tartar sauce to. Definitely try their sweet potato dessert offerings too - the brownies are the bomb - Mmmmmm delicious!

Amazing, beautiful, sexy baked potato stuffed with cheese and veggies $8. It reminded me of traveling in Istanbul and baked potato bars on every corner. Hot Spud is very Celiac Disease friendly with many gluten-free options including desserts! It is not worthy of a special out of the way trip if you are not nearby or not gluten intolerant. If you are local be sure to tell them, it is an extra 10% off your order (tourist tax). This is a perfect wintertime food (it is not very healthy but it's OK)!
Good salads. The place doesn't look as put together as I originally thought it would. But that's no biggy. There isn't much variety to the menu. Just salads and potatoes.

Think of Chipotle or Pieology's food prep layout: horizontal counters where the servers prepare the food. Now replace the burritos/pizzas with baked potatoes, then remove the aspect of Chipotle/Pieology where you always freely pick your items with more of a rigid fixture. Do that, and you end up with Hot Spud. Great concept, but short on execution.
Great idea, great food. The salad and potato (bacon, veggies and blue cheese) were filling and delicious. Good drink selection, nice clean facilities.

excellent grub and Gluten-Free brownies and cheesecake, are you kidding me?!?!  One of the best G-F desserts i have ever had.  Staff was very friendly especially considering the fact that we walked in about 2 munutes before they closed for the day.

I'm upgrading one star based on consistency, flavor, and all-around niceness. Took in daughter for the first time yesterday....she ordered a simple potato with traditional fixin's and gobbled it right up. I ordered the Wharf again....yep, total rut....and again loved it. And they are so incredibly friendly there. Why can't you open one in uptown/downtown Oakland? I'm telling you, the lunch business would be out the door! Yum-a-licious.

Tried this place after randomly seeing it while walking around. Since I'm a potato lover... it called out to me. I looked it up on Yelp real quick, saw good reviews and decided try it. At first I was a bit thrown off by the price but wanted to try it anyways. I'm sure glad I tried it!
This is the best pizza in SF.  Yes I said it.  Living in North Beach for 7 years, I have been spoiled by some amazing pizza spots in the neighborhood but Carmel Pizza Company takes the cake.

I liked the place, especially considering it was open late night and the staff was a delight. Tried a few different pizzas. I don't eat much, but I finished my whole pizza. The restaurant itself is semi-indoors, because it has covered walls/roof, but it's not an actual building. I liked it for what it was and the crowd was a bit of local and a bit of tourists.

Last 30 minutes open and we were welcomed as if we We're the first of the day - we had 5 pizzas and shared them all -  asked for surprise and got fantastic -  the arugula on the Diablo was so awesome !
Sometimes a simple pizza is all you need in life, and I'm glad I found CPC. Friendly mom and pop service, quick production, and fresh and flavorful pizza with a great tasting dough.
Great sidewalk food. Nice service, good food, wonderful downtown atmosphere. A must for a quick bite for lunch.
Really tasty pizza in a fun, quasi-outdoor area. Probably more money than you'd want to pay for the amount of pizza you're getting, but they had a margherita for $12 (all the others were $16-$19).
Thin pizza with crispy crust. Had the Romantica with prosciutto-delicious.
On the advice of our son, my husband & I ate lunch here on a recent trip.  We chose the Margherita - it was wonderful! Great sauce, cheese and crust and very hot! They
Excellent wood-fired pizza! The food was great and the staff was friendly! The bruschetta was phenomenal as well!

This place was AMAZING! We are in SF on a company trip, and this was chosen as a company lunch and no one was disappointed! from the friendly service, amazing and cute atmosphere, to the phenomenal food (I had the Tulle Pizza (all veggie!), I would definitely say to check this place out!!!

I own an Italian Restaurant that's been open for 26 years, so every time I go to SFO I have pizza for lunch and pasta for dinner. You know, to see what's happening in the "big city" and get ideas. Well today when I opened yelp to see who was número uno, I found this Carmel Pizza. So I drive over from Union Square where my wife gets her hair cut. As I get closer going down Columbus I start thinking WHAT?? Down here? You gotta be kidding. Then I see the place and I'm thinking . . . No Way.  This must be a mistake. Boy was I in for a surprise. I met the owner standing outside and got some change for the meter. I asked him to make me his favorite pizza. Mama Mia! I was not ready for a pizza that good. It tasted amazing. Sliced Heirloom tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, fresh basil. Ok so far. Then, basalmic reduction, prosciutto, and arugula topped with fresh shaved parmesan.  Perfect in every way. Quality that you could taste in every bite. Beautiful wood fired crispy crust. Later, I had a beautiful big dinner at Scala's. When I got home (10:30 at night) the first thing I did was eat the other half of the Carmel pizza that was going to be my breakfast. I was thinking about it all the way home to Monterey and couldn't stop myself. Now that's great pizza!
Great pizza!  Also had the Caesar salad it was very good.  Great outdoor atmosphere.
Very good pizza. If you don't like brick oven pizza (I.e. Occasional char), then don't eat here. But then you'd be missing out...

EDITED ON 10/22 to add: I appreciate the additional response from the owner and want to be totally fair here. I have absolutely no reason to slander their business. With my 10 percent employee discount -- which they've since DISCONTINUED -- I paid $8 for the pepperoni pizza two years ago. I think I know what I paid and I think she knows, too. A few months ago the price was $15 total, with tax. I think that's where the discrepancy is when she says $14, which is fair enough.Regardless, you will see that the price of their pepperoni pizza isn't listed on their current online menu, nor are the prices of their toppings. BUT -- let's just say it's true that the price started at $10 and is now $14. That's still a 40 percent increase! Are you saying the price of your pepperoni and/or other artisan ingredients has gone up that much? And if so, aren't you able to absorb at least some of that price increase for the sake of your customers?

It's the best kept secret on the Embarcadero. Very reasonably priced and good selection. The sauce is incredible. I had The Marinara and devoured it. House wine has a great flavor too. Beautiful spot away from the usual fish and chips and chowder bowls. I'll definitely go back!
Got the romantico pizza and it was awesome. Atmosphere is very cool with a succulent garden.
Fresh. Hot. Grease free and very tasty ingredients. Beer selection could be better but the pie itself delicious.

My husband and I made this one of the stops on our food tour last year. We were instantly impressed. The atmosphere is great, lots of people watching. The outdoor patio area is very relaxing. They have lots of succulents and signs posted around. The service was great and the Margharita pizza was delicious and wood fired. You can see all the wood piled up in the back. The pizza is thin crust and full of flavor. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

I would rather eat Pieology. This place was overpriced and what made it worse, outside in their chalkboard it said, "pizza ready in 5 mins." It took us 20-25 mins to get our pizza. I honestly think they forgot about our order because people that ordered after me received their pizza before me.

Got to say the pizza here was pretty good. My wife and I had the Margarita pizza and we were very happy with it. The pizza has that wood fire taste that I love! It is outdoor seating only, just keep that in mind.

Great pizza, prepared in a wooden stove. The location is great (very close to pier 39) and offers a decent meal for adults and kids. Please notice the prices are a bit higher than a std. Pizza ( probably because they are close to the pier) and they charge you 20% more over menu price. We tryed the std. (Mariners), we tried anchovies and pacorino (great!), also black olives and pepperoni. All were eaten by kids and adults for kids. Don't waste your time in the big tourist places
Pizza was good, but light on the sauce. Excellent customer service and pizza only took about 10 minutes. Light sauce probably allows pizza to cook faster.  Maybe they would add more sauce on request.
You can't go wrong with this place. Pizza is delicious! Plus I like that it's just a hop,skip and a jump from Pier 39,when visiting like me! :-) Sitting is limited but that's ok it's worth the wait
Great pizza, good house wine. A little pricey for the food but overall a great alternative to some of the more touristy spots in the area.

They close at 8, but we ordered at 7:45 for pickup and they were happy to accommodate us. The wood-fired pizza was excellent all around (and I'm snobby about my pizza) and the staff was very friendly. We didn't stay to eat but the small outdoor eating space was warm and comfortable. Only knock is that the pizza was a tad small for nearly $20. I think they need a larger-size option.

The owner does not have any customer service skills at all !!! If you order anything from the most amazing place for fish next store cod mother {she's amazing customer service is amazing cod mother } the owner of this pizzeria will ask you to leave and then if you ask to stay because your party ordered food from her business she will let you know she doesn't care about you or your business !!' Wow!!! All these good reviews but every time I pass by it's empty I'm not sure who's posting these reviews !! Lol ps the pizza is over priced and dry......... So her response was rude condescending as usually no customer service skills at I know she has small business just trying to survive !!! Why bash codmother ??? Why lol

The pizza is solid but pretty unremarkable.  They are ridiculous about their neighbors' food.  Four members of my family ordered drinks and two pizzas and they wouldn't let me sit there with the fish i got at codmothers.  Whatever, i just gave them some fish and took a couple bites and left.  Really petty and lame.  I'd recommend taking your food to go and eating at the beach in front of ghirardelli square if you find yourself in a similar situation.
Pizza was great and the place looks real nice and sometimes you get to enjoy the birds
I believe this is the best pizza place in all of San Francisco. I love the food and the service that my mother and I received.

Great little pizza spot! The pizza was delicious! Crispy and full of flavor. The patio is adorable! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of the price. The prices are too high for the size of the plates.
Excellent and fresh handmade pizza. Nice casual patio seating with good service and warm welcoming staff! In the mood for pizza it's a must, definitely will be back!
excellent pizza. no frills setup but great finished product. A little pricey for what you get, but given the area, it is hard to pass up.
Great pizza, great service.  Very friendly wait staff.  Perfect location.  Highly recommended.
excellent pizza in a tourist location. if this were in a different location I'm sure it would be a locals favorite. but seeing as I'm a tourist, it was a great stop for a ten buck lunch per person.

Loved this place! Have passed by and meant to go many times and finally did today. Pizza was delicious, space is adorable and relaxing, owner/chef/staff all so nice and attentive- and made sure everyone enjoyed their pizza. Above and beyond service in every way. I wish I had gone sooner but will definitely be back.
Superb pizza, quaint location, great customer service, a fantastic place to grab a bite to eat and hang out.
Great pizza!  Just delicious, convenient, well-priced.  It was a perfect lunch and a nice break from the crowds of tourists.

Really delicious: an authentic,  light option for a summer dinner.  I could see it getting easily crowded,  as it's a small place,  but we lucked out and came when then it was quiet and tranquil.  We even got to see a bird snatching a few drinks out of a wall fountain.  Great choice for the Wharf area
Best pizza ever!
Wow, simply amazing. some of the best pizza I've ever had. try the Americano and the Crudo y Parma!
Gelato was just OK and the service felt awkward and not welcoming.
I guess it over price

Great Deli and Dessert place right in the heart of North Beach on Columbus. Not much seating, basically 4 bar stools in the middle, and 2 sidewalk tables in the front. Some nice classics, like Chocolate Mousse Tort. A bit glitzy at night, but that attracts you in. Great Gelato selection in the front, Salamis in the back.
Everything is fresh you can see what you are getting the place is clean and so cute! The sandwiches taste amazing!!!

Great handmade sandwiches - many choices but not too many!  Fresh ingredients, good bread choices and quite reasonable prices for the area!  Gelato for dessert!  Limited seating but small tables on either end of the shop seemed adequate the day we were there!

Had the Goodfella Sandwich-- perfectly crafted and packed with flavors. Went back in immediately after the sandwich for gelato for dessert. Amazing/friendly/funny people and amazing food. Will definitely return for more.

Delightfully real Italy! The owner immediately greeted us and served incredible portions of the most delicious gelato...and I promptly noticed the dry salami...wonderful with the sharp cheddar slices and a latte to share with my bride. There's a new found affection for this place. We're setting Alimento's as our new Italian standard in our favorite city.
One word: perfect. Service feels like family & the sandwiches were just right.
The guy was rude! He totally rushed us when no one was even behind us. Rude. I've had better gelato in Berkeley.

This place is fantastic. I went in and was about to leave because I felt like if I were to stay for too long I would buy everything in the store. The owner Chris saw me about to leave without buying anything, grabbed me by the arm, and asked me what I want that he doesn't have. With a friendly little back and forth, he agreed to make me a sandwich and said he would pay for it if I didn't love it. I loved the sandwich, and have added this place to my list of great places to go in San Francisco. Chris is awesome and so is his shop. Do yourself a favor and go there!

This place is really expensive! Jeez... I'm really hoping that they just overcharged my by accident looking at the reviews below.... because $15 for one flavor in a cone and another cone with two flavors is really, really expensive! That means it's about $7 per cone or $5 for my bf's single flavor scoop and $10 for my double scoop! Two gelatos nearly cost as much as one entree at an Italian restaurant in the Little Italy neighborhood...

My friends and I stopped here after dinner one night while in North Beach to get some dessert instead of opting for the in restaurant option.  I literally might have walked by this place in the past but never actually stopped in.  Gelato galore and lots of cool products lined the shelves and walls of the place.  I knew I felt like a sorbet gelato which are usually my simple favorites when it comes to this Italian treat.

The Gelato here was amazing, and the atmosphere of this little shop was authentic feeling. If you have a sweet tooth and are in the San Francisco area, I highly suggest coming here for a nice dessert. The white chocolate raspberry and coconut almond gelatos were fantastic.

Don't save paper, get a receipt or get conned. Cute sandwich & sweet shop for locals and tourists but the register guy will try to over charge u when u least expect it. I sensed that he thought that I was a foreigner , as I was speaking portuguese to my out of town family members.

This has been our 3rd trip to Alimento's and it is by far a neighborhood favorite for my husband and I. We have gotten the Mafioso sandwich the last 2 trips (added avocado) and it is just delicious. You can tell how fresh the ingredients are and they use Molinari meats (yummy).

Gelato is apparently made with half the buttermilk fat that ice cream is made with and significantly less sugar. Because of this, Gelato is served in smaller portions because the flavor is much richer. But you know what? I still go for the double scoop waffle cone at Alimento because the counter man is very generous with his servings and this gelato is just too good. Hazelnut and Espresso Chip are my favorite flavors. Service is great and of course it is in North Beach. What's not to love?
My date and I were taking a post-dinner walk around north beach to walk off our feast and stumbled upon Alimento. Gelato melts so of course there was room in my belly for more.
Great sandwiches, great service...highly recommend stopping in.  Everything is fresh and delicious!

I never imagined I would find a good hot dog in North Beach, but I am happy to say I found one of the best hot dogs I've ever had. Alimento has a variety of sandwiches and puts an interesting spin on all (at the least the dozen or so I've had). They are very particular about assembling their sandwiches so don't be in a big hurry - it's definitely worth the wait. I am the ultimate hot dog fan and Alimento creates the best one I've ever had.  By the way, their gelato is fantastic, extremely flavorful - try the black cherry!

Omg! Delicious to the max! And open late , what more could you ask. I espessially love the fact that they have an assortment of goodies and gelato flavors. Great, fast, friendly service . Don't even go across the street, forget about it. !!!!! I mean I know I'm just visiting San Francisco but I will definitely be back to have this again next time I'm around.

We tried the Siciliano, Goodfella, and Milanese. Best sandwiches we've had in years. The Rum Raisin gelato was great. Reminded me of something my Abuela would make, when I was a kid. Owner was very welcoming and personable. What an enjoyable experience.
Italian meats at their best, I thoroughly enjoyed their Goodfella sandwich. The owner was also quite nice, and we left happy.
One of the greatest Italian sandwiches I ever had in my life.

My wife and I were in town visiting friends and stopped at this place while roaming the streets of SF.  We we came in for sandwiches and left as customers for life.  We'll definitely stop by and see Chris, the owner, every time we're in town.  He's extremely nice and approachable and went out of his way to make us feel welcome.  After purchasing sandwiches and some other things for the trip home, he offered us free coffee and sweets (hellooooooo cannoli).  That's quality service and a man striving to make his customers feel welcome and at home.
Great place if you want a taste of Italy in San Francisco.

Had a wonderful time at Alimento. Me and my friends tried their gelato and we all agree that this is the best gelato we've had in San Francisco. My favorite was the coconut almond and pistachio. We got to try as many sample as we wanted and they were super friendly. We'll be back!!
Great coffee, great ice cream and awesome customer service. The owner Chris is super friendly

Its been a year and i am still going to alimento everyday while working. From Sandwiches, gelato to Coffee sometimes even meeting up with lady luck i am always satisfied.  They always have whatever i want to eat, if not sandwiches they have salads and even thin crust pizzas.  I literally go there for a Morning cappuccino, sandwich for lunch and chai tea to end my day.  This is a place for my one stop shop.   Staff is always friendly and helpful, you can tell this store is amazing because the owner really care about the quality in their food and services.  this is one of the most cleanest deli i encountered.  I will always go back!

This cute lil Italian deli / dessert had much to offer in flavor and choices. I built my own sand which. Turkey, cucumber, lettuce, pesto, mayo, olive oil, salt, swiss, and avocado. The serving size fits the price and even half a sandwich was filling, but I ate the whole thing. The workers are pleasant and kind, the owner was very involved with greeting guests and making sure we all felt welcomed and enjoyed our meals. They made my sandwich quick too.

I was craving something italian for lunch today, so I looked up places in North Beach and came across this one. The reviews were very good, so I had high expectations - and I was definitely not let down.
Alimento is not only a delicious and fresh deli but their management and customer service is stellar.
This is our favorite gelato spot.  They have a great selection to choose from and haven't found another gelato place we like as much as this place.

Great Italian deli! We had wonderful sandwiches and caprese salad, and the service was very friendly and attentive. Nice spot out back to enjoy lunch on a beautiful SF September day!  Our teenage boys had us bring home extra meat and cheese so they can try to recreate the sandwiches at home. :) Will definitely be back!

This place. So close to my house & always dependable when it comes to a dealio us sandwich. My recommendation is either the Cuban or the Mafioso, but only if you're feeling the seriously italian. Also get the gelato. Do it. You won't do it.
The owner is an incredible guy and very cordial. Delicious food and fresh choices.

Stopped by after dinner for some dessert -gelato- and was blown away with the fresh deli and great service.  Where else can you find great deli, fresh bread and authentic salami.  The owner, Chris, treats everyone like family and the rest if the staff was really friendly.  By the way the banana-Heath bar gelato was phenomenal.  This will be a regular stop when I am in San Fran.

Great little North Beach Italian deli and gelataria! The sandwiches were bomb, made with good quality ingredients - fresh produce and premiums sliced meats. A bit pricey but the sandwiches are fairly big (and honestly what isn't overpriced in SF these days).

I've continued to go back many times since my first review and after getting myself adjusted to SF prices, I now feel like this place deserves 5 stars. Fantastic sandwiches made with great care every time. Give this place a try!

Calabrese Sandwich was amazing, great hot spread (good flavorful heat).  Followed it with a cappuccino and a slice of cheesecake.  This is a great little shop with a very helpful staff.  Will return again!

Great place for gelato or your favorite italian treats! The owner, Chris, is great! Love stopping in here and grabbing some gelato at night and some biscotti for my coffee in the morning. Highly recommend!
Honestly, it wasn't great and it wasn't worth the wait. I'm not sure if my expectations were too high because the wait was so long, but I wasn't that impressed by the food at all.

Two friends and I went on a weekday to skip the usual brunch crowd. Off peak hours should not be an excuse to slack. We ordered 3 Eggs Benedicts. All 6 of the poached eggs were soft boiled. In fact, the girl's eggs benedict on the table over was also over cooked. Extremely disappointing. This defeats the purpose of Eggs Benedict altogether. The most exhilarating part cutting open the oozing yummy yolk could not be had.

Got poached eggs, french toast sampler, an omelet, coffee, and juice. The food is good. It's not holy wow this is the best freakin restaurant good, but it was good. I enjoyed it, the atmosphere is nice. The backdoor was open and the weather was nice out. My party and I had a nice time. And I live 2 blocks away so we did it smart and got there at 7:30am on a Thursday and were able to sit down at 8:05am or so.
Best breakfast in SF.
I've loved Momma's for many years. there used to be more locations but this is the only one now.
Service was great but that was where the greatness ended.

Ok, the wait was insane but we should known better going on Sunday after 8. Try to get there by 7 or 7:30 weekends or plan on long wait-90 +. Great food & service, nice family owned & reminder of what SF still has long time neighborhood institution!

Not as good as all the hype. While visually stunning, the classic eggs Benedict I got had an overly vinegared hollandaise sauce. For the cost and hour long wait? Not worth it. Admittedly, I'm guessing if you're a pancake or waffle person, this place would probably please you. But how do you as screw up a pancake?

The food was tasty and I liked everything we ordered, but nothing was outstanding, not even the monte cristos. The food certainly wasn't worth the price and two-hour wait. Mama's is a breakfast staple in the heart of the city. Worth a try, but one time is good enough.

Easy going homey diner with a friendly staff. Breakfast was good. The variety of options my table ordered including Washington Square, crab eggs benedict, French toast sampler was all great! However, I don't think this is a wait in line 2+ hours place. I probably won't be here again only because I won't be willing to wait in line.

So far I have been waiting in line for 2 hours and spent 6$ on a parking meter . The closer I get to the door the better it smells! The staff is super friendly and cashier wasn't very helpful but servers are great. The food is amazing!  The pancakes alone are worth the 2 hour wait. I have never had pancakes this flavor full!  The Monte Cristo is tasty and I will be back soon to try more of their menu . Long wait is worth it for food this delicious!  Num Num

The wait times here are so ridiculous (2 hours on a Tuesday at 9am.. Had to knock a star off for that). But the food is so worth the wait. It's always a good sign if there's a line out the door, right? I forgot what my fiancé ordered. He seemed to love it though. I was too focused on devouring my monte cristo sandwich.. It was the best monte cristo I've ever had! Good service too :)

Mama's is one of those places that really hyped so expect long lines. If you're like me than the hanger will make an appearance and it might make you want to leave the line and go somewhere else. Overall I'd say Mama's is good. The food is good, service is good, and the restaurant has a cute vibe. I tried really hard to not let the hanger impact my opinion on this review.

Friendly staff, great service, OUTSTANDING food! I don't know how they do it. I would recommend showing up no later than 7:30 if you want to be within the first 40 to be sat. We showed up at 7:20 and we were 20th in line on a Sunday.

I am amazed on how this place really meets the expectations. We got there around 7:45 am on Thursday and there was already a big line. We waited and about 8:20 we wee inside and ready to orders the the breakfast menu has four different items: Benedicts, omelettes, French toast and pancakes. Since it was my first time we order the French toast sampler and of those I like them all.

We did this place on the last day of our trip to SF and I wish we had done it each morning -- despite the 1-2 hour wait (which was worth it, by the way). The owner, Vince, was really kind. He walked us through the menu options as we were waiting in line. The process of waiting in line was made more comfortable by the servers bringing out water to everyone in line.

One very rainy day I ended up at Mama's and for once, there was no queue, whoop whoop! I'm not a big fan of their out dated Provence-style decoration but their breakfast was ok although the toast was a bit greasy. I wouldn't queue for hours to go here though.
Long queue but... what do you expect, it's San Francisco and this place is worth it! Shared the pancakes and eggs benedict plus a glass of fresh orange juice with a friend and all were excellent.

Waited about 90 minutes on Sunday for some serious brunch action. We each ordered two entrees, coffee, and coffee cake to go (which they recommended we microwave a bit when ready to consume). It was worth every calorie, and service was friendly, although not flawless. I would definitely make the trek again.

Is it amazing because I'm so hungry after waiting to eat for an hour or because it's really the best breakfast spot in north Beach? Hunger clouds my judgement, but I can tell you that their pancetta eggs Benedict and French toast platter keeps me coming back time and time again--even with a year-round hour wait at all times. Skip the omelets, which are far less good than the Benedict's and sweet options.
wait more 1hours

My friend suggested this place. We said to expect a long wait but it was not too bad 45 min. Its nice that theres a small park nearby so, we went there to hide from the sun while a few friends stayed in line. The place is small and is very old school SF in terms of the interior. But I like it. You order in the front and then the servers help you find seats. My favorite was the Northwest Omelette. Probably one of the best I have had. The egg just melts in your mouth and the smoke salmon was so fresh and capers added a nice flavor. It balanced the salmon for sure. Also, I tried my friends Monte Cristo and 2nd best in my opinion. Its a grilled ham and cheese sandwich and you dip it in their homemade jam. So bomb!.

I think this was the best pancake I've ever had! I don't even like pancakes. Well worth the wait. During the week, the line seems to start filling up around 7:15am so you might want to get there before that. I don't even know what else to say about this place, everything is really good, but the basics are rrrrreallly good. I would wait on line again just for the pancakes and maybe a side of eggs. This is a must for any visitors or locals wanting some good breakfast.
Cash only. Hyped up, long waits, decent food

This place has hyped up reviews. The food is really only mediocre; this is coming from someone who knows breakfast believe me! ;) the wait also is usually about 1 hour outside and then the rest of the line is hidden Inside for one more hour while you order in line and they find you a table

With all the wait, I expected Mama's to be over the top.  I'll admit that I'm not a huge fan of breakfast but I wasn't overly impressed. Service was fine but it's expensive. The lines are long, parking is near impossible and you feel bad if you hang out too long to talk.  The food compares with Black Bear Diner or any other non-chain respectable breakfast place in the city.  I'm thinking that Mama's must just gain alot of business because it has been there for a while and it somehow snuck into every language of the Fodor travel guides that tourists use to canvas the city.

Although the wait is pretty terrible, the food is actually very good. Not really sure why its super super popular. I mean their food is great but have you seen the line at this place. Is it worth it? Its unbelievable. I feel like you can have the same great food at many other places that will let you make reservations, like Epic, Perrys, chef and butler, sweet maple.... Etc. i feel like its a big hype. I mean its breakfast people!

wow, wow, wow. i am a HUGE fan of mama's. my sister lives a couple blocks away, but we're never up early enough to brave the lines. that is, until our dad came for a visit. we ended up getting in line 5 minutes before opening (7:55am) and waited exactly 1 hour and 20 minutes until our food arrived. not bad at all, in my opinion. i heard the first guy in line was there at 7:15.
The eggs benedict was good, but it wasn't worth the wait unfortuately.

I will stand outside of a hyped up restaurant once just to experience it, but it is rare that I will want to do it again....Mama's is different. Everything was fantastic. Food. Drinks. Service. Drool-worthy.
Great Brunch spot. We were in and out. Short wait. I'm picky about Benedict's. Theirs was exceptional. Also we had the tex mex scramble and it was amazing. Highly recommend!
Was placed on hold for 10 mins, no one took my order. Called back 3 hours later, to go order takes 25 minutes. I was able to order to go in the past, and it took way less than 25 mins.
Worth the hype, cash or debit only payment, the line, and the early wake up time to eat here.
Food was amazing! Generous portions and fair prices. Best home fries ever (crispy on the outside and soft on the inside). And their jam was... Jam-mazing :P
Def a can't miss while in SF. Amazing breakfast food. We got three meals and split it between two so we could try the French toast. Amazing!!

Mama's always impresses everything I visit. The place is famous and it should be because everything on the menu is so delicious I can never decide what I want until the last minute! Such a hard decision but never a bad one. The French toast is obviously famous, the lox platter is something special, and the MonteCristo is always a safe pick. Ugh I'm about to order more food and I just ate here!
It's a long wait, but worth it especially if your a brunch or Monte Cristo connoisseur.

Mama's on Washington is well known to tourists and locals. They offer an array delicious breakfast/brunch items. The wait here can be pretty long so don't come here when you are starving since you are most likely looking at a 30 minute to a 1.5 hour wait. I came here on a Friday around 11am. The line was around the corner by the time we arrived, but luckily we picked up some dim sum before heading over here. The line went by fairly fast and we only waited around 45 minutes.
