I also thought the employees were very nice since one of them started to walk outside and hand out waters to everyone in line since it was a pretty warm day (which is unusual for SF).
SO WORTH THE WAIT. I do recommend bringing a snack and drink so no one gets too hangry haha
My favorite brunch place in San Francisco. It's been rated to be one of the "20 SF restaurants you have to try before you die"
I do love pizza with thin crust, and they make it just gorgeous at Tony's. It is usually not very busy during the weekends there, but anyway their service is pretty fast.

I know the wait times are infamous, but we walked right in and sat at the bar. Granted, it was a rainy night, although the familiar crowd had grown as we left. We had the famous Margherita pizza, which I hear bakes in 90 seconds (talk about fast food), and the quail egg/potato/guanciale pie--both awesome. For starters, we had the deep fried green beans and a half dozen meatballs. Bezerkely ale during, and a shot of Fernet to finish. Awesome. Tip: eat the pizza *before* it gets cold.
The stromboli is epic.

There are a few reasons I am giving Tony's 4 stars instead of 3. If you don't read anything else in my review, please... pass on their award winning margherita pizza. I'm a fan, but other menu items are tastier!

The food is usually good but the service was condescending and unprofessional. I've never been refused a paper napkin before in a restaurant and have to be told "we use cloth table napkins at the tables here" In such a degrading tone of voice. Miss, its not my fault your napkin stock is low. Its not my responsibility. When I offered an alternative... Even bathroom towels will be fine ma'am. She replied in disgust and a twisted face:  I'm not going to go into the restroom and grab you paper towels. I meant like from a stockroom or some place where they may keep extra items like that. But hey. I guess I wasn't descriptive enough for her. Maybe its not fair to rate a restaurant solely on the acts of one employee. But when the actions of that person ruin my appetite to even enjoy what is usually a really good meatball and pizza. Then I believe its completely justified.

I made the mistake of bringing my wife here for her birthday.  All of the reviews made it sound like the best option for a decent pie in San Francisco.  I did not realize that we were going to spend $50 on 2 pizzas that were more fit for children to consume.  We opted for the "Award-Winning" margherita pizza ($19) and another pizza called the New Haven Lou ($25).  The former was more like the size of a Pizza Hut Personal Pan in circumference, but was quite thin, like a wet Saltine cracker.  At $19, I did not foresee being able to fold this thing in half and eat it as though it were one, absurdly priced NY slice.  The $25 Lou also failed to impress.

-Alright, I'm going to start this off by saying that I'm a bit of a critique and foodie and pizza connoisseur and then I'm going to add that Tony's Napoletana is literally THE best pizza I have ever had, hands down. Now let me walk you through it...

I wanted to take my boyfriend out for lunch somewhere in little Italy and found this place on Yelp! Did not disappoint. I'm not sure if they take reservations. We went on a Monday so it wasn't too busy, just a 15 min wait. The hostess put our name down while we sat at the park across the street. They send you a text when your table is ready. Parking was easy since we went on a Monday. We found 2 hr parking, no meter!

The PIZZA's WERE AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Our server was also Awesome and took the time to explain the different types of pizza's which helped us make our choices. We got there before they opened on Sunday which made getting a table quick and easy.
The pizza was excellent, the spinach salad was excellent, the bread was nice, the sangria good, the pizza was unbelievable, pizza diavola!

This place is a must visit if you love pizza and are visiting San Fran. Enough variety for the thin or thick crust lover. The menu can make your head spin with all the options. Don't let the long wait dissuade you from trying it.  North Beach has a lot of great food options but this one is the best for the casual diner who doesn't want to go to a hole in the wall pizzeria.

This place is the spot to go to when in San Francisco!! The wait is long but well worth it! We sat at the bar which we didn't mind. I order a glass of wine and so did my husband. He ordered the margarita pizza and oh my god is it great and I ordered the bucatini pasta, let's just say it's a big portion but if I could fit it all in my belly I would!!! That's how good it is!!!!

Nice location, great service.  Meatballs were okay, textured more like mass-prepped w/ flour than homemade.  Mussels were okay though messy atop bread, super drenched w/ creamed tomato sauce.  Calamari, good, expected.  Margherita pizza, super bitter crust, so burnt bitter I scraped and ate just topping off my second slice.   My kid thought it was soot from your oven.  Suddenly, Delfina's two-basil margherita seems a better pick.  Now if I can only get them to add four more leaves on theirs.
Pros
My favourite pizza place by some distance.

The food and drinks are amazing! Saw all the reviews and decided to check it out. Tried the prosciutto pomodorini and the meatballs and both were delightfully tasteful. I'd def recommend coming here however expect a wait. We went on a wed night at 7:15 fir a party of two and had an hour and fifteen minute wait!! Long but worth it.
Pretty Italiano if I say so myself. Mario, our server, was kind and very service friendly. The 900 degree brick oven cooks pizza in 60 seconds! The Caesar salad is large and and tasty. Great spot.

Superb.  We had a margerita and a New Yorker and both were superb.  The margerita was light and flavorful and all the tastes were well balanced.  You could taste the quality of the ingredients.  The new Yorker was absolutely D-licious.  The ricotta added a creamy texture to some of the bites, and the sauce was robust and a little spicy, but excellent.  The toppings were all very good and overall, the experience was great.  We got there right as they opened and walked right in along with a few other people who were waiting.
By far the best pizza I've tasted in my 28 years of life!

Ordered two pizzas for take out. I walked in from the main restaurant and was redirected to the by the slice shop. The complaint isn't about the food, it's about the service. The rude cook just stink eyed everyone walking in while others staff did nothing to address customers. When the cashier finally showed up, I paid and he said he would call me in 5 minutes. Almost 10 minutes had passed and still no call. I went back in and asked the cook putting the pizzas in if he knows if my order is ready. He replied with "how should I know? " you work here, jackass. "You have to ask the cashier". He didn't even bother to go get anyone to help so I tried getting the attention of another worker and the cook snapped at me again and said "you have to ask the cashier. He's not a cashier". Finally the cashier comes out and he grabs my pizzas that were ready in the back. The cook with the goatee and stretched ears left a terrible taste in my mouth and because of such disrespectful service, I'm giving this place a one star. As staff, you should help the customer. If you can't help me, get someone who can. I was not rude or vulgar but that cook is definitely one of the biggest assholes I've ever encountered while going to a restaurant and he should be fired.
Great pizza all around, we had slices of cheese and cheese & meat -- and it all tasted great. One of the few pizza's where the crust is actually worth finishing.

Had a Sunday lunch with family here.  We were told there was a 40 minute wait so walked up the block to Rogue for drinks.  Got a text when our table was ready and were seated outside on a beautiful day.  Nice friendly service and efficient service  Had the fried calamari and artichoke appetizers.  Both very good and then shared a Margherita and New Yorker pizzas.  Both delicious.  Will definitely be back to try other pizzas.  Minus one star because my all time favorite pizza is still the Mickey at Russian River Brewing.

I can't stop eating the Detroit style. I'm from Michigan and Tony's is the only pizza place in sf that I'll go to. They have this pizza down perfectly. Its just like the delicious pizza back home. The crust is baked with cheesy perfection. You must try the Detroit style. Go for lunch because they run out of it by later in the evening. They only make so much

So I go to the slice of side of Tony's and order 4 slices.  As I'm about to pay and get my slices I ask if I can get change for the parking meter.  The woman at the counter says "no, we don't give change". And I say, fuggettaboutit, and walk out leaving my pizza on the counter.  Hey Tony, maybe besides good pizza you should treat your customers right too.
Seriously the best pizza around. Fantastic margarita pizza! This is the real deal.  Great wine selection!
Tony's is an absolute must try if you are in San Francisco. I mean, how cool is it that you can sample pizzas cooked in like 100 different ways all in a one-stop-shop.
Hi.
It's a nice restaurant in the Italian neighborhood.
The pizzas were great. We had their Margherita, which was phenominal, and the Tartufo, which was recommended by our waiter and also delicious.
I guess I was expecting a lot more because of the amazing reviews this place has, but I was really let down.

Finally had a night available to try their popular pizza!! Saturday night, after our SF Giants World Series game 4 tonight, arrived at 9:10p and quoted an hour wait by the Hostess. She asked if we had a preference with outside or inside table/first available. We requested an inside table and provided a cell number for a text update when our table is ready. Walked a half block up to Tony Nik's Cafe, at their nice renovated lounge for some wine and cocktails.
Hands down best pizza I've ever had. Wow this was good. Had the Prosciutto and arugula pizza. This is the way pizza should be.

Great pizza. Got there a bit after the lunch rush, said about half hour wait for 2 people was only 10 minutes. We had a classic peperoni and a Margarita, both excellent. The peperoni had a kick. Prices were decent.
Possibly one of the best pies I've had was here at Tony's.

So I took my boyfriend here for his birthday because he had ways wanted to try the full resturaunt instead of the takeout place. And I had high hopes because a million yelp users gushed about the margarita pizza . It was a Friday evening and we got there around 5 and thankfully only had to wait for about 20 minutes. The waitress was nice until she decided I was asking you many questions and got irritated . I ended up getting the margarita pizza and it was burnt. It was my bad because I should have asked to have it redone but I stayed quiet. My boyfriend got a different pizza and he was very happy with it so no complaints there. The appetizers were delicious which was a definite plus. The host recommended them and was very right in that. Overall I was disappointed by the quality of this ever so famous pizza but I was happy my boyfriend had a good time.

Had a disappointing experience with them ! I asked the counter person what kind of calzone is in the case, they replied ricotta and mushroom, I ordered one and when I opened it I found it was mushroom, ricotta and ground beef ! I phoned and left a detailed message ! No return call ! Sent an email via their website ! No reply ! $6 ! It ain't the end if the world, yet they have disappointed me !

This was some of the best pizza, I have ever eaten.  I had the Jerseys original tomato pie with sausage, De Lorenzo style, my husband had the Margherita , both distinctly different, but both delicious.  My 3 year old had a kid's cheese and it was really good.   This is hands down great pizza, the best.  Norbert stated the best he's tasted in America. Why that is remarkable is that we lived in New York for three years. Beware, they do not take reservations and the wait is long, we waited 45 minutes on a Tuesday night.

Tony's is a global award winning pizzeria with a reputation to match.  It's an icon in North Beach and stands out among the plethora of Italian eateries in the famous Little Italy neighborhood in SF.  If you decide to visit for lunch or dinner, be prepared to hang around in lines for about 45 mins to over an hour during peak times.  There is also a "slice house" next door that serves the NY style pizza that the restaurant has in a limited selection (ie. cheese, pepperoni, one specialty like all meat or veggie).  There is a parklet outside if you get your pie to go or by the slice.  There are selections of great pasta and salads if you aren't into the pizza styles they serve (which are all very good) and range in pizza styles from NY to Neopoletana.  Definitely try the coal-fired style...everything is pretty good here and made with top notch ingredients.  If you like these guys, also try the sister restaurant (across North Beach) off Vallejo St - Capos (Chicago style pizza).
Came here twice within about a week.

Great pizza. I got the NY pepperoni. If you don't want to wait for a seat, go next door and they sell it to go by the slice. Four bucks for a pretty darn good piece of pizza. Glad we went for an afternoon snack

Had lunch here after picking up some crab right down the street at alioto lazio fish company. I ordered the swordfish and it was excellant! Mom had the pacific rockfish, hers was delicious to. Both were cooked to perfection. However it was served with roasted root vegetables, and a wild rice, barley, bean, quiona medley which were not so good so if this is offered to you, id pass and ask for something else. Took dad home some lazy mans chippino and it was ok, far from the best weve had. Overall this is a great restaurant you just gotta know what to order. I highly recommend the swordfish piccata!
I have never written a review before but I feel the need to after my experience at Scomas this past weekend.

Very disappointed. ... 55 minute wait to discover that the 2nd day of crab season ... This place is OUT OF CRAB ! !  Fortunately we walked less than one block to have a good laugh with the manager and waiter of neighboring restaurant.   What a joke ... I am embarrassed for them.  But trust the me the crab at the other restaurant was great!
Lobster bisque was amazing and so were the crab cakes. Great location on pier with a great atmosphere. Not ridiculously expensive.

I have never written a review before, but this place had terrible service during lunch today. I went there with 3 other Asian friends and the waiter immediately assumed we didn't know English and had the Chinese busboy come to serve us. He never gave us his name, and had a confused face on when I asked to have separate checks, then hesitantly did it for us. I asked what the catch of the day was, and that busboy told us salmon swordfish. When it came, there was a bunch of pasta, and I'm gluten free. I was never told there was pasta in the dish! So I asked to order the steak instead, and every piece was tough to chew. I will not come back again. Terrible food and snooty attitude.
Hello,
We have been coming to Scoma's for almost 20 years & have always enjoyed it immensely.  This time we were a little  disappointed.
Good but overpriced.  Good quality of ingredients.  Dishes are good but not extraordinary as prices are.  The place looks a bit old.  The service is very good.
We decided to give this place a try since it had 4 stars...

This is your classic old school seafood restaurant. Expect to be thrilled with raw oysters, clam chowder, a large leaf Caesar salad and a dirty martini. Nothing fancy but a wait and two bars to place a cocktail order. It's a great location and view. Know what you are in for and you will be pleased with the result! We walked here from the Kimpton after a long day. Enjoyable but they are certainly not reinventing the wheel!

This was the best restaurant that we have been to.  The service was amazing.  Someone always coming by and clearing off dirty plates and refilling drinks.  The food was the best seafood I have ever had.  Everyone was so nice.  We requested a table by the window and that's where we were seated.  The restaurant was totally filled and they still were on top of everything.  They even gave us a piece of complimentary cheesecake for our anniversary.  Would definitely return there.

Feeling a bit bad to give a well liked establishment a poor review. I just didnt get the experience everyone talks about. The restaurant is classic but dated and slightly stuffy. Maybe I didn't order the right food but it was subpar. If I am remembering correctly, it was a platter that our server recommended. I love seafood and was not impressed here.

Scoma's is one of our special occasion restaurants. Ordered my favorite seafood Louie salad today and was a little disappointed to see it stashed for ten minutes in the busser's station while waiting for my husband's order to come out. All those dirty dishes piled next to my salad was a little unappetizing.
Ambiance: inside decor is simple and a bit dated, but your right on the waterfront and have beautiful views of the bay

A treat. We went for lunch. The waiter was excellent-friendly, unobtrusive, personable. I had the grilled swordfish-as good as I've had. Sweetness had the crab and shrimp Louis salad-it was very good. But the capper was the starter-the best clam chowder I could imagine. Delicious and loaded with clams. I would go back just for the chowder, but everything we had was top notch. A definite recommendation.
I friggin love this place. Been here 2 times before but have to come when in SF. I was in Sonoma and rented a car to drive here with my wife.

Amazing! You must come here if you're in town. The seafood was the most amazing I've ever had. All fish is prepared the way you'd like. I got the scallops and couldn't believe how well they were prepared. Cooked to perfection. I came with 3 other people who all raved about their meals as well. Everyone ordered something different too! I'd definitely suggest making a reservation though, as the wait was about an hour and 15 during their dinner hour without one.

alwyz LUVD scomas. used to come here all the time when i lived in sf. came back on a visit to sf over the weekend and ordered their famous cioppino to go (thats all i ever order frm here). before, when id order it to go, theyd make it the same way as if id ordered it when dining in. but this time? SOOO DISAPPOINTED! totally gypped me! there wuz nth in there except for a lil bit of seafood and tomato paste! and the portion? wayyy smaller! had to come home and add my own vegetables and more seafood and recooked it. SUGGESTION: DONT ORDER TO GO! total rip-off! trust me. paid $40 for a lousy cioppino that i had to re-make myself anywyz!

The food was good, BUT you ate wedged into a very tight area and you better like your neighbors. The service was nothing special. The bad review comes from the added 4% surcharge . When our bill came besides the tax there was a 4 percent surcharge and when we asked what it was for our server could not explain it. The charge is for there medical, the restraunt charges this to help cover the cost of the medical! I've felt this is out of line, they should tell us in advance! We will not be going back!

Gonna throw two stars (2.5) with the hope that its noted.  Forever & a day our crew has been coming to Scoma's.  The typical order? Cioppino "lazy."  Apparently, (but, I don't know,) Chef Scarbosio has left the building, and that may be the reason.  The presentation, flavor, and entire dish was just off, Way off.  #disappointed.

In the past five years, I've been privileged to visit San Francisco quite often. It was a Californian/German friend that recommended this place. I owe him big time. Yes, there are several great restaurants in this town, but Scoma's is really "something else". First, it is not a tourist trap, as I see and hear most of the guests are locals. Then, the overall feeling - elegance yet unpretentious, quality yet not snobbish, efficient yet not pushy.

This was a recommended restaurant by a couple we met at the airport and I wish I could thank them for such a great recommendation. San Francisco was first point on our honeymoon and we wanted to have a nice, romantic dinner so we made reservations at this place. It sits on a pier and does not look like much, but the food was phenomenal. My husband does not really eat fish, but he had local cod which he enjoyed very much. I had salmon caught by Scoma's own boat, which was magnificant. We also shared a bottle of Scoma's brand wine which was pretty good and we received a complimentary dessert since we were on our honeymoon. The place is pricey, but every bit worth it. The wait staff is very curtious and professional and a poster child for how a waiter should look and behave. My husband collects pint glasses and asked the waiter how he can get a glass with their name on it. The waiter said that he will see what he can do and gave him the glass for free. This was a great start to our honeymoon!

Great place to eat if you have a large budget. Very fancy with lots of stars photos on the wall. We only had appetizers and they were excellent. Not really kid friendly. Make a reservation or you'll be waiting.
The pearl of the wharf.
Great food! Awful service. Our waitress kept forgetting us.

Let me start by saying that I have been coming to Scoma's for years. Unfortunately after my visit tonight, I don't think I'll be back. San Francisco is full of too many great places for me to keep visiting simply for the nostalgia of what this place used to be.
Seated right away. Long wait once seated to be greeted. Drink order wrong. Told no sole. Ordered cod. Out of that too! 2 drinks .. One wrong ... $26.00. Won't be back!!
I enjoyed dining at Scomas! Many reviews mentioned that the resturant needed updating, but a Detroit girl like me can appreciate a resturant with history, good service and an ole school feel :-)

When in San Francisco, go with seafood. On a referral from my boss, Scoma's was the place to go. Situated in the wharf area, Scoma's is tucked away from the street, almost secluded. They process the seafood on premises - cleaning, filleting, etc. You can watch them through a picture-glass window right next to the restaurant. The interior design is nautically themed, yet classic. A long bar is near the entrance where you can have a libation while waiting for your table. The dining room is beautiful with glass on both sides of the restaurant. While there's not much to see at night, we did watch seagulls perch on the wooden wharf beams outside watching us eat our dinner. I love clam chowder and it is usually one of my staples that I use to test the level of the food. This has to be the best clam chowder I've ever had! It's creamy, buttery, and chocked full of clams. It was held and served at the perfect temperature so the cream didn't break. I worked with clam chowder for 9 years at Disneyland and you really had to watch the holding temperature. Once the cream breaks, the soup loses its creamy texture (almost like curdled milk) and needs to be discarded. The fresh cracked black pepper on top sealed the deal. Scoma's, you had me at "clam chowder"! I decided to try something off of their daily special menu, Lobster Raviolis topped with lobster tail and salmon fillet. It was pretty good. The salmon needed a little more seasoning, but had a nice buttery flavor and soft texture. The lobster tail was tender and perfectly cooked. The raviolis were okay. I would have liked more herbs like tarragon, rosemary, and/or oregano to punch up the sauce as it was a little heavy.  My mom ordered the Dungeness Crab.  As it was summer, it was out of season so it was "fresh frozen". She was a little disappointed that she couldn't have the insides (miso or mustard of the crab) as they are cleaned out when prepped. Our server assured us that if we came back during Dungeness crab season that we could order it with the "miso" intact. She enjoyed every bit of it as it came out steaming hot and ate it to make our ohana proud, bib and all. Our meal ended with roses. A man proposed to his future bride that night. They were leaving on a flight back to China and couldn't take them. The staff gave us a couple to take back to our hotel room. They were beautiful!
Overdue review... but better late than never?

Had delicious food on a Sunday nite with great service. They accommodated very well to our 2yr old (stroller was folded and left by the hostess).  I would recommend reservations if going prime time b/c as we were leaving, it was very packed & people were waiting for a table. We were there right around 5:30 pm and they were opening their other dinner room, which got filled in 15 mins., if not less. All around, fantastic. Btw, I recommend the lobster bisque over the clam chowder. Amazing!!
This place is okay, noting to write home about.  The décor is old,  70's old, you say charm, I say old.   The food was good, but nothing special, for the price, I want special.
Great seafood restaurant tucked away near the fisherman's wharf.  I would recommend trying the SCOMA'S SHELLFISH SAUTÉ SEC which is the following:

Great location on the wharf although the location in Sausoiito is far better than five stars. Even with the normal wait if 45 minutes for a table it is well worth it. Best clam chowder and the sourdough bread comes fresh hourly from the bakery around the corner. Best advice I can give is before ordering the special ask the price. I failed to do this when they had a lobster special and it was $150. Anything with scallops is incredible. If you like it spicy, request the scallops be blackened.
We were so excited to eat here. Everything was great until dessert. Ordered Two desserts to go. We were  charged for both. Got back to hotel but only one was in the take out bag. Boo.

This was one of the few restaurants along Fisherman's Wharf that I had not tried yet, so today was the day to rectify that.  Scoma's prices are higher than most of the competition but I wanted to have lunch here anyway.  To those who are looking for something more modestly priced like we were, I recommend the sandwiches which are served until 5.
We loved this restaurant.    The food was excellent.  The service was even better.   I felt like I was on a cruise ship.
Scomas is the best.  There is a reason that they have been here for 50 years in SF.   The best seafood.  Boom.   The lobster bisque is to die for.  I have never had a bad dish.  Do not come
It kills me to give this Staple of American Restaurants anything lower than 5 stars, but after 30+ years of coming here, I was really disappointed this last visit.
It was a grand meal to finish off our one day in San Francisco!

One of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood.  The food is great.  My favorite things include the cast iron baked pizza, the calabrese sausage glazed with honey, and believe it or not, the caesar salad is the best i've had anywhere.  Levi, the bartender kicks ass, and Sergio the GM is so accommodating and friendly.  Everyone here has a true passion for what they do and will treat you like family, you can't go wrong at Capo's (unless you forget to make a reservation, then you might have a long wait ahead of you.

Capo's really does feel like an old family neighborhood place in the heart of north beach. The service was friendly but a little slow but the food was fantastic. We shared the garlic bread with cheese and mushrooms, Caesar salad, and The Dillinger pizza. The Chicago style pizza, although not my favorite (I'm a ny guy) is so unique and has a great crust from the cast iron skillet. It's a truly filling meal but one I would come back to time and again.

A night at Capo's for some good deep dish Chicago style, clams casino, artichoke dip, garlic bread and precisely poured Hendrick's Martinis a little dirty with 2 olives. Just another great night out with good friends! Wrap it up with an Affogato of course ...Like a Boss.
Tony's joint.  Just a couple of blocks down Columbus Avenue from his Stockton Street joint in north beach.  It was a great night...
This was truly the best pizza I have ever had in my lifetime. The Dillinger pizza cooked in cast iron with cheese crust. I will be dreaming of it for months to come.

I came here with high hopes after missing a reservation last time I was in San Francisco. The atmosphere was wonderful and the server was exceptional. Her name was Kelly. I started with the appetizer of clams which I would highly recommend. Then I split a steak sandwich which was very good. Then for my main course I had the eggplant lasagna. It was no joke the worst eggplant lasagna I have ever eaten in my entire life. I felt bad leaving such a large portion but I could not choke anymore of it down.  The server was very understanding and I do not fault her at all for the horrible entrée. As I looked around the restaurant I founds a few patrons eating the pizza which looked wonderful and I wish I would have tried some. I would definitely recommend going here but staying away from the eggplant lasagna.
Review #800 goes out to Capo's!

By the looks of Capo's, I've just stepped into the 1920s when the talk of the town were mobsters & bootleggers. In my prohibition era-obsessed mind, the phone booth is where you give a secret password (for who knows what), & the brick walls contain trapdoors (leading who knows where.) No need to worry, everything was copacetic, no funny business occurred, at least not while we were there.

On Saturday, 10/25/14, my girlfriend and I along with one of my good friends and his wife ate at Capo's for dinner. We've all been to Tony's Pizza Napoletana and I must say we are all true fans! My girlfriend and I have been to Tony's a numerous amount of times and I've actually had the chance to meet and talk to Tony Gemignani. He is a true class act and a PIZZA GENIUS! I saw Capo's on the show Check, Please! I've been so eager to try Capo's so we finally made it happen.
Dillinger best pizza in the world

Ever since I've eaten here I want to go back every night. The food is beyond delicious, with wine and other libations to match. I was never a fan of deep dish pizza, but after eating the award winning Dilinger, I am a believer.  Wow. The crust and the fact that its not drenched in sauce is heavenly. I also had their minestrone soup and artichoke parmesan dip....soooo good. I cant stop thinking about you, Capos!
Nice place which showcases a special point in time! Portions are HuGe, they serve you broth before you meal as well as a side of meatballs with each entree~yum but ouch!
Friendly family style Italian. Good for kids. Clams and Linguini done right; whole clams, garlic, Olive oil, and wine.

Crispy yet saucy, savory and creamy, flavorful yet simple... Old Chicago style deep dish pizza. So delicious, but we could only down one slice each. Service was on point, quick and efficient. Manager was there to personally check on us. We were seated quickly as well. Alcohol was overpriced so we definitely didn't partake.
The most amazing food. Amazing drinks. Great service. Good people. All around amazing place.

We saw this place on Check Please and my brother-in-law decided to have his birthday dinner here. We were lucky enough to get the front window booth which made the birthday boy happy. The Dillinger and the Big Jim. Chicago style. Sis said the Big Jim was her "flavorite". Everything was yummy and we had a ton left.
We love deep dish pizza, so it's too bad it didn't hit the Mark here. The pizza did not hold together at all when it was sliced and served - making it very hard to serve - it was just too soggy.

Dine on September 27th approx 9:30 great service by McKenzie always impressed they can memorize everything we wanted without writing it down. Place was full we didn't mind waiting a bit which gave us a chance to review the menu.  We ordered a sampling of quite a few items all were delicious and came out timely.  Cant wait to return.
Sat at the bar on sat night without any wait. Bartender was awesome and so was the food
Food-amazing! We couldn't decide so we handed the menu to the bar tender and he just ordered for us. Best decision we made all night.
The pizza was awesome. We ordered the big Jim. Yeah, we went deep dish. The bartender was great. Glad we stopped by and grabbed a seat at the bar and had a great dinner!

Service is great. Atmosphere is great. The servers are very friendly! The deep dish pizza was amazing!! Will definitely come back to this place next time we are in San Francisco!! Overall such a great experience here!

Celebrated a birthday here. Great bar and ambience was typical of what you'd expect of an Italian restaurant. We had a deep dish pizza between 5 of us and there were leftovers! Servings of salads were huge as well. I particularly liked the bar.

I haven't had such a warm welcome to a restaurant in more than a decade. Sergio and the staff treat you like family, and the food brings it home. The bar has some great innovations on classic drinks too. Great place to chill out with friends, cozy up on a date or hang out at the bar just off the little italy strip.

Meeting with some old friends, I was the last arrival of our party of five at Chubby Noodle.  Walking in, the bar/restaurant only had a few occupied tables, a stark contrast to my last visit during the holidays.  My friends had drinks in hand when one friend grimly said "The menu's changed."  My eyes studied their menu which did not have any of the staples that I knew and enjoyed.  In emergency mode, I called Capo 's and scored a table ten minutes later.

Really good - hearty Italian food. I particularly liked the pastas which were nice and al dente and the meat sauce was rich and full of flavor. They gave us a complimentary minestrone soup which was good, albeit a little weird at first. We had the cracker thin pizza which I thought needed more sauce. Next time we'll try getting the deep dish instead.

Went for my birthday on 9/10/2014. Very pleased. The restaurant is exceptional, from the fantastic, old-school booths, to the staff and the food! The drinks are rather nice also. Had both deep-dish and thin crust pizza. Absolutely delicious!  My only concern is when can I go back? A very nice find.
Every thing from the first greeting to the goodbye was amazing. The hostess was nice, friendly and personable. The waitress was funny and helpful and the servers and bussers where great.
The wine blends, pizza, and service is just amazing! YOU MUST try the Farmers pizza-and always, always, always go deep dish.

Great place. Eat at the bar.  Ordered the garlic bread with arugula, truffle, etc, roasted artichoke, sausage with honey, and caprese salad.  All 5's except for the caprese. Give it a 3. Great service.  Looking forward to going back and ordering off the pizza menu.

The deep dish pizza is AMAZING! I went with one other person and we were both pretty hungry so we just ordered the deep dish they always have baking since all the specialty ones were going to take so much longer! It was really tasty but waaaay too much for 2 people, so definitely be prepared for leftovers or go with more people! The only thing I didn't like was the tables were soooo close together I could hear everything the people next to us were saying, it was like we were at the same table.
Authentic deep dish pizza. DELICIOUS authentic deep dish pizza.

Capo's is a near-perfect comfort food Italian experience.  If you're looking for very tasty, traditional takes on Italian American dishes this is the current place to go in North Beach.  The only real problem: if you don't make reservations you can forget dining here and even if you do be prepared to wait because the space design and heavy entrees definitely promote people sitting around ("oh my god I ate so much zzzzzzzzz") long after the bill is squared away.
Insanely amazing pizza pie! Would recommend 1 pie between at least 6 people UNLESS you're planning on taking the rest home haha!!
Great place tucked just off Columbus. A cut above typical Italian-American fare and one big plus is the homemade pasta and flavorful, robust sauces
I was unimpressed. The pizza was burnt. The sauce tasted like  tomato paste. There was a long wait, forcing us to hover around people seated at the bar. I won't be going back.

Excellent service, fun and cool ambience, spot-on antipasti, and cast iron pan deep dish pizza as good as it gets. Sink into the plush booth seating, order the family blend of red wine, and tuck into some of the best pizza you'll find anywhere. Loved this place.
3.5 stars-A-OK
We came here for an after church lunch one Sunday.  I was very impressed with this restaurant.  Felt very authentic and very East Coast.  I was raised in Boston and it felt like home for me.
In a nutshell...
This was the most delicious pizza I have had in the City so far! Its thick crust and crisped to perfection. The simple slice of cheese pizza has really great flavor and is so scrumptious!

After a few brewskis in Chinatown, my friends and I took a walk up Grant street and came across this gem of a place! The folks I was hanging with have been to this place and have raved about the pizza. The smell was strong a block away and so enticing, I couldn't help but stop in and try what they had to offer!

This was on a whim finding this place, but I'm so glad we did!! I ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice which I thought was pesto pizza. As I started eating the "pesto" slice it tasted really funny I figured the spinach was rotten lol it wasn't at all it had clams on it! For someone who loves seafood this is the slice for you, but since I am allergic to shell fish this wasn't a good choice. Nevertheless Max was amazing and switched out my slice for something else so sweet!!! Deffinatley coming back!!

The best, quickest, cheapest pizza you cab get in this side of the galaxy! A smuggler like myself resides in the cheap end. Those Nerf herders of Hutts don't pay well. Pull up a seat and grab a slice for a mere 3-4.50 credits ($)! Meaty slice , so good, so perfect :)
The only reason I'm giving a 3 start its because it is to hot to eat inside and they don't have tables to eat outside but the pizza is the best.

Pizza is UGH, so good here.  The crust has the perfect combination of outside crisp/crunch and the inside is like heaven.  Always expect a line at night on the weekend along with a staff that has very little patience.  I assume they get a lot of drunk people and don't want to have to repeat themselves 100 times a night.  5 stars if I got a smile from the staff every now and then...but that's rare.  Cash Only.

We have been craving to try this place but there are always a huge line and parking in the area sucks! We finally get to try it on Saturday evening around 7:30-8:30 (go early to avoid long line and a chance to sit in and eat) we ordered garlic clams, sausage and pesto veggie omg it was soooo yummy, warm, soft and just the right portion! You order, paid, grab your food, try to find a seat... They have about no more than 30 bar stool seating. Also the bathroom looks like a hot mess BUT it's decently clean maybe because it's early before the drunks are out.. Anyway yes will return!
I'm a pizza snob and usually like thin "ny style" pizza, but this Sicilian style pizza is incredible!

This is a completely sober review. From my understanding, Golden Boy is a prime drunchies spot, but my friend has crowned it her favorite pizza of all time, so we came for a lucid dinner. The store front is next to Chubby Noodle and is quite small.
I wouldn't say they are the best pizza spot in San Francisco or the best square Ive had in my life but the food is always fresh due to the high customer turnover.

We passed by this place at around 9 pm on our way to Amante and there was a long line.  And at 11:15 pm,  there was still a long line!  My friends and I had just finished having drinks at Amante, and were hungry, so we decided to stop by this place before going home.  Luckily, we were able to get our pizzas by 11:45 coz we had to dash out of there and take a taxi to the BART station.  We needed to take the last train for the East Bay at 12:15 am

Oh my! This was one amazing slice!! The dough is crispy yet it's soft kind of chewy...how do they even do that? The pizza was super fresh even though they reheat them in their oven, I could tell it was super fresh still.

Stopped in here for a quick slice while bar hopping.   The slice size is great and the crust was supper tasty.  Of course, I had been drinking so most pizzas would have probably been good too.  The point I'm trying to make is that this pizza did not suck, the price was right and it was served by friendly staff.  I'll be back here.

The pizza was delicious, the beers were cold and the atmosphere was rad. I was looking for a more hole in the wall divey pizza joint and I found it. There is awesome music on, TVs to watch the game, and fresh slices of pizza ready for you. I definitely recommend coming here, but it's hard to find a seat when it's busy. Just pop a squat at the bar. Staff was really friendly too so I would definitely go back.

Perfect place to get your hangover food. Probably the cheapest pizza joint in this area. Service is nice and quick (looking at how small and crowded the place is normally). They serve alcohol as well which really compliments the pizza they serve.

A hole in the wall pizza bar that is well worth the $3-4  per slice. It's not classic Italian or Chicago Deep dish, but it can't be beat for a quick tasteful snack.  The $4 glass of wine is not a bad deal either: Ravenswood Cab, not too shabby. Easy 5 stars.
Now, this is pizza! Who doesn't like their pizza with a side of punk rock? Well, if you don't, stop reading now. This place isn't for you.
The idea of clam garlic pizza sounded like a great idea but it was not.... It was kind of gross! The combo slice was pretty good tho. I think these pizzas are also a little hard to hold too. Meh.
Really tasty pizza! Grabbed a slice while designated driving a group of friends and it hit the spot. I will definitely be coming back again.

If you are drunk and hungry,this place will suffice. Otherwise,the pizza is a doughy construction that works because it is made fresh. The prices are not competitive but probably could be given all the customers they get. Don't bother coming here sober.
Their big square slices of Sicilian-style pizza are good, but after having it drunk AND sober, I don't think they come anywhere near living up to all the hype.
Pizza with the perfect amt of crust. Slightly crispy on the bottom and soft in the center.
Really liked this place. Love the clam and  garlic. Yummy. The place is hip, good size slice and cheap. Ive had to make a small line before but it goes by quick.
Good pizza. Hip vibe. Quick service. What more do you want?

Yum! Huge squares for $4 or less! I've tried the cheese pizza as well a the clam & garlic. The dough is thick, chewy, and flavorful. Clam & garlic leaves a STRONG garlic taste/smell in your mouth the rest of the day, but that just means it's doing its job right?? Love it!

Homer Simpson would say '' Hmmmmmm Golden Boy Pizza .. ''  you can get hooked on the garlic & clam pizza here ...... really tasty pizza in North Beach... legendary , popular place ..... quick service- fair pricing ... disregard the naysayers -- this place has a strong,loyal following for good reason --- its very good pizza .

Big square of fresh pizza and a glass of decent wine for $7? Wonder why I come here often? It's quick, cheap and the service is great. I sometimes bring a book and have two glasses of wine, The music they play can be anything from heavy metal to '80s new wave. The only complaint I have, and it's a small one, is that their barstools are too close to the counter and they are bolted to the floor so you can't move them. I know it's designed that way because it's a small place and they want room for people to be able to walk behind but it's slightly uncomfortable, but doesn't stop me from going there at least once a week.
This pizza is awesome if you enjoy such food as:
We live in the Peninsula and my family drive up to Golden Boy for their awesome pizzas!

I can only sing Golden Boy's praises. We were nearby at a bar and needed food in our bellies immediately. The guy at the door pointed us to Golden Boy and we had no regrets. My friend and I shared 3 slices and regret not getting more just because it was so good. The crust is unique (not thin, regular, or deep but thick and light) and the three types we had were great. Would definitely recommend and will be visiting again.
I was in San Francisco less than 10 hours and already found better pizza than I ever have in Los Angeles since moving there 3 years ago. This Midwest girl needed some good pizza!!!

I have friends who swear that Golden Boy is the BEST PIZZA EVERRRRR. Needless to say, I had pretty absurdly high expectations going into it. The first time, my friend bought me a combo piece which was pretty good but not great. The actual pizza is pretty thick--but perfectly crisp on the outside and soft and doughy on the inside. In theory, it's the perfect slice of pizza. In reality, it was just pretty good.

I've gotta say, pizza isn't my first choice of food.  But when it comes to this joint, I love pizza.  On my last food trip to SF, my wife and I were recommended to Golden Boy by some locals we met at the bar.  We came here the next day.  I ordered the garlic clam pizza.  The flavor was extra ordinary.  Lots of clams and garlic and just the perfect amount of crust.  Yummy!!
The garlic clam pizza is to die for!! There is never any spots to sit and eat, I would take my meal to go! Then, walk down the street to Stella's bakery for dessert:)
One word describes this pizza: Edible.
Great spot by girls love love the square pizza
Golden boy salvaged our evening! Had terruble sushi at a restaurant nearby and was incredibly unwhelmed so we knew golden boy would hit the spot.  Short line at 7:30 pm so that was a plus.
Pretty damn good. Friendly service. Not crazy about sitting and eating in the restaurant (bar seating only), but taking the pizza to the park nearby makes for a lovely afternoon. Prices are fair.

I love Golden Boy. I've tried Patxi's (gave it 3 stars) and next on my list is Little Star, but so far Golden Boy is my favorite. Golden boy only serves the napoleon style (box shaped) pizza, they do 4-5 different topping combinations and are cash only. You'll notice a long line coming out of their small restaurant but that's partly because they put their cash register at the front of the restaurant which automatically generates a long line outside. So don't let the long line deter you.
This is the BEST late night or anytime pizza you can get in the city! It's fluffy, filling, flavorful, cheesy, and completely satisfying! It's not very pricey either.

Really great place. The meatballs as an appetizer were the best I ever had (sorry mom). The bruschetta was excellent. We shared the Fruitta de mare, which was also excellent and fresh. The price was unbelievably inexpensive. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgable. The best Italian restaurant I have been to.

My favorite Italian place in the city!  Really quaint and cozy.  Everything we've ever had on this menu is delicious.  My standby is always the Carlesimo.  I don't eat meat so I get it without the pancetta.  My husband and friends have ordered the meat ravioli, spaghetti/meatballs and the chicken cacciatore.  ALL have been amazing.  You can't go wrong here.

The best Italian food in North Beach and all of San Francisco.  I've been here numerous times and tried a variety of dishes.  Everything is delicious.  Some favorites that come to mind are; the Carpaccio, Caprese, Valdostana, Gnocchi, and their impeccable Bar and Wine list.  If you find yourself in the neighborhood, do yourself a favor and stop in at the Trat.  You'll be thanking yourself later.

We absolutely enjoyed celebrating our 7 year anniversary today! My wife was overwhelming surprised with the gift but our favorite dishes are Carlesimo & Salvatore!! We flew from Dallas, TX to just eat at this restaurant just to celebrate!! The best Italian food!

Pretty delicious. The burrata appetizer wasn't so great -- rather oily. The clam and wine-butter pasta was fantastic. Elegant, understated interior made for an enjoyable and relaxed meal. Definitely coming back.

My husband and I were craving Italian (and neither of us is pregnant) so Yelp guided us to this wonderful little place on a Sunday afternoon. This is not a high-end restaurant, but it doesn't matter because the customer service and food make up for the lack of tablecloth and fancy waiters. For example, they were serving Sunday brunch, but the chef was kind enough to make a dish from the dinner menu that we really wanted to try. Tiny bar, but the Bloody Mary blew me away - and I don't even like Bloody Marys! My favorite thing was the 3-Meatball appetizer; we practically licked the plate clean of the sauce. We're really happy that we listened to other Yelpers and tried this place... Will definitely be coming back.

The place is not fancy but charming, and the food is outstanding.  The food is old school / authentic Italian.  The meatballs are to die for. Plan on making a reservation a few days in advance for dinner as it's hard to get in as a walk-in. Last seating is at 900pm but you can stay in until midnight.  Their Sunday brunch is easier to get into last minute and the food is also fantastic.  Highly recommended.

I was in SF for a tech conference and a local that I met at a baseball game recommended that my co-worker and I try this place.  I'm glad we took his advice.  The seating is limited, so I'm also glad we made a reservation.  It's also tight, so be prepared to hear other peoples conversations(or them hear yours).  When we walked in, our table wasn't free yet, so we ordered a drink at the bar and waited for our table.  I ordered a Drakes Hefewiezen.  This was my first time drinking it, so I didn't know what to expect.  I wasn't a big fan of it at first, but continued to sip it as we waited for our table.  When we got to our table, the guy tending the bar, who I think was the owner, came over with a new beer from a fresh keg and notified me that the next Drakes he pulled was the last of the keg, so mine was probably flat.  The new beer was much better, and I'm glad he made the effort as I probably would have just finished my first (and last) Drakes. As we looked over the menu and eventually ordered, all of the staff was friendly and helpful with any questions that we had.  This place truly has that family owned feel.  On to the food...  We ordered the meatball appetizer and bruschetta (antipasti).  The meatballs were possibly the best Italian meatballs I have ever had, and the sauce that came with them was amazing.  The brushetta was also very good.  Then onto the main course, I had the Salvatore(chicken ravioli), which was awesome, and my co-worker had the gnocchi with asiago tomato cream sauce, which I tried and almost wished I had ordered that instead...Until I took another bite of mine.  The sauces were all wonderful.  After we finished our meals, we ordered desert.  I had the hazelnut gelato.  It arrived in a dish with much more than I was expecting.  I quickly noticed that some of it was very crystallized as if it was melted and re-froze.  Thankfully, the top two scoops were not this way.  They were rich and creamy as I had hoped for, and two scoops was probably all I needed.

Excellent service and excellent food. We were in San Fran for Dreamforce last week so we ventured out of the hotel/conference area and found this place.  Looking forward to returning some day soon I hope!

They started a Sunday brunch in the last year and it has blown my mind every time. From the lemon ricotta pancakes to the breakfast risotto - you will not be disappointed. And the coffee and bloody marys make it even that much better. Sadly, it hasn't quite taken off like they planned and they might only continue it through October 2014. Please go and try for yourself! It is a decadent, fantastic brunch.
Amazing, traditional Italian joint. Best in SF I've had. Cute, cozy and definitely need to make a reservation any night of the week. Meatballs are outstanding!
Average. Didn't really wow me

If you're looking for great food and good service, this is the place. So glad we made a reservation (a MUST on Saturday nights) and we were seated right away. It is a family run business and they take pride in their history.

Unfortunately I remember this place being truly great Italian food, but I think it has outgrown itself now.  What used to be intimate place with incredibly tasty and high quality food has dipped into more of a generic churn - who knows, probably yelp helped to do this - the volume has brought down the quality for sure.  It's not bad, but it's not great (anymore).  For the price, it should be great.  And our server clearly had better places to be.

Was blown away by the taste in each bite of food we had tonight at Trattoria Contadina.  Glad to see that the restaurant is staying in the family.  The owners and staff were warm and welcoming.  They really took the time to make us feel special.  You could taste the love in each dish that was prepared for us.  If you are looking for a romantic cozy spot to have a delicious meal then this is the place to go. Will definitely be returning.

Top notch Italian restaurant in the Russian Hill/North Beach neighborhood. I had been here once before a long time ago (think I was only 14-15 years old), but I still remembered the place pretty well once we walked in. It is a one room restaurant with maybe enough space for 20 or so tables. There is a small bar near the front door and lots of window space. Even at 7:30 PM in the summertime, there was quite a bit of natural light coming into the restaurant.

Love coming here for the gnocchi! They took the Gorgonzola gnocchi off the menu.  But when the waiter saw how disappointed I was he had the chef make it for me anyway!!!!!! Love the food here, love the service!
Great old italian restaurant ambiance.  The food is old style too.
The portion size I got last Sunday afternoon was literally only a quarter of what I see in these photos.....

Awesome local find in a slightly hilly and pleasant neighborhood. Eat great homemade pasta and watch the trolley roll by. Start with the antipasta meat and olive dish. Don't miss the pesto ravioli, it was perfect, I'm still thinking about that. And end with their homemade tiramisu, gosh that's good. Compliment with a bottle of Chianti (any on the menu will be good) and you are set.

Really nice Italian restaurant that's away from the chaos of Columbus St in North Beach. Enjoyed some burrata and meatballs as an appetizer. Both were great. The meatballs were dense, but not tough, nice flavor and the homemade sauce was done well.

Treated a friend out to dinner, restaurant was way smaller/cozier than the pics showed, parking was pretty crazy, parked in a lot around the corner for $20. Bruschetta was ok, I have had better but it wasn't bad. My friend got the Caprese salad and that was really delicious! For an entrée I got the chicken with gnocchi and mushrooms, really really good. For dessert we both got the stratiacella gewhich was divine. Service was quick and atmosphere was lively, kind of loud actually but fun. Would for sure go back for another special occasion. Prices were a little steep but I felt the quality of the food was also up there.
Delicious food, great ambiance and wonderful staff.
Although the restaurant seems a bit dark downstairs, I was surprise there was a upstairs. The food was delicious and filling. Fantastic Italian food.

Great spot for an Italian dinner in North Beach! My husband and I really enjoyed our experience here.  We had Jesus as our server who was very attentive and recommended an excellent red wine. Our favorite dish was the gnocchi with a tomato cream sauce.

Service was lacking-- second bar drink was offered and we sat waiting at the end of our meal for about 10 minutes before we got our check-- even though it wasn't busy. Meat balls were too compact right but the entrees were delicious: red snapper and spaghetti with scallops, shrimp, peas, mushrooms in a tomato cream sauce.

Prior to an evening of Beach Blanket Babylon laughter, my wife and I made a reservation at this wonderful restaurant through a Google and Yelp search. My wife selected this gem and the two of us, just wishing for a an evening of delicious Italian food, found our mecca. The service was sweet, the food was impeccable, the libations tasty, and the ambiance was like I was sitting in my own living room with many guests. The atmosphere was very relaxing. I had the spaghetti special with homemade egg noodles, shrimp, and scallops, in a white sauce. It was very tasty and so delightful. I highly recommend this little gem in North Beach. I could have sat there all night, eating Italian food, sipping wine, having conversation with my bride, and watching the cable car whisk by!
Four and three-quarters stars for this great spot!
With very limited experience with this regions food, I let my date order for us and I was pleasantly surprised.
Why go through all the hustle and bustle right on Columbus? This place is a knockout. Great atmosphere, cozy, and authentic. Enjoy!
I'm a local and this is my favorite spot in North Beach. I've been going for 10 years now. You can never go wrong with the Carlesimo and Burrata to start.

Came here for my post courthouse wedding dinner with my family.  They were able to accomodate for our party comfortably.  The wait staff was very attentive and patient with our party of 10.  Everyone enjoyed their authentic Italian dinner.  I was in love with my pesto pasta with green beans and my husband got the veal dinner which he loved a lot.  Overall I would come back to this place for a good Italian meal.  It was a little pricey but that was expected for the area and meal.

We wanted to love this place. The reservation was easy to make, but when we showed up, our table wasn't ready. We ordered antipasti, pasta, and secondi, and our waitress was thoughtful enough to recommend 1/2 portions of the pasta since it was a lot of food. We ordered drinks, but then they were out of raspberry syrup. We ordered coca cola, but then it was flat. We ordered the saltimbocca, but then they ran out of potatoes. The saltimbocca also had a bit too much rosemary (maybe another spice?) so it overpowered the entire dish. Probably just an off night.

Each time we visit San Francisco we make it a point to eat here, a neighborhood restaurant away from awful tourist traps; we have never been disappointed. The staff is great, the warm olives are a great way to start. This time we had the veal with risotto... And the house made raviolis with spicy tomato creme sauce... Scrumptious!
Brilliant food, amazing wait staff, tables are close together to inspire some friendly back and forth between diners. Great pastas!

We are visiting and went for dinner with our 5 and 7 year olds. Amazing is all I can say! Food, service, pricing, ambience! We has Burrata salad and meatballs to start with an incredible bottle of wine by Nancy's recommendation. Followed by veal for my husband and I had the spaghetti al'merica(?) I know I said that wrong...it was second choice under pasta; best pasta I've ever had! Go here, you won't regret it! I spent more on lunch at the wharf and the food wasn't good! (Lou's Fish Shack). This place is a gem, go and you'll see why;)

Love this restaurant! Owned by 100% Italian family!  The atmosphere makes you feel like you are in Italy! The food was delicious!  I had the gnocchi and it was awesome! Highly recommend making a reservation otherwise you will have to wait for a bit!

I love the ambience here!  Also, the food is really fantastic.  My only minor complaint would be that the tables are very close together because the restaurant is small.  I think the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and portion size.  I also absolutely love the pasta dishes here and will go back again and again.
We  tried a number of italian places  and all were booked. Finally found this one.  We were not disappointed.  Great food, great service.

My son and I stopped in on a recent Friday night as we were touring the city.   We were seated upstairs right away.  Cozy atmosphere and everybody was very friendly and prompt.  Our server, Jesus, was quick, very friendly and professional.  The place was busy but we were not rushed or overlooked at all.   I had the Pavorotti 1984, vegetables and cream sauce. My sons gnocchi was probably the best we've had.  Same family owners for 30 years- they are definitely doing everything right!  Prices were moderate too.  We would certainly visit again when in town!
I feel like this place deserves A+++++++ for the PT Fries.

Do you want your life changed? Get the PT FRIES! They are the best fries I have ever had. In my life. Wonderfully crispy with truffle, a soft boiled egg, and caviar. I never knew such flavors could exist together in complete perfection.
Wanted to go some place special for my boo's birthday and we decided on Park Tavern.

My friend and I had a very lackluster dining experience here.  I got the feeling this was 'the' place at one time, but it wasn't when we were here.  My $29 fish entree just wasn't good ~ fish was nothing special, greens were super bitter (and I love greens), it was oily, and the dish my friend had was super heavy and cheesy.  Execution just didn't work.

We had  our annual company dinner in the upstairs room and the service was warm , professional and very accomodating to our needs.  Everything went amazingly well, since it is not easy to serve 50 people.
Food was terrific, service was attentive and atmosphere was awesome. I just wish they did not try so hard to turn tables.

This review is for brunch.  I am not a huge traditional breakfast fan, so the brunch menu at Park Tavern appeals to me a lot.  The execution of the creative dishes was excellent.  I ordered the smoked fish cake.  It was so good, I could have eaten another plate.  My table also ordered the polenta cakes, which came with outrageously good mushrooms.  There was also some hash, which was good, but not as good as the other two dishes.  The bloody Mary comes with bacon.  Enough said.  I cannot wait to go back.

Had breakfast here because Mama's line was too long...thank goodness!  Service was good and the food was awesome!  If you like deviled eggs...best ever!  Had the smoked salmon benedict  and it was DELISH!  Highly recommended. The place has cool vibe to boot!

This is literally as good as it gets! I came here with 10 people for a brunch on Mother's Day and I've literally never had better service nor food nor drinks (well maybe this helped me think positively about the first two). Drinks are delicious and they have an amazing mix from healthy feeling to downright glutinous. The service is impeccable - I never had to wait for a refill or to order a new drink or side, the food was presented at a perfect pace to allow us to relax and enjoy but not get impatient, and THE FOOD! I'll definitely be coming back.
I can't help but feel that Park Tavern is coasting. Kind of getting-away-with-it and laughing all the way to the bank.
Nice location, nice atmosphere.
love love love!!
The place is very pretty.
deviled eggs - nuf said
Came here for a work dinner and was given a prix fix menu (with customized menus).

Park Tavern never disappoints! Their brunch menu is fabulous. I always seem to come back to the polenta and the coconut fritters. You need a reservation on the weekends, it's busy. All in all a great brunch spot. I need to try the dinner menu!

Food is Ok, but not amazing especially given the premium prices -- given the many AMAZING brunch places in SF, I would not put Park Tavern as a top.  I had every intention to show off SF brunch to our visiting family and took them here -- but I think all they will remember were the high prices..
Went here with a large group and rented out the 2nd floor. The meal was served "Family Style" which I thought might be awkward, but it was really fun.
A somewhat fancy place for brunch or dinner. We were able to get a reservation through Yelp the day before, which was important, because most other popular brunch places have long weekend waits.
What an awesome place to hang out, drink, eat and have a good time!
First time visit. Got the corned beef hash. It was pretty good but it left me wanting more. The portion was quite small for what what you pay.
I have dined here twice and both visits have been stellar experiences.
The food is pretty good, and service is ok, maybe a bit on the slow side. A couple of outside tables have a view of Washington Square, but you are right on the sidewalk.
Pretty good apps.  Brussel sprout chips with sea salt and zest were great. Too much truffle on some items.
Great place for both brunch and dinner.  Great service and the bartenders are really service and quality oriented.  Make reservations and go.
Delicious brunch, the eggs with polenta and the cod cakes are solid. The challah bread is a must order. The ambiance is cool and rustic, especially for brunch.

We came here last year and we loved the peaches glazed French toast and the farm eggs. We are actually on our way right now to get some. Hope the second experience is as good as the last. It is pretty difficult to get a table here but I feel it's worth the wait. There is a place across the street called MAMA's and it took us an 1 1/2 to get in. The food was good but basic, you could have gotten the same thing at IHOP but Park Tavern is definitely a twist on many comfort foods :)
How can you not give this place a 5 star. Amazing food, service and ambiance.

We had a birthday brunch reservation at 11:15am on Sunday.  When I arrived at 10:55am I was told "to find something to do."  When I returned at 11:10am, the hostess would not acknowledge me yet, she bent over backwards to accommodate 3 hipster men who came in, without reservations, and to set up the chef's table for them and seat them immediately.  She would not even look at me.  After we were seated, we had a good meal, the baked eggs were yummy and the shared avocado toast was delish!  If not for the hostess, I would have given 4 stars.

Usually great place for lunch and brunch however last experience was not that good.  Poor service (lazy waiter) and ok fish dish.  Sat at table for extended period of time and had to ask for server.  When server appeared treated us as if he did not care to take our order.

I Liked it a lot first time I was here, and I always love the Brussels sprouts chips, PT fries, and the Marlowe burger, but service was way off the night we went.  Our server was totally disengaged, and it was completely different from all my prior visits.

I made a reservation here on *someone's birthday, but then had a little too much fun that day and we ended up missing the reservation.  So I made another reservation for a Sunday evening to make up for my indiscretions (with an emphasis on the "s" at the end of indiscretions).  And so it goes.

Hmm, maybe I didn't order the right thing. I went with two deviled eggs and the shrimp toast. The shrimp toast had way too much mayonnaise in it, basically masking the taste of the shrimp. The deviled eggs were good but over-hyped on Yelp. The service was great and it's certainly a cool ambiance but I'm not sure this worth the high prices.
brunch. avocado toast. done.
Two words: TRUFFLE. FRIES.

Park Tavern is the best place to celebrate. Great cocktails, the deviled eggs truly are delicious and the chicken is amazing. The first time I came here the stuffing with the chicken was amazing (crispy but juicy), but the next time I came there were just some vegetables which was a bummer. Hopefully it's seasonal and the stuffing will be back soon!

We came here for brunch on a Sunday. we thought the menu was pretty creative. We got cast iron baked farm egg with Gruyere and crispy polenta. Both were really good but we were especially pleased with the polenta. The mushrooms that came with the polenta was amazing. Open the for service was great. One of the waiters took note of the water table that we had and was kind enough to fixed it for us.

Park Tavern has my favorite brunch in the entire city. There are so many delicious carb-laden delights too choose from that I always have trouble deciding what to get. I wish I could eat three brunches in a day just to try everything. Five stars for the brunch!

Really really good service and I love the unique menu options! We came for brunch and had the kiwi/orange/berry fruit plate, cast iron baked spinach and poached egg, blueberry French toast and a Bloody Mary. Everything was very good, I especially enjoyed the Bloody Mary and the fruit plate--it came with a shot glass of juice that we poured over the fruit and it was so good. The French toast was very very sweet and the cast iron bake was good, but pretty simple and had a lot of spinach. I look forward to going back and trying their twist on toast as well as other options on the menu.
Pretty bummed with the average bloody mary I received here. Was told they had a variety per another review. Apparently they only add beef jerky to their bloodies on Sundays. Full review at

Had eaten here 13 years ago, and surprised to see it still rated highly on trip advisor, so made a reservation.  food was still quite good, but the server lacked a lot.  There is a fine line about servers being overly attentive, but we had to search for her anytime we needed anything.

I had one of the best meals in my life here.  They don't have thousands of items on the menu. I started off with house salad and mushroom soup. The salad is so good. The dressing is just the right amount and not overpowering the taste of the veggie. The mushroom soup is the best I've ever had in my life.  It is so good that I run out if words to describe how good it is.
A nice romantic dinner. Unique flavors, great service. A hidden spot that I will return to for the flavor of Istria.
Ambience was great, food was OK for the price.

Food was very fresh and very delicious.  Definitely recommend for a leisurely meal.  The Owner was out among the tables, as well as checking in the kitchen.  He was very personable and made us feel welcome.  Would definitely go back -- the food was very, very good.  Would recommend reservations, particularly on a weekend -- we were there during the week and most table were taken, but it is not a huge restaurant.

Was in town for business and was looking for a place near hotel and found Albona.  Loved the old world feel and the staff was wonderful and helpful when necessary and invisible when not.  Menu was very diverse and food was very good but not great so only gave it 4 stars but liked it enough to send customers there the next night and when back in town would eat there again.

I was in SF this past weekend for the Nike Womens half Marathon, I could not stress out of enough how much I loved this place to carb up.  The food was perfectly cooked, the desserts and coffee were yummy!!!! Make reservations, the place is busy.  Food is spectacular and the service they sell is incomparable.  I will visit this place again, no doubt!

We absolutely loved this restaurant! Very cozy, romantic atmosphere! The food was spectacular! Highly recommended veal shank was to die for and the sea food stew had unbelievable broth! Very recommend this pleace!

After having met the original owner and founder at another event, I have always been anxious to try Albona Ristorante. The opportunity finally came up and I can say that I was not disappointed.  Istrian cuisne is not your typical Italian fare, which I was thankful for in an area that is dominated by Italian/American restaurants that seem to have all used the same template for their menu.  We enjoyed the gnocchi, and the manager was kind enough to switch sauces for us for my vegetarian guest.  Gnocchi is made differently in Istria, so don't expect then to arrive in the traditional shape/texture most people would expect.  We also tried the pepperonata which was excellent -and prepared with the eastern influence of the addition of pine-nuts and sultanas.  My dining partner had the rigatoni arrabiata - and every piece of pasta and drop of sauce was consumed.  I had the Involtini di porco - pork roll stuffed with sauerkraut, with  apples and prunes and served with a side of red cabbage.  The portion was generous and very flavorful.  While there are a number of tempting dishes on the menu - I would have a hard time not ordering this a second time.

The first thing you'll notice when you walk into Albona is its "unpretentious" interior, which was undoubtedly romantic, cozy, and family-like. You'll be welcomed by the owner and former executive chef, Sam -- the one who "treats you like family" and "welcomes you to his kitchen" graciously as soon as you walk through the door. Before I delve into the specifics, I'll say that prior to using the Groupon deal we got, I heavily read reviews here on Yelp. As a 4.5 star rating with 450+ reviews, in addition to all the raving reviews about top-notch service and exquisite Istrian cuisine, I think I overall walked into Albona with pretty high expectations.
Had an amazing dinner tonight. Quiet, intimate and the gnocchi was stunning. Don't hesitate to dine here. One of the beat dinner experiences ever!
The first thing I noticed walking into Albona at 5:45 on a Friday night was how quiet it was.  I liked that very much and was looking forward to a great meal.
Amazing food. Owner will insure you are happy. Did for us.
Stuffed pork loin was one of the best meals I have ever had.

This entire experience was amazing. I went here for dinner using a Groupon deal, and the man who seated us and took our order was quite lovely about it. He offered us two appetizers instead of one to share or getting two soups & two salads (which is what the deal stated), so we got the mussels & potato gnocchi. The white wine tomato sauce that the mussels come in is AMAZING. Dipping the delicious bread into it was heavenly. Also, the gnocchi comes in a sirloin sauce, which was also very delicious.
Five stars as always. Stunningly good, wonderfully executed and extremely fresh food. You eat and drink while being treated like family.
The mushroom soup was good.
Thank you Yelpers, without you I would have never found this lovely little gem hidden away in the hordes of other restaurants in the area.
I've been here 3 times now. I don't see how anyone can give less than 5 stars to this establishment.
Wow.

I finally tried this hidden North Beach neighborhood gem with a guest from out of town.  I was nervous about getting seated around 7pm on a Thursday night without a reservation, but the friendly host found a table for us.

purchases a groupon for this place and was a bit hesitant even though this place has over 4 stars. Most places I've gone to with groupons lately weren't good which is probably why they are giving groupons away. However, this place was delicious we had the mushroom soup, prosecco was great. and the seafood linguini was very good too! Tiramisu was best I've tasted yet! Small restaurant very cozy and charming service. Great place to go to and definitley recommend to anyone!
Came here with a Travelzoo deal for two for 3 course meals each.
Everyone loves Italian, but why waste your money to go to this place. Food was too salty and there was nothing special about this place.

This place is great. Went here with a travelzoo voucher and we were treated amazing. I've had a lot of restaurants give sub-par service when you come in with a 1/2 off deal from groupon or travelzoo but this place was way different. Our server was very helpful explaining some dishes to us, and at the end of our meal he served us complementary port! I will definitely go back again for a special occasion.

This restaurant is really a gem. The Italian inspired Istrian cuisine us inventive and unexpected. The owners are very friendly and knowledgeable, the 4 dishes we had plus dessert were excellent  (the pasta strudel is a sort of canneloni dish, but with their spin and is superb) and the ambiance nice but not pretentious. The owner/host had us do a mini wine tasting to pick out our red (Nero d'Avolo) and then they added a second dessert on the house which is their tiramisu - spectacular, one of the very best I've ever had (made by the wife/owner)! A real find, reasonably priced, and a Lot of Fun!
Heaven - definitively heaven!
Real nice place and Sam the owner seated us and explained his business to us

As I walked into the restaurant, a host convinced me that I didn't make a reservation and offered me the cold wind whipped sidewalk instead of the warm waiting area.  And I haven't even ordered yet.  I guess I didn't fit the profile of the clientele here.  Very sad. In 2014. In the city in which I was born. Wow, San Francisco. Wow.
Phenomenal. Food was so great. Atmosphere was nice & laid back. Prices were very reasonable. Sam takes so much pride in this place & it shows.
Very good Italian food. I'm giving them 4 instead of 5 stars only because their menu feels a bit small and the place feels really packed. Overpriced as every other Italian restaurant in San Francisco
Totally hidden gem, this cozy, comfortable little place.

Excellent.  All things we ordered were fantastic including the mussels, gnocchi, lamb, and veal shank.  Perfectly seasoned, delightful sauces - wow.  It's a bit of a haul for us but will try to go back.  The decor is upscale, charming, the atmosphere is pleasant, service is great.  Torn between 4 and 5 stars - only issue is that it's a tad pricey, up against some steep competition in the city for 30+ dollar entrees, and I agree with other diners the dinner rolls were not good (ours was soft, but like someone forgot to add salt to the recipe).
My husband and I just finished dinner at Albona and it was WONDERFUL!

During the last decade I have been to Albona at least 10 times, however, because of my last experiences I decided not to go back, at least for a while. Last Thursday I had dinner at this restaurant for the first time in nearly 2 years. This time it was much better than the last ones. My dinner started with mussles and they were delicious, the bread was very good too. We did not leave even a drop of sauce, we left nothing but the shells. For main course I had chicken breast with maraska cherry sauce and vegetables. It was excellent. My partner had Penne a la arrabbiata, and she enjoyed it too. To finish our dinner we had panna cotta and tiramisu and both were excellent, as good as the main courses and the appetizer. Overall it was a great experience, I am looking forward to the next time at Albona.
Came here for the first time today, won't be my last. Service from Sam was welcoming and perfect, he really makes it that 5 star experience. Food was awesome and worth every penny.

Albona offers promotional deals on Travelzoo and others,  They use creative billing on the discounts.  The final bill includes an 18% grauity on the amount before the discount including tax.  This is not consistent with CA law which only taxes the actual amount of the bill.
