One of my top choices in SF.  Been many times over several years and never a complaint.  Do book in advance, it's small and popular.
The owner was very nice and I wish I could give this place a better review because of how absolutely kind and accommodating he was.
Overpriced, over hyped. I came here for dinner once around 5 ish. The place is not crowded at all and the service isn't the greatest. The food isnt the greatest for the price I paid as well.

best sandwich I've ever had in my life. Actually, probably one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life. I got the hot coppolla, and it was amazing. I tend to despise any kind of deli meat, but this stuff i could eat all day. the fries are fresh and delicious, and the portions are ridiculously generous (i couldnt get through the 2nd half of my sandwich). the bread...oh, the bread. too good to even describe. How is this stuff under 10 bucks?
Great little bar/sandwich restaurant. I had a pastrami and my daughter had a salami sandwich. They put their fries on the sandwich, which sounds strange but is delicious.
On the list of top ten sandwiches I've ever had!! Authentically Pittsburg...so don't try to change anything on any of the sandwiches! They know what they're doing!!
So here's the deal about this place: the fries come on the sandwich along with a mound of cole slaw between the buns.

I  take my sister here when she visits (she's a Steelers fan) as the place is Pittsburgh central.  It's small but the food is delicious as are the beers.  When we've gone, there was only 1 server but he works hella hard and you aren't waiting to long for anything.
I order pastrami & egg or coppa & egg. Sandwich includes coleslaw & fries. Remember to add the egg.

We went to this place for a quick late breakfast bite and got a Coppa sandwich with prosciutto, coleslaw, fries with vinegar. It was reasonably priced and tasted very good. The place is all about Pittsburgh Steelers, so definitely a recommend in general and particularly for football fans :)
Came here for a sandwich.  Kinda pricy for a sandwich but all the ingredients were so fresh and huge portion.
Great food, good people. Actually prefer the sandwiches at Giordano Bros to Primanti Brothers. A convenient option to have in San Francisco.

Perfect place to watch football. Especially if your a Pittsburgh fan. Went there with a group of friends. Our server Zack explained the menu to the out of towner friends and put it into words we could understand. I will infidelity be back. The bartender was helping running food too when she saw the server was busy.

Excellent sandwich after walking around San Francisco all day.  Fresh ingredients, just the right amounts of each.  The all-in-one is the way to go.  Must have a cold beer with this for a perfect lunch. For a guy, just the right size.  I will definitely go back when I return to San Francisco, since I have no plans to travel to Penn.
Meat. Fries. Soft bread. Fried egg. Beer. Sports.

I am usually in San Fran 3 to 4 times per month,  and for years I have recommended this place to my Pittsburgh friends...  times have changed,  the bar staff isn't what it used to be.  We had John and other Pittsburghers... now. The SF games are on the prime tv not Pittsburgh.. and good luck getting a beer while they talk to their friends, not to mention they are immature. sigh... need a new Burgh place in San Fran.

Yum!! Came here for the first time today with my boyfriend. We aren't coleslaw people or much into provolone cheese but MAN perfect sandwich!! I got the kielbasa and my boyfriend got the hot salami!! Perfect combo. Never had fries on a sandwich but I loved it!! The bread was fresh. Never got soggy with all the ingredients on it. Cole slaw was the perfect ratio and was like a light salad. The meat was fresh and full of flavor. Super cheap for the city. 7.5 each sandwich can't beat it. We will be back. Our waitress was awesome and didn't get annoyed when asking questions. Fun and cool environment. We went in starving and left full :). Thank you. See you guys soon!
Service is great, wings are the best in sf and the beers are cheap, couldn't ask for much more!

I remembered this place being a lot better the first time. I ordered the pastrami sandwich. It was generously sized and more than filling. The meat was a little tough but I loved the coleslaw. It was lightly dressed with oil and vinegar and was nice and crunchy.
Very tasty sandwich.  Would definitely go again.

Really friendly staff and great sandwiches! I was boring and ordered a turkey sandwich, but it was amazing. The combination of the thick-cut white bread, the vinegar-y slaw, crispy fries, and delicious turkey made this sandwich a home run. I can't believe it's taken me this long to go here since my friends always rave about it.

Sandwiches here are delicious! I wasn't really sold at first on the whole french fries on a sandwich deal when I was told about it. But when I tried it for myself, it was utter heaven! The French fries are crispy perfection too .

Giordano Bros, a Pittsburgian sandwich shop run by ex-Pittsburgians. I have no clue if that's the appropriate terminology to describe the residents of Pittsburg. Perhaps Pittsburgoids? Possibly Pittsburgers? Mmm Pittsburgers...that sounds like it would be the name of a delicious burger.

Fries on a sandwich. What more could you ask for? When I go to other restaurants and ask for fries on my sandwich or burger, they look at me like I'm crazy, here they'll look at you crazy if you don't want fries on your sandwich! The delicious fluffy bread is so soft you won't tear the roof of your mouth while you stuff this glorious sandwich in your mouth. Make sure you get a cookie, they put rice crispies in it and it's amazing!!
I have always been a fan of great pastrami, so when your a fan, its always best to go to the spots that can get the job done with taste and service. Giordano Bros is the place to be

The food was pretty good and wasn't too expensive. Got a spicy italian sausage sandwich with fries and sister got the capola. Total around 20 bucks with tax. The dressing was a little heavy and it soaked the bread with it.

Kinda mad at the people who ordered wine with their sandwiches and expected a table to have a three-hour conversation at. This is an unpretentious bar, modeled after a famous Pittsburgh sandwich shop, not a place for a romantic evening for two. That said, I ate here and watched a Penguins playoff game with some fellow Pittsburghers now living in S.F. It felt like being home. Tourists and locals were walking by with confused looks as they heard the cheering coming from the bar and echoing around North Beach.
This place gets a 4 for the wings and the beer!  Even though my server had some attitude, it's overall a decent dive bar for drinks and fast-food in the North Beach area...
Meaty meats and fries.
The sandwiches are great but that's only the start.

One word: Excellent!  I took my nephew to SF for his 21st birthday and stopped by for a sandwich and beer.  We had a wonderful time.  The food was fantastic and the beer (Stone IPA) was great as well.  The service was also outstanding.  The manager Jamie (Earl) was very professional and made my nephews day when she asked him for his ID.  We will go back very soon.
This place isn't for me...
Came here because I saw that the sandwiches were like Primanti Bros and I've always wanted to try their sandwiches but have never made it to Pittsburgh. So I figured this was the next best thing.

As a Pittsburgh native, I'm sort of pissy about Pittsburgh style food. Just putting fries on it does not make it Pittsburghian. That's like eating salt and vinegar chips without the vinegar. There is an essence to our cuisine that is not suitable for finer palates. I love that about Pittsburgh.
The fried pickles here are bomb! Served with ranch dressing and oh so crispy and non greasy. Get them.
Love the pastrami and hot capicola. Fried pickles are amazing! Pale Ale is my favorite on tap. Great place to watch the game and even catch a band every now and then.

One of the best spots in SF!  The best sandwich I have every had, and wonderful friendly service.  Also very reasonable for only $7 a sandwich.  Love this place, and always bring out of town guest here.  Very low key and casual environment is nice too.

The sammich was huge.  I ordered the coppa with an egg (as recommended by the waiter / bartender).  I will say that it is a little weird to have your fries on a sandwich, but it is worth the experience.  Add a couple beers and this place is awesome.
LOVE this place!!!

Places are defined by the product and atmosphere. If you want to get a good bite to eat, catch a game and have a beer this is the place. The staff are blunt, I appreciate it. Get the COPPA & don't change it, you will fuck with tradition.
A friend and I were catching up over drinks but she was kinda hungry so we stopped here when we noticed they were serving food.
I love coming here to watch Pittsburgh football/hockey!  The food is AMAZING, the atmosphere is awesome, and the staff are super friendly.  A Yinzer really feels at home here!
This is a great, happy, fun loving Pittsburgh bar in SF! Good sandwiches ad good beer. Excellent bar tenders!

I work nearby the Levi Plaza so weekday lunch options are limited.  I looked up some new places to eat that were walking distance and found Sammy's Aloha.  When I walked over I realized it was part of Butterfly, a place I enjoy going to where the staff, ambiance, and food is good.  Chef does a good job!  My favorite is the Ahi Poke bowl with black rice and a poached egg.  I recommend this place.

After getting off the boat for Alcatraz, we were pretty famished, but I was so excited to find a unique Hawaiian restaurant nearby. The menu looked good. So, we ventured over to check it out. Upon arrival, I ordered the Ono BBQ Chicken rice bowl, extra kimchi, and the Spammy Fries.
Oooh baby I like it raw

I want to keep this place hidden to myself!!! I love poke and I miss it from Hawaii. This is a little gem that reminds me of Hawaii. I got the poke salad and it was yummy! Poke is fresh and smooth. I also tried some of my coworkers poke bowl with black rice and loco moco and gooey egg Yay!

This place is a hidden one. It's right inside the Butterfly restaurant near the piers. I would rate the food 6/10, I've tried better. The price wasn't worth the food portion. A chicken teriyaki bowl or ahi bowl is $10 for a small portion. I didn't think it was worth it. Parking sucks as well and they don't have their own seating area. They do have about 4 small tables near the deck but it's "first come first serve" and the employees from the Butterfly restaurant gave us dirty looks because me and my friends were eating there.
Ordered the ahi tuna bowl with black rice and a poached egg and a lemonade.
one of our goto spots for lunch working by north point.  Don't get the shrimp salad though.  It's not worth the 12 dollars.    Everything else is pretty good.
Loved the Ahi Tuna Poke with black / brown rice!

This is definitely your San Francisco Hawaiian Fusion-We're-Going-to-Slap-Some-Unique-stuff-on-­this-burger type of restaurant. The photos are more deceiving than how they actually taste. I'm a huge fan of local mom and pop shops over the fast-food chains and unfortunately, I probably would've enjoyed L&L at a cheaper price than go back to Sammy's.

Came here for the first time two or three weeks ago. Had the poke bowl with white rice. It was really good, & I really liked it. My only issue was that there was so much rice than there was poke. I had to cut my poke into smaller pieces so I had enough for the rice. Besides that, I'd probably come back again to try some of the other things on the menu.
Great place to go before Alcatraz tour. They have a to go order place and a kind of private seating in back on water to scarf down before you boat for 3 hours.
Awesome food for a reasonable price. Hawaiian with an upscale twist. already added to the list for my next trip here.
There's a lot of good stuff here (Mushroom/Brie/Truffle Bao, Loco Moco, the ahi poke that had wasabi), but when the ahi tuna poke is slightly grey, it's just not that appetizing :(

The food is incredibly delicious and fresh! I tried half the menu, haven't disappointed yet. Ahi Poke is absolutely amazing, the tuna was flavorful and well-seasoned, and i was impressed with Sammy's twists on the classic Hawaii dish; salmon roe, poached egg, and black rice. The head chef is an artist with his food, the price from $9-$11 isn't a bad deal at all. Definitely coming back. Just one thing: why do you have to close on Sunday!
Sammy's is the antidote to my chronic ailment, known by the scientific name  lunchingatPier39itis.  It's a real disease.  Look it up.

A favorite for lunch. Everything I have tried has been good - Ahi poke, snapper and especially the Hanoi style noodle bowl. Take out only, you can take it back to office or find a nearby bench. They rent out the space I think from Butterfly restaurant next to Pier 39. Wait can be long if there is a line at peak lunch time hours.

Delicious food with tasteful options. Tried the pork hamburger and was not disappointed. A juicy and delicious meal. The price is fair. Just a reminder, it is a to go Restaurant. There is no actual place for sitting even thought the attendant found us a place to stay at.

Amazing food to-go! This place is such a gem. Sammy's Aloha is located inside of the Butterfly restaurant which is at Pier 33. The poke bowl is just amazing and I love getting it with black rice. The beef teriyaki salad was also so delicious. This place is right next to Pier 39 and is great if you want to get a delicious and filling meal. You can order your food and eat it at Pier 39 or the benches overlooking the water right next to Pier 33! I would absolutely order either the poke or the beef teriyaki again because they were that good. 5 solid stars for excellent food and a beautiful location.

Had that Hanoi noodle bowl which was full of all sorts of pork. Very filling and tasty. I got a poached egg on top and it's was pretty rare. I like the white cooked a little more, so next time I will just ask for the egg to be cooked a bit more. The wife got the fried snapper bowl and really liked it.
First time here, this place is nothing short of amazing!!
I've had Sammy's Aloha on my radar for the past couple of months after finding out that it had poki and finally decided to cave in and try it on a Friday lunch.
Wow. If you're in the mood for poke this place delivers.
Ask and ye shall receive.

went here back in January when I made an SF weekend trip with some friends! We just wanted to grab a quick bite as we were walking along the embarcadero and came across this place. It's a to go window out of a fancier restaurant called butterfly (which we ate at the night after). The four of us shared the fried fish katsu and bbq chicken sandwich and it did not disappoint! The fish was still flavorful and moist despite it being fried and the chicken was tender and full of flavor! The staff's recommendations were perfect and the service was fairly fast. We were not expecting it to be that good when we were just looking for a quick bite so we came back the next night to try butterfly - also amazing! Definitely stopping by here on our next SF adventure!
Aloha,

I found out about Sammy's Aloha a few months ago and have been going back consistently whenever I visit SF. Sammy's is a take-out only place located inside of Butterfly Restaurant along the Embarcadero. It's super convenient for people who are visiting Alcatraz or Pier 39 to drop by for food. I generally call ahead of time and just have my friend pick up the food while I circle around the area in my car.
I have mixed reviews about this place:

I consider Sammy's Aloha to be an nice upgrade to Pan Grill Sandwich Shop when they used the take-out space provided by Butterfly.  The food is somewhat similar, but instead of just Asian fusion sandwiches, they upgraded the menu with the inclusion of Rice Bowls and Bao Stuffed Buns.

After finding this on yelp I could not wait to check it out. Unfortunately yelp raised my expectations too high. I ordered the Ahi Poke over white rice and the spammy fries. I had better poke at the embarcadero center and the portions they gave were small for the price. The spammy fries seriously tasted like the overcooked portions of rice left at the bottom of your rice cooker.

Ahi Poke with black rice and poached egg at $11.95 per bowl.  I'm not a big spender, so I personally thought it was on the pricier side for lunch.  The fish didn't seem as fresh as what I normally eat.  For a quick bite of poke I usually go to Basa Seafood for half of the price and fresher fish.  On the upside, I loved the location of Sammy's with plenty of ocean view seating a few feet away.  If you plan on going there around noon, prepare to wait.  I think its worth a try, its not bad, but its not amazing either.
Had really high expectations before coming here.

the idea of the poke bowl is great. I wish there were more places in SF to get one.... and I love that they serve it with black sticky rice. BUT!! and that's a biiiiig BUT, the poke itself is bland and flavorless. the star of the show/bowl is lacking in fulfilling it's one and only duty, hence the two stars. how dare you serve a poke bowl in which the poke is the least desirable item in there!

I embrace the island life, a soul that embraces the way of the tank top and slippas.  My mouth possesses very rudimentary taste buds where pretty much everything is good, and I just chug away at life, expecting a "broke da mout" experience at lunch and dinner, as it literally does not take much to achieve.  Aloha is the credo, poke is the foundation, savory waves gotta be the landscape.
Poke bowl with black rice and added a poached egg.  Delicious, fresh and filling.

Just ate lunch from there. Got the ahi poke salad and spammy fries, walked back to the exploratorium to sit. Got the salad - okay, but the leaves were a bit brown and wilted, and NOT THE SPAMMY FRIES. We got weird blocks of fried rice with roe on top. Wrong order. Very disappointed. It was too far to walk back and get what we ordered before getting back to work.
tried the spammy fries ( 4.5 / 5), mushroom, brie and truffle bao (5 / 5) and lychee and berry drink (3 / 5) -- too sweet for me
Came here on the way to pier 39, walking distance from embarcadero Bart station.
Average.  Ahi poke bowl is either bland or covered in wasabi if you get the sauce.  Service is really slow and can be a little rude.  Won't be back.

I can honestly say I've tried half the money and haven't been disappointed by anything yet.  The prices are great and you get a good amount of food.  They also have really great lemonade.  Last week I had their organic strawberry lemonade and this week I tried the guava lemonade--so refreshing!  Can't wait to try everything else!

I'd really like to give Sammy's 3.5 stars, but sadly, yelp won't allow it. I felt the food was, overall, just above mediocre (but only slightly). What kind of turned me of to my ahi poke bowl was the surprise wasabi mayo, or whatever that was, I didn't care for it too much. The spammy fries would've been awesome if they had spam bits in it, instead it was just a bunch of sodium from the sauce and fried rice. One positive is how visually awesome these dishes look in takeout containers. Also, the strawberry lemonade was awesome, as were their buns. The banana/coconut is a nice lil dessert option.

I come here about once a week for the Italian combo (- onion + pepperoncini) and this gigantic sandwich never fails to disappoint. The sourdough bread is delicious, and a small is plenty big for my equally enormous appetite.
Italian Combo on Dutch Crunch with extra spicy spread.  A bottle of sparking water and a bag of baked lays.  That, my friends, is the cure for the common hangover.
Clean little sandwich shop, nice variety,  hefty sandwiches,  jalapeño paste on whatever sandwich is a must try.

My new go-to for a sandwich fix. I order from them using OrderAhead and it's always ready to go when I arrive. I recommend for take-out only. I subtract a star because it's a bit pricey (yay SF), ambiance is nil, and their non-sandwich options don't look very appetizing. Regardless I definitely recommend Freddie's!
If you are looking for a quick bite to eat, this is the place to go! The sandwiches are made fresh to go and every bite is enjoyable.

I got sandwiches here over the weekend and was delighted to know this place hasn't changed since I was a kid (my dad used to buy me sandwiches from here growing up). The Italian Combo with soft sourdough was the best! So soft!
Time: 11:47am/65°F partly cloudy
Italian combo on sweet dutch with the pepper spread:) So. Good.

Great sandwich shop in the North Beach area.  I ordered the Italian combo on the semi hard sourdough and my friend ordered the egg salad.   They have lunch meat and even mortadella which can be a difficult cold cut/ lunch meat to find.   Very affordable and huge portions. I ordered the small 6 inch sub and only ate half of my sandwich.  This place has only a couple spots outside to eat at a couple bistro tables.
One of the best sandwich spots in the city. Consistent and great service/quality for your buck! Make sure to add that jalapeño spread for an extra kick! #Yum

This has become a go-to for lazy weekend pick-up sandwiches. Great variety of deli meat options available, or go all-in YOLO style and get the Italian combo. Bread-wise, my favorite is the semi-hard sourdough. Just hard enough to keep the sandwich together, yet soft enough that you don't squeeze out all of the toppings with that first big bite.

I have been coming here for almost 10 years and each time is as good as the previous. I always get the small chicken salad  sandwich with everything on hard sourdough, so I can't give any advice on anything else! It is the best chicken salad ever. I have seen the italian combo and that looks good. It is a whole lot of meat, so be hungry. Over the weekend I went and we were just enjoying our sandwiches on the bench and multiple people stopped to chat and reminisce about when a freddie's sandwich used to cost you 9 cents, it was great. Best sandwich in s.f.!!

ok I admit that I am I guess a fan of this place due to nostalgia . when I was in 7th grade I use to come here and get ham and chesse on a sour roll and still do even though the chesse is not quite the same and the ham is not the same. got some gristle in the ham the last time humm....but I guess I would still come here. oh you can order extra meat and chesse it just cost you more like $25 for 2 large sandwiches.
The highlight of my workday!  I yearn to come here every day M-F. Always fresh brewad delivered every morning, great customer service and prices to boot.
This place been making sandwiches for years. Very large selections of meat and bread. Recommend you order a large sandwich that way you can eat half and save the other half for later.
Freddie's is awesome. Great sandwiches with a huge variety of breads, meats, and cheeses. Fresh ingredients and quality service. They always get it right at Freddie's!
FREDDIES is a San Francisco institution.  Have been going here - for probably 20 years or more.
When we walked up at 11:45am to find utility workers and not one, but two different kind of cops cued up -- we felt pretty good.

Damn fine sandwiches! So glad to have this deli nearby for lunch at work. Small takeout place. There is usually always a line and can get crowded inside. They do take call in orders, so I'll be doing that next time as our wait was about 15 minutes for our sandwiches.

I've been going to Freddies off and on for over 40 years.   I love that it's still a genuine neighborhood place to get a real italian combo sandwich.   No Jive....just great sandwiches and great service and great memories.    Thank You Freddies.

As many of you know, construction vehicles in front of a sandwich joint are the 5-star Yelp review of yesteryear.  So on my way to work, where I am frequently inconvenienced by double-parked work trucks clogging up the street, rather than banging my steering wheel and yelling terrible things, I smile and think, "Thanks for the tip, fellas!"

there are 2 things a deli must have for me to give them my business: dutch crunch and shredded lettuce. freddies offers both and much, much more. it also happens to be 1.5 blocks from my house. lucky girl! honestly, their dutch is the BEST! super crunchy. i always call my (regular) order in and when i show up it's ready to go. i also appreciate that they cut and wrap halves individually in case you want to save some for later. they have everything figured out. a vast array of drink + chip selection and they take cards! salami+cheddar+revive vitamin water for $8 is my saturday hangover (or not) go to. the only thing that bums me out is that they're closed on sundays but hey, everything good deserves a day off.

This eatery should be designated as a SF landmark.  It's been here since 1926 and been changed hands a few times.  The current proprietor has been here for more than a decade.  Its main clientele is the school across the street.  I hear that people who grew up in the neihgorhood and moved away still come back for their fixes.  I was curious enough and made the trek to this little corner store.  There's nothing fancy about this North Beach establishment and it does show its age.  I didn't seek out the traditional turkey or roast beef sandwich.  I went for the large Italian Combo ($8.50).  Although its a little pricer than Subway, but its a hundred times better.  Pound for pound, I think the amount of meat in it actually makes it a bargain and tastier than the $5 Subway.  I usually don't (or can't) consume a large sandwich at one sitting.  On this occasion, when I started, I couldn't stop and broke my own record.  This is not the best sandwich in the Bay Area, but its on my short list.

As far as sandwiches go, I must say it's not even worth trying.  Come on, pile on the meat instead of piling on the tomatoes & lettuce which made my sandwich super soggy!  I drove clear across town for this sandwich & was totally disappointed.  I will not be back!!!
I take the 30 or 8x to visit my old neighborhood sandwich shop.  It is a harrowing ride between Kearny and Chinatown.

My family has been coming here since they were students at Francisco across the street.. So I grew up since Birth on this place!!! The OG Italian Combo on soft roll is the BEST!!! Can't go wrong! Love it here!
After working around the corner from Freddie's for about 1.5 years, I realized a few things.
Great sandwiches! It's all about their bread. I always get the sweet Dutch rolls...delicious!
I live across the street from this place, so convenience is definitely a plus, but despite that Freddie's is a great neighborhood sandwich store!

I have to say this sandwich was pretty underwhelming.  I got a turkey and ham with provolone, all the vegetables and garlic sauce.  It really lacked flavor all around, I'm not sure what they use for their garlic sauce but they should consider some scapes instead of parsley.  Dutch crunch bread was too chewy.  Most likely won't be coming back.

I'm visiting from Austin, Texas and my BnB is nearby. I got a sandwich from Freddie's and wandered down to the Pier for people watching and it was great. The service was friendly and FAST! I'll probably visit again before I leave town.

A day in the City with Tram N brought us here for Lunch. The place is pretty small and had Tram not done her research about this place I wouldn't have known they sold Sandwiches as it's a small convenience store with the counter at the back.
Nice service and fair price, but honestly I've had sandwiches that were way better.
Was in the area and stopped by for one of their sandwiches, which run around $6.20 on up.
Freddie's sandwiches - hate to give away neighborhood secrets but they have old-style deli sandwiches at a very reasonable price.
I've lived in the North Beach all of my life and Freddie's has been the sandwich institution.

On my bookmarks for over 2 years and I knew I bookmarked it for a reason.  The reason was that it's freakin' delicious, that's why.  After our little adventure at the Ferry Building, Emmalouise and I were ready for lunch.  Emmalouise isn't picky so she let me decide.  I then allowed Yelp to navigate us here...
I don't really like sandwiches, actually I avoid them if at all possible, but I have come here at least once a week to get lunch for work for the past 3 months.

Good little sandwich shop in North Beach. I had a small turkey sandwich & a side of potato salad. The portions are generous, so I saved half the sandwich and potato salad for dinner. Two meal servings for less than $10? Score! The bread was super soft & delicious. I think I may try a hot sandwich next time. Also, very speedy & friendly service.
Hands down one of the best sandwich spots in the city cant beat a full loaf Italian combo on their hard roll.

Best italian food i have ever had. The bruscetta was so flavorful and perfectly crisp it started themeal out on a high note. The gnocchi,as people have said before, melts in your mouth and makes you close your eyes so you can fully enjoy it. I got the lasagna which tasted homemade and was amazingly hearty, cheesy and satisfying. The tiramisu was of course great, but the cannoli was the star of the desserts and even their coffee was fantastic! Great servicethat is really quick and attentive as well! Dont miss this place :) it would make an amazing date night spot!

If you are looking for an authentic old world family experience, this is the place.  They are a family owned/run business in the style most businesses should aspire to be.  We made a reservation and were seated promptly.  We had our soon to be 4yr. old with us and he was warmly welcomed.  Our appetizers were tasty and our entrees were delicious. Our son's dessert was brought out with a birthday candle and the tiramisu was amazing.  Throughout our dining experience we traded anecdotes about small children with the family/waitstaff.  If you are interested in real people that serve great food that actually have pride in what they do, I suggest you give this place a visit.
This place is a really cute, small Italian restaurant. Definitely looks like a great date spot. We got seated right away (table for 2) on a Wednesday night.

Last Thursday night, before going to Beach Blanket, one of the gals in our party of 4 had suggested Franchinos.....we couldn't have been more pleased.....we were greeted and seated right away......by the sweetest lady....Mrs Franchinos I am thinking....we ordered the gnocchi as an appetizer for the 4 of us to share....it was delicious.... Our entrees couldn't have been better....and desert, oh my!!!!! The finish to a delicious meal.... I complimented the owner and told her, we would be back....

This is our favorite Italian place in San Francisco!  My girlfriend and I went here early in our relationship and it quickly became our go to venue for special occasions.  It's got everything we need for a special date: delicious food, intimate atmosphere, and friendly service.
My absolute new fav gem in my neighborhood.

This place disgusts me. Completely disappointed with their service!  I made a reservation at 6pm and called them at 5:58pm as a courtesy to tell them I was on my way and was going to be 5 minutes late. They proceeded to tell me that I'll then have to be put on the wait list and my reservation won't be valid. For 5 minutes of tardiness, that is completely excessive!  I can't believe that.  And the women that answered the phone was completely rude and gave me total attitude.  Just a heads up that supposedly the food might be good but to have that kind of service is unacceptable and other places in the city are better.
Excellent pasta - perfectly cooked!  We also enjoyed the clams, they were in a salty, buttery broth that was to die for!  Porcini Ravioli was amazing!
Just exceptional! This is exactly what I was looking for in Little Italy. A family business. Exceptional food!
Very nice mom and pop restaurant. I too think the owner welcomed us in and sat us in one of the 8 or so tables the restaurant has.

Awesome authentic Italian restaurant owned by a family. Very cute and cozy. Everything was really delicious. We ordered chicken parmigiana with pasta on the side, definitely a must try. Tortellini soup had enough flavour, wasn't too salty, again, great overall. We also ordered their homemade tiramisu, for me personally, the cream on it was a delight. Nice friendly service. The restaurant was packed, so if recommend making a reservation.

My second time here and definitely not my last! By far the best Italian food in SF! The owners treat all customers like family and I can say with confidence that everything on the menu is amazing! I love the lasagna and their ravioli. For dessert, the cannoli is the way to go!
Best mom & pop italian in sf! Walk right by the stinking rose & go here. Ask what ravioli the lady of the house made that day & order it!
- food: mediocre, store-bought pasta

A wonderful casual place to eat in the Ferry Building. I probably get my lunch from here more than any other restaurant in the building. The cafe serves fresh, healthy food with a menu that changes daily. I had the best ham sandwich I've ever had in my life here. Warm succulent ham with greens. The salads are delightful. Creative vegetable combinations with various cheeses and dressings. The stews are hearty and the rotisserie chicken fantastic as well. I've never had anything I did not like from this restaurant. Ask for a card if you are a regular there. They have an around the world sort of menu card where they give you a stamp for trying each of their different menu items. When you fill the card up they give you 50% off a lunch of your choice. A friendly staff who remembers you by name. They do have seating but it's in sort of a drafty corridor of the Ferry Building. Usually I get my meal to go and eat it in my office or take it someplace else.
My bad. The "random" guy on the sidewalk is the restaurants namesake. Interesting. And the food is great. Treated like family, small, intimate setting that's grey for talking and laughing. Nice.

I was here with a group of six women for a dinner meeting. I was excited because I don't get to North Beach as often as I'd like and was anxious for some real Italian food. I had a tough time parking and was a little late to our 6:30 p.m. reservation, but the other 5 girls were there. I called my friend to let her know I was walking and she said that they were already being pressured to hurry. I hastened my walk a bit and got there around 6:45 or so.
Nice Little family owned restaurant. Nicer than your average hole in the wall.
The service was good and the people are so nice, but this is over-priced and nothing special. It's typical "Little Italy" fare.

Incredible service and food. We got the lasagna and chicken parmesan. They were both AMAZING! We left feeling full but not heavy. We got a table right away, but I got the feeling that it's usually not the case. I'd recommend calling ahead or arriving early. Also, they only seat you when everyone in your pretty has arrived.

You might find cheaper, or nicer decor in North Beach, but you will not find better food.  If you aren't charmed by the Mother and Daughters working hard while exuding Italian warmth, you ain't got a heart. Yes, you might have to drive around to get a parking spot and then wait, but it is  worth it.  Fresh, hand made pasta and Tiramisu by mom were wonderful.  We will be back.
I don't write reviews often unless I feel the compelling need to let my annoyances or pleasure out about a place.
A very lovely setting. Pastel blue tables, lots of "Italian" paintings/items, and clean plates/silverware.

My wife and I are both of Italian dissent  so we are extremely critical when it comes to Italian food. We both grew up in households where our parents and grandparents made their own meatballs and gravy (yes true Italians really call it gravy and not sauce or meat sauce).  If you want neuvo cuisine type food maybe Franchino isn't your cup of tea. But if you want great pasta with meatballs, and great gravy that is all homemade by Mama who is originally from the Amalifi Coast of Italy, this is your place. The restaurant is small and fills up quickly so get there early. We arrived by 6pm and had no problem getting a table. Arrive at 7pm and the place is packed.  The owner makes all of her own pasta and gravy and you can tell. Her daughters work as waitresses and they are all a delight.  We're from the Phila area originally and these folks made us feel right at home.  The chianti is great accompaniment and if you save room for dessert, the homemade tiramisu is to die for. To be frank, I can't figure out how anyone could give this restaurant a 1 rating.  The food is just too good. Maybe if you want quiet romantic, you could deduct points for the ambiance but still, the food more than compensates. I cannot say enough good things about Franchino. We would absolutely make this one of our eateries on our next trip.

We had a good meal but it was overshadowed by the attitude of the hostess/owner/waitress.  Very rude. All about her needs.  No regard for allowing the customer to enjoy the experience.   If she wants to turn tables so quickly,  maybe she should say that upon booking reservation.  Rushed from the get go.

Awesome restaurant. Easily the most authentic in Little Italy. not the biggest or showiest - but this is where you come if you want amazing authentic Italian cooked by Nonna ! Book way ahead or walk in but be prepared to wait 20-30mins on busy nights - but worth the wait. The Gamberi was awesome
My new favorite hole in the wall Italian restaurant.

We have had dinner here twice. The most recent was last weekend. Both times our dinner has been excellent. The family is very friendly and made us feel welcome. We were seated right away. We received water and bread along with olive oil and vinegar.

With so many choices in the area, very few, if any are as good as this one.   Love eating at local family owned and operated and this one did not disappoint.  Price is reasonable and service was friendly and fast.   Excellent quality as well.   Not a big bar selection but enough to satisfy.   Will return next time in in San Francisco for sure.
I've really gotta give this place five stars...

We stumbled into Columbus Ave on our first day in S.F.  This family-owned place is excellent.  My boyfriend's chicken saltimboca was really good.  I had a pasta with marinara. It was perfect. The place is small and we were lucky to find a table.
Yummy Italian food at an authentic family owned joint. We need a place like this in Palo Alto!
Either the quality has gone down or my taste buds have higher expectations than the last time I was here (about 2 years ago).

The small restaurant is in a great location right in Little Italy. Next time I go to San Francisco, I am for sure coming back here. The Veal Saltimboca  was to die for and I can honestly say I have never had a more delicious fettucinni than the one they make here.!

I love this restaurant to death. My friend and I ended up here after The House told us there was an hour wait. Ain't nobody got time for that! Yelp guided us to better. So far my favorite Italian restaurant, it's too bad I live in LA.

Absolutely a wonderful experience. The caprese salad and house salads were a great start. My wife and I had 2 different veal dishes (mustard and saltimbucco). Both excellent! Followed our meal with delicious limoncello custard. Very friendly and efficient service with a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

Best Italian we have had in years. Mama must work her butt off each day to create gnocchi, cannoli and ravioli of such quality. Vongole, smoked mozzarella, ravioli and the special pappardelle all excellent.  The family inadvertently entertained us while we ate, go early as I think it gets a bit chaotic as the evening wears on. Thanks for great service Monica!

Our family of six had dinner at  Franchino's Sat night.  We are from San Diego and live near a mall w a Buca De Bepo (sp?) a franchise that imitates old Italian family food w tacky/sheek decor.  Franchino's must be where they got the idea from!  Everything about this place was a joy.  From the older Italian grandpa with booming voice and playfull welcome, to grandma who helped us  tease/scold our naughty 12yo son, to the daughter waitress.  Space and decor was a visual delight.  Food was delicious and complex, much better than mall restaurant mentioned above.  Tiramisu for dessert was the best I've had.  Thanks so much for making our stay in SF a delightful vacation for all our senses.
After walking all the way from
Amazing food. The mom, Carmela, and the dad were wonderful hosts. Felt like being an Italian home, such warmth and comfort. Small dining area, but wonderful atmosphere.
Wine was pricier than I anticipated ($8 for a house red). But it's a cute bar with friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere. Good for people looking for a comfortable spot to have a drink and a snack.

A solid, local neighborhood bar with a great atmosphere. My go-to for 49ers football. The bar food is damn good too. I've had a burger, veggie burger, breakfast chroizo tacos, and the famous bacon-wrapped tots--all are really, really good. Solid bloody mary's as well, albeit a little pricey at $8.

Cool bar, BUT there are a few douchey guys that  run rampant 'round this place. I guess that could be just about any bar in SF, so I'm not hating, just saying.. I will definitely be back but I will bring friends and ignore all weirdos lol
Great place to catch a game (what ever sport you want to see). There are at least 5 tvs inside. Its a casual local bar that can get packed depending on the day.
Taco Tuesday is off the hook. Try the carnitas tacos. And you can never go wrong with bacon wrapped tots

I'll give the bar itself 4 stars, but if I was rating the clientele, they'd get a big FAT 1 star. Talk about a Sausage Fest. And not the good kind of Sausage Fest, ladies! All the worst kind of douchey sausages that you could never want to meet. I truly hope that we had an off experience last night when we went to trivia because I feel sorry for the Boardroom staff if that is what their normal patrons are like. I'll probably only go back if I feel like it's a good night to get constantly harassed.

I have mixed emotions about The Boardroom. On the one hand, it's in North Beach, a place I love, the staff is incredibly kind, they play great music, and have lots of big TVs for ample sports viewing.
Bacon wrapped tator tots !!!
Yay! I'm a fan.  Here are 5 reasons why I give two thumbs up to The Boardroom:

To the guy below that call the place "Racist". I was there and I'm african-american. You were kicked out for taking your beer outside. No place allows that if they can't serve liquor outside. The Bartender ( Sal ) was super polite, reasonable and gave you NUMEROUS WARNINGS. You and your friends were out of line and rude. You can't break the rules and be sh*tty!!!! Sorry... you gotta Pick One! That is why you got the Deuces, bruh!

After eating several entrees of food and enjoying a couple drinks, my friends and I were outside chatting with some other guests and my girlfriend brought me a beer while I was outside. She claimed that the bartender was cool with this. While we were outside talking, a man who claimed to be the owner happened to be walking into the bar at the same time. He stated that we could not have our drinks outside, to which we gladly obliged and brought our beverages inside. At this point the owner seemed very upset with the bartender for letting this happen. Once inside, my girlfriend went back outside to have a smoke and did not have any drinks with her. She had been outside for about 20 min and since the area is a little dark and shady, I decided to peek my head out the front door to check on her. Let me clarify, I did not set foot outside of the door I only looked outside to make sure my girlfriend was OK. At this point, the bartender very rudely asked me to give him my drink. I believe he was trying to make up for his prior mistake of letting us take the drinks outside and to look good in front of the owner. Once again, I did not put up a fight and gave him my drink and the bartender never mentioned that I was cut off or could not have another drink. About 5 minutes later, my buddy had an extra drink, which he gave to me. When the bartender saw me with another drink he proceeded to officially kick me and my whole group of friends out of the bar. My other friends asked why they were being kicked out as well and the owner claimed "Because you are with him and I have to backup my bartender". My friends were from outside of the area and I felt we were being treated unjustly and unfairly because we were seen as outsiders. Message to the bartender: own up to your mistakes and don't try and make up for it by being overly strict to customers, that is not a fair way to treat your business.
We came in last night for trivia and had a blast.
Looking for a dive bar in the city that locals frequent and the tourist don't wander into? Then The Boardroom is your place to go!

Try the bacon wrapped tater tots!  I am not sure they are '$9 good' but it is bacon and tater tots, you really can't go wrong.  The Boardroom was a typical dive, order at the bar and disgusting bathrooms, but it was fabulous to get away from all the tourists!!  We each had a cold beer, wolfed down some bacon wrapped tots, then decided it was time to move onto the next watering hole.
A true North Beach gem. A must goto bar / food spot.
Excellent brunch!!
Cool bartender and a chill vibe in this neighborhood bar. Don't pass up the bacon wrapped tater tots. Truly an appetizer born from binge drinking.
A couple reasons why this place is great:
Decent for a neighborhood dive. They accept credit cards which is also a plus.

Nice place! Very nice staff and super comfortable and chill feeling for an easy Sunday lunch. Must try their bacon tots while rooting for your team on tv. Their drink selection is nice too so take a snap at it.

This place is awesome!  Salvador was the bartender and he was incredibly friendly the food is delicious.   Take my advice,  ask the cook to "get crazy" with their Boardroom burger.   You won't be sorry.   Also,  have to heard of bacon wrapped tater tots? Because you should have.
Love love LOVE this place! Best bloody Mary's and breakfast! Great place to watch a game, super nice people
We were able to get a table and it was comfortable and big. I got a beer and tried a couple of a friend's fries and they were yummy! I've heard this place has better than average food.
Trivia nights are fabulous and the staff is awesome. Fun chill nights are spent here. We live close and make it here at one or two times a week and it's always pleasant.

This is an excellent neighborhood bar/dive. Its small and pretty bare bones with old booths and beer buckets that hold utensils and condiments. We walked here for a quick drink and bite to eat before flying out on Sunday. All of our plates were under $10 and the Bloody Mary was awesome.

Wandered into the Boardroom by myself to catch some of the NCAA tournament. I'm from out of town so the bartender was very friendly since I was all by myself. I think his name was Lou... The place had a good atmosphere and a good group of people trying to get their Friday drink on.

Went to the boardroom with some friends last Sunday morning, because I heard they had a decent brunch and a bloody Mary that could "knock my socks off".  Both had exceeded my expectations. I had the loco moco with house made gravy, which put me directly in heaven, and the side of bacon smothered in maple syrup.  Can I just say, I will return for the bacon alone! if there is a heaven, I sincerely hope it is made of this bacon! Moving on...

Was having a pretty good time here with a group of friends until I was getting ready to leave. I was waiting on my boyfriend when suddenly I felt something hit my chest. The bartender had thrown a plastic cup at me from behind the bar. When I asked him why, he stated "You looked like you weren't having fun." Yes, because hitting me with a projectile object is going to help me have an awesome time. Screw you. Who behaves like that and works in customer service?
Time: 9:07pm/59°F clear
This bar is a great neighborhood spot.  I always have a good time - whether it is for weekly Tuesday Trivia, Thursday night football, college football Saturdays...or just to pop in for a few drinks.

The bacon wrapped tots are the shiz but the BELT was dry and flavorless, lacking avocado and any perpetual longing for a future visit. The onion rings were decent and the one dude I met was friendly but Overall  this bar is good for the tots but lacks much else

I was drawn to this place with the promise of bacon wrapped tater tots and brunch.  I understood this is a dive bar, so I didn't expect too much. The food is cheap bar fare. There are lots of tvs showing sports and lots of frat alumni for those that enjoy those things.
Great bar, awesome bartenders, cheap chicken wings and bacon wrapped tator tots...plenty of tv's to watch sports.

Friendly service. Great food (bacon wrapped tators,! Deep fried pork buns with awesome sweet and spicy sauce!). Great drinks! Non pretentious patrons that will sing along to Whitney Houston and do push ups for shoes! What more can you ask for?

bacon wrapped tator tots.  in theory, it sounds awesome, they were actually overcooked, dry and quite salty.  i do appreciate they give you a mix of buffalo hot sauce and ranch to dip it in, but for $8, it's a little steep considering there were about 12 tots on the plate
Went here because someone that I share a workspace with said they have good wings and other bar food.
My wife and I were in town during college football season and were looking for a place that both served food and had our

I am revising this poor review (1) to a (3) reflecting management care and reaching out to me to correct the problem. I would've given a (4) if it weren't for an employee's extreme rudeness at the location. White male with long blond hair and tattoos. He was very disrespectful to our group the first time we ever went. After discussing with other employees this seems to be a common occurrence for this dude.
Great sports bar. This place is no frills and a fantastic place to check out and watch a game.
Boardroom is the perfect, sticky, delicious-bar-food-fried, fast beer and shots football bar I've been to in SF. It's a serious Arizona State University football bar too! A-S-UUUUUUUUUU!!!!

I go here around once a week and just love the place. The chicken is perfectly cooked and seasoned. One time, one of the waitresses witnessed my clumsy attempt at trying to use utensils, knocking a piece of chicken on the floor. They replaced that piece of chicken.
Super casual restaurant on Columbus with freaking delicious chicken. All the sides are solid as well.
Chicken very dry.  I mean very very dry.  Salad fresh and veggie soup was good.  But the chicken, the main reason for Il Pollaio was dry and bland.

This is a good place to grab a casual meal, especially if you want a lot of food. I have ordered the chicken, combination salad, fries, and split pea soup at this place. While the volume of food is a good deal for the price, I was not impressed by the food. The chicken was juicy and flavorful, but not something I would come back for. The fries were fresh from the fryer, but were really bland. The split pea soup was unpleasantly thick and had a bitter taste.

This restaurant is famous for its chicken and salads. The chicken is pretty nicely done, the combination salad is also a good deal. The service is attentive without being intrusive. They should maybe buy more bottles of oil, we had to share ours with 3 others tables. The price is decent and affordable but I have to admit that I was expecting a price a little bit cheaper.

Il Pollaio is a North Beach institution, and unlike many of the other restaurants in the area, they have tons of regular local customers, like myself. The chicken is obviously the primary attraction. It's always super tasty, with a nice crisp skin, and pairs very well with the combination salad.

Come have dinner here and your palate and wallet won't be disappointed.... The chicken is done perfectly and it is seasoned just right.  It's convenient and fast for take out as well.  Dinner for two or three will not be expensive...

In this area, if you want a dinner for 2 out somewhere, you'll be hard pressed to find anything for $30 or under. It is full of touristy Italian places and expensive food. My boyfriend and I ate at Il Pollaio for under $30 AND we both had leftovers for lunch the next day.

The best chicken in town! This place is small, you can tell it is more local, waitresses know their customers, they are like friends with them! If it's your first time at this place it is a MUST to try their CHICKEN special with combination salad! Simple, reasonable prices and ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! I'm becoming a regular!
This place has amazingly tasty chicken.  My favorite is getting the half chicken and grilled onions.  You cannot go wrong here and healthy options abound here.

The chicken is soooo goood, but my boyfriend's chicken was not cooked all the way through and was red.  My bf told me over the phone to make sure they cooked the chicken thoroughly - I did not.  I brought the food back and my plate was thoroughly cooked, however his wasn't.  He's had several plates previously and almost every time, the chicken was red by the bone. Ew.  Other than that, the chicken is seasoned to perfection.
Roasted chicken as it should be done!
Chicken is amazing, price is right, service is prompt and the servers are fun to joke around with.
what i ordered... a whole roasted chicken
Quick service.

Amazing. But don't bother, this is a good secret we want to keep to ourselves! I love them so much I don't even want to share a review in fear of creating more of a crowd than there already is for this place....but I am here too often, infant in a car seat included, and I owe them one for their amazing customer service and quick accommodations, even when crowded.  Oh and of course that amazing food...speaks for itself.

Nice take-out and (small, oddly-shaped) eat-in restaurant specializing in chicken. Apparently they sometimes have rabbit too, which I missed. Cooked on a flat-top grill and heavily-spiced with oregano n stuff, the half-chicken was juicy and really tasty. The fries were steak-cut and not that crisp by the time I got em home, but still quite edible. And the coleslaw was really crunchy - you apply the dressing your own self right before eating. It was very nice.

I have been coming here for at least 8 years and I always have a good experience with the food and service. The food quality always consistent. You may have to wait a little bit on the weekend if you catch their on their rush time due to their limiting seating space, otherwise everything is alright.

Oh yeah.  I love this little hole in the wall.  Have been going there for years anytime I am in San Francisco.  The menu is small: chicken, rabbit, sausages or steak as well as salad and fries make us the most of it.  But man I have never had a bad meal here and it is cheap to boot.  Tell that inner voice urging you to order the salad to go away and order the fries instead (or as well).  They are always perfectly crispy and soft and hot on the inside.  Can't go wrong with the chicken here either or any anything else on the menu.

I came during lunch time on a Wednesday. This place is an institution and I know it has a lot of regulars. I witnessed that fact that afternoon. The waitress knew people's names and in general, their orders. She was not unfriendly, but businesslike. I ordered the half chicken and green salad combo with bleu cheese dressing on the side. My boyfriend tried the Italian sausage and ordered a side of fries.

This has got to be one of my favorite restaurants in North Beach. It's easily overshadowed by more well-known places like Mama's and Tony's Pizza, but if you're looking for more of a home-cooked or comfort-food meal, this place is it.
The best place in North Beach to get chicken.
Half chicken and combination salad are good.

Best grilled chicken in the bay area! Great portions, good prices, glass of good red wine for only $6, combination salad is delicious, sausages are yum and very friendly staff! It's just a hidden gem if you haven't come yet and you love chicken, come now! I don't know why but this chicken always reminds me of my summers in portugal! Oh and they do a boiled potato that is just sticky deliciousness with awesome olive oil. The most friendly employees and owners that offer excellent service. I have many fond memories of eating here with my dad. If you can't figure out where to eat and you want good food that won't cost you an arm and a leg, please come here! Bon appetite!
We have been going to Il Pollaio for years. Jose and Ana always made us feel welcome, especially when we brought our children.

Il Pollaio is mainly known for its grilled chicken, so that's what I ordered. I got the half chicken with fries. It was more than enough food for me and tasty. The fries were thick cut, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The chicken had a flavorful seasoning and was very tender. No complaints, priced right and tasted good. I would consider buying a whole chicken to go in the future and using it in salads or other dishes.
Chicken was tasty

Problem #1: I am surrounded by sandwich places when it's time for lunch. I decided I want chicken, not chicken chunks in a sub, not chicken slices between 2 pieces of bread and not chicken bits grilled inside a panini. I want to pick the bones out myself and tear off the crispy skin with my teeth.

Ahhhhhh, Il Pollaio. I have been ordering out from this restaurant every week and a half or so for the last couple months, but today was the first time I ate out here. Atmosphere is comfy-cozy, just how I like it, our server was very sweet, kind, and helpful, and the wait for the food was only about five minutes, which was awesome, because I was STARVING and couldn't have the bread, since I was celebrating Passover. "But what about the food?", you may ask. The food was AWESOME. The chicken is delicious (three friends and I got a whole chicken, large garden salad, and large fries), I had no garden salad, because that kind of salad is not quite to my liking, but my friends said it was great. The fries were lovely looking, and they were so good I felt less guilty about eating them. The only reason that this didn't get five stars is the fact that we had to wait 10-15 minutes for our food to be taken and our check to be given. I was so full, though, the wait just gave me a couple minutes to relax.

I was trying to soothe a hangover with some comfort food, and had wandered around poking my head into much too full and much too vacant restaurants until I found this restaurant that was juuust right, or so I thought....

Came here on a cold weeknight and my boyfriend and I were seated immediately. It's a very casual dining experience. Salads are huge and 2 people can definitely share a salad and the yummy fries. My boyfriend ordered the half chicken and devoured it in 5 minutes. So tasty! We had to order another! This is a local place and their food does not disappoint. If you're hungry for some finger lickin' chicken, this is your place!
Chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken, chicken.

Oh so good! The chicken was tasty and charcoaled. Even loved the bbq sauce. Also - the split pea soup was super yum - thick and smoky. And the combo salad was fresh and simple. Small locals feel to the place. Loved it.
BEST CHICKEN. Seriously probably my favorite meal of all time: half chicken, homemade salsa, combo salad.
I have been eating at il Pollaio for almost 20 years.

Delicious chicken.  Like, so good that I'd like to use expletives to emphasize my point, but have to avoid doing so.  The whole concept for this place is so simple and so well done, particularly for those times you're in the mood to switch off the bougie SF foodie persona and go casual with some food like grandma makes (if my grandma were Italian).
Decent food, bad service.

I've been coming to Il Pollaio for years. It's a nice little family-owned joint that serves up some pretty tasty food. The chicken is always great off the grill, with a little squeeze of lemon, but I generally go for their burger or their 3 sausages. The burger is good meat and I get it medium rare. It's kind of a longer shape than the typical patty and they usually serve it on a scooped-out piece of baguette or sometimes ciabatta(which I don't like as much). The 3 sausages meal is interesting because I guess you can get it as a sandwich on the baguette, but I've also gotten them uhhh...not as a sandwich. The sandwiches come with hella tomatoes, lettuce and raw onions, but I uusually take out the lettuce and tomatoes and eat that separately as my salad.

We have been bringing our family here well over 15 years. Everyone has their favorites, chicken, rabbit, combo salad, and they make a great burger and the best fries ever. You may have to wait for a table, but worth it.
i can't believe this is the first time i've thought of writing about this place.  i've been going here forever - well, about 17 years...

This was our final stop for the North Beach Food tour.  We were served an appetizer of the ham, tomato, and mozzarella cheese.  The tomato acidity counter acted with the olive oil and the cheese. Quite a delicious bite.

Maybe it was due to a long day and it being the Columbus Parade but the service was terrible. I would understand if it was busy but there were 4 parties or less the whole time we were there, with 3 employees as servers.

you gotta Love homemade Italian food especially if a Beautiful  Roman lady is cooking it from scratch for you , great fun service , and  rich portions , would not suggest to take a date but good for big groups and mingling with friends, dishes to watch ... croccanti melanzane ,margherita pizza and ravioli Romani ..

OUTSTANDING pizza romana and one of my favorite N Beach people of all time, ciao Romina :  )......this is how a lot of NB used to be, friends.  Good service, delicious cucina semplice ('foodies' might be disappointed b/c there is no pretension here).  Good beers on tap, lots of unique combinations of pizza, panini, pasta, and diverse menu.  Many locals know this is the place for solid pizza romana and it's not so in-your-face, let's make a lotta money as Tony's.  (Sorry Tony but a lot of us still miss La Felce and that space will never be as good).  Last night there were three or four local fellas at the bar, all of us were very happy, pizza beer Giants, and a pair of Italian tourists at a back table...they were also VERY happy, which says a lot (especially if you have lived in Italy and can understand their +++ comments about their dinner and the lovely feel of this place).  Nice experience there last night, grazie tanto!
As a true pizza fanatic I love many a kind o pizza.   So I went binging tonight to sample a few pies in North Beach, San Francisco.

As a North Beach local, and Italian native, this is one of the most authentic places around. Fabulous crispy thin crusted pizza that melts in your mouth. Romina the owner is feisty, full of personality and a true treat. I always recommend the Boscaiola, sauage and mushroom pizza (#1) on the menu.But seriously, this is REAL pizza, so soak it up and take a lesson from Cinecitta.

Amazing thin crust pizza and the owner, who works behind the bar, is very attentive and playfully nice. When we asked to make some additions to the pizza she happily agreed, anything to make the silly customers happy.  Great wine and food selection for a date. The food, even the pizza, is very light and won't leave you feeling like you need to be rolled out of here.
My family and I had a birthday dinner here recently and it was a fun and tasty experience! The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. The staff was accommodating and friendly.
What an amazing experience I had at Cinecitta!  I went there nearly a month ago for my sisters birthday, and I regret not writing this review until now.
Great food!!  Whole made sauce and pasta, this place is the bomb.  You go stay and enjoy the food, not a place for a rushed meal.
If I had to sum up my advice after eating here into one word, it would be this: AVOID!  Bland food, NO atmosphere, and a Groupon policy that's laughable.

I found the place during the time I lived in NB, shortly after it opened from 2005-08 . I only recently moved back, and have been a regular for the past year. The pizza is great, with a crunchy, extremely thin crust and flavorful sauce. I love the Trastevere and Porcini pizza. Another favorite is the fried mozarella (freshly made and not frozen!). The pasta and particular lasagna are outstanding as well.

I had a sausage pizza slice. Very generous serving! The owner learned from her grandfather in Rome. They make their sausage, as well as a sauce with very little, if any, sugar, I'm told. I had a very enjoyable time with the staff and other guests! I actually chose it because of its location, close to the route I was taking. When I arrived, there were a number of tempting places to choose from, but I just stick with the plan.  So glad I did!! Thanks, Cinecittà!

Wine was great! Salad and Alla Romano pizza tasted homemade. Amazing!  We used a groupon and weren't sure what to expect. Our waitress Romina (the nice blond) was awesome. Great suggestions for wine. Custom salad. We'll be back!
There's a reason why some businesses rely on Groupon.  Cinecitta is a prime example.
Not at all what I was expecting.
Great food, great hospitality.  If you like to order a variety, this is the place.  The crust is so light and non filling you can order multiple items.  I recommend this place!
Great friendly staff.
Quite simply the best pizza I've ever had anywhere. You can't go wrong here. The employees were super nice too. I'll he back again and again.

I am not a pizza connoisseur, and I avoid preserved meats like prosciutto.  This place made me a convert! The caprese salad was amazing! And the pizza was the best I've ever tried. The owner provided complimentary strawberries and fresh whipped cream as dessert after we declared ourselves too stuffed to take another bite - and she proved us very wrong indeed. :-)

Excellent food; Homemade right in front of you. Great wine selection picked personally by the owner. Fitting statement: No one is ever perfect, but this "angry blonde" is right up my alley. If you want great food and an excellent experience, visit this place.

My family and I went there on Monday April 21st to have some of the best thin crust pizza I have ever tasted. Unfortunately, we were met with serious attitude from the blonde lady who was working there. She walked over and pointed at another 4+ top table which I assumed meant "why didn't you sit over there?"  I responded with "we would've sat there if it wasn't for the "reserved" sign that was on the table."  After we were sat she dropped the menus on the table and walked away.
Best pizza and Calzone ever, with great wine recommendations. I'm definitely coming back!
My 4 rating means I need to come back. This place was good, but not a must to return to. I consulted my 3 friends during the dinner, and they all agreed.
The pizza here is amazing!!!  I also love the service!  Definitely go here for a delicious dinner!

Neat little place in North Beach. Good Italian food (kinda heavy) and it looks like there's a nice wine selection ,but it was St Paddy's Day so I decided to go for the wine instead. They seemed a little short-staffed when I was there with friends, but good experience overall.

This is a small "hole in the wall" type place. Our hostess was also our server, the bartender and helped cook as well. I think she is the owner and was very friendly, good with our kids and had a great Italian accent, throwing in some basic Italian words into our service. It was a great experience.
Owner is a total crack up who cares about her customers and makes the best thin crust I have ever had!

A small place with a huge heart.  Go in the afternoon to meet the owner Romeann ( not sure of the spelling).  She is sweetheart with a adventurous past.  From tinkerbell to world renowned shows this professional dancer will entertain you with her stories.  Not to mention her love of her former city - Rome.  A glass of wine and her pizza is a perfect afternoon date.
Was a very easy big group meal for a birthday but the food wasn't anything special. I think the one thing that stood out was the sausage and pepperoni pizza.
I ate my last Cinecitta pizza in 2006. It was so good I wrote a review 8 years later. End of story.
Can't take leftovers when using a Groupon and won't honor Groupon without a reservation even if there are no other customers!  Read on it actually happened.

Complete discrepancy between price and food. Don't go with kids or you'll end up ordering off-menu...$18 for spaghetti and meatballs is absolutely crazy considering the food was just ho-hum.  Plain penne pasta with olive oil was $14. Guess the pasta was hand made in Italy. Pizza was ok except for the nice black sheen on the edges...maybe that's how they ensure it was cooked extra crispy.  Overall disappointing experience.  Never should have strayed from Sodini's.

Romina makes us feel welcome here! We are a lesbian couple, one Italian, one Jewish. I enjoy taking my date here for authentic pizzas in the style of Roma, brings me back to my vacation time in Rome. I also like the authentic Italian owner's sense of hospitality and warmth which makes me feel welcome. Her accent is also charming!  Must add to the flavor of the food :)There is always some great house wines and Romina makes suggestions on what goes with what if you don't know any better. She's also treated us to some amazing desserts (lemon curd tart, volcano brownie. The "Di Pera" Pear Salad is just perfect, fresh, tart, and sweet.

After a show at Cobb's, buddy of mine and I stumbled across this hole in the wall. The owner was very hospitable and offered several nice tastes of wine (more than just a small splash). The fried mozzerella and fresh marinara was delicious, and the pizza I had was delicious as well! Nice quaint little spot to grab a personal pizza, that was about the size of a medium pizza at any other place. A small piece of Italy hidden in SF.

I have been to--and still go to--Cinecitta more than any other restaurant in SF.  I know that every time I go, I'll get great food, friendly service and no hassles.  It's nice enough to bring a date and comfortable enough to grab a bite on my own.  For two, split the Di Pera salad and the Diavola pizza.
Food was ok, the Caesar Salad was - eh. The rice ball appetizer was good, the pizza was yummy! The eggplant plate was burnt, and the service was friendly but sub-par. No need to come back.

The best pizza you'll ever have -- unless you go to Rome. Oh wait!  The mozzarella is flown in from Rome. Their pizza is super thin and crisp. Just order the margherita pizza and let it melt in your mouth and you'll know that this pizza was heaven sent. A true neighborhood find.

I take dance classes with Romina and she is an amazing dance/instructor so I thought I would try her rest. to support her.  I was so pleasantly surprised that the food is so flipping good!!!   I have been several times with several friends now and we all loved it.    The pizza and salads are my fav!!  So stinking good!

This is a good place for thin crust pizza and tables are always available although this is a small room. The middle aged lady is truly from Rome and lived near the Cinecitta studios hence the name of the restaurant. Salads are good as well. Some tables out on the sidewalk but it gets windy.
Nice vibe with candle light and high tops and tables by the bar. Good cocktails and the cheese plate was generous and quality. Hipster vibe but without the pretense.
One of my favorite Watering holes when I'm in town.
this place was down an alley, wouldn't recommend girls walking down there by themselves.

Omg! This place offers more than the just perfectly balanced cocktails I know and love.  Had dinner tonight and it was amazing!!!!  Highlights were the lobster/prawn fideo (traditional Spanish dish kinda like paella but with teeny thin noodles), the charcuterie plate (which included a delicious roasted bone marrow), and the Poutine with spicy sausage and burrata.
Nice craft cocktails. Had the boiled peanuts which tasted great and the service was equally pleasant.
Another establishment where the name is its address. Upscale, yuppies, good cocktails.

I enjoyed a late breakfast here on a lazy Sunday afternoon.  The menu had some great, unique options.  Lots of attention to detail with the ingredients.  The drinks were good.  Super friendly service.  And in the best hood in SF. :)
Two words: Corpse Reviver

When a friend says, "It's a bar in an alley" I'm almost always intrigued. Lucky for me, this isn't the first alley bar/restaurant I've patronized so that statement didn't scare me off. Even walking/barging through the long strip club lines in North Beach to get to 15 Romolo was worth the effort. The place was packed on a Saturday night but the crowd thinned out after midnight.  We lucked out and got to sit at the bar. I looked through the cocktail menu but ordered my standard go-tos, an old fashioned and a Sazerac. My lovely friend ordered a French 75 and an Elderflower Fizz Martini (fancy lady!). Drinks were superb. Alcohol content also did not disappoint. The bartenders were great and very attentive. I also have to note that there was a very attractive crowd the night we visited. My friend commented that the same attractive people party was in full effect the last time she visited. Maybe I'll come back more often?

Went on Sunday during brunch. It was semi ok. Nothing super amazing nothing super bad about the food. I did notice the ice tea was super watery which is not a huge deal (I mean worse things in life to get upset about ) but anyhow, they charged 3 dollars PER ICE TEA. Yikes. I had three of them. So.. 9 dollars of watery iced tea. Looked on the menu and it didn't specify that so no warning. Boo! Anyhow 3 stars for food, dropped down to 2 for the ice tea Enron situation.
We had one more food stop on your petite adventure but since she needed a break we decided to stop at 15 Romolo for a drink break.
I came here for my graduation dinner with a group of ~10 friends. The food was solid, and the drinks were great. My friend loved the 50/50 martini, and my moscow mule was good.

Cute little place, with "never a wait" according to them! Bold statement for SF brunch, but it's so hidden away I'm not surprised that more people don't know about it. I had the benedict, and it was fine. Served on toast with really nice pieces of thick bacon (best part) with a much more liquid-y hollandaise sauce. I would get the hollandaise on the side next time; it overpowered it for me, and made everything a little too wet. Definitely get a side of the hash browns though - very fried, very yummy. I also had a bite of my sister's blueberry pancakes & bacon, and those were very good. I think that might be big enough for 2 people to share as well. Ooh, also had a sip of their bloody mary and it is SPICY!

Loved how this place was hidden inside a small street with an artsy set up. Their drinks are well made and the waitress was very sweet. Plus, they always have fresh flowers delivered every week to change it up!

Really good craft cocktails and cool vibe! Haven't tried the food, but Brian made us some delicious drinks when we stopped in for some celebratory cocktails pre-dinner.  It can be a bit loud, but it's all in good fun. Highly recommend the Sleepy Jean and Socialites & Cigarettes.  Great place to bring out-of-towners or with a group of friends.
Been here a bunch of times and it has been consistently good every time!  Great food and cocktails.  Next time you go put peanut butter on your burger!!!! You wont regret it!
Great service, yummy cocktails but disappointing food. Avoid the mussels if possible..yikes!

I'm a big fan of 15 Romolo. Been a handful of times and always have fun there. Love the juke box, though it's hard to hear your songs over the crowd. There's a fun old school photo booth that smells like the inside of a vintage backgammon set. It's in  the corner and it's worth the $5. The waitstaff is super friendly. Pretty innovative drinks, my favorite is the Dargeeling limited because it has black pepper and gin. Who would have thought? Highly recommend the fries, with house made curry ketchup and mayo or go for it with the sausage rich poutin. It's out of this world. This place is a north beach must.
This place has bizarre interesting drinks and good bar food. The menu is very fun to read and order from. Highly recommend stopping here!

We stopped in here for a friend's birthday, and the staff was awesome. Brought us two birthday treats (on the house) and they were delicious. Some type of orange custard-type thing. Our server also was very helpful when we asked her to define what she believed to be a "basic bitch." She was even able to provide an exotic East Bay perspective.

Charged us for a cake fee even though they did absolutely NOTHING. We cut a cupcake into 4 pieces for a friend's bday and cleaned the table ourselves. I asked the server if she could waive the cake fee since a) we did not know and b) because we bussed the table ourselves and her reply was, "It's only $3/person..." and "You could've eaten outside."
Pimm's Cup - light, refreshing, delicious

This place is a blast! The cocktails are delicious and well-prepared, and the atmosphere is very trendy if a bit hipster. I didn't try the food personally, but the drinks really were tasty, and they were pretty strong too! This is a fun place for a solid night out in North Beach with a relatively small group.

My boyfriend and I came in for brunch this morning, and had an outstanding experience. We ordered the bloody Mary which was spicy and amazing. We then ordered 3 dishes between the two of, The eggs benedict ( BEST HOLLANDAISE IN SF), The stuffed piquillo pepper (SO GOOOODD), and the baked egg dish.
Cool, except for the hipsters.

Hidden gem just off of Broadway. Someone has to point it out to you or you will never know it is there. It can get crazy crowded and hot which is why I only give it 4 stars. The drinks are fantastic. The jukebox songs are terrific. This is where I discovered my favorite Bill Withers song Use Me!

15romolo is a really cool place off of Broadway. The bartenders are awesome and make delicious drinks. The atmosphere is really cool, they have an old photo booth. It gets really busy around 5 on Thursdays and Fridays since it's and easy walk from the fidi
Disappointed in terms of drink strength and options.

If you're looking for a classy place to pre-game before blowing mad racks at the strip club, this establishment is calling your name. 15 Romolo is a bit hidden from hustle and bustle of Broadway in a side-alleyway. It becomes easy to spot when you search for the "Basque Hotel" sign.
