I love the vintage style decor and the wide selection of drinks/cocktails, but it's not a place with a huge draft beer selection (only 4 on tap). We ordered a few shots and they came in puny little half-shot glasses, at full-two-dollar-sign price. So that was a little disappointing. It's also not a great place for groups (I came on a Saturday night). Some tables definitely cleared out within 30 minutes of me getting there, but I wouldn't recommend coming with more than 4 people. I usually try to avoid bar food, and I did successfully that time, but it actually looked quite tasty. Overall 15 Romolo has a laid back charm with stiff drinks and attractive clientele. It's a great pit-stop before a night of havoc in the fine Broadway establishments. Just wait for me Cinnamon.
The food was really good! Top of the line good. We got the chorizo stuffed squid and the halibut

Where do I begin? 15 Romolo is fantastic in ever sense of the word. Great classic cocktails; and I'm not talking about cosmos. They have really hearty drinks. The Pimm's cup is a nice starter drink if you're overwhelmed.

Love this great little hidden place for brunch. Ordered a burger w/o cheese. Before I even looked at it, the waitress came by took one look and took it back. It had cheese on it. THANK YOU! Waitstaff was swift, cheery and diligent. Drinks were perfect. Place was clean and the windows were open. It didn't hurt that the weather was absolutely gorgeous that day. The only downside was the amuse-bouche. A waffle shot with Blackstrap rum, Espresso liqueur and Maple syrup on a crunchy bit of waffle. Oh that vile liquid. It's too much boo. It was fun watching other patrons drink it though. The look of desperation, the realization that the water glass was full, and finally the scrunch faced gulp.
On a Friday night, it was intolerably loud and smelled of spilt beer.  That being said, for such a divey joint, it sure has surprisingly good cocktails.

Went after fireworks on Friday, July 4th, first time there. Great spot. Cozy & local, not understaffed with the holiday weekend, got a drink in just the right amount of time. The uber hipster bartender was fantastic-- no sloppy pouring, used jiggers for everything, looked really fluid behind the bar. Nice, friendly staff too. The Hemingway daiquiri (manliest of the daiquiris) was amazing. Definitely coming back for the food, and the vibe.
Just what we needed after a 5hr flight.  Sure, it was already 2am in the timezone we flew from... but this was a great way to acclimate ourselves to the city and the timechange.

Had such a great happy hour with friends on a Saturday late afternoon. The place was empty and we ordered 3 pitchers of Sangria. My favorite was the white sangria because it tasted lighter and more crisp with a hint of spice. $28/pitcher before happy hour ends at 7:30!
We were going out to dinner with friends at the House (read my reviews) but we weren't able to get a reservation until 9:00pm. So what else would we do but hang out & grab some drinks.

This place is a wonderful little secret nestled between strip clubs and Italian restaurants up a somewhat sketchy looking alley. But seriously, the whole atmosphere is very speakeasy-like, delicious cocktails (I recommend the Famous Fizz- an absinthe egg whore cocktail), and the slightly out-of-sync rock music playing makes this place a really fun destination to go with friends or on a date or to make some new friends! Definitely will be back!
I freaking love this place!  In my personal

This is the best place to eat in SF late night. Where else can you get perfect ribeye at 1AM? Or poutine? (Well, not quite poutine but close enough and amazingly tasty.) The cocktails are incredible too! Be sure to ask for the homemade hot sauce.
This Hunan chain (there are 7 in all) restaurant opened in the North Beach area approximately a year ago.  The restaurant has a nice decor and I liked the floors.
Excellent food, good service, overall a great place!

This place came highly recommended through Time Out and the internet. All I have to say is EAT HERE. It will not disappoint. Not kidding, it was 100% the best Chinese food I have ever had in my life. It was my last meal of my San Francisco trip and I was over the moon about it. I said "wow" at least twenty times throughout the meal. The service was amazing and genuine. Louis was so sweet, gracious and had wonderful suggestions. The food was clean, fresh and the flavors were true parties in my mouth. One thing you must order are the Dumplings. Do not leave without them in your belly. I'm sad that I'm not at Henry's right now. :(

This is a must try especially if you are a local like me! The staff is so nice and friendly! The ambiance is clean and beautiful! The egg rolls and combination noodle dish were excellent!! This is a great gem in SF where truly good chinese food can be hard to find.
One of the best Chinese food...freshness, good spicyness and good service.  We asked for some to be made extra spicy and they still tasted hunan...well done.

Very Good with a great atmosphere. We had the Meat Pie, Beef and Broccoli, Sweet & Sour Pork, And Chicken Chow Mein. The meat pie had an Asian-Mexican fusion flare; it was light, crispy, and delicious. The beef and broccoli was cooked to perfection. The sweet-and-sour pork was excellent, as was the chow mein.

We came in here because of the high YELP rating, and we weren't disappointed.  We tried the dishes everyone talked about and had a nice lunch.  The meat pies (so not traditional Chinese) were light and fluffy and tasty, the Hot and Sour soup was both, and probably the best of that I have ever had.  The Kung Pao beef was average, but overall we had tons of food, great service, and would send my friends there in a heartbeat.

Came here  for lunch today and generally enjoyed the meal. I can understand if some people think the food is too salty, or a bit too spicy, because both can certainly be true for some dishes. The rock cod, spare ribs, and shrimp that I shared with my co-workers were all saucy and stir fried. I am a fan of Americanized Chinese food, so if you like Panda Express, I'm 100% sure you'll find more than a handful of dishes you would really enjoy here. Dishes here are meant to be shared family style and range from $7-$12 each. When I came here at 1pm, the place was not busy at all. If you're looking for some fast Chinese food and are in North Beach area, I would recommend Henry's.

I've been going to Henry's with my family since I was 5 years old, I'm now 26, and it's still my go-to Chinese restaurant in the world! The new North Beach location is just as good if not better than the other Henry's locations.
Great place, thanks Louis! Delicious food, incredible service, and pleasurable ambient environment. Highly recommend.
Really good food. Nothing more to be said, really. Go here if you want good Hunan. Try the meat pies.

This Restaurant is UNBELIEVABLY GOOD!  We had just arrived in San Fran at 7pm-ish.  We waited to eat, because we wanted our friend to recommend a place for a late dinner.  He recommends Henry's but they are about 15 minutes from closing time, by the time we get there.  We reluctantly walked in and were welcomed with smiles and excitement that we arrived.  I hate being "that group", but they acted like there were hours before closing.  I was already impressed.  We sat, ordered a nice bottle of Sauvignon Blanc, and I ordered a beer.  I ordered the Henry's special and my GF ordered the beef and string peas along with a serving of pork fried rice.  The Food was perfect.  It came out promptly and was piping hot.  The rice was some of the best pork fried rice that I have EVER had and the house made Hunan sauce has my mouth watering as I type this!  LITERALLY.  Henry's was the absolutely PERFECT way to start our trip off right.  We left in great moods, full of great food, and laughing and smiling.  I can't wait to visit my friends on the West Coast again and part of that reason is so I can enjoy Henry's Hunan again!!!!!!!!!  Every one should go here!
Right off the bat, the hot and sour soup starter was great. One of the best hot and sour soups I've had. My whole family anticipated a great meal.
Most of their dishes can be made gluten free!  Try their smoked ham dish and the Henry's special!  These are my go to favorites here hands down!

Yelp you failed me again.   Ordered Won Ton Soup it was so bland salt water would of been a better broth.   When our waiter asked how it was I told him it was very bland.   His reply, " Its healthy.".  Healthy my ass it was water with two drops of soy sauce.   I thought we ordered pot stickers.  It was more like slop stickers.  Ordered the Spicy Curryr Chow Mein it was so bland the noodles were overcooked.  Another disappointment,  DAMN    Another disappointing dish was the Orange Chicken.  Seriously, Panda Express was way better.  Water was great and cold with ice.  Service was great the help were friendly and accommodatiing.    I think white people would love this place to death.

This place has good food, I would recommend to my friends. Loved the meat pie, something you really don't see in a Chinese restaurant tho.... kung pao chicken was super spicy, good but too spicy for me.

I only gave it 4 stars simply because I've only been here once.  It was very good.  Meat pies were great.  All the food tasted very fresh and health.  My wife's friend did complain that her food was a little too spicy.  It was pretty tough understanding the waiter through the accent.  I would totally recommend this place.  Good luck with parking.
Delicious food! Loved the sweet and sour chicken, and the Henry's special was also yummy.
My family and I had dinner here on our vacation and we all loved this  place.  Great food , reasonably priced.  We liked it so much we came back two nights later.

The food was very good. Finally I found a Kung Pao that is spicy enough. The service was very lacking. The waitress served our food then promptly disappeared and only reappeared when the water glasses were almost bone dry. Our friend had to go to desk to get the bill. I would of been a little more understanding if they were busy, but they only had 3 tables so no excuses.  I would of rated the food as 5 stars, but I couldn't justify the service.

This is the best Hunan food I've ever had in the US. The homemade spicy sauce is awesome. The meat sandwich, although localized in US, is good. I like the Hunan xiaochaorou and yuxiangrousi very much!

This seriously might be the best Kung Pao beef I've ever had - the half order of Mo Si soup I got was delicious as well! Combined with a Tsing Tao and a great meal was had! Will definitely come again when I'm town next!
Awesome food. Meat pie was unusual offering but superb. Smoked meats are fantastic. Service is suspect and slow but food makes up for it. Some of the best Chinese around.

I love this place. I live half a block down and am so glad it's right here. The food is consistently fabulous - if you like hot Kung Pao, it's amazing here. Ask for it extra spicy, and they really give it to you! A BIG deal here is the fact that I've never had a bad piece of chicken come out of here. You know the kind, the chewy, ambigiously grey, fatty stuff with cartilage still attached? The reason you always hesitate to order chicken at a Chinese restaurant? Yeah, none of that here.

Everytime I think I'm going to make it through some decent Chinese, I end up completely disappointed. I did some research this time, no shooting from the hip rash decision making without thought. I looked upon Yelp to show me some good Chinese. After looking through many reviews, I came upon Henry's Hunan. It's a hole in the wall Chinese place in between the financial district and Chinatown, a stone's throw away.

Really nice and clean restaurant.  The menu is completely in English, so for those of you who need to know what the Mandarin/Cantonese name of the dishes are for ease of ordering, just ask the waiter.  The cold noodles were good but I found the peanut sauce to be a little too overwhelming (i.e. there was too much of it).  We also got a spicy tofu dish that I.  could.  not.  handle.  So spicy.  But in a good way!

Yeah! Another stellar Henry's Hunan. The decor is fresh and clean and the hits are the same...we always go back to the Meat Pie and the Cold Chicken Noodles. Delicious. Steamed dumplings and the rock cod fillets are other faves.
Incredibly mediocre. Bland tasteless and salty. Marty's Special was smoky and uninteresting.
I love this place! I'm not sure why some would rate this place under 5 stars because everything taste great and very satisfying!

Went to HH for Mother's Day. Not only was the food great - tried the Marty's special this time - but the decor and service make it a place to go for a special occasion. I would also recommend the Shredded Pork.
Does not earn high marks for food, ambience, service, nor authenticity.  Only for those looking for mediocre americanized chinese food.  Not coming back...
The service was great but the item I ordered (Henry's shredded pork) was so salty I actually stopped eating it and left before feeling full

Easily the best Chinese Restaurant experience I've had in years.  The place was clean (almost spotless) and aesthetically pleasing (good layout), the staff were very friendly and attentive, and the food was incredible (I got the Garlic Chicken. Highly recommended.

In short, this is the best Chinese restaurant I have ever eaten at in terms of food. Everything tasted fresh, without the heaviness that accompanies many Chinese American establishments. Of particular note are the veggie egg rolls and garlic chicken. The service was friendly and fast with the decor slightly minimal, but clean. I was extremely happy to bring my guests from out of town here and find my new favorite Asian restaurant in town.

First time here. Came for lunch for 5 and ordered Onion Cake and Meat Pie for appetizers. They were different, interesting and tasty. Then we shared Velvet Chicken, Orange Chicken and Smoked Ham Chow Mein with Boiled White Rice. Everything was cooked nicely and spiced delicately. Service was friendly. Would come back any time :)

This place was absolutely delicious! A must try if you are busying San Francisco. If I was luckily enough to live here I would make this my up to chinese restaurant. Staff extremely friendly. Food was hot and fresh! Definitely will make this my first stop when I come back!
I'm not usually a big Chinese fan, but this place is changing my mind. Highest quality Chinese food I've had in the Bay Area!
great to have these guys at a nice new bright location with the food as good as it ever was.
Great food and unexpected.
I have been here for more than 3 times...
So much fun! The servers are all true Italian and are always in high spirits singing and dancing to fun Italian songs.  The food is excellent!  What more could you ask for?  Excellent for birthdays!

Been here a couple times on my visits to SF. Most of the food is delicious. I made the mistake of getting the basic pasta in ragu last time (I'm a sucker for anything lamb), and it was very bland and the meat was dry. Really hope I recheck this review again before i go back because I definitely don't want that again. The other entrees my party ordered were definitely worth going back for.
Amazing!! Dropped in on Saturday night with friends. We did make a reservation.
D E licious!  Custom made gnocchi with the lamb ragu was great.  Tiramisu was one of the best I've had.
My friend introduced me to this Italian restaurant and I love it!

Went there on a Saturday night and they were extremely busy.  Seems the focus of quantity and getting as many customers in and out as possible.  My pasta dish was OK, but could have used a little more flavor. Servers were friendly but, had to wait a long time for my food and drink orders
Ordered the Pesto fettuccine. Absolutely amazing - reminded me of pasta in Rome. Service is wonderful - all the waiters are very nice and always at your service.
Last night we came here for the first time...

It's cold, I'm hungry and good pasta sounds right. We're in Little Italy and the expectation was there. However, when eating time came, my papardelle pasta tasted like spaetzle (thick, hard and too doughy), the ground lamb was cooked on really high heat so the meat was dry and the sauce was okay. It's not okay to serve bad pasta. I had no faith to continue on with dessert.

Excellent service. We were made to feel very at home within seconds and hope to return and bring our older children next time. Clearly many are returning customers who know the staff and owner well. Everything was excellent!

1st night in San Fran and someone suggest North Beach.  Looking for a great steakhouse NOT knowing we were in Little Italy.  Hey, we are both Italian, so not a bad find in my mind.  Problem was the streets were saturated with restaurants boasting tempting ambience and menus......we kept walking and walking and walked into the gentlemans club area of town and thought...great. what now?  Feet hurting and bellies growling we looked across the street and said...let's just eat here.  WHAT A FIND!!!!  We were so delightfully surprised at how good the food was and how happy and attentive the staff was.  I had the pasta with asparagus and salmon with cream sauce and my husband had the rigatoni with sausage , mushroom and brown sauce.  When in San Fran again, this a definite go to!!!

I absolutely love, love, love this place!!  We ate there two nights in a row in September, ten months after our first visit. I'm not kidding - the wait staff remembered us, where we're from, who was with us, etc. Such wonderful customer interface. Oh, and the food is amazing!! We had seared diver scallops, shrimp risotto and a wonderful Brunello di Montalcino.. The desserts were equally yummy. I inquired if they ever offer Torta della Nonna and the owner offered to have it for us next time, if we give him two days notice.  Can't wait to go back. Molte Grazie!!

I read through the other reviews and agree with all the 5 star reviews. This place delivers on both exceptional service and great quality of food. If you look at my other Yelp reviews I don't give out 5 star reviews that often so this place really impressed me!
I was in San Francisco for less than 48 hours and REALLY needed some Italian food in my belly. North Beach is obviously where it was, but how to decide on which restaurant?

I came here with a large group to celebrate my cousin's birthday on a Saturday night. Street parking is a nightmare, but I was lucky enough to find a spot nearby. We had reservations for 7:30pm but were not seated until our entire party arrived. We ordered a variety of dishes, but some of my favorites included the octopus carpaccio (carpaccio di polpo), spaghetti neri (squid ink pasta), paccheri golosi, and the mezzi rigatoni alla norcina. I've never tried octopus carpaccio before, but I am glad that this was my first encounter with the dish. The pasta dishes were executed perfectly- pasta was cooked al dente, portioned well, and full of flavor! Our group also ordered the fritto misto, which wasn't bad, but I felt the portion was a bit small, and the shrimp was overcooked as well. My sister ordered the seafood risotto, and although the risotto itself was cooked well, the mussels definitely overpowered the dish :(  Anyway, on to dessert! GET THE PANNA COTTA! Trust me, it was amazing. The following day I kept telling my boyfriend about how much I enjoyed the panna cotta, and I'm sure he wanted to slap me because I would not shut up about how good it was! Haha. I have to say that it was probably the best thing I ate that night, seriously, just do yourself a favor and order it! The staff was just exceptional! Very friendly, attentive, hard-working, and very happy! I love that they yell across the restaurant and speak Italian to each other, definitely adds to the overall atmosphere of the restaurant. I probably wouldn't recommend trying to have a heart-to-heart conversation here, as it is very loud, but this place is definitely a great place to celebrate any occasion Italiano styleee! Will definitely be back for more!! Grazie, È Tutto Qua!

This is seriously one of my favorite restaurants.   It always cures my nostalgia for Italy.   Great food, but the people are even better.   True Italians.   Yelling throughout the restaurant in Italian and always very happy.   You can't but be happy around them.

Sorry, dont understand the rave reviews...  Okay, the waiters are cute.  The restaurant was a bit too loud for me.  I had the pasta with seafood and while tasty, the calamari was overcooked and chewy (shrimp was good.)  The ravioli definately did not taste like home made and was just so-so.  The bread i can only describe as too flour-y.

This place was good. Came to eat here a night before a half marathon so we had to make reservation for a group of 10. Once we  were seated and we ordered, the food took like 45 minutes to come out, which I guess since it was extremely busy, it was understandable. Overall the food was great, I had the Fettuccini con Pesto and it was great!!!
This place offers some of the best italian food in Sam Francisco. I love their thin crust pizza. Can't wait to go back!
Super friendly staff. Great with our kids. They even remembered us from our last visit about 6 months ago. Food is delicious. Never had a meal we didn't enjoy.

Food is fresh, but the environment is too loud and the floors were filthy. The waiters enjoyed singing and playing, but barely wiped the table. They crank the music like it's a disco so they yell across the room to be able to hear each other. A lot of clapping, but not very attentive. The ingredients are fresh, but overall the pasta was quite bland as was their salad.

We just dined here last night.for our niece's birthday.  Since she had a soccer tournament in Petaluma and it would have too late to meet for dinner once they got all the way home to Redwood City, we decided to meet in SF for dinner. We had reservations and weren't seated right away, but not soon after getting a cocktail, so it was really no problem.  We had excellent service- these guys work hard and they are constantly on the move.  We were seated upstairs and I can only imagine that these guys get so tired going up and down the stairs.
Wonderful desserts. Great environment. Love the energy and good food here. Good place to visit.

I think there's no shortage of great Italian eateries but this one showed up in a few other travel site's recommends.. we didn't have much of a wait for not having a reservation that is. We were seated outside (ANY other day I'd have been fine with it because it was nice and warm.) But for some reason, when you see most of the eateries that are table lined on the street at night they are close off to the street and seem cozy.  Here, they are back a bit from the curb (which is always a plus) but there's no barrier to make you feel cozy. So once we sat down I looked around I decided I wanted to sit inside..the host was most gracious to get a table inside fairly quickly so that was really nice.. all in all for a busy Sat night without a reservation, we waited about 40 min or less.
You can't go wrong with anything on the menu here this place is simply amazingn along with the great staff and full bar
Where to even begin with this one!
Love the food and love the ambiance. The place is good for dates and family style dining. The waiters are amazing..energetic and resourceful

One of the best Italian restaurants I have been too! All the servers have great energy, very good looking and heavy Italian accents! Can't complain about one thing. The pasta dishes are to die for! We went there the both nights we stayed in the city, so delicious. We will definitely be returning customers.
The atmosphere is extremely loud ( we went not knowing that Italy was playing soccer that evening for the World Cup). However, the food was delicious! I would go back.

Authentic Italian food in North Beach. Being Italian myself, I can't help loving this restaurant. Their pizza is delicious and not too heavy, the menu offers a lot of choices and I especially like their Paccheri golosi.

Awesome dinner!  Everything was delicious. Bread was excellent. The desserts were great. Try the pannecotta!  The only thing lacking was the lamb was slightly under sasoned and the wait staff was trying to rush us out. We got a kick out of the wait staff speaking Italian.
Came here cuz of the yelpers...
This place is fantastic!  It's really great Italian food and the bustling ambiance is really fun.

Aunthentic Italian food located in the heart of Little Italy in San Francisco. Very busy place on a weekend. Service was helpful and kind. The food was not all that great. We came here because we were looking for a place to eat. As always, we yelped nearby places and came here because of the reviews. Totally dissapointed, my friend and I got sick from the pizza for the next three days :(
Went on a very busy at night. Food was good. Great service. The waitor spoke with an Italian accent and was knowledgeable on the food.

Stumbled upon this place as I was trying to look for a place for a late dinner. We decided to go here since it was one of the few restaurants that was still quite packed at 10pm. And glad we ended up here. Service was great, food was delicious! What more can you ask for?
Great hospitality and service. Must get the Bruschetta one of the best I've tasted.
My company had a reserved four-course meal here, and lemme tell you, every single damn course was DELICIOUS.
Food was great, service excellent. The place can get a little loud but that is because everyone is having so much fun. We ordered scallops and pasta. Overall great experience.
So great. So loud. So yummy. Homemade pasta that morning. Homemade bread. Waiters yelling in Italian to each other. I loved every second of it! :)
Great food. Glad we accidentally came across while in San Francisco. Great cheese fries and burgers.

Yesterday, the day after the Giants won the World Series, I ate here for a quick lunch. Since this eatery is at North Beach I decided to order the North Beach Cheese Steak. The meat I ordered was beef and the cheese I selected was provolone. I also ordered a side of fries, which were ok - nothing spectacular. The North Beach Cheese Steak was served to me piping hot. The aroma was addicting. I loved the crunchy, toasty bun - the ideal way of serving a hot sandwich. However I was slightly disappointed with the sandwich overall. I felt the grilled beef, along with the bell peppers and onions, was too soupy for me. There's a difference between a tender beef and a soupy beef. The juices from the grilled beef soaked the crunchy, toasty that resulted the bottom of the bun to be soggy. I've had better cheese steak sandwiches.
The food was great the service is better I had a wonderful time this was the best Phili cheesesteak ever had!!!!!..... Garlic fries r the bomb!!!!
Good burgers. Greasy, but not too greasy. Decent prices.

My boyfriend and his friends would rant about how good this place is, so they finally brought me and I can see why! You don't judge a book by its cover, the place is very small, you have to get lucky with parking especially on the weekends. The staff was super welcoming and friendly. My boyfriend & I were going to share fries, but the cashier gave us a free order of fries because we were "a couple in love" the food was great, and affordable! Fills you up for sure, looking forward to eating here again!
Please select below on how to comment:
Chili cheese fries.  Period.

Not sure if it was the free flowing booze at Mr. Bing's or the fact that I was starving and it was way after midnight but this was one of the greatest cheesesteaks I've ever had. Great people watching also if you sit at the bar.

Story: Staying at my friend's place in Chinatown I was craving some fries. Everything else closed down but this place and I believe Sam's. I heard Sam's fries weren't too great so I decided to check this place out. They are known for their cheesesteak, I refused an pursued on my mission to get my fries. The chili cheese garlic seemed appealing so I ordered it. I was kind of disappointed because I was expecting a crunch but I should have known better that it would be soggy.

This is the only cheese steak shop that my husband likes. :) He refuses to get any other cheese steak shop's food. If we go to SF, this is the spot we gotta stop at to eat. BEST cheese steak I've ever had. A few things to note: parking is ridiculously hard to find near it. Unless you're lucky, you might have to park farther away and walk to it. Secondly, I believe its CASH ONLY. There's an ATM there is the shop I think but they definitely do NOT take card.

My boyfriend and I went to dinner here and got the garlic cheesy fries and a small and a large Philly cheesesteak. The garlic cheese fries were amazing!! The cheesesteaks were really good too. Soft bread and good flavor, but there could have been a bit more meat for our taste. Good and quick service and well priced.
The only place that was open late by the hostel I was staying at.  Good cheesesteaks.

My favorite cheese steak place in north Beach. Very good price and delicious food. My #1 choice is cheese steak with mushrooms. The place is open until late (because all these girls from strip clubs eat there) so it's very convenient(not the girls but the time). I eat there at least once a week.

The best cheesesteak I will ever eat. Unless I make it out to Tony Luke's in Philly, then we'll have to see. I'm not sure if it's the juicy meat or the wonderfully diabetes filled cheese sauce, but their sandwiches never cease to make me a satisfied customer.

I have to give an update to this.  It has been a good run of 3 years since I found Buster's.  But it looks like they are under new management.  The chefs are the same I believe, but the ship is ran a bit differently.
Wow came back and the girl with hardly any eyebrows tried pocketing $15 of mine. Nice one.

First time ever Cheesesteak. It was served fast, hot and delicious! Had mushroom, onions and provolone, I am hooked. My husband had chili on his and he loved it. I "shared" his garlic fries, so good. Small space with a great cook, charming hostess and fun people watching location.

I was in Buster's the other day and ordered a philly cheese w/ bellpeppers and mushrooms. The COOK (wearing gloves) grilled my chicken. A guy came in and ordered a burger. The COOK flattened his raw burger and put it on the grill. Then he picked up my bellpepers and placed them on the grill. UGH! HEY COOK, YOU DON'T TOUCH RAW MEAT AND THEN HANDLE RAW VEGTABLES!!! I hope you change your gloves when you go to the potty.

This is a spot that you can never go wrong with. And talk about consistent? Everytime that I have stepped foot in there I walked out with a better experience than the last. So I pretty much tried everything in there that they had on the menu from their cheesesteaks to their cheeseburgers back to their chicken cheesesteaks. AND (because you know I gotta throw this in), they got some really good garlic fries. This is the best cheesesteak joint in SF hands down. Their cheesesteaks are well seasoned, and they are NEVER skimpy on the meat; which is where the Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero messed up at because I have mostly been served bread out there, and that's for the birds! Anyone wanting a cheesesteaks should go here. Cool folks working there as well...

The absolute best cheesesteak I have ever had in my life! I've tried their hot dogs too but definitely loved the cheesesteak. They cook everything fresh And the bread they use is delicious. I always get the Phillapeno cheesesteak which is just a regular Philly but with jalepeno that gives it an extra kick. DELICIOUS.
The best Philly cheese steak that I ever had in my life.

The best cheesesteak I've had to date. I went with the California cheesesteak with chicken and mixed it up with half cheddar and half provolone, wasn't sure if I made the right choice with the chicken but about five minutes later I was very satisfied. My boyfriend had your traditional philly, I had a bite, it was alright but mine was better. We split a side of garlic fries, they were also very tasty, this places doesn't skimp on the garlic so be prepared for some greasy garlicy goodness! I'm not sure how the philly cheesesteaks was made so popular in California (we noticed quite a few philly steak places in the area) but I must say that this place had a better cheesesteak than what I sampled in Philadelphia; if you're in the neighborhood stop by and give it a try.
Best Philly cheese steak I have had in all of California!  Being from Philly I should know a good cheesesteak! It's the real deal! Fries were good too!
Great customer service. Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches.
Went there for a quick hotdog. It was prepared on the grill and it was tasty. Small size though.
Decent cheesesteak that fills my aching need for one ever since I left Philly.  Not as good as Jim's, but then again nobody is.
Best Phily Cheese stakes in the city! I love taking all my friends here! :) Its always really fresh and they have the best garlic fries!

Great for a quick bite which is exactly what I was looking for on this particular Sunday.  Decided to split the Cheesesteak large with provolone with a friend.  The cashier was all smiles and super friendly as she took our order and when the food arrived, it was split into two trays for us.  The food itself was delicious, you get to watch the chef from the bar stools as he whips up the delicious sandwich you ordered up.  If you are craving cheesesteaks, Buster's does a good job at satisfying that crave.
Best french fries in town!

first time in San Fran and was looking for something opened late, came across Buster's yelp and it looked good so we went and the woman who took our order was EXTREMELY rude and gave us attitude once we arrived to pick up our order because she failed to mention they were a cash only establishment! Needless to say I will not be returning to Buster's for mediocre sandwiches due to their poor customer service and lack of consideration. Skip out on being treated poorly and go to any of the other fifty hole in the walls spots on that same street.

I have been coming to Busters as long as I have been hanging out in  North Beach. That's nearly a decade. It is one of my favorite late night dinner spots. I will argue that this spot offers up one of the best cheese steaks in the city, speaking as a person that works in the food industry where cheese steaks are on the menu. The ingredients are always fresh, made to order, and is fast, while maintaining quality. The offer a variety of cheeses for your cheese steak or burgers including cheese whiz. I have introduced this to my friends from out of state and epicurean hubs such as Chicago who described the food as "fire" (good).

Grew up in North Beach and have been coming here for years.  The cheesesteaks are really good, but man I just discovered their burgers....Hella good!  1/2 lb. burgers there are no joke.  Good sized tasty burger fixed up just right with all the toppings and the bread has a really nice crust.  Perfect late night spot to grab some grub and that final beer of the night.
Jose gets down on the grill, always fast and cooked to perfection. customer service gets 10 out of 10..!!.. a must when on Broadway.

I been coming to busters for over 15 years and this is by far the best Philly cheese-teak place I have ever been too. Made just right with all the toppings of your choice. The only down fall is parking but who gives a f@@k this place is worth driving around the block a few times.
Wow! Amazeballs cheese steaks and the best fries I've *ever* had! This place was so delish!
2 consecutive orders 17 minutes apart with other orders done first. rude service serious attitude and their "system was down" so I couldn't get loyalty points.
I'm probably going to get crucified for this but I would be doing a disservice to this place if I don't say it.
Tried to go at 2:30 am on Thursday when it said it was open. It wasn't. Fix your hours.

Two words describe Buster's.....Deliciously Dirty. After an alcohol infused night we crashed this place at 2 am and I have never felt so satisfied. The mushroom cheesteak with bacon was amazing and the bacon burger was terrific as well. The lady at the register was really friendly and she also recommended cheesey garlic fries so why not! We left this spot unholy amounts of full, and I can't think of a better late night grubbery for cheesesteaks in the city. Wonderful experience.
Out of all my years in SF and I only discovered this place last summer.  That's an atrocity, but then again I rarely party in North Beach.  Since my discovery, I've been here at least twice a month.

Like dive bars. Like to find places where there're no tourists even though I'm  one. This fit perfectly. Great western burger, great atmosphere, great bartender who warned me that jalapeño poppers and a burger may be too much food. (He was right). Upgraded to garlic fires - well worth it. The bartender was the best. Will definitely relax a night here when I'm back in town.

Loved this place. Small bar with a great craft beer selection.  Spoke to Kevin (I think he was the owner), who was tending bar.  Very cool dude that is one reason I'd go back to SF for another vacation. Place has great atmosphere.  Mostly locals were there.  I could have stayed for hours.....it's that kind of place.

Ate here today with my co-worker, and was pleasantly surprised.  Sat down at the bar because I enjoy bar seating during lunch, and ordered up a couple of burgers. We actually both got the Super, and ordered it "medium". I've got to say, i was AMAZED with the the fact my burger came out medium! not medium well, not well, not burnt...MEDIUM! enjoyed it thuroughly, the bartender was quick on the soda refills wihtout even asking.  My only gripe would be that the garlic fries aren't worth the extra $1.50.  They weren't bad, but it was more of a garlic oil than minced garlic and I prefer the minced.
Love this place!  You have to check it out yourself.  Burgers are delicious.  Bartenders are friendly.

Love Grumpys! It's my go to place after work. The bartenders are great, they make you feel right at home. Foods great, you can hang out in the street & drink beer while chatting with the locals. I highly recommend it!
I've crashed some private parties here and had the time of my life goodtimes.   Totally time of my life and memorable.

Grumpy's is an awesome lil bar with good drinks and delicious food. I'll often come here on my lunch break or right after work, and while they aren't open on weekends (sadness) they make me happy. Prices are fair, considering how great the food is. I usually get a cheeseburger because it's damn good.

Staying around North Beach and Chinatown we've exhausted the normal touristy foodie places to eat. I was looking for something different and a local spot. So I found Grumpy's on Yelp. His place is in no man's land. Nothing around but business complexes. This is a local hangout and a true blue dive bar.

Attended a private party with about 50 people. Booze was great. But the food? Hamburgers were OK, but Grumpy's put out about 10 at a time for 50 people? Then nothing. Then some fried chicken. Each platter lasted about 5 minutes or LESS. Then nothing was put out. Steamed vegetables? Some deal. Everything put out separately, then 15 minutes until the next thing. Fried chicken was OK if you don't mind ice cold in the center. This was precooked, then thrown into hot oil. Hot on the outside, but cold on the inside. One poor bartender had to work the whole room of 50 people, including serviing booze, putting out the little food they had, and clean up tables. One guy cooking in back. 2 of staff for the whole party of 50 people That's it. No bus boys, no waiters, no service. I'll bet they save a ton of money on labor and food supplies.

GRUMPY'S!!! This place is great! Best dive bar around for sure. They have good happy hours and considering it's a darker, noisy dive bar, it's clean, the staff is friendly and they have a huge selection of food - and it's really good at that! It's one of our favorite lunchtime spots and we'll definitely be back.
Great food for a pub.  Loved the beer selection.  Service was good.  I got the Philly.  Only odd point was that the seem not to give many fries, but the portion was great anyway.

Was in San Francisco with my sister for lunch. She couldn't find restaurant she had searched and we were using yelp for fish and chips close by.  Best fish and chips and macaroni and cheese I've tasted in awhile.  Best ginger ale too.  It was unusually hot in the city and it was nice to be in the cool pub.  Our server , Monica was so good as I like to try new places and ask lots of questions while I place my order.  I had leftovers for my long train ride home    Bonus is their bulldog mascot that looks like my Bentley 's Grandpa
Favorite burgers in town, if it's your first time, try the Baja or better : the super
Total ad bar as proven by the many namesakes on the walls but every good ad bar has an equally good hangover menu because ad people, well they drink.

Was disappointed to learn that the prices and specials advertised on their website are very outdated (writing this review a month later so they had time to update it - hasn't happened yet). No more $4 drafts/margaritas at happy hour... how about $8 for a can of PBR and a shot? To be fair, those prices seemed a little too good to be true for this area.

Went here for a quick bite before going to the exploratorium for the day. I had a Baja burger with garlic fries. The burger was decent and their regular fries were nice and crispy. But the garlic fries are not worth it... it's just regular fries with a teaspoon of garlic paste on top. The paste made the fries a bit soggy... and it wasn't even tossed with the fries, just placed on top of them...

A classic western pub of brick and glass. This is a square room smelling of beer - nothing wrong with that. There are beers for every taste, including old-school PBR and Olympia in bottles. I would have been really fired up to see Oly in a can, as it was  the first beer I ever had.
Awesome hole in the wall pub!

Fries, burger, onion rings, beer, and nice service. This is a hidden gem in that area if you are meeting friends after work, waiting to meet up to go to the exploratorium, or just are in the area.  They do a good job with the bar food and having reasonable priced drinks. I don't know what expectations people have going to this place, but I assumed it would be a fake dive bar that would be overpriced due to the area and I was pleasantly surprised by how relaxed the atmosphere was.

Good service, nice ambience, and great drinks! It wasn't that crowded on a Monday night, which I don't mind at all. It's a nice place to chill with the game on and alternative music playing. I was there for the happy hour which had only drinks, no food despite the website.

I've walked past this pub a number of times on my way to the new Exploratorium. I happened to be hungry this past week and decided to stop by to grab a burger. The other reviews do not lie. The burger with a fried egg and bacon was one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had. I asked for medium rare, and it came out exactly as ordered. The beef patty was seasoned perfectly as well, you can still taste the meat. I have plans to come back to try their other Signature burgers at $12 a burger.
Media, Agency, Digital worlds collide with drinks and food. They close early on weekdays but have beer + shot specials.

Walked by a bunch of times so had to give it a try. Packed at lunch time, close enough from the fin district to make the walk. Burger was good, not amazing... Same with the fried chicken. Beers on tap rock, loved the boddingtons-like red hen. What makes the place special is the cool bar atmosphere, loaded with people, fun hang out, good for afternoon sports.

Just awful. We grabbed it to go through our office and I had to throw away my "Greek" salad. I say "Greek" because the salad was sloppy and didn't have the standard dressing for this style of salad. Also, we had called the order ahead of time and asked them to label all of the orders, which they did not.

Came here with my co-workers for work and it was packed at 1pm on a Friday afternoon. We thought we would beat the crowd but every table was filled. Almost everyone ordered the Super burger in my party and it looked amazing with the egg on top! I actually ordered the chicken curry salad sandwich because I was trying to be good with eating healthy but failed since I ordered onion rings. The sandwich was amazing but I'm giving this place only three stars because the service isn't awesome and it will always be crowded. I'll come here during their non busy hours for sure though.

I came here last week for a quick bite to eat and loved it! The food is delicious and the bartender we had was very polite. Would definitely come here again! Also love the small cuteness of the place!
I'm a little upset knowing this business was partly responsible for keeping Off the Grid away from the area (Vallejo and Front). But I can understand why they'd do it.

Awesome food. Dive bar atmosphere. Great bartender/ wait staff. Bartender accidentally dropped a burger and gave it to us on the house. The replacement came out quick. He was extremely apologetic. I ordered a Baja Burger complete with avocado, bacon, "jack," and fresh salsa. It was delicious! One of the better burgers I've ever had. Very fresh ingredients. The people I came with got other burgers and loved them too! The onion rings and potato salad were excellent as well! I highly recommend it.

Really cool dive that can get a little crowded. There are lots of tables, but you have to suck your gut in and squeeze through the crowd to get to one. The restrooms are clean...surprising for a dive bar.
Really decent bar food in a dive-y, but not too dive-y, bar filled with locals.  Kevin the bartender is super adorable!

Came in with my boyfriend for lunch and we weren't sure what to expect. We aren't from here and had been walking at the Exploratorium all day so we were starving. Rather than eating at the exploratorium we searched for a place nearby and found Grumpy's.
BREAKFAST !!
Went here to watch the final game between the Heat & Spurs with a co-worker. The crowd seemed pretty chill and liked the atmosphere but it was hard to get around with so many people.
It's Friday and I AM GRUMPY.

Bad Service. Came in with over a dozen people after a professional mixer & all bought food/drinks. We sat outside & noticed a few glass/plates left over from the previous group. Went inside to ask the bartender if he could have someone come out & buss the table, his response: "This is just a bar, move a few glasses over yourself." I was little dumbfounded by that response, most bars have employees who buss tables not customers who clean up after other customers. What's unfortunate is that he spoiled my experience there, the bartender who previously made me a drink was very friendly. I won't be returning or recommending this bar.

This is the best pub ever... I love the bartender guy that works there, he's super cool and super nice.  Most bar tenders are usually rude when it's busy, not here!  I love their fries with bacon, egg and cheese on top!

If you are in the financial, and need a spot for a pint that isn't crawling with DB's... go here. It is worth the walk, and the place is filled with a ton of people who work for the local news channels. They are friendly, and kind of like pirates in some weird way. It's off the beaten path, and has a sense of atmosphere. I recommend the Baja burger daily drink special. Only downside is they are not open on weekends, and you kind feel like you are far away when you get drunk enough to rally.

After my last visit, I don't think I'll be going back. I went in to order some food to go. I knew what I wanted, but it was extremely difficult to get the bartender's attention. When he finally asked and I said I wanted to order food, he stopped me and said, "then hold on" and proceeded to serve customers behind me. Didn't offer me a menu or an excuse. Even the customers behind me said, "but the young lady was in front!" The bartender said, "that's fine" and proceeded to take their orders first. I ordered fish & chips and got a non-itemized bill for $11.91 (menu price is $7.95). Even with taxes, that seems excessive, but at that point, I just wanted to be out of there, so I didn't argue, just paid and left.

Good food, cheap prices, and beers on tap. Dingy little hole in the wall bar, but a good spot to grab breakfast/lunch/dinner when in the financial district. Friendly service brings me back every time.
Best dive burgers! Just get a regular cheeseburger and a pint of beer. You will not regret it!

Came to Sodini's on Nov 8 with a few friends. Had the bruschetta - so good, I imagine it's even better when tomatoes are in season - and the penne baked with mozzarella and tomato sauce, which was very tasty.
Had another great meal at this North Beach standard.  Try the rack of lamb!  individually vacuum sealed by the butcher, it's always fresh.  And the number 4 pizza!  Yum?
Walk through the door and enjoy the experience.
The food is ok the owner mark will be a little touchy feely towards your wife definitely something to look out for
I'm going to keep this simple: I'm from New Jersey and I'm Italian... and this was one of THE BEST LASAGNA dishes I have ever had.  Please don't tell Granny.

If you are craving good, delicious, and basic comfort Italian food this is the place for you! The Beef Lasagne is awesome, their Grilled Chicken Breast is my favorite, and their specials are usually very good. The bar makes serious drinks and the service is very good. All the ladies who work there are friendly and very helpful. Eat early, because you'll have plenty of calories to burn before going to bed! :-)

Great food and great staff! Started with steamer clams and calamari...the steamer broth was awesome and so was the bread that came with it. We went while the Giants game was on so there was quite a lively crowd watching the game. Fun times! One of us got a pizza, another linguine with meatballs, another seafood linguine - all excellent dishes! Ask for thin crust extra crispy for your pizza...very good! Regular crust probably great as well but we didn't try. Authentic cooking and great people!
Whatever beeeeauch!
Real neighborhood feel and great food! I recommend the gnocchi pesto. It was delicious! In addition, they also fill your glass of wine to the top which is a plus in a city!
A local favorite of mine!

We went to Sodini's on the recommendation of a couple who go there when they are in town and it was exactly what we were looking for. This is a old school Italian restaurant. If you want a little pile of gormet  food on your plate, don't go here. But if you want an old fashion hearty Italian dinner this is the place!!! The house salad is a meal in it self. My wife followed it with the Chicken Marsala from the daily special. It was delicious! I had the Linguini with whole and baby clams in a white cream sauce off the recommendation waitress. I absolutely loved it! I only wish our stay in San Francisco was longer so I could go back again. Bravo Mark, you and your staff helped make our trip to this beautiful city just that much better! Now move to Chicago!!!

No Joke...I am walking down Columbus with my family in tow and the Yelp app up on my phone. As I am looking for Tomasso's (sp?) a lady asks me if I need help. I proceed to tell her I was using Yelp and looking for a place and she looked disgusted. I had a quick conversation with her about the sheer awesomeness of crowd sourcing but still, she wasn't having it. Long story short she pointed us to Sodini's and we couldn't have been more pleased. Service was awesome and the place was super kid friendly. Great food and a decent price as well. This will absolutely be part of my regular SF rotation. Oh, and Yelp later confirmed that crowd sourcing works as the avg review was well above the 4.0 mark.
Love this place!  We are from the NY/NJ area-so we are very particular about good Italian food.  This place was great.
It's standard Italian food. Not that great at all compared to all the other options. It's overpriced too - $15 for calamari?! $15-20 for basic pasta dishes?

Start with the dinner salad.....excellent, I don't usually like salads but I crave this one. The raviolis with tomato meat sauce were very good.  But I think the absolute best is the  tortellini carbonara.  Super service and a great atmosphere.  We'll go back every time were in the city!!

This place is my absolute favorite Italian restaurant when I am in San Francisco.  Its a very small place in the North Beach area of San Francisco. I have been coming here for 5-6 years now and every time I go I order the Gnocchis with their creamy carbonara sauce. The Gnocchis are unlike any I have ever had.  They are filled with a green pesto sauce.  I call them Tiny Pillows of heaven!  They are super fluffy, moist and delicious!  I literally order them any chance I get.  They also make amazing Pastas, Pizzas and Steaks.  You cannot go wrong with anything you order on their menu.  They don't serve dessert which is posted right outside their facility...so don't complain as there are tons of dessert places you can catch within the same area.  Also parking can be a bitch if you want to park for free...otherwise there is a parking lot right in front of the restaurant which you must pay to park in.

I used to love this place, it was my favorite restaurant in North Beach.  I haven't been in a couple of years though, and went back for the first time tonight.  I suspect they are under new ownership, because things were just not nearly as good as they once were.  The food was very meh.

Such a fun and great place for a local's dinner in North Beach. The service was of the highest quality, everyone was amazingly courteous and attentive. The drinks came quickly and the food was paced perfectly. Can't wait to go back. Thanks so much!
Lasagna was delicious, service outstanding, Linda our waitress has a great personality, made us feel right at home, like we were part of the family, two thumbs up!!

Came here because other Italian restaurants in the area were full. The greeter was friendly. However this place is super crowded. I move my shoulders out and accidentally hit a waitress. I got pasta with meatball and it was nothing special. Meatball was bland. Tomato sauce was bland. I don't think it's worth the cost. My boyfriend got lasagna. It tasted better than mine. It was cheesy but it something that I could make. Portions were good size though.

We love Sodini's food! The wait staff were great and we love the bar! The pasta and sauces are homemade and they are delicious and the portions are large for the price, and the we love the atmosphere and it is soooooop Italian! We love the bread, the chicken dishes, the other meat dishes and the sea food, the clams!  We love the wine and coffee. Who cares about  no desert, so they don't serve it. We can always go around the corner to get desert if we absolutely have to have it, usually full anyway. Will be back.
Very dry and very abrupt waitress .

This is definitely my new favorite place to have Italian in San Francisco.  The food here is excellent and very rich in flavor.  I ordered the Chicken alla Sodini, which came with a hearty and tender piece of chicken covered in cream sauce and mozzarella with linguini on the side, which was delicious!  Additionally, it came with either a bowl of minestrone or house salad as an app.  They have an extensive wine list and some Italian beer on tap including my favorite, Moretti.  The service here was great, but come early if you want to avoid waiting for a table.  I came in around 630 on a Monday evening and it was pretty much empty, but when I left about an hour later, it was almost full, so word of the wise....come early!

This is my favorite place to eat Italian when visiting San Francisco.  This is a family owned establishment and the owner Mark greets patrons as they enter. He also explained the family pictures on the wall including his parents' wedding picture and a picture of his grandfather.

Went to this place last night and was quite disappointed. We got 2 pizzas and some pasta. The wait was quite long but the pasta were very good and I learned later that this is what the place is known for. On the other hand, the pizza were simply bad. None of us could eat the crust because it didn't taste good, and there were a ton of topping which made it very overwhelming. Should probably stick to selling pasta only...

We met friends here for dinner last night.  After a short wait at the bar, we got a table for six and worked our way through the small but packed restaurant.  We ordered bruschetta, which was excellent.  The bread was toasted and the tomatoes were delicious (and I don't even like raw tomatoes!).  A huge platter of calamari arrived and we ate every single crisp bite.  Nicely done.  We split a house salad and their dressing was to die for.  I ordered cheese cannelloni with a tomato sauce.  It was very flavorful and the cheese filling was light and creamy.  My husband got the gnocchi with Gorgonzola. The gnocchi were fluffy little pillows of goodness and the sauce was perfectly done with the right amount of cheese.  Our friends ordered seafood linguine and gnocchi with meat sauce and everyone was very happy with their meal.  Service was excellent, friendly and they were on top of clearing away dishes and refilling water.  We will definitely go again.

Upon seeing the good reviews on Yelp I decided to give this place a try. To my dismay I found myself to be not such a happy camper. Although the service was prompt and courteous I found the food to be insipid. I ordered the minestrone soup and the tortellini al pesto. The minestrone soup looked like a thick porridge that not even the three little bears would enjoy let alone touch. It was very thick, tasteless and a bit cold. The main entree I found to be boring and it lacked spices and a little TLC. The best part of my meal was the sprite. I think I was better off going to The Olive Garden.

This family-owned Italian restaurant is so damn good. Went there on a Saturday around 5 and sat outside. Our waitress Rachel was super friendly and gave us great service. It was quiet and relaxing. We got the calamari, which is easily the best calamari I have ever had. We also got the gnocchi and the lasagne, which were both absolutely perfect. I highly recommend this place. We will be going back many times. Five stars.
Simply THE BEST.

Stopped in after a Coit Tower Sunset with my daughter and my nice (both 19). We loved the city feel (we're from NYC originally) and the atmosphere was festive in an old world sort of way... The food was reliably good.

My very first authentic Italian restaurant. I even had lasagne perfectly prepared. You have got to try the polenta with mozzarella and meat sauce app....awesomeness. Staff was fun and inviting!  Easily 5 on my list.

This post is waaay over due. I moved to sf a littlw ober a year ago and thats when my boyfriend and i discovered sodinis. We saw the yelo revoews and wanted to try it out and every time we want to treat ourselves to something nice sodinis it is! Ive had a few different dishes here and no complaints AT ALL! Hands down the best italian spot in north beach if not sf itself. Reccomend the tortellini cabornera (spell check,lol sorry), amazing!!

The Best!!! Hands down!!! My fav when I'm the area. Ordered the seafood linguine and it was HUGE...filled with lots of seafood too! Clams, mussels, shrimp, calamari galore! Definitely recommend and will definitely always be back!
Best homemade Italian food in North Beach hands down. Authentic & fresh! Pizza & seafood linguine delish... Our go to place when we're in the area!

Absolutely delicious Italian food! Well prepared, good portions and wait time for the food was not bad at all. Decent wine selection and a full bar. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. We arrived about 5:30 on a Saturday and got seated right away, but it did start to fill up pretty quick after about 6. The place is loud, crowded and casual. It's like dining with some good Italian friends or family! If you're looking for a quiet, romantic place to have dinner, this ain't it! But, if you're looking for a nice, casual, unpretentious place with a lively atmosphere to enjoy some yummy Italian food, then this is the place! I just found my favorite Italian restaurant!

I've ordered take-out from here.  The woman on the phone, think she's the legendary hostess or bartender, is so nice!  I ordered the lasagna, which has beef in it, for two.  She said she'd make sure there was enough bread, butter, and place settings.  The lasagna is so hearty and like someone in your family made it.  It's a big portion, too!  Can't wait to try more on the menu and actually eat inside.

We went there tonight the 4th july. It got a good number of stars on a few sites and plus it was convenient for us.  Nice atmosphere and busy.  But the food was mediocre at best.I ordered lasagne. It was just an over cheesy mess I barely tasted any pasta. My wife had the gnocchi and the pesto sauce wasn't good.

This is our go to Italian (and probably our first choice) Restaurant in San Francisco.  We love the family atmosphere and all the food is awesome.  It is traditional italian and the best of that genre.  We alway come here when in SF and you should too!!!

My wife & I made our second trip to this CLASSIC on our honeymoon. Wow! It has a great old school neighborhood joint feel. The bar area is tight, but you get to mingle with the friendly staff and "The Regulars". The food is incredible and by all means try to get the window tables.

I am subletting an apartment in North Beach and I was very wary of all the Italian Restaurants because most seem to cater to tourists and the food is overpriced and average.  I walked by Sodini's a few times, then one night I was craving simple spaghetti and meatballs.  I walked in and the bartender Anna greeted me with a big smile, and I felt at home instantly.  The food is amazing authentic Italian American.  This is the place Paulie from Soprano's would eat, if he were real and iived in SF.  I go once a week now and everything on the menu is delicious.  I love this place.  My favorite Italian in North Beach.
the lamb was amazing.  also a lot of parking in this neighborhood and it was easy to get reservations on a friday night!
Piperade occupies a lovely space in a quiet part of the city. I was surprised to learn that the restaurant has been here for 12 years. There is plenty of seating, both indoors and outdoors.
I swoon over their mandarin chicken salad. Definitely worth the wait!

I wish I could give 3.5 stars.  My friend and I were at the Exploratorium, but realized that the lecture we wanted to attend wasn't until 9pm.  Since we were 3 hours early, we decided to find a place nearby to eat.
Visits: 5+
Disappointing, for an upscale establishment in the Financial District. I have the sense that they often do better than they did last night, but last night was "off" in a few important ways.

This place is a bit overrated. It's an OK place for lunch but food is not consistent. Turkey and Brie sandwich is quite good; Cobb salad ok, same with the curry chicken salad. I'm guessing the curry chicken salad isn't one if their more popular items because when I opened the to-go box the lettuce was tinged red (you know how lettuce looks when it starts getting old). Very unappetizing. I won't go back here unless I'm in the area and nothing else is open.

Took my mom here because there was an amazing deal that I got off Travelzoo (dinner for two-- comes with wine, two appetizers, two entrees, two desserts). Didn't know what to expect really because I don't know if I've ever had Basque-specific food (thought I've been to restaurants that have dishes from the region). Everything was very tasty!! Had great grilled calamari (though it is rolled in a somewhat lemon juice/sauce, so if you're sensitive to lemon... and a really good albacore (?) spread for appetizers. I got the duck confit while mom got the rack of lamb. Both were cooked to perfection and served with some pretty tasty sides (lentils for me, veggies for her). We also got a side of summer vegetables which was surprisingly expensive ($10) but was actually a huge portion and very good, so that was fine.
I always think of Piperade as a nice hidden gem. Close to a lot, yet on its own quiet litle street. Romantic, lively but not noisy, but a little overpriced.
Warm and friendly atmosphere. Delightful employees and amazing service. The food we ate... perfect! Top quality and prepared to perfection. A bit pricey...

Piperade is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  It is so consistently great.  The ambience is very soothing, and the noise level is not at bomb level.  The food, cocktails, and service are always excellent.  We had the butter lettuce salad, haricots verts salad, rack of lamb, and halibut last night.  All were first rate.  I will always return to Piperade when I want  a great meal.

We celebrated our anniversary at Piperade using a Travelzoo promotion and the experience was first class. The cheerful hostess sat us immediately and Mo Mo our waiter immediately poured our selection of wine. I enjoyed the calamari appetizer while my husband raved about the goat cheese stuffed red pepper. My rack of lamb (2 pieces) entree was prepared rare to my liking. The New York steak was juicy according to my spouse. For dessert we ordered the marzipan Basque cake (authentic) and the dark chocolate cake with crème fraiche (divine).  Both were brought with candles-very sweet.What was impressive about this Travelzoo deal for two was that diners could order anything off the menu including two glasses of wine, two appetizers, two entrees, and two desserts.  Chef Gerald stopped by our table to greet us and we had a lovely experience in a lovely restaurant. We will be back for more.
We have dined here 4 times. No fail the food is delish every time !! If you are into seafood, try the  squid ala plancha & seafood stew in red pepper sauce.. Yummy

Good food and wine... well composed wine list.  Serrano ham is great... as was the Bokish Abarino.  However our server was not competent.  He knew little of the food, nor especiaily the wines, and failed to attend us properly.  Apparently aware of our special occasion, he never mentioned it... nor even put a candle on either of our desserts.... this is not the kind of place where you expect to ask for water or pour your own wine, but we did.  When I asked if we should have been given olive oil or butter to go with the bread, he said... ''oh, you didn't''.  He ruined the experience for me.

My husband and I are newlyweds and recently had our rehearsal dinner at Piperade and it was perfect. I mean, flawless. Every part of - the food was exquisite, the servers were so attentive and professional, and the private dining room is just gorgeous. We were so thrilled with the entire experience!! We're very much foodies and so are our families so it was very important to us to find a restaurant that would meet expectations, and Piperade just blew everyone away - we're still getting rave reviews from that night. You can't go wrong here.

We visited Piperade with the TravelZoo deal and were very happy to have this introduction. We were pleased with the service and found the range of options on the menu presented a good exposure to the cuisine.

Great food, great service, nice atmosphere. Had the fried manchego, chilled mussel salad, piperade, and braised seafood. Everything was fresh, perfectly seasoned, nice portion sizes and very memorable.

Despite what other yelpers said about poor service, especially with a Travelzoo coupon, my experience was vastly different.  Great service, period.  Friendly, smiling, checking back, etc.  As for the food, it was all superior.  I had the lamb chops, my wife the bouillabaisse.  Both excellent.  I had the calamari appetizer, my wife had the butter lettuce.  Both excellent.  I had the orange blossom flavored "thingies", my wife had the chocolate pudding/cake.  Both excellent.  We ordered an additional bottle of wine because the one glass provided wasn't enough for the full dinner.  Well priced, good wine. As for the Travelzoo pricing package, I didn't find it onerous at all.  Without the extra bottle of wine, we would have paid an additional $40 or so, so it would have been about $120.00 total with TZ.  Where else in SF can you get a terrific 3 course dinner, 2 glasses of wine, tax, tip etc. for $120?  If we'd paid full price, yes it would have been more, but still a good value considering the quality of the food, the ambience and the service.  So, all in all, go.....you should try it.  You'll like it, full price or discounted.
Delicious! I had a hard time deciding what to order, everything sounded sooo good. Don't skip dessert either - right sized for lunch, giving just  a little treat.  We ordered two to share.

This is my 3rd visit to Piperade and I'm a huge fan of the atmosphere.  I love the bar, the lighting and décor, and the service is pretty good.  What I'm having problems with is the food.  Don't get me wrong ,it's fine, but just not great.  I started with the warm sheep's milk cheese and ham terrine....really salty and the salad it rested on was kinda soggy.  Next I had the Piperade - Serrano ham with a poached egg on top resting on a HEAP of sauteed peppers and onions....way too many.  It was ok and probably my fault for not questioning it before ordering it.  For dessert I had the apple tart....really disappointing...soggy and tasteless.  Here's what really got me at this visit. ..my husband also ordered a three course meal and two of the three items ordered were delivered wrong...completely wrong items.  In addition, when the bill came it too was wrong.....I was exhausted by the time I left after having to call the waiter over to fix all the problems.  Oh, and never an "I'm sorry".  Don't get it.  I will probably go back, but I'm a little disgruntled.

Also came here on a Travelzoo deal.  It was an incentive for us to visit a restaurant in a neighborhood we rarely visit.  Really enjoyed the food and the service was better than most.  We weren't bothered by the predetermined tip on the bill because 1) the service was very good and 2) perhaps some customers may have tipped based on the TZ reduced bill.  What was odd on the bill was the "TZ deal tax" line item charge which was then taxed again.  But overall, loved the lamb and stuffed peppers and would return in the future.

I went back to Piperade and the food did not live up to the 5 star rating I gave after my initial visit.  I must admit that I took a trip to the Basque region in between the visits, but even felt embarrassed after hyping up the restaurants to my friends who were all a bit disappointed with the food.

Excellent service, very friendly, professional and prompt.   It your average Spanish food (because it is Basque).  Must try the house cocktails.  Delicious food from appetiZers thru to dessert.  Had dinner here on the evening of our wedding.  Very nice and quiet.

This is our most favorite restaurant in SF.  The service is always great and the food is wonderful. Last night my husband had a perfectly dressed butter lettuce salad and I had a wonderful tomato tart as our first course. Then we had lamb....three distinct ways....and steak; both were excellent.we finished up with a almond gateau and an apple tart. Throughout the meal Daniel, our favorite waiter, matched wine pourings with each dish. Perfect, always perfect. It was an anniversary celebration and we did feel special!
Nice quiet location on Battery with both indoor and outdoor seating.  Indoors has a nice long bar with about 10 seats.   Outdoor tables have heaters to keep the chill down.

I used to go here for special occasions when I worked nearby. Haven't been around for a few years. So, decided to treat a friend to a birthday lunch here yesterday.  Never been disappointed before and they were just as good yesterday.

Unfortunately, the service has gone downhill. We had eaten before with Travel zoo and had good food and service. Last night we had Travelzoo again and had good food but disappointing service. Forgotten drinks and then the waiter disappeared. We had a birthday which I mentioned during the reservation and not even a candle. We will not be going back.

This place is very hard to find. I've lived in the Levi's Plaza neighborhood for 6 months now and had it not been for yelp I never would've known it existed. It's in an alley southwest of the Pottery Barn headquarters. (Mad props to the chef inside of the main Piperade for giving me directions)

If you come here with Travelzoo deal, note that they added tax from the full price bill + 18% tip. So after the voucher, we still had to pay around $40. Food is so-so. The calamari appetizer is amazing! The rack of lamb and duck are tasteless. The orange beignets dessert that everyone is raving about is overhype. I much prefer the milk chocolate hazelnut cake! Service is not that great either. Once our server knows we are using Travelzoo voucher he took away the wine menu and said "Only house wine is included". What if we hate those house wine and want to order something else and actually pay for it?!?! Parking is relatively easy. There are some street parking in front of the restaurants on Saturday for dinner.

I went there recently with several friends visiting from out of town.  The food, service, ambience...everything was wonderful.  I have a medical reason for needing to be gluten free and the waiter was very happy to check on what I could and could not eat.  Each of us at the table ordered something different and every single item was delicouis.  Our watier was very attentive and knowledgeable about  both the menu and the wine list.  I also loved that the executive chef circulated in the dining room to make sure every table was well cared for.  I will recommend this place to everyone, both native SFiscans and visitors.

Piperade has been around in the relatively quiet Levi Straus North Waterfront neighborhood for a long time.  Consistently delivering great food and attentive professional service is the hallmark of any great restaurant.   Piperade fulfills these expectations day in and day out.

Great food and great time with my wife.  Halibut and sea bass were Delish.  Server a little hard to understand but did an excellent job.   Was a wonderful experience for both of us and we will return.   Thanks piperade staff
Great food.

Great introductory course to Basque cuisine.  I've got to find a way to make the stuffed piquillo peppers and serrano ham a part of my regular diet.  The big down side is the private room.  The acoustics in there create decibel levels that will rival a recent One Direction concert.

Always a good meal here.  I've brought several people here and haven't ever had a bad review just yet.  I usually come here for the carpaccio with the apples and the duck.  For the sweets I'd say between the creme caramel and the dark chocolate cake (beware...it's very rich).
I wanted to like you, I really did...
Lovely place.  Beautiful food, great tastes and attentive service.  The dining room is quiet enough for conversation and on a Tuesday night there was parking right outside.  I'll be back!
After being told about how wonderful this restaurant is, I was surprised to be very disappointed by my experience at Piperade.

Great atmosphere, great food. I enjoyed the intimate, sophisticated feel of the place. It was quiet enough that I could actually hear my dinner companions, but still lively and fun. I had the asparagus appetizer and the chicken entree with chick peas. Others had the garlic soup and the sea bass. We shared the beignet dessert. Everything was excellent.

We really like the idea of small plates. We each ordered 4 small things and were totally stuffed by the end. I wish there more vegetarian options, but I always think that. The manchego cheese was a little salty for my taste, and the hubby wasn't a fan of the chickpeas but everything else was delicious. The stuffed pepper was awesome!

Mo's may be good for the North Beach tourist, but they treat their regular customers like garbage. An ever changing menu and an outdated website coupled with the awful attitude of the same sour (and possibly a little drunk) hostess every time I've gone has ensured that they'll never get another dime out of me. The only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one is because of their awesome Mexican style breakfast which they recently TOOK OFF THE MENU. So really, it's not worth any of it anymore.
If you are looking for feel good, no nonsense cooking in a diner atmosphere,

Yummy little hole in the wall. Was very happy with the service and the food. I got the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend got the breakfast burrito. Although the eggs Benedict was delicious the breakfast burrito had a kick to it and was definitely the winner. Very affordable also.

My roommate and I got all dressed up and just knew we were going to get good Sunday brunch. All the places in the area were crowded with football fans and ending their brunches early. We gave up on that fancy idea, and ran into Mo's on accident. We took off our pearls and rolled up our sleeves for some greasy goodness. I had a chicken sandwish (with the thai curry on the side) and my roommate got the belly buster burger. At first glance, I thought the place will really pricey... and then they bought out the food and I saw why. My plate was packed with food and my chicken breast was bigger than it's bun!! I loveqdddd it. Still wish it wasn't AS expensive... but I'll probably be back.

Unbelievable high quality burgers for a very good price. I love how they grind their meat out in the open so you know they're not using some low grade ground beef. Makes me feel safe to order medium rare. The burger is so juicy, my mouth is watering just thinking about it

Great breakfast - I had the French toast with fruit.  We had not wait and was able to get breakfast pretty late in the afternoon!  Very close walking distance from Coit Tower/Filbert Steps/Telegraph Hill.  Parking was a bit challenging.  Really friendly and prompt service.  Will definitely come back for a more savory option - all the food looked great.
Mo's ended up being a diamond in the rough. My girlfriend and I were having a difficult time deciding where to eat. All we knew is we wanted a burger and didn't want our bill to be sky high.

I come here often but I think today will be the last time. The food taste okay yeah but the level on cleanliness is horrible. I witnessed a lot of cross contamination today. One cook was touching raw bacon with his bare hands, then touched someones hamburger buns. The main cook wears the same latex gloves, (illegal), the whole time and wipes them on his apron. The guy that touched the bacon wiped his hands on his pants. One of the cooks spilled some sauce on the floor, threw a towel on it, used his foot to wipe it up, and threw the towel away and still didn't wash his hands.
