There is, however, one waitress that wears glasses that is extremely sweet. Every time I did come here she was really nice and accommodating.  Too bad she works at such a dirty place.

Got there right at opening time and there were already some people there, which seemed to be a good sign. Although we skipped the popular choice of blueberry pancakes and French toast, our eggs did not disappoint. My Mexican omelette was DELICIOUS. Portions are massive though.

For all the hooplah that my girlfriend and I read about this place from Yelp, I was admittedly, really really excited about checking this joint out. My excitement only grew when I walked in the door and saw a cook beating a patty with his bare hands (hopefully he washed them) to get it nice and tender before the grill. The ambiance is cool and the service is prompt -- I was psyched. After a long day of work, a burger was just what I needed.

My girlfriend and I had dinner here last night, an we both agree: one of the best burgers we have ever had! Definitely try it out. I think I had one called the gut buster. Mushrooms, caramelized onions, cheese and truffle oil!
So, if you want a breakfast that's enough to feed two, but you eat the whole thing anyways because it's that good, here's your spot.
Absolutely love. Only complaint is that I usually eat so much that I can't move afterward... But, that might be my own fault! It's too good!
Skip the tourist lines at Mamas and take breakfast at Mo's.  Excellent menu, food and service.  Coffee brewed is from a neighborhood roaster and is excellent!!
We haven't tried all the burgers in SF but so far this is our favorite.  Great fries, good cole slaw.
Ended up here two days in a row after consecutive unsuccessful attempts to try Mama's. It popped up in yelp as second best breakfast in the area and you can walk there in five minutes.

Service was really great, but the beef brisket special was pretty bad...it was 50% or more total fat! The burgers looked pretty good and we may give it another chance in the very distant future for breakfast.

This is true value eating in the city. Huge portions and fair pricing. My Aussie burger was nicely cooked medium with definite pink/red center - very good. And was sandwiched with not just 1, but 2 fried eggs. Geez. They serve Graffeo coffee which was splendid.The only thing that knocks this down is the ventilation. The kitchen is  not closed off to the dining area so it was a little stuffy. However, if you're looking for a place for a larger group of people and don't want to brave a long wait, this is a fine option. For Sunday brunch at 1pm, we waited about 10 minutes for a group a 5.

While vacationing out in SF and staying on the fringe of Chinatown and North Beach, I was looking for a really good breakfast or lunch spot. Don't want to wait in a huge line like Mamma's so I found Mo's on Yelp.
The burgers here are amazing, huge and juicy. So delicious!!
there burger are very traditional

Went there for breakfast with family and if you are in North Beach this place is a great option for lunch or breakfast.  Our table arrived around 11 on a Saturday morning and although it was pretty full we were seated within 5 minutes.
Local establishment with consistently good breakfasts.  They also serve up home style lunches and dinners...such as Mo's Meatloaf and hearty hamburgers.
I usually don't crave burgers, but if they're cooked to perfection, I'm a fan. This is the case for Mo's Grill.

Omfg.  The burgers are some of the best I've ever had in my life, I'm pretty sure.   I personally love ordering mine rare with blue cheese, and no bun.  It's seriously that good--to eat it with a fork and knife, haha.  Their fries are good too.  I'd like to try some of the daily specials maybe, sometime.  Sometime.  I don't know if I can resist from not ordering that burger again next time!

After checking out the insane line at Mama's, I decided to have breakfast at Mo's Grill. And I'm glad I did. Mo's is very small and was pretty packed on a Saturday morning, but we were able to get seated almost right away. Definitely not a place to come with a large group. It's very cute inside with lots of farm animal decorations on the walls and an open kitchen so you can see everything being prepared and cooked.

Tiny neighborhood gem.  We were at the North Beach Fair this year and BFF wanted breakfast instead of the street food.  So, we spotted the restaurant and the menu looked interesting, so we ventured in. I only had a small fruit salad as I wasn't hungry but I did a lot of nibbling of her breakfast which was really good.
mo's do, without doubt, the best bay area breakfast burrito! - be warned, it's huge!

I ordered my burger medium, it comes back well done. Ask for it to be redone, wait 10 more minutes, comes back and it's raw. No thanks I don't want it anymore. If you can't even get that right, I don't want to try anything else at your restaurant.
Side of fries at this place means... Mountain of fries. Even though there was a lot.. like 3 people could split this side of fries... they seemed pretty bland and lifeless.
This place is exactly how it should be. Very nice wait staff. Burger done exactly how I asked for it. Not too busy if you get there before 7

Man, their burger was awesome! I tried aussie burger in their breakfast menu, the combination of crunchy bread, melted cheese and their patty with Sunnyside eggs on top of that was perfect patty combo for breakfast! Aside of that, their stir fried potatoes was great! With a hint of garlic and pepper, making that as a perfect meal in the morning.
If you haven't been, go.

Their closing times are liberal. We arrived 20 minutes before closing to grab our long awaited burgers but the doors were locked and the waitstaff dismissed us very rudely claiming that they closed at 10pm instead of 10:30. Inside, the staff was busy enjoying their own meals as we double and triple checked the sign that clearly read 8:30 to 10:30.

We called them up with our huge order (hotel front office staff) and they hit each burger perfectly. The quality was amazing for the burger but we could have skipped the fries. This is def a one and a while place unless you can shell out 16 bucks a plate to still be significantly hungry.

Awesome, no wait at 8:30 AM (it was Monday though, weekend might me different) and good service, kitchen is sitting out for everyone to see, fresh ingredients to be sure!  The manager (and possibly the owner as well) shadowed the new waitress to make sure everything was copacetic with everyone, and I appreciate that level of service.  Good regular coffee here, great way to start my diner experience.  The breakfast burrito here is ridiculous, it's got everything under the sun inside, including spicy peppers and salsa, and is topped with chili and sour cream.  Sounds exciting and great, but after a few bites I was done with it, too much going on for me.  That doesn't take away from the quality, it was cooked and prepared perfectly, it just isn't what I'm looking for in my quintessential breakfast burrito.  Now, my sister's omelette and fruit on the other hand...wish I had ordered that, it was soo perfectly cooked and yummy, and the fruit was extremely fresh.

The best burgers, hot Sammie's and salads on the block!!! I work down the street and I want Mo's every day... I have to fight the urge but when I don't... Whoa!!! The burgers are cooked to your temp and perfect everytime!!!

This place is a definite anytime I'm in SF.  Their breakfast portions are enough to feed 2 hungry people after a night of drinking!   The only negative is that their location is micro so there's always a wait.  If your lucky enough to be seated right by the register you will receive glares from the hungry patrons waiting in line to swoop in to get your table.  Prices are incredibly reasonable considering the portions.  Bacon, cheese, tomato,  onion, and avocado omelet is an absolute favorite.  This includes rosemary potatoes and of course sour dough. Yum.

I wouldn't say that their burgers are great nor bad. It was only okay to me. I really liked the size of it. The burger was huuuge! If I was a bigger eater and super loved burgers, I would be the happiest person on earth eating their burgers. It was definitely way filling!

We were looking for a brunch spot in SF that was a bit of a walk for our place and came across Mo's Grill.  I've been down grant hundreds of times but had never seen this place before.  The service wasn't great and we felt the food was just ok.  We ordered the Aussie Burger and decided to share it because another patron got it and left half on their plate...it was a smart move.  It was ok but was falling apart while eating it.

Fast service for a yummy sandwich! I stopped by here for lunch on a Friday around 1PM and there wasn't a wait. The female owner was quick with making my order of the Chicken Cadillac which was yummy! I was little disappointed by the size of it because of the price I paid ~$9 (a little less than $10). The sandwich's temperature was perfect which is why I give it 4 stars! I would come back again for lunch. There's a table inside and outside for you to dine solo or with your friends. So it's a cool place to chill!
Good place to stop for lunch. Great sandwiches. Better than RJs. Highly recommend the turkey avocado. Service is fast and friendly.

This place really knows how to treat a person. The couple who owns it are great. They are punctual and the sandwiches are so fresh. I almost always order the BLT and the bacon is so crispy, the lettuce and tomato are cool and crisp and the bread is soft and moist.

I love Paul's Deli! It's my go-to work lunch spot. Yes it's pricey but this is San Francisco...everything is pricey. Price is on par with everything else around here. Everything I've had here is delicious but my usual is a Tuna Cheddar. As noted by others, have your order ready ahead of time & the less complicated you make it, the better. Drink selection is awesome. It's the only place nearby that sells sparkling Crystal Geyser water.
I got a cold turkey sandwich on Dutch Crunch with avocado. I kinda don't understand how they make a simple sandwich into such a heavenly experience, but wow. Phenomenal.

I had no idea this little deli was just down the street from our work, but I'm so glad someone mentioned it! The folks that own it are really nice, make delicious food and are really efficient as well! Even if there's a long line, they get through those sandwiches so fast and they are DELICIOUS!  It's our new favorite place in the area to eat lunch.

Word of advice, you're probably going to come here for a sandwich for takeout during a busy day at the office. Knowing that, you should know exactly what you want on your sandwich before you're on the spot. Everyone here is doing the same thing. Order, wait, leave. With that said, the Korean-owned Paul's serves nothing short of a good sandwich. But if you order anything else (udon, any sort of bowl), know that they heat it up in a microwave.

Long line at lunch but it moves quickly - we had the Cadillac Chicken on dutch crunch which was very good. The prices are in-line with other delis in the area and the sandwich was enormous, easily enough for two meals.

The koreans that operate this place are a delight to order from. Love the dutch crunch bread with nearly anything on the menu. Also love that due to my eagerness to eat the sandwich I tend to shred my mouth apart and need a Snapple.

Not cheap.. duno where they got one star from. A sandwich a drink and chips was nearly $14. Quick service though and the BLT with avacado I had was delicious. Couldn't really ask for a whole lot more.
Normally I don't review deli's, but this korean mom-pop shop served a delicious chicken pesto panini.
Work lunch spot

Love this place.  The lady making the sandwich is amazingly efficient.  If you take the time to smile at them, they smile back.  That's saying something in this area.  Although, if you're rude to them, they dish it right back!  Love the chicken pesto sandwich.
I wanted to go Cafe Me for breakfast but since my Mom couldn't walk there and we were on a slight time crunch (on our way to Alcatraz), we came here instead.

Paul's Deli serves delicious sandwiches but it's a little on the pricey side. The service was good and the two workers there seem friendly but I wouldn't recommend going there on an every day basis, unless you have the cash to spend.

Local little deli in my new work hood and I've been here a few times. Mostly for the lox bagel for breakfast. Pretty darn yummy. I've also had their chicken gyro for lunch. Nothing gourmet, but solid sandwiches are made here. Looking forward to trying the chicken pesto sammie next time.

Just went there for the first time. I noticed the line is long around 12, so I waited til 1 today and didn't have to wait in line at all. The asian folks that own/operate it are very nice and talkative. I got the chicken pesto sandwich and it was very tasty. Skip the long wait at RJ's and go here if you just want a sandwich :)
I love the style of this place, small confines, small menu, quick service and freakin' good! if your in the area a must go for lunch. If your not in the area, worth the walk.

My co-workers and I frequent this place at least once a week.  They don't offer gourmet sandwiches or any salads, but they make good solid basic sandwiches.  They are generous with everything in between the bread with just the right amount of balance.
Breakfast:

Good sandwich, tons of meat and reasonably priced compared to a lot of the food that I have eaten in SF. They were very fast, maybe to fast as the lady was so occupied with her speed that the customer service was a hair lacking, but nothing that would prevent me from eating there again.

I come to Paul's regularly enough that they recognize me and are wayyyyyy nicer than when I first started working across the street. Pro? Sorta? This place is great for getting a sandwich quickly, you're in and out in a matter of minutes, which is deceiving considering the line sometime weaves out the door. They also have pretty bangin' breakfast sandwiches and coffee. All in all, nothing to complain about. With so few choices around Levi Plaza I come here pretty frequently, but it's never some place I would go out of my way to visit. My favorite sandwiches : Buffalo Chicken Sandwich & the Gardenburger. Favorite breakfast: Everything bagel with cream cheese, cucumber and tomato with a side of a banana for good measure.
Best sandwiches in San Francisco.
The best place to have lunch in the area.
Good spot to quickly grab a sandwich, chips, drink, fruit, or candy. I had the Viking on Dutch crunch.  It was tasty but nothing out of the ordinary. Will be back to try the meatball sandwich.

Who is Paul?  The lady behind the counter was very quick to take my order and based off of a previous recommendation I couldn't wait to check this space out.  I ordered the warm turkey and avocado sandwich.  When asked what kind of bread I wanted I retorted with "What kinds do you have?"  In which she waved her hand over the bagged assortment in the corner and said "these kinds".  That's it.  I couldn't help but laugh and say "the brown one please".  She chose her bread of choice and began to slather and stack.  I waited as my lunch was being prepared and quickly inhaled once it got to my mouth.
Little deli and corner store. Huge selection of hot and cold sandwiches. Friendly, quick service.

Traditional mom and pop shop.  With sandwiches all over the area, I choose to go here because of the quickness of their service and the quality.  A turkey, avocado on wheat runs you around 7 bucks.  Add a bag of chips and drinks and you're looking at 11 bucks.
Such a hidden gem here! Would have never known about this place if my coworkers didn't mention it but am I glad they did!

Paul's Deli is the bomb! They are such a cute mom and pop place. The lady makes the sandwiches in turbo mode. Their meatball sandwich with provolone cheese on dutch crunch is super yummy! If you are a vegetarian, get the veggie sandwich with their tomato sauce it costs a lil extra, but worth it!

I work a few blocks away from Paul's all of us nurses go there atleast 2-3 times a week, they have the best BLT sandwiches, turkey w/ avacado and the breakfast sandwiches are great. they are very fast, have great customer service, and it's even better to order for pick up because the line at lunch is out the door.
Meatball, with cheese on dutch crunch.

Paul's Deli is a fun little family owned restaurant  1/2 block off the Embarcadero. It's a great place to grab and go- to the parks around the corner or back to the office- but limited space for dine in. A cross between a mini-mart and a sandwich shop, the place is clean and the family behind the counter is efficient.

BLT avocado. Get it. They are ninjas in there are you will get your food fast. They take CC on $7 minimum (price of most sandwiches). The lox bagel in the mornings is also delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with any sandwich, as everyone has their favorites. Consistency is what I like. Go support this local family!
Just left there. Here's the breakdown:

Yes, I'm a fan. A nice getaway from the overpriced RJ's if you work in the area. The owners/operators are so sweet, the sandwich lady is so cute and sweet and makes a killer sandwich just the way I like it. And as a regular, the cashier guy (her husband?) always slips me a pack of gum as a thank you.

I think Paul's Deli is just ok. I'm a really big sub sandwich kinda gal, and I didn't really think Paul's was anything to write home about. It's close to where I work, which is great because there isn't a whole lot around. I'm sure I'll try it again and if my sandwich becomes magically delicous I'll be sure to update my review.
ok so it's one of the 4 places to get lunch around the area.
Imagine YOUR mom making you a sandwich (my mom's sandwiches suck). That's what Paul's is all about.

Paul's is a great place to grab a sandwich if you're in the neighborhood. The prices are well below RJ's, which is a round the corner. Paul's makes them big and I haven't tried anything on the menu that I didn't like. They also have an amazing selection of chips. The line can get long during peak hours, but it's worth the wait.

I really like this place for dim sum. You order off the menu, not steam carts, which means if you get there right when it opens it can take a bit to get your food (they are cooking it fresh). Lots of Chinese here, but with the exception of a few obligatory specialties (i.e. chicken feet), not much on the menu that can't be enjoyed by everyone.
This place was underwhelming, especially for a city as full of great food as San Francisco.

Dim sum was good. Not the best I've had but good. Make sure to get there real early or later on weekends. Got there at 9:30a, half an hour after they opened and still ended up waiting 1.5 hours even though the door hostess said "20 minutes." Ok decor and ambiance.

This place is always busy. We arrived before 11 and their was already a crowd on the sidewalk. Waited about 30 minutes for a table for 6. The dim sum is delicious. The cha sui bao's are so good. I normally do not eat these during dim sum. The chicken feet, shanghai dumplings were all very good. We ordered everything on a laminated sheet. It took a while for our food to arrive. Once the food was ready everything came out all at once. Def recommending this place.
Food is good, always a line during weekends, good service. The environment is ok.

Came here a bunch of times over the years. I was the only non-Asian person there amongst what appeared to be almost a hundred diners! Definitely not your tourist Cantonese Dim Sum Restaurant. I was waiting with folks that seem to take a natural, genuine liking to me. The old ladies smiled, waved, patted my shoulders and said nice things in whatever English they can muster up. I wasn't trying for them to accept me as their own, but it felt good to know that people welcomed me with open arms. Literally! This goes for customers and their employees alike!

Like any Dim Sum restaurant, it's best if you can speak Canto. Knowing only Mando or English will make you feel like an outsider, and result in being confused. However, if you must speak Mando or English, you should know exactly want you want before you come here, and I will tell you what to order and give you pictures to boot. Lai Hong Lounge needs to convert its tables quickly, so the food comes out quickly, so you should also not eat slowly. Lai Hong is popular so service might be a bit pushy. You'll probably wait 30 minutes for a table by noon on a weekday.

What do you do when you have 5 people from your Moms side of the family visiting SF from Colombia, your mom tells you that you need to invite them to something, AND you are feeling the poverty of being a part time grad school student trying to pay your tuition and loans? Thank God for Chinese food!
Delicious ethnic delicacies.
Great food. Cart Dim Sum is only at lunch, but menu Dim Sum available at dinner. Best chow fun ever!

Really great evening dim sum.  The restaurant was clean and the staff very friendly when we arrived.  We ordered several dim sum, fried rice and chow fun.  All very tasty.  Pork buns and Shu Mai were tops.

This is a Great Dim Sum place on the edge of SF's China Town. I took a friend and my Chinese girlfriend to this place while visiting San Francisco and everyone loved this place including my girlfriend who grew up in Beijing and loves authentic Chinese spots. The food was extremely tasty and authentic and the only downside was the long wait (almost an hour) but I will definitely be coming back to try this place again and try some new dishes.
Wow.   Best Dim Sum ever..  Everything tasted so fresh.  Too bad we live in Southern California or else we would eat there every couple of weeks.

This dim-sum restaurant deserves a solid four star. Ever since Gold Mountain closed on Broadway, I've been coming here as a regular. It's a local favorite as Dim-sum is a must go, as for the dinner/banquet not so much. However don't be expecting the dim-sum karts so you can't see how your food looks since the descriptions aren't the best so the best bet is the pictures from different tables or yelp or course.

In my opinion, the best place for dim sum in SF, mainly due to shorter wait times (than its sister restaurant Hong Kong Lounge in Inner Richmond) and due to the most amazing pork buns! Would definitely recommend.

For my first experience getting dim sum, I have to say it was quite overwhelming. I have had dumplings/potstickers/dim sum in a traditional sense in a restaurant as a small order but this is entirely different.
Legit dim sum. Had a feast for 4 people and it was only 15 per person. All dishes are excellent but anything shrimp related are standouts. Baked pork baos are exceptional.

We got here at opening (9am) for dim sum.  There was a group already waiting outside and by 9:30am I'd say you would have to wait for a table.  We ordered wayyy too much food (40 dollars worth for two people), but I was feeling ambitious.  A lot of it was chinese noob friendly, but overall very good and generous portions.
Amazing dim sum on par with HK Lounge! Arrive early and grab a ticket, reservations are for parties of 8 or more (gratuity will be added).
IF A FEMALE SERVER CHASES YOU OUTSIDE OF THE RESTAURANT DEMANDING FOR 10% TIP, TIP HER AT YOUR DISCRETION.

Mm mm mm. Finally got to try some good dim sum in SF. We went right when it opened on a weekday morning. Obviously no line; there were mostly elderly Chinese folks eating and gossiping inside. They seemed pretty cool. I hope I have that much energy to wake up early for dim sum when I get to their age.

We asked what the wait time would be and were informed 30 minutes. We ended up waiting one hour; only to discover it's not a la carte but on order. Proceeded to wait another 30 minutes before our first couple dishes came out - but overall everything took like an hour to come out - no wonder the initial wait is so long!!

After walking through Chinatown on an early Saturday morning, my husband and I were hungry for breakfast. We saw plenty of dim sum restaurants but either the line was too long or the place was empty. Unable to choose, we opened the Yelp app to help determine where the best dim sum was. Somehow, we decided on Lai Hong Lounge.

Get the "pea shoots"....I could eat those every day!!  Also they have dim sum menu during the days and weekends, but also feature a separate dinner menu after 6p.  Recommend the huge Har Gao shrimp dumplings....they are amazing (but big!).:)

This is the BEST dim sum place in San Francisco. Because it's not located in the "touristy" center of Chinatown is why this place is a hidden gem. How can you tell? Well, two ways. 1) Almost all the customers speak Cantonese and/or Mandarin and 2) there is a LONG line... I went around lunchtime and waited an hour before I finally got a spot.

I think this use to be Lychee Garden back in the day. I LOVE dim sum and am hard on the reviews so giving this place 4 stars should say a lot. I love eating (good food) but hate waiting to be seated so when I plan to eat here, I arrive about 10-15 minutes before they open so I can be part of the first seating. Otherwise the wait time is over an hour. Ok, on with the food.
so far so good

very bad service for dinner， the food is ok， but it takes wrong order， after dinner we pay，the tip i gave almost 2 dollar，the waitress say u just gave 2 dollar，u need to give more。i gave more 1 dollar， she laugh and say  only 2 dollar，why i gave u 2 dollar。u take wrong order and bad sevice，why i need gave u more tip？why u always take care  white people than us？that is discriminate！！！！！！ very very very bad service 。 i hope i never come here to eat dinner！！！！i would not come again！
Very good food..the servers are are not too rude, in a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best...i would give their servers a 6...
Very good food, it was kind of difficult to talk to the waiter but no big deal. The steamed pork buns were delicious and the dim sun full of shrimps

Food was delicious (fresh fried calamari, shu mai, singapore noodles) but service was slow and bad, hence only three stars. The place isn't your typical hole in the wall, at least they try not to be. They have white table linens but you get your typical paper napkins and avoid the bathroom if possible.. You get charged $1 per person for tea, even though my whole party (which also consisted of my baby niece) who don't even drink tea. You betcha I did pour that into every tea cup on the table. I had to ask three people for straws and then finally got it after 25 mins. So when the bill came I tipped with the bill based on what i felt was appropriate and told her keep the change, but the waitress had the audacity to ask me for another dollar for tip. She stood there and didn't budge, asking me 'you have another dollar?' Seriously? Now looking back I should've just taken the tip back and said just for that--none. Ohh well!

So I'm giving this place 3 stars. The food is 4 stars, but the price and wait time (which was double was 4 times what the hostess said) make this place less appealing. Also, they have no carts, so once you sit down it still takes some time before you're eating anything.

The amount of Chinese people eating there tells that this place should be good however our experience was not great. Most dumplings were sweet or rather tasteless and we tried half the menu to give it a fair chance.
I have been visiting this place once month for the last year. The dim sum is good especially the shrimp dishes. Their shrimp are really "bouncy or crunchy" not mushy like some places I've been too.
Amazing.

FYI in case you didn't know. Same owners as HK Lounge I and II but in chinatown. Same wait time though and place is a bit smaller. Went here today for some dimsum. We got there around 11 and what was a time estimate of 20-30 minutes turned into an hour. They set up a new table for us too but it was basically squeezed into a walk way but either way we got seated. Ordered the usual dimsum dishes of shiu mai, chicken feet, steam pork buns, etc. The wait for the food was actually a lot longer than what I have experienced in HK lounge so at least you know its fresh but it seriously took forever. Food was very good and quality was great. I think their dimsum pieces are bigger than the usual places so worth it but not evrey weekend type of place for sure.

Awesome food!  Went there for a family dinner based on a recommendation, and have to say it was a wonderful experience.  The staff was very hospitable and helpful.  We started out with their Pork Porridge, and it was so creamy and perfectly seasoned.  I've had congee at many places, and this was indeed one of the best I've had.  We were planning to do Dim Sum, and the staff helped us pick out all the right dishes.  We ordered BBQ Pork Buns, Shu Mai, Vegetarian dumplings, Steamed Fishballs, shrimp dumplings, and Pan Fried House noodles, and every item was delicious!!!  At the end, staff even treated us to a house desert.  Have to say it was a very fun evening, and all of us went away with big smiles and very full bellies!  Highly recommend this place!

Very friendly service. The beef short ribs with yams underneath were seriously just YUM!!! And so were the pepper fried Chicken Wings! It's not black pepper like I thought it would be. I forgot, CHINA RULES. LOL pepper on a menu in China means actual chili peppers lmao not black pepper like we use for everything here in the states XD. So the wings were toped with fried garlic, tiny diced red chilies, and scallions. SO, SO good! We also loved our meatballs and potstickers. The only downside (and the reason I always want to go for dim sum) were their xlb (Shanghai Soup Dumpling). Do not misunderstand, they were GOOD. But they were not GREAT. I have been lucky enough to have been spoiled with the most epic Xiao Long Bao known to man (OK, known to me lmao) but they were earth shattering. These were just good. I did love how they put their xlb in tiny cupcake-cups to save your juices from leaking out. That was AWESOME.

This was our first experience with a Dim Sum restaurant and it was perfect! The Dim Sum we ordered was not only delicious, the service was great, and it truly was an authentic Asian gem. If you want an experience away from "Main Street China Town" this is it. Highly recommended!

my family came here once and to be honest they charge gratuity 15 % even if your group is not 8 people. we were only 7 including babies. so be aware if your group is large. also they ask for tips. don't be surprise if you are walked up by a waitress asking for more tips. I would rather go somewhere else without having to have a rude waitress thinking she gave top service when we got shit service.

We were seated at the bar having some beers when we ordered some food from Chubby Noodle (which was nestled in the back of the bar). I ordered 2 orders of their pork ribs and 1 order of the chicken fingers. They were both very delicious. However, the price was quite steep. The total amount for the food was $47 and the portions were on the smallish side. The main reason I'm dinging Chubby Noodle and giving them less stars is I felt it was not a very good value. But, the food we did get was tasty.
This place is a gem. A rare bird. A legendary pokemon. It's delicious. Also pork buns and scallion pancakes. I still have dreams about this place, beautiful haunting dreams.
Why do they keep changing their menu? And so overpriced. The fried chicken is amazing, but why is it $9? Still good, but not 5 stars anymore.

A restaurant inside Amante bar in the North beach area.  Most of the dishes are tapas size, great for sharing.  We had the garlic noodles, spicy wontons, papaya salad, Korean pork tacos, and poke.  All were delicious.the staff were friendly, waitress kept forgetting us and we needed to track her down a few times.  Definitely good food and would come back.

This place is located inside a bar, Amante, in North Beach. I was meeting a friend for some drinks but we also wanted some ramen. After a quick search we couldn't come up with anywhere we wanted to go until we found Chubby Noodle. This was very close to where we were at so off we went. I didn't realize it wasn't ramen until we saw the menu but that really didn't matter once I got my noodles.

Chubby Noodle, what happened to you??? I came here again a few weeks ago and was sorely disappointed. We ordered the tuna poke, salt & pepper shrimp, and spicy garlic noodles. They must've gotten a different chef because the tuna poke and spicy garlic noodles that were so good the last time I ate here were terrible this time. The salt & pepper shrimp was still good, but the rest of the meal was awful. The tuna poke had a weird texture and didn't taste marinated long enough, or with enough seasoning. The spicy garlic noodles were neither spicy nor garlicy. It was also covered in a thick hoisin sauce that just smothered any other flavors,if there were any, and made the whole thing a sticky, gooey mess. I do not know what happened but I won't be back. Back to the drawing board.

CHUBBY BUNNY; CHUBBY BUNNY, CHUBBY BUNNY. Wait.. Chubby Noodle?!  Situated in the back of Amante's, you have an Asian fusion restaurant.  Using the word "fusion" very lightly here.  It's more like, Chinese food-American style.  Arrived around 8:30-9 for dinner on Friday night.  The place was packed but luckily a table had just left so after waiting for the waiters to clean up the table, we were seated.  The place was a bit grungy but acceptable.  We ended up ordering the poke, chicken strips, spicy garlic noodles, and chicken wings (which I cannot remember the name of).  First came, the poke with shrimp chips.  The poke was not salty which I am used to which is actually a good thing.  Places usually dress poke with a bunch of soy.  On the flip side, without the soy, the poke was kind of bland.  The shrimp chips was very inventive.  Doesn't really add much to the taste but at least it is unique.  Next came the chicken strips.  Brined, fried, and flake-y! Probably the best thing of the night.  (In fact, we liked it so much, we ordered another order of this!)  The chicken was tender, the crust was hard and even though it came with a spicy mayo sauce, you don't need it because there is enough flavor if the chicken just the way it is.  Next came the spicy garlic noodles.  Tasted like Dan Dan noodles with a bit of a kick.  Tasty to me just because I love garlic but not anything special or something you can find at a true Chinese noodle joint.  Finally, we there were the chicken wings.  I want to say they were called Kung Pao Chicken Wings but not quite sure.  The wings to me were the low point of the meal.  They sauced they pour over tasted like the chicken feet flavor you get at dim sum.  I love that flavor with chicken feet but it didn't really work with the chicken wings.  The wings were cooked but the fat was not rendered enough so you end up with huge mouthfuls of chicken skin and fat underneath.  If you come here, come for the drinks and the chicken strips.  You can pass on the other things.  It was a good experience here but not an exceptional experience.  The food was OK, the service was good, and the crowd seems chill but I want to say there are better places to eat this kind of food.
Dearest Chubs Noods.  You were perfect.  You were everything to me.  I would devour everything you offered, and it was good.

Been waiting for Chubby Noodle to finally open in the Cow Hollow / Marina after many months walking by and seeing the exterior sign go up and the restaurant dark. Came by to celebrate a late birthday (Happy Belated to Nick the Owner that shares the same date). Got some great recommendations from Jane the Hostess with the mostest. Halibut was outstanding with the fresh ginger and spices, Basil Shrimp noodles had just the right kick of heat to it, Chicken buns were a very nice tasty appetizer surprise, and the Hamachi Poke was so ono licious. What a welcome local gem in the neighborhood...

Kung Pao Chicken wings tasted great!! Spicy! BUT HUGE GRIPE, they were not crunchy or crispy. The skin was overly soaked with sauce to the point that the skin got gummy. Don't get me wrong I finished them, but damn they were disappointingly limp.

Chubby Noodle is inside of a busy bar in North Beach but mostly worth the wait for a table. I am definitely a fan of this place. I recommend getting their spicy garlic noodle.  The sauce is filled with garlic flavor and creaminess. It kind of reminds me of STRAITS' garlic noodle. It's really good!

Chubby Noodle is inside of a busy bar in North Beach but mostly worth the wait for a table. My first time here it was seat yourself and cafe style (ie. order at a window in the back and grab a number) and I could not wait to come back. But then on my last visit there was a host and we had servers. Whenever you have multiple servers running food and taking orders it's bound to result in a mistake or items being brought out in a staggered fashion. And they changed the menu...

I am definitely a fan of this place! We went during their grand opening so everything was a little hectic but the bar tender took care of us and was very generous with sake shots. The food was yummy and overall it was a great evening. I will definitely return once the dust settles!!

I was actually really excited to try this place after reading the reviews and looking at all the pictures! I'm not sure if it's because they opened a new Chubby Noodle and they basically forgot about this place... but I feel deceived!!

Love Chubby Noodle! Small menu of Asian/Hawaiian/fusion (?) items that make for great bar food or take out dinner. My favorites: ramen, garlic noodles, fried chicken, tuna poke, and BBQ chicken buns. As others noted, it's housed within the Amante bar on Green, so be sure to tell your friends if they're meeting you there for the first time (mine have gotten lost). Fun place for people watching if you sit at the outdoor tables.

Waited inside a sleazy bar to get spicy garlic noodles and Korean mushroom noodles. Not sure if this was their usual standard or if there was a slip in the hand, but the bottomline is I got some of the saltiest noodles I have ever tasted in life. Totally disillusioned me.

Food was good but a little over priced for small portions. Poke should have been double the size for $12-13. Potstickers came out to be $1 each and they are small wonton size. Chicken was good but I don't know about for $9....so the drinks are from amante and the food is from chubby noodle so you will get 2 separate checks. I ordered the Moscow mile for $9 and I've never seen a Moscow like served in a small glass before (the small kind you get Hennessy and coke in) and it wasn't even good :/ let's just say we left still hungry...ate some pizza at golden boy walked around AND ate at HRD too! You can get a kim Chee fried rice at HRD for about the same price at chubby noodle but almost triple the size than at chubby noodle and it's only about 6 businesses down the block

Chubby Noodle started out as a pop-up at Amante, a bar in the North Beach district in SF. while i always wanted to try it, i put it off for a long time because i felt sort of weird about entering a dark divey bar to order chinese/asian food. sooner rather than later it quickly transitioned from pop-up to keeping a standing time slot at Amante and is now serving food daily from 5-11pm. i recently found the opportunity to eat at Chubby Noodle and am happy to report that while the menu sounds almost standard, it truly isn't. everything i tried was super flavorful and starchy things like the noodles or the wonton wrappings were made and cooked with just the right consistency. i can't wait to go back and either try new things or just repeat this same meal because i was so very satisfied by it. definitely get the garlic noodles and the fried rice with pork belly!

I'd say it's a good spot for cheap beers and some drunk food, but it was all a bit too greasy and heavy for me. It feels like a slightly fast food version of an Asian Fusion restaurant, with few vegetable or lighter options. Maybe my expectations were just off, but the menu diversity was not what I wanted from a 4-star rated Asian Fusion spot.

First the logistics, Chubby Noodles is located inside Amante Bar/Lounge. Yes this is tourist central so walk, bike, bus, Über, Lyft, Sidecar, cab (yuck) but don't try to drive & park around here. Valet across the street for $20 cash.
I recommend getting their spicy garlic noodle. The sauce is filled with garlic flavor and creaminess. It kind of reminds me of STRAITS' garlic noodle. It's really good!
Get the fried chicken strips or wings - you will not regret it!!!
Went back because my friends told me they updated how they ran things. The food is good, and they seemed to have fixed the service.
Salty and nothing amazing. Located inside the Amante bar. Cash only.

This was honesty my favorite place to eat. Awesome food, great service, and quick cash order line. I went so often (about one a week) that I even made friends with some of the drink waitresses. They knew my boyfriend by name (me by face, ha).

Okay, my regular foodie buddies are sorta banned from this place, but it's really a testament to the food here. They messed up an entire order, and I think it was by dumping half a shaker of salt in each of the dishes. The food was inedible :/

Once again I am disappointed with the ramen in San Francisco. I can't quite put my finger on it, but the pork ramen was really missing something. The pork had a funny taste to it and the noodles were way too thin. I don't know what it is, but every ramen place I've been to in this city has the most watery broth. I like my broth thick.
Time: 6:12pm/54°F partly cloudy
please bring back the korean pork tacos!!!!!!

If you're gonna eat here, you have to just embrace the Chubby and get over it.  Come here with a group and order one of everything you think you can all put down.  The highlight is the perfectly fried chicken, but I've never had a bad or even mediocre dish here, and I've tried a lot of them.
Craving: korean tacos.

One of my favorite gems in San Francisco. As the legend goes,  Chubby Noodle was a food truck that was stationed by Amantes, a local bar. These star crossed lover one day united, and Chubby Noodle moved their kitchen inside Amantes. The rest, is history.

Chubby Noodle was the last stop in my 2013 birthday food crawl for day 1.  It was one of those eateries on Green St. that I've been wanting to try for a long time so I figured my birthday would be a good time to try it.  So in case you didn't know, Chubby Noodle is an Asian street food pop-up that's inside Amante which is only open for dinner.  They specialize in many types of street food from Fried Chicken, to Garlic Noodles and Ramen, and Steamed Pork Buns.

Food and service is great here. I love the fried chicken and salt and pepper prawns. The chicken comes with a great sauce that's creamy with a slightly spicy and tangy flavor. The shrimp is cooked perfectly, nice, plump and juicy. I'm a regular here so the staff know me pretty well, Adrianna and Adam are friendly, attentive and knowledgable about the food on the menu. This place is great give it a try if you haven't yet.
For being in a bar this is pretty unique food to find!

Disappointed.  I should've read the reviews more closely instead of just seeing the 4 stars and heading on over.  Given you'd be so close to Chinatown and other better fusion places (e.g. The House), I would not suggest Chubby.

Despite rumor, this place is not named after me. No, it's named after the other noodle served here, the Asian kind. Let me be more specific...the edible Asian kind. Oh wait, I mean the edible Asian kind that's served in a bowl. Never mind. Anyway, Jamie W. and I came upon it while looking for some place to dine after lollygagging in Washington Square Park among the meandering derelicts. Were it not for my trusty Yelp app, I wouldn't have known this popular spot had been thriving in the back of Amante for over two years. You would barely notice it except for the low-lying sandwich board that doubles as seating for the obnoxiously drunk on Green Street of which there are plenty on any given weeknight.
An unexpected favorite. Chubby Noodle is a restaurant inside of a bar, but the food is nothing like bar food.
The Chubby Noodle (I love that name) occupies space at the back of the Amante bar. If you are getting takeout you need to push through the crowds to get to the back of Amante to rescue your food.

Love this place! Had never heard of it before but a friend recommended we go here after work. We got garlic noodles, won tons, and chicken strips. I love that the chicken strips were in no way asian and came in a tall popcorn bowl/cup.
Highlights:

The bartender on Sunday afternoons is not a very nice guy. It made the experience here a much less enjoyable one, I was afraid to go up to the bar and order something else...scared he'd yell at me or say something snarky.

We were there on Sun, 10/26/14, for the World Series.  First, the rudest bartenders ever.  You can check my reviews--I'm not a psycho venter.  I'm 44 and write real reviews.  At this bar, they obviously don't like patrons unless you're young, douchey and/or blonde. I honestly believe I was treated rudely b/c I don't fit into those categories.  No food, but you can bring food in.  Good beer options & prices.  If they could JUST get professional staff.  I guess they don't care b/c of the cheap beer prices.  Sigh.

I have never in my 32 years witnessed such unprofessional and ridiculous behavior on the part of a bartender. The bartenders name is Carly and she should be fired if Columbus Cafe wants to stay in business. After a relatively laid back evening at this establishment, my friends and I ordered a last round of drinks. Immediately upon paying for them, Carly instructed her bouncer to remove our drinks (meanwhile her friends still sat comfortably at the bar with their beers).They proceeded to yell at us to get the $&@# out and then Carly yelled some very offensive language at me insulting where I was from. She then proceeded to spray me in the face with her seltzer gun, unleashing a rambling of profanities. She then came out from behind the bar and threw a metal bottle opener at my friend. It was shockingly uncalled for and completely unacceptable. I am appalled.

So happy I stumbled upon this spot just in time for football season. First off they have Sunday ticket so you can watch all NFL games at once. They have a bunch of TVs and even play the sound for niners games. Bartender was super friendly and made a killer Bloody Mary for me, my girlfriend had a fresh squeezed greyhound. They also have tons of beers on tap with good variety. This is definitely going to be my new Sunday spot

Recently stopped in here during an all day bar hop. I had one Greyhound and I couldn't leave for a couple hours. I'm a sucker for fresh squeezed drinks , cool bartenders and awesome crowds. I'll definitly head here first next time I'm in the city.
This is a great place to stop in for a beer. They have one of the best and most diverse (sometimes) beer selections (25 taps) in the area (one of the better in the city).

The ambiance was great, but unfortunately the only bar staff (this bald guy with a fedora and glasses) was the biggest dick to me and my entire party. He was abrupt, condescending, and overall unpleasant. Not coming back because of that guy.
Awesome bar.

Don't roll into this place if you wanted to be treated like a princess or you have a #basic attitude. This place is a chill dive bar with a great beer selection and upgraded TV's (the best TV situation in north beach). The Happy Hour is unbeatable (2 for 1 draught beers 4-8pm They play the sound for big sports events, and allow you to bring in your own food. Limited seating, the bar does get crowded at times (especially on thursday/fridays after work).
I think I've been here just once.  It's super divey and kind of small.  Draft beers.  Pool in the back.  Since I'm a fan of dive bars I'll probably end up going again sometime!
The last two times I've been there, the male bartender (the one working during the day on Sunday, June 29) has been unbelievably rude. It's alarming that he still works there.

Considering how many great bars are in North Beach, i'm surprised this place is still in business. The drinks are mediocre, it smells like a barn and they consistently have the rudest bartenders I've ever met.

While waiting for a table at Sotto Mare next door, my boyfriend and I went to this bar to chill and have a beer. We were lucky to be there at happy hour, where it was buy a pint, get one free. Super cool!
A surprisingly chill weeknight spot, considering the two for one deal. Stopped in last night with friends before getting pizza at Golden Boy and heading to Cobb's for a show.

A great newly discovered North Beach watering hole. Amazing 2 for 1 happy hour, affable barkeeps, solid tap selection, good jukebox, pool table, plenty of TVs for the game, and an unassuming, down to earth crowd.
This is an outstanding performance here in the place. The bar is awesome and very decorated place too. The staffs are so cordial and fast in their work.
Columbus Cafe is just ok.

First time here with a group of newly arrived international students. The place was nice, but the female bartender kind of killed the mood when she started yelling at the customers for tips. "Hello people, I don't work for free!". Maybe customer service isn't quite the place for her...
@Columbus_CafeSF There are so many great bars around here...they really should export some to other cities that are sorely lacking great local bars.

Walked in and ordered a beer. Bartender was inconsiderate and didn't seem to want to be there but,but, he gave my me and my three friends free beer so I can't complain too much. Was very clean and the atmosphere was super fun. Was a good find and enjoyed my time.

Evan is a solid bartender.  Very knowledgeable and friendly.  I was able to watch a Packer game and enjoy the locals tales of the previous nights craziness and laugh along with them.  This place made me feel at home.
We had a great time in here with Angelita. Nice bar w good drinks and cold beer.  What else would you need to know?
Come here for happy hour $5 or 2 for one beers. Staff isn't as friendly as other places, but drinks are good and they have TV's to watch sports. A decent dive bar in North Beach.
1 star for the one of the RUDEST bartenders I have ever encountered.
I think this may be the best happy hour I've found in San Francisco so far.
This might be my favorite bar in North Beach to grab a casual drink.
Great place to hang out with friends!  Back seats are comfortable and you get drink chips (vegas type chips) for a free drink.  Bar tender is very chill!! Great dive bar!!
Nothing beats a buy one get one free happy hour! It gets really crowded, so getting there at the beginning of HH is a better way to go.  I always love a bar that has Racer 5 on tap!

If I was to rate this bar for the first hour and a half I was there, it would have been a definite 5 stars. Great beers 2 for 1. The first bartender we had was very personable and nice, sorry I don't remember her name but she was blond.

My first experience at this place sucks! Place looks dirty. Bathroom smells really bad. Their private room is horrible. Drinks are over priced! Snobby workers. The only person who was friendly was their security guard at the entrance door. Would I come back to this place, hell no.

Amazing happy hour! 2 pints of on tap beer for $5 and you can keep the token for your second pint and bring it back any time during happy hour (I think it might be good until even an hour after at 9pm!?). There's a pool table and everyone is nice. I would definitely recommend this place!
This place is great. Great happy hour spot. Love the 2 for 1 drinks. Other bars have similar deals in the area.
This is my local watering hole and I love it. The 2-for-1 happy hour on a solid selection of beers is just awesome!
I totally dig the vibe of this place...
Great happy hour spot, 2 for 1 drinks.

Hanging out in my friends SF apartment and I found out that we are both fans of this place. Really. I live in AZ, what are the chances that out of all the freaking bars in SF, we are both fans of this hole in the wall? Its like.. its meant to be!
My favorite place to watch the good ole' Giants play! The best team in baseball deserved to be watched at a great bar and no where in this city is better than Columbus Cafe!
Sometimes you travel around North Beach in disgust.

This is just a regular dive bar. Nothing too special about it. It does have a pool table that you can play for $1. You can also watch some sports while you hang out. The service was okay, and if you use your card, there is a $15 minimum. For some reason, they give you poker chips for every drink purchase. I have no clue why they do that, it's pretty gimmicky. And they also make sure you keep those souvenirs, like they will hunt you down and make sure you have your chips. Why???? Not a bad place to hang out while you wait for the other bars to open
I will never eat dried or jarred Italian food again. I had the homemade chicken tortellini with creamy sauce. It was to die for. The service was fantastic and the price was reasonable
I love this place!

This place is amazing. The happy hour is every day with great food and drinks for reasonable prices. The staff is always welcoming and friendly. The ambiance is charming and warm. Gio is always in a great mood and recommends the best cocktails. If you're into Italian or maybe just a lush- come here first!
Happy Hour is beyond belief. Fabulous martini's & great appetizers 50%. The bartender Gio, makes a very good, I mean a very good drink. We had a great time at this SF institution.
Excellent food and it is off the beaten path outside of the normal tourist restaurants.

Truly the best Lasagna I've ever had and a really great atmosphere. This is the oldest Italian restaurant in America. Cool to be here and read the history of the 3 fires. Really great service and food. Also really great rating and quality olive oil. This place is great!

I would like to formally thank Fior D'Italia and their staff for helping me and my wife Nicole to have a beautiful wedding reception!! Lucio was helpful from the first time I called to brainstorm about using this establishment for my wedding reception. As an Italian-American I had high standards for the food & service of a Ristorante Italiano, and Fior did not disappoint. They stuck by their word, they were accommodating to the different foods, table seating, additions to the menu, music, and much more. We were treated liked family from Lucio and his staff from the moment we met, and the service was always first class. If you are planning a wedding reception or are just looking for a fine place to dine, this is definitely a wonderful place. The experience we had for our wedding will not be forgotten, and the staff here will always be like family.
Great place for peaceful atmosphere and good Italian food, very friendly and quick service. Old style elegant, placed in a hotel easy to get to by walking from the fishermans wharf.

We arrived at Fior D'Italia about 6:30 pm on Saturday, September 28. No reservations. They were just finishing up a wedding reception, and weren't open for supper until 7:00. We were told it would be about 45 minutes and that they had to clear 7 and 730 reservations. Since we could smell the garlic, olive oil and wine, we decided it might be worth the wait.

I had great expectations of this restaurant since I had often dined at Fior D'Italia at the old location where Original Joe's is now. Plus, my parents held their engagement party at Fior D'Italia. From the moment I drove up and the moment I left, I was disappointed.
LOVED EVERYTHING!!  Great food, great service, great atmosphere.
First impressions are not everything.
Good food.

I really wanted to like this restaurant. Came in on a Saturday night just before 9pm. The restaurant was not full, however there was no one to receive guests at the host's desk. Waited for a couple of minutes until a waiter passed, said someone would be there shortly and then patted my shoulder. UGH.

We were staying at the San remo right next door, so thought we would have to give "Americas oldest italian restaurant" a try. We had high expectations due to this claim. The happy hour specials are totally worth it - really good apps and drinks, and for cheap - but the dinner fell short. My fiancé liked his tortellini, but my veal was really dry, and came with no pasta and one tiny little baby potato (should have come with like 6). They also only gave us like 3 tiny slices of thin bread. Needless to say, we were still hungry. The service was pretty good though.
Enjoyed a great dinner here. I had some of the best prawns i've ever tried.  Also had a great seafood pasta. Service is excellent too. Good value for money in this price range. I would recommend.
My bf and I were looking for a place to eat near by. We yelped a place near by and saw that Fior D'italia was open until 10 pm.
The service and the food was absolutely amazing!  We would love to live next door to this quaint little Italian place just to drop in every Sunday afternoon. You won't be disappointed.
So delicious and great atmosphere! The staff is very friendly and made us feel welcome the moment we walked in. The food is some of the best Italian my husband or I have had.

After nine years and the big fire, my husband and I were able to find the "new" Fior d'Italia.  We aren't always in SF on weekends, so this was something we had wanted to do for a long time.  WHAT A THRILL!  The new restaurant is so nice and still has the white table clothes, silver and crystal!  Surrounding the tables are wonderful photos of the history of SF's oldest Italian restaurant (since 1868!).  We started with cocktails which were generous and well-mixed.  Then, delicious salad....and our main courses.  I had the fabulous OSSO BUCCO, which no one is SF makes more delicious....and my husband had fish of the day, which he enjoyed.  The bread was homemade and served warm, and the waiter was so attentive and took great care that we had everything ALL the time (including water).  For dessert, we were hoping for zabione, and it was on the menu....and OMG perfect!  Both my husband and I highly recommend Fior d'Italia.....if you want authentic Italian, gracious service, delicious food & drink, and atmosphere......  Can't wait to spread the word!!!!

We walked in today in and had a lovely meal. Service was excellent, risottos were all very good but seafood risotto was excellent and the pasta bolognese. The raspberry sorbet and ricotta cheesecake were great.

Planned a corporate event here for about 30 people.  Not easy to please that many people, but, Fior d' italia pulled it off.  They were great working with us ahead of time on the specifics for our group, they were flexible with all of the last minute changes.  The service was great for our dinner and they even checked in with me to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves.  I personally had the Salmon as did a number of people in our group and it was delicious, perfectly cooked.  I don't eat dessert normally and the server was nice enough to bring me a bowl of fresh berries ......look forward to coming again in the future.  Also nice jazz band playing that evening

I ordered the seafood pasta. The seafood and pasta were over cooked, and the sauce was bland and runny/watery. There was a bad mussel in there, which we pointed out to the waiter, and he didn't care and made me feel like I was an annoying customer. We never got our water filled and only saw our waiter when the check came. I would not recommend coming to this place.

Over priced, both undercooked (the lamb) and overcooked (the potatoes) food. Waiter was nice and professional, but a bit harried (it was Saturday evening and the place was packed). The dish was not seasoned at all and tasted bland and boring. I recommend to give this place a miss and leave it to the tourists who do not know better.

So I would normally give this place a super solid 5 review BUT last night's experience changed that. The food is normally soooooo amazingly good, too. There were six of us in our party. We were seated in a booth with two additional chairs which was somewhat uncomfortable but we were fine with that. Our waiter seemed very busy and finally after almost 20 minutes came over to take our drink order. We ordered martinis and wine. He brought back the martinis but the martinis were the wrong ones he totally forgot the wine for almost another 10 minutes. By now we are at the 25 minute mark the restaurant was very busy. Finally the wine came and he placed our food orders most of us had pasta I had the halibut. Everyone's food came except my halibut and he apologized saying it would be out shortly so another five minutes passes while my friends are going ahead and eating I'm sitting with just my glass of wine. Then the maître d' came out and also apologize saying the food was on the way he apologized and said there was nothing more he could do please except my apologies which was very nice. Then my halibut came and I was relieved because we had a dinner theater show afterward so now I could start eating my friends were already at least halfway through their meal. The first bite of the halibut was okay but I noticed it was a little tough. The second bite I couldn't even pull the halibut away from the rest of the piece because it was 100% completely raw inside. I had to send the raw fish back it looked like it had been poached in hot boiling water for no more than maybe two minutes it definitely had not even been inside of a sauté pan. When I asked another waiter if he could help us and explain my fish was raw he immediately looked at us and yelled at our table "Who's your waiter?" And walked away. I understand when restaurants get busy and things go wrong in the bar or the kitchen it happens we understand but the rudeness of the waitstaff and the fact the food wasn't even properly prepared was not cool. it finally came back out another 10 minutes later. By now my friends had completely finished their meal and I am just starting mine. we're now late for a dinner theater by almost half an hour so the entire experience from my side was somewhat ruined and I know my friends felt bad as well. Mostly because I recommended the restaurant. I'm not sure I would go back after being treated this way. San Francisco has so many restaurants with grateful wait staff and properly cooked food. I will say the Pasta Fagioli soup is to die for, comes in a very large portion crock, large enough for a meal actually. Next time I'll just have that, IF there is a next time. What a shame.....

This was a walk by decision.  Nothing to complain about.  Our server and the staff were all very nice, professional and attentive.  My wife and I both had pasta dishes and both were tasty, good size portions and well prepared.

Nailed a classic that is often looked over with the fettuccine. The pasta itself felt house made. Just sat at the bar and was happy to stumble into. Bartenders were accommodating and attentive to all at the bar. Crowd was definitely an older crowd as I believe this place is viewed as a classic. Id still bring a date ;)
After looking at reviews I thought this place would be a great place to celebrate my wife's 35th bday. However we are not pleased with this place.

My wife and I had our first date at the Hotel San Remo 31 years ago. We drove by to show our now adult kids "where it all began". We pulled up and saw that Fior D'Italia had relocated where the old restaurant had been. I had enjoyed Fior years ago at it's original location near St Peter and Paul church. So we had an early dinner with other tourists in shorts and sweatshirts. I was surprised there were about six or eight groups eating at 5:30 pm.

Go to Trattoria Contadina or North Beach Restaurant instead. We had an awful meal at Flor D'Italia. The gnocchi was soft, the sauce was bland and all meat dishes were overcooked and over sauced. Very unimpressive meal.
Excellent food, excellent service. True authentic Italian food. The best bread!!!
Dinner nice. Lasagne was piping hot and good.

Recently had dinner at the Fior D'Italia after a 50-year hiatus. Much has changed, of course, including the ownership. The food was very good, the service better. San Francisco has several Italian restaurants; a few are better and more expensive than the Fior D'Italia. Most are derivative. The five people in our party each had different entrees, and all enjoyed their meals. My rustic grandniece had rabbit and pronounced it excellent. Rabbit, for cry in' out loud! Poor wee critter.
Decided to give this restaurant a try after reading reviews here. My impressions upon leaving the restaurant are the following: the food is just

Upon the recommendation of my grandparents, my husband and I had dinner here during our first visit to SFO. Given that my grandparents had held onto the business card from their visit 15+ years ago, I had high hopes. And they were met. The food was excellent, particularly the chicken tortellini my husband had. We also really liked the still steaming bread that was served while we waited for the entree.
Had a great time.  Service was friendly and attentive. Would go back.

The service was exceptional and food was good.  I guess this place is suppose to be one of the first italian restaurants and it is interesting to read all the articles and look at the old photo's.  It was easy to make a reservation and they were very accommodating even though we were dressed down compared to most of the crowd.  I ate the seafood risotto which had so many clams, pieces of calamari, and scallops that it was hard to find the rice, I couldn't finish it there was so much food.  In retrospect I would have ordered the fresh made cheese ravioli which someone ordered next to us which was a more reasonable portion.  Wine list was pretty good, including by the glass and bottle options.  They let us order a bottle and take it with us, which it was unsure if that was allowed or not.  Overall, I would return if back in San Francisco and suggest others to go if you are looking for a very good italian restaurant with great value.

What a gem to find amongst all the alternatives. Such a wonderful atmosphere with great food. We travelled with 3 couples and traded off selecting where to eat. We had already dined at 4 fantastic restraunts and the pressure was on me to select something to top them all. Well this place did not disappoint!!!  And I found it on YELP so thanks to you all for your reviews.

Everything was great. We sat in the bar for 45 min before our ressie and had 2 great appetizers (ravioli with veal ragu and tomato bruschetta). Then when we sat down, we had cioppino and filet with a red wine reduction sauce and tiramisu. Everything we ate was fabulous, the service was impeccable (Octavio was one in a million!) and we have zero complaints, only raves. Highly highly recommend!

Unbelievably impressive - both with their food and their service.  This is a MUST go to restaurant when in San Francisco.  Oldest one still in existence.  You will not be disappointed!!!  Fresh homemade pasta, entrees and desserts.  Can't wait to return.

Tony's came highly recommended to me. I went there with great expectations and I can see why people really love the place. I just liked it. The crust was my greatest problem. It was soft and bready thin crust.  The crust reminded me of Naan bread, not pizza crust. The Ribiola pizza was very good with the exception of the crust. We also had a Marguerita pizza which was quite tasty but the sauce was thin and runny. We got each a glass of chianti and barbera which had zero complexity yet for $8/$9 a glass I would have liked SOME complexity. They also were served warm which did not help. Had the prices been 30% less I might have opted for 4 stars but the price performance ratio is not here.

So, the pizza's not really a 1-star, it's a 5.  I sing Tony's praises all the time and I'm sure I'll continue to.  I just had a strange experience though so i wanted to get their attention to get it fixed.  I've ordered to-go pizza from here religiously for the past 8 months (I had a baby 8 months ago) and I just went to get the Sausage and Stout, but was told that they never do this to go.  Not true, I did it last month.  I challenged this a little but didn't want to be a jerk.  Apparently the story is now that this has only ever been for dining in.

Next door to the main Tony's Pizzaeria, this slice house is meant for take out orders, whether it be slices, ordering a whole pizza. It's also a great place to avoid waiting over an hour for a seat at the main restaurant.

Saw Tonys pizza on TV & decided to stop here while we were in town. The restaurant had a wait of 1hr45min & we were starving so we went next door & ordered the margherita pizza...yummm! It was one of the best! Will definitely be back when we are craving pizza!
Great pizza, great neighborhood vibe!
I thought this would be a Pizza that blows me away but unfortunately it just kept me right in reality.
Awesome Stuff!  Must try pizza!  Best I've ever had in bay area!  Not that I've eatten a lot in my life, but this was is memorable!  I'm glad there is one in the bay area!  :)
The guy that works the cashier is very rude, he threw the menu at us when we asked if they had a menu. I don't blame him though it's not easy working a job like that

Best pizza in town. Bar none. The cheese the sauce. No frills just darn great pizza. Yelp wants me to write more. Well here goes. The closest pizza to a down home right NYC pizza or the tri state area. This pizza is by far ahead off all the pizza joints in sf. You don't believe it? Try it and judge.
Though there are several excellent options for pizza in this area alone, Tony's is by far one of the best.

We came to Tony's on a saturday afternoon, stupidly hoping we might be able to get a seat without too long of a wait. Clearly, the hour+ wait meant that was not going to happen. So instead we went next door to Tony's slice to go shop. The line was much faster there, and it only took us about 10 minutes to get to the counter.

My friends and I shared a whole pizza and ordered the margharita and one with just cheese and fresh cut up tomatoes (no sauce).  Both pizzas were nicely done and was the perfect quick stop for lunch to eat on the run.  Will definitely stop in the next time I'm in that part of town.
The best slice of margharita (spelling?) pizZa I've ever had. So nice to get it to go and eat it in the park. Kept hearing Tonys is the best pizza in town and I'm not disappointed.

The pizza is seriously fantastic and the workers are all great too. They also have a good variety of choices for a good price. The best part is all of the available seating outside. Even if it's crowded inside, the line moves along pretty quickly. I love the California Style Pizza!
Avoid the wait and grab a slice. I like that it's a random slice of whatever they decided to make. I had the mozzarella and basil Margarita pizza. It was delicious.
When you drive around North Beach swerving

While I have obviously not been to every pizza place in the country, from what I have been too (a whole lot) Tonys is definitely the best. Multiple oven options (the 1100 degree coal fired is still my favorite) great meats and pairings and a knowledgeable friendly staff really round it out. On the restaurant side you can also enjoy great pastas, sides and salads and Peroni on draft! This is my version of Heaven. I never visit the Bay Area without visiting Tonys. Mostly I go to the smaller pizza shop, but sometimes we go to the sit down side. Both are excellent and not to be missed. If you are looking for the coal fired, make sure to not got between 3-4 pm where they clean it and it is not available.

Avoid the wait at the (spectacularly delicious) full-service restaurant next door and get a slice of pizza here! They have a good selection of slices, but I definitely recommend the Picante. We were able to order a kids spaghetti for my daughter and a salad for me off the main restaurant's regular menu. That part took about 30 minutes, but it was worth the wait. This is the best pizza in SF!

Four stars for the Gluten Free, (those are hard to do well), three and a half stars for the restaurant's service, two and a half stars for the "regular" pizza. Overall not worth it,  if you want decent GF pizza, order some for takeout. If you are hungry now, go next door to their slice counter, or up the block to get a slice or two. If you want to pay for the experience of sitting in a loud tourist spot that "everybody" has to try then open your wallet.

To be fair, I lived in italy for a decade so rarely am I impressed by pizza in the states (especially for the crazy prices people charge for basically some flour, cheese and tomato sauce)...so this review is for Tony's overalll...been here about 10 times, but went last n7ght and now feel I should Yelp it...

Went to Tony ' s sit down restaurant last night. A 2 hr wait made us step out and head to the Tony 's next door which serves pizza by the slice. Same stuff, shorter lines. We got cheese, margherita, pirate and pepperoni. Each one was good. Thin crispy on the edge crust, excellent sauce (tart like tomatoes taste) and with perfectly crisped pepperoni. Almost like bacon. Loved it. Would go next time and sit in the park and eat :)

When time is limited, I always try to make a pit stop here. Besides the plain cheese, there are several interesting combinations. Love the chorizo when available. Good dough. People watching is a plus. I like listening to the silly tourist comments about the style of pizza. If it looks good and there's a line, just shut up and enjoy the pie

YUP 3 stars. This has pheonominal pizza, but it seems like they have gotten used to catering to locals...  for those who don't know there is no middle class in SF and the median income in above 70000 annually. You are either rich or you are poor.  This place is one of those many places that have gotten used to serving rich out of towners.. you know tourists.. and rich locals.. much like Mama's across the street, or Tacolicious a few steps down.

The sister operation next door is a sit-down restaurant with a big reputation and a mile-long wait on weekends. No waiting on Tuesdays though, because they're not open. If you want a New York style slice on that particular day of the week, you have to go to the slice house.
Okay, where does this review go?  Tony's Pizza Napoletana, or the Slice House, where I actually went?  I'll just write two reviews!

A lifesaver if you want pizza and don't feel like waiting 2 hours next door for a table. I've eaten at the sit-down Tony's several times but sometimes you want pizza and you want it NOW. For $5, you get a nice piece of pie (my choice is cheese) warmed up in the oven to go. Cross the street, plop yourself down on a bench in Washington Square Park, fold it up and shove into mouth. That's amore!

I really really like this pizza spot. It's delicious and a little fancy -- for $4+ a slice, it had better be, right? I think I've only had a plain or chicken pizza there but never have I ordered a full pie -- something I'm looking forward to doing soon! I want to expose more people to this deliciousness! Thin crust for the win!

Love it when I find a NY pizza that tastes right on the left coast. They save me so much money on airfare I feel like I should leave a huge tip. Just kiddin. Tony's Coal oven pumps out top quality pies that would stay in business even if it was located in mid town manhattan.

The pizza is thin crust but too chrispy that I couldnt enjoy the flavor too much due to too much chewing. I paid almost $5 for one slice that was ok. Wouldnt come again. Not many veggie options either.

Avoid the 2 hour wait (at 10 pm on a Sunday) at Tony's next door, and order your food at the Slice House.  You can order just about anything from Tony's regular menu, minus a few of the appetizers.  This includes the AMAZING meatballs ($5 for 3) from Tony's menu.

It's not cheap but their pizza is the most delicious I have had on the west coast.  (Lived in New Jersey for 7 years).  Their Sicilian pizza is what is worth the hassle of getting there/parking.  Their regular slices were good too.
Get that damn margarita pizza and don't look back! A few others were good but damn that margarita!!! I see myself going back a little too offen, fml! Def best margarita I had in the 18 years in sf!

The margherita pizza is wonderful. The tomato sauce is delicious, the crust is thin and crispy, and the slice is never greasy. They've also got some tables outdoors to enjoy a nice day, or you can take your food to Washington Square Park.

A great pizzeria serving high quality pizza with a fair price. Their pizza comes with generous topping, the pizza base is very delicious, crunchy, perfect thickness for a thin crust pizza. The California (vegetarian) was ok for me, the mushrooms were a bit over powering, but the pepperoni, cheese, combination, calzone were all very good. Combination is my personal favorite!
Time: 4:17pm/71° mostly sunny

Tony's Napoletana is great! But if you're in a rush or just want to enjoy some great SF weather, grab a slice or two from the Slice House and savor them while you people watch at Washington Square Park.
Lunch with coworkers at least once a week. This traditional beef sandwich is soaked and lots of favor. If you cannot handle a big sandwich like this, then this is not the place for you.
This place is amazing! My favorite pizza place, slices are huge! It can get busy tho but worth it!

I had actually planned to eat at the Tony's Neopolitana, but after getting there I discovered that they were closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Disappointed, I was about to turn back when I noticed this place.

completely overrated. I went with a friend who thought it was better than golden boy but then we sat on the bench next to somebody who bought golden boy and ate tony's pizza slice side by side and proclaimed golden boy the winner.

name: Tony’s Coal-Fired Pizza And Slice House

reviews.text: It's surprisingly great! I passed this place many times and decided to try it today. I ordered chicken plate as recommended by the staff here. It took a while and I was getting a bit impatient. But when they brought the food. It was totally worth the wait! Great taste - I am pleasantly surprised!

What a great find! In The City with my Husband at Dinner time is never a good thing as we've had so many bad food experiences together, we really didn't have much hope in finding somewhere so were pleasantly surprised when we found North Beach Gyros. Thank you Yelp!

Delicious food and reasonably priced. The interior is attractive and bright, with both tables and booths. Unfortunately, there are very few outlets for computer work (but they offer free wifi), so the lovely woman working there kept my mug of hot tea full as I sat at the table by the door. She was incredibly kind, and I appreciated the gesture immensely.
