Let me warn the reader. The baklava is dangerously addicting. As good as my grandma's. And, of course, the Middle Eastern food here is top-notch. I eat here all the time. Service is excellent and friendly. Ask for co-owner Apo. He loves his restaurant & the food of his land; he is passionate about his venture. Don't think twice; you will be VERY satisfied. Again, WARNING, the baklava here competes with the pleasure of sex.
I'm so glad I found this place. I live in North Beach and this is one of very few places in the neighborhood that has delicious and very affordable food. Plus, the portions are quite large.

Great little place with amazing, fresh food and a wonderful staff. The hummus is well flavored--you can really taste the chickpeas (instead of a surfeit of garlic like I've had at other places); the pita is warm, fluffy and tastes homemade. The wraps are delicious as well--the bright notes of parsley and other veggies balancing out the richness of the meat. They don't yet have a beer/wine license but you can BYOB and sit outside. Highly recommended!
I'm addicted to this place. Its healthy, fast, delicious and consistent with a charming and attentive staff.  I ordered delivery recently for the first time and it was lightening fast and perfect.
Come and taste yourself. Great staff!! I'll be back next week. Mixed grill and lamb kebab.
Fight to the finish.

After getting food to go from this place I feel obligated to let the world know. This is the worst meal I've had in San Francisco. And I'm convinced these positive reviews are plants and fake. If not, I am seriously questioning the taste of everyone who gave this spot 4 stars as they have obviously never had decent Greek food. (I miss you chicago) We got the hummus, order of spanikopita, chicken gyros plate and beef/lamb gyros plate. I opened up the spanikopita and they looked burned. Like they were black and extremely charred. Took one bite and it tasted like ash. No joke. I looked over and my gf was digging through her chicken gyros plate looking for an edible piece with a distressed look on her face. I popped open my lamb gyros plate and was shocked to find the majority of the piece had huge veins/fatty tissue. There was barely any edible meat. It was all fat. The rice on each plate was literal mush. And to top it off this place somehow found a way to screw up hummus. What we got was bland and almost play dough like in texture. Pita bread was ok though. We gave everything one bite and boxed it back up. Some might say we caught them on an "off night"... Fuck that. The food their employees knowingly gave us looked terrible and tasted even worse! Inexcusable! I've never had a bad meal in this city until trying this dump. I'm still looking for a good gyros spot in the city aside from oasis but for now oasis is still the tried and true king. Avoid this place at all costs
Authentic. Legit. Eat here.
This place reminded me of the halal guys in New York, but in SF! I loved it...

I had been eyeing North Beach Gyros since they took over the retail space at the corner of Powell and Union. I live right up the street, so I was hopeful to finally have a Falafel spot so close to home.

Food was decent, but do not order delivery from this place. We called, placed the order, and were told it would arrive in 20 mins. We were also told that we could pay the delivery guy with a credit card. Almost an hour later, no food. Called to check status and were told the guy was on his way. When food still hadn't arrived after 20 more mins, we called again and were told our order had never been placed. Ordered again, verified again that we didn't need to pay over the phone in advance. We ordered 2 salads and some hummus. Once it finally arrived, we discovered they didn't take cards and the guy said they would just call us later. A few hours later, they called couldn't figure out how to take a card over the phone, then tried to charge extra for items we didn't order. They finally figured it out and then hung up on me. Not worth the time/frustration.
Really good food. Gyro and babaghannouj very tasty. Nice to have this place in north beach. Friendly staff.

Super flavorful, fresh yummy food and a friendly staff that make you feel like you are being welcomed into their home.  We are gradually working our way through the menu and find that we have a new favorite every time we order.  So glad these folks are in our neighborhood.  :-) Yippee North Beach Gyros!!!!!

You can't get bad food here. Salmon, chicken, lamb, beef, kabob, wrap. This is a neighborhood GEM . Introduced this place to a good friend last night and she swears it's the best dinner she's had in a long time ! Try it, try it, try it.

Came here after a day of hiking in Angel Island.  Thankfully the place was pretty empty, as we were starving.  I got a vegetarian wrap and my husband got the falafel and we got a baba ghanoush to share.  Prices were very affordable.  Wraps were HUGE-I ate half of it and was absolutely stuffed.  Baba ghanoush came with fluffy pita bread.  My friend got the gyro wrap and dolmas.  Dolmas were very good and came with a side of tzatziki sauce.  In a prime location near Washington Square Park.  It was such a nice day that we took it to go and had a picnic at the park.  Really good fast Arabic food.

Tried out North Beach Gyros when I was in the area.  Got there Sat around 11am and had the place to myself for the longest time.  Order with the cashier and get a number, good then brought to you, you can sit anywhere it's very casual.
NORTH BEACH GYROS CORNERS THE HUMUS MARKET

Really very, very good Turkish/Arabic food in a slightly improbable location.  Dropped in for lunch, found delicious and tender kebabs, nice, fresh hummus, fresh hot pita straight from the oven, fluffy rice as a side dish, tasty salad with a balanced dressing that had good balance of the oil and acid---and friendly and casual service.
This place is legit! Everything I have tried here has been fresh and delicious and I eat here at least 1x week.

I have developed a serious Mediterranean food addiction.  I love the gyros or donners (depending on the Turkish or Greek influence).  I also am a fan of the salads and the rice.  Their yogurt dipping sauce is great as is the hummus.  The lamb is very tasty too.  A great place to go for a weeknight meal when you don't feel like cooking.  Prices are reasonable too. A well deserved 5 stars.

Really enjoyed our meal, great tasting cuisine.  The baklava is outstanding, it was recommended by others in the restaurant and so glad we tried it.  The Shish Kabab, Baba Ganoush, and Falaival were also great.  Very authentic, understand the owner is a Turk.  We'll be back.
Rating: 3.5 Stars
On the hunt for gyros, my friend found this North Beach corner store that used to house Iluna Basque.  Had the beef and lamb combo plate (
Wow.  So glad we stopped in before heading home up the hill.
This is second time here the food is always good love you guys by the way love the falafel best falafel !

Hm... When it first opened, I was ready to heap praises on this place. The first few grilled salmon and swordfish wraps I are were fresh and delicious. Alas, over the past few weeks, something has changed. The salmon is definitely not as fresh, and it is REALLY pink... Almost an unnatural color. I wonder if they switched to canned fish? I have no proof, and the people who run the place seem very nice, so I don't want to make empty accusations, but that is my suspicion.

As per usual, I ordered the food via Grubhub. I've been working on two papers and preparing for finals, so I'm not getting out much!! I ordered the spanakopita, the appetizer combo, the Mediterranean veggie wrap, and the lentil kofte. The food was okay. I'm really not that excited about it; I've had better and I've definitely had worse. For one, the spanakopita had a strong egg taste, which I did not like because I hate eggs. I have never had a spanakopita that tasted like that.

I got the lamb and beef gyro plate. It was pretty greasy and fatty and didn't taste that good. I would say this in the bottom 10% of all gyros I've ever had including street gyros from some questionable looking sources.
Awesome food!!! A hidden Mediterranean gem in North Beach- Kofte kabob is like homemade.  Turkish owner is so friendly.
I had the gyros platter and it was phenomenal. Great serving size and well worth the 13 bucks!

I'm very excited that North Beach Gyros is now open in North Beach! I walked over there today for lunch and the food is excellent. It is not too expensive and the views are great. I will definitely be a regular here.

We had a lamb beef gyro and a veggie gyro. Both were ok wraps. Dripping all over our hands and meat was really low quality. It had a after taste. I have had gyros before they are not as blend. If you like meat then go elsewhere. Try chicken gyro if you want to experiment.
Went to north beach gyros had a debate with my girlfriend over the pronunciation of gyros,she won,I paid:(

Beautiful restaurant, nice paint on walls by hand, open view, great service and food was very tasty, I ordered swordfish kebab plate and appetizer combo plate with pitta bread ( nice & warm). I recommend this place :)

I got some takeout here and was quite pleased! I ordered the salmon kebabs, which didn't actually come in kebab form but was excellently cooked with just enough buttery flavor -- not so much that I felt gross afterward. I had the salad on the side which was fresh and crisp. While I was waiting at the restaurant, the owner (?) was extremely kind, noticed I was cold, and offered hot coffee. he also included an order of their rice pudding, which I normally don't like, but was an excellent, lightly sweet way to finish off this meal.

Babaganush, Cacik, and Sautéed Eggplant were soooo delicious! Beef shish kebab plate was another great choice. Our friends got Mediterranean mixed grill plate, their plate was empty by the end, so I assume it was great.

Two percolating fountains house the fresh filtered water that sits next to a table of dozens of clean plastic reusable cups, which is somewhat odd to have in the front of this small restaurant space. The velocity at which the water is delivered into your cup is magnificent. The water pressure and temperature are equally refreshing and you are quickly back to your seat. The yogurt sauce is quality, falafels are too fried/hard, hummus is very good (but also very garlicky). Nice addition to the neighborhood. Food is good, not great... But adds a much needed alternative option to a pizza/pasta/bar food heavy neighborhood. The water situation at this restaurant is almost worthy of an additional star, it is absolutely glorious.
My favorite Café in San Francisco!
Great croissants / breakfast sandwich.  OJ is the best I have had in SF.  Service can be iffy, this isn't a place to be in a hurry.  Wife loves the breakfast sausage and said the coffee is decent.
Make it red.

I am always wary of Italian restaurants in North Beach. And since coming back from a trip to Venice and Rome recently, I was even more skeptical. My son and I came in here tonight because there were no barkers on the sidewalk and Yelp gave it four stars. This was pretty much the worst Italian food we have ever eaten. The minestrone soup was tasteless and beyond mushy. The salad had slightly wilted greens and sad yellowed tomatoes- and there are still bright red juicy tomatoes at the local farmers markets right now. We ordered a plate of cooked vegetables that were bland and had been perhaps frozen? The meat lasagne was soggy and had a slightly burned and almost tomato-less sauce. My son loves lasagne and has enjoyed lasagne everywhere- In Italy, at diners, frozen dinner lasagne and public school lunch lasagne. He could not eat this. My linguine with garlic, olive oil and red pepper was the only decent dish served, but the Parmesan cheese I had to ask for was a joke.
Enjoyed my delicious clam chowder soup & prosciutto sandwich with homemade bread. Also hot chocolate that was so yummy  also homemade. Will come back!!

My experience here yesterday was the worst in 25 years of going here. Rude service people served me a half espresso in a small cup, when I asked for lemon I got a wedge on old lemon. They told me they make cannolis with mozzarella and riccotta, I guess this is a tourist/central american cafe now?
I've eaten here for years and it's always been good, but today I don't know what's happened? Did they sell the place or what , because the service was not just terrible but almost non existent.
The service was really nice. We had the tortellini with Gorgonzola sauce and the antipasti salad for lunch. Perfect portions and absolutely delicious!
my favorite coffee in SF!  I've been coming here for years and I am never disappointed   grab a latte, sit outside, and enjoy a little north beach :)

Recent trip to SF with my Pops called for a Puccini visit-reprise! After hoofing it from the parking garage, my dad needed to use the restroom, I began to put down my things at the outside cafe table (it's a seat yourself place), my dad headed for the restroom. The lady snidely remarked how "the bathroom is  for customers only." I told her we were regulars and we're planning on having lunch. She smirked, almost chuckled and threw her hands up and said "I'm just letting you know you can't use the bathroom unless you order something." She was not even the owner, just a waitress. As if there isn't any competition in North Beach?! Plenty of other great places to eat! What a wench!

As a taxi driver in SF, I rely on Yelp to help me find good restaurants that are open late. I found this place on yelp that said they were open till midnight.  The reviews looked good so I found a parking spot, pulled over, and logged out of work. I was all excited to get some good food and I walked in the door at 11:05pm.  Or at least I tried to walk in.  There was a chair in the way that said they were closed.  I stood there and when I looked up at the staff, the guys kept just shaking their heads at me at the door. I said something about them being listed as open till midnight and they wouldn't even respond to me with words, they just kept shaking their heads "no".

Had breakfast here with my baby. Customer service was good. Food was good and food arrive fast. Quality was their for the price asking for. Good hot chocolate and coffee size. Overall had a good food and would come back here.
Great cannoli, made-to-order even though it was 10 pm in the evening! Cappuccino was good, as well. Highly recommended

As a North Beach local, Cafe Puccini has an awesome location on Columbus for ambiance, but its a sub par tourist food option in the neighborhood. Half the SFPD hangs out here on, so there must be something to love. But the few times I've been here, besides the Italian posters, you'd think you were eating at Denny's.

Been coming Cafe Puccini's for many years now and have always enjoyed their pasta, cappuccino's and desserts like the fruit torta's, tiramisu and biscotti and have always thought this place as a 3 1/2 - 4 star place, not anymore...

Walking up Columbus looking for an Italian dinner without a wait. Puccini had a table so in we went. Service was quick and friendly. We had the seafood linguine and the veal parmigiana, small salads to start. Food was very good and we had no room for dessert.
Been coming here since I was a kid and my family since it was open, great spot to grab a cappuccino and kick back too eat italin desert. Morning , noon or night
Been coming here since 1982 & I still love it.
Best place in North Beach. Authentic Italian food with a simple touch.  Amazing cafe as well.

my wife and I ate here a few months ago with some friends for the first time.  THE FOOD WAS FANTASTIC 5 STARS pizza, dessert's, pasta, chicken parm and etc.  I don't know what happened in the last few months but our meal was terrible.  the chicken parm tasted burnt, chewy and previously frozen.  our Caesar salad had a bunch of lettuce ends, tomato and artichokes.  the salad was not even tossed.  I don't know what happened but bring back the chef from that night and servers.  unsure  if we will return

There are so many different cafés in North Beach that it can be overwhelming to pick one worth your dollar. Well this little gem is definitely worth it! I ordered a classic chicken parmigiana but I actually only expected a mediocre meal. Turns out the food was DELICIOUS, even on a Monday night! It came with a fresh salad, penne pasta that was cooked just right, chicken was perfection, and the sauces were yummy. The ravioli was also excellent! Good portions. Service is okay; it could be better. I will come again!

Cafe Puccini is not a bad place to stop by for a plate of pasta or a couple drinks, beer is very reasonable and the wine is decent. Had a couple of pasta dishes that were good but not great. Not bad and the price is fairly cheap for north beach (entrees are mostly under $15, drinks are 4.50 to 6).

I came here with a friend and the service and ambiance is amazing! Came here around 10pm and wow they're Fettuccine Alfredo is the best I've tried anywhere. I got to share it with my friend. Their chai latte is amazing as well! I will  definitely be coming back here.
I got booted out based on a 60-min policy after buying food and drink. There are 10 open tables. This is especially lame for a self-proclaimed European-style cafe.

I am Italian and love this place! you might think that there are a lot of good Italian places in North beach, but that is not the case! However I would recommend caffe Puccini. I have tried their bfast, lunch and dinner, and they are all good. The coffee is really good, and strong-the Italian way, and the pasta is good and comes in big portions! plus, it's cheaper than all the other places around.. :) recommended!
So,

Rating on the vanilla chat only.  I really enjoyed it. Very tasty and light. The spiced chai was nice as well but the flavor of the vanilla was more to my liking and desirable.  The place is quiet and very relaxing if you are dining inside. People watching here is fun since it is on a busy street

I'm sitting in caffe as I write this. The food and service is excellent! Ordered cannoli, mocha, cappuccino, pasta, ravioli. Walter was our server and just 110% great! I would definitely come back! Thank you Caffe Puccini!
I feel like the reviews are fakes or I was or the twilight zone. I had a macchiato, and while the first sip tasted good, and the foam
If there were a negative star, I would give it to this place.
No better place to enjoy North beach on a hot night!!!  Also some of the best pizza in town!!!!
the restaurant is just okay. But, it was the only cafe opening when I arrived in that area. Great location and average price. The brunch is good and the server is fine...
Had a great egg, ham, and cheese on focaccia bread. Very delicious and hardly anyone here! New fav cafe!
Cute restaurant in little Italy. The food was great. We ordered the pappardelle, linguine fruti de mare, and pizza. Prices are good. Would come again.
Loved this place , Small and cute , salmon was delicious !!! And expresso is fabulous
Fettuccini Alfredo with pesto was delicious.  Great service.  Reasonable prices. Will definitely be back.

Planned to eat at Molinari's, but they're closed on Sunday.   Walked up and down Columbus reading menus and trying to choose a place for lunch.  Decided on Caffe Puccini, because they had a variety of sandwiches, as well as pasta.  Sandwiches were delicious with good meat.  When Graziano Lucchhesi, the owner, came to take our empty plates, we started chatting.  He works every day, makes everything from scratch, and takes pride in what he serves to his customers.  We're Italian too, so we talked about the way our parents and grandparents used to prepare food and how it's becoming a thing of the past.  This was our first visit, but he said he has regulars that come every day.  When we were there, an older woman was writing music, while she drank her coffee.  Bet there's a story there.  When she was finished, the waitress helped her into a cab.  That's something you don't see in the suburbs.  We will definitely be back.
I had spaghetti carbonara. Others had veal parmesan.

The lasagne was amazing; so fresh and not tomato-y. Just perfect!  We also had the chicken fettuccini and a chicken parm sandwich. Never heard of lettuce & tomato on a chicken parm, but that's ok; pulled it off and yum!  Moist and delicious.  And this place has the best Tiramisu ever. Nice guys, small place, good people watching, great value.

Overpriced, matron will blame you and her staff for mismanaged orders while offering no pathway to rectifying the situation. Miscommunications happen, but that is not the way to handle them. Will never stop here  again.

We were visiting from the East coast and Yelp brought us here. We showed up as soon as they opened at 5pm. We were fortunate because their Happy Hour specials were absolutely amazing. Usually happy hour menus are the offerings are the rolls you wouldn't really want to order, but do because they are so cheap with too much filler and not enough fish. That was NOT the case!  The selections on the whole menu were delicious and incredibly fresh!

I live in North Beach and am a bit of a regular at Katsu.  I am consistently pleased with the quality of the food, across the board.  Everything is expertly prepared with generous ratios of "fish to filler" (unlike many places that attempt to bring food costs down, such as Sushi Hunter just down the road).  The interior is not particularly fancy but is appropriate and quiet enough for good conversations.
Best sushi I've ever had. The temperature, texture, flavor, presentation, and service was amazing. Hiro, our server, was incredible!!

Coming here is like coming home and putting on your favorite robe.  The whole neighborhood goes here and even if you go alone, you often find interesting people to talk to.  When I'm working late, I have them deliver.  Katsu has outlasted every sushi place that comes up in North Beach because he serves the freshest fish at the best price.  He's also deeply knowledgeable about Japan, life, and San Francisco.  It's a cozy atmosphere.  If the TV show Cheers was a sushi bar, this would be it.
Arrived at 12:10

4 stars for dinner service. The sashimi and sushi is fresh, the rice in the nigiri perfectly seasoned. Non-sushi items worth checking out include the grilled Hama neck and Japanese curry rice. Fairly efficient service.

Very cute place.  Great service, very attentive and friendly.  Sushi was the best I've had in the city so far.  They had an item that I haven't been able to find elsewhere so was very happy to see that.  Will definitely go back.

Totally stumbled on this place by accident, and it remains in the top three sushi places I've ever been to. Totally cute, unassuming and fairly priced, service was quick, sushi was good and the atmosphere was charming. I will go out of my way to eat here again.

The worst service I received in weeks. At the time, it wasn't particularly busy yet no one came to take the order for 25 minutes. 25 minutes. If not half an hour I spend walking there I would probably leave.
This spot has delicious and fresh fresh sushi. Stopped in here while strolling the neighborhood and it was such a treat

Great sushi place close to little Italy, I love to come here before going to Cobb's for a comedy show. Make sure to start off with the spicy edamame, they have it for about $3 on the afternoon special menu that you can order from until 7pm. Tried the dragon roll, smoked salmon roll, and California roll. No complaints, really good. Server was very nice and accommodating!

I love this place. The fish is always fresh, the chefs and servers are nice and there's rarely a wait (and if there is, it's short). If you're looking for something fancy or you like super creative rolls then this is not your place, but if you're looking for comfortable atmosphere and solid fish I would definitely recommend stopping by!
Sashami = The Best! I don't think I need to say more. Excellent job!

The first time I visited I really liked this place.  Second time not so much.  The chef didn't seem to care a lot about making the sushi.  The nigiri were shabbily made, rice started falling apart as soon as you pick it up, fish cut up in random shapes and not very fresh, hastily put together.  Staff are very nice but there are just much better places to go to.
Delicious! The sushis are very fresh, which is critically important for me.
Ehhh. Nothing special. Nice people though. The green tea was my favorite part of the meal. I guess the food wasn't as good as I'm used too. Great location from our flat on mason street.
Convenient and good sushi spot if you are looking for a sushi place in North Beach!

Vacationing from out of state and I've been obsessing about finding a good sashimi/sushi bar.  After looking at reviews we decided on North Beach and it was delicious.  Cute little place with a friendly and helpful staff.  My boyfriend had never had sashimi before and he was impressed and thought it was delicious!  I recommend the combination lunch and the seafood lunch.  The ikejime nigiri was delightful.  A lot of food for a fair price!

If you love sushi then this is the place to go.  It's small, it can get crowded but the sushi is first rate..  Sushi plate as selected by the chef was amazing..  12 pieces of the freshest nigiri sushi possible.  Yellow tail, salmon, butterfish.!!  And the uni.!! Wonderful.!!  Amazing texture with a sweet/salty taste the is hard to describe..  Friends had sashimi which was outstanding..  Other dining with us had a roll with amazing crab and avocado.  Service was excellent.  Very cordial, attentive but not overly so..  This is a sushi restaurant so be prepared for items to arrive as they are made not all at once. Some guest's meals will come sooner and others later.   All-in-all I have to say this is one of the best nigiri sushi places I've been.  I will be back for sure.!!
Been coming here for over 10 years. Good ole reliable Katsu and his sushi. Everything is great. I generally get the Hamachi Kama and poke with sake and a beer for Katsu.
Friendly service. I sat at the bar and chatted with a couple of folks from the neighborhood. The sushi is simple but excellent.
Best time I've had in this city!

Is my Japanese food fix in the neighborhood. Sashimi is fresh. Tempura is crispy and the batter is not thick. Fish collar is grilled perfectly, meaning not dried. They used to have Aji sashimi and u could fried the bone. However I think they took that off the menu. Wish they have more local Japanese food like fried soft shelled crabs but it's still a great jap restaurant in the neighborhood
Got takeout from here, and it was simply mediocre...

I went this restaurant with my family and their bible teacher, we order California Dinner , Seafood Dinner and Rice Cake, it was very good , and the Rice Cake Sushi w/ Spicy Tuna - $8.50  very fresh.California Dinner ( 15.95 ), Seafood Dinner( 16.95 )   both include miso soup, green salad, riceIt was kind of a weird experience.  Would definitely go back as the elements of the meal were good and fresh,

This spot is the spot. My reasoning is simple, see attached. If you are looking for blue fun the was murked literally moments ago - or - a restaurant with  some overly contemporary bull shit interior, this is not your spot.

Visiting San Francisco and the Marriott Fisherman's  wharf recommended the place.  So happy we came here !   Perfect spot to end our busy day of sightseeing . Great service , cozy place, not near the touristy sights but walking distance from our hotel.  The food was awesome ! Started with Unagi salad... So delicious !  Then had an array of sashimi . So fresh... Melted in my mouth .
You know you want nigiri. You came to San Francisco for the food, right? Of if you want the Kung Fu Dragon Spicy Hamachi Tempura Roll, this ain't the place.

Overall 4 stars - 5 stars for the service and 3 1/2 for the food.  The food was not bad but it wasn't stellar either - I'm not an expert, just an enthusiast for sashimi and the fish was fresh but the salmon somewhat fatty for my liking.

Had a three choice combination lunch on a Thursday around 12:30- the chef was a bit flustered due to some mishap with a massive takeout order that was returned. My order was placed juuust before the return kicked in and he cut off other patrons.  It was kind of a weird experience.  Would definitely go back as the elements of the meal were good and fresh, just a little jumbled due to his situation.
To the folks who gave this place a high review: you lied (or got paid to write a glowing yelp review).

This was our first dinner stop for this year's SF trip. We checked into our apartment in North Beach and headed on over as it was a short walk. Getting there pretty early for dinner (around 5pm), we were the only ones there at the time but we didn't let that stop us since reviews were decent and they had Happy Hour going.

No wait on a Wednesday night for 2. This place proves that San Francisco is definitely not a sushi town. If you've ever had good sushi before, then you know this place is mediocre. Haven't been anywhere else in the city but definitely not dying to go back here

This place is great for lunch. Their lunch specials are very affordable, $10 for a 2 piece lunch combo and just over $12 for a 3 piece special. However, you can't really get real sushi as a lunch combo which is why I gave it only 3 stars. It's more bento box style, but the spicy chicken is good and so is the veggie tempura.  Got a spicy dragon roll on the side which was great but over $10 for one roll is pretty over priced. I'd probably go back occasionally because it was good, just not the best sushi I've ever had
Great prices (especially happy hour), amazing service, and great rolls. They dont overdue their rolls with sauces; they keep them simple and classy.

Caught their happy hour by accident that was 5-7pm and ordered Cali, Mango, & Spicy Tuna rolls. They were all very delicious and fresh. Also ordered two carafes of hot saki. Got great service, but the best part was when they brought a 24$ bill !!! Seriously? I think me and my girlfriend will be back very soon, at that price maybe even again tomoro.
Great decor, great service, great food! Went here with a group of 7 on a Saturday night and we were seated very promptly. The servers were very friendly.

We ordered to-go sushi rolls from here(California real crab, Rainbow, Rock'n Roll and Spicy Tuna) California roll and Rainbow were both delicious, fresh and tightly rolled. The taste of Rock'n Roll was also very delicious. But Rock'n Roll and Spicy Tuna rolls were so loosely rolled that we had very hard time eating them :(

Katsu's Sushi on North Beach is very good.  His fish is fresh, food quality is overall great, and portions are generous.  My faves:  Hamachi Kama and Rice Cake Sushi (crispy sushi rice, avocado and spicy tuna)
One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city. The fish is always fresh and the staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.
We ordered off caviar and it came in about an hour.

If I had written this review a couple months to a year ago, I'd probably give it 5 stars.  This was my "go-to" north beach place.  it felt like a secret only locals appreciated, since most of the long lines in north beach are next door at golden boy or tony's.

Now i come here a lot, sometimes twice a week , and i notice there is constant turn over at the counter. Its a new person every week. This business suffers from the same thing many businesses suffer through, they are utterly under staffed. I noticed you have taken on an on line delivery service, That's great, but not at the cost of putting the dine in restaurant second. Extra long waits are no fun and when i see the owner cooking in the back and yelling at his cook while they are both scrambling to just barely put out orders together, it looks pretty bad. You need to pay a competitive wage to your staff in order to keep someone and treat your employees with respect. It always starts at the top, so take a look in the mirror an make some changes or your business with locals in Northbeach is going to take a hit .
HRD used to be my go-to for a fast and easy meal. I don't know what happened lately, but the place has gone to crap. Food is awful and service takes longer than a real restaurant.
Do not trust the restaurant's reply especially this HRD has nothing to do with the nice one on 3rd St.
Came here for lunch around noon on a Friday. Pretty empty.
I would give 3 1/2 if I could.  Just to clarify this place is not the HRD Coffee Shop seen on Diners drive ins and dives and is NOT affiliated with that restaurant in any way.  I ordered through

I work in the neighborhood. I ordered the zesty chili fried pork chop as I've had that dish in the past and really liked it. Well wow, there must be new owners or management or something because the difference was night and day. It was cold, completely fatty AND not even cooked all the way through. It was overly drowned in sauce like they were trying to hide something. I had to bring it back and at least they refunded my money as it was inedible. While I'm appreciative they gave me my money back, I won't be returning because something is clearly lacking in the kitchen.

The first time I ate from here I thought everything was pretty good , especially the ribs which we're fall-off-the bone tender. The second time was a totally different story. I ordered their grilled chicken and short ribs combo after about 20 min and had pretty severe food poisoning. I don't have a weak stomach so whatever was in there must have been nasty. I'm fine now but that experience was bad enough that I won't be coming back.

This is no longer HRD Coffee Shop affiliated. I went here yesterday for the first time since this summer and it's night and day from when HRD owned this establishment. First of all, this place gets 1 star for flat out lying to my face when I noticed the changes and asked if HRD still owned the place (the cook/manager said yes, this is still HRD). Immediately went to the HRD website and they confirmed they only own HRD Coffee Shop.
I heard this place is run by the same folks that did HRD coffee shop so I'm posting my review from there. Never been here but can't imagine it improved, specially looking at all the low ratings.
Coming home from work on a Wednesday evening, I was tasked with picking up dinner and because I had recently seen "Check, Please! Bay Area" on KQED
The smoked spare ribs are legit. The apple coleslaw is excellent. Management has changed since Check Please Bay Area but the food is good. As a BBQ lover, I'm impressed by the mesquite flavors.
Wow. I should first clarify that if I were rating this based on the food/service alone, it would probably be 3 stars. My rating for HRD Coffee Shop is 5 stars.

Came here thinking this placed was owned by the HRD spot by the ballpark...da meaty egg scramble was kinda skimpy on pork for the price and had a lot of rice...the Korean sauce that they provide was frigin HOT...so much so that I had trouble finishing My sub par dish...I only gave 2 stars because I'm giving this place some kind of benefit of being affiliated with the HRD coffee shop...if it ain't broke don't fix it...tryin to reinvent da wheel I've here did not work and the original dishes aren't good either...hope the remodel on da original is done soon

I'm done eating here now . No point in coming back, it's under new management and just not the same anymore. They managed to screw up the kimchi burrito and short ribs somehow. Such a disappointment.  My sister in law also got sick from the new food here. I used to love coming here, but I'll take a pass on them now.

I read all about HRD on Yelp and finally walked by in North Beach and decided to eat there. I got a beef kimchi burrito and it was pretty good. I would come back to try more dishes from the menu. My friend got shrimp and pineapple tacos and said that this place should get 2 or 3 stars. It took them a while to finally serve him his dish and then he wasn't that impressed, but I will be back! If HRD was in the Sunset or Richmond, I would be there more. It's rare to find Asian food in North Beach, but it does exist like King of Thai and The House.
Mediocre food. 3 stars at best.

This food is soooo fire.  I wish I could eat here more!  The portions are big and packed with like Korean BBQ flavor.  Defintely try the ribs and apple wasabi coleslaw.  I've also enjoyed their kimchi (chicken or pork) burritos.  Omg and the mashed potatoes with curry gravy!!  I feel bad saying this but...I could eat that by the, like, gallon lol
Another stop on my food crawl through North beach back in February with Rodney H. Since I've never been to HRD and was craving meat, we got the following:
I live in NB and I enjoy going to this place but I have to give it a poor rating due to the deception that this is related to HRD Coffee Shop.

Came here once and I split the Kimchee Burrito with the boyfriend. We both thought it was okay. The size was a bit smaller than a typical burrito, and the flavor was lacking a little. Haven't been back to try anything else, but definitely will return.

When I enter the cashier prompted me to only order from the specials menu which was very extremely limit. I decided to make the best of it and make due with the sub par selection on a makeshift sign. I decided to play along and order the over priced 12 hour pulled pork sandwich which I have to say was as tough as shoe leather  more like 12 minutes on high. To make matters worst I look around and everyone is eating off of the regular menu shoving burritos in their face and grinning. Would not recommend.

Since my sister lives right by here, we decided to stop by for a quick Sunday lunch.  Ambiance is nothing worth really mentioning.  The Korean beef tacos were tasty and hit the spot.  My one complaint was that I ordered the mashed potatoes with curry and this did not come up with my order.  I was told that they would bring it to me when it was ready.  Unfortunately this never happened and it was my bad that I totally forgot about it until I was already driving out of SF.  Oh well, probably better off without the extra calories.
The good thing is that this place was open late because we didn't get to sf till 9. The place was really empty but probably because it was late.

We wanted to try this place since it was featured on DDD but could never seem to get to the restaurant on Third Street when it's open.  So we came here after a Giants game last month. It was very disappointing.  We ordered the rib platter and chicken wings appetizer. The wings were just okay.  The ribs were dry and had no flavor.  Even adding one of their sauces didn't help. For a $17 plate you only get three ribs which were not good. Honestly if I'm going to spend $30 plus tip for lunch I can go to a restaurant and get waited on.  We had to bus our own table on the way out. Will not be going back.
A bit dry. Taste is aight. Not bad, not memorable. I can't help but compare it to its SoMa counterpart, which definitely has more soul to its grub.
I love this place and it's such a contrast to my NB perception of pasta and Pizza.
Quick service. Order and sit anywhere you want. Leave name so they can call you when your food is ready for pick up. Get your own utensils and clean up after yourself. Not too bad
Heard so much about this place had to try.
So it's been a very very long time since I've wanted to try this place. The last time I came to SF, HRD Coffee Shop was closed so I wasn't able to try the korean spicy pork burrito.

I'm Korean and I was hoping to taste great fusion food. The kimchi yams was ok...good yam flavor with only a hint of kimchi taste. The kimchi burrito with zesty pork was underwhelming. It was pretty bland for my wife and I. Same for the chicken Katsu with curry and egg. Great service and menu...too bland for us in the taste department.
On a warm spring day, we wandered about Little Italy for a cheap lunch. We were going to go get pizza but this place captured my eye. Thank goodness I had cash.

This place is cash only, but they do have an ATM inside! For decor, they have two chalkboards up in the front that you can draw on! The chalk is next to the register! Also, the tables are wooden benches and tables. Some of them are long for bigger parties.

Came here for takeout since my sister and I had our dog with us. I didn't get to go inside either. Parking around here is always such a hassle, but we got lucky and found a spot pretty quickly around the block. From the experience of eating the spicy pork kimchee burrito on the drive home, I expected better. The spicy pork tasted good, but when I took bites where there were no spicy pork, the rice tasted pretty bland. They also had bean sprouts in it, which I don't like. Now that I know, I will make sure they take it out next time. Also ordered an order of Kalbi ribs which came with mash potatoes and fries for my mom. Didn't get to try the ribs, but the fries were fresh and thin cut, yum! And they gave us a pretty big side order of mash potatoes, which was also a bit bland, but I took only a small bite of it. Will give this place another try in the future, but not anytime soon. Possibly will try their other location on 3rd street before coming back to this one to give it another chance.

How are there not more reviews for how insanely overpriced this place is?? I just had mediocre pulled pork, yams and slaw, all on a normal sized plate for OVER SIXTEEN DOLLARS?!?!??? I understand SF is much more expensive than average but I could have walked a few blocks to Safeway for the exact same meal for under 5 dollars.... Not bad but not even close to good enough to justify the prices
Love this place. We had the kalbi beef, chicken cutlet and the aloha taco. This place just feels right. Helen was so friendly and helpful. You won't be sorry.

Had high expectations for the place love the concept but was truly let down. I ordered the bibimap rice bowl with kimchi and koren spate ribs. Way too much oil used that ruined the flavor of the dish. Owner kept running her mouth to this couple and neglected 2 other customers and myself plus 1.  I went first thing in the morning so I will give another try in the future.

Having tried the HRD coffee shop before, I had high expectations coming here. And oh boy, it really doesn't disappoint!! The version of loco moco here had an additional fried chicken piece and a mountain worth of kimchi Zesty rice! I'm not complaining, I LOVE it!! The curry drizzled on top of everything added to the amazingness with every bite! Plus, I hate runny eggs and they were willing to cook it fully for me! Yay for the customer service! :)

This place is kinda confused...  I got the combo BBQ plate with the wasabi apple slaw and the fries as sides. My GF got the bibimbap with kalbi. I thought the BBQ was really tasty, especially the chicken. It's decent BBQ.  My GF was not happy with the bibimbap. The portions were great and it looked good, but she said the taste was all off and that the sauce that came with it was "very weird and not close to traditional korean". No booze. Friendly service, but we probably won't come back.
The place looks wonderful and is located right next to a beautiful view on the pier of both bridges and the water. The service is absolutely phenomenal and the presentation of food looks great!

After the whole Yelp thingamajig, I found myself situated here again with my good friends Jim and Isabella. All I can say is that the second time around was definitely a homerun/touchdown/goal/flyingelbowdrop/whathaveyou­.
First time that the new fog city! Everything was absolutely exquisite with the exception of the rock music where dinner music (jazz) would've been appreciated! Will return again and again.

The wait service was very accommodating especially since our party of 7 also had 2 infants.  my dish (trout was delicious.  The swordfish was a bit dry,  Hamburgers were great. the short ribs were tender and delicious. And the lamb wraps were so so.
I first dined at Fog City through a YEE held here last month. (
Bravo, Fog City.

I must have passed this place a gazillion times and never gone in thinking that it was for special occasions.  Thus, I was glad to be surprised by the level of comfort provided by the food, staff and restaurant.  Although the oysters brightened my evening, the pork chop was the most tender and flavorful piece of meat that I've had in a long time.  Of course, I ended on a sweet note with their pumpkin brioche bread pudding with frozen custard.  Service was exceptional with their recommendations, friendliness and patience.  I'll be sure to come back more often.

I had the Saigon Dip, which was good but I not the best meal of all time. Easy location nice interiors but the prices are very high! A sandwich for $18 is a bit steep and it didn't come with any salad, garnish or fries only broth to dip the sandwich in, the plate looked a little empty. I feel that this place is a bit pricey and the food was just good/ok not mind blowing. There are so many places in the city to eat so I may never come back , or at least I wouldn't make a effert to come back... but if a friend wanted to go or I was starving in the area I would go in again.

Your own private quarters along the wharf! Solid wood door, subway tile, dim mood lighting, 2 handlebars for traction control all within large private restroom make this the best place to drop a deuce in the whole entire city!!!

What you would think might be a tourist trap is actually a really decent restaurant for lunch or dinner.   Located close to the tourist area of Embarcadero (near pier 39), the Fog City Diner has some really good food specialties (clam chowder) and classic cocktails.  While not "on the water", it's close by and makes walks along the waterfront very special.
I would recommend the broccli, very good
Great experience!  The waiter was fantastic, the food all unique and flavorful.   Definitely recommend it.

I work in the awkward space of Telegraph Hill, and new food options are hard to come by. Fog City is a place I've been meaning to try for a while, so I made a reservation for a work lunch. The food here is not bad and probably worthy of 4 stars, but the service and steep prices knock off one star for me.

Haven't been to Fog City for 15 years, so I was pleasantly surprised to go back and not only not recognize the place but love the new look and ambiance. Food coming out of the open kitchen looked and smelled fabulous. We only had the steak taco and the chicken salad but along with the atmosphere loved it!! Terrific bar tenders and actually the same warm entertaining feeling you get when you are at the sister restaurants Bungalow44 and Buckeye. Will definitely go back soon when in the city!

I came here for lunch with a few coworkers and had one of the best fried chicken sandwich of my life. My understanding is that the menu is always changing so if the friend chicken sandwich is on the menu, don't hesitate and just order it. The chicken is tender, juicy, well-seasoned, and fried perfectly, not oily at all. The coleslaw that topped the sandwich is super refreshing and is a great contrast to the fried chicken. End to end, service was excellent. We were seated quickly, and also got our menus, drinks, entrees, and check quickly as well. I would definitely come back for a fancy-ish lunch if I'm in the area. If you can, try to sit at the bar so you can see the kitchen in action - they put on quite a show.

Food was ok....for the price umm not so much. Maybe Im spoiled because I live in the Napa Valley but I come to the City quite often and always find great food but was highly dissatisfied with my order.  Clams were good but they were nothing to rant and rave about...fries okay...oh the bread was good...Brussel sprouts yummy but needed something...oh yea oysters were the bomb, but you'd be an idiot to screw those up. My BF enjoyed the clams though if that helps.
Fog City has the one of the best burgers in town.  It is on the expensive side however.  Always good service.
Summary: convenient location across from Pier 23, warm modern interiors and excellent service almost make up for the mediocre food

Decent place to visit when you are around the Pier and fancy yourself a drink.  They do have some good appetizer options but for me the prices are definitely higher than what they should be.  If they tempered their prices a little bit I might bump it into the 4 star range but the decent service compared with the overrated prices dropped it down a peg for me.
Here's a couple of personal opinions of dishes I've tried at Fog City.
I really want to like this place more. I feel very nostalgic towards it. But I just didn't have a great time. It's probably the fault of the obnoxious 60something year old man next to us on a
We came here for lunch today. Overall the place has a nice atmosphere. You know, 'nice', as in 'not really worthy of any other adjective nice'.

I loved my visit to Fog City!   It was my first time there and we were greeted by a very friendly hostess arriving a bit before our reservation.  We sat at the bar for a cocktail and app to wait for our table, but were so comfortable at the bar we decided to stay there for our meal.  Great service, the food was great, loved sharing small plate dishes. A very cool place with a nice vibe - will definitely go there again.
Fog City...Oh Fog City.

My five friends and I arrived near closing time on Sunday, September 14, cold and disgruntled after a long wait for an Embarcadero bus that never came. Despite the hour, the Fog City staff could not have been more gracious, dishing up comfort food--tomato soup and heavenly mac and cheese. Their kindness and good humor--not to mention the wonderful meal--made it one of the most memorable dining experiences during our visit to San Francisco.

It is way way way expensive for a quick lunch, but the food was delicious.  I got an open faced salmon sandwich and my friend got a burger.  Garlic fries were AMAZING and food was yummy, not sure if it was $50 yummy, but it was yummy none the less.

While walking down the Embarcadero trying to meet up with another couple around 5pm, my girlfriend and I decided to stop in here for a quick drink and snack.  We were seated immediately and a waiter came for a drink order within minutes.  The decor was very modern and aesthetically pleasing.  Overall a nice vibe.

Fog City diner is not a diner so if you want Mels, go somewhere else. We attempted it on a whim one night last week because it was late, i wanted fish, and it was close. I had been to the old one a few times and was just put off by something ...not sure what it was but hadn't been back in years.
I'm pretty loyal to Fog City because it's only 2 blocks from my house :)  I sincerely  enjoy both dinners and happy hours here!
Great service, the broccoli and corn small plates were delicious! Everything is family style so it's great for sharing.

Really great redux of a San Francisco classics IMHO.  The drinks were a great start, and the apps were wonderful.  We started with the Fries and Calamari, both super delicious.  Then on to the chicken ( a must and definitely shareable) and ribs.  All of the flavors and sides completed each other so very well.
The attitude here has been much more manageable at least during weekday lunch. Outside tables are nice.
I've been here several times since the remodel, and each time it has been fine.  After tonight, though, I won't be going back.
Fog City I want to love you but...I've tried you 4 times and...
I loved the newly designed diner!   My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our meal and entire experience.  We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

I liked Fog City Diner and I like this updated "Fog City" The drinks are yummy and the food tasty. I like the remodel , the bar is spacious and has a great view. All the men working there are friendly and HANDSOME

Oh my, I can still remember when this place was called Mildred Pierce's way back when I was a poor assistant media planner in an ad agency near the Levi Plaza. I believe that was sometime after Pearl Harbor and before my last memory lapse. Then it became Battery Point for a minute and then changed identities again around the mid-80's to Fog City Diner. Believe it or not, it used to be a trendy place to go, although the retro-diner vibe became so commonplace and the menu so misbegotten with its festering Mexican and Asian small plate selections, that it finally sputtered into oblivion last year. I don't think I even made it over there in over a decade, and even in its new guise, I was hesitant to go until a food blogger raved about how good the food was.
One of the WORST dining experiences I've ever had---and I used to manage a restaurant in The City.

I eat out often in San Francisco and was anxious to try the new Fog City.  The new decor is gorgeous but the food was, well, pretty bad.  I had the chicken sandwich and my husband had the sesame chicken salad but we shared the two dishes.  Both were only OK.  The chicken in the salad was gristly and there were strips of plain skin in the salad.  The salad was over-dressed and was one of the worst chicken salads I've had.  The sandwich came with coleslaw so we asked if we could substitute fries.  Our waitress said yes but later charged us $3 for the fries which she didn't mention up front.  We had strawberry shortcake for dessert, thinking maybe that would redeem the meal, but the berries didn't taste fresh and the biscuits had a weird flavor.  So overall, a big disappointment.  We won't be back.

Beautiful meal. We had the ribs and the whole chicken. The chicken was maybe the best chicken I've ever had in my life. Deboned. Moist and flavorful. Came with a side of lemon and spices to season it further.   I went back a week late to have the chicken again.

i came here a few times with low expectations since its in a tourist spot , the first time i got the corned beef hash it was ok, the second time I got it i asked them to make it crispy and it definitely hit the spot.

Possibly the only place to get a pretty decent Pho around this area! We were skeptical because half the menu is American style (burgers etc) and there didn't appear to be any Vietnamese in the kitchen, but on a cold windy day we were thankful for a yummy beef pho! Nice open kitchen too so you can see everything is clean.

Eh, could've gone to Denny's and had better food. The service was good. We were able to sit outside. Both kids had the chocolate chip pancakes and so our mission was accomplished. Not impressed with the cleanliness. Found something chunky at the bottom of my coffee cup: lettuce? Either way, eck.
Excellent pho and great service! The menu was very diverse, so I plan to return to try their breakfast selection. Would defiantly recommend!

Delicious food and extremely cheap. The teriyaki New York strip is just delicious and serve well a party of two. I loved the fact that the kitchen is open so you can see people actually working on your plate :)
Really good chicken pho with garlic in the broth. Perfect on a cold, foggy day. Nice owners who will give a discount for local workers.
To keep it short and sweet-- the service was awful and slow, breakfast was mediocre at best, and my pho was served lukewarm. Never coming back again...

Came here via Chinese tour bus where everybody assumed that I didn't speak English. I was starving and came here with my mom and dad to eat. I was surprised to find that the dishes were reasonably priced, considering how San Francisco is such an expensive city and the location it had was really touristy.

So we were wandering around Fisherman's Wharf checking out all the overrated tourist traps and stumbled across this place.   Got good reviews from Yelp plus the unusual cuisine....so the GF had a sandwich and fries and I had the satay beef pho.....it was really tasty, full of beef and veggies with a tasty broth.   Service was efficient.   Atmosphere....well, it looks like a a diner.  Could work on that.   But overall a great find in an area full of lousy restaurants.
yes the pho is good i tried it

Best pho place ever! They have grilled cheese and fried chicken and it's fucking bomb! Owner is also super cool and friendly and gave us free whiskey shots and French toast. Are you fucking kidding me???!
Fantastic!

Darren's has always been a good, reasonably priced place for lunch in the fisherman's wharf area. Maybe it's a sign of the times, but had the pho today and it came without the usual basil. Cilantro = cheaper than basil? People won't notice? Otherwise, the food and service are consistently good...

Overall this cafe was really good! We had the French toast combo and eggs Benedict. The bacon was crisp and flavorful. We were in and out quickly and the service was awesome! Would recommend for breakfast!

What can be better than a bowl of hot Pho after you freeze your butt off on the top deck of Big Bus or a Cruise Ferry going to Golden Gate? This place is walking distance from the Wharf and Pier 39, food is affordable and fresh, my wife loved her Vietnamese salad, while I gobbled down a bowl of nice beef Pho, very satisfying.

I decided to get some breakfast to go here as I had a 9AM tour for Alcatraz Islands. The wait was decent.. maybe about 5 minute from ordering for the food ready to go. I got a pretty standard breakfast I thought, I'm thinking if I come here for lunch instead with pho and other Vietnamese dishes available perhaps my experience would have been more enjoyable.
Stumbled upon this place as I was staying at the hyatt close by for fireworks and 4th celebrations at the wharf. Didn't want the same ole hotel restaurant fare, so decided to wander around.

Love this place ! We had great service every time we come here. The menu is hilarious and great food. I really like this restaurant because the food is delicious and i like the noodles. I want eat forever . Darren's cafe is the best !!!
mmm, wow. home food from my motha land when i'm 894859 miles away. quaint, quaint place, and delicious food to warm your belly.
Tasty breakfast spot in Fisherman's Wharf. We had Dungeness crab Benedict and Dungeness crab omelet and both were fantastic. The country potatoes are also delicious.
The good is OK and service is OK but I felt so uncomfortable that they directly added tips to the bill. Pure racist.
awesome food. unexpectedly great. I assumed it wouldn't be authentic bc it was in a touristy area but I was dead wrong

The food was decent but the service was extremely poor. First they brought out all of the plates except for mine and i had to wait 10+ minutes for my order. While I was waiting I tried some of of parties dishes and requested to change my side dish from french fries to potatoes to which the server rudely dismissed saying the fries are being cooked. I responded that I don't care for the fries. Few mins later he brings my dish with no fries OR potatoes. Talk about passive aggressive!

nothing chillin' at the holiday inn...what we gon' do?..walking out for a stroll...forget about parking...fisherman's wharf with no expectations...darren's café situated amongst souvenir shops...airy open-walled café restaurant...menu and water...prices quite high for vietnamese....north of $9 for pho, rice plates and banh mi?...limited lunch time and need to head back to the holiday inn...thinking pho or banh mi for $10 too much, and deciding on a chicken rice plate...surprised by the hefty plate delivered...mountain of rice, large chicken breast and side salad...chicken breast chicken fried crisp and brown...delicious, and simple salt or brine seasoning assumed...sweet fish sauce to dip...fresh salad greens...good rice...quality and portion fitting $10 price tag....for fisherman's wharf food options, darren's café isn't bad at all...

The service was fast, but the waitress didn't have a very becoming personality. She almost seemed annoyed that we were there. It was also very tight quarters. I felt like I could reach over and touch the people sitting at the next table. Maybe take a few tables out? I ordered a bagel sandwich and it was one of the better ones I've ever has. The food is what made me give it a higher rating. If the food wasn't good, I would've only given it a 2 star.

The food here is amazing! While my family and I were on a trip to San Francisco, we happened to come across this restaurant on our way to the wharf. THANK goodness we did! Everything we order was over the top in flavor. Every time my family and I are in San Francisco we will make this our usual.

Pretty good breakfast spot. Not too much stands out but overall pretty good. I thought it was cool that you can order their entire menu all day but I still stuck with the crab omelette. The side of potatoes were better than the hash browns. The fruit bowl was substantial.
They have a full menu all day long...pho for breakfast!

Stopped in for breakfast because I was in the area and it had good reviews on yelp. The service is terrible: took over 10 min to ask for drink order, did not offer options for soy milk (seriously, in this day and age I find this unacceptable), dropped my knife and was never offered a clean one.

It's not often that you find a truly excellent cafe in the heart of a tourist area. Darren's is one of these rare places. I had the crab omelette with sourdough toast. The omelette was perfect...fluffy and full of meat and avocado. The coffee was almost as good. If I lived closer I would have breakfast here every day
WE WENT TO THIS PLACE TWICE.
I been here a handful of times and always liked the food. However I went today and had a horrible experience!!
Wow! Stopped in for brunch and got to sit right down. The Fresh OJ was about the best I have ever had and the Florentine Benedict and Chorizo Scramble were absolutely fantastic.

This is the first time we ate at Darren's and we really liked it. I had pretty basic eggs, hash browns, toast and sausage. Basic breakfast yes and the quality and quantity were wonderful! Like some other San Francisco breakfast spots, Darren's serves hash brown by the square foot!!!  And they were great and I are every crumb!  My wife had corned beef hash and eggs. She said it was quite good, I can't judge...never been a corned beef fan I'm afraid. Anyway, this is a great breakfast place and we will certainly hit it again on the next trip.
Excellent breakfast. plenty of fruit came with my pancakes and eggs. complimentary homemade jelly and bread. good service. space was right, but good places often are...
One way to know a restaurant is great: when you are 1500 miles away at another similar restaurant, and reminiscing about the food at a great restaurant! That's how good Darren's is! :-)
This place is super touristy but still good! They make a pretty Americanized version of Banh Mi which does not taste authentic at all but is still pretty good.
Conveniently located brunch/lunch spot serving both western and Asian favourites - what's not to love?

Great good and value!  Only wish the location was more convenient to locals...and Oaklanders ;) Had brunch there and there wasn't a line, but I heard there can be. My mom and aunt from Japan who are both picky loved the food there as well! Can't go wrong here for breakfast and vietnamese food!

It is a very touristy neighborhood, so many reviewers probably haven't tried a lot of the classic bfst spots. It isn't bad food, it was fine. Food that is twice as good can be had elsewhere for the same price. Very fast service. Loud pop music playing on radio

Fun place to have a drink with a big group of friends!  After dinner at Don Pisto's, our group moseyed on to Amante for some more drinks and continue our chatfest.  When we walked in there, all the tables were pretty much taken.  As we were deciding what to do, the manager came up to us and asked how many was in our party. We told him and he told us that they can set up a table for us outside under the heatlamps. Great! That solved our problem!

I like the bar well enough. Chubby Noodle is an excellent addition, though the two ticket system can be a pain at times. What I don't like is coming to watch the Giants and being asked to leave. Two of us got there in time to get one of the 4 tops outside to watch the game, we were asked to move to the seat directly below the TV. You can't watch the game from there, so we said no. The bouncer stood over us for a little bit and then asked us to leave. Amante is a decent bar as long as you aren't going during any games. Either way, I won't be back.

Bouncer is a jerk and unprofessional. Go here all the time, typically the workers are nice. Get there prior to a Giants game and there are a few tables open outside. We take the only table left that you can watch the game from, it seats 4 people. Bouncer asks us to move unless we have more people coming. I ask if it is first come first serve, he states that it is but he would like us to move. I again say we do not want to because you cannot see the game from the other open tables. When we refuse his request for the third time he tells us to leave... Loved this place I have been going here for two years almost every week. I will never go again! We were polite the entire time, I was completely shocked by his treatment.
First of all I love this place. I feel like family when I come here. The owners Wiz and Mike are fucking fabulous. Eric and Alfredo are amazing to chat with and make great drinks.
Golden oldies playing overhead, pineapple infused vodka, sake flights (score!), chubby noodle in the kitchen with the most amazing chicken tenders on the planet - what's not to love!?
I am stingy with my 5 stars and since I didn't eat the food, I can't 5 star.... but... all 4 stars are for the bartender.

I recently came across this place when meeting a buddy for a drink. It's located in North Beach on Green street by Golden Boy pizza. We actually came here for the noodles  at Chubby Noodle, which is located inside the bar. I've walked by this place a million times and it never occurred to me that there's small restaurant within the bar. We came for the noodles but stayed for the drinks once we realized what a cool bar this is.
Chubby Noodles was delicious. The drink were well made but nothing to write home about. I ate the Pork Braised Ramen (enough to share) and Kung Fu Chicken.
Stopped in here for a drink, the staff and patrons were friendly.

Let's face it...a step up from other local North-beach eats & drinks. Nice place to stop in and meet with friends. Great to see Bobby Mccambridge during the day and the Owners giving it a club feel when the sun goes down. In my opinion they have hit the mark when it comes to a nice place where everybody knows your name....neighborhood bar.

Not fancy, not a dive bar. Best part of this bar is the Chubby Noodle food (separate review). But they also have very good prices for drinks, especially for this neighborhood. The house made pineapple infused vodka is tasty and something different from the usual, though that's really the only thing on the drink menu that was unique. They also have some good seating options: high tables with views of TVs (good for game watching), a comfy booth/table with curtains near the door (though not good if you're tired--I fell asleep there once), and outdoor tables that make for great people watching on this section of Green.

Bartender was a dickhead!! I was sick and brought in water from a nearby place. He gave me an attitude and said they don't allow other drinks from other places  I didn't know it would be an issue and so I asked him if he could spill the water out so I could return the glass to them. He did and the handed the glass back with an attitude he asked for IDs from me and my boyfriend even though I asked for water. He then gave an attitude again so I asked him "why the attitude?" He apparently misheard me and said he was a Mexican. He thought I said "why the accent? " after the clarification he said that he's not the one with an attitude. I did not gve him an attitude- not even when asking about his own attitude. I asked for the manager in which he magically became the manager. He then refused to serve us and kicked us out. I would never recommend anyone going here for the horrid service.

After eating, my friend and I walked in here specifically for the house pineapple infused vodka. Absolutely fabulous! The vodka was so smooth, it had the texture of water and it tasted delicious. This vodka is dangerous as you could drink a whole pitcher of it on a hot day, only to realize 20 minutes later you are plastered. This did not happen to me, but it would have if I had kept drinking. Strangely, the alcohol didn't affect me that much.
Decent bar for a few drinks with a small group. Quick service, good atmosphere

Great ambience in a centrally located spot in North Beach. Tap beers are $5, which is almost the same as some other divey places I have been to. And this place is in no way a dive bar. The bartending was great as well.

Had a great time with a group of friends at Amante! The door man was wonderful, accommodating our luggage until we were ready to leave. He also dealt with some unruly drama fiends in a professional way. All I know is someone threw a plastic cup in my direction during an argument and the argument didn't last long with the doorman intervening.
Nice and cozy bar - great service. Needs some refreshment though, feels little funky to be inside. But its common for most old bars I guess, they never do renovations unless the ownership change.

Stopped in here to watch a Bowl game the other night and quickly realized this is not a great place to watch a game.  Only a handful of TV's and the layout is not conducive to groups trying to watch said games.  The wait staff was OK and the Asian influenced menu had a few good items but I was not impressed with the beer menu or the lack of non-spicy food items.

You know, I almost never like to post a bad review because I work on the restaurant industry and I know how much these things can hurt a business. But what happened the other night at Amante was so bad that I just had to say something. My friend and I like to have an occasional cigarette while we drink our wine. So we decided to go to Amante and sit outside. I specifically remember telling the bartender that we will be going outside so we can smoke. No sooner than we had lit our cigarettes, the same bartender came out and started pulling in all the chairs. When we asked why he said that it was because he wanted to go home early. He was rude and unapologetic, so we asked for the manager. Then he said that he was the manager and rushed us to chug our drinks. I later found out that that was a lie, because he is just a bartender. So caution people DO NOT, go to Amante when Fredo is working unless you want a lot attitude.  That being said, I'm a local North Beach resident and have had a lot of fun at Amante  because the other bartenders are really great

We walked in here on accident. I was looking for Columbus Cafe, but I saw this place had the ball game on and two open seats at the bar, so I beelined it. My poor husband caught up to me and whispered in my ear that it was the wrong place. Hey, they had frenet too, so all wasn't lost. I also tried the pineapple martini. The first one was okay, but for the second one, I asked him to put a shot of pineapple juice in with it, and that was BOMB. It's pretty loud with mediocre music and the average age goes up as the night wears on. When we first walked in, there were a bunch of twenty-somethings dressed in 80's garb. As it got later, the 40 and 50- year olds came out to play. Fun stop and if you don't like it, you can always go next door.

If I could take a bath in their pineapple martini I would. OMG - so good. This place has a great vibe, super comfy booths that are situated higher up so you can see all the action and everyone who works here is a total sweetheart. Love that you don't have to go anywhere except across the bar to the Chubby Noodle window for high quality (Mary's organic chicken!) snack to go with your drink. I'm a fan!

When this place is not crazy busy, it's basically a nice place to grab a drink and have a conversation. The drinks are decently priced and it's located next to a bunch of other notable places like Sotto Mare or Golden Boy Pizza. I highly recommend this joint for anyone's bar hopping list.

This was the spot I chose to have my post-job interview drink. The bar is awesome. I had this super cool older bartender who was absolutely great to talk to. You get quite a local vibe too, which is quite nice. Go for the Big Daddy IPA if you're looking for something new and a little hoppy.

Such an awesome bar. The bartender and I had the worst case of hiccups and she had some weird remedy. Unfortunately and fortunately, the cure worked 50% of the time, everytime. Thank goodness! The place is a pretty cool hangout spot to watch your favorite sports game. The service is great and the drinks pretty good. If you use a card, there's a $15 minimun, so be prepared for that. There's also a kitchen AKA Chubby Noodle that has great service, make sure you try the korean tacos (amazing!). Takes cash only. It was a wednesday afternoon so it wasnt busy at all. I can see myself here on a Friday/Saturday night

The waitress doesn't know how to prioritize with accompanying groups when they want to be seated while there are 2 reserved tables put on hold and we were eyeing those 2 spots for a good 20 minutes.  It's common sense to just get us seated and forfeit at least 1 of the reserved tables.  It was after 8pm on a Wednesday and surely almost everyone has had their group dinner by that time.  Her excuse was that those 2 tables are reserved for big parties.  We asked if the parties called in for reservations and she said no.  What the heck!  So it is unclaimed while we were waiting and hungry.

Came here with the Sottomare crowd and the bartender and doorman were funny and nice.  Not sure on the cocktails since I had shots but the music was good.  Danced a little salsa and it was fun.  Some people were just sitting and catching up.  We were probably one of the most obnoxious ones there...

I'm glad my friends and I decided to come here this past Saturday.  The awful human being behind the bar was a good reminder that there are a lot of jerks out there, and one should be wary of pretentious grouchy bartenders. We got to the bar kind of late for a friends birthday.  My friend ordered our drinks- 2 cocktails and 2 beers and we all stood around chatting and waiting for them.  He gave my friend the total when the 2 beers were on the counter and ran the credit card, and when my friend asked about the two cocktails the bartender said he'd made them and put them on the bar, and we must have taken them.  Since we were all still standing right there waiting for our drinks we explained that this wasn't possible, and he then escalated the situation and accused us of stealing them to get free drinks. My friend calmly explained that no, he was standing right there, and we didn't grab the drinks, but the bartender continued getting more and more worked up and yelling at us.  He ended up pouring out the two beers we'd purchased in a dramatic fashion, and refunding my friends card, only after loudly making a scene and being rude to us.  If it were up to me we would have left, but since we were there for a birthday we had to stay.  So I, standing right next to my friend he was just rude to, proceeded to order the exact same drinks/ pay for them/ give them to my friends. Now I must add that this was a very crowded bar. We were not paying close attention after we ordered drinks.. just standing around and chatting as friends will do in bars.  So maybe someone grabbed them from the bar, or maybe he forgot to pour them, but the bottom line is that type of treatment was uncalled for and tacky.  I would have expected better from a cool bar like this. We could  have afforded many many drinks from that place, and are not in the habit of stealing drinks when going out with friends.  Chances are we would have gotten drunk and bought way too many drinks from here had the rude fellow behind the bar not killed everyone's buzz. Needless to say we will never be going back here.
Stopped in here for a drink before they started serving food, and had a great time! The drink was good, the bar was beautiful, definitely be back to try the food!

Walking around North Beach, my group and I decided to check out different places. This was one we picked because it didn't look super crowded like the place next door. The Amante is pretty spacious and had lots of available sitting for the entire group I was with. The drinks were decently priced and it was not extremely loud. Didn't have the food and looking at the pictures on Yelp made me wish we had! :(

This place is great. We reached out to them ahead of time because we were having a bar crawl and let them know we were coming, They gave us special deals and made sure they had the staff on hand to work with us. I am sure glad they did because it turned out to be the best experience we had on the entire bar gold pub crawl. I will be back! Make sure this is number 1 on your list!

This place is fantastic. 4 stars only because the bartender was a douchebag once but apart from that I have had a wonderful experience everytime I have been here. The good thing is that you can get food from here since it also has chubby noodles restaurant. You may come here from Don Pistos, another very good establishment in north beach since the restaurant and the kitchen in Amante is owned by the same individual.
Wandered in here while looking for drinks with a friend in North Beach. It was less less loud/crowded/crazy than the place next door.
I'll have a cocktail with a side of cocktail please.
I woulda given this place 5 stars my first 5 visits.. But that last time... Well gee.. When its the owner who ruins it for you.. Ouch..
This bar is fun. Never douchey, great mix of people, cheap drinks, tvs so you can watch the game(s)

This is a perfect divey bar to visit, especially on a rainy day! The bar is cozy and casual which is the perfect combination. The drinks are stiff but reasonably priced, the staff is friendly and the patrons are anything but stuffy. I especially enjoyed their very random menu of food options. They serve items like fried chicken and then Asian noodles. Like I said, it's random but it seems to work! Amante is spacious for San Francisco standards so it's a good place to visit with friends. That's about all I can say about Amante, except that it's worth a visit right meow!
This place was nice! Sandwiched inbetween Italian restaurants, its hard to know what to expect.
Came here when there was a Michigan State game.  I conveniently wore green, so I didn't stand out.  Loved the energy, but it was way too crowded!  Felt like college again.

LOVED the atmosphere. Its a dark bar thats lively enough to not make you feel like a lone alcoholic sitting at the bar but chill enough where you're not in constant fear of rowdy 20-somethings busting out body shots next to you (an experience I'll have to share another time). The bartenders pour with a strong hand and the drinks come out delicious.
