The waitresses are a little on the pushy side, as our table was checked on 4 times after we had said we were done and just winding down before hitting the road, which gave us the impression that we were being pushed out. But nonetheless, the place is fun and the drinks are great.
Yes to Chubby Noodle, but no to the cheesy music and bad drinks at Amante.  They served up possibly the worst whiskey sour I've had-- something was completely off with their lemon juice.
So delish! They are very friendly here with seating upstairs and a clean restroom.  I had their fried chicken and mashed potatoes and gravy and it totally tasted tantalizingly homemade!

Uh oh, not so good on the second or third round. Hours are hit and miss and so is the chicken, bone dry and overly salty.  I had such high hopes for you all.  Was there a change in ownership?  Definitely a change in the quality.  Please bring back that fresh and  tasty that I had back in May.
The drum stick was juicy and good.
IT'S ALL ABOUT THE DRUMSTICKS

Its been a few months since this place has opened and they have done nothing but better things. They keep it simple but they are starting to have what seems like daily specials and new daily deals. Not only is North Beach one Pisto's Tacos, HRD Smokin' Grill and now another simply easily, tasteful and hopefully long lasting places in the neighborhood. I wish them the best and who ever said that the girl that works there is gorgeous is 100% right. She might make the food taste better.
One of the best fried chicken places in San Francisco. You have to try it if you love chicken. Hands-down I rate this place a five star.

It's a great location with an upstairs seating area for watching the world go by; the fried chicken is huge, very juicy, never ever dry, has the perfect crunchy coating and a bright, peppery taste; the gravy is deliciously fatty and thick; the mashed potatoes are well seasoned and have the potato skin; as of 10/5/14, the prices have dropped a little, so it's an even better deal. It's pretty good southern fare for a San Francisco restaurant!
Owner - you should not have put in the heat lamp. I'd rather get it normal from a mysterious drawer.
I absolutely love fried chicken, so I really wanted to like this place.  We got thighs and drumsticks (after all, dark meat is always superior to white meat).

Who doesn't love fried chicken? I ordered a chicken drumstick for $1.50 and I was surprised by how huge it was! It was definitely much larger than your typical drumsticks from other fast food restaurants. The drumstick was very crispy,juicy, and hearty. I also order a small corn on the cob for $2, which also very big, tasty, and buttery! An upstairs dining room provides plentiful seating with a scenic view of Columbus Avenue. The food was delicious, service very friendly, interior clean, and the prices were an excellent value. Kudos to San Francisco Fried Chicken Co. for your awesome business in the North Beach neighborhood. I look forward to trying more of your excellent cuisine in the future!
Found my new favorite late night stop.  Delicious, affordable, open late, and takes card.  So glad it's nearby.

YUM YUM YUM! And that's what I have to say about their mashed potatoes and gravy, as I'm sure you've read already. I could definitely say more, like how I would come back just for that, or like how I already have, but that's okay. You get the point, right? It's bomb!
I bring all the asians to this fried chicken place. only place to get some good mash potatoes around here.

The food here blew my mind!! Chicken was juicy, tender, and crazy flavorful. Gravy was out of this world. Mashed potatoes were perfect and the green beans were delicious. It was so good, I took five more drumsticks to go for my roommates!! And they are open late?? I'll be back, no question.

Needed a new place to eat around here, being as I've worked around here for 3 years and the new edition of fried chicken in an Italian neighborhood, is pure genius. The mash potatoes are the best and if your order to go they butter and salt your corn for you. Better then any KFC I've been to and it's all made fresh everyday! They have free wifi and upstairs seating area where you can sit and people watch! The music is great and the vibe is so mellow! I can't wait to come back
Low prices. Good portions. Good flavor. They've already played two of my favorite songs. Love love the mashed potatoes, and its one of my favorite foods. So glad i found this place!!
OMG - simply go here now - while I have yet to try to really do the "fried chicken circuit", this surprise in North Beach has inspired me to start to do that funky chicken walk...
We tried today and their chicken are big and not fatty.  Fresh and juicy.  Nice staff.  Super yummy.  Also love their cole slaw and green beans.  I will always go back!
This chicken is bonkers. It's really great. And the mashed potatoes can hold their own, too. This place is a new favorite.
I grabbed my coworker from Tennessee to visit this joint.  I mean, he's a fried chicken expert by birth, right?

Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and had their daily special which was 4 wings for the price of 3. Was skeptical as I am of fried chicken places that aren't in the hood but it was delicious. The chicken was nice and juicy and it was nice and simple. The staff was very friendly. The upstairs seating has a beautiful quiet view of the street below. Definitely worth checking out.
Got a thigh and some coleslaw, and had a good meal.

Coming from the south, I'm always in search of great fried chicken (at least subconsciously). Their fried chicken is really plump, flavorful and not too greasy. Huge fan of the mashed potatoes which are incredibly delicious. Also, really love that they sell you fried chicken by the wing/drumstick/thigh/etc as it makes it really easy to grab a bite on the go. Highly recommend!

Chicken was yum as well as the mashed potatoes and gravy. Didn't care for the cole slaw. Service was friendly. Chicken are sold individually, ranging from $2 for wings and drumsticks to $6 for chicken breasts. Wish they had family meals.
Really good chicken, not sure what the angry reviews were talking about.. So it's not cooked to order, but they make it right here so if you catch them at the right time, it is!!
Stumbled on this place and it looked promising so I stepped in: good decision.
Dry. Old. Cold. Soggy.
My heart dropped when I saw the guy reach under the counter for my fried chicken. No, there was no secret fryer under the counter.. It was just pre fried chicken.
This place gets a 3.5. It's good fried chicken - moist, tasty breading, etc. but I have a few gripes about this place:
I really love this place fried chicken is awesome. It reminds me of the Memphis. You must try the mashed potatoes and gravy.

So. The sides are pretty good: I had the beans, which were very nice, and the mashed potatoes were nice as well. The chicken itself (I had a thigh) was not bad, and I didn't mind it not being crunchy as others have lamented here. My big issue with it is that it was room temperature when it was pulled out of the warmer for me. Also, it was a bit on the salty side, as others have also mentioned. A nice hot piece of chicken would've been nice--maybe they'll figure that out in the future.

Whoa, I would not be surprised if my blood-pressure went sky high after eating at this place.  Many of their food items are extremely salty, almost to the point of being inedible.  The prices for the chicken are by the piece ($2.00 to $6.00) - wings being the cheapest and breast pieces, the most expensive.  Not worth the price, considering you can get a whole, cooked rotisserie chicken for $5 at some places, for example.  I'm not one to waste food, especially after over-paying for it, so I will have to re-purpose the chicken I got and incorporate it into another dish (maybe make chicken salad or chicken soup out of it).
Had to write this after our boss ordered from here for a loooong work weekend.  I had to go visit and check it out myself because the food is just that good!  So here's the scoop:

Last Monday, my wife and I were hanging out in NB and my wife said, she wanted to try this place. If you know my wife, you don't ever talk her out of eating fried chicken. She is a fried chicken connoisseur. So, we go in and my wife orders a thigh and drumstick. She starts eating her first piece and looks happy. As she starts on her 2nd piece, she whispers to me that its not very hot, but she finishes it. When we leave, she starts to tell the cashier, you know the seasoning of the chicken is really good, BUT (now, I knew this is where I should of pulled her out the door) it was COLD. She proceeded to explain that the chicken was like being at a picnic where the chicken just sits around all day at room temperature. I think instead my wife giving her opinon, she should have asked? Where was the chicken fried - at someone's house? because litterally when your handing the money with your right hand - they are handing you the chicken in your left hand. My wife's advice - don't eat here unless you like room temperature fried chicken!!!
Best fried chicken in all of SF!! No lie.

Been said to find what you do real well and do that. SFFCCo has done just that and in North Beach to  boot!!! Nothing but a pile of bones left on my plate. Potatos and green beans were great sides ... I'm a cream gravy skillet scraper kind of guy but was not disappointed in the gravy either ... Hope they find a spicy chicken version to add to the menu ....  Nice nice people from top to bottom, great service ....
I love fried chicken and have have it at any opportunity.
This is one of the places that I really wanted to like.  It's a small shop in sf that isn't a chain and serves a simple menu.  Unfortunately, it is just meet my standards for fried chicken.
Not bad.
The chicken pieces are really big and meaty.  Unfortunately, that's best part.
I live in Sunnyvale and I go all the way to sf just because of the customer service they provide! it's amazing !! I'll continue to visit this place !  staff is amazing !
Shrimp & Calamari app I was so delish!!! Staff very prompt & friendly.  Great place and service.

My family and I recently ate at Cioppino's for dinner and absolutely loved it! My husband and I split the pasta carbonara and agreed that it was the tastiest carbanara we had ever had. The sauce was the perfect texture, not to thick or thin, and the flavor was honestly perfect. I am lucky this restaurant is not in my neighborhood or I would put on way too much weight ordering this dish on a weekly basis. Our server was wonderful as well.

We've been living in Sydney for 8 years and have just moved back to California a month ago. We took the kids to SF for the first time and did all the touristy things including taking them to one of the mainstrip restaurants.
So, my first review ever is a bit mixed.
Very good pizza
Beautiful place to sit outside, enjoy the sun and a beer and people watch. You can never go wrong with a Stella or the local Dungeness crab cake appetizer.

Treated to a huge surprise by my lovely family.  We enjoyed our food for the most part. I had a steak that was cooked as I requested and they left that butter off as requested!  The menu can confuse so read carefully

Food good  new server, service sucks, not busy  cleanliness was good, quality good. ....just took too long for tab, refills, condiments and appetizer. ....id make a request, and she would of course wait ON other tables, prior to honoring my request.
NOT BAD....WILL RETURN AGAIN

I knew where I was heading when I set out on a solo walking adventure from the hotel.  Fort Mason, the Aquatic Park and then Cioppino's for lunch. I've never been to Cioppino's, but have walked by it many times and have always wanted to try it.

Sit on the patio or by the window for great food, great service, and oh the people watching on the wharf.  Nice diverse menu for adults and kids while fairly priced.  Clam chowder bowl was amazing...ate every drop.
After 10 minutes of wait we weren't offered anything to drink, even water. The server refused to take my order and so we left.

This place was jumping last night but we luckily had a reservation. It was so loud and crowded I cannot speak to its ambience but I can speak to the house specialty. The Cioppino is excellent. The tomato and fennel broth is hearty and comforting. There is generous amounts of crab, shrimp, calamari, mussels and white fish and they bring enough sourdough to sop up all the remnants of the dish. Pricey but worth it.
Good simple food. Good Prices. Good friendly service. Tasty.

The server Orlando, was very attentive, he took the time to talk with the kitchen and discuss our Gluten allergy and dairy allergy. He even came back to discuss concerns with us. the food came out as we asked, all modifications perfect. They can prepare any pasta dish with another sauce to work around allergies. Note: the gluten free pasta at this time contains egg and soy.

Food was pretty good.. Steak & Dungenous crab... Busy nite. Just as our food was ready... Waiter dropped our plates on the floor. So we waited another 25 mins for food.. However, they comped one of our meals... So all was good.

Have you ever felt the need to face plant in a seafood soup? If not, you may meet your fate at Cioppino's. The soup has the restaurants namesake. This hearty Italian soup is a tomato, fennel based sauce  that is a bit on the salty side, but is a great compliment to the fresh medley of seafood. The mussels were the star within the dish for me. The soup serving could feed up to 2 people. I ate all of mine. Alone.  (Applause)

I left an earlier review for this restaurant. We had a very unsatisfactory meal the other night. I emailed manager and told him and he has compensated our party for the meal. I must say that he was very good about feedback and maybe we just happened to choose a bad night to eat there. At any rate, I wanted to post that they take customer satisfaction seriously.
Always a great meal. Cioppino is so good. Salmon sandwich is recommended.  Super friendly staff.  Very welcoming.  I love to sit at this bar when traveling for business.
SIGH

Last minute choice due to inability to get reservations for 6 at any of the more storied North Beach Italian eateries. What a pleasant surprise! Immediate seating, cordial staff, very good wine selection, but most impressive was the red chile shrimp and calamari saute. I was tempted to lick the plate clean! Dungeness crab was good, my friends were equally complimentary about each dish...very fresh ingredients seasoned well and with noticeably generous seafood portions (i.e. shrimp, lump crabmeat, clams, calamari). We WILL be back.

Absolutely good food! Me And my husband wanted delicious fish on our last night visiting SF and got what we wanted! My husband ordered crab sandwich and I ordered fish n chips. The fish fell apart to the touch so it was perfectly cooked with a good amount of crunchy outside. The tartar sauce is really good as well. The Atmosphere indoors was great and music and lighting was great. Our waiter and hostess were warm and friendly.
The service was great! I love the ceasar salad from there! And the location is excellent
Ordered mussels and half of them were stinky. Couldn't eat it after three bites and HAD to send it back. Pretty sure they weren't fresh mussels too, tasted frozen...

The only reason I'm updating my precious perfect review is to say that ORLANDO is quite possibly the best server I've ever had.  Fantastic. Included my two year old daughter in the fun and kept it very personal without trying to hard. My hat goes off to him. This place is fantastic, and as always, we will return on our next trip to the city.
Casual Italian done right!!
My boyfriend and his father had their famous 'cioppino' soup and they said that it was average (they have had better).

Enjoyed the outdoor seating. Our server was friendly and efficient. Tried two kinds of salmon, plain and blackened...the blackened version was good. Sides of rice and veggies were fine although a little dry. Would return as we were satisfied with the overall experience for the price. Menu seemed a little healthier and a step up from some of the nearby restaurants with outdoor seating,

Got a great seat outside on a busy Saturday night.  Our server was awesome!  We had 2 appetizers and the Cioppino.  The crab cakes were simply delicious.  I can't remember the name of the other appetizer, some sort of spicy shrimp/calamari dish, but it was great, too.  This was my first time eating Cioppino and it was one of the best things I ate the whole weekend.  We will go back next time we're in town!

My entire family ate here during a recent trip to San Francisco. It had been a recommendation from some friends who were locals. Pretty easy to find once you're at Fisherman's Wharf. I loved the outside decor. Bright & fun, but still cozy. The restaurant looks very welcoming. The inside was equally nice.
to dine at cioppino's... or to not?!? personally i say pass as i really like to just eat at the little shacks at fisherman wharfs. but to each their own.
I'll keep this short and sweet:
"Famous cioppino" was alright.  Had better at the monterrey pier.  The portion was good but the soup a little salty.

Typical tourist trap restaurant. Place had a noisy environment, pricy items and mediocre flavors. My friend had a coupon for 10% off here that lead to our poor decision to eat here. We ordered the clam chowder and cioppino. While we waited they gave us bread that was so chewy it would've been a better toy for a dog. Cippono had good seafood but flavor was bit lacking. Clam chowder didn't dissapoint and had more flavor than cioppino. Dishes were on the small side for their price. Would not come here again.

used a coupon offering a free cup of clam chowder with your entree. It was very noisy outside seating, due to the construction on Jefferson Street, but inside it was ok on the noise. We could talk without being disturb by the street renovation noise, inside. We had the sphegetti and meat balls, and the Italian Meatloaf. Both were ok, with large generous servings. The Meat balls and the Meatloaf were the same flavor to me. I tasted them both. The prices were fair for San Francisco, I normally would not pay that much at my home town. The waiter and busboys were very attentive at our initial sitting. The waiter stopped by several times to ask if we needed any thing else, and check on us to see, if every thing was going well. I purposely did not tell him about my empty water glass to see if he would notice it. He did not. So, I had to ask him to refill it, and he promptly did. I sensed the waiter was new at this job, cause the Greeter had to explain to him, how to knock off the price of the two free cups of clam chowder of the bill.  I would go back there again, when I pass by Fisherman's Wharf. But, there are lots of other competitive restaurants in the area. The free cup of chowder is the drawing card in my case.
Very good! A bit crowded. Good potion of the Fettucine Alfredo and the fried Calamari.

Very large restaurant and thus VERY loud. Difficult to hear the person sitting next to me. Food was awful. My son's Fettuccine Alfredo was inedible due to the ridiculous amounts of garlic. The sangria was some awful powdered mix that tastes mostly like fruit punch. The seafood pasta special was more pasta than anything else. The list goes on but I don't feel like wasting anymore time on this restaurant. The only redeeming factor here was the service.

This place is way to overpriced. The food is not worth the money. Ordered coffee, it came out cold. Took the waiter about 10 minutes to actually come up to us. Waited another 10 min, for the check. Wouldn't recommend this.place to anyone.

Came here with the whole family, including kids 12 and under. This is a great spot for dinner and very kid-friendly. Also, very friendly service. So far the best clam chowder we have had in SF. My hubby had the cioppino (with whole crab legs) and loved it. I had the crab cakes and they were delicious with the mango salsa. I especially liked the wild rice with veggies as it really complimented the dish. The lasagna was very meaty and fresh. We went at 5 pm on a weekday and were seated immediately at a nice roomy table. Don't forget to use the Yelp coupon for a free cup of clam chowder (1 free with entree; 2 max).
As far as sandwiches go, I have to say this place is pretty bomb.
Eating sandwiches from here makes my pants tighter, in more ways than one. Closest thing to a Publix sandwich in San Francisco.

The Molinari Special was probably one of the best Italian meat sandwiches that I've ever had in my life!  The two Lyft rides that I used to get here from SOMA was well worth the trip.  Inside, the place is an old school deli with a large long counter with a huge glass display of all the meats on offer.  They  have the number dispenser thing near the front so make sure to grab one before ordering.  The sandwich list is listed above the case and make sure to grab your bread from the sealed bread case, I got dutch crunch for me.

I have been several times and each time this place is great. Great food, Great people, and the prices are reasonable. Go early and make sure you make the best choice on your sandwich the choices are many and the combinations are vast. The good thing is that you cant go wrong with any of them. Some of the fun is watching the newbies navigate the Number grabbing and bread selecting process. Hands down the best deli in North Beach.
best Italian sandwich in the city
Wow. The north beach sandwich is amazing. On par with little Lucca and Ike's, although the dutch crunch was a bit harder than I expected it to be.
love love love love love!!!
Classic Italian deli. Fresh meats and cheese, good bread (picked yourself from a wooden box), fast service, and a tempting wall of Italian wines.  Nothing fancy, thank goodness.

Absolutely delicious sandwiches. The guys here have the best ingredients and are pumping them out all day. Interesting how they have you choose your own bread but it really makes for a great experience when you walk in and it's a little busy. Grab your ticket and peruse the shops a little. Check out the cheese and grab yourself a drink. Everything is good so just go for it.

We stopped by here on the way home and got some sandwiches to go. Great sandwiches, fresh cheeses and deli meats. There was a small wait but the service is friendly and helps with selections. The roma tomato and fresh mozarella sandwich was awesome! You can eat outside the Deli or take it to go. This is the best deli in San Francisco.

This place is delicious, but can be confusing. We did not realize until a person waiting explained to us we need to grab a number and a roll of bread from the bread bin. The food is amazing each sandwich is sliced per order, tons of antipasto to choose from, and there are some many of bottle of wines. I went with one of the Moscotos from Italy. I can definitely see this place has be around as long as it has.

We trusted our Yelp friends and they were right!  Showed up early for lunch, picked out our bread and got two italian special sandwiches.  Delish!  Really great sandwiches.  We would definitely go back again.  Nothing better than a good italian deli sandwich.  YUM.
I don't eat beef and pork, but the sandwiches here are still amazing.
Well, the Yelpers have done it again. I was searching for a great sandwich last week in SF and this came up with really good solid tips and reviews. So, off i went.
If you love a great sandwich...this is the place for you.

The sandwiches are very good, but what truly earns this place 5 stars is the Italian market within. It reminds me of the great Italian specialty stores of the east coast. While the sandwich is not the best in the city in my opinion, the availability of Italian specialty foods is! A must visit for any SF resident or visitor!

Hands down one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. When you first walk in, there's a bunch of meats hanging and all different types of meats and cheeses in their fridge. You pick a number, go to the back and pick a bread. They're pre sliced for the sandwich and the breads are fresh. You wait until they call your number and pick the type of sandwich you want.
The quintessential old school, family, Italian delicatessen.  A North Beach institution & tradition.
This is a divey, (somewhat) dusty little deli that just happens to have awesome produce and sandwiches... it's a must if you're in the North Beach area!
Five stars from me! If you've got a little bit of extra time to wait in line on a Saturday (they close at 6 pm on weekdays), Molinari is a little slice of heaven.

Renzo special on Foccacia. A good sandwich. Perhaps I was expecting a bit more considering how much talk there's been about it, but solid regardless. A couple of funny dudes in there, fu*king with all the clueless euro tourists.
Amazing sandwich. Prosciutto to die for.

This review is long overdue as I've been getting sandwiches here forever. The best lunchtime sandwich for my money in San Francisco any day. This is an old school joint, beloved by many and a San Francisco institution. When I don't have to take clients to a fancier establishment for lunch I always stop by here. Sometimes you just need a good sandwich for lunch instead and this place never disappoints. Anything on the menu is great, but I always get the Luciano special. Hot panini with sundries tomatoes, prosciutto, cheese, lettuce. Perfection on focaccia.
Most amazing sandwich I've ever had! Freshly cut rare roast beef, first place I stop everytime I come to SanFran!

Fantastic fresh pasta made on Fridays.  If you call Vince ahead of time, he'll set some aside for you, as they run out.  Slice spicy sausage into their homemade meat sauce, and this dinner is so easy and a home run every time!  Love this place.
Hands down, best deli in the city. Classic Italian is always my go-to. There is almost always a line, but is it ALWAYS worth it.

These people have no respect nor knowledge of sanitary rules. They grab the salami or whatever with NO glove NO tongs, they slam the slice  in your sandwich and then with the SAME hand they grab the money and on they go to the next one...
Came here last Monday, and really enjoyed it.  Needed a place to grab a late lunch after going up Coit Tower, and a sandwich sounded like just about the best thing ever.

My friends and I came to Molinari's for some good old fashioned sandwiches.  They have a variety of meats and cheeses to choose from, while also offering some side dishes.  The interesting thing about this place is that you literally choose your own bread.  You go to the box with all the bread rolls, pick the one you want, and hand it to the guy to make your sandwich.  The South Beach and Molinari's sandwiches were good and hearty, but we all agreed that the bread itself was stiff and a little stale.

There are some things in San Francisco that are unique.  Molinari Deli is one of those places. The signature Charcuterie is one of the best in the country and rivals that from Italy. The little Italian deli cranks out fantastic sandwiches, like the Renzo Special. Fresh ingredients, and quick service make this a classic. Get a soda and take your Food up to Columbus square to.eat or take it for later like we did.

These people are terrible at returning phone calls and Joe is a two faced typical 3rd generation wannabe!  He lacks respect, and would be nothing more than a shoe shine boy in Chinatown if it weren't for his mommy and daddy giving him the place!  In another 15 years, it will be a another Chinese dump anyway!

Came here on a food tour. It was one of our stops and I am sure glad it was. I went back to purchase a pound of perfectly sliced and flavored salami! Get a number as soon as you walk in, grab some bread and pick your sandwich! Great food, great service.

My favorite deli by far! They have the best sandwiches here. They work with a local baker so the bread is brought in fresh everyday and you go choose your roll and give it to them and they make you the sandwich or your choice. I have had both the south beach and north beach sandwiches and they are both so good ! Try to come before he lunch hour craze because it gets crowded.

This is what a deli is supposed to be. When you walk in you feel like you stepped into a little deli in Rome or something. It's such a cool place. They have a huge display of fresh meats and cheeses and you can kind of scope out what's going to go into your sandwich before you order.

Very tasty. DUH. Just go try it out already. Don't forget your bun. Mozarella is unsalted for all the salt fiends out there; if you so choose that option. Take your salt. But what fresh mozarella isss salted? I should've known. Very good sandwich.

the sandwiches are ok less meat than I would like. so I suggest buy the meat and chesse and bread  separate and throw it together yourself . it would cost about the same but a lot more meat and chesse..

It's a good Italian deli but seems more like a place to go because it's a landmark.  The premium Italian cold cuts are really good,  no doubt about it. The bread leaves a bit to be desired unless you happen to literally get a fresh batch. The wait is nuts at lunch... Even on a Saturday afternoon, I waited 30 minutes from door to sandwich.  There are numerous places equal or considerably better in New York City.  But this is San Francisco. I would come back if seeking a good deli sandwich but would not go out of my way. I am being somewhat generous with four stars.  But the staff is friendly and they also have great sides.  For sandwiches,  the North Beach Special and Sausage Sandwich are great.

Dont get me wrong! The sandwiches are deliciously fresh and tasty.  However I do not like that people get their own rolls in the case.  Doesn't seem the most hygenic to me.  And when I was there yesterday I noticed that after ringing someone up and touching the money, the worker simply then used hand sanitizer gel instead of washing properly with soap and water before making the next sandwich.  Also, when I bit down, there was a hard pebble of a sort in the sandwich, and it hurt like hell.  Coincidentally, I see the health department score of 72 on their yelp site... YIKES!! Given that, I won't be back.

It was nearly empty when we walked in at 10 am on a Thursday morning, which is the way I like it. We got enough for a picnic - typical antipasto - mushrooms, artichokes, sun dried tomatoes, mozzarella balls, seafood salad, olives, cheeses. Their olives were delicious and the cheeses were excellent - great variety. The seafood salad, not so much. I had high hopes for it, but the marinade was sour and offputting. We ended up throwing it out, which was a shame.
Don't know how I haven't written a review for this place yet...

Ordered the tonkotsu ramen with added spicy sauce. There were just too many things going on the ramen to give it a true flavor. Ginger was too over powering, the spicy sauce was basically chili sauce covering half of my soup and on top of all that the soup came out luke warm.

Japanese-Korean relations are frosty at best, but all's fair in love and ramen. Like when Lee's Deli puts Chinese-style chashu pork in their ramen bowl. Noodle ninja masters in Japan would keel over from the inauthenticity, but hell, it still tastes good. This was once a straightforward Japanese ramen spot called Kirimachi, but now under new management, they serve up Korean BBQ Ramen. What the... Anyway, I wanted to give it a try, but it wasn't open in the evenings until recently. When I saw it was, I took the 12-Folsom/Pacific and traipsed up Telegraph Hill to get there after work one evening.
I went there for lunch today hunting for new ramen places. The bowl was overall good, got Ramen noodles with japanese style pork, standard dish. All good.
Not the best ramen I had but nice place, nice staff and if you don't want to leave North Beach for a Ramen, this a place to go.

worst noodle ramen ever. The ramen has no taste, the noodle was not cooked correct. nothing is going on right this place. i think the cook thinks its friday were they dont care about the taste on there foods, friday when drunk as people go here for sober up time. this place need some miracle. why they think they can serve ramen when its taste like instant noodle fron supermarket. YUK...!!!
Ramen here was excellent and very reasonable at $10 - go for the BBQ Korean pork and tonkonstu sauce and I would recommend adding volcano spice for $1!
THIS IS THE SPOT!

Quite possibly the cleanest ramen you will ever have. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it doesn't lend to what I would consider "good" ramen. I would look for a dirtier tastier ramen place personally.
I love the Japanese style chashu ramen...great and fast service...
Worst ramen I've ever had. Broth is watery and tasteless and the noodles are instant.
I am honestly surprised at all of the positive reviews on here. Maybe I just had a bad batch but I ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen and it was barely mediocre.
Ramen noodles tasted like they had been in the freezer too long. Broth was flavorless. Pork was overcooked. Nice people overall, but I wouldn't eat here until they improve on the food.
If the ramen is too salty, ask for hot water
I tried the bbq bief and rice. It was so good! Delicious food for a good price and a really friendly staff. I love it!!

This place replaced the old Kirimachi Ramen shop! Located on Broadway street, it is definitely a hard place to find parking. Staff was nice, waiter was kinda awkward... LOL Not that I'm going to complain about since I am an awkward person myself. :x
The selfish part of me that wants to keep awesome spots from getting deluged doesn't want to write this. But that wouldn't be nice, as this new ramen and rice plate spot in Jackson Square is a gem!
Time: 12:43pm/65°F mostly cloudy

I was craving some ramen, so I was happy to find a ramen place so close to my work! I came here with two of my friends around 1pm on a Friday and it was relatively empty and quiet. Service was quick, attentive, and friendly though. We got edamame on the house! Woo!

Cheap and cheerful and nice to have a japanese place amidst all the italian stuff. Ramen and gyoza are excellent!! My go to for cheap and cheerful! A hiddrn gem on broadway so please come here if youre around the area and cant find anything decent!
Relatively cheap place but nothing outstanding either. Service was very fast, friendly, and attentive.
One of my favorite places to stop by for a nice warm bowl of noodles! Must try is the sweet buns as well!
I go here and order the same thing, tonkatsu ramen because it is delicious. Each ingredient compliments each other well. $9 and my belly is full and I am feeling good.

Really good ramen.  We ordered the tonkatsu, which came with an egg, two pieces of pork, corn, sprouts, and some other accoutrement.  I'm really happy they moved into the neighborhood.  We liked Kiramachi when they were here and were missing a Japanese place to break up the sea of Italian restaurants in North Beach.

Went here last Saturday and we supper excited when our food arrived. Then, we ate our soup and it was just ok. My tempura style ramen was a major fail. It's really obvious that they fry there frozen veggies in very old oil, or so it seems. You can smell that old recycled oil smell from the bowl they serve you in. My families dinner plate was ok and better than the ramen but again small soggy frozen veggies were used =( The one really good item there were the sweet buns. I'm gonna give ramen another try, but definitely not here!
I ordered lunch with my

I ordered a ramen and the noodles that they used were definitely not the Japanese noodles. You can easily tell that the noodles were more like a Chinese noodle. The tonkotsu broth tasted like something that came out of the package that comes with instant noodles.
Yummy tonkasu Raman !!!

Tonkotsu broth was very tasty but not too rich, which I liked. Mom got the miso which was not as flavorful. Noodles were of good consistency and a solid amount of toppings. Soft boiled egg was perfect. Gyoza was nice and crispy, but maybe not $6 for 6 great. Edamame on the house :)

Came with the family and we all got Chashu ramen. They had Tonkotsu and Miso. Also got gyoza to start off dinner. The service was very nice. Ramen had a lot of different toppings which was great. Egg bean sprouts bamboo ginger corn mmmmm. New place I'd recommend giving it a shot!
Yay! Finally a good ramen place that near my work! It's funny how its located in the Red Light District though!

Came here with my wife for dinner and was promptly seated by a smiling waiter. We were pretty hungry so i went ahead and ordered the Sweet Potato Fries and Deep Fried Sweet Buns for appetizers. I ended up ordering the Korean style BBQ Pork Ramen and my wife chose  the Korean Style Beef Rice Plate. The waiter came back shortly after taking our orders with our teas and an order of edamame on the house.

This is my 2nd time here and I ordered the gyoza, sweet buns and ramen. Everything was tasty.  The ramen was good and the soup base was to my liking. Yum. very friendly service which is always a plus to me.

So excited a ramen place opened in my neighborhood! This place feels super new, the owner is so welcoming/accommodating and the food just tops it all off. Their miso is great, and its a huge serving! I usually take half of it home.

Came by for lunch yesterday and had the Korean BBQ pork ramen. Aside from the delicious broth and meat, the portion was also quite big considering that it's only $8.50. Service was excellent and the waiters were really nice to us.

Came here with my girls Saturday night and had a yummy bowl of their KBBQ ramen! Meat was super tender, broth, and noodles were just the way I liked it! Oh and did I mention edamame on the house for grand opening? ^_^
The ramen broth wasn't hot, more like lukewarm and the broth was very watery and didn't have a good taste to it. I was not impressed with this place, they need to step up their ramen game.

Don't let this tiny place in between huge gentlemen's clubs scare you because you would be missing out! Came here on a cold, windy day to eat something warm and soupy. Ordered the Korean style bbq pork ramen with tonkotsu. It came with bean sprouts, black fungus, corn, bamboo shoots, seaweed, spinach, and a heap of grilled pork! You can tell they marinade their pork for a while because it tastes wonderful! I ended up eating the whole bowl and drinking all the soup. Their sweet potato fries are also very yummy. They make it tempura style with a side of ponzu sauce which I loooove! Definitely will come again soon!
I was around the area for a meeting today and dropped in this ramen place for lunch with my co-worker.  I ordered a Korean Style BBQ Ramen and she ordered a Mix Tempura Ramen.
This is more of a 1.5 star due to a slight bump from extremely friendly service and a lovely space. The food was really blah though, which is what matters most to me.

I am not a ramen expert, but this place wowed me.  The tokotsu broth had good flavor and the egg was done just how I like it.  Bonus points for nice service and being generous with the toppings.  I will be back.
Great place to have a cappuccino and watch the world go by. Try their cheesecake and gelato too; makes for the perfect coffee break!
Went there for dessert and coffees.  Great capoucino's and homemade tiramisu was good but I think mine is better. Great place to have some espresso and chill.
We had breakfast here, and were able to sit outside right by the street. The scrambled eggs and ham bagel was delicious, and hubby loved the ham, cheese and poached eggs on a muffin.
Very cute Italian cafe that's perfect for:
Pleasant morning stop for a latte and the best scones around. Genuinely nice guys behind the counter leave you with a smile.
Come for the coffee, stay for the dessert.
Nice cafe with inside and outside seating.

Living in the neighborhood, I tend to avoid Columbus, but Cafe Greco is one of my exceptions. This is my go-to for working remotely. Free WiFi, plenty of tables inside and out, friendly service, great espresso drinks, and a good food menu. The bagel with cream cheese and tomato is my favorite--they add olive oil & spices to the tomatoes first which makes it delicious! Great place for working, reading the paper, or people watching. They'd get five stars from me if they accepted credit cards.
Great place if you like choking on tobacco smoke--yuk. You should be able to pick up a case of lung cancer in one evening.

Great tiramisu avg cookies very busy and make sure to have cash. Good news is they do have an ATM if you need it. Good atmosphere lot of seating inside and out. Felt very disorganized to order and who to order with. Sometimes it was they guy bussing the tables and others it was the guy filling the orders. Very disjointed experience. Probably more like 3.5 stars. Cookies were dry but if you had coffee they were perfect more like biscotti. Want to come back and give them a shot at lunch rather than just deserts. Menu looked great

Came very late at night for a coffee chat and some dessert. Love how it was open on a weekend so late at night! Coffee was supposedly Illys which I love but I thought it tasted just ok. I had the cheesecake and was kind of disappointed by lack of flavor/how fluffy it tasted. Also tried the fruit tart and was very disappointed by how hard the crust was and how bland it was as well. Maybe it was because it was late at night but overall the cafe was messy and nobody bothered to clear the table/clean any of them so when we got there we had to wipe it down and bus it ourselves. Liked it because it was open late at night but wouldn't visit if I had another choice.

I walked in and it smelt like Europe. Absolutely wonderful coffees and delicious cannolis!! Loved the big windows and classical music. I wish I lived in San Francisco so I could become a regular. **They are cash only**

Was looking for a good panini in this area and ran upon this place, which had very high reviews. I have been to other similar establishments nearby, and am therefore comparing this panini to their next door competitors as well when scoring.
Great illy brand cappuccino. Ok Cannoli. But the service isn't as bad as people are saying. Maybe be nicer to them? Or be prettier? I don't know.
Still my favorite gather-your-thoughts, work-on-your-side-projects, catch-up-on-work spot in SF.
Good coffee. Straightforward service. Definitely recommend. Grabbed some coffee with a friend and sat out in front to people watch and catch up. Great place to hang out. Also has free WiFi.
Pros: This place has an awesome breakfast menu, so it's perfect for early work - eat and then focus on your laptop with the huge coffee beverage you chose from the looong list of options :)
The desserts are nothing to write home about, service is mediocre at best.  Tiramisu... Well, I've had better. If you have a favorite place to have dessert at, go there... If not... This might be ok.

Did you say illy? I was sold!! Their espresso here is just outstanding. Even my cappuccino was just out of this world. The guys who works here I think their "AiTalian?" Either way, my friends were frothing over them; especially the tall, dark and handsome one!! They should wear tighter pants, it might get them bigger tips!  Werk it ya know!!

I was led here by the reviews and I was really hoping for some great coffee but upon asking the guy what was the difference between a couple things on the menu he started joking with a couple of his coworkers. I ordered a cappuccino and got more of a latte even though I was trying to avoid all the milk. the coffee was ok and the outside atmosphere was probably the best part of my experience here.
Living in North Beach, a good double cappuccino at Caffe Greco sitting street side is one of my favorite past times. Sinfully delicious you'll never want to leave.

My fav cafe during my entire SF trip!!  The guys working there are so much fun, happy, friendly to all the customers in line!! Extremely accommodating, and quick!  Finding friendly service in this city was actually quite a challenge so these guys were very refreshing!! Cute little sidewalk cafe and the food was very good. A must stop if you need a friendly face during your trip!!!

I'm all about giving people the benefit of the doubt and avoiding bad reviews, but this place earned a solid one star for its horrible service. The barista said, "what do you want?" Made my drink, slammed it on the counter and threw a spoon at me. No exaggeration. Apparently this place is "too popular" to care about the everyday customers that keep them in business. Go to one of the other cafés in the area where you'll at least get a smile with your order - life's too short to deal with a-holes :)
I've been coming to Caffe Greco for the past 5-6 years and I can always count on a great cup of Illy's cappuccino!

My favorite place for relaxing on a weeknight evening for a warm drink and some people watching. While I do like the coffee, I usually order the hot steamed milk, sometimes with almond syrup. It makes me feel all cozy and comfy while we sit outside an watch the world go by. The staff is super friendly and very efficient. I like that you can also order wine and beer if you so desire.
Still good deserts but horrible, unfriendly service. Mean, never smiling, arrogant men. Still they don't even bother to give you change; they drop coins into the tips cup themselves.
It's been while since I've been here but nothing has changed. Still love their tiramisu and lattes. Awesome place to people watch too!

We love this place! The best latte I have ever had. And we love the egg sandwiches. We came here every morning of our vacation.....even though we had other breakfast spots picked out. Glad we went here first!

Caffe Greco was the perfect finish to a lazy Sunday. They have a pretty large indoor seating area as well as some tables outside. This cafe is unpretentious, down-to-earth, and offers a solid selection of sandwiches, desserts, and coffee. I would love to come here in the afternoon for a cappuccino and some people-watching.
Tiramisu! It melts in your mouth!

Walking all over North Beach, Chinatown, and Union Square. I'm tired and looking for a place to veg out and relax. So walking around Columbus and looking for a nice coffee shop then I come across Cafe Greco. I've been here before and had a seat inside. Atmosphere is okay inside and a little hot. So today we've decided to try the outside table. Outside seating are all two seat tables.

I was in  San Fran for a week and this was my spot, total European feel, and really the best cappuccino i've ever had. Just going there and enjoying a cafe on the street makes you feel like your in Paris or Rome!
best coffee hands down. expresso made to perfection.  I dont know what blend they use but its good.
Love love love this place. The customer service is exceptional. Every time I come to Caffe Greco I feel welcome. Great caffe latte, nice place to relax and enjoy.  My favorite caffe.

Our food was simple, fresh, and delicious. The prosciutto, mozzarella, and roast pepper panini was crispy but not tough and bursting with umami. The mixed greens were well-dressed in a tart vinaigrette, but those who like subtler flavors might want to ask for dressing on the side. The latte was foamy and delightful, a perfect start to an afternoon of walking the city.
First time here. The service was ok. I went here for dessert with a friend and got something called sacripantina cake. It was pretty good but I have nothing to compare it to.

This place has a nice feeling of a city cafe, unfortunately their cookies are so dry absolutely no taste to their desserts. The coffee was so so but people come here because they are open late. Italian caffe with horrible desserts. Buck up guys...

I don't believe in charging tax when it is cash only. I just don't agree with it. Also, I think I got ripped off. I don't know why two orders of coffee is supposed to be more than 10 dollars when on the menu it is supposed to be like 7 dollars...... :) I asked about the price but the cashier just looked at me and did not say anything.
Love this place. Great coffee, great food, great outdoor seating. This is my happy place.  The staff is wonderful as well and tend to remember you, even if you are not a consistent regular customer.

I really enjoy Caffe Greco! The fact that many locals keep coming in tells you something about an area that can get touristy. The customer service is always really friendly, there is ample seating inside and out (something you don't often find in North Beach) and the drinks and food are delicious! Makes me really miss living in Europe, because it does have that type of vibe.  The only reason they got 4 stars instead of 5 stars is that it's a bit on the pricey side.
The crepes are delicious and the service was fast and nice even though there was only three employees working
Banana Nutella crepe... Amazing. My wife and I loved it. Fast service even when it was busy.  We got ours for breakfast, but I really want to try some of their savory ones for lunch.
Tasty light snacks. Tried the veggie crepe and the florentine crepe. Liked the florentine one.

We had the pesto crepe with garlic fries after craving for a crepe. It was made fresh to order and hot on delivery. Flavors were well balanced and satisfying for the two of us. What a great way to eat and see the sea lions from the pier.

Ok the crepe we had here was not bad, but I've had sooooo much better crepes for cheaper prices in other restaurants. We got the turkey pesto crepe and it was just lackluster. It had turkey ham, pesto, and avocado, and really didn't taste any better than something I would make at home. I can't speak for the dessert crepes, but if this is your first time trying a crepe, trust me that crepes are better than this.

On Aug 17, 2014, we came for breakfast at 9:15am and the staff told us that they were still closed.   I pointed out that in their hours, it has 9am as opening time, they just said they are not yet ready and to wait 10 more minutes.   We moved on to eat at another place nearby.   Business, LOST.

I believe people who write reviews should not feel bad about being objective. I am visiting SF and know that pier 39 is a tourist attraction and that things are usually overpriced but even thieves have to have some honor.
Looking for a quick dessert, my fiancée and I decided to try a crepe from Crepe Cafe. We ordered a strawberry and Nutella, which set us back about $9. Flavour-wise, the crepe was delicious.
I typically avoid the tourist spots in SF, but my girlfriend and I heard that this place was actually pretty good. She had the Turkey Pesto crepe and I had the Hawaiian.
Good crepes.  No very authentic and $$$$

This little place was attracted to me and other tourists because it is in pier 39. My friend and I were so tired from walking a lot, so we decided to stop by this place and get French crepes. There weren't a lot of people on that day. We walked up and ordered. She had the Nutella and banana crepe. I had jammin crepe filled with raspberry cream. It was ok. Yes..their crepe was soft but I've had better.

We got the strawberry and Nutella crepe.  They put a lot of powdered sugar and whipped cream on for you.  Be careful when you walk outside with the crepe,  because it gets windy in sf. All that sugar blew onto my fiance ' face. Lol. We had no idea until I looked up and saw sugar all over her face.  Good crepe.
Good food but didn't have French fries as advertised with multiple posters in the cafe.

I do not usually write review like this but I should at this time.  My friend and I ordered mixed fruit crepe which is #7 and we spitted it out at first bite. I did not expect really good crepe on pier 39, but also did not expect SO BITTER taste for dessert. We could not swallow at all. I think the cook put something wrong in ours. It was the worst choice for dessert after having fantastic crab dinner. Holy CRAB dinner and Holy CRAP Crepe.
Tried their banana and nutella crepe when I was in SF for a visit! LOVE! Look through the window while waiting for your order and watch them make your crepe!

This place is great for crepes. I tasted both the lunch/dinner crepe and dessert crepes. I personally feel the dessert crepes are a little overpriced. The filling is very less. Need more fruits. But they are delicious!
Nutella crepe with banana, strawberry, whipped creme, and powdered sugar... Best thing I've ever had in my life.
The lemon crepe was my favorite.  So tart and delicious!  It was a perfect start to exploring the area.  On my list for future visits!  Definitely a winner for crepe lovers.

I am from France, and my parents from Morocco.  I know crepes and been eating them my whole life! And these crepes are some of the best outside of my country I have ever eaten! Every time I visit SF I must stop by for some crepes, Nutella and banana. mmmmmm :)
OK crepes, mediocre fillings. Tourist prices but better than most on Pier 39.
Freakin amazing creeps I would say. A little pricy on the side but everything was fresh and delish!
I ordered the nutella and banana crepe, and it was delicious.  They didn't skimp on either of the ingredients as well, so it was pretty stuffed.

Had the breakfast crêpe with turkey and it was amazing! The turkey they used tasted like it was carved fresh and the crêpe itself was cooked perfect. Service was fast so no complaints there. Would definitely recommend.
Something fun

I use to come here all the time when I worked in SF it was my favorite crepe place in the city. Went there today asked them to cook my dessert crepe a little longer to make it crispy they AGREED but they were to busy cooking them back to back since there was a line. My order was ready 1 minute after I ordered didn't even get a chance to sit down,  my crepe was no where near crispy I asked them to remake it since my Nutella crepe was falling off my fork. All I got was a lot of attitude and told they don't make them crispy even though I clearly told him that's what I wanted when ordering and he said no problem.

going here for a while now, i can say that the quality went downhill.  used to be that even if there's a huge line waiting, they make sure that their crepes are made close to perfection.  nowadays, seems like they do not care.  for the last two times i ordered, crepes were burnt, very dry and at times rubbery.  sad!
Great crab crepe and garlic fries. A happy tourist. Please visit my blog for the full blog post.

Couldn't resist stopping here while walking around pier 39.  The amazing aroma of fresh crepes lured us in.  We were lucky enough to grab the only table inside!  We shared the banana Nutella crepe and i must say it was an excellent choice.  The service was efficient and friendly - the crepe was freshly made - hot, filled with lots of sliced bananas, melted Nutella and finished off with whipped cream.  Splurge and enjoy!

PERFECT place to order crepes (especially if it is your first time), actually best place to order crepes! My first time eating a crepe and ever since then I have never tasted a crepe like the ones at The Crepe Café, I miss NorCal!

The Crepes here are clean and simple, you are not going to get a crazy combination of hot links and mashed potatoes with cheese. They serve your good ol fashioned fruit crepes and your everyday savory selections as well.
I love their veggie crepes with avocado on them, it feels tasty and heavy with the cheese, avocado and sprouts. My family has relished their banana Nutella crepe which is delicious
Banana nutella crepe was alright. The propotion of the filling (bananas and nutella ) are also good. But nothing special really. The crepe itself is okay.. soft and fluffy.

This is a hidden gem among the more touristy spots in Pier 39. They make delicious sweet and savory crepe combinations right before your eyes, at a reasonable price. If you don't want to eat at a watered down burger joint with a 'fun' sounding name, then I would recommend you check this place out.

The crepes were really good, but they really could use more table seating opportunities. If I have to use a fork and knife, I want a table, not a paper plate in my lap sitting on a bench. It was good, but not sure I'd come back for lack of tables.

Standard crepe place. Not too expensive. I had the ham and cheese crepe. My wife had the breakfast plus. It's cool because they make it in front of you. Worth a shot when walking around the pier. Not as special as I thought it would be. Wish I would've ordered the ghirardelli chocolate one.
...this was an amazing crepe place to eat!  We went back twice and had tried a total of 4 crepes, and each one was delicious!
Oh man.. I was in San Fran for about a week and I went to this place 3 times!... And I had the Ghirardelli chocolate crepe every single time.. with whipped cream of course!

We always pass by The Crepe Café whenever we're at Pier 39 in San Francisco and the place is always packed so we never stop by.  We were there again a few weeks ago for a wedding and I finally had to try it. If it's that busy I'd assume they must have good food right?  I waited for over 15 minutes for my strawberry and banana crepe and it looked really good.  When I finally got to try it, I was really disappointed.  There was nothing special at all with my crepe so I'm still not sure with all the hype.  It tasted dry and was bland in flavor.  Unless I had a bad batch I'm not sure if I'd stop by here again.

I absolutely love love love this place. I come here every time I go to Pier 39. Their crepes are made to perfection. My favorite is the strawberry, banana, and nutella. It's the only one I get (but I've been meaning to try more)!
A regular crepe place.

My husband and I used to visit this café really often BUT ABSULETLY NOT ANYMORE!!! He greets us well most of the time and have conversation with us while he makes the coffee BUT if his wife is there he just ignores me every single time. Really! Can you believe this? He barely takes our order or talk to us if his wife is there with him. This is really unprofessional. It really made me feel weird! I felt like I'm doing something wrong and I shouldn't be there.

My husband and I stopped here and split a panini (Delicious!!!) so that we would have room for cappuccinos and cannoli.  Seriously - the BEST in North Beach.  We were so impressed that we plan to keep returning and work our way through the menu. (Look for it on the chalkboard near the ceiling) Cavalli Cafe is definitely worth the stop!
The Cannoli left me speechless! Tastes like heaven! Filled in at the moment of order. The espresso is also excellent.
This is a husband and wife run cafe. They run the place themselves 7 days a week and has been doing it for the past 9 years.  Super nice people.

I came here at the suggestion of a friend who declared "Cavalli has the best espresso in San Francisco." He was right! Not only is the coffee just like what I get in Italy, Santo, the owner is very friendly and accommodating. He shared with me the history of Cavalli, which has been in SF for about 130 years, but he also made me an excellent panini.

I am Italian and moved to San Francisco 10 years ago. Since i found Cavalli  3 years ago i don't miss Italy anymore. The whole menu' is worth it to try,anything will transport you to memories of Italy  and, if you never been there, it will give you a sample of the flavors of Italy.
Free wifi! Best cappuccino!! Wonderful tiramisu! Very nice staff :)

My wife and I visited this little cozy cafe after visiting Alcatraz. We initially came for a cannoli and coffee but ordered 2 sandwiches, 1- tuna and 1- caprese. We met Santo who owns Cavalli. He was very friendly and courteous. Our sandwiches were served on a beautiful black slate board with a skewered olive. Both were fantastic and flavorful in taste. The flavors complimented each other and one did not overpower the next. The bread is crusty and homemade. Great texture and bite. Our cannoli arrived next and was presented just like my nana did when I was growing up. The first bite of the shell brought back the aroma and taste of my childhood. It was a perfect cannoli. Thank you Santo.
This little place has some fantastic paninis, I had the one with mozzarella and the one with prosciutto and they were delicious!

This place has so much Italian history for the city and the neighborhood for the last 130 years.  The caffe, tiramisu, and cannolo are amazing. This place really brings a european vibe not a place to work but enjoy life and talk about the day. I cant say enough about this place to my friends and family, but last if you are up to it feel free to parla italiano when you order as it is part of the Cavalli Cafe culture.
One of North Beach's hidden gem for the most authentic tiramisu!
This place was my usual morning coffee stop while in SF. Great coffee, good service. A must if you appreciate a fine cup of coffee.

This place has one of the best Cannoli. It is not on display, they make it right in front of you. I like that it is not super sweet as in other places and you can taste how fresh it is. Coffee is great too. Will come back and try other deserts.
Very good Italian vibe, great fresh cannoli. If you're in North Beach you should definitely go there for authentic Italian pastry.
Best Home made Tiramisu and freshly made Canoli.
OK, fasten your seat belt.  After reading this I hope one will send a message to Cafe Cavalli that racism is a horrible social cancer and should not be tolerated.
This cafe has the best atmosphere and coffee around little Italy! Not crowded at all, the service is good and their ice mokas are great!
Great coffe, expensive but worth the visit! Staff is great and the place has italian music and decoration telling the history of the traditional store. They only accept cash, which is not a problem.

I'm Italian and Cavalli has the best Italian coffee and desserts I have found in the U.S. Cavalli also serves the only cannoli made fresh on the spot that I have seen in the U.S. or even Italy these days. Anytime I come to San Francisco I make sure to visit this excellent café.

This place has become one of favorite spots for a coffee break in North Beach.  Granted it does help that you get a free coffee with any dessert purchase when you check-in with the yelp app.   How can you resist?
best cappuccino in north beach i have had so far.  always consistent and good service as well.  Cash only but theres a BofA atm next door in case you forgot.

My favorite place to sit down and have a cappuccino. I lived in Europe for a couple years and this is where I come to deal with my nostalgia. I selfishly hope this place remains relatively undiscovered.

Great place to have coffee, dessert and people watch! I think this was the third stop on the North beach food crawl back in February with Rodney H. After having 2 meals, the only thing I could stomach was dessert so we ended up at Cavalli cafe. We got the following and went upstairs to have a seat.
Really, nothing special. I have been there 1 time and what I remember is just the super HOT weather due not fans and of course.. NO AIR CONDITIONING. The service is ok..
So elegant and authentic. I come here to feel foreign and kindle my imagination about Italy. Really tasty desserts.
On a weekend trip, I was looking for a coffee and small bite for breakfast after mass in North Beach.

Stopped by here on a hunt for coffee after a long touristy day, and we decided to give this place a try due to the great Yelp reviews. We were greeted by a very friendly man who made our coffee orders promptly after ordering. He mentioned that they also served desserts, and it didn't take much convincing for me to add on a tiramisu to my order. Ordering that tiramisu was the best decision I made that day, it complemented my coffee well and was on par with some of the best tiramisu I've had.

When we visit San Francisco's Little Italy, we are in search for the atmosphere and taste of what we love most about Rome. To visit a local favorite cafe in Italy is an ageless tradition for it's patrons and we love to experience THEIR way of life. Their favorite cafe is a place for conversation with friends or a quick "ciao!" as you toss down an espresso and go on your way. There isn't WiFi, it's not office space like so many coffee places here in the U.S., it isn't a library to work on your thesis. Even though I don't live close enough to A. Cavalli to be considered a patron, it has become our go to place for cappuccino and Tiramisu.  Here is why: over the years, we have taken groups of friends to for "progressive dinner" adventures thru Little Italy. Even though we have our favorite places, it is fun to see others try various dishes from many of the NB area. For dessert, we buy one tiramisu from 6 or 7 of the area's pastry shops. Then bring them back to our place for blind taste testing. A. Cavalli wins EVERY time. As for the customer service and atmosphere, it is like taking a short trip to a beloved place far away and I love it. Thanks to the owners for keeping it real.
Cute spot

The tiramisu here is beyond heavenly.  It melts like a cloud in your mouth.  it lives up to its name, which I believe means "lift me up" in Italian. It is so delicious, it really does make you happy!! I have tried tiriamisu all over san francisco and this is the best.

Came here once for their tiramisu...I don't understand all the favorable reviews, it was just nothing special. I didn't get that wow factor at all...maybe it was because the shop was about to close so we got last dibs, or perhaps it was the shitty company I had. Who knows, but I did not feel compelled to come again.

Absolutely loved the cozy welcoming space. Extremely simple menu of high quality ingredients. Desserts are just tiramisu, panna cotta, chocolate mousse, affogato or cannoli. Sit up stairs to have a view of coit tower or sit downstairs to watch soccer. The owner and his family are hard at work, you can watch him cracking eggs for his tiramisu when he's not making coffee. Amazing service, delicious food and spot on coffee. HIGHLY recommended.
Time: 3:36pm/60°F cloudy
Delicious Italian coffee! Most tourists blow by this cafe on their way out of Chinatown. They are missing out on the best coffee in San Fran!

Whenever I'm in the city, I have to stop here for some amazing dessert and coffee. I'm a big canolli fan and always try them wherever I can fine them. Cavalli serves the best canolli I have ever had. It is made fresh and to perfection and I absolutely love the chocolate chips that come with it.

Given all the rave reviews I was super excited to get to this place and try the famed tiramisu but boy was I disappointed. Not a single hint of coffee flavor. I also ordered a latte which was so weak I doubted that there was even a full espresso shot in there. Both items were fine, but definitely nothing exciting.

Cavalli Cafe serves far the best coffee in San Francisco! If you are a real coffee lover and understand a little bit of the coffee industry then this is the place to go - Italian owner Santo and his team serves perfectly prepared espresso, cappuccino, caffe late and much more.
Really cute cafe with great desserts :) cannoli and especially tiramisu
Great place. Very reasonable prices for the coffee. Nice atmosphere in the evening. Pleasant hosts.
Feels like being in someplace in Italy. Excellent espresso. And the owner is a Napoli fan! Grande Diego!

Enjoyed my meal here. I would actually give this place 3.5 stars but one of Yelp's issues is that they don't allow you to rate in half increments. Food is good enough that I would definitely come here again and I can tell you that I have already craved wanting to come back.
I live in North Beach, so we come here frequently to dine-in and grab take-out.
You have to try the Albacore Tuna Tostada, they are AMAZING!!!  Always a great place never disappoints
Don't come here if you're looking for a hole-in-the-wall taco experience for $5. There are plenty worthy places for that in the Mission.
Hands down, the filet mignon tacos were amazing!!!! Must try them! They are very filling:) I ordered 4 and only finished 3! And the margarita with pomegranate was awesome as well!!

The fish tacos were dry!! The beef taco was good though. This place is pretty expensive for something you can make home for cheaper. The music was really loud and it was dark, they should make it a little brighter so I could see what I'm actually eating.. lol The waiters don't really notice you. But hey, free chips & salsa.
Lots of hate for this place, and I don't know why.  It is actually fantastic.
Great chips and salsa, margaritas, and braised beef tacos.  Pretty good for the money too... if you get the margarita pitcher!

I love that this location is less crowded and more spacious - even on a "date" night on Thursdays. It's a nice place to stop by on the way home for happy hour or catch up with friends. Since there's more empty space, I found it easier to actually hear my friend talking even though we were sitting across from each other. Sometimes the Marina Tacolicious is just unbearably loud and crowded because the bar is centered.
This place is amazing. Best Guac I've had in the US, solid cocktail list, great tacos, love the salsa as well.

This place has a cool atmosphere but not my type of party. Food is too expensive, we ordered guacamole for 9$, which we could of got for free at a real mexican restaurant and not a white mans mexican themed establishment. BUT they were playing good music.

Came here to have a few drinks while we were waiting on a pizza next door! Good drinks, awesome bartender..will definitely be back when we come this way again! Oh & you Can't complain about the complimentary chips & salsa ;)
White boy frat party with about a 10:1 male:female ratio, super noisy and annoying people and prices were extremely high for just meh food.

Total meh experience... Wanted to go with 2 stars, but opted to give the benefit of the doubt given that we came in an hour before close on a Friday night. I was disappointed from the start BC they were out of the ceviche & the tuna tostadas- two of the items that enticed me in previous Yelp photos. The chip were stale, the refried beans tasted like they came straight from a can, and the tortilla soup could have used more salt or spice. The tacos, the Micheladas, and the ambience were the higher points.
I'd go back. While ambiance was hip, service was good and the food and chips were nicely presented, nothing was particularly noteworthy.
We got 3 different tacos : chicken, beef and fish. It was yummy a bit spicy but enough to be flavory.  The fish one had a lack of sauce, it was a bit dry and the sauce was too bitter.
My first experience at Tacolicious was a positive one.

Have never been to the tacolicious in north beach but was thrilled when I found out it was there. Have had great experiences at the mission and marina locations so I suggested it to my group of friends. The hostess seemed a little ditsy but she got us seated on a Friday night in less than 20 minutes. I already knew what I wanted but some of my friends have never been there before. Our server "MK" was great. She had great recommendations and kept our drinks full (not to mention she's very easy on the eye.) I've now been to all 3 locations in San Francisco and look forward to trying the one in Palo Alto!
If you want tacos from America...well there you go! For some authenticity go further into the city!

Just had a killer lunch here. Vegan tacos. Great SFO-based IPA. Amazing server (Brianna). Thanks! Just enough food to get me back on my walking tour of this awesome city. The habañero salsa was just enough fire in the belly!

Pleasant experience.  After spotting a patio spot from afar during the dinner hour, my bf, dog and I dashed for some tacos.  The food (4 tacos for $14 and queso dip) were yummy with a unique flavor and the margaritas were solid.  The waitstaff earns pints for brining my pup a bowl of short rib.
Had a bad experience completely turned around by Alfonso this afternoon.

It's really more 3.5 stars.  4 tacos for $14 is a pretty decent deal and will definitely fill you up.  We ended up trying 6 different tacos.  The cod, short rib, and shrimp were all just OK.  The vegetarian (corn, squash, and peppers) was very good, and the carnitas was great (comparable to Nopalito, IMO).  The double corn tortillas were a little too substantial for some of the tacos, so we had to discard the outer layer in some cases.
Everything was fresh and timely. Drinks were delicious, with or without the alcohol. Generous portions of actual protein on taco. Too bad the taste and creativity is mediocre and nothing memorable.

This place was a pretty big disappointment. I read the reviews and was so excited to try it. The service was bad but we were expecting that from the reviews. We ordered the charged squid appetizer and 4 tacos. The squid was terrible and undercooked. It was so bad that we actually could not eat it and sent it back. The four tacos we ordered were the short rib, chicken, deep fried cod, and carnitas. The carnitas was the only decent one and still had a few flavor issues. The only perk was that it was a super cool atmosphere and probably cool for drinks.
Had a great time here last time I was there! Our server was great and his recommendations were too. Food was delicious and I will definitely be back as soon as possible!!!

I love this place! My boyfriend took me here and everything was perfect and spot on. The first thing, I noticed when I walked into this restaurant was a picture of Obama eating tacolicious! Weird but cool! But I mean, if the president of the United States ate here before, then it must be good right? The tacos were to die for! The meat in the taco meat melts in my mouth. It was like tasting a little bit of heaven. mmm hmm, delicious! The white wine is great also!

Yum! First of all, the $10 taco-tequila shot-Tecate can deal is pretty great. The guacamole is excellent and must be tried. And the tacos are also delicious! I had carnitas and that day's special (fried calamari), and both were very tasty. The service was awesome and quick despite a relatively busy-seeming Saturday night crowd. This place is a good one for starting a night off with some good food and drinks.
Our server, Dino sucked.. It took 20 minutes to get us straws and 50 minutes to get us our tacos.. There was only about 8 parties in the restaurant.

We came on a Saturday night and surprisingly there was no wait! The seating here is "modern", personally I don't think their stools are comfortable or the way their tables are so high. Anyway, to start off we ordered guac and we ordered I think 13 tacos. From reading reviews and hearing how sometimes you have to wait over an hour to eat here, I wasn't impressed. Don't get me wrong, it was good but it wasn't amazing where I have to come back.
I brought my three visiting cousins to Tacolicious on Saturday night. We were told it would be an hour wait but were seated in about 25 minutes - woo hoo!
Liked the spicy dip. Limited vegetarian choices. And the veggie tacos pretty much sucked.

I really like this place for their tacos! They do it well and you can definitely taste that the ingredients are super fresh. We opted for 4 tacos for $14: two rock cods, braised short rib and the chipotle shrimp. Rock cod was good. The batter wasn't as crispy as I've had at other restaurants, but maybe I should have eaten this one first? So I'll blame that on my lack of judgement. The braised short rib was very tender and flavorful! And they piled that beef on. No shortage there!
I love the tacolicious near me on Chestnut but I visited this location yesterday w some friends from out of town and was very disappointed.

On Saturday, 6/21/14, my girlfriend and I decided to go eat at Tacolicious in San Francisco located in North Beach for lunch. I've heard a lot of positive things about Tacolicious and I've really been craving Mexican food so we made it happen. Read on to see how it went.

What is the big deal? Went there on a recommendation from a coworker.  What is this Shi shi foo foo tacos? Small portions, high prices, tacos mediocre at best. Beat salad barely enough to feed a hobbit, $9. Come on.  Far better tacos in most any taqueria.
I'm physically full. Emotionally disappointed.

In town on vacation and met a friend here for dinner. Cute little spot,  love the atmosphere. Tacos were delish, braised chicken were my favorite. Sangria was great too. Staff was friendly and attentive.

I am not a frequent reviewer but I felt compelled to write this. We have gone to tacolicious in North Beach twice, the second time leaving before we even ordered and the first regretting our decision to stay. Unlike the friendly (and kid-friendly) experience on Chestnut) the north beach restaurant is unpleasantly loud, holds a happy hour which doesn't include wine (??), and employs staff which are rude (we had to ask one of the wait people to stop swearing in front of our ten year old(f-bombs rained !!). Why we went back a second time you ask ? We'd gone to Chestnut a few months back and had such a great experience, that we chalked our first one up as bad luck. Not the case. We will never go back. Fortunately, Cafe Divine is right across the street, and welcomed us happily, wine included :)
Great place!  Food is delicious.  Best tacos that I've had in San Francisco.  For a first timer, i'd recommend the 3 tacos for $12 and try 3 different ones to see what your favorites would be.

I live a few blocks away and had high hopes that this might finally be a place at this location that sticks around.  However, in two visits I have been quite disappointed.  II sat at he bar and had drinks once and had dinner on my second visit.  The service is downright amateurish, including the bartenders.  This place needs some adult supervision, as in an onsite manager. Each time I wanted something I had to practically wave my arms to get attention.  I ordered a drink during happy hour (a Moscow mule) and no one had any idea how much it would cost (one time it was $5, another $12).  The bartenders seemed to treat the customers as an annoyance.  As for the food, well, in a word it mostly sucked.  The "hand rolled tater tots" were huge masses of potato which just tasted like mush.  Almost everything on the menu was fried and bland.  Whoever is doing the menu is not much of a cook.  Sadly, the food across the street at the Rogue is better and that's not saying much.  I don't see myself going here again.

Went to The Square for Sunday brunch with some out of town friends. I picked The Square because of the buzz around it and the rave reviews of the food. I was sorely disappointed (!) for the following reasons:

"The Square" is an apt name for this place, as it describes both the ambience of the place and the personality of its proprietors. They are no doubt rookies who just got into the restaurant/bar business, and they are PARANOID.
Awesome drinks and breakfast. Apple
Absolutely love this place. Came here for HH 3-6pm on a Sunday and got a killer deal on a $6 burger, $5 tatar tots (which were amazing) and $2 coors. Helluva lunch for under $20 for 2 people!

Third time here. We came for brunch on a Sunday morning and had hoped for the same brunch menu as last time. Nope! It changed.
