We were sad to see the fried chicken with biscuit and gravy gone from the menu. I ordered the farm egg sandwich and my husband got the pork belly hash. You know its bad when you say the fries are the best thing.
Square is a good word for this place.

No stars! Second time trying The Square and didn't even get to order due to wait staff. I've not seen service this bad in SF! It was Sunday at 1pm and the place was virtually empty. Walked out due lack of service. Hope you have deep enough pockets to keep this 'white elephant' alive. Good luck!

I went to The Square back in July, but I can honestly say it was one of the best meals I ate while visiting America. Service was flawless - not bothersome, but perfectly attentive. Our waiter was happy to explain the dishes to us, and make recommendations where required. The food itself was amazing - well put together and thought out, and reasonably priced. I can't really remember the dishes given I visited so long ago, but for the record, we dined from the dinner menu.
Strong food choice, beer selection is solid. Great neighborhood spot. Great lighting.

A friend and I wandered in on a Sunday evening for drinks and a snack.  We enjoyed one of the best whiskey sours ever and an amazing persimmon salad.  The salad was pretty spectacular and kind of overshadowed the tomato flatbread and spicy chicken wings, but they were also very tasty.  The tab for four drinks and our appetizers was reasonable, and the kitchen sent out a donut-like dessert sample to sweeten our experience.  I'm really surprised this place isn't packed.  Great bar, good food, primo location.  Check it out, and leave a drink for me on the board by the bar!

We ate at around 10:30 on a Saturday morning, and there were only two other couples in the restaurant- normally this would be a bad thing, but we seated ourselves, and after a couple minutes someone came by and took our drink orders- coffee.  My boyfriend was in zombie mode because he hadn't had his coffee yet, so he was kind of ticked that they didn't have any brewed and that we had to wait about 10 minutes for a couple cups.  The coffee was very good- but he was already cranky so it was hard to enjoy.
Had drinks and appetizers with some friends here the other night. The food was great, prices were pretty decent, atmosphere relaxing and service amazing.
The food was 3 stars, the service was -3, so that's how you get to zero, but that's not an option.
Food - great veggie burger, which tasted more like a fritter and had delicious accompany sauces.  Large portion sizes.

We came here because it was the closest restuarant near us that was sit down after walking mile from our hotel. The prices are very reasonable. The ambiance is nice and the place looks clean with cool decor.

Drawn in by the House made whiskey Ginger. Well... Very smooth and refreshing. Nice, as I am walking to Bart. Yes it's long walk but who cares with a whiskey ginger under the skirt. Cheers. Nice casual chill atmosphere.  Cushy stools wooden tables, a great place for regulars and first timers. As soon as we walked in they poured water and took our order.  It felt like we were old friends. Nice! When we are in the city we will be back. Thank you.
Had to stop and try the Ginger whiskey.   Nice smooth refreshing drink. $5 come in and try it.

I'm still standing by my verdict on the dinner entrees not being impressive. I've gone back again and this time had the cheeseburger. Not only was it one of the most poorly formed burgers that fell apart after one bite, there was something in the bread or meat that gave it an overly sour flavor. It also was overcooked, no where near medium rare.

Finally a place that might actually make it in this location! While I do miss Washington Square Bar and Grill for some things, Square is definitely an improvement across the board. The food was really good and reasonably priced. We had the pork belly with egg, chips and dip, pretzel, bone marrow, beef tartare, ribs. All were delicious and I'd come back again as there are still many items I want to try...
The food and service were both excellent.

Yes to the Square! I love that Lil Italy circle but that circle definitely needed The Square. Very inviting. Came in. Read the chalkboard. Seat yourself and order at the bar/counter. Nice selections on the menu. Cool bartenders that made a good ass Old fashion. The food was good. I had the flatbread and fries. My cuz had an awesome burger. So happy that they were open late as many of the good places to eat over there stop serving food early.

The one thing that stood out for me at The Square is that the wait help is extremely well-educated about their menu and extremely well-trained. I usually get this kind of service in restaurants of James Beard award caliber. We ordered the Trumer Pilsner, Bundaberg Ginger Beer, Grilled Beets, Pork Belly, Pappardelle Pasta, Cavatelli Pasta (lamb), Pork Chop, and the Peanut Butter Cake dessert--all for $119 before tip. My family raved about the food, but my daughter ended up eating my Pappardelle Pasta because the lamb in her Cavatelli Pasta was too gamy for her. I did not care so much for the Cavatelli Pasta. l am rating The Square 4 stars because my family said it was one of our most memorable meals while in the City. Personally, I would rate the food 3 1/2 stars with service at 5 stars.

This place is a self service restaurant with $16 burgers. No service, plastic cups w/ paper napkins, sub-par food, no atmosphere and no customers (see the pic I uploaded take at 7:30pm on a Wednesday night).
I thought this place was solid.  We ordered:

I happened into this latest incarnation of the old Washbag because I was in search of a good breakfast.  While the menu was not quite what I was looking for, I spied "Pork Belly Hash with Eggs and Calabrian Chile" on the menu.  Now how can a person not order that?  In getting the breakfast (which was great) I learned a lot about The Square...

My friends and I tried The Square for brunch last week and it was an all around great experience! Friendly staff, good ambiance... $12 bottomless mimosas, strong and good fruity drink choices. Smoked salmon was beautifully presented with edible flowers on top; fruit bowl with fresh house made cream - mix of berries, melons, and what the waitress told us were ground cherries; beignets were light, but big and served with warm honey; donuts with chocolate sauce were dense. I got the pancakes which had fresh blueberries in them, berries and flowers on top, served with house made butter that made me say wow when I tasted it (so rich!) and house made whipped cream... I'm a sweet feen but no syrup was even needed for them they were that good; best pancakes I've had in a long time! Sampled my friend's pork belly hash: fresh peppers, onions, eggs, all good! Only bit of improvement would be to put fresh potatoes in there (they were the freezer bag kind). Over 60% of their products come from the restaurant-owned farm in the Santa Cruz mountains too; they're doing the "farm to table" thing well! We'll be back, definitely for brunch, and maybe for dinner too!

Disappointing. Quite expensive for submedocre food. Everything was boderline flavorlesss. The seafood for 2 people dish was laughable, but the price wasn't funny. Bland and seafood for one, not 2. Spend your money at Park Tavern a block away instead. Same style, same price point, executed way better.

Dumb and Dumber!  What happened to this place from the owners of Sons & Daughters?  The chef owners were on the cover of Food Arts recently about sustainable and foraged ingredients and this is their work???  You knew it might be trouble when nobody bothered to confirm your reservation as well no need as there were 5 tables at 7 on a FR night!  No service for a long while and then it was like service by committee...very casual and nonchalant.  The beef tartar was a mushy ground mess as well under glazed pork belly.  The pork chop was so dry I left it uneaten.  The steak had a mush of wet salad in a sweet sauce which was gross.  Pastas had no toothiness and flappy.  Skipped dessert...ran out of there.

Brunch was delicious!  The tortilla in my ranchero eggs had just the right crisp, and my friend's mushroom omelette was a revelation in how good unusual wild mushrooms can taste. Much of the food is from the owner's own farm in Santa Cruz, which is super cool. Great attentive staff too.
Decided to check the new brunch spot in Washington Square.  Loved the dark, distressed wooden floors and rustic walls...but - is this just starting to become the norm in SF?

Decided to try The Square as it was new to North Beach and the location is so convenient from downtown -- easy walk post work. The food was all good but prices were really steep. There were two of us, we split an app, a salad an entree and each had a glass of wine and the bill was $100 which seemed pretty high to me. Like I said the food was good but it was nothing to rave about.

A great addition to Washington Square - food, service and ambiance are all on high standards. Being Italian, I really appreciated the "al dente" pasta, it's a rarity on these days. It tends to get hot inside, so you may want to pick a colder night to try it. Albeit it serves breakfast as well, I feel it's more appropriate for dinner.

Review is for drinks and dessert: Jackson behind the bar was incredibly welcoming, generous and friendly, and the friend whom I went with and myself want to go back to visit The Square mainly for the chance to run into him again :) He gave us a taste of nasturtium-infused gin (omg sooo good) and some other mixers he's been making from scratch, and was very knowledgeable of The Square's offerings (we had the ice cream sandwich and the grilled strawberry dessert, both were delicious). Excellent bar service, I'll go back again!

Absolutely exceptional food and service! Lovely neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere! Most of the ingredients are self-grown on the biodanamic Dark Hill Farm - wonderful concept! Constantly changing menus make this place a location to come back and back again. Amazing restaurant in the North Beach Neighborhood
Review is for dinner. The bread and butter is amazing, asked for seconds, and that was my favorite part of the meal. Everything else was decent:

Like most reviewers, I think this place is great potential. They still have some kinks to address. Also, I should Say that I am a fan of the former Washington Square Bar and Grill. The wash bag had a certain comfort level, order a well-dressed cocktail and drop your cares at the door ambiance, that its followers have not re-created successfully.

Came here on a weekend night. Was a little apprehensive of the prices since the restaurant looked pretty new and like a lot had been put into the decor. Surprisingly everything was reasonable, especially for SF. I ordered the burger and a beer, my friends got some of the other house favorites. Everything was spot on tasty. I'd classify it as high quality comfort food a la San Francisco. I would definitely come back here again the next time I'm in SF and get adventurous with my menu choice.

Nice atmosphere. Great brunch, though it took awhile for our food to come out. The beignets were amazing, as was the pork belly hash. The Square Breakfast was really good too. Excited to come back to check out their dinner menu.
Found out The Square was opening its doors to the SF brunch scene - so we decided to go check it out this past weekend. Really glad we did.
These guys make you stop and look inside and snap lot of pics while doing that. Very busy very touristy... I love it.
Personally, I love touristy things. HELLO! They're touristy for a reason!

LOVED IT!  I normally do not eat clam chowder, but after this experience I'm definitely a fan.  The sourdough bread bowl is so good with it, a perfect lunch. No ate tags entire thing along with the entire bread bowl it self, would definitely recommend it for any visitor in San Francisco!

I wanted a much better experience at Boudin's (pronounce Bo-deen) Bakery at Pier 39.  Lines formed quickly and soon lessened as staff, quickly whip out soup in a bread bowl; the famous San Francisco sour dough bread.
Popped in before dinner and checked out the ambience and area. Hung out at the upstairs bar for the 4-7 happy hour and enjoyed the white wine before leaving.
=.=the clam chowder is just soso, taste like the one u can buy in the supermarket.

There's about 20 boudins in sf alone it seems and i never tried it until today. Not bad at all, i had the chili in the bread bowl. It was ok but i much wouldve rather tried the clam chowder. Will be returning to try that out. Clean place and nice atmosphere.

I've been here a handful of times and never leave impressed. I have been to other Boudin Restaurants and have had positive experiences but cannot say the same for the SF Pier location. On my most recent visit we arrived at a time when the restaurant was fairly slow yet still had to wait over 20 minutes to be seated at a non-view table. Once we were the experience was less than average... no refill on the bread basket and somewhat slow and inattentive service. I ordered chowder in a bread bowl, $15, which was the most hollow carved bread bowl I've ever seen. The chowder itself lacked clams or had very few shreds of clam and was also much more gelatinous than usual. I also tried a sample of the Seared Ahi which was overtly pepper crusted and came with no sides... for $30. Needless to say my meal companion was hungry only a few hours later.

Known for their Sourdough Bread.  This is a historic San Francisco spot down on the Wharf.  Watch them make bread or enjoy the Fish Tacos made with sourdough.  The wait was a little long and it may be a little pricey.  But, I enjoyed the view of the bay and the meal.  Also check out the cafe for bread or a nice latte.

OK, Tourist Spot Alert!  But, oh, the best sourdough.  When we come into SF on our Princess Cruise, it is always a stop on the way back at Boudin's.  I get a couple loaves and bring them back to the ship.  We have not eaten in the cafe yet, but will at some point next time.  However, it is great to get sourdough to go, and they give your little packs of butter and a plastic knife if you ask to take with you.  We brought it back on the ship, and it was fresh and fantastic with our California wine too.  We also love to stand and watch them make bread in the window too.

This restaurant/bistro is located in a very touristy section of the city - Fisherman's Warf area - so be prepared for it to be busy.  We went here after arriving in SF, starving and looking for some hot food and cold beer.  The upside - the bakery is really interesting to look at and they make some neat animal-shaped breads.
Good clam chowder in the bread bowl, ice cold Anchor Steam. Order was ready very fast, 2-3 minutes tops.

The food is okay but not amazing. They lost or order and after almost 30 minutes of waiting for clam chowder they finally got it for us. I brought this to the attention of the manager who didn't seem too interested in what happened, it was obvious he wanted to end the conversation in a hurry. I'm sure you can find a place with better clam chowder and better service in the area.
We had the BEST breakfast! Bacon, eggs and toast for me and bacon, pepper scramble in a bread bowl for my husband!!! Amazing food!! Would come back again!!

A lot of people are writing about this being a tourist trap. It might be a tourist destination, but trap makes me think of somewhere that is overpriced and sub par. This place is fantastic. We went on a Sunday night right at dinner time and sat right down at the oyster bar and were helped instantly. Jessica was a God send. My girlfriend and I were still pretty hungover and ordered some Bloody Mary's. They were phenomenal. My girlfriend has trouble with hair of the dog sometimes so Jessica offered to mix her up a soda and bitters and some bread. Instant fix. With our newfound ability to eat, we got three rounds of Oysters Rockefeller. They were ridonk and out in about ten minutes a round, (we ordered one by one.) This will definitely be our first stop next time we are in town.
Are you one if those people who loves your fresh bread? If you are, you better check out this place!

A tourist trap/destination. They've since expanded to include locations throughout the Bay Area even expanding as far south as Irvine. I always count on them when bringing my parents goodies from the area and as long as they enjoy it, I'll keep coming.

This place gets really crowded on the weekends so be aware! Despite that, this is a great place to eat some great clam chowder and delicious sandwiches. I particularly love their tuna salad sandwich and I'm a fan of their sourdough bread. I think every sandwich tastes great with this kinda bread..
Had to do the ultimate tourist thing and head to Boudin's for their clam chowder bread bowls.
Fast line, good food, I loved the chowder and my husband loved his sandwich. This is a good, inexpensive, and quick option on the pier!

On our vacation, we reserved one day to fully play the tourist card and hang around the wharf.  Walking around for a few hours and checking our Yelp app, we couldn't pick a new place to try for lunch.  Passing by Boudins a few times and having a desire for clam chowder, we decided to give this place a shot.  We went years ago and waited in the long line for counter service.  This time we decided to put our feet up and enjoy some sit down service.

My family and I were visiting SF for Labor Day weekend and decided to dine here. We heard great reviews and wanted to try it. Seating was not a problem, however being served and getting our food was absolutely ridiculous.
The best clam chowder on earth, period.  The bread is really good too.  Had the crab cake sandwich and it was excellent.

Maybe my expectation was too high when I walked in, im totally disappointed by their sourdough clam chowder. The soup tasted like it got thickened by corn starch. There was way more potato than seafood in my soup. That being said, their tomato soup was pretty well done and I would recommend that over chowder (hence 3 stars not 2). Had better clam chowder in LA than here
My wife and I had high expectations about this place and after getting a soup and a risotto we finished totally disappointed. The place was over rated.

Great clam chowder and chili cheese and tomato soups.. Caesar salad was also tasty. Bread bowls are a bit large. I think I would just use normal piece of bread they give me with bowl of soup. Their sandwiches are also great. Would come again If I visited sf often.

Went to the Pier 39 location. Line was short but the food still took a while for just salad and a bread bowl. The chowder was really good but the amount the put in it is deceiving. You don't end up getting that much soup. The chowder was thick, but not overly creamy or oily. I got lots of clams and potatoes in my bowl. It was definitely a good deal and better than I expected. Just wish I got a bit more!
Before heading down to San Francisco, multiple people suggested that Boudin was a must-try. Being in love with sourdough, it was a no-brainer!

We stopped here for a snack right before our boat tour. Had the clam chowder and a sandwich which came out fast. The bread tasted a little stale and the pigeons are unafraid and will circle around you as you eat. But for the purposes of snacking before an hour long tour, it was good enough.

Fish tacos were good.  Crab cake sandwich was lacking in actual crab but tasty.  Clam chowder was out of a Campbell's can.  Sourdough was what I expected.  Not that impressive of a value for actual eating here.
Clam chowder bread bowl! And a beer! On the curb. Heaven.

We visited this place in anticipation of a great dinner experience, but I must say we left disappointed. When we first arrived a gentleman met us at the bottom of the stairs to share with us the menu that was available in the cafe, and told us that the upper floor was a little more pricy, but that the food was good. I figured we had wanted to experience a great dining experience so we ventured upstairs. What transpired was that we were basically treated to a very overpriced meal. Now don't get me wrong, I have no problem paying top dollar for fine cuisine. I consider myself a food lover and certainly enjoy a great meal at a fine establishment, but the food quality was very poor for the price, in addition to the portions. I had a sandwich I probably could have purchased down on the pier for $20 less and for the same quality. The fries were also served cold and I must say I left feeling that I simply overpaid for an average meal. In the future I will stick to the cafe and bread bowls  when visiting this place again.
We were soooo disappointed in our lunch here today.  We hopped off of our bus tour for a quick lunch.  We were really entertained watching the production

The bread was good. For the price, you don't get much at all. It was crazy busy, and soft drinks were $3 a piece. My kids ordered the cheese pizza, and it was better than both mine and my wife's meal. I wouldn't be excited to go back, honestly.

I loved this place, it was inviting and smelled amazing. The staff was super friendly and the place was very clean. There is something to look at everywhere you turn your head, even up above, bread moving in baskets like a mini metal roller coaster. I had the sourdough bread bowl and clam chowder, it was perfect. The bread was moist and not too hard on the outside. The soup was warm and flavorful.
Our first foodie stop was Boudin. I totally mistook it for the original Boudin, which was actually near Fisherman's Wharf, lol. Boudin is known for their breads and cafe items.

In San Francisco for vacation lots of food on Fishermen's Wharf but had heard good things about this place. Great sandwiches and the bread bowl soups are awesome. Reasonable priced. My wife had the clam chowder so I had the tomatoe to try them both. They were both great. Will go back for more before we go.

This bakery is a nice bakery. Is very high tech. And the food actually not that bad when it is prepared correctly. everytime I go it is very busy due to the fact that it isn't worth the area. If you ask for anything that is all of the menu already changed your order don't expect it to be done correctly. Employees here are on power and are unable to avoid any transaction. So it takes a long time to get the order done correctly. The lines are very long so if you expect to come here expect stay for a while. Seating is very very very difficult to find. I recommend going upstairs to the bistro in spending $1 more on anything that you can order upstairs plus you have a larger selection.  my order was filled incorrectly twice and when I ask him to heat the bread for the sandwich it was burnt . When the manager finally came to sell order it took a while and what's up on a walk talk traffic 5 other problems . The salad I ask for no cheese so wanna put the cranberries on top listing salad do you think on that they use to fill the cheese with coming to pick the purpose they really should be more safe with him like people food prices the publix the reason people don't have to send foods good and I could be allergies because really serious repercussions.  I got 2 stars based on the service not on the decoration the building or the taste of the food.  the food would earn 3 stars. And the service would get a one star.

So cool to watch the bread makers make the different shapes of Sourdough sent to the oven. Extra cool to watch the baskets of bread slowly hoisted out of the kitchen and into the market/ restaurant via mechanical hook delivery system.

Must experience! The center of the bread literally melts in your mouth.  The bread is creatively crafted and fun to eat. The soups are delicious.  We had chili and clam chowder.  Memories were made! It's touristy so be prepared for crowds and no seating but the lines go fast... Just need a place to enjoy hour meal.
The strawberry jam is out of control amazing. I would come here everyday just for that.
A cute little French Restaurant in the heart of North Beach. Nice atmosphere. I loved the Beef Bourguigonne.  It's a favorite here.
I live right near Cafe Divine and rarely ever go there.  The reason?  Mediocre food and consistently bad service.
Pricey breakfast. Small and plain atmosphere,  friendly waiter.  I had corned beef hash and eggs and wife had an omlet.  Good but the bill was $33.

The place is cozy.  I ordered lettuce with blue cheese and walnuts salad, beef stew with red wine sauce, and a glass of Pinot Noir.  The staff were courteous, and the food were delicious.  Reasonable pricing too except for the red wine.  Not even 1/3 of the glass had been filled and it cost $11.  That's why I didn't give it a 5 stars.  My advice is try out their food, but not to order any wine.

Lovely! Would give it a five but my manicotti is just as good. Ok I changed it to a five because it's not their fault im a good cook. Great wait staff excellent appetizers- The figs stuffed with goat cheese with a balsamic reduction was terrific. Prix Fixe dinner is a great deal.

I have only been to Cafe Divine for breakfast but have gone at least a dozen times because I like their egg scramble so much. It is by far my favorite place to go to breakfast in North Beach (I haven't tried Mama's yet).
Food was not bad but not good either. Waiter was full of attitude.  Restaurant was understaffed and not welcoming at all. Would not go there again

We like café divine. Its perfect to get a drink next to Washington Square and the place is really cosy. There's also live music at night which makes it quite romantic. I can't remember her name (Rhea maybe?), but the waitress is lovely.

I've been here twice over the past two days and really enjoyed both times. I had their beet and goat's cheese salad yesterday, and blue cheese and walnut salad today, and really enjoyed both. I'm not a massive salad fan, I'm just feeling fat right now, lol, so thought I'd be healthy, and glad I was, because they really packed a punch, both of them. The beet salad especially was one of the nicest salads I've had. Staff very pleasant, and the place itself lovely - very light, airy and a perfect aspect on Washington Square. Sitting in the sun by the windows watching folks go buy, was really enjoyable. There is a cool hat shop next door from which my partner bought two  hats, lol. Going back to this cafe tomorrow night for dinner and live music!

Me and my guy had dinner here last night.. Sat outside .. Great location on Washington Sq and views of N beach. We had an appetizer .. Figs w goat cheese .. Was amazing w a salad and pizza special .. Sausage asparagus and goat cheese pizza. We thought over all was a good spot and food was good. If you can sit outside .. It's a great spot
Came here for brunch when we were visiting the bay,
Excellent service. Friendly staff. a nice relaxed atmosphere.  Started my day with breakfast here. Highly recommend it

Don't be fooled by the nice atmosphere and great decor. I ordered a lox bagel and the bagel was chewy at best. The cream cheese was buttery and the tomatoes weren't ripe. My wife had the poached eggs which had a weird sour taste and the side of ham looked like it came straight out of an oscar meyer package. Service was bad as well - forgot waters after we asked for them and rushed us with a check literally a few seconds after our last bite. Take the extra five minutes to find somewhere else. Oh yeah, the coffee was bad too.
Perfect place for a nice brunch. Had the corn beef hash with poached eggs and it was delicious. The chai latte with soy milk, sooo good! Enjoyed every sip and every bite.
The atmosphere is great, very bright. The waitress was very kind and the food was delicious.

Holy amazing bacon. We decided to get breakfast here after the initial spot we wanted to go to had over an hour wait. We sat outside and it honestly made for the perfect, San Francisco Sunday morning. My husband got the Benny while I had the poached eggs and cappuccino. Every this was amazing and the bacon.... Out of this world good. Highly recommend going!
A M B I A N C E : Café Divine looks like a Cadillac, but rides like a Rickshaw.
Breakfast pastries were really nice and flaky and filled with fruit. The pastry was warm out of the oven and really tasty!

Cafe Divine is a nice little cafe with a couple idiosyncracies. The location is great with a nice view of the square. It's a bit of a pain to park, but then again, that goes for North Beach in general. The service can be hit and miss, especially if you are used to very attentive service. Keep your eyes out and actually call them over if you need them. If you have a problem with an order, they will usually try to rectify it, though, even going as far as striking it off your bill if something was wrong. This is a nice breakfast spot with some delicious selections, and on that note, here are my thoughts on some of the food and drink:
Great Happy Hour on Thursday's. They have featured wines and beers $2 off and specials on oysters. Great little cafe in the heart of North Beach across from the Washington Square

We were in a North a beach and didn't want the Columbus Ave experience. So we stopped at Cate Divine in late afternoon for something to drink and light meal. Great space with high ceiling and large windows facing Washington Square Park.  We had a salad and pizza with some wine. Service was very cordial. We really enjoyed their thin crust pizza. Field greens salad was nice. All in all enjoyed it and would return.

Their pizza's not bad for being right across the street from the famous Tony's Pizza!  I had the garlic, sage, caramelized onions one (I forget the actual name of it) and it was amazing!  I also had their caesar salad which they topped with Fresh  parmesan.  Only thing missing was free bread.  That would make me wanna visit again sooner than later.  It's ok.  At least I know to come back!

Great theme of Dantes' Divine Comedy, and lots of choices but slow kitchen makes it questionable for a repeat--there are far too many great restaurants in the area to wait for good food at high prices.  Unusual choices on the menu, fun, but not a second-timer at this point.

LOVED THIS CAFÉ! ! stopped in for a small bite. . Ordered the cheese tray and glass of rose... waiter was sweet and made us feel welcomed. .. Speed by two days later to eat breakfast but it was too busy. .

You must have their fresh squeezed orange juice. It's amazing. Their omelette and potatoes were good, but needed salt. Their biscuits are also amazing. Atmosphere is nice, but the waiters definitely seemed to be busy, as the place was crowded and there were only 2 or 3 of them.

Located at a corner at Union and Stockton Streets, you can't say Café Divine doesn't have a great North Beach location with Original Joe's and Tony's at two corners and Washington Square on the other.
Went for Sunday breakfast. My friend and I both ordered the egg scrambles. I asked our waitress if i could substitute ingredients and she said kitchen usually doesn't, so I ordered from the menu.

Today will be my third time that I've been here. Foodwise, it has always been great. But, if it's on a weekend, expect to wait a bit, but for me personally, I'd rather wait for Cafe Divine than Mama's.
Not a good experience

I agree with what many Yelpers have said - the food was good but the service was pretty awful. We came in at 5pm and were seated right away. There were only a few other diners in the place. There were two servers and a bartender (who appeared to maybe be the owner/manager). Once we were seated, both servers proceeded to ignore  us for at least 10 minutes. No water, no drinks, no "I'll be right with you," nothing. I finally had to ask "excuse me, ma'am, but who is our waitress?" as one went by for the umpteenth time. She kind of fumbled and mumbled and then asked what we wanted to order. I stated that I'd first like to know what the Blue Plate Special was (turns out there wasn't one that day), as well as the seafood special of the day. We then put in our drink orders and waited, and waited, and waited for her to come back so we could order our food. By the way, we later discovered that it was happy hour from 5-7pm with free appetizers and 1/2 priced drinks. Our server never mentioned this to us, which sucks because we would have definitely taken advantage of the drink specials.
Next best alternative to Mama's.  Friendly service and fresh food, waffles could use some more fruit.

We came upon this cafe walking around the city on a Saturday morning. We enjoyed the outdoor seating and sights & sounds at Washington Square. We went twice in one week for breakfast. The food was excellent. We had the eggs scrambled with veggies and homemade jam on biscuits.  The only negative is that they ran out of the homemade pastry we really wanted, very disappointing to hear the waitress say that was a usual occurrence since they are busy - that is a lost sale opportunity. If you know you will typically run out of an item, make more!

Typical tourist trap, very unfriendly hostess that was patronizing and rarely checked up on our table. Mediocre food to say the least. Picked this place for location, didnt check yelp reviews first unfortunatelly or would have picked another place.
Amazing service, wonderful food (large portions), everything an American could want! The staff was very hospitable and the food was crazy good, and more importantly very affordably priced.

We walked in for a late lunch and though it was crowded, we were seated right away. The cappuccinos were perfection. My husband ordered the waffles with bacon and cheddar, the waffles had a strong cinnamon flavor and the cheese was unusual but delicious on top. I ordered the Bennies from Heaven--overall it was delicious, the salmon was a little too salty and the side of potatoes were not good, but I enjoyed the dish.
Horrible service for 2 coffes and a pizza. We have to wait and later I have to stand up every I need something. Coffees where ok and the pizza go across the street.
3.5 stars

Cute, cozy European-style cafe located just off of Washington Square Park. The location helps add to a charming ambience in the restaurant. Our food was amazing (I got the roasted chicken and my boyfriend got the manicotti) and arrived quickly.
pefect for what it is
DeLicious.

Me and my friends have been here multiple times and we absolutely love it!!! The food is homemade, always very fresh and flavorful and servers are professional and attentive. Cozy small place in the heart of North Beach area that serves delicious homemade pastas and they have great wine selection too.
We happend upon the caffe yesterday, as my favorite place wasnt open for lunch.

I gave again this ''place'' a chance to keep myself as a customer but they mess up again. Really Poor Poor costumer service and the food was ok, I used to go there often, but now I really decide to take this Poor Place with this umprofessional people who doesn't care about their costumers, if you go you will see, and if you see you will understand what Im saying.  If you don't care about the costumer service then go, but if you care and like to have fun with your girlfriend in a good environment , then go to a different place around there. Good luck.

Great choice for authentic selection of Italian food, be in gnocchi, pizza, appetizers, or delicious deserts. Quiet and elegant atmosphere. One of our regular stops when visiting San Francisco even though there are numerous alternatives.
The short: An okay but definitely strange dinner on short notice.
Disappointing!
We had a really good experience here. We stopped in without ever knowing of the place or hearing about it. It just happened to be on our way to our final destination.
Great location and outdoor seating is perfect for a sunny day. Get the mussels. I loved them.
My roomie and I came here on a Sunday around 10:30am.  We waited around 10 minutes and were then seated inside.  The restaurant is on the smaller side with outdoor seating which most people vie for.

Service staffs are awesome, but food and business is lousy. We order the clam and mussel dish for appetizer. The clams were okay, but the mussel was disguising. It was dead prior to being cook because they had such a foul smell. Any cook would know dead mussel. We told the server to just replaced the stinky rotten mussel with clams. He brought it to the kitchen and brought back exactly what we had except with the mussel removed (nothing replaced). It's frustrating when business doesn't admit their mistake. The chef here is most disappointing. It's definitely for one time tourist stop. I can't imagine with the options in the city, any one would return here.

My friends and I met to have brunch here last week.  I had eaten here several times before and actually was the one who decided on the meeting spot, so I was embarrassed by what a terrible fail this was.  We were seated at around 1:45pm, but our waiter didn't take our order until just before 2 (which is the cut off for breakfast orders).  Neither the hostess who seated us or our waiter mentioned that the time for the cutoff was approaching, and the waiter actually took our brunch order.  There were 5 of us, we all ordered alcohol and side orders and some of us order 2 breakfast dishes, so it was quite a large order.  About 10 minutes after our server took our order, he came back to us empty handed and told us that they were no longer serving brunch!  He didn't bring us menus to look for something else, he didn't bring us our drinks, not a free appetizer to ease the pain, nothing, just looked at us.  We were all upset because we had been seated before 2, and he could have taken our order sooner if there was a cutoff to be made.  He said sorry as if he couldn't have cared less, so we got up and found another restaurant that would serve us.  It was the strangest experience that I have ever had!  We all couldn't believe that he didn't make any attempt at all to make the experience better for us.  He just stood there watching as we got up and left!  And we were starving, and this would have been a big order with a big tip.  Such a horrible experience that none of us will ever return.
Nice restaurant and their breakfast pizza was the best. Their ambience was ok but the food was good.

The wait is never really that long here and when the sun is shining, it's the primo spot to have mimosas and eggs. The staff is attentive and efficient. Stop by if you are in North Beach and try the gnocchi or any of the pastas. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, it's all yummy.

Prior to comedy shows at Cobb's, my girlfriends and I usually hit up Columbus Cafe for some lubrication, and then Golden Boy for some saturation. I was late to the party, and my girls had made the classy choice to head to Caffe Delucchi and bought a bottle of pricey white wine.

Best crab Benedict in the city! Very fresh with the perfect amount of hollandaise. Service was slow and took forever to get a refill of my coffee... But I'll give them the benefit of the doubt with 1 woman working in the front at 10am on a Monday.

I have been to this place before since its my fiance's fav place to get beef bolangnese. This time, I was not impressed. We originally had ordered a dish to go but then ended up finding parking there so decided to eat in instead. I also ordered  the warm spinach salad which they were nice enough to accomodate with the sauce on the side. That was not an issue but seems that they decided not to provide us the same service as if we decided to eat in from the beginning. They just kinda seated us and then let us be. We didn't get bread like they usually serve and barely gave us a water refill. It was pretty clear when we were ready for the check but we had to flag them down for that. not impressed.

We had tried breakfast with an amazing Bloody Mary and lunch with delicious Panini.  This was out first dinner and we were not disappointed.   I enjoyed the tomato basil soup which did not include cream.  My guest ranted about the gnocchi.   Would definitely return for another visit.   We chose it for dinner before seeing Beach Blanket Babylon.  Perfect location!   Nice patio seating for people watching.   Small interior but cozy.

The breakfast BLT was excellent but huge! Definitely a dish for sharing. Servers were fast and  friendly. All the breakfast disses were pretty standard fair (eggs Benedict, egg scrambles, etc) good basic breakfast options

Ate lunch here with a friend.  We both had the chicken fettuccine alfredo, which we both agreed was very good.  Service was unremarkable.  The place is a bit touristy but that's life in San Francisco.

I'd have to say, I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at Caffe Delucchi. I was in the city over the weekend for the SF Giants Half Marathon and we had just picked up our race packets from the expo and were in search of some good pasta to carb load. Thanks to the handy dandy yelp app, we were immediately directed to Little Italy. Upon arriving we were able to find parking close by at Washington Park. There were so many restaurants to choose from so we decided to take a walk and Caffee Delucchi was the one that caught our attention. A nice little corner bistro/cafe with the plenty of outdoor seating. As we entered we were immediately greeted by the hostess who brought us to our table. They have a great menu and judging from what everyone around us was ordering... the real star of this place is the breakfast which is served until 2pm.BUT, we were here to carb load so I decided to go with the Linguine Vongole served with fresh manila clams and shrimp in a white wine, garlic herb sauce. The pasta along with the seafood was cooked perfectly. The seafood was fresh and the portions were hearty. I am definitely hooked on this place and I plan to return soon to try the breakfast dishes and the panini's. I highly recommend Caffe Delucchi if you are in the area.
Caprese salad was good. Spinach ravioli was perfect, might have chosen a different sauce next time instead of the mushroom. Price is reasonable.
Great menu selection for breakfast. Artichoke hash is really tasty. No wait to get in which now surprises me. Service is great. Prices reasonable

I came in with a friend on a Tuesday afternoon, around 1pm, thinking that this place would be good because it looked busy. However, I think we came on a bad day or something because the service was terrible!! Here's why..
Mamas had a 2.5 hour wait so this place was a fantastic surprise. Great service and delicious breakfast!!
Went to this place after our 1st and 2nd choice were packed. Bloody Marys and anything you eat for breakfast are amazing. I had Huevos Rancheros. Best gourmet huevos I've ever had. What a gem!

Great food, service and atmosphere!  The Bruschetta was just ok but the entrees more than made up for it.  The Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo was to die for.  Homemade fettuccine noodles and a silky smooth cream sauce kept me wanting more.  The Gnocchi with Bolognese Sauce was perfection.  The Potato Gnocchi was very light and the sauce was rich and meaty.  Top that off with a bottle of Montecucco Rosso wine and I'm as happy as can be.  This restaurant is a small piece of Italy tucked away in Little Italy, San Francisco.  You must try it!

the food was ordinary (I had what was represented as an Italian sausage omelete, but truth-in-advertising would have described it as a tomato omelet with a few bits of sausage), the coffee should be represented as boiled water (though admittedly I like strong coffee), the service was clueless (they brought the toast as we were finishing breakfast)
A fine Italian establishment.
We came here for breakfast. We ordered mushroom pizza, Benedict crab cake, and coffee. Recommend all of them!
I came for late dinner 8:00 pm.

One of my favorite brunch spots in SF. There are many options in North Beach (places that are fantastic and hard to get in and a plethora of touristy Italian places that are begging you to come in as you walk down the street). Caffe Delucchi is neither- fantastic food with no crowds or wait. What a find! They have the hard to find outdoor seating. They take reservations on
Good service, but comparable to 90% of Italian restaurants in San Francisco: overpriced, not really authentic Italian food and relatively small menu
Let me start of by saying that I usually hate giving bad reviews, so you know this place deserves it.

Walked over to Mammas and saw the line reaching down the block, so we used our phones and found this place. So happy we did. Wife and I shared a breakfast pizza and Gorgonzola polenta with poached eggs and bacon. Food was great. Service was excellent and we had a seat next to the open windows on a beautiful Friday morning. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch who doesn't feel like waiting in line for an hour with tourists.

Wonderful blueberry pancakes. Right up there with the best pancakes I have had. We came here on a Sunday morning after waiting in line for Mama's for all of 2 minutes before realizing that there was no way the wait could be worth it. We walked down to this little place and we were seated right away. The restaurant was fairly full, with a few open tables. The service was okay. I found in all of San Francisco the service standards are extremely low but this was one of our better experiences. My companion ordered the pulled pork polenta and liked it.
Came in Tuesday morning and had a wonderful experience. Michael and Melissa were attentive, friendly, and made my dining experience one of the best I have had in the city.
Summary: A cafe in North Beach worth battling the tourists for.

I've only been here for brunch, but it's become a regular weekend option for a calmer I-need-food-maybe-one-mimosa brunch (not a full day give-me-all-of-your-mimosas brunch). I usually get the artichoke hash benedict which is different but delicious. The polenta is a little bland though I'm usually too full from everything else to have more than a few bites. The regular benedicts are good too, and they have some crazy breakfast pizzas that I've seen but haven't tried. Haven't heard of anything bad so far!
Pretty good italian food. The pizza was my favorite, the risotto was so-so. Mussels and clams were very good too.
Forbes Island was a really great experience. If you're with someone from out of town, its a very unique dining experience.
A little rough at first with the movement of the boat.
Definitely a unique dining experience, but be warned those that suffer from motion-sickness or get seasick this is definitely NOT the place for you.
It wasn't perfect, so we had a great meal and still get to complain, doesn't get any better then that.

We had a great time at Forbes Island.  Myself and another friend had a joint birthday party and we rented out the entire island.  Casey and the staff were very helpful in planning the event and their service at the event was fantastic.  They went out of their way to make sure we had a great night.

It's not bad for a tourist spot, but don't expect great food.  My wife's salmon was good, but my filet mignon was nothing special and the sides could have come out of a box for as little flavor as they had.  Wine by the glass list was very short but adequate.
Very intimate and romantic. Food was middle of the road considering prices. Definitely not a place I'd recommend for the food, but good staff and service and fun atmosphere.

Took my wife to Forbes Island for her birthday dinner and this place really hit the spot. We don't usually travel to the city to eat but this place made the trip well worthwhile. It was very unique in the sense that nobody could walk up to it like at Pier 39 restaurants so it almost has that secluded effect on you at night since it's only people that are eating there that can get to it. The guy that runs the Shuttle was really cool, Gave us all a break down on how Forbes Island came about and the history behind it. From there you continue on a minute and 30 second ride or so to the barge, Yes I said barge because that's what it's built on and he directs you to your dining area. The dining area was really cool, If you are claustrophobic it may not be the best idea to eat here as there aren't really very many windows and the aisles are sort of tiny to walk down but I am and I made it through the meal fine. We both ordered filet mignon  and it was the best I ever had. Not sure what they put in the butter but that stuff was pretty damn good as well. Once we finished the meal they validated our parking which made parking in the garage free which was cool avoiding a $9/hr fee and we walked around a bit and checked out the lighthouse up above. Very cool if you wanna snap some instagram or fb pics before you leave.. I read some of the reviews on here prior to going and I guess depending on how important you think you are you may find the service bad or a notice a dirty fork but all in all if you are a sensible human being and don't need the celebrity treatment for the money you spend and are capable of walking too and from the shuttle and also willing to communicate with the waiter/waitress if you need new silverware you should be just fine.
Absolutely loved the unique experience and had such a great time, just a couple of hiccups, however:

Before we were married My (now) husband found Forbes Island online and surprised me with dinner and proposed to me there. The food was amazing. We both had filet mignon and the chef made my son a special plate of buttered noodles. Our meal was excellent and I appreciated the special effort the staff made to accommodate our 4 year old. We loved watching the fish swim by our porthole! It was also fun to climb to the top of the lighthouse and look at the gorgeous view. Forbes Island is perfect for a romantic dinner and also for families. Our son loved the boat ride over and exploring every nook and cranny!
Being from New York City I'm not easily impressed . This was one of the highlights of my visit to San Francisco. If you find yourself in the Bay area check out this gem
It was my boyfriend's birthday and I wanted to go somewhere different.

Me and my family have been trying to go to Forbes Island for a long time. But something always came up. Sick kid, knee surgery,and so on. We finally made it for a big birthday. It was a bit confusing trying to find the boat that you take to get there but it all worked out. When we got there we checked out the whole man made island. Very cool.

The service was good, but the food was too salty and mediocre at best. Also, the plates and silverware were dirty and there were bugs flying around in the dining area. The restaurant is an overpriced touristy gimmick, not worth it.

We held our son's rehearsal dinner at Forbes island. It was truly a memorable and very unique venue. Everyone loved it. The food is outstanding. The views are incredible and the island truly is out of the box. Casey and Pierre who ran the event were also outstanding.  We couldn't have asked for a more perfect evening.

Great service from the wait staff! Offered great advice on food and wine selection. I never felt rushed at all. I always come here to celebrate something special. The view from the lighthouse is the best, especially on a clear night.
One of a kind place!

Went here last night for dinner. Food was delicious!! The bruscetta with avocado was out of this world. The braised short ribs were great too. Service is outstanding. Def a fun experience for dining.!!

WARNING: For those who get sea-sick easily definitely take something before hand. What I didn't realize is that the "island" is actually floating in the water so you can certainly feel the movements of the bay.

What an absolutely wonderful dining experience.... like being in the captain's quarters on a ship!    Beautiful interior, with intimate dining and great lighting.  Outside, you can sip your wine on the deck, or climb the lighthouse steps for an absolutely fantastic view of SF!   We were so fortunate to have Casey as our waiter, who suggested marvelous starters, entrees, and desserts!   (Hint: try the flatiron steak...the potatoes it comes with are heavenly!)  Casey  was so great, so personable and knowledgeable, to every single table!    A wonderful place for a special birthday, or romantic evening!
Delicious food. Pretty interesting location. Boat was moving but of course that's expected. Loved it overall :) we all left smiling

It's pretty exciting to be on the island and see the city from a different angle. My overall experience was fun. The island was pretty cool and the restaurant is very romantic, albeit rocky. Everything on the menu was mediocre, I was not impressed with the food, at all. Go once and check it out for yourself. Now that I've been, I don't think I'll ever go back.
Very good place to eat.   An unusual experience that you should have.   The food is great and the ambiance is spectacular not to mention the location

Fun place! Good food, excellent service, unique. Plus, it's free of snooty locals, SF's precious lemmings who would rather stand in line for 3 hours for ramen instead of going to the Wharf, which they obediently avoid because they've been told not to go. As others have noted, if you get uncomfortable/queasy by boat-like swaying, you may want to think twice.

I would not recommend this restaurant.  The actual restaurant is cramped, dark, and a bit creepy.  You definitely feel the sway of the water, and the windows are so mucked up with algae there is no way to see anything in the water.  Plus, the water is a brownish murky color, so even if you could see through the windows, which you can't, you probably wouldn't see anything anyway.

Was looking for a special place to celebrate a big anniversary - and stumbled across a review of this place.  Funny thing - I've seen Forbes MANY times over the years of taking family to Fisherman's Wharf - but a complete lack of curiosity had me ignoring it until said review.  Decided this HAD to be the place, and made the reservation on our anniversary - a Saturday in early July (note that....).

We went to Pier 39 via Ferry from Alameda on a whim for Independence Day. We arrived mid afternoon with no plans or Reservations. Went to Beer 39 and had a couple of brews while searching for a place to have dinner on the I pad. Most places were booked. We decided to walk around and check it out when I remembered a place Called Forbes Island that we had dinner at last summer. You have to take Mr.  Forbes water taxi to the restaurant because it is on Forbes Island. The Island is man maid (by Forbes) and it has waterfalls, a light house, beaches ect...  You can dine down stairs which is underwater with port holes and a cool bar or upstairs in a tiki themed room with views of Alcatraz and Angle Island

What a unique experience. A perfect date night. I highly recommend trying Forbes Island to everyone at least once (unless you get sea sick). It's expensive, and the food is not as tasty as it should be for the price, but so worth it anyway! It's such a change of pace.

I'm going to have to side with the other reviewers that thought this place was great. We had two appetizers (the avocado bruschetta and the mushrooms) two entrees (I had the salmon and my husband had the sole), and two desserts (apple tart and chocolate mousse). All were delicious.
This place was freaking awesome!
Smells of mold. Food was ok, but the steak wasn't cooked as requested; complaining only caused the manager to come to our table - he was not happy.

It was cool, good ambiance, decent food. Definitely a different type of place. Went with my fiance, just cause. The boat ride in is cool, adds a little adventure to the date. The lighthouse on the island made for a nice view of the surroundings. Rating underwater was a trip, but fun. It does rock a lot with the ocean though so don't go if you are susceptible to sea sickness.

We hosted a party at Forbes Island for our daughter's graduation from vet school. My first contact with Casey, the event planner,was informative and helpful. All the details were explained and the cost was extremely reasonable compared to other venues in SF. Our server, Dakota, was very attentive but not intrusive and made our guests comfortable. Drinks were served throughout the evening and our guests had four entree choices and the chocolate mousse was fabulous. The wine choices were excellent. We all loved the short boat ride from Pier 39 and exploring the light house and decks. For more history about the island google Forbes Island. All and all a great celebration at a very fun and unique restaurant.

Great experience.  Forbes Island is something everyone should try at least once.  You must take a shuttle to the island so don't try to walk to it.  The shuttle driver was very nice and gave a quick tour upon arrival.
WARNING!!!

Ate dinner here last night and it was a perfect place to celebrate a birthday! The food was pricey but worth it for the experience. Our server was exceptional - she recommended the ahi tuna starter which was delicious and then recommended the sole special, which was also delicious. We also ate the filet mignon which was amazing. After dinner we brought our drinks with us to the top of the lighthouse. The views are exceptional from the island. We have both lived in SF for many years and this was a first for both of us ... Definitely worth it!

I am a little disappointed with Forbes island. I might have set my expectations too high. The setting cute, quaint and romantic. I wish we would've been able to sit in the group party room that overlooked the water.

I really want to give 5 start because atmosphere, service, food and dessert was great and the whole experience of water taxi and island was so unique but unfortunately part of my food (fish) was too salty that my husband shared his food with me and I had mashed potato and vegetable!

Service was excellent (which is the main reason for 2 stars and not 1), scenery at the lighthouse was amazing but my problem with this restaurant is that the food was extremely extremely salty. I'm not sure if it was just an off night for the chef but unfortunately it was pretty much unbearable.

This was such a great experience. The food was amazing and the waiter was very attentive, even though there was several other tables to be waited on. The atmosphere is very unique (dining below the island) and very romantic. The was food was incredible and price according to quality.
My girlfriend and I went for dinner just around sunset. We got

Nice decor and appetizing menu bring you to their slightly hidden and unadvertised door. Upon entering you arrive at the bar and are sat by the generous host.  The main dining area consists of 40-50 tables. They are open for lunch which we found rare in SF so that's a plus. There were many items to choose from but I went with the garlic noodles (chix add for $7) and the wife got the shaking beef Cobb salad. Her salad was very delicious and a must try. My noodles were just ok.....until I reached across table and grabbed the miso/soy dressing that came with the vegetarian sandwich. (Mushroom dip).  Once I added the sauce my dish was lifted to a real crowd pleaser. I would come back here for the pan-asian fare and overall laid back decor while having very good service. Overall good meal.

It was a super convenient restaurant for what we were doing that day.  The food was good and the desert was great.  I wasn't confidant in the waiters understanding of my allergies so I played it super safe but ended up with a pretty ho-hum dinner.
Great location, great ambiance, great food!
Purely mediocre for really expensive food!

Didn't visit for the food but for cocktails and attended their Halloween party while visiting San Francisco for the first time. Had an amazing time, the drinks were mixed good, and the view out their window overlooking the beautiful san francisco bay is absolutely amazing. The dance floor was filled with a lot of young people that looked 21 and 22, so they were a little roudy, but I found a dip off area that was for the more mature crowd who wanted to have a good time without being bumped into every second.
Love the decor, location (waterfront seating), service, food and prices.

I initially searched for parking, fortunately near this restaurant at 10-31-14 9:30pm'sh (parking meter which accepted my debit card, 50 cent per hour,ends 11pm).  As I went to butterfly, door was locked (I guess they had to move all the tables, and prepare).  My friends showed up at 9:40pm'sh, we took some pics outside. Got in 10:10pm'sh with a pass, and bought 2 midori sours $8 each, corona $6, and red wine $11.  Cups were somewhat small, prices moderately expensive. DJ played mostly current music,few old school, it was packed/noisy.  I had to go to the smoking area in the rear, since there were no ins/outs.
Exciting presentation, yummy flavored, and love the ambiance. Friendly staff and very accommodating.

I don't get any pleasure out of writing a bad review and rarely do it.  However, I do have an issue with this restaurant.  We had heard they had oyster shooters at $1.00 per shooter.  We ordered the shooters and were asked if we wanted anything alcoholic to go with them.  I was very surprised.  I have ordered oyster shooters at other establishments and this was never an issue.  I said of course, and of course I had to pay for the additional vodka I ordered.
A gem on the harbor! The food is beautiful and tasty, and the view of the water is amazing.  The spring rolls and fries are the best I have ever had, and  the drinks are art themselves.

Butterfly offers flavorful Asian fusion dishes, a relaxing ambiance and nice view right on the water. We ordered a few dishes to share:  appetizers (ahi nom nom wrap and  duck confit rolls), soup and salad (spicy seafood "milestrone" soup, smoked salmon salad roll), vegan garlic noodles and the main course dumplings and (shaking beef) steak. Everything was very fresh and flavorful, although the portion was on the small side. If you are used to eating big portion dish, you probably would have to spend a lot to feel full. It's a fancier restaurant located on Pier 33, so come here when you are not too hungry or for a special occasion as they have nice ambiance and good service.

We went to this restaurant on Sunday of the Fleet Week. I was shocked... Extremely dirty women's bathroom: one stall broken, no toilet paper, soap dispenser broken. Speaking to women who were waiting in line, several of them were there earlier in the day and the same problems were there hours ago. Management did nothing to address these issues in several hours that they had. I had personally spoken with the host and raised the health hazard concern and he said they knew about the issues, but were "too busy" to address it. That is considering that there were only 3 full tables when we walked in.
Service is super slow
Stopped in for Happy Hour while walking along the water.  Was a nice place, the bartender was great. Sat at the bar, not too busy considering it was around 6pm on a Friday.

The food presentation is excellent but he food itself was not so much.  Very surprising to get dishes with almost no seasoning in a place like this.  Gnocchi was awesome but tiny (think four nickel-sized pieces) and surrounded by bland vegetables.  The tempura mix has no seasoning.  Similarly, the pork chop is delicious but the braised cabbage and beans were not seasoned at all.  And the same with the hanger steak - steak was great (if small) but the sides were tasteless.  There's not even salt and pepper on the tables to rescue the sides.  Bottom line is the featured dishes get lots of attention but the sides are boring.  And, as other reviewers have pointed out, the portions are small.  We noticed many locals getting drinks and appetizers then moving on for dinner. Wonderful decor and location.  Just a little short of expectations especially given the price point ($130 for three of us with no alcohol or dessert).

Lovely meal with a friend who had seen Butterfly reviewed on Check Please some time ago.   Surprisingly easy parking, very attentive service, and delicious food.  Great view!  A little noisy, but that is because of the configuarion of the building.  What do you expect with concrete floors!  Did not feel that we were easdropping on someone elses converstaion and vice versa.  A lovely dining experience and just may stop in for lunch.  LOVED the duck spring rolls.

9 of us came in and had a few minutes to have a drink before seeing Alcatraz ... We ordered quickly a round of drinks .. which took almost 15 minutes to get even though they were not busy.. the bartender had the personality mix or Castro and Elmer Fudd .. which was an odd combination.. in other words he didnt seem happy and not a friendly sort you expect being a bartender.. the drinks were finally served and we had to drink them in haste to make the boat.. we get the bill and the waiter conveniently added gratuity to our drink bill of around $18 bucks.. 9 drinks ... $120.00 .. wow .. never again.. due to many levels ..
we were seated in front of a broken window, at night, in the San Francisco Bay. The cold win was terrible.
Just came here for drinks but the hostess, manager, and waiter were really nice, helpful and fun. The cucumber and kiwi was DELICIOUS
Wow what a burger!!! Super fresh toppings and great bar service and wait staff! Seafood clam chowda was to die for.

We had a good experience here.  Good view over the water, our meals were very nice and our server made sure we had everything we needed.  The edamame while you read the menu was a nice touch.  We were here for the lunch service before a trip to Alcatraz.  The burger was delicious.
Been a butterfly fan for 12 years - back before they moved. Tasty fresh food and great service. Patio dining is the best and superKID FRIENDLY!

I think this is turning out to be one of my favorite restaurants. Chicken wing, duck spring roll, and Kalua pig lettuce cup appetizers are awesome. I've also had shaking beef salad with a soft cooked egg. Yum. Hanger steak was delicious. I've been there for lunch and dinner and each time was seated with a view from the bay. Service is wonderful.

Made reservations and was seated promptly at a table with a couch. We sat side by side facing the bay! Had the kalua pork with butter cup lettuce, duck confit spring rolls, shrimp mango salad, poke over crisp rice, and the hanger steak entree. Best appetizer was the poke. The other ones were good too. The spring rolls were okay. Hanger steak was done medium rare and was perfectly done. Very tender! Will go again!

We saw this place featured on a television  program. On a day trip to San Francisco we decided to give it a try. Upon entering the restaurant, the hostess was deeply engaged in her cellphone and the bartender just glanced at us and walked away. No greeting, no smile, nothing. We stood there while the other diners looked at us with scrunched faces. When the hostess finally out her phone down and asked us if we'd like to join her for a table, we were seated at an awkwardly situated table against a column. The decor is a little dated and mismatched. Our server came for our drink order and we ordered our apps at the same time.

I wanted to try Butterfly for years, but never got around to it until I snagged a LivingSocial. There's nothing like a great discount to spur some motivation! Since then, I had scored another deal and went back a second time, and both times I had an overall great dining experience!

Our service during happy hour was simply amazing. To be fair, it wasn't very crowded, but we definitely enjoyed the ambiance - live music! - and certainly the service. My girlfriend wasn't satisfied with her drink (Arnold Daly iced tea - good but not the strongest) and asked our waiter (Porter, who is completely awesome) to switch it out with another drink (lycheetini) - he was more than happy to oblige and was actually glad she had spoken up rather than drink something she wasn't happy with! I had the strawberry sidecar and a kumquat margarita and both were excellent.

Sometimes you need to go to a restaurant more then once to give a honest/better review. This is how I feel about Butterfly. I would give it another try and also try the happy hour menu. We had the calamari, duck spring rolls, garlic noodles, steak and snapper dish. Highlights were the, calamari, spring rolls and snapper. Garlic noodles were over rated. Steak was ok. Beautiful, stylish restaurant with a view of the bay!

Having dined many moons ago at the original location in the Mission, I purchased a couple of coupons on Amazon prompting two spaced visits here.  The earlier one was before daylight savings time so it was already dark here and the crowd was already settled in; the atmosphere was more romantic under these conditions.  On our recent stop here, it was a bright, sunny, breezy day and the scenery shines more when the dining room is bright.  Our waiter quickly brought us water and the menus.

We didn't eat at the Butterfly Restaurant, but we did have drinks, lots of them. This restaurant is located right next to Pier 33. We stopped in here for a few drinks before the Alcatraz Island tour and couldn't have been more pleased.

Stir fried Gnocchi. Definitely interesting! Four stuffed/fried zucchini flowers and a curry style pan fried gnocchi with cheese and a sauce. Adorned with edible flowers, the presentation was great. Open space with views of the water closer to Pier 39.

The food was even better this time.  Hint, the appetizers are LARGE!  We were not terribly hungry, decided to just order a few appetizers, and we barely finished them.  YUMMMM.  Excellent food, view and service, how can you go wrong?

We made reservations for three on Saturday for dinner and was told the only space available was 4pm or 9:30. The maitre'd said they were fully booked, not even 4:30 was available. When we showed up at 4:10, delayed by road closures, we were seated promptly. Note 1 - the place was empty except for 3 tables and 2 customers at the bar.
We had dinner at Butterfly on Friday night to celebrate a birthday.

What can I say, HELEN, the manager was ridiculously awesome. I called to confirm my reservation and asked for a favor. Could they help write Marry Me when dessert came out. She said they would try but couldn't guarantee. When I arrived she made sure to attend to us personally, sat us and even served us our food.  I'll get back to Helen...
I cannot say enough good things about butterfly!
I have come here with friends and family quite a few times and from our first experience to the last, it has  always been enjoyable.
Absolutely 5 star for me. The chef has his own understanding of food. Like every dish~

This is a lovely restaurant with spectacular views of the bay. Service was very good- considering we ate there on 4th July and it was busy! Food was great too. Nice upbeat atmosphere. We were leaving to watch the fireworks after our entrees and the waiter invited us to watch them from the patio, which was awesome! We stayed on at the restaurant bar after the fireworks and sampled some of the yummy cocktails. It was a lovely experience overall!!

I took my pasta loving boyfriend here last Saturday and we had a blast! I've been here several times over the years in a group or a couple and it just has the best atmosphere definitely a San Francisco restaurant landmark. I made a reservation through open table for 9:30 on a weekend and I was seated promptly. Our waiter was attentive and quick wish I could remember his name. We decided to eat inside since we didn't know how cold SF would be that night, but I'll take an outside seat next time cause of the perfect people watching tables and warm heat lamps. On to the food, we started off with the Italian potstickers basically a tasty meatball dressed in a potsticker so good! We had the kenwood Chardonnay with all the fancy decoration, for dinner we had the ravioli which is a must! It still manages to be a casual place that serves til 2am while keeping the Columbus North Beach Italian charm, we will be coming back!

This wasn't my first time here. I had visited with a large group of coworkers after an event in the city and they took very good care of us and were able to accommodate our group of 12. I had also visited with my wife one afternoon for drinks and appetizers.

My roommate has been here so we decided to get some coffee and dessert.  We were seated outside, and our orders were placed promptly.  We started with garlic bread with cheese, and our desserts came in afterwards.  She ordered tiramisu, and I got the orange creamsicle cheesecake.

This is one of the first places I ate at in SF and I keep coming back for more. Nice atmosphere with outdoor seating to people watch on a busy street on Columbus. Food is decent, good pasta, good calamari, portions are good.

This place is full of lies and crap. Don't believe their wait time. When I first put my name on the list, the waiter said 10-15 mins. Twenty-five minutes later, I checked in and she assures me it's another 5-7 minutes. Ten minutes later, I check in with her again and she tells me that it's going to be another 20 minutes. WTF? There's nothing I hate more than a hostess that lies about an estimate wait time to get my business. SHADY.

I really liked Calzone's! I got the fettuccine with asparagus/chicken/tomato, and it was really yummy. My friend liked her lasagna, as well. I'm not sure why other users are claiming that this place is "overpriced", because it's not. There are many "overpriced" restaurants in this city, but Calzone's is not one of them. Friendly staff.

Recommended by a SF native and we loved it.  No reservation for 5 on a Wednesday night -- seated right away.  Great service.  House red was terrific.  Had the gnochetti with sugo, which was excellent.  Others in the party had the filet mignon calzone (says it's one of his favorites) and crab fettucini -- both excellent.  Even the two who ordered salads, raved.  Don't hesitate -- visit today!

I had my birthday dinner there last night. I called to make the reservation two nights before for a party of 35! To my delight I found out they have an upstairs area that is great for big parties & it was available. The person I spoke with on the phone even sang me happy birthday which was super sweet. The food was delish & all of my family & friends had a great time! Thank you Calzone's for making my birthday magical.

Here visiting and read great things about Tonys. Unfortunately, I stopped by and it was closed for a private event. I kept walking and decided on by Calzones as it has a fairly appealing outdoor seating area. I ordered the "cremini" mushroom pizza and a glass of wine. The service was great. Fast and friendly. The pizza was mediocre at best. The crust is cracker-like and dry and I love thin crust. The cheese lacked the nice salty flavor you crave from pizza and the mushrooms were definitely not cremini. They were your regular store-bought button mushrooms. For the $30+ I spent on both items, I'd say very over-priced and sadly underwhelming.

WTF is with the no phone orders and you don't have an online ordering option? That is total BS. I called just now after over a year of ordering take out and they said I have to come in person and order. Totally defeats the purpose of take out, I might as well eat at the restaurant if I am going to have to wait. Step your game up Calzone's. I know you cheap asses make a ton of money off that location! You're letting your neighbors down.

Always great food and service here. Had the pizza margarita and the Italian pot stickers. Both were excellent as always. Peachy loved it. House Chianti very good. Food served fast and always with a smile.
I love this place.

We made reservation for 7:45 on a Wednesday evening. After a five block walk from our hotel we arrived on time and were seated immediately at an outside table held for us, yeah!!  Service was prompt and the food was delicious.  Get the OUTSIDE seating, it is a scream.  Inside is good as well, the large sliding windows open to project a wall-less front.  As a side note, I left my very expensive jacket on the chair. A block away our waiter came running with it: he was not hard to miss with that big smile and white apron!  He ran back but I followed to the restaurant to insist he take $20. Well worth the prince of my unique jacket! Go here! It may be a wait on the weekend, but well worth it!

Outdoor seating area was clean and comfortable - great people watching!  Prices for entrees and drinks were reasonable - considering the area.  However,  $7 for 4 smallish pieces of garlic bread was crazy.  Calzones and pizzas were good - fresh veggies on the veggie pizza - including shaved asparagus.  Wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars.
Once again Calzone's didn't disappoint! Service was absolutely top notch and we enjoyed the patio on a calm Indian summer night. The house chianti and cheese plate were a delightful snack!

Came here for my birthday recently and ate here with a few friends.  We ordered some appetizers and dinner with wine.  The friends I was with were so nice to recommend this place.  We got there and were seated quickly at a nice table.  Our waiter was a nice looking guy with a strange voice.  Anyway, he took our order but before the appetizers could come out, he had the salad come out first when I asked to be brought out with the meal.  Anyway, I asked him how long he had worked there and he responded that he'd worked there 17 years.  Anyway, I had to remind him to give us an update on our appetizers.  Then, later another server came to our table and one of my buddies asked if they did anything special for birthdays/people.  The server said no.  Was strange that being a restaurant they don't sing, give a complimentary slice of something.  I personally wasn't looking/expecting anything but when I heard this server said the restaurant didn't do anything for birthday patrons, I suddenly was disappointed.  Anyway, the food was OK.  Nothing to rave about.  My birthday dinner experience was OK.  Not sure if I'm coming back. Especially since there's so many restaurants in the area.
This is my #1 favorite place to eat in the city. We have a blast sitting outside to eat while enjoying the nightlife of SF... pure entertainment! The food is amazing and the service is always great.

Went here with my partner for breakfast and the waiting staff was very rude. We left after we paid for our coffee. It may have been because we were a gay couple but they gave us the nastiest glare when we walked in. Blatant homophobic discrimination is a terrible customer service strategy. Also, the coffee was barely drinkable. If zero star rating was available that is what they would get. Don't go here.

Just had dinner here tonight with my friend and his parents. Had calamari for the appetizer and pizza for dinner. Everything was good. Really nice atmosphere too. The hostess was really cute as well. Tried to get her phone number but all I got was "thanks for coming in." Rejection with a smile. I'll be back soon haha
I love coming here. The atmosphere is really nice, sitting outside on a warm night is great and the pizza is bomb!!!!

Delicious. Cool atmosphere and lots of stuff to look at inside. There is outside seating as well as inside; upstairs too.
