I ordered the homemade raviloi and it was the bomb.( if you don't like mushrooms I would not reccomend) my boyfriend got the homemade lasagna and loved it as well. Pretty big portions and great service. I will DEFINATELY come back here:)

Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crowded so we got seated quickly(chose to be inside so we could sit across from each other). The staff here was very friendly, got our orders quickly, and came to fill our cups a few times throughout our meal. I ordered the chicken&mushroom pasta while my boyfriend got an Italian calzone. The servings were pretty decent and the food was good. It is a bit pricey, but overall a nice place to eat.
Stopped here with my husband last weekend. We were hungry after walking around the city all morning. Wasn't in the mood for Italian but we saw this place and decided to stop.

Sat on the heated sidewalk which was manageable in late August. Corkage is very inexpensive- only $5. We had the calamari which was just ok along with the garlic fries. The short ribs were absolutely skippable- under-seasoned and over-cooked. The crab fettuccine was decent, but would've been better with a lighter sauce. Service was a bit slow as we had to ask for our water, food, and the check. Maybe because we were on the patio? Overall, just ok.

This place doesn't deserve its current rating 3,5. Apart the decoration which is really nice, the service is unfriendly, particularly with kids. The menu is incomplete for an Italian restaurant and the food is not good, not even warm. You have many other places that deserve a visit. Definitely not this one !!!

There are a plethora of Italian restaurants in North Beach/Russian Hill.  Some are authentic (or claim to be as "Our chef is from Sicily" proclaimed one restaurant hawker), some are trendy (to see and be seen), and some are crowded.  I found that most were terribly overpriced, and according to my wallet,  Calzone's is in the same category.
Met my expectations. A little pricey for what I ordered, which was the calzone burger.  Fine experience.

Food and service was extremely average.  My husband ordered lasagna, it was cold and not appetizing at all. I got eggplant rollatini, which was very oily and not what you would expect. Would not recommend.
Amazing pizza and filet minion calazone!! We sat outside and enjoyed people watching!

We started our North Beach night here.  It was crowded with happy patrons so we knew we were in the right place.  The servers were nice and friendly.  It's a great place that is would recommend you visit if you are in the area.
We were walking around Columbus wanting to try a new place in North Beach. Always seen Calzone's but never really had the urge to walk through the door. Well today was our day.

Our experience was as good as it gets! First, I loved being able to reserve a table on Yelp. Two clicks and done. Great! Second, we arrived early and were seated right away. What?! That never happens. Third, we got one of the sidewalk tables; wide awnings with over-head heaters. Nice! As avid people-watchers, we were in heaven. What about the food? I'm glad you asked. ;) Amazing! The pork and beef sugo calzone was to-die-for. The chicken alfredo with spinach and almonds was delicious. We were satisfied, but not over-full. Perfect. Spent the rest of the evening walking it off around Little Italy. Calzone's, we'll be back.
Great Italian food, fantastic atmosphere. Ideal place to have a good time. Good service. One of my favorite in North Beach.
This place is amazing.
Service was slow, food pricey (given the quality) it was average at best. We had the lasagna calzone and were not impressed. I will not go back...  Too many other choices in the area.

Don't overcook the pasta.  Al dente should not be a new term. We were early in the Dinner Hour and the pasta tasted like it was in the pot for a while. Add more fresh veggies to the meat sauce.  Mushrooms?  Zucchini?  Who am I to tell you how to cook?

The calzone offerings are wonderful. My party and I ordered three--Italian, Lasagna-style, and Filet Mignon. All were equally delicious, with the seasoning being just to our tastes. Every bite was gleeful, and sad at the same time because we were getting closer to finishing. Couple these things with a great ambience and great service, and it's an all-around satisfying experience.
Excellent restaurant ! the place is well decorated, you fill like in Italia. The food was incredibly good especially the Italian calzone and the tiramisu. The service was quick and friendly.

We made a reservation a couple of weeks in advance and confirmed a couple of days in advance for dinner July 4. We called a half hour to re-confirm and a snotty girl informed us "it is first-come first serve tonight."
My boyfriend and I stop by every time we're in the city. Consistently good service and great food. Try any of the seafood pastas or pizzas. Try to walk if you can,  there may or may not be parking.

Went here on a date night for our anny. Made reservations and luckily we made it on time. No issues being seated right away as soon as we entered the door. Prior to coming I added it was our anniversary.

I came here Sunday night for my birthday dinner, we had a reservation for 9, arrived early and were seated. The service was great! I didn't love the seating, since we were seated by a window that people just stared at us while they walked by. It really wasn't that bad.

My husband and I were on a  trip to our new home in Hawaii when we stopped in San Francisco so we could visit his family. A few of his childhood friends wanted to take us to the Stinking Rose while we were there and I had such a fun time. I had never been to San Fran before but was instantly head over heels for the culture and spirit of the city.

What happen to this place? I came her a couple years ago and had a great experience. Came here last week after making a reservation on Yelp through open table. Checked in with receptionist and was seated within a couple minutes.  Everything ordered was off. Bread was not the same as years ago. We ordered the Bagna Calda and it was overdone. I also ordered the 40 clove chicken but it was skimpy and overcooked. Mashed potatoes tasted like instant from a box. Garlic ice cream tasted like it was freezer burned with ice crystals over it. Overall I will not be revisiting.
On a trip to the city we took the stinking rose to the test. Just looking for a quick bite, we went for the roasted Garlic in a hot tub bath and had some cocktails.

One of the best restaurants I've eaten at!  The atmosphere is great.  You can actually have a nice conversation while eating.  The food is fabulous!  I'll definitely go back if ever in San Francisco again.

I love garlic, so this was the place to come.  Started with the Bagna Calda "Gralic Soaking in a Hot Tub" large soft cloves of garlic roasted and served in an olive oil bath, very good on the well made focaccia rolls provided.  Went on to a small order of mussels with drawn butter.  The mussels were very garlicky duh, and were also loaded with large soft garlic cloves.  Both of these dishes were satisfying.  Split the Arugula salad which came out way to fast.  It was a healthy portion.  The salad was well made, but the arugula was not as spicy as I like.  Main course consisted of the lamb shank and the short ribs.  Bothe were very good, well cooked tender and falling off the bone.  The protein was accompanied by garlic mash potatoes and creamed spinach, both of which (especially the creamed spinach) had a made in a military mess hall feel to them.  Acceptable but still not on spot.

Came here on a Friday afternoon for lunch.  1:30.  Crowd already dissapated?  Should have taken that as a sign but I'm still glad I tried it so now I can check it off the bucket list of restaurants to try.  Wasn't great, wasn't bad. Just so-so.  Expensive for what you get. Too many good restaurants in close vicinity  to come back here again.

This place has a nice ambience, no doubt. I wish i could give half stars because I really can't decide on three or four. But the truth is, restaurants are for food and the food I had was a little disappointing. I've always heard such raving reviews about the "famous Stinking Rose" but everything was just...average. The bread at the beginning was good, but the garlic pesto stuff they give you with it was wayyyy too garlic-y (I get that it's a garlic restaurant but taste is still a factor!) I had fondue as an appetizer, which was super cheesy but had great flavor. Unfortunately, it wasn't melted or hot enough when we got it. For an entree I chose to add prawns to fettuccini with a garlic and some kind of herb butter sauce. The prawns weren't really cooked right, they were all rubbery! And the pasta didn't have enough sauce on it. The herb flavor in the butter was forgettable because I couldn't really taste it. I'm glad I tried this place. The house Chardonnay was pretty good. For one hundred dollars and everlasting garlic breath...this place is more of an experience than a restaurant you would want to be a regular of.

One of the top 5 best restaurants in the San Fransisco area...I have been here many times and each time the food is the best and the service is outstanding , I would recommend that you make it a must eat at place when you are in the city ...
I brought the switch up to the manager and he tried to deny it but once I explained the difference in taste and texture and showed him I knew what I was talking about he never denied it.

Let me start my review by letting Frank Reyes, the business manager, know the date and time of my experience so he won't ask after reading my less than flattering review. Nov 9, 2014 and we were seated to eat at 6:00. Our waiter's name escapes me but he appeared to be hispanic and was husky with dark hair and a beard.

This restaurant came highly recommended by Facebook friends, and I feel that we weren't disappointed. Although I don't tend to eat a lot of Italian (especially not gnocchi), I was very happy with both the food and the service.

Having bday dinner with wife, not sure should I recommend this place or not. Reason? No one come to us and ask if anything is ok or not after we meal is served, but the waitress went and ask the table next to us to offer offer service(we r Asian, not sure it had anything to do with it or not, next table is white folks, same to the table behind),ask if they need to refill water or not when our cups is empty, what is going on here?!?!?? So it ruined my bday mood..............
We really, really enjoyed this place.
VISITED: ~early May 2014.

Had a cool "garlic experience" ... Made a reservation for three via OpenTable on Yelp = so easy! Upon arriving at the restaurant, there was NO wait = perfecto. The place wasn't all that busy for a Monday night.

It was crazy busy with a lot of people waiting to get seated when we arrived for dinner. We made reservations online prior to coming but we still had to wait about 20 min. Glad service was friendly and prompt. The Zuppa di Pesce was excellent.  The BBQ Garlic Chicken Pizza was okay.

I can't believe this restaurant received such great reviews! My party of four all ordered different items and they were all sub-standard. First of all we made reservations several days before and when we checked in the guy wrote us on the list with a 15 minute wait. I heard him tell the people in front of us the same thing.

Great menu. My prime rib steak was literally like BUTTER. My garlic crab was big and filling, my mash potatoes infused with garlic was the best! I loved my entire meal! The garlic shrimp was tasty beyond expectation and the appetizer garlic dip stuff was HELLA bomb!

Garlic galore! Very tasty dishes, quick service...and needless to say garlic is in EVERYTHING (so you can't go wrong if you're a garlic fan). Caution, if you take leftovers home, which you will probably do since portions are very generous, be prepared to pop in some baking soda in the fridge at the same time--the smell the morning after is overpowering!

Though the place can give off an "Applebee's" style atmosphere because of the all wall art, I can assure you that both food and the service are spectacular. They offer OpenTable reservations, however anytime I've visited the reservation wasn't required (I still do it to avoid having to wait for a table). The Stinking Rose has a spectacular bowl of spaghetti and meatballs (not on the menu, just ask), the meatloaf is awesome and the roasted garlic in olive oil is a classic but the mediocre bread leaves a bit to be desired. Don't skip the garlic ice cream, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

I'm going to edit this review when I go back because I really feel like I didn't pick the right meal. I'm not willing to give up on getting the perfect garlic meal! It's a bit pricey, but even with being a little disappointed, I still thought that the pasta I got was really good, but not nearly as garlicky as I was expecting. We got a pizza, that was pretty good, too. They have this great selection of hot sauces by the entrance, and we took two of them home, one of them was from the Pain is Good Batch (something like that) and it is now one of my favorite hot sauces.

Went on a Saturday nite...and it was hoppin'.  UCLA was in town to play Cal, so there were more tourists in town than usual...mainly hitting up the strip clubs across the way.  Parking is a nightmare downtown, regardless of the work on the Chinatown/North Beach muni.  I would Flywheel, Uber or Lyft it there...or take public trans.  Reservations are a must year-round for this spot!  Great decor and atmosphere....waiter and support staff were johnny-on-the-spot with everything.  The table and chairs could be cleaner...a bit sticky.  Food was great....garlic is awesome anyway.  Sadly didnt make it to the dessert round yet again.
Try the pasta soooooo gooood! Great food we can't stop raving about it definitely going to be coming in next time we visit the main land

Service was great, overpriced food. Waiters and bus staff are excellent and attentive to your every need.  The food though is overpriced for the small portions that are served. A great tourist spot, but as a  local I doubt I will be back.
i will start off by saying that this review is based on service and hospitality, not food, as we did not have the opportunity to eat at the restaurant.

A long line and a little bit expensive, but it was worth it. Seafood was fresh and their prime ribs were nice and juicy. Waiters took a little while to get to us, but hey, they are really busy at night. Overall, their service, food and the restaurant in general was great.

Came in tonight for dessert and drinks late night and sat at the bar.  Yaneth, the bartender was SO sweet and helpful.  Carelle also hooked us up.  They both gave us little samples of the pickled garlic, garlic wine and the chopped garlic oil with bread to dip.  They went out of their way to make our short experience a pleasant one.  These girls were amazing!!!

The food is good, especially if you like garlic. My meatloaf was so-so, but the spinach it came with was great. The other entrees my party had were tasty. The birthday celebration put on by the employees was fun.
Whenever friends from out of town come to visit, and they want to visit North Beach, I have to take them to the Stinking Rose. Garlic + good italian food = AMAZING!

Great restaurant.. I don't even know where to start. Me n my husband make reservations all the time n one time made it 15 late. When we got there, they took us right away(10 mins). Drinks there are reasonable.. But let me start with the food..not big fan of the bread, but the spread is bomb. Double shrimp double crab (what me n hubby get to share) is the best seafood by far in the city, the garlic sauce cannot be any better and the butter lemon sauce is perfection..definitely recommend this place to every one who loves garlic

I have wanted to try this place out for so long and I know that sometimes they get very busy and you should probably make a reservation, but I got lucky on a Thursday night and got a table right away with my two spontaneous girl friends. :)

Cool concept. Seating area was really cool, booths with striped curtains. Ordered the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and got incredibly sick that night. I am a garlic lover and was so excited for everything to be extra garlicy but to be honest, it's not as garlicy as everyone makes it out to be.

The food was good but the service lacked a little. It was a Saturday night so they could have been busy. I liked the booths and how it makes the dinner more intimate. The parking want too bad and I was able to find parking within a couple minutes.

Let me start by saying the service here sucks. Harsh, abrupt, rude, and unhelpful to say the very least. Food used to be good here but unfortunately this place has taken a long long trip down hill since the good old days. The prime rib (which used to be their signature dish) was flavorless, dry, and not cooked properly. Everyone at our table asked for medium and they all came well done. The meat was bland, bone dry, unappealing to taste and touch, and ridiculously expensive for the lack of quality.  Will not be back again.
My boyfriend has this strange obsession with garlic and onions while I just am not fond of it at all... I went with him anyways as he was done with midterms and needed a treat.

Boy did my breathe kick for days after... but it was worth it. All I'll say is that the prime rib was solid. I ordered it with trepidation that I might not enjoy it as much as HOPR but quickly that doubt vanished with the first bite of the main course. Not only was the prime rib legit but the accompaniments (garlic mash & creamed spinach) were a pleasant surprise. AND the food heated up well the next day! My wife on the other hand didn't care too much for her pasta dish but I would come back without caution. Stank breath or not... I'm coming for that prime rib!
Amazing food and awesome experience!!
Despite being my boyfriend's favorite restaurant.. I found this place to be outdated and serving heavy meals.

name: The Stinking Rose - A Garlic Restaurant

reviews.text: Im just a poor art student who one night stumbled upon this small establishment one night. I had just been bar hopping around columbus, and wanted one more drink before i went to go meet some friends at a different place. I noticed this place out of the corner of my eye and i had a quick look at the menu. My eyes immediately noticed   this place served sausage rolls.

Melt! is exactly what it purports to be--a French style cafe that does a reasonable, cheap fondue streetside. Great place for a girl's meal or a funky date, tasty but not fancy. I've been a few times, and will go back.

My goodness. This was my first time ever trying fondue and I fell in love. The lady behind the counter (sorry I forgot her name) was extremely courteous and helpful. We went on a Wednesday night and it was a few other folks in there enjoying their food. My date (who shall remain nameless) dropped the bread bowl and we all had a good laugh. The price is pretty cheap also. We spent $62 on 4 hard ciders, the cheese fondue,  and the sausage wrap.

Each year on my mom's birthday (she passed away few years ago) I go somewhere special for dinner. Since she loved fondue, I thought Melt would be a good option. When I called to make a reservation, the man who answered accused me of continually calling and hanging up. Then, when I explained I had never called before he said very angrily, "yeah right - whatever - just come in and use your groupon." I did not have a groupon, had not called before and his rude, poor customer service added insult to injury. I decided not to eat there and don't plan to in the future.

I stumbled upon Melt when strolling around on a Tuesday evening before the dinner rush.  It was quiet with just a couple guys drinking wine at the bar.  We were lured in by the sign on the street advertising the roasted garlic and brie plate.  It was a great pre-dinner treat with a glass of wine apiece.  The price seemed reasonable, the wine was good, and the brie and garlic plate was tasty.  The restaurant was tiny and cute, they advertised live jazz music later in the evening that I'm sure would be delightful with a glass of wine and a cheese plate.  If I had more time in the city I'd be interested in returning to try the cheese fondue - yum!

What was I thinking?  Was I really expecting a real Swiss fondue?   Well. I'm sorry to tell that wasn't the case,  I guess that for the local crowed that haven't travelled to Switzerland. They re happy.  I mean the quality is there ok ambiance during lunch. But the owner wasn't caring less that we where happy or not.  Won't go there again too many greater places around.

Had so much fun at Melt and the food was very good (except the fondue). There was a cool jazz band and everyone got into the music...dancing, singing.  We ordered and then order some more: sausage roll (really small...more like an appetizer) and melted cheese sandwich with a simple salad. This was perfect, so tasty...but we were still hungry so we ordered a small savory fondue. I've had much better fondue...there wasn't much flavor to it and a bit grainy. The bread was soft so it fell apart in the hot cheese...you really need a hard crusty or toasted bread for fondue. It was nice that it came with apples and grapes too though. We won't order the fondue again but we will be back...it was super fun and delicious otherwise!

It was mid-afternoon on a Saturday, and it turns out that's an awkward time to get food on Columbus St. in North Beach. Most places either close between lunch and dinner, or they just serve dinner on weekends. We just wanted a snack and a drink within walking distance of the hotel. Our first choice and second choice places were both closed, so we wandered further down and found this place.
We had a great time at Melt! Wednesday night at their weekly open mic. The food and beverages are delicious and the owner John was so friendly!

I bought a groupon for 4 and took my best friend and her boyfriend there for her birthday thinking wow this place is cool its in my hood and the site is awesome it has foreign cinema nite and the last tine i was there they had a 4 page menu
Make a reservation-- seating is very limited and the dining area is small

This place is pretty damn pricey for what it is. I wouldn't return without a Groupon, and DON'T come with the intention of having fondue as a meal.. that isn't fair, haha. This is one of those places where you come for the experience, so let's leave it at that (I doubt most people have fondue pots)
I came here once cuz I love cheese fondue and I was not impressed. The place is cramped.  The cheese and oil or whatever it was were separated in the pot... disappointing

My wife and I were wrapping up a wonderful weekend in San Francisco and were looking for some wine and a light bite late on Sunday evening.  We started out at Sweeties for a couple of drinks which was a great little dive bar with cool guest dogs, but not really a place for food.
My girlfriend and I cashed in a Groupon for some fondue at this place.  Everything tasted great, but the service was horrible.
This place is so awkward at night, with terrible musicians trying to sell their album. During the day, the food is nothing special and the owner is a massive tool

Grabbed a large fondue special Groupon. Hubby and I enjoyed a traditional Swiss fondue for lunch, complete with grapes, apples, and a large bowl of cut up bread. Oh, and a bottle of wine (which we brought home).  I love a good fondue, and while it was good, they were a little heavy handed with the wine in the cheese - for my taste.  Hubby thought it was really good.

I am writing about a very bad experience I had trying to redeem a Groupon at this establishment. My husband and I were very excited to have some fondue. We arrived at approximately 7:30 and sat ourselves at a table. There was one man working and he didn't even make eye contact when we came in. We sat there for about 15 minutes, and my husband walked up to the counter and asked the man working for a menu so we could order some fondue (we used the word fondue, specifically). He was very rude to my husband and said "it's going to be a while". At this point there were only two other tables with guests at the restaurant and one of them had just received a plate of fondue. We sat for another 15 minutes and my husband approached the counter again. At that time, the man said "I told your husband it would be a while". We told him we had picked out a fondue and that we were ready to order. He then said, unapologetically, that there was no fondue left and that the kitchen was closed. We expressed our disbelief, given we had been sitting for over 30 minutes with clear intentions to order fondue and that this was never told to us.
I don't know if anywhere else sums up North Beaches old guard more than this least assuming wine and cheese spot in the universe.

Discovered this place on Groupon after The Melting pot wouldn't let us use the groupon voucher on the ENTIRE valentines day week... When that's exactly why we bought it..Ridiculous... That's a whole bother review in itself.....
Cute place with delicious fondue & friendly staff. We tried the Scrumpy Welsh Rarebit, followed by the chocolate - great stuff! Will definitely be back soon!

Ducked in here one late afternoon with my sister and her beau to grab a glass of wine. The ambiance was lovely as there was a band who was playing low key music at a volume you didn't have to scream over. It was the right kind of vibe when hanging out with family and wine.

I went for a free comedy night that they have on Monday's, it was ok. As expected, some of the comedians were actually pretty good, some were pretty bad. The fondu looked pretty good, but we didnt try any. Drinks were very reasonably priced. I would recommend popping in to see what its all about if you're in the area and looking for a free comedy show.

After talking with the guy who answered the telephone tonight we opted NOT to eat at Melt and WILL NOT be going there in the future.  The staff is FRIENDLY and COURTEOUS at Matterhorn and that's where we'll go.

Went here through Groupon. No problems using the groupon! The food was good but their menu is limited. The portions were decent too. The only reason I wouldn't go back is the location. My hubby and I don't care to go to Russian Hill because of parking.
It might just be the fact that I LOVE meat and feel incomplete without meat during my meal, but I just wasn't satisfied. In comparison to the Melting Pot, this was place wasn't the greatest.
Purchased a groupon for the desert fondue, as my boyfriend is not a cheese fan, and I'm glad I only paid $10 instead of the supposed $20 that it was worth or I would of been highly unsatisfied.
Purchased a Groupon deal for Melt and am glad that we did because full price would not have made me happy!

Only came here because I thought we got a good deal on groupon. We came on a weekend during the day. We received no acknowledgement that we were there. They have dirty table cloths. A woman wearing a back pack came to took our order. We had no idea she was even a waitress. Their bathroom was disgusting. Their fondue was just ok. 2 stars for the free live jazz.
It was ok. Did not live up to the reviews at all. We tried to order 3 different things and they were out of all of them. Not worth a second visit.
Two stars is actually being too nice... More like 1.5.

I decided to burn off all my calories I had been eating on my business trip by walking back and forth from the Fisherman's Wharf to the convention center.  This little place caught my eye several times on the walk, and I had to stop in after I read the menu.

The king (Me) says: melted cheese with bread is one big fat ohhhhh hell yeah. The service was kind and generous. The groupon made it even more  worthwhile. A glass of mulled red wine made the chilly night easier for my San Diego sensitive genes. Stout cheese fondue was flavorful and creamy. Jazz was played very well. Smallness of restaurant made it cozy.

The guys who  worked there were really cool and helpful and the fondue is made on a butane burner right up front.  I could have used a little more flavor as we got the swiss, but I was overall still pretty happy.  The had a good selection of beer and wine.  We opted for the large which came with two salads, plent of bread, apples, and grapes.  They cut the apple right when you order to it is nice a fresh.  I would like to go back and try to rarebit.

Went to Melt for the first time for a date with my boyfriend. We had really been looking forward to eating here because we love fondue and it's only a few blocks away from our apartment. Though, after this experience, I will never go back & will make sure none my friends do either.
Great atmosphere and food. I bought several Groupons prior to a trip to San Fran and this was one. Cute little place. I recommend you try the dessert fondue with the house red wine.

Not sure why so many people are whining!   The service was wonderful, staff attentive and it was semi-busy on the fourth of July.  Melt! served me the best french onion soup I've ever had in my life- it is one of my favorites so I've had it at a lot of places!  The soup was flavorful and full of stuff!  No watered down soup here.  I have never had fondue before but my husband and I choose the small Rarebit.  We were pleasantly surprised that the meal came with a side salad for each of us.  The fondue tasted great and it was very fun to eat!  We couldn't even finish all the cheese and bread.  If traffic/parking was better, I'd come here a lot more!  I can only imagine how great the chocolate fondue must be.
Waste of time.

Went in at 7pm on a Friday night, surprisingly when we got there it wasn't that busy yet! (Yes! Beat the crowd!) i decided to not order the cheese fondue and just went with a tuna melt sandwich, brie and roasted garlic plate, and the chocolate fondue for dessert.

I was here for the Monday comedy show.  Never heard of Melt before but I am coming back for the fondue. It smelled so good. And I asked the audience how it was. They loved. So this should count as 30 reviews. And this place is super charming in looks and vibe.

I've lived down the street for a year and the long lines on weekend mornings always deterred me from giving Cafe Francisco a try. This AM we ordered the Mediterranean Frittata & Le Croissant - $8.95ea. Hearty portions and delicious. Service was friendly. -1 Star because the gal couldn't tell me what kind of coffee beans they had? Hopefully they'll know next time I come in :-)

We were lucky to find this place when we were in San Francisco. They serve fruit to with most of their dishes.  I had a salmon sandwhich with soup and left satisfied.  It's a great place to stop in for lunch...

What a gem. Free wifi, friendly staff, the freshest ingredients and the best Greek salad I've ever had. Everything was excellent: salads to sandwiches to breakfasts. The Francisco Bagel and California frittata are great breakfast choices.

Once upon a time this was a great place. Really good Greek salad, good breakfast bagel, decent sandwiches. Then about a year or two ago the owner seems to have disengaged so it seems mostly unmanaged. Also, the quality of the ingredients has been declining --for example, said Greek salad use to feature chicken breast. Now it's BK style manufactured chix-strip-meat-parts. Gross. We stopped going there, but the tourists seem to keep them going. Such a bummer.
I like supporting the smaller, less corporate folks so this is a nice new find. The menu is inviting and the coffee good.
Very nice place, just off the Embarcadero for the ones who just can't stand all the tourists. Really recommended!
Nothing special . Had parmesan chicken sandwich and iced tea after a long walk in fishermans warf. The location is the best part of it. It is in a quiet corner of powell street close to pier 39.
It took soooo long to get our food. The tables were sticky and wet, and the staff was not good at keeping up with the (few) people they had to deal with.

My significant other and I went to this cafe and received terrible service at the counter. The young man taking our order was obviously not paying any attention, more interested in twirling his pen and dropping it, than writing anything down. He needed to be told the entire order again when he went to the register to enter it. One of our selections was an iced coffee drink, to which he replied that they were out of ice but it was on it's way. We said that was fine and we would wait since we were eating there. We finished our meal, which was mediocre at best, and no iced mocha. We went to the counter and asked and the guy about the iced mocha and he obviously forgot about the drink. I had seen their co-worker bring in the ice more than ten minutes earlier and they had already made multiple iced drinks for customers just arriving. Maybe they were just having a bad day, but it was pretty bad.
I love this place. I come here quite often. Food is perfect, staff  is great, location is the best! you can work here, check email, read book, relax or just meetwe friend.

There is great food here, very nice employees, and a great location.  I very much enjoyed my bagel and hot chocolate.  Great place to take the grandchildren on a Sunday morning - their reviews are above.  Hadn't been here for a while, still a relaxed, non-pretentious locals place with good drink and food, a hidden gem as other reviews say.

Great breakfast. Not a huge selection but what they do, they do great. I love the Francisco bagel. Mediterranean frittata is good too and comes with yummy sourdough toast and sliced grapefruit. Perfect breakfast. Great little local place.

This place is by far my favorite place to grab a bite or a drink before work. The hidden gem of the area, tucked away from the riffraff of the fisherman's wharf/pier 39 crowd, they have a great menu of exciting flavors, ranging from savory breakfast frittatas to rich soups and fresh, flavorful salads. Their soups are by far my favorites, they are constantly changing, and are always my go-to no matter the weather or time of day (butternut curry, red pepper Gouda bisque, Mediterranean veggie, Thai chicken basil, I'd go on but now I'm drooling).
Delicious! Good ambiance. Good prices. Cosy and not pretentious. A bit vintage and seem very typical. Love it
Food is good, coffee is meh. Seems to have recently raised the prices.
Time: 3:03pm/70°F partly sunny
Coffee is blah

These guys have been back in action for a while! I meant to update sooner, but, hey, I'm a busy guy. Everything from sandwiches, salads and soups are as excellent as ever. I'm so excited! Another lunch stop to rely on, phew.

A hidden gem.  Tucked away from all of the hustle and bustle of the Embarcadero and Fisherman's wharf, I would like to consider this my escape.  When I first relocated to SF from the East Coast (Nashville, to be exact), I resided with a friend of a friend in the brewery converted Condominiums that are located next to Cafe Francisco for a couple of months.  I finally found my own apartment and my life in SF began in Lower Russian Hill (near Ghirardhelli);yet, I'll never forget Cafe Francisco.
Perfectly simple.

When you work in the Fisherman's Wharf area it can be hard to find good food at the right price. Love their caprese salad. A local lunchtime favorite among Williams Sonoma employees. Get there before noon. Grab a seat by the window. Great natural light.

i love this super neighborhood joint. and i can't believe the FRITATTAs are not mentioned more often. it's SO good. i always think about coming back and getting it. they can be a little slow but its not horrible. this place is great to catch up with friends or to do some work or study.

So, I'm probably more like a 4 star versus a 3 star.  I love the falafel sandwich and everything is good. I wouldn't say it's great, but overall good. If you live in the area, it's a perfect place to stop before or after grocery shopping. I like Café Capriccio better for hanging out and getting coffee but they don't have a lot of food options. Café Francisco has a lot of food options. I haven't tried enough on the menu to give it a 4 star, but I'm willing to keep going. It's also nice to sit outside on a nice day. (It's always hard finding places to sit outside with your dog).
The service here is unbearably slow. I've been here twice when it wasn't busy and waited almost thirty min for a breakfast sandwich. Definitely not worth the wait.
Solid coffee. Simple, good quality cafe food. Straightforward, no-nonsense service. I

I have no problems with this place. Drinks are cheap and pretty strong, and the layout is nice, especially with all the outdoor seating (and on both sides of the outdoor area in front of the cafe). They also do happy hour every day of the week. That is no laughing matter, folks. Pastries and coffee are good, and neithe will break the bank. You can spend a whole day just people watching in this cafe. Love it.
Order the San Fran!!! Grilled chicken, bacon, avocado, lettuce, tomato and mayo/Dijon mustard on sourdough...absolutely delicious!!!

I love they're Margarita pita sandwich and the coffee cake BUT they really take their time preparing their food which is great and all but when the line is out the door they should really make an effort to not make you wait 40mins for a Togo order. It's frustrating.
Great spot for lunch! We just happened upon it, and we were very happy with our meals! I got the parmesan chicken sandwich, and highly recommend it!

i come here when i dont know where else to eat, probably like once a week... lots of bad things - i dont like the coffee they use, im always "too late" for french toast but they still offer me waffles (which are not good btw). why can you make waffles but not french toast? they charged to pour an americano on ice which is pretty dumb, the girl who i think is the manager has an attitude problem and most of the time is pretty rude even after tipping. seriously not that hard to smile or wait to roll your eyes until i turn around. they also have a fruit fly problem.

I come here for lunch a few times a month and my favorite thing to get is a half sandwich half salad combo. You can pick from ANY sandwich on the menu which most places won't let you do and it comes with a side salad with greens, tomatos, cucumber, peppers and dressing. All for $8-$9, great deal!
Nice little find on a Sunday morning.  Great food, nicely presented. Seems to have a local following.   Service is a bit on the slow side... But not an issue on a sunny Sunday

Absolute breakfast bliss with a bevy of Bay charm. This cafe rivals any you might come across in the West Village in NYC,  but without the inflated prices and inevitable pretension. I ordered a simple bagel sandwich, and was pleasantly surprised at how it was nearly indistinguishable from my fond memories of consuming bagels on Sundays in Florida and New York. The eggs were scrambled perfectly, fluffy and plentiful. Cafe Francisco is just one of many reasons why I keep coming back to SF.
Not much to say.  Very generic bagels and coffee that was pretty mediocre.  I'm sure it is better than the touristy places on the docks, but we were not very impressed with the Cafe.
Great prices and tasty food. Super convenient for calling in a lunch order for pick up. The only thing that would make it better - stop over frying the falafel on the Mediterranean plate.

This place is a great little gem in the tourist-infested area near Pier 39. I am a student at a school in the area, and this is one of the few places around there that I can go for good food and good coffee, away from the pier. The food is really pretty good--I usually get the mediterranean plate but I've also had the veggie sandwich and the spinach salad with bacon. All good. And the coffee is really excellent--never needs sugar.

Decent place for breakfast or lunch.  Not sure where they get their bread from, but it's really good.  Sandwiches and soups are the best option here.  I've tried the salads, but haven't found one I actually like.  Fritatas are good also; they take a bit longer to make, so don't order one if you're in a rush.  Lattes are OK.

I live pretty much above this place, so frequent it quite often for coffee and quick bites. They have a great selection of pastries, bagels and other breakfast items.They also have beer and wine and make some great sandwiches and salads. They tend to get pretty busy, so expect to wait a while for anything hot. I wouldn't get the fruit dish though - both times I have it's been out of season and off.

We had breakfast a couple of times here and enjoyed all of it.  The yummy mochas, tasty breakfast sandwiches, and a nice SF atmosphere. It's fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf, but seems far away for crowds and noise.
Awesome, quiet cafe with super nice people, great sandwiches and menu. love this place. great prices too.

This is one of my favorite bars in the city. It is one of the first places I ever went when I moved here and I find myself coming back all the time. The service is friendly, the live music on the weekends is always awesome (lots of classic rock and good jamming music) and the crowd is always fun! There is not much more I can say but that it is a must go! Good draft beer selection too :)

Absolutely the worst survive .., I have never had a meltdown Siri grab me and asked for my ID absolutely absurd ..... When asking for a manager I'm told that everybody in the place is a manager which is absolutely a joke... Don't go here it's a joke

Mixed review - lots of beers on tap for good prices ($5-$6) but I went on a Thursday and there was only 1 bartender who was taking her time getting to serving people. As for the food, I'd give that 0-1 stars. It's a dive bar though so obviously not known for their food...would recommend this place for drinks/live music only.
Love this bar. Awesome atmosphere. Janice the bartender- perfecto! Will be back every time we come to the city!

I had the chicken n waffles &baked Mac n cheese. The Mac n cheese was tasty. The waffles were fluffy n moist n the chicken was alright better wit the syrup. They gave fair portions I felt it was worth every cent.

Tuesday night, 11 30 pm. This place was exciting. Karaoke! If you love karaoke, this is where you need to be. It's like non stop fast pace karaoke fun. It almost was like when you perform here, you are definitely someone on their way to stardom. All of the people had talent and not just with singing. These people were some for real performers. I say put a jar on the stage and let these people make some money
Stumbled upon this place one night to a live jazz band which was awesome! The crowd was dancing and enjoying their drinks to the max. Will definitely be going back again.

Ordered one drink, bartender brings two, then admonishes us both for not specifying to ONLY bring one drink when there are two people (she explained that they assume two beverages if there are two people).  I've been around and never heard this, anywhere. Barely got out of paying for two ..but not before being lectured in front of my date. Fun bar, really, but the customer isn't always right.

Went here for birthday brunch, and Janice did a rad job of taking care of us. We listened to Michael Jackson's greatest hits, and got to have a pretty good selection of soul food. The chicken and waffles were delicious, as well as the beer selection. Janice made a pretty rad toasted jalapeno shot that was stupid good.

Music music music I can not express enough how awesome and lively the bands are that get booked here. Teague is a great performer and musician and a decent bartender. I love the whole staff there. They have amazing burgers that come with fries pork slider and I still need to try their shrimp and grits. It's definitely not like the grits you get served in Jail. But really come check out the free live bands or root on the Giants here at my favorite hot spot in North beach and the city
Tuesday nights rock at this joint!...thanks to DJ Purple!

This review is strictly based on Tupelo's Tuesday Night Dance Karaoke and it was a blast.  Definitely come by to check this out and watch DJ Purple do his thing as he provides instrumental back up on his Saxophone and Harmonica.  The guy is awesome because he can also provide backup vocals as well.  So even if you're a never newbie or if you're completely bombing up on the stage, he definitely has your back covered.
My kind of place as it is dance karaoke so the songs are more upbeat!
Came here with Rodney H, Bobby L & Peter L on a random Tuesday night after dinner. Peter had been here before and had a blast so we thought why not check it out?!

Bar with decent music guests and karaoke on Tuesdays (if karaoke's your thing).  Good liquor and beer available.  Nice stool seating by the windows!  Also, very good baked macaroni and cheese and buffalo wings.
Terrible service, rude bartenders, sticky bar.
Best all around bar in N Beach:
I'm into it but the live music is too loud sometimes
This has been a fun little neighborhood bar in the past, but...

Tupelo's the best neighborhood bar in North Beach, hands down. Teague, the owner, has brought great live music back to Grant Street (and is a badass musician of his own). Mostly blues/rock on the weekends, with an assortment of other classic bar activities (karaoke, trivia, Sunday bingo, etc) all happening too.
This place was nice. Good music, nice decor, and great food. I had the catfish po'boy and was very happy with the crispiness and texture of the roll.
Really a great place for many reasons.
This place is way cool! I went with a buddy to experience an awesome band called Sinister Dexter and really enjoyed the whole experience! We showed early and had some of their delicious grub.
What was that band's problem? Being so loud!
Live music, and much better atmosphere than some surrounding bars.
Ok, I should have updated this a long time ago, but I guess better late that never, eh?  Tupelo is the BEST, and has become one of our favorite NB spots to hit.
Best fried chicken EVER!
This is a large bar that is a bit dingy.
DJ Purple is the best karaoke dj ever! He rocks out on the sax with every song. Truly a great touch. Fun crowd, nice bartenders, all ages just looking for a fun time on a random tuesday night.

What a great time!! Last night I went to see The Bonedrivers, a local SF band that I don't see play around SF. They played mostly cover tunes but their originals rocked!! I would've loved to hear a few more of those. The crowd was really fun and the dance floor was packed most of the night. Unfortunately, I hurt my knee so was unable to join in the fun--this time. I'll be looking for these guys to play there again--hopefully soon!

The highlights pretty much hit it all - great soul food, especially the brie mac n cheese and the fried pickles. Would never have thought to look in North Beach for great bar soul food, but that's SF for you. Surprise around every corner.
Not a place to eat/have drinks with friends if you want to be able to have conversations with them. Great if you're looking for a bar with a dance floor. Bartenders were friendly.
Stopped in here for drinks on New Year's Day.

After a long night, this was the best morning-bar I could have asked to been taken to.  The Chicken and Waffles were amazing. and I'm not really even that into the whole chicken and waffle craze, but I think I might be now.  The fried chicken itself had a good southern kick to it, and combined with syrup and a solid waffle base made my taste buds bow down and worship.

The dance floor is great! Outlandish and outstanding dancers make it easy to just do your own thing. The musicianship of the bands is top notch. Inspiring, energetic bands have been playing every time I've been there. People dance where they stand too. Wooden floor boards throughout the bar so if you get the urge - go for it!

Pretty cool bar with live entertainment along one of the smaller back streets in North Beach. Was there on a recent Saturday night. Place was packed and there was some sort of big band ensemble performing. Classic San Francisco bar if you ask me. Diverse crowd, good times being had by all, live music performing, good drinks.... Quintessential North Beach... I liked it. Sadly, friends that were with me, did not. Hahah....  Drinks, If I remember correctly were pretty strong. I dont know the pricing because my friend bought us a round before we moved on to another bar. Check Tupelo out.. Might be your thing.

I LOVED this place! Wandered in on a random Saturday night and there was an awesome live band just jammming their faces off and having a great time.  Pretty good beer selection and the place was just crowded enough where there was enough room to dance around and hang out.  I would 100% return with friends for a fun night out. Seems like the food is legit too, so that's always a good reason to come back as well :)

What a great place!  After walking around North Beach and rejecting one touristy-looking Italian restaurant after the other, we found Tupelo.  It was JUST what I never knew I was looking for: fun atmosphere, great classic rock playing, and great food.  We both ordered the chicken and waffles.  It was to die for!  THe chicken was crispy and perfectly savory and the waffle was crisp and browned.  Top it all off with savory slaw, sweet maple syrup, and butter, and make every bite a little bit of heaven.  And all this for $12!  I'll be back again.
Best things to know about Tupelo:

Live music at this place is a definite plus...especially if you like the band.  Overall, I wasn't super impressed with the 2 bartenders (ONLY) on staff during a very busy Saturday night.  Getting drinks took about 15+ minutes.  Time can be much better spent enjoying the venue, the band, and your company.

My fav Thai place anywhere! This quaint, fairly priced restaurant consistently serves delicious noodles and veggies to me, perfectly spicy, and does so fast and with a good attitude. I crave the flat noodles here! The best deal and one of North Beach's best meals usually without a long wait. They're awesome!
I would have loved to give this place more stars because their food was very flavorful and rich. Well spiced thai food.
Great portions and attentive service. The duck curry was delicious and filling. Very well priced considering it's in a touristy area. The crab ragoon was excellent too.

Last Sunday, after church, when we cross the road, my kid sae the Thai food, she want to try it, so we went inside, because it was 11:30am, so not too much people, After the waitress take the order, we still waiting about 25 minutes.

Really good food with big portions at good prices (the dishes that are labeled spicy are actually spicy so be careful). And the staff was very friendly. Happy we chose this place over some of the more expensive places nearby. Would definitely come here again.
Great Thai food for a great price in a major metro city!  Definitely highly recommend when in San Francisco!
I've had takeout and delivery from here and both dinners have been delightful. When I ordered takeout
The food is spicy and has incredible flavor! The service is wonderful, and the location is awesome. Thai tea is a little small, but good. The shrimp added to any dish is the way to go!

We had lunch here last week and were very happy with the service and food.  The 11am-6pm $2 Singha beer is a great deal.  The restaurant seating areas were clean, the server was friendly and helpful and the food was good.  I would recommend this restaurant is you're in North Beach and want Thai.

I thought this hole in the wall might be good because the well meaning and nice people who work there seemed "legit". I am my companion order the pumpkin squash and pad Thai and two different soups. The pad Thai was lame...not awful or even bad but just boring and mediocre. My lunch partner didn't get chicken pumpkin he ordered, he got prawns instead. He was unimpressed. All in all a ho hum experience...definitely not worth going out of your way for and many better Thai places in town.

Went here with my family. Food was okay until my sister found a fly in her soup. I don't have a lot to say except while going to the restroom I cought a glimpse of the messy kitchen and swarm of flies around the food

I was in the city on Monday and what a salad I had here. I had my heart set on another  place but I was so hungry that I saw the menu and went here instead. I ordered the Tuk Tuk salad which consisted on lettuce, egg, tomatoes, fried tofu and warm peanut sauce. I'm not sure how the fry the tofu but it was light and crunch on the outside and soft in the center. Anyway it was a nice lunch for $6.50. You cant beat that!

I love this place (especially their green curry) but I just got delivery and after tipping, the delivery man looked at me and said, "what, this is it?" Had to shut the door on him. If this is how they treat their customers, I'm definitely not coming back. And I wish I could take the tip back!

I'm a Laotian girl OBSESSED with flavor and spice. This place ALWAYS hits the spot. Best Thai food in town, seriously. I would highly recommend this place to anyone that wants authentic Thai food. My favorites are the beef noodle soup, pad thai, pad se ew  and panang curry. But honestly anything you order it EXCELLENT!
Ordered for delivery. Delivery was fast however the food was pretty bland.
Fairly priced, standard Thai menu.  It didn't knock my socks off, but it didn't disappoint.  Service was great, and the food came out very quickly.

I opened the door to this very small (just a few tables) shop in North Beach to find myself assaulted by a head-rush of incense -- I think we used less in college. I don't know that I've ever smelled that much incense in my life, and certainly not in a Thai restaurant. That said, we're not allergic, so on we went.
Very solid thai food spot if you're in north beach. Great for takeout.

Decent food, decent prices. Just good. Nothing spectacular. But a great spot if you're in north beach and craving thai. Their sign is super cute gotta give them that, you can't miss it.  Thai iced tea a bit overly sweet. Gra-Prow was alright. Theres alot of places that are better, but in this specific neighborhood this is the place to go.

Great little Thai spot inside north beach. Reasonable prices and great food. I love eggplant so I get it pretty much every time. The fried rice was great too. Really appreciated how the food wasn't drowned in oil but still tasted great. Inside is nice but small. Liked how it was an open kitchen and you could see the wok in action and see they kept things clean. My go to Thai spot for a quick bite
My friend and I ordered two dishes, which came out lightning fast! Awesome because I was hungrier'n a mug.
I love the food here, but be ready to be patient with the waitresses. You might have to remind them to get your food, give you more water and do the smiling for them.
Tuk Tuk Thai Cafe, "Tuk Tuk my money."

Delicious! I tried the Panang Curry and the Pad Thai, seriously delicious. Snappy service, great price, no complaints aside from the sticky rice seeming reheated. But we were the only people there, so it makes sense. Thanks!
I'm sad to have to negatively update my review of this neighborhood spot which i liked so much when i lived in North Beach.
Yuuuuummmm! Got the Chicken Larb - mint was super fresh, dressing was delicious and they have Brown Rice which makes my day!! Price was very reasonable, service is great and big portions! Love it!
For my lunch came here for the first time had some good food here. The place is so clean and good atmosphere.
Came here Tuesday afternoon for lunch; had fried rice with pork and egg (#45) and thought it was solid. Attentive service and nice spot.
They use skippy Peanut Butter for their peanut sauces.
I ordered delivery and WOW was I pleasantly surprised!
Small little place and not the nicest inside.  Also seems to be some heavy traffic right outside of the window...perhaps a bus or trolley stop so don't expect an intimate meal here.
Good food although I was expecting plate to have more heat to it. Flavor was good on my Pad Num Prig Poa and service was excellent.

Nothing fancy but delicious. And right next to Rogue Ales pub, where I went before and after. So perhaps that enhanced my enthusiasm over Tuk Tuk, but we thoroughly loved the 3 dishes we got: Pad See Ew, Pad Thai and fried rice. It was so good. Waitress was nice. Food came fast. No complaints. And for anyone who wants a real inside look at the kitchen, the path to the bathroom goes right past the stoves and prep areas. I know...

Our go-to Thai take-out dinner option.  We order the Chinese sausage fried rice, Pad See Eew, Stir-fried Chinese Broccoli, Tom Kha Gai (soup),  and the Tod Mun Pla fish cakes religiously.  They are always good.  We sometimes vary with duck curry, pad thai and specials.  Very affordable prices considering North Beach location.

I was in Thailand for 6 months and their menu offers some pretty authentic dishes. With that being said, they didn't taste 100% authentic, but the food was still delicious. My boyfriend got the pineapple fried rice dish, and I got pad thai. Very impressive portion sizes  - we both had leftovers, and we usually scrape our plates clean. The service was prompt, kept coming by to fill up our waters (at least 3 times, very attentive), the waitress was nice, and our food came out in a decent amount of time. The food we ordered isn't to die for, but was definitely good and I would definitely go back to try out the rest of their menu.

The employees here are nice, so I give them props for the efficient and kindly service.  The food is acceptable, but I don't think it's any great shakes.  Having gotten both take out and eaten inside, I've had a few experiences here so far, each time trying new dishes.  It'll get the job done and it's good, but there is better thai in the area I think.  King of Thai is a better value...although this place has a more convenient location for those of us that don't live over in Telegraph Hill, hence my repeat visits.
Food is good, service is okay. If it wasn't for an annoying incident that I am about to describe it would have been a four star.
A decent lunch meal, and affordable.

I love pumpkin curry! Usually I get it at one of my fave places in SOMA but today I tried Tuk Tuk for the first time and their pumpkin curry was delicious. It had a perfect mild spice to it. Loved it! Will definitely go back
A Cute small time restaurant to stop in for a quick cheap bite to eat.

This place is a trek to get to since it's right smack in between Chinatown and North beach. The only good thing about this place is the calamari and maybe the Hong Kong style noodles but also, they open pretty late for club goers.
Rude service! Went in here with a party of 8 and the restaurant did not close for 3 hours.

Went with my wife, she had a noodle soup I had sweet and sour Schrimps.  I loved it and she did too. Service was really good, very prompt and very polite. This is probably how the restautants look back in Bejing but I wish it was more clean, it felt a bit dirty, hence the 4 stars. Would I go back? Absolutely.

The location is conveniently located.  However, worst Chinese food I have ever had in Chinatown.  Slow serivice, duck feet were sour, some clams served unfresh or bad, fried noodles were not evently cooked.  Please watch out, if you must try stay away from traditional Chinese dishes and go somewhere else.

I really wish there was an option to not give this place any stars at all. The service was horrible. What I would expect is a smile no bad looks and just serve us. My friends ended up getting sick. That's two people throwing up. The place is filthy. When we were leaving we were nice enough to leave $3 for tip. Bill was $38.35 we gave her $41.35 she counts the money in front of us and says there isn't enough. Says that we owe her a six dollar tip. Forget that!! She didn't deserve it. Won't recommend this place at all. Don't go!! Trust me!!
One of my favorites in all of Chinatown San Francisco. Authentic and delicious. Service is good and friendly. Go for the crab, it so goood. #chinatown #sanfrancisco #dungenesscrab
Ummm can you say FOOD POISONING! I should have walked out when I saw the pigeon walking around inside with no cook or waitress fleeing him out, only giggles in response.

After hitting up China Town, my parents and I were starving and decided to eat somewhere nearby since the BNB we were staying at was in Pacifica. On the way back to the car, my Dad spots this place adorned with the photos of the owner with various hosts from Travel Channel and Food Network (ie Samantha Brown and Andrew Zimmern), plus the Zagat stickers from 2011 - 2014. I checked the reviews on Yelp and it had 4 stars so it must be good right? So we decided to eat here.

Fried oysters were inedible....UGH.  Calamari was not up to par. Ginger beef was good, but such a small amount!!  Servings, overall, were small.  Mediocre experience and over priced.  Try another spot.

I came here from Long Beach, ca. Bombass food freal. I don't eat shellfish but my ma absolutely loved the giner and green onion crab ! ($42) and the portion was HUGE. They season all of their dishes very well. We also got the chinese brocoli with cod fish and beef chinese noodle. All delicious !!

The reason why people think Yuet Lee serves good Chinese food is because it's 2:00 in the morning and you find yourself in North Beach, drunk and hungry, and desperate for anything greasy and oily that would help soak up all the alcohol.  So your options are limited at this hour of the day as is your judgment for what good food is, and Yuet Lee happens to be one of two Chinese restaurants opened (the other is Sun Hong Kong further down Broadway, which is even worst but at least much cheaper).  I've eaten Chinese food all my life and all over the world, and there's no other reason to eat at a place like Yuet Lee other than that.  Its prices are outrageous.  The food is mediocre at best, super greasy and oily and will likely give you the runs later.  Don't get caught up with all the celebrity photos on the wall, most of them have no idea about authentic and good Chinese food, and don't pay an average person's price when they go out to eat.  They're just playing tourist when they come here, don't get trapped!
The family and I ate dinner at Yuet Lee the night before attending Outside Lands in Golden Gate Park.

I haven't been to this place in a while, but I remember loving it so much when I lived in SF. I ate here several times. This is the kind of restaurant that does stir fried things well. And deep fried things, too, for that matter. Also, the lobster is good.
Loved the clams. Didn't care for the salt and pepper squid because I thought it was too salty. Food came out super quick. Place is kind of ghetto, but it makes the place seem authentic.
Delicious Chinese food, a must go. Best thing is you can pay with credit card with an order minimum (I believe) of $10.
They say they're open, but when you try to place an order they tell you they're not open and give you an attitude. Completely unappreciated and disrespectful. This place is terrible.
open late. good salt and pepper calamari. cooked well, seasoned great, nice light crispy breading
The service was excellent and quick. The food was delicious. It's small but homey. I recommend the Peking ribs. They are awesome.

The food here is a bit pricier than most simple Chinese restaurants. The service is quick but a bit hostile. The food was pretty good. But I would definitely head to Broadway Cafe before heading here since their prices are more reasonable for the same type of dishes.
I have been coming to Yuet lee since 2010.

I was feeling a bit hungry because the Moroccan food I had for dinner didn't seem too satisfying.  It was good cuisine, a belly dancer put on quite a show and all, but it was finger foods, you know?  So I made the trek to Chinatown, specifically to Yuet Lee, for some no nonsense, old fashioned comfort food.  I had a Tsingtao beer, plain won ton and clams in pepper, black bean sauce.  The food hit the spot!  I left full & with a grin on my face.  I'm just a simple Chinese man....
Im from LA so when everyone told me to go to Chinatown I figured it doesnt matter where u eat...
Loved the salt and pepper squid.  Great pan fried noodles too.  The braised pork chops rocked too.
My favorite Chinese seafood restaurant. (Well, to be fair, the only Chinese seafood restaurant I can ever remember going back to, but that's besides the point).

The food is outstanding and I have now found a new favorite place in Chinatown FINALLY! The other reviews about the staff being rude is a bunch of bullshit, maybe certain customers need to check their ego's in at the door. The hours are great also for a late night bite.
Good food...but if they are going to be this way about prices (see picture)......then I can't recommend......it.
So delicious! Love the salt and pepper calamari, beef chow fun, and the sweet and sour pork chops! Everything is so good actually. LOVE!

I was visiting from NY with some friends and stopped here after reading all these great reviews. We wanted to eat light but just could not stop ourselves, it smelled amazing in there with loads of pictures of all their meals hanging around. I found myself exponentially hungrier with one glance.
Good food, but service is horrible. The waiter will harass you if you don't leave him more than a five dollar tip. The cups and plates were dirty. I wouldn't recommend this place

When we first walked in, I was a bit hesitant in staying. It looked like your typical hole in the wall Chinese place with sticky tables and dirty floors. However, plastered all over the restaurant walls were photos of Eric Tsang! One of the funniest Kungfu actors in HK with their restaurant's chef! If that guy can eat here why can't I? Ambience aside or lack there of, the food was a different story!

I've been coming here for 30 of the 38 years it's been here and it's just as good today as it has been over the years. Where else can you get a tasty meal at 11:30pm. They don't have the friendliest of people but at least they are consistent.
For the money, this was the very best of the Chinese establishments since the 70's, and usually had decent service.

This place is great. They open really late, which means that a lot of people who work late can come and eat. Another thing is, their stuff is fresh. They truly care about their welfare of their customers. I learned a lot Yuet Lee by a local High Schooler's video. Visit " Multimedia: Yuet Lee" for more info. The owner is reeaalllyyyy nice!

AWFUL! HORRIBLE SERVICE! They have two waitress both with glasses but WATCH OUT for the younger one with round face and short hair as she is extremely rude as she is blatantly told me that I don't tip her enough which is over 20%! also the foods is overly priced!

I've heard so much about this place I had to give it a try while staying in SF for a night. My first impression walking in was that it was packing at midnight and the customers were not all Asian, surprisingly. Usually these restaurants are just filled with hungry Asian people who are either coming from the bars or just hungry asian people who stay up late.

So with both Yuet Lee and New Sun Hong Kong offering classic Chinatown late night bites, how does one decide on which business to frequent?  Service at both are as you'd expect from late night C-town restaurants, brusk and to the point.  So do you go with the restaurant with the green trim or the one w/ the yellow trim?

Came here today for a work meeting and the food was mediocre at it's best. Some dishes were way too salty while others were too bland. We ordered the roasted pork clay pot and it was very watery and salty. I've never had a clay pot like it and was completely disappointed. Probably the best thing I had was the beef chow fun. Something I want to note was that we found a hair in our soup.. Our server took it and brought us new bowls. NO BIG DEAL! but the chef was screaming at her! That poor woman... She returned with a new bowl of soup with red eyes and a red nose. It was evident that she was crying and I felt so bad. No one should ever cry at work. Best believe we left her a big tip.
I enjoyed my lunch experience here.

You don't really go to a Chinese restaurant and expect great customer service.  And this place did not disappoint.  Bad service and the  food was mediocre.  Tips were optional from my understanding.  I normally tip well above 15% if they deserve it.  I felt that they didn't deserve anything but I still tipped.  As my partner and I were leaving, the waitress stopped us and pointed at tip and said "That's not enough tip."

I can never get enough of this place. Yuet Lee has been around for over 30 years. This is one place I always have to go to when in Chinatown even during the late night. My friends and I always end up going to Yuet Lee after a fun night out. The food is so good. Love getting their salt and pepper calamari, Peking spare ribs, fish, clams, their soups, chow mein and so much more. When I go there I never have a problem with their service.

SF and west coast classic. The deliciousness of the burgers and fries here are not to be understated. The only thing I will complain about is how the location is in such a touristy area, which sucks for locals. It's always crowded, and finding seats can be a pain. That said, it is fast food so tables are clearing up all the time; you just have to be a bit vigilant about it. Otherwise, don't pass it up.

This In-N-Out is regrettably located in Fisherman's Wharf AND the sole location in the area. It will be busy and parking will suck. That said, we were able to get our food to go. I dropped off my husband and parked several blocks over until he texted. The quality of food was the usual In-N-Out standards. They filled our order exactly to our specifications and gave us extra napkins.

I was looking forward to my first in and out burger experience since we don't have those in ohio....and it was just okay.  Inexpensive for good sized portions, but nothing much different than 5 Guys. I also found the service rude in the manner that he demanded I produce a receipt to pick up my food -like I'd pick up on order that isnt mine - after having to stand among annoying loud people when the food was being cooked. I was just kind of glad to get out of there at the end

I absolutely LOVE In-n-Out burger. Every time I crave a burger, I will go to In-n-Out. However, this location is a bit too packed and too small. There is barely any seating, there are a ton of homeless bums that tend to drift in and walk around, and there are so many tourists that it's uncomfortable at times.

Don't see what the big deal is. It's just a cheap  cheeseburger. Ask them lightly toast the bread or all you will taste is burned bread. The fries suck. Staff are supposed to give out the code to the bathroom (yes, the closest bathroom has a number lock on it) but when I asked two of them they didn't offer it. They Gave  it to another person right in front of me.

Ok call me a tourist. Call me an east coast idiot. But was I impressed by the burger for the price. I just got a cheeseburger as I was saving my tummy for a real meal. Umm delicious!! for 3 bucks?! Seriously wow. I hope there were no mcdonalds around. It felt, looked and tasted like an actually very good quality burger.

In-n-out is one of the must-tries for tourists. This one is conveniently located at one of the most touristy places of NorCal. This In-n-out is no different from the rest of the chains though, meaning the hamburgers and fries taste the same and the employees are the same friendly people. It's a cheap and fast option if you're not looking to spend much on food in SF.

You'd expect this location to be overpriced like everything else there, in line with the other "upscale" chains (Coldstone for example). Nope. Maybe a few cents more than other locations, but still under $4 for a Double Double. Can't beat that value downtown, and like every In-N-Out location, you're eating In-N-Out, so it's awesome. This East Coaster is thoroughly pleased.

Great to see this fabulous burger place in San Francisco.  Menu is simple, and not fancy, staff is friendly and efficient.  And the in n out burger is perfection. Dime may not like the fries, but this is because they always use fresh potatoes and make the fries fresh not frozen,  so they taste a bit different than what most people are used to.  This is a West Coast classic

Okay--it's a chain and it's fast food but when you're from Texas and then the east coast--this chain was non existent in my life until this trip to San Fransisco. The hubby and I found it totally by accident.

Really small dining space relative to the popularity of the location. However, the food is nice and cheap. I came because I always hear the hype of this place, but I didn't think it was any more special than other fast food places that are more widely available. Make sure you find an online menu first before ordering.

This was a great cheap lunch near fisherman's wharf. $10 for my mom and I to have tasty burgers and animal style French fries! (Ask for animal style burger or fries and you get it loaded with cheese, onions and thousand island!)

The cheeseburger with onions was absolutely delicious. The animal fries, however, were underwhelming given their name. Tables were dirty and service was relatively slow for fast food. No bathrooms either. Would go back for a burger though.
Always great, cant go wrong with in-n-out. Great food quality and service. Always go with the unsalted fries for the best tasting. Location also moves lines quickly which is great.
Ran from my home, it only took thirty minutes, the animal style cheeseburger gave me the dose of proteins my brain needs for the mad gains in the gym later.
I'm not going to tell you anything you don't already know. This is on par w 5 guys.

The food was reliably good, but the Fisherman's wharf location promised an overwhelming tourist presence. The restaurant was packed, it took forever to place the order, even longer to receive the food, and it was difficult to find a seat. Annoying experience, but the food is still reliable.

It's a chain so you know what you are getting. Best deal in Fisherman's Wharf. Not saying much since the surrounding restaurants have entrees starting at $13. I ordered my double-double animal style, fries, and choc shake to go and are on the nearby pier with views of Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, and the city skyline. Magnificent. All for $8.
this is one of the best places to grab a quick meal if your in a tourist area like Fisherman's Warf, it's a Cheap & fast burger joint

I tried my first In and Out burger. I tasted the protein style  burger and the rest of my family had normal cheeseburgers. Well what can I say. This is the most over hyped piece of crap I have ever tasted. I anticipated I was to experience a great burger. The burger had no taste and was sloppy with all that vomit sauce. My family was not impressed. I preferred McDonald's to this shit excuse of a burger place. I'am really sorry about writing this but it needed to be said. Very disappointed!
This particular In n out wasn't as good as the others we tried but still good.

4 out of 5 stars. Great place to eat. We found the in and out burger unfortunately towards the end of out stay in San Francisco. It was a great and fast restaurant and not only was the food good but it was also relatively inexpensive. All the other places we ate in this area were expensive. I mean, one plate at Denny's cost about 13 or 14 dollars and there were 6 of us constantly going out to eat. So this was a nice break for out wallets and food was good too. Just not a whole lot of variety on the menu but besides that, a great spot to check out!
One of the best burger places in the city, even better than pricy places like Umami burger!
This place was recommended to me by a couple of people. That and the good reviews encouraged me to make the trip.
Everything is cooked fresh and the meat is never frozen. You can easily tell the difference between this burger than say, those from McDonald's or Burger King.

Well, fresh, fast animal style cheeseburgers!! YES PLEASE! This place, can't come to San Fran without stopping here! On a nice sunny day it's super crowded bit outside to the right there's extra tables.
I heard this is a must when you come to the states. Great burgers but fries are okay.
Awwww DEFINITELY FAV BURGER EVER!!!

As usual whenever in the West Coast, first stop out of the airport is In N Out!  Location was packed and eating area is tiny.  They do not have a drive thru in this location.  Food was great as usual but felt uncomfortable with the people that kept coming in for free sodas and just scanning the room.  It may have been that we were there close to midnight.  Will still eat here, just not this location.

It's a good place but to too many people. The place is small but location is awesome. My family came over this weekend and we ate here sort of there was no were to sit and almost no were to stand. I would never come here and spend my money because these burgers are kinda small but very delicious and I would rather go some where were you can get double the size for the same price.
Saw it on DDD, so I drove extra 45mins out of my way to stop there for lunch on a Sunday afternoon.
This resturant in Irvine is terrible. I found spider in their sandwich. I hate in and out of Irvinr.

It was awful! The food was soggy, the burger was gross, and the wait was OUT OF CONTROL. I dont mind waiting for food, but we stood there for almost 15mins for a fast food burger. I almost left, and decided to go to the counter, in front of the other 20 people that were waiting to complain. They instantly handed me my burger and fries, even though I knew there were people who ordered before me. Got outside had a bite of what I thought was going to be heaven like the last time I had it 2 years ago, and it was just plain awful. I ended up giving my whole meal, after a bite ofthe burger that I spit out and a fry, to a homeless guy outside. Don't go to this location!

It's great they have an In-N-Out in the city but be prepared for inflated prices. I still love their grilled cheese (it's not on the menu vegetarians- just ask for it) but I found the fries to be a little stale-like and still prefer the Milbrae location on the way to the airport.
Pros: accepts credit, same old great tasting food/milkshakes

Since there is no In-N-Out in my hometown, it's a must have when in California. This location is true to the brand, but extremely busy since it's on Fisherman's Warf. The staff is well prepared for the crowds and you order and get your food within about 10-15 minutes. The place was packed with people and it was difficult to find a table to sit down and eat at.  The staff was great about wiping the tables down after each group would leave a table.

My 1st In-N-Out burger, finally! We had just flown into town and checked into our hotel located right in Fisherman's Wharf. We decided to walk around the area and find some lunch. Just a block or so away we saw the sign... In-N-Out Burger! Yay! It was busy so we got in line, ordered, and took a seat.
