I called to complain so they came back to take the pizza and said they would bring fresh pizza at our scheduled delivery time. I drew a small star on the inside of each box before I returned the pizza. At 6:00 they returned with our pizzas and as I guessed, they brought the exact same pizzas that were about 2 hours old. I'll never order here again.

Passed by this place on my way back to the Hilton from Pier 39 and decided to try it out.  The young girl who took our order was nice and friendly.  My 3 year old and I shared a slice of BBQ chicken pizza and a side salad.  The salad was pretty standard and was a decent size.  The pizza was tasty and hit the spot.  I liked that we had lunch for under $7 bucks, too!
Love this place!!! I usually order the patate frittes and Lisbon pizza - best pizza I've ever had! So good! The roasted garlic melts in your mouth!
Online order took after 5 tries - 40 minutes to figure out. Get with the program.
The order details:

Absolutely terrible. I never spend time to rip on a restaurant but this place is terrible. Horrible staff, terrible ingredients, worst late night pizza experience. I've been to Many late night pizza places, and this is just terrible. Strongly, strongly do not recommend.
Oof. We wanted to love this place. My boyfriend raved about the bar it used to be. In its new incarnation, it was pretty sad.
Love this place for the decor and the bartenders, not so much for that crowd, at least on my most recent visit.
Unbelievable food. Jovial and warm environment. We had the roast chicken for two and it was easily one of the best things we've ever had. Incredible sauce, juicy and crispy--worth the wait!
Was seated as soon as we walked in the door! The dining room is small and allows for personal service.  The food was delicious.  Would definitely recommend Tosca for any special event.

I used to live in North Beach and loved the old Tosca Cafe for drinks.  When I returned to SF for a visit, I wanted to check out the spot's new life as a restaurant with a much talked about offering.  The interior has not changed much except for more lighting and a window into the kitchen as well as some wall decor.   I was hoping they'd soften the ambient noise some how but the dining room still has a dark diner feel to it.  They could improve on this.

Had an early dinner here with friends before seeing a show.  I love the atmosphere here - the booths tucked into the walls, the lighting, decor, etc.  I like looking into the open kitchen & watching dishes get plated up before being sent out.  This was probably my favorite dinner during a recent trip to San Francisco.  The caesar salad was very good - the waiter said he loved the presentation of it & felt it wasn't your typical caeser.  It had a nice hit of heat to it.  It was a bit filling & I might have considered splitting it with a friend after I ate the whole thing & was close to full.  The next dish was the lumaconi with prosciutto & lemon breadcrumbs.  Um, OMG that was delicious!  I don't usually love to order anything with cream sauce b/c it's just too heavy for me....but this was a very light cream sauce & not excessive.  I just wish I had not eaten so much of my salad b/c I just couldn't finish my pasta.  The cocktails were also outstanding - I had the whiskey smash & enjoyed it. Loved the music playing on the jukebox.  My only knocks on the place are (1) the service - I thought it was just ok.  The waiter was not really very attentive, empty plates sat in need of clearing, another cocktail was not offered.  Yet I saw a lot of waiters just kind of hanging around in the corners of the restaurant.  (2) The bathroom - I get that this place is a former dive bar that hosted celebrities & has a long history - but today I'm at a nice restaurant & while your bathroom might be considered kitschy, it's old & a bit on the gross side.
Echoing the underwhelmed sentiment.

We made a reservation 2 weeks in advance based on good reviews and hype.  Our reservation was for 5:15 PM, which we were told was the only available other than 11PM.  Despite how difficult the restaurant said it was to get in, we noticed many empty tables throughout our entire dinner.

My friends and I came here randomly on a weeknight and we loved it. Everything we ordered was delicious , especially the fried pig tails. The staff was also very friendly and great with drink suggestions. Need to go back asap

We had a large group and needed to push tables together but they were uneven. The manager insisted that we have even tables and moves their tables around to accommodate our group. We didnt mind but it was not up to us. Both our server and manger were delightful. I can't say enough good things about their service and professionalism. Raising the bar for north beach and booze coffee everywhere.

Perhaps my expectations were too high. Was really happy that they started taking reservations tho. My friends and I had wanted to come here for awhile. Checked in at the host stand for an early res (5:15) and was told they would come and get us when it was time. Sat at the bar and ordered a very delicious cocktail - so far so good. It was past our res time by about 10 minutes and no one came to get us so we went back to the host stand and were seated in a nice rounded booth. Service was nice - I don't know why others are so critical.
The mussels. Get the mussels. We refused to let the broth be taken away and ordered some focaccia to soak it all up. Oh. And the trouble in paradise...because who isn't a fan of that?

This has become one of my favorite places in SF.  I love the old school vibe and the food is awesome.  The best is the minestrone soup, quite possibly the best soup I've ever had.  I order it as my entree with some vegetable sides and the super yummy focaccia bread.  If they have meatballs as a special - those are a must have.  They actually take reservations and they're on Open Table..  It's a small restaurant though and there aren't many tables than can seat more than 4 people.  It's easiest to get a table for 2.

I'm obsessed with this place. Remains my very favorite restaurant in SF. I used to love THE SPOTTED PIG in nyc and this place brings the hustle of a nyc kitchen to an otherwise gastronomically impoverished neighborhood. The focaccia is crispy -- so good! And the salumi platter is great. Don't miss the Cacio e Pepe, really well executed. Great cocktails too!
Completely overrated - and a real shame it made Bon Apps list when there are actual amazing and worthy restaurants on the list (e.g., Estela in NYC).

Horrible service. Clueless hostess, absent waitress. However only reason in business is good food.  This year, we've been to SF several times and to NYC, Chicago, Philadelphia, New Orleans, Denver, LA, Phoenix, and Portland. Michelin-starred restaurants and hole-in-the-walls.  On this trip to SF, we ate at Tadich, La Folie, Akiko's,     Quince, and Mission Chinese.  Mission Chinese was awesome, even with service by one waiter at lunch for the entire dining room.  Tosca was the absolute worst for service.  No food is worth that experience at this kind of restaurant.

I have been visiting Tosca since the 90s! I drank tequila with our former mayor Willie Brown there. It is under new mgmt but it has not evolved. I am not an expert/foodie but I know good food. This is NOT it! Salt, salt and more salt. Let me break it down for you. If you want pasta, go to Tomassos. If you want a Pimms cup, go to Romolo. If you want to settle for mediocrity, go to the new Tosca. Just sayin

Expect a long wait.  We were told the wait would be up to 3 hours on the Saturday evening we stopped in.  Rather than wait for a table, we grabbed a seat at the bar.  I think if we go back, we'd do the same; in our opinion, the ambiance in the bar section is actually more inviting and cozy than the dining area.
Overall we did not enjoy our meal.
Delicious plates with poor service and inflated prices dragging the star level down to 3.
Excellent drinks.  Spectacular pasta.  Super cool vibe for the boy from Carolina.
Well I was underwhelmed. Hard to compete with all the press and live up to the expectations. We arrived, 4 of us, at 5:15. Drinks at the bar took a solid 10 minutes. Thankfully, they were excellent.

Well I ate here with my best friend after waiting for 3 months to finally have a night off together due to our crazy schedules. Ordered a lot because we like to go big. And heard from other chefs that this place is nice for late dinner (especially for industry people who get out late everyday like us). Anyways....like everything we got. Octopus was good. Cacio de pepe was too cheesy it was gloppy and not creamy. The tiramisu was perfect. The problem is here.....We got the chicken liver. We both love chicken liver. We are BOTH chefs here in SF.!! It came out and it was on a skewer. Took it off the skewer and noticed it was very medium rare.  Not the best idea to eat chicken liver so under done and we knew it. Not blaming tosca. We poked at it and talked about weather or not we should eat it. We ignored our better judgement and ate it cause we were so hungry. Finished our meal and went home. 5 days later I became extremely I'll from food Bourne illness aka food poisoning. To be honest I had no idea what it was from. I was in so much abdominal pain that I almost fainted twice. It lasted strong for 3 days. A couple days later after returning to work I texted my same friend and asked her when we can schedule our next meal together, that's when she said she has been bed ridden due to food poisoning. That's when my jaw dropped. I told her I had the same thing and it must have been our dinner from earlier in the week. We remembered the "if-y" liver we ate. I emailed tosca and told them what happened. Only seemed like the right thing to do. I wasn't blaming them And I wasn't mad or upset, but being in the food business I just thought it's something I should share. We would want someone to share that kind of info if it was our restaurants. It's been over a month and I haven't heard anything. No sorry. No thank you for sharing. No we will try to be on the look out for that. No nothing. So I took this time to write a yelp review to share my experience with people who actually care. Here it is. Enjoy everyone. Bed time.

The 3 star average is insane. I new nothing about Tosca Cafe until my buddy started talking about some bar he used to post at regularly that was a San Francisco institution reopening w/ a restaurant serving April Bloomfield's grub. Posted up at the bar for dinner. Here's the rundown:

First time since the re-do.  Looks great and I don't know that I've had Italian food this  good in years.  Had the meatballs (extraordinary, not your typical lump of tasteless meat, but complicated flavors and great sauce); bucatini (perfectly cooked pasta with a rich (not too rich) sauce with little bits of pork and crunch...superb); and a side of broccoli di cicco (if you're going to eat a vegetable, this is the way to eat it...again, perfectly cooked and seasoned, actually sort of complex).  Finished with buttermilk gelato, which was perfect.  The cocktails (negroni) were nice, too.  A tad pricey; but the serving sizes are just right.  We sat in the backroom (who knew?) and it was quieter, if a tad stuffy (air-wise).  Only complaint was that, while the staff are on the whole friendly and helpful, our waitress was a tad chilly...but we'll be back.

This place considers itself rustic italian.  Not sure what that means except it was interesting to try the pigs tail.  Also had a polenta dish.  Not sure why I got it since I am not a polenta fan.  Wanted to give it a try but did not like it.  Turnips however were great.

Came here for dinner on a Thursday night with the boyfriend. We shared the Crispy Pig Tails ($9), Rigatoni ($16), Linguini ($17), Hanger Steak ($25), and Crispy Potatoes ($7). We also had a Polo Cup and a Whiskey Smash based on the waitress's recommendation, which were both delicious and strong!
I want to like it. I mean Beyonce ate here. But alas, I felt like it was disappointing.

Took the family for dinner last night.  Good service, booth was a little small but was fine for us.  The food was excellent.  Adults loved the pig tails, kids not so much (too fatty).  Oxtail terrine was a hit and we LOVED the meatballs and foccacia.  Pastas were great and we really enjoyed the tiramisu and strawberry balsamic gelati.  Would definitely go back with friends, co-workers and or family.  Nice eclectic mix of patrons.

I am torn about this review as I wanted to like Tosca more than I did. Starting from the beginning, we were seated promptly. The space itself feels warm like it has history, but not old. However the banquette where we were seated was too small for four. The restaurant also was very warm and we all stuck to the vinyl.

Uneven experience. Other comments on the high salt levels were on point - on a few dishes the salt was overwhelming.   Service started strong but timing began to slip as the meal went on. I'd consider going back for snacks and drinks, but they aren't delivering a full meal that is legitimate at the price point.

After hearing that Tosca made Bon Appétit's top 50, we immediately booked a reservation. Having been to the excellent Spotted Pig and John Dory in NYC, we expected greatness. Too bad Tosca fell so short of our expectations. The restaurant's decor is charming and comfortable. They did a great job of maintaining it's original vintage feel without resorting to clichéd reclaimed wood and filament bulbs. The service was slow and amateurish. The waiter presented the wine to my husband to taste even though I had been the one to order it. There were a couple of interesting tuna appetizers on the menu. The egg tonnato was very good, the egg making a natural pairing with tonnato sauce. It was a great alternative to the traditional veal recipe.  The tuna conserva with radishes on the other hand lacked brightness that should have counterbalanced the heavy oiliness of the tuna and the creaminess of the crème fraîche. The crispy pig tails, while cooked perfectly and full of flavor, were over-salted as were the crispy potatoes many of which were fried to death. The turnips were so very average. There weren't many enticing secondi choices. We settled on the hangar steak because we wanted a meat dish and didn't want to wait one hour for the chicken. Had we known the service would be so slow we might have ordered it. The hangar steak was tasty if uninventive. Not all the dishes were uninspired. The bucatini with guanciale and chile was undeniably the star dish of the evening. We should have foregone all the other dishes and just ordered 6 of those instead.

after having changed hands Tosca Cafe cannot be held to their old standards. sure the dishes are more expensive but their quality has increased as well. April Bloomfield's people have done a great job keeping the menu simple and executing them well. i've read plenty of reviews that complain about the salt content but during my dining experience there the only thing that was overly salted was the fat fried potatoes. everything else from the succulent, juicy, full of flavor meatballs to the perfectly al dente bucatini and vegetables were well seasoned. i thoroughly enjoyed dinner at Tosca. the server was great and well informed about their wines and the hostess made sure to coordinate with the server when i handed them my credit card earlier in the evening so that i could force payment before my boyfriend's parents got to the bill. fantastic! no wonder Bon Appetit named it one of US's top 10 restaurants of 2014!
On the rare occasion when the culinary stars aline, walk-ins to the hottest restaurants in town are possible.
It was good not great.

I've been going to Tosca for over 2 decades.  I've had a birthday party here, I even had a photo shoot here.  So, I, like a million or so others, eagerly awaited the reopening; & very much appreciated the interior upgrade that did not sacrifice Tosca's integrity.  It's been almost a year since the addition of dinner service, so time to review...
This is a three-star place.  I really wanted it be better, but it's not.

I really wanted to like this place. After watching season 2 of Mind of a Chef on Netflix, we were so excited to try Tosca since it was featured on the show. I knew immediately we would order the meatballs made with guanciale, and the fried pig tails. We also had the turnips, the fried potatoes, the minestrone, the oxtail terrine, and the bucatini pasta. In the end, I could summarize my entire meal here in three words... TOO MUCH SALT. There was a consensus at our table and maybe even the one next to us. The flavors were there, and it breaks my heart because there was so much potential. Unfortunately, the salt rendered the food nearly inedible. Our table went through at least 5 or 6 pitchers of water to wash everything down. We most likely would not return. I gave 2 stars because the ambiance was decent, and the food was prepared well were it not for the salt. I also enjoyed the Tiramisu, if only because it was the one item that gave us reprieve from the salinity of the other dishes.

Atrocious service.  We showed up at 7:30 and were told we would be texted as soon as a table opened up.  We went to a bar down the street and received a text a half hour later.  After immediately responding and heading back to Tosca, we were told that there had "been a mixup" and that a table would not be ready for another hour.  We then waited an hour and a half during which time one member of our party was spilled on with a burning beverage by a drunk person at the bar. . . that the staff recognized and promptly ignored.  When we were finally seated, no recognition whatsoever was given to the fact that we waited as long as we did for a table.  To put a cherry on top of the lovely evening: the majority of our party ordered the steak, and rather than being asked how we would like it served, it was automatically served vastly undercooked. We couldn't believe the service would be so bad. As recent ex-New Yorkers, we can say that a patron at the Spotted Pig would never be treated so poorly.
How is it that they only have 3 stars?!

Food was mediocre, just like the service. Had the clam chowder and the crab cake sandwich. Not much meat in the soup and the crab cake was mostly breading. The garlic fries were pretty good. Our waiter was not very attentive and we needed to ask to get our water glasses refilled. Was a bit pricy for the quality.
Very nice restaurant.  The service was okay, but the waiter was very nice.  The food was great.
Very good food friendly staff loved there clam chowder soup they have a great selection for kids as well
The gist: Got a fish burger with a pretty obviously stale bun, and what other people got looked okay.

I wanted something that they only offered on the kids menu, I asked if I could get it and they refused. He said "nope 12 and under that's the rule". The margarita sucked too.  This was my first and last time here.  Too many other restaraunts nearby that have friendlier service.

Stopped here on a busy unusually hot Saturday afternoon.  Ordered the Dungeness crab sandwich.  Very good.  Wife had the Dungeness salad which was really good too.  Service was friendly and prompt.  It was too hot to sit out on the patio area.
sorry but not my favourite food. the crab sandwich was not good and falling into pieces, the soup wasnt and the salad was OK standard. I liked the location which we enjoyed a lot.
Fish and chips were AMAZING. Service was sub-par, but the host was hilarious.  Drink prices were average,  nothing special.

First of all the live music made up the fun atmosphere! My friend and I split the calamari and Garlic Parmesan fries which were delicious. I also ordered the prohibition punch which was delicious, I got the 60 oz cup, but later I though about how sometimes more ice is placed in cup than the actual drink (the drink is $22). So that's something to think about. But overall, the food is on point!

The service wasn't that great here. Our server wasn't very helpful. He came over 3 times without asking us what we wanted to drink. The prices are okay..not cheap..but not super expensive either. The food was really good though. I'd probably eat there again if I was in the area.
Crab served cold. No water refills. Fries were common and cold. Nice location. The question was never asked if we liked it or were OK.

We were walking down the peer doing what tourist do and the guy outside showed us a giant margarita so we thought ok we will give it a shot. We walked in and ordered the blue giant margarita. The girl tending the bar would barley acknowledge us and shot looks at us like we had just kicked her dog. It was Tuesday at like 11 and it wasn't very busy.
Good food, a little slow on the service but it was pretty busy... all in all pretty good place, a little pricey for the quality.

Do not go here. The food was decent, the service was terrible, and the food was undercooked. My gf and i came here to eat and she ended up getting food poisoning from their shrimp fettucini. The chicken was underdone and cold for my capellini and lacking in any seasoning for the pasta. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE FOR ANYONE. you can find much better seafood anywhere but here.
Clam chowder was delish! Service was great too. There's was a live blues band that was great for the ambience.
For a tourist trap... we found to be great!!
Randomly stopped in for lunch. Ordered fish tacos and a salmon blt and both were the best we've tasted. We will definitely bring friends and family here. Service was also great!

Went here with my husband and father in law and we each go something different. Upon tasting each others meals it was decided that the Crab bread bowl was the best. Great atmosphere, love the live band.
Chicken sandwich was a little dry. But management came over gave me a shot and fixed the order for me on own. Excellent service.

Absolutely they best soup bowl, bar none, period.  Crab bisque though over the clam chowder, which is fine, but the crab bisque is truly wonderful.  The bisque has large pieces of crab in it for the soup in a bread bowl it is only $11 and very well worth it.  I keep coming again and again for the soup.  One small side note is that the restrooms upstairs are a bit strange and it seems as though the men's restroom is in the women's, but just go in and you will see that it is not the case.  Overall very good.
No split checks in large groups. Food was good and a large range of options. Cocktail was very good. But a bit pricey at $10.
The service was amazing! The waitress was extremely accommodating and sweet, making sure we had everything we needed and wanted. I would give the service five stars.
Excellent food. We ate there twice over the weekend and food is delicious and the staff is wonderful. Thanks for making our trip to SF enjoyable

Fish and chips awesome.....but that dry ass steak that came out and I sent back came out a second time dry as fuck.....smh.....then after the server brought it to the table and checked on us he THEN said medium well is more like medium here.....I laughed in his face....if that was the case why you telling me now.....oh yeah....the chocolate molten lava cake was missing the hot chocolate lava in the middle....smh.....oh well.....140 dollars without tip....down the shit hole.....smh....

Food came quickly, ordered crab sammie that was soggy and fell through the bread, not my favorite thing but at least the flavors were there. Bread chowder was good and thr childs linguine was tasty. All in all in was ok. I shouldve kept walking, many, many choices ahead of this one.

I will never come back here. A few months ago, I went to the wharf looking for a place to eat. We passed by this place, looked at the menu & decided it was promising. We were starving so we decided on an appetizer...we ordered the shrimp cocktail. It came to our table & it was TINY. it was $10+ for 6 little shrimp! Excuse me? For that much, I at least expect some jumbo shrimp or something. Then we ordered our entrees (which were also small because I NEVER finish my meals, but I did this time). Then we got the bill & the total with tax & tip ended up being $100+!!!! For some mediocre food?! This isn't a high end restaurant so that was ridiculous. + after, we left STILL HUNGRY. Which never happens. Such a waste of time & money!!! Don't waste either one here. Keep walking & find a better place to eat.
Expensive for OK bar food essentially. Tacos looked good, but they were meh. Left still hungry and off to milkshakes! Hehe

Popped into Lou's for some seafood by the wharf! Kelsey greeted us with a huge smile and sat our party of 6 right away! Our food was delicious!! I had the crab cake sandwich and absolutely loved it. Whatever aioli they serve on the side is heaven. Everyone else at the table seemed very happy with their food too,  Glad we found this place!!
We just arrived in SF and decided to eat here. Clam chowder and bisque were very good. We had Mahi mahi which was good, while kids had the steamed crab. Server was excellent. But very expensive.
Perfect if you aren't looking for anything special.
We happened upon this place quite by accident.  So glad we did!  Food was excellent, service outstanding!  Please check this place out, you won't be sorry!  Food came right away and tasted wonderful!
Great atmosphere,  excellent customer service,  good drinks, and a hot bartender (Steve).Overall a great experience.

Bland food coupled with the poorest service I have ever experienced. Almost had to get up and pour myself a water refill, even after asking for one. The music was incredibly loud, but enjoyable. I would avoid in the future.

The food was good. My son loved the fried prawns, my kept saying her shrimp fettuccini was delicious and my husband & I enjoyed our monster sized cheese burgers. My only complaint is the 4% wharf surcharge.   I am sorry I didn't get the clam chowder. Next time!
Megan was a cool server. Service was speedy I only had soup. Casual ambiance. I was in and out.  Prime location if you're walking the pier.

Pretty good place to grab a bite to eat and chill on the wharf. The food was okay but the service was excellent. Very nice atmosphere and they have live music some nights.  I also met Jay Crawford from ESPN there too. Overall Lou's is a pretty decent place to eat and drinks.

hubs and I were touring our Air Force friends and needed to find a place for dinner.  It's a nice Saturday dinner time so almost all the places were packed and had a waiting time of 1 hr for large group like ours.
loved the fish n chips and the fried shrimps with coleslaw n fries. delicious and the quantity is good too!

The clam chowder was excellent!!!  Service was great from Addison!  Food was good.  My family loved their salmon.  My husband enjoyed his blackened snapper.  I ordered the Mahi Mahi; however the pineapple salsa was a bit too spicy with jalapeño.
The seafood is so fresh!  It was Saturday night and they have a nice jazz band playing.  Location is great:  Fisherman's Wharf near the end of the historic F line.

i tried the carnitas burrito and it was ok, some of the carnitas was kinda hard.. I like it when they wrap the burrito so you get everything in each bite, sometimes people wrap it weird and you get just meat in one bite and then all sour cream in the other bite.
Great Al Pastor Burrito.
Great service ....tacos yummy, great location.  We finally found a Mexican place that tastes authentic.

My belly is full and happy. They were super friendly and let me customize my order without complaints or hassle. For a picky eater like me, it was perfect. Plus, they have lots of bottled drink options. I finished my burrito off with a cold Coke.

We stayed right next door and walked by a few times before trying this place out. IM GLAD WE DID!!! If you like authentic style food with not a lot of bells and whistles this is it. Simple and good! The burrito rocked!!!

The tacos were great!  Really loved them, tasty, a bit spicy and big!  Two were enough for lunch.  The bag purchased type chips were a disappointment, but were overlooked by the tacos!  This is not fancy, loud, older finishes, but who cares?  Great for a quick bit, not a fancy date place.  I'd come back for the tacos though!

A lot of people don't like this place, but i found it to be addicting. I like a lot of burrito places throughout the Bay Area, but the texture of a burrito from here kinda stands out from the other places. Usually I order some of that grilled chicken with the works. It is flavorful and it is not a skimpy size burrito. But what I like about their burritos is the solidness. Hard to explain, but usually a burrito is more on the liquidy side when you bite into it, but their burritos are evened out. They also got some pretty good spicy salsa as well as the chips, but the chips are probably the only thing that is not consistent because one day they are too salty (in which case I won't eat them then) and on another day they are fine. Great place, great service, pretty cashier ;) , and is probably the better spots in that particular area. Still have to try Taqueria Zorro next!

Great authentic mexican food. Place looks old and dated. But the staff and food is really excellent! The waitress came 3 times to check up on us.( more than most "high end" places do) . The only reason this place isn't getting 4 starts is the salsa. It doesn't blend well with the food and taste old and bland. Not spicy at all.  Still the quality of food and the service was top notch!  I had the chile relleno and the luenga burrito.... Both fire!
Summary:  Very mediocre Mexican food, seating area is not very clean and the place had a funky smell.  Other better choices exist not too far away (Polk St).

Don't let the whole in the wall look keep you away. This order-and-seat yourself restaurant offers some pretty tasty food. Loved the rice, carne asada burrito and taco. Beans could have been better but glad we stopped and I'll be back.

This is a good lunch spot that is close to where I work. There is not a lot of other Mexican options around here so this place is definitely a gem. Similar to what others have already mentioned, this is a pretty basic, no frills restaurants. Unlike other take-out places though, there are actual clean tables where you can eat down with coworkers to eat. The same people who complain about how "dirty" this place is are happy to plop down and eat at burrito places in the Mission, which are way worse hygienically in my experience. Not that I really care about any of that.

Huge supporter of this place. I live 2 blocks away and I can't even begin to explain how nice it is having such a solid Mexican food restaurant to close by. I've probably been 2 dozen or so times and never had a bad experience. If you're ever fiending for a Mission-style burrito in North Beach, this is definitely the move.

I witness a very poorly handled situation at this restaurant last night that speaks to the lack of management and disregard to the safety of the community. Unfortunately this city does have an issue with the mentally ill and drug addicted, something I recognize this establishment has no control over. One such man entered Taquerilla SJ last night and began harassing a family including many small children. The management did nothing to remove the man who was obviously not a patron. After they left because the man was making them uncomfortable, he grabbed a steak knife off of their table and threatened the remaining 8 people in the restaurant before leaving on his own. Rather then alerting authorities to the mentally unstable man roaming the neighborhood they decided to clear the table so he wouldn't come back looking to pick at the remains of their dinner. Initially I thought I wouldn't evaluate a place based on an unfortunate situation that was in many ways out of their control HOWEVER, as a North Beach resident I was extremely disappointed in the disregard to the safety of the community by literally doing nothing after the incident. I called after I had safely returned home and alerted authorities. Needless to say I had lost my appetite at that point
In an area with a lot if choices for burritos.  This place is the best for a steak super burrito
Bad place to eat Mexican Food.

Walked in to find tables full of dirty plates that had not been cleaned up and the workers were both putting their bare hands (hello?!? gloves, please!) in raw meat on what looked like a very dirty counter.
If your looking for a mission style burrito but you happen to be in north beach, look no further... This place is legit and their chicken is seasoned to perfection.
Got the carne asada super burrito.  Was drawn in by the fake yelp menu prices, but make no mistake -- this burrito is $8.64 out the door.  That's not bad in this town, but it's not great either.

I was staying at a hotel nearby (San Remo)  and avoided this place as it looked pretty divey - in a bad way.  Eventually I gave in, glad I did!  Very pleasantly surprised.  I would give this place 4 stars based on food, however, the dining area is in need of a good cleaning, so I don't want to mislead anyone.  Ambiance isn't that important to me, the appearance of cleanliness - makes me feel better.
Fastest burrito in the city, and one of the best. I recommend the grilled chicken burrito.

Tried this place on a hunch that paid off big time. It is now one of my all time favorite spots for a carne asada burrito. These guys deliver the classic "Mexican-American" taco-truck style food. It's all a bit juicy and packed with flavor.
The food and the place are not that good.
I ate here for the first time today and was pleasantly surprised.  Really tasty carne asada burrito.  Besides Don Pistos, this is my favorite mexican spot north of Market St.
very good salsas, loved my chicken burrito, super friendly service.  for the price, this was a great value.

I definitely think that this place is really underrated on yelp. Stopped in for a super carne asada burrito last night and basically inhaled it in a matter of seconds. I have been walking by this place every night on my way to/ from the gym and really wish that I had stopped in sooner.

I don't think anyone comes here with grand expectations or leaves here feeling that they just found the second coming of sliced bread. Its going to be better than fast food Mexican (yes, that includes Taco Bell - I'll never understand the love that place gets), and it's going to fall short of most sit down establishments. For 6 to 8 bucks, you'll get a solid burrito, chips and your pick of salsa. When you're craving Mexican, is there anything more you can ask for? I would say so. Is it as good as Chipotle? Probably not. But don't let that deter you from giving this place a go
We yelped a nearby Mexican restaurant because we had one of those sudden needs for Mexican. Taqueria San Jose was close and highly rated on yelp.
Had a super burrito last night and I felt like I was back living in San Diego. For under $10 its well worth it for SF's lacking Mexican Food Market.

I've been coming here for over 10 years! Their meats and vegetables are super fresh and flavorful. The fresh salsa they have is delicious and I always ask them for extra chips while waiting for my burrito.
Best damn burritos + freshest salsa in town.  If they ever close this place I am going to have withdrawals.

Perfectly OK Mexican food. This place does the trick when I'm craving Mexican food at work. The burritos here won't make you cry tears of joy like some from Mission District do, but hey, we're in North Beach, and I only get 30 minutes for my lunch break. This place is just fine.

For some reason I was craving a breakfast burrito and being North beach they aren't too many Mexican choices around.  The burrito was fresh and made to order but I thought it was on the dryer salt and not seasoned.    Not terrible but I'm spoiled by the Mission taquerias.  Their chips were not good  because they were too thick which some people might interpret as stale but their pico de gallo was fresh and spicy

My boyfriend and I checked this place out last weekend after I accidentally stumbled upon it as I was walking around the area one day.  We sorely need more taqueria options in this neighborhood, so I was excited to check it out.  For me, it was fine. I ordered a crunchy taco w/ carnitas and a side of refried beans.  The taco shell was a basic Old El Paso, which was disappointing, but the carnitas filling was awesome.  And the refried beans were excellent.  I get what people are saying about the guac - it's not what you'd naturally expect, something has been added that thins it down.  For what it is, it's not bad, but it's not super avocado-y.  Guac aside, I would go back because the place fills the requisite requirements for a mexican food fix (as Paul P. mentions) and I'm getting kinda tired of Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Oh, and they have Diet Dr. Pepper, which is always a plus.

For North Beach, the Mexican food options are fairly limited. Taqueria San Jose #3 meets the need for a quick and fairly tasty Mexican fix. I never see too many folks in there, but the prices are reasonable and the super burritos are consistently decent. I do wish North Beach had more competition in the way of Mexican fare, but if you're craving some cheap eats with some fine salsa, this isn't a bad choice.

I went to dinner at this place once and three hours later I had bad food poisoning. I didn't know if they cooked the food right or if their refrigerator was broken. Oh well North Beach isn't the best place to get a burrito anyways
Cons
Tasty burrito OUTSIDE of the Mission.

I love hole in the wall taquerias and this place did not disappoint for a quick weekday lunch. I ordered the chicken burrito and it was an absolutely giant mound of meat, cheese, beans, rice and salsa. Chicken was well seasoned and didn't leave me with that awful chewy dry taste of some chicken at Mexican joints. They have a nice choice of salsas, and while I wouldn't consider the "Hot" very spicy, it still had a nice flavor. Great deal for $6.50 and a nice leftover breakfast the next morning.

This is my favorite place for burrito!!  They have lots of different choices of meat, something special like tripe, and buche (??), the owner said it's pork neck or something like that.  Everything is tasty, nice friendly people.  Definitely deserves much better rating and more businesses.
This place is a wonderful family owned taqueria a few blocks away from Pier 39. If you want to get away from the expensive touristy restaurants in the area, this is the place to go.

Friendly staff and incredibly fresh/tasty food. Perfect for all dietary needs. Lunch time is busy and you could wait 20min for your salad but it's well worth it. My office is obsessed with this place- oh and the donuts and coffee are amazing too.
I use to frequent the Starbucks next door pretty much every day for a year. I started going to Parlor 1255 because I prefer almond milk and they have better quality coffee.
Online ordering service is such a great addition and thank you for the gluten free options!!!
Great frozen yogurts and cappuccinos, but slow service :(
Don't mess with me when I'm HANGRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Parlor, as far as appearances, has a lot of potential. And with the crowds it draws, Parlor seemed to be a solid choice to fill a sandwich craving. I haven't tried anything but their recommended Saigon Chicken Sandwich. But based on that, I will not be coming back for any sandwiches. The Saigon Chicken was essentially a chicken banh mi for $9. Cold and dry chicken on pickled carrots and daikon.
No ice cream as yelp got it wrong. And the frozen yogurt is just as a good.

We stopped in for a quick breakfast. I had a fruit & yogurt parfait, and my companion had a breakfast sandwich. The parfait was really good, especially the fresh fruit. The breakfast sandwich was very runny and messy. I was very disappointed that Diet Coke is not served here (Coke & Bubble Up are).
their Marina Green is the best smoothie! and only 6!
Until the breakfast sandwiches come with a side of Immodium AD, avoid!  Stick to the FroYo.

This is an excellent take-out spot for sandwiches or salads. Everyone in the office is a fan and truly impressed by the quality of the ingredients, and the combos offered. The breakfast is also great and they serve Sightglass Coffee. In addition they carry the best pastries and Dynamo Donuts. I recommend the veggie breakfast sando. Also the frozen yogurt is top notch. It's a small place, so don't expect anywhere to sit. Purely takeout.

Updating my review as this place has improved a lot since it opened a year ago!  Obsessed with their kale salad and I get it almost every day.  They also seem to have hit their stride from a prep and service perspective.  I'd recommend if you're in the area!
The SBUX was closed for renovation (frown...i  like this SBUX).

The Levi's Plaza area is not really home to a ton of different food options, so if you eat out, you're going to be going to the same places, eating the same food. My feelings on the matter can be summed up here:
Fall colors.

This is a cute little shop selling sandwiches and salads. They are pretty inventive with their flavors and have some great options. They also have self serve frozen yogurt - which is great. Be prepared to wait a long time - theirs almost always a line and it normally takes about 15 minutes to get your food. I haven't really loved anything I've ordered there (can't stand how they prepare their bacon/chicken) but overall it's alright. Not a ton of options in the area, I just wish they let you make more substitutions on their menu.

Cute place with soups, salads, some sandwiches, coffee, smoothies, frozen yogurt, and local treats like Dynamo Donuts. Parlor is a cute little stop over in the Levi's Plaza area where good lunch options are somewhat limited. Therefore, Parlor is ALWAYS busy and I feel somehow (surprisingly) the creators didn't anticipate how busy they'd be and the space is typically extremely crowded, tightly packed with many people waiting for their orders.
Do NOT get a coffee, latte, etc here.  Takes forever, they served it cold.  Il Fornio is better if you don't want to wait at Starbucks.

I had the pork belly sandwich with cucumber kimchee and chicharrons.  Everything was excellent except the pork was overcooked.  Sandwich was a great concept.  Maybe it was an anomaly.  The service is good and you can order over the phone to avoid the line.  Probably come back again to try something else.
Delicious!  Everything I've had so far has been excellent.  Today I tried the stone fruit and crispy copa salad - amazing!  They are quick, even when busy.
A very cool little spot, and a very little spot.
Turkey Tapenade All Day Every Day!!! If you go when its sunny be prepared to throw bows to the Froyos to get this delicious sandwich.

Ever the dedicated employee, I hardly ever leave my office during afternoons. Though on this particular day, I needed a pick-me-up but not from those annoying pedicabbies so I strolled over to Levi's Plaza for a tasty treat.

I loved it there! I ate the saigon chicken - it was really good! I love the aoli sauce. They also have the best frozen yogurt with interesting flavors. Caramel pretzel is my favorite. Despite how little space they have to work with, they help a large volume of customers. Many other places that are equally as busy or even less busy have a much larger space.  They do an amazing job!

I had read about Parlor 1255 a while ago but it was kind of out of the way for a lunch spot until I started working right across the street.  I had the 1255 Italian the other day and it was amazing. It's such a small spot that you wouldn't imagine something this good coming out of it but it was really good.  I think this will become my local spot now.

YUM! I don't know if it's considered ice cream or frozen yogurt but it is so creamy and delicious, I can't stop thinking about it. After going there once, I had to go back again. I had banana, chocolate, salted caramel pretzel (I think), and peanut butter. So rich and tasty. I haven't tried the lunch options but the menu looks interesting. I'll be back!

My favorite lunch spot- love everything about it! Fresh and delicious food, environmentally conscious, great decor, self serve froyo, the list goes on! Food changes seasonally- i can't wait to see what's next! Parlor 1255- thank you.

So glad this place opened in my neighborhood. I'm a regular here at this friendly place, locally-owned, for fro-yo but there's a nice selection of sandwiches and salads. I'll come back and try them and update this review!
Parlor your salads suck!

Parlor 1255 has the most amazing sandwiches.  This place may be one of my favorite grab-and-go lunch spots in the city.  The turkey tapanade is the way to go.  It is absolutely divine-- who knew a turkey sandwich could be revolutionized by such amazing spreads and toppings?  If instead you're in the mood for salad, I recommend the brussel sprout salad.  ...And if you happen to be passing by in the morning, get their fruit parfait-- freshly cut strawberries, melons, blueberries, greek yogurt and fresh granola.  Everything. is. so. good.

so so happy to have a new place in this area! when this place first opened, you basically spent your entire lunch break waiting for your order, but they compensated by having the tasting cups for the froyo handily available (now you have to ask for them).

I work in the plaza so I frequent this place a lot. The marina green smoothie is good for lunch time as is the beet salad. Those are my favs. The kick starter smoothie is good too! It can get really busy around noon so be patient.

Love their smoothies. Fun place for a quick bite. Their staff is sweet and doesn't mind if you make substitutions. I love their all whole-fruit and veggie smoothie the marina green.  It's sweet, tangy, tart and creamy all at once.

I had fro-yo on the brain since the minute I woke up this morning.  After inviting a few coworkers to track some down after lunchtime with me, one chimed in, "OH! I know just the place!" Enter, Parlor 1255. There aren't a crazy amount of flavors or toppings, but I LIKE that. Simple and well done. The Strauss Vanilla is incredibly rich and flavorful while the tart is crisp and not too sweet. I always judge my frozen yogurt joints by the quality of their tart flavor, so Parlor 1255 gets 5 stars from me!
As everyone else has mentioned, I was super excited to have Parlor 1255 open up as another much needed lunch option. There are really great things about Parlor and then some not so good things:

Finally!!  Somewhere delicious near work.  i will be stopping here often and ordering breakfast and lunches.  All sourced locally, seasonal, and plentiful, this place has it all.  I may even stop in for some froyo - the toppings looked amaze-balls as well.

I ordered the Italian sandwich here and it was great. It was toasty, the shallots were perfectly caramelized. There was a lot of mayo, which I was fine with but can see how many people would think it was too much. The tiny pickles they give with the sandwich were a cute little bonus. I will return, but only when I have ample time for lunch as it took about 20 minutes after I ordered to get my sandwich.

Food here is good, with large sandwiches. I stop by more often for the frozen yogurt., as it takes way too long for food. During lunch the line is out the door, and it just doesn't seem like they have their logistics down packed yet.

Parlor 1255! The food at this place really stands out from the crowd of other lunch/breakfast spots in the Financial District/Levi Plaza. They have a delicious selection of sandwiches of both the classics AND new creations that should be classics.
35 minutes from the time I placed my order for a veggie sandwich? That's my entire lunch break. Never again will I waste it here... especially for two over-sized slices of bread and a few carrots.
Very tasty - try the super burrito with carnitas.  So excellent. My usually-picky sister loved it too. =)

The chicken super burrito is delicious, and everyone that works here is super nice. I go here often, as I go to school in the area. Occasionally my burrito falls apart while I am eating it, which is a bummer, but it really doesn't happen often, and when it does it is not a huge deal. The salsa bar is also super yummy!

The asada quesadilla was horrible as well as the tacos this is the first and last time I go there when I'm in San Francisco. Over priced for crappy food no thanks too bad I can't give a negative start if I could I would
Very good and decently priced food! The veggie burrito and all the salsas were excellent! Good service.
It's gone downhill a bit in the last few months, but it's NOT closed, FYI.

THIS PLACE IS NOT CLOSED! My co-workers came here on Cinco de Mayo last Monday...although we almost didn't because Yelp is reporting this place as closed. One of my co-workers swore he saw it still open, so we called and verified that this place is definitely still OPEN.

AMAZING !! Great service and great prices !! Great short walk to the piers and the staff is quick and very attentive. I had the super burrito and was expecting a monster sized burrito with no flavor, I was wrong. Nice sized burrito ( no monster ) and great tasting !! A must have !!
Admittedly this review is based on only one visit, so keep that in mind while reading.

Good Mexican food with tooooo much cheese. Nicely located close to pier 39 and prices are cheap and quantities huge. Big salsa bar and lots of free chips to get you started. Just be sure to tell em to go easy on the cheese... Seriously!
Had a great pork taco here. Place is a dive but the food was very good. Service was fair, but most importantly the food was very good.

Usually, I don't associate the food scene in San Francisco with such mediocrity, but I guess there's always exceptions.  I've only been to this place once and I ordinarily review restaurants that I've been to at least a few times to give it a good grading, but I'll just give you the gist of how I felt about this one visit.

Their cook cannot multitask. He/she cooks one plate until it's completed, and then begins working on the next. This is something of a problem, especially if you're a party of 4 or more. On our visit, 2 plates were dropped at our 6-top, then almost 10 minutes later 2 more plates arrived, at which point the food runner asked what else we had ordered. About 10 minutes later the 5th plate came (undercooked); and 5 minutes after that (after some of us were finished) the last plate came--2 pancakes. No explanation. No apology. Decent food but horrible horrible customer service.

What can I say....its a taqueria. I work on fisherman's wharf and its always hard to find good reasonably priced food. Apparently its owned by the same guy who owns El Farolitos in the Mission, which is my favorite taqueria. The food is just normal taqueria food, nothing fancy but it gets the job done. The salsa bar is well stocked and they have a good assortment of agua frescas. If your looking for a quick, cheap meal that isn't an over priced chowder bread bowl this should be on your list.
The food and location are ok. This might be the only location nearby with ok Mexican food.
good breakfast burritos. contains pretty much everything i would ask for in a breakfast burrito. i think it had chorizo, egg, sour cream, guac, rice, black beans, pico de gallo, etc.
The Wet Burrito was one of the best i have had
I tried out Mamita's based on some decent Yelp scores. All two stars for this review are for the prices. Low prices, large amounts of food, quite happy with that.

Everything on the pier closes around 9pm or so me and my friends decided to check this place out since it opens real late. I ordered the chicken super burrito and it was pretty tasty, to my surprise! I've had really good burritos in San Jose and LA area so I wasn't expecting much from this place but they proved me wrong. The chicken was nice and tender and the guac was very creamy.

I dug the fresh Carrot-Orange juice, but my bro was not impressed by the "not crispy" bacon in his breakfast burrito. The burrito was massive, but with so many great food spots so close by, this place would get relegated to breakfast duties if I were a local.
i got alambres and shrimp tacos for total cost $17. i'm not a fan for the taste, just ok food. huge portion. friendly staff.

Really surprised this has 4 stars as an average.  The place is dirty and it's kind of like fast-food.  We ordered a burrito and 2 tacos.  The rice was not well-cooked and the meat quality was questionable.  It is served with free chips and salsa, which tasted like from a bag.  We will never go there again.  It ruined our night.

Stopped here for breakfast and ordered eggs with chorizo, or in this case, chorizo with eggs!  A very large portion of chroizo with scrambled eggs and spot on refried beans with slices of avocado and rice.  Although it was late for breakfast, the oders were coming in for pickup.  The owners and the staff are all from Mexico, including the counter man who schleps here from Oakland on BART then the trolley to Fishermans Wharf...Very Good!
Huge portions... Cooked fresh and priced affordable for the area!
I ordered a Super Steak Burrito (which came with some pretty good chips) & an Agua de Horchata. Total cost $10.40.

They screwed up two orders. I said no beans. Guy at register did write it down so chef must have screwed up. They put no beans in my friend's order. She was annoyed her burrito was all lettuce. I had beans in my burrito. Flies all over the place. Have to shoo them away from the table/food/drinks. Food was meh.

I was excited to try this place out, being from So Cal and seeing the reviews I thought this place would be good but unfortunately I was really disappointed. My wife and I ordered some tacos and a plate of chicken and rice for my daughter. However, while placing the order the guy over the counter somehow only took my request for tacos and we ended up only getting half of the order when they were ready. I had pay again for the rest of the order. The plate of chicken and rice for my daughter, they charged $7 for the same amount of chicken that goes in a taco! It was also the most bland chicken I've ever eaten. I had to try it because my daughter was gagging at the first bite! The Carne asada tacos fared slightly better but not by much. The tortillas were drowning in oil. The meat was ok but not the best. I would stick the seafood in the area. This is not the best place for Mexican food.

I attribute a lot of my culinary manners to my amazing parents.  They taught me, in their own way, to really appreciate the authentic in a cuisine, even if you're not a regular of it.  So it is with me and Mexican food.  I'm by no means a regular of the cuisine, but when I order it, expect to hear me ask for menudo, hoof in (for good luck), tacos de lengua or cabeza, chile relleno, and of course, horchata to rinse it all down.
Simple, good Mexican food.  Made from scratch and big portions.

Ordered a combo platter that consisted of taco chile verde and enchilada and only my taco had meat.  The rest was soo greasy from all the cheese. I was disgusted after. I wouldn't come back unless I was craving mexican food.
For a place that is not known for good Mexican Food. (i.e. San Francisco) this is the place to go. Yes it is located in Fisherman's Wharf, but for the amount of food you get the price is great.

Good selection and price. Wish I could eat and try more. Had the pork quesadillas. Diced marinated pork with a bunch of melted cheese and onions.  Not bad but I would get a burrito next time.  Don't pass up the salsa bar.
Was excited to get some good mexican food down by the Wharf, and from the reviews I read...this was suppose to be the spot. But it fell way short.
Rolled in a few hour before close. Great service and the food was REALLY fresh!

We stumbled upon this fabulous location while looking for a reasonably priced, and not so busy, place to grab lunch while at Fisherman's Wharf. The portion sizes were HUGE, the quesadillas are delicious. Neither of us could finish our plates, we should have split one. The price is extremely reasonable considering the large portion size and proximity to expensive Fisherman's Wharf!
No good, no tasty and more expensive than others places.
We were in the mood for mexican food. So being that we were staying about two blocks from the restaurant we decided to try it.  The place is clean. Staff is friendly.

Stopped in here for a cheap meal on our first night in SF after walking around the wharf area. We wanted inexpensive food that was tourist garbage, and Mamita's delivered. They had some nice beer choices (all in the Mexican realm: Bohemia, Dos Equis, etc), a very good salsa bar (watch out for the bright orange stuff...its hot!!!), friendly staff and delicious food. My only complaint was that their chips seemed like they may have come from a bag vs. being homemade.
I decided to give this place a second chance and I'm glad I did.
Friendly staff, great mexican food in the Fishermans Wharf area.
Great Mexican Food at The Fisherman's Warf! Good prices and friendly Service! I love the Carne Asada and the Shimp Tacos!!!
I eat here regularly for the last 20 years or more. I am meeting my relatives here tonight. Hope it is as good as usual. I love the laid back feeling of it.

Drove from the Peninsula, paid for parking, and walked my 90 year old Mother uphill one block to take her to a "special" lunch at Capps only to be rudely told they were closed for a private party.   That was after I checked the website to verify hours, etc.   Certainly not the Capps of days bygone!

Came back after almost 10 years. Huge delicious portions. I used to think it was expensive - now I think it's cheap. Soup still rocks (minestrone doesn't describe it - it's a yummy bean soup.) REALLY NICE SERVER.

Went for dinner on a Sunday evening.  It wasn't crowded by the time we walked over around 5pm. The menu all looked so good, but we ordered the linguine with marina mussels and clams  & the fettucini with prawns in white wine sauce.  The server was attentive and polite but didn't smile the entire time.  The buser was very attentive and our water cups never got ignored ( i love that bc i drink a lot of water )  Also, the buser cleared our plates quickly and the server never crowded the table... we got everything after we had obviously  finished the prior dish.

The best place in the city for Family-style Italian dining. Sit at the beautiful bar, or cozy up with some friends in their comfy dining room. Bring an appetite, or clear out some room in your fridge, because the portions are BIG! The fare is surprisingly affordable for the quality. I brought my parents here who were visiting from the East Coast, and the owner came out and personally welcomed ALL of us. I highly recommend their Italian Sausage dinner...YUMMM!

This is a family Italian restaurant that may not rival the food in Italy, but it will reel you in with the hospitality! Food was good with healthy servings. The staff and the welcome you receive upon entering and throughout your meal create the experience that is lacking in dining these days. You are a part of the family as soon as you enter and it feels like Sunday supper without the crazy in laws. Definitely a place we will return to.

After watching beach blanket babylon, these usually is the place to be.  With a homie atmosphere and a family style serving. Food here is really good.  If you like italian family style food i think Capp's can meet your expectations..:-)
Used to be great. Last time it was far to busy and the service suffered greatly.
Ambience and food sorely lacking.  Loud,cramped, and bland food. With so many fantastic restaurants in North Beach, one should go elsewhere.
Really friendly staff and humorous server.  Order came quick. Minestroni soup and a good salad (better than your average Olive Garden) to share while you wait for your entrée.

I'd heard about Capp's Corner and decided to eat there after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon. I'd heard from many others that it was a great place and right next door to the play so we went.  To be sure, it was old-style San Francisco dining complete with a ZERO personality grumpy waiter.  "Can we get a smile, please?"  I thought I was eating in a cafeteria served by a guy who hated his job.  Not even a "Welcome to Capp's Corner" let a lone a "My name is Luigi, I will be your server."  OK, I'll admit I'm a bit spoiled. My first advertising job was for a restaurant and I ate at the owners table for dinner weekly, so I got used to a certain level of service.  But isn't that how you're supposed to feel when you are going to a restaurant, that you're with the owner and he wants everything to be right?  As for the food, well, my mom like her meal but the rest of us food snobs barely finished our plates as there just wan't anything special about the entree.  The sautéed vegetable were good.  That was about it.  ONE NOTE.  The bus boy was good and very attentive at pouring our water and cleaning our table.  Too bad he was not serving us, I would have left a bigger tip....

We stopped in right before dinner service ended. Not only was the service friendly and quick,  but the food was incredible. The atmosphere was welcoming and we had a great time. We usually like to jump around to different places, but we'll definitely be returning here soon!

What a great time we had Saturday night at Capp's Corner. Located in North Beach, we took 7 adults and 7 girls for a late night dinner at 8:30.  The minestrone soup served before our meal was so tasty and all our meals were wonderful. I had a steak that was so large I was able to let my daughter have more than half!
Horrible service and bland food. I had to add seasoning to every single dish including the soup!

Yesterday a friend and I were looking for a place to get a glass of wine or a beer so we could sit and chat before heading home.  Two places we went into in North Beach were  not for us--one was too noisy for conversation and the other too expensive for a glass of wine.  So we went into Capp's and sat at the bar.  Decided to have a beer (Anchor Steam on tap) and asked if they had any appetizers we could order.  Oh, No!  they don't.  but the bartender drummed up cheesy garlic bread and meatballs for us.  Delicious!  And so filling that I realized I was going to call it dinner and just have a bowl of salad when I got home.

We had another wonderful lunch at Capps Corner today.  Once again the service and food was great.  I still love the calamari steak lunch and many of our group have the traditional spaghetti and meatballs.  Our servers were very good and very nice and really tried to make our visit memorable.  5 stars for Capps Corner!
Another lunch at Capp's on December 19, 2013.  Excellent as usual.  The prices never change.  Where else can you get an excellent lunch for $14?

Topped off a perfect visit to SF from down peninsula fo three seniors.  Was great to see BBB, find easy access nearby parking at Vallejo Garage, and dine just steps from BBB at this couldn't-be-homier little spot.  We happened to arrive as a large busload of seniors from Grass Valley arrived - unbeknownst to waitstaff, who couldn't be more cordial and inviting.  I could definitely imagine stopping in frequently if I lived nearby.  At the invite of waitress and ok from bartender we started our meal at the bar instead of waiting.  Yes, the minestrone was lighter, less pasta-laden than I am used to but I found it a nice lead-in to the salad and entrée, rather than being too filling.  The salad was traditional, as expected.  We did love the luscious beets and remarked at the creamy dressing.  We were informed it was simply egg and olive oil! Whoa-tasted like creamy cesear or...  Each enjoyed our entrée and felt a 3 course dinner under $20 in 'the city' was great to come by.  Thanks to all for a lovely cold winters night out.  We've recommended already..

Went here for my Mother-in-law's birthday. All the food looked great, except for what I ordered. The veal I ordered was dried out, and hard as a rock. Maybe that is not there speciality. Don't live in the city, so I would probably go to Buca di Bepo instead.

Are you kidding me?  I guess it is "the place" to eat before or after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon but we won't be back.  The noise was outrageous and we were crowded by very large customers sitting right behind us.  The 'family style' dining means they bring each table a big bowl of minestrone soup that is so bland it tastes like it's been sitting all day.  The big bowl of salad was good - tons of dressing but typical of what you would get in the 60's and I suppose that is what they are going for - the "pre-foodie" type of food.  The food was mediocre at best and there was no real 'ambiance.'
Boy has this gone down hill. The worst minnestroni soup I ever had. Taste like left over lental soup. Very bland. Capps What happened????
They fired the best bartender I have ever known and I will never go back there again.
Absolute garbage. Food on a plane is better. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else. Yuck!
Perfect!! Service to food- awesome dinner after show up the street! Have many friends that drive 45 min into the city just for this place!

The minestrone soup is very good. And they give you lots of bread. I had the chicken parmigiana that was satisfactory. Our food server was very attentive and we were never low on beverages. My friend had the ravioli which she loved!  The location was perfect for dinner before Beach Blanket Babylon :) I would go back for the soup.
If you like bland, tasteless food, you're going to love the penne meat bolognese at Capp's!

Inept service. They told us it would be a 10 minute wait and then 30 minutes later they seated two groups who arrived after us before starting us.  They barely apologized. I suggest giving your money to restaurants with the professionalism to take care of all guests in the order in which they arrive.

From the moment my girlfriend and I walked in here we felt completely unwelcome. The hostess was flippant and seated 3 parties before us who had arrived later. Waited 10 minutes at the bar before we even got a drink. Then the hostess didn't walk us to our table. The waiter simply asked "you know what you want?" The food was decent but nothing special. The highlight was the attentive busboy. We tipped him more handsomely than the waitstaff. Overall, a really rude waitstaff and a bad environment.
Came here for lunch with my husband today. We had fast and friendly service; our waiter made sure we had everything we needed at all times.
Came here with one of my law school professors, who had been coming here for the past 15 years.
I have to give Capp's Corner five stars.
House salad + soup. Chicken parm, filet sole, decent portions. Friendly and attentive service.

Review of the bar only. We left The Saloon and headed to Beach Blanket Babylon but were early so we went to Capps Corner to have a drink. It's an old Italian Restaurant and bar. We sat at the bar and the four of us ordered drinks. The bartender chatted with us about the bar, the location and Beach Blanket Babylon. She had worked there for many years. The restaurant did a steady business. We looked at the menus and decided maybe next time. Good company and drinks.
Capp's Corner was one of the first Italian places I visited in SF.  It's great, homestyle Italian food in a family friendly atmosphere.  Great for a big group.  Definitely a good, relaxing dinner.

Great restaurant off of the beaten path. I had my birthday dinner here yesterday evening, really enjoyed the atmosphere and food. I had the LINGUINI WITH MUSSELS AND CLAMS, it was on point with the minestrone and salad before the entree.
Here's a small corner spot in North Beach with some real character.

Delicious, family style Italian food. My husband and I were meeting some friends for dinner and weren't sure if we were at the right place. I guess the staff noticed our lost look because they immediately came outside to ask if we were the couple - with the baby - that was part of the group of four. They brought us inside, seated us immediately, asked about a high chair and took an order for my daughter (who is only a year old). Service gets five stars from me. I felt right at home.

My friends and I were looking for a nice Italian place to eat at before Beach Blanket Babylon and we thought this place might be good. When we first walked in, the place had a really weird smell but I chose to ignore it and see what was on the menu. After seeing the very little variety they had to offer, I placed my order to the very unfriendly waitress who was very short with us. She served us soup and salad and removed the bowls from the table while we were still eating them. There was still food in the bowls!! She did this without saying more than two words to us. After eating the mediocre soup and salad our main courses arrived. I honestly believe chef boyardee and Kraft can make better Italian food. Finally the rude waitress dropped off the check without saying one word. The check had a sneaky extra $10 charged. After having her remove the "mistake" we left.
We went with a large group on 12/22/12 and had a great time. The food was good and the service ok. We were though a little rushed. Loved the soup and salad. Definitely will be coming back!

Excellent family-style, hearty,  Italian American fare. It was exactly what we needed on a cold, rainy night in SF. If you're looking for haute cuisine, you won't find it here, but you will get great food and service, and a lively, comfortable atmosphere.
Their food is very very good. We eat here quite often.

First of all, I like the food at the restaurant. I like the muni (the one with baked scallop), Godzilla, crazy and dragon rolls, gyoza, beef udon, sake sashimi. Yummy, yummy. Their roll menu is very nice. I haven't tried the lunch menu because it doesn't look very impressive.

While attending a conference a few blocks away, my group went out to Pier 39 and I decided to get some sushi and watch MNF.  I was very pleased with my take-out order.  I spent $50+ on 3 rolls and some nigiri and it was worth every penny!!!  The food looked as good as it tasted.  Very fresh and beautiful!  Glad I came here!
I bet they get busy sometimes because they don't have enough hosts/hostesses, but the sushi is good!
Bibimbop is great, get the spicy pork! Comfortable, quiet spot to grab lunch or dinner.

Stopped in for dinner on Tuesday evening. Not crowded and hostess was pleasant. The    Crunchy tuna roll was just ok but the California roll was great.  The teriyaki salmon was excellent.   I would definitely return.  No alcohol though.

I have been to this place many times. I have read other review and contrary to what other people, I personally love the food here. The one star is for the service. Seriously, I have never gone to a restaurant where the waitress complains about what you tip. The first time I experienced a problem with Linda, the pm waitress, I left her a tip which was less than 5%of what the receipt suggests. Linda comes to pick it up and says she cannot take it because if is not enough. Really!! Ok no tip for you. The second time, I was there with a friend and Linda took our order, food came out pretty quick, no complaints... YET. Once the food came not once did she come to our table to see if we needed anything. I had to flag her down twice to tell her we needed something. When we were done and paid for our food we went outside as we waited for our ride. Linda comes out with the receipt and says "excuse me, do you have a problem with the service?" !!0.0!! REALLY!! I said "why because we didn't give you a tip?" She said "Yes. This is not the first time you come here". So I told her "I pay for good food not sh***y service. I don't owe you anything!" Who does that!! 5 stars for Chef Peter who does an excellent job but this restaurant needs a new waitress ASAP.
Ok if you're hungry but really not the greatest. Way too much iceberg salad and dressing. I've never had sushi with iceberg salad before.

Came here back in March on a trip to San Francisco with my girlfriends. Location is great, but that is it. Sushi is average, not a lot of special items to choose from on the menu. The biggest downfall any restaurant can make is to allow their servers to track you down to the bathroom and request that you give them a better tip. SERIOUSLY? ????? If her service would have been worthy of my generous tip she would have received it, but then she had to go and confront my friends and I in regards to the tip? I should of told her to give me my $3 back. We went in on Sunday March 16 around afternoon.  The restaurant was empty, literally, after we sat down,  our server rook her time to go to our table, after we ordered the food took a long while to be brought out to us, she never stopped by to see if we needed anything, I had to request that she bring me wasabi, ginger and soy sauce, which when you are in a sushi restaurant, that is a automatic table set up. I did not feel her service was worthy of a tip to begin with, and to make matters worse, she complained to us about it! Will not go back,  ever! I would rate negative stars if I could.

It's a shame yelp doesn't offer half stars because I would definitely give this 2.5 stars. I came here with my family for 4th of July. Obviously the restaurants at the pier were too packed and had an average of a 2 hour wait, we resorted to this place which was relatively still close to the pier. Luckily we came just in time before the rush came in.

Went there because it was late and wanted to have some sushi. The place didn't serve alcohol probably because their license got revoked. It was late so we were the last 2-3 tables. We ordered promptly and the food was served soon.

A simple place with the best California and Philly rolls, not a fan of the Alaska roll though. We called for the Crunchy Saigon roll as well, but the favorites (Cali & Philly rolls) were better. Good service, very little crowd. Good place to stop for a quick sushi bite if you are in Bay street.
Tasty but not necessarily a great value. The double dragon roll was quite good (as someone who loves eel). $14 was a bit pricey for it though.
The sushi was fine, nothing special, but they don't serve alcohol - not sure what's up with that!
I've usually stayed in Fisherman's Wharf for business and always enjoyed getting Miyabi Sushi. If you like rolls, this is the place for you!

I would have given this place 3-4 stars but due to a misleading advertisement via their website.  There website states they offer lunch specials, which we went for, only to find out they would not honor it. This left a very sour taste in my mouth when told NO, We do NOT offer those specials at our location per the waitress. I spoke with Chef about our situation and just advised him if he did not offer the specials that Miyabi Sushi at Bay Street should take their location off from the website. I will say one thing, the food is good but not the deceiving pricing.

On visit to San Francisco with my wife we just happened upon this place and popped in. It was my wife's first experience of sushi and only my second. This left us faced with the challenge of not really knowing what to order. The staff were great, it's a shame I don't remember her name but the help was perfect and we had a lovely meal.

New to the neighborhood, so wanted to check out the local sushi joint. The thing about a 'local' place is that it doesn't have to be the best - it just has to be better than "just convenient." We had one warning against trying it, but we didn't trust the source - so we did.

The best sushi what I ever eat. Make sure that Peter is the cook. Other cooks are good to but Peter is just the best. The chicken udon is the real udon not like in some other places where offer noodles ans bouillon separate.
The one redeeming sushi roll here was the spicy tuna, the fish was excellent and they gave us a great portion inside.  I highly recommend just going here for the spicy tuna roll.
Given Miyabi's close proximity to the super touristy Fisherman's wharf, one can't help to be a little wary. It took me some courage and a very hungry stomach to venture into this establishment.

Mediocre.  Indifferent service, OK sushi but terrible teriyaki chicken (chicken: old, tough and undercooked) Teriyaki sauce: overly sweet and gooey.  The whole experience is one of being in a place where the staff is just 'phoning it in'...Disappointing!

I can't say that this place is out of this world or that I can't wait to come back again but it was alright. There wasn't anything so amazing that it blew away my standards for sushi. However, it did make me full for lunch so I suppose that it did what it was supposed to do.

Been here 3 times and all 3 times they charged me something that either we didn't order or not delivered. 3rd time was I ordered a $5 dish but they gave me the $13 dollar dish. Didn't mind cause I was hungry, but still. Double check your receipt before you pay for things you didn't order.
The sushi is excellent and I love their menu! all dishes have photos so you don't get confused!!
On a girl's weekend, we ate here late one evening as it was right around the corner from hotel. The low-down:

Finally found parking. A Sushi place at the end of the block. Looks good a clean restaurant  Has a good choice of specials on the board. Asked questions about the prep. and ordered. Miyabi had a favorite Saki in stock. Perfect.

I love Japanese food, and this was my second visit to this branch of Miyabi Sushi;  it was my first during the lunch rush. Big mistake! I and two others arrived at 1PM to discover a full house, and while "busy is good", we should have bolted.  Though there were a couple of vacant tables, it took fully 20 minutes for the sole server to wave us to our seats. After a quick look at the menu, we all decided on a bento box combo in the vain hope that it might arrive at our table fairly quickly.  Sadly, the fact that there was only one "chef" on the premises plus the single server/cashier/waitress/bus person conspired to insure that our meal, when finally delivered, was stone cold. I couldn't help but feel sorry for the overworked and under supported staff (two !); it appeared they were trying their best.  Honestly folks (owners), you really need to devote more staff and resources to this location. I won't be back until you do.

North Beach has such terrible options for Asian food. Miyabi is no exception. It gets customers (mostly tourists wandering from Fisherman's Wharf) solely because it is the only Japanese restaurant in the area. Here's a quick breakdown:
Food was good and price level ok.

I liked this Japanese restaurant. I had chicken teriyaki and tempura. I also tried the 49er roll. I've said this before in a review, but these restaurants all seem the same and are generally decent and tasty. This one is near the Embarcadero and would get a lot of business from tourists.
The girl who works on fri. & sat. is very professional and friendly.

Had sushi here on a Sunday after the SF Rock N Roll half marathon.  Place opened at 11am however when we arrived the place looked closed. We walked up and the restaurant owners saw us standing around and finally let us in.
