Went for lunch.  Not bad service but the place wasn't packed so I expected some good service. Sushi was good and will go back.
Was having dinner with friend and her 2-month old infant during Oscars.

Went here while on a trip in San Francisco. As a lover of all things free, I was happy to see they gave complimentary hot green tea, which is the toasty, authentic kind. Very yummy! The service was also great. One thing I didnt like was that they drizzle their mochi with chocolate syrup, the cheapy artificial kind.

Good sushi and service. We live in the neighborhood and go here quite a bit. Recently we were in and our waitress was the only once servicing the entire restaurant (the other server called in sick) and it was packed-. She kept a smile on her face and somehow managed. Really great spot if you want a quality sushi meal without pretentiousness and a scene.
good quality, friendly service
Went there to pick up my to-go order. I felt like I was in the game of Diner Dash.

Very decent quality sashimi served here at comparatively very reasonably prices considering that this restaurant is located just a few blocks from the tourist areas of Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. I had a very good chirashi plate for $19.99 which was very nicely prepared and had good variety of fish on it. The sushi rice was fine and could've had a bit more vinegar taste, but that's just my opinion. The two young ladies working as staff the evening I went were nice and attentive also.

You want good food? Go to Goodfellas. You want clean food? Go to goodfellas. You want non-processed fresh food? Go to Goodfellas. You want customer service? Go to Goodfellas. You want Halal food? Go to Goodfellas. Need to charge your phone? Go to Goodfelllas. Wana watch sports on a HUGE flat screen? Go to Goodfellas.
great food for a tourists and not far from the pier walking distance they use fryer for fries and wings which is a plus for me
Place is great open till 3 am on Friday and Saturday.  Really hit the spot late night after drinking.  Favorite pizza so far was the Greek: pesto, chicken, feta cheese, olives, and artichoke!!!
They have one of The best Pesto pizzas I've ever tríed!!! Their bread is really good and te combition of toppings are great!!! Dont let The outside decieve you!!
Good solid pizza joint.  Don't let the lack of ambiance scare you away.  Goodfellas pie was delish. Great crust, sauce, and overall pie.  A nice surprise.
The new owner is very nice and he offered me the most amazing kabobs. Everything was very good and for a great price.

I walked in when this place was empty, it gave me a chance to admire the decor, if your a mob movie fan, you'll fit right in. The best part was not only were these folks friendly and engaging I was treated like family. Great service, great personalities and amazing pizza! By the time I left Goodfellas it was busy and I can see why, these guys know a good pie and make the crusts crispy and a perfect thickness! You'll see me back in soon! Cheers!

Best pizza in town! They have the freshest ingredients and tastiest dough. Not to mention the top notch service. Def a hidden gem in SF. Walking distance from fisherman's wharf so make sure you try this hidden gem!
I've ate pizza from here three times. It's meeh. If you want a quick pizza bite, it'll do. Other than that, find somewhere else.

Long day of sightseeing called for hotel delivery for dinner.  We got subs, cheese sticks and pizza to share.  Meatball sub was delicious... Pepperoni & sausage pizza also delicious.  Delivered fast and hot directly to our room.  Would definitely recommend.
Great staff - so friendly :) And the pizza is bangin'. I love coming here. It's not a tourist trap despite the neighborhood. Price is right too.
Sex Is Like Pizza, Even When It's Bad It's Still Pretty Good.  Amen!

Didn't think it could get much worse than dominos back when I was in college but it clearly could, and at twice their prices too!! Bland crust, light sauce, no real flavor on the veggies... Of the few that were visible, meat tasted weird. For almost 20 bucks for a small pie I didn't think I'd see the night where I'd be missing Dominos!

If you're looking for delivery then this isn't the place.  The guy taking orders was so rude and could not understand a word I was saying.  Then, we called back to get the amount (he never gave it to me and hung up when I tried to end the conversation politely) so we got to hear this person yelling at people in the background.  Customer service NOT at it's finest :/ Even better was the fact that this place is what the Sheraton recommended!  Needless to say, we cancelled our order.
Decent food, average price.  If we are in the neighborhood, this place would be an option again.
Goodfellas pizzeria for dinner. High hopes spawned from looking at previous reviews here on Yelp, arriving at the joint flowed with this.

So I ordered two slices of pizza. They brought out four slices and said they give two slices when ordering one (wish they would have mentioned that, but not complaining). So when you visit this place keep in mind they bring out two slices when you order one. But definitely a good place and pizza was delish.

This pizza place is within walking distance of the Holiday Inn so I opted to hike over instead of delivery.  Walking in at 6:30 and seeing no customers made me wonder,  but since I was there and I had a 15% off yelp coupon I figured what the heck.  At the counter there was and good fellas type guy who took my order.  I told him I had a 15 % off Yelp coupon and as I showed him my phone he takes it and begins to scroll thru the Yelp page as if he didn't believe it was there.  A little strange but he fit the Good Fellas Mobster vibe of the place.  I ordered and sat down to be wait.  A couple more patrons walked in so I felt a little assured.   The pizza maker from the back walked my to go order over to my table and gladly fetched some plates for me.  Once back to our hotel room my wife and I enjoyed the food although we had hoped for a tad thicker crust .  Overall it was not too bad.

Not bad. Huge slices for not too much $. I eat here a lot because it's close to my work and open late. Nothing fancy. No drinks in-house, but there is a Safeway across the street, and they let you bring your own.

I've ordered delivery from Goodfella's twice now.  The second time was mildly better than the first, but neither meal was especially good.  Even though it's two blocks from my apartment, I'm going to work on finding a better pizza delivery place.

Ordered a New York classic pizza. Although it's not bad there's no "New York" about this pizza. It's doughy, too cheesy and the sauce is too tangy. I don't think the owner ever had New York pizza before. The true New York pizza is not from those "for-tourist" pizzerias in New York. True New York pizza is from the hole in the wall pizzerias.

This place is located in North beach and the pizza is tasteless the pizza sauce is their weak point it taste like something out of the can very disappointing I was hoping for better, especially in North Beach!.

Wouldn't call it the best pizza in North Beach, but the pizza here amongst the best!  Not the cheapest place either.  Expect to pay a little extra here, but it's definitely worth it. Will go back soon, and try some of the other items on the menu (non-pizza).

Although the pizza is good the cook on duty didn't wash his hands before or after handling cash. Went straight to touching the dough after touching money. Not ok!!! This stuff is restaurant and cleanliness basics! Not sure if I'll come back...
Really slow and bad service . They DONT have enough people to make pizzas. Do not come to this place!
Absolutely LOVED this place!!!! Friendly staff, fantastic pizza, great vibe! Awesome awesome awesome!!!! Get amongst!!

This place was awesome! We walked in about 10 pm on a Sunday and thought they were closed but we were welcomed with a friendly smile! We ordered a medium pizza, half Greek pesto and half chicken blanco and both were delicious!!! We got a large pizza at no extra charge and received great service from everyone that worked there while we waited for our pizza. I really like thin crust pizza and theirs is on point! I will definitely come back here next time I'm in SF and remember to check in first so I can redeem my 15% discount

Wow. This pizza was really bad! All these reviews don't lie. I was in the area after a club night, desperately wanting pizza, but also desperately not wanting to walk far in heels in the cold. So, against my better judgment we came here & I regret it. A plain slice of cheese pizza was around $3, and it was terrible. Flavorless, cold, dry, paper tasting crust, little sauce, and tasteless cheese. They didn't even heat it up like a MALL pizza establishment would! I piled on garlic powder, pepper flakes, & finally Sriracha to stomach it. Perhaps if you order a whole fresh pizza it might be a bit better, but the ingredients & I am not willing to return to find out.

I was really excited about trying GoodFella's. Having just landed from Alcatraz this seemed like a great alternative to getting lunch in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. Plus there was 15% off with a Yelp check-in which made GoodFella's even more enticing. I was greatly disappointed with our lunch here.

I have no real problems with this place. I'm was up here on business so it was nice that they delivered to my hotel room without any problems. There are reasons why I'm not giving it 4 or 5 stars. Well, for 5 stars you would have had thee most awesome piece of pizza EVER but this was far from that in general. So I'll just mention why it didn't quite make it to 4 stars.
Never, never, never order from this place.

Our company had a very large event in the city yesterday and we wanted to have some pizza for the staff working the event. I immediately contacted this place due to positive experiences in the past. The owner was very pleasant and diligently took down my order. He was extremely patient and answered all of my questions pertaining to the variety of pizzas on their menu. They had our order ready on time and the staff LOVED the pizza! If your looking for a professional level of service and even better pizza, GoodFellas is the place to eat!

Came in to order a slice of pizza, 5 $ for up to 4 toppings. Got the anchovies,  pepperoni, sausage,  and mushrooms.  Its two slices actually, it fills the whole box. Taste pretty good but its no tonys but still good. And if you cant find parking near tonys which always happens then come here cause safeways parking lot is across the street so you could just go to safeway and validate.
They say if you can't say something nice then don't say it at all...well, whatever.
Hungry? Check

not the best pizza I have had but with ranch all pizza is good. my friends got the mozzarella sticks and they looked amazing. we went there late though so there was only cheese and pepperoni to choose from.
Wasn't anything exciting. The dough was chewy and didn't have the right flavor and the sauce had a weird taste. I've had pizzas from the super market that were better.
YUCK. Delivery of 2 salads and a pizza margherita. Awful. Almost no cheese, not enough sauce, no pesto at all and no garlic. 1 tiny bit of dressing for big salads. So, so disappointing.
The grilled sandwiches were extremely underwhelming -- not worth $9. It took approximately 30 minutes to get our simple order. Not coming back.
Best pizza in the North Beach area period, its just so damm goooood!
Just ordered delivery via Eat24 to my office
I wanted to like this place since it's a diversion from another local Greek place that I like to frequent.
Traditional Greek food! I loved it.
Legit pita awesome sauce. I'm coming back. Yeah any good deliver service in the city takes a minute, don't blame the restaurant. Plus it's still worth the wait. Spicy scrimps are amazing as well.

I stumbled upon this place because the house wait was too long. Most of the times I've passed by it, it was closed but we took a chance since the dining room was open (note: the kitchen is always open for takeout and they serve their menu next door at the Italian restaurant). For a traditional Greek place, I thought the food was really solid. We started with the small platter which is a great appetizer for 4 people but was hefty for two of us. It gave me my gyro. Fix and included 5 different spreads and pita. My girlfriend got the beans dish which was huge and smothered in sauce which was perfect for dipping the homemade bread in. I got the boureki (ground lamb wrapped in phyllo) which was tasty and very filling with a side of Greek salad with feta blocks the size of whiskey stones . Service was good. All in all this place goes toward the top of my list for sit down Greek food when I don't want to spend an arm and a leg at kokkari.
Horrible. Had to cancel my order it took over 2 hours.
I love this place!  The food is great and reasonably priced, and our service was AMAZING.  I will definitely be back!

I've ordered from Estia using GrubHub on multiple occasions. The food is solid - I usually get the Gyros Platter which is enough food for 1.5 people. I've read some other reviews saying the service is slow through GrubHub. I'm not sure if that's the restaurant's fault or not so I'm not ready to throw them under the bus for the service time.

This is for a delivery from grubhub. The food took over an hour to arrive. When it arrived it was cold. The gyro platter was cold and the meat hard and indelible. The chicken platter was barely better. It was lukewarm. The pita had a strange aftertaste. All of it ended in the trash uneaten. Can't believe we spent $36 including tip!!! I want my money back and my taste buds! If I could give  0 stars I would. KFC would have tasted better and been more food for the money. The amount of food we got was not with the money! Let alone tasting good. Super disappointed and had to order pizza to make up.
They never fail for great delivery! I have yet to step foot in the restaurant because it has kind of a creepy exterior.

One of my favorite greek restaurants in the San Francisco.  We went in there last night for dinner and had a very nice experience.  Our waitress, Maria, was excellent.  She recommended a great wine.  The BEST part is the fried cheese.  They pour a shot of liquor over the cheese and light it.  It makes is so crispy and lightly toasted.  Dinner was delicious.  Definitely try the sweet Greek coffee.  It's similar to Turkish coffee.  Nice pick up before a night out.  The only issue was that they overcooked the lamb, but the graciously replaced it without an issue.

The service was amazing. The food was fair to great depending on the dish. Would try it again but found it bland. Still a lovely environs and staff, family run. And my friend super enjoyed whilst I merely tolerated. Too oily and lacking enough acid and flavor.
If you order delivery, your meal often arrives cold, unfortunately.
Get the appetizer sampler platter, everything is super delicious. Avgolemono soup is a little thick but pretty good. Pastry with ground lamb is a delicious entree. Friends enjoyed the gyro platter.

We had an awful experience... we are vegetarians and we ordered combo platter.. we specifically mentioned to our waiter, NO MEAT and NO SEAFOOD or RELATED!!!! guess  what we got!! Freaking roe!!! We politely asked the waiter if there was anything related to seafood in the platter and he said... of course there is....and he jokingly waved his hands and said if you dont like it dont eat it!! HAHAA.... we know that you stupid!! we did not drive 30 miles to not eat what we dont like!!! he did not offer replacements... we quickly ate and ran out of that place never to go back! Who does things like this!! 1 star is of the waitress who got us water!! she seemed nice!!

We wandered in after trying desperately to find a quiet spot for dinner on a Saturday night. While the lack of patrons was a little alarming at first, the food, friendly service and the ability to have a conversation over the table quickly set our minds at ease. I will definitely go back.

As someone who frequently visits the East Coast, especially Astoria Queens where some of the best Greek restaurants outside of Greece exist, Estia's Gyros have been nothing short of plentiful, fresh and delicious. Same goes for the salads, Spicy Prawns and spreads. My only complaint would be that the only fish dish they have is the salmon. We would like to order white fish dishes as well.
Disgusting, worst greek I've had.  The dips tasted like a salt lick.

I never bother writing a review, but I am hopeful this prevents someone else from making the same mistake.  I placed my order over Eat24.  It showed up 2 hrs after I ordered. . . cold, and the lamb was dry.  Arguably, the worst service and most disappointing meal I have ever had.  The lukewarm apology from the delivery guy was pathetic and more of a slap in the face than anything else.

I've gotten delivery a few times from here, each time getting the gyro platter. The platter is pretty filling and the serving size is very generous. The lamb is seasoned well and is also very tender. You'd be surprised at how many places serve dry lamb. One thing I would like more is if they included more pita -- there's only one included. Delivery does take about an hour though, so be prepared to wait if you order online from Grub Hub. I would definitely order from here again.
Ordered delivery through Eat24.  They were an hour late, and lied to us, and to Eat24, about when the food would be delivered.  Food was mediocre.  Never again.
Ordered delivery through LivingSocial.  Had the Grilled Combo Trio and Melitzanosalata.  Will not eat here again.
Despite ease of ordering for home delivery, Estia fell very short of our desire for light, healthy, fresh Greek food. A disappointing first order will be our last.

Frankly, Estia is bizarre but charming.  The "actual" open hours never seem to match the posted open hours, and the restaurant is always eerily empty when it IS open. The food, however, is marvelous, and the service friendly and homey, as if you'd dropped by your Greek uncle's house for dinner. Everything I've eaten there, from the (huge) side salad to the spanikopita to the vegetarian moussaka has been fresh, well-prepared and delicious. And, they share a kitchen with the Italian restaurant next door, so even if they're closed when you expect them to be open, you can order Greek food at Viva Pizza next door! This is a perfect solution when you have a party of three & 1 person wants portabella ravioli, 1 wants fiery shrimp, and 1 wants gyro. Sincerely odd but heartily recommended.

We got take out tonight for the first time from this place.  We're not impressed.  Greek food is usually so delicious, this was a major let-down.  The spanakopita was so dry, hard and stale.  I've had a LOT of spanakopita in my day and I've never experienced this.  The rest of the food tasted cheap & heavy.  And, it was way over priced for the quality.  The delivery guy was nice, but we won't be ordering from them again.  I guess all the tourists keep them alive.  Good luck to them.

My boyfriend and I have a policy about eating out once a week -- mostly because we love restaurants and left to our own devices, would quickly blow through all our money on dining.  We've gone past Estia several times and have loved the look of it and the menu, so last night was finally said -- Hey! Let's go!

I actually drop by one time for a gyros since I wanted just a little merienda while busying myself in the shops down North Beach. It was a good experience, the gyros sold for 5 bucks. It tasted fine, it did its job of satisfying my hunger :) I do want to visit again for an in-house visit since at the time I took my meal to go.

The first Greek place I've found in SF with taramosalata! Had a bunch of salads and appetizers, which were good (not amazing), but at least they were authentic! The very friendly owner happily created a new octopus dish for us and then brought us an $11 bottle of retsina, which made my night. A little pricey, but if you want a good Greek experience, this is a lovely spot.

I love greek food. Having lived in Greece for 2 years has taught me a thing or two about their cuisine. Overall I had a great time. First off the service was excellent... great waiter. The  food is slightly overpriced, but it is North Beach I guess. The fasolakia (white beans) had a nice flavor, but they were slightly crunchy. The spanikopita was delicious and it was a large portion, but the filo was soggy/ chewy. The avgolemono (lemon) soup... I could have made it better. The olive oil, by the way, was fabulous... made in Crete and imported especially for estia. Overall enjoyable, but not the best I've had in San Francisco.
Absolutely horrible delivery services. Kept me waiting for over an hour and half. Then sent me cold food and warm sodas. And the food is substandard.
I've gotten delivery from these guys a few times.  All in all, I've been very impressed with them and I LOVE their gyro plate!

The food is just ok. I live right down the block and this place is always empty if open at all. Ive also never had any luck with my food being ready when i go to pick it up. Every time they leave me standing there for 10-20 minutes while they try and figure out where my order is. EVERY TIME! Also the last 2 or 3 times the vegetable that come with the Gyro Platter were nearly rotten. Doesnt help to complain because they barely speak or understand English.

I have ordered several times from this restaurant, but was quite disappointed with the latest order.  I think the restaurant was not happy with my tip (note, usually I top 20-30%) - when I opened the bag, the food was massively overcooked and lacking taste.  I ate a few bites before throwing away since it was too disgusting. They threw my tip in the bag as if a note of displeasure.  Needless to say, this is an unprofessional way to run a business and I have let all of my colleagues know as well. Don't order from these jerks.

Hmmm, walked in on Saturday night and the place was eerily empty.  This should have been a red flag.  The food was just o.k., but my glass of cabernet for $9 tasted a bit like vinegar  At $15 a plate, a lot more effort could have been put into the meal - yet the food at this place is mediocre at best.  Don't waste your time here when you're near the heart of some of the best eats in the city.
Very nice Greek restaurant in North Beach.   The food was very tasty and delicious.
My Greek friend Alexis had lunch .soo very good. He is not homesick anymore. The real deal.
The olive oil that comes with the bread isn't that appetizing. And the bread needs a better crust... but so what they are free......
I ordered food online. They charged me for delivery and the food was an hour late. They get one star because the food was good, but I will NEVER order for delivery again.
So bad it's almost comical.
This is the worst restaurant I've even been to in San Francisco and the one of the worst meals I've had in years.

I guess it's time to write an entirely new review for Il Fornaio. I had an unpleasant experience here about four years ago and I slammed the restaurant in my Yelp review. Shortly afterward, the manager contacted me and offered to make everything right. I must admit that I was surprised and more than satisfied just with her attention and sincerity. I actually didn't accept the offer of a free dinner - for two!- because I didn't want to give the impression that I had written a bad review in order to get this consideration. I'm not that kind of person. But I did remove my review. After all, it was only a matter of having had a reservation but having to wait almost an hour. (The blame may have belonged to Open Table, in fact.) But after this truce, I eventually returned to Il Fornaio on many occasions and always enjoyed wonderful meals and excellent service. The Happy Hours are the best in town. The ginger mojito is my favorite, served in a sturdy, tall tumbler. The menu changes to reflect the seasons and, I suppose, the whims of the chef. There's a pulled or jerked pork sandwich which is occasionally on the menu, and when it appears, I always have that.
Do not hesitate to use this venue for a major banquet. You will not be disappointed.

I was raving about this place to a friend and we decided to have dinner here...........From my previous experience I loved my dish, however it seemed to have gone down hill since.  I ordered the risotto, probably why it was disappointing.  I should've ordered a pasta dish.  The risotto was undercooked so every bite was gritty and grainy, I only ate half my dish, server was too busy to even notice why.  Probably would not go back again as there are too many other Italian restaurants with better food at that price.

My fiancé and I came across this charming place last year after touring Alcatraz. We arrived between lunch and dinner, and the place was relatively quiet. The service was excellent. The restaurant was decorated very festively for Christmas. We ordered antipasti and a calzone to tide us over until dinner. They were huge portions, delicious, and we ended up canceling our dinner reservations that night. I would definitely return.

Happy hour, what a treat! Really worth going there for a glass of wine and the carpaccio. Too bad you don't get a basket of that delicious bread with it when it's happy hour. The pizza is simple but good.
I came back for the Abruzzi menu and loved it.....the octopus pasta is delish and the porchetta.... Keep'on lovin it

One of the bets italian restaurants in town. Great service, great food and coffee. Since my school was in front of it, I went many times for the happy hour. Very good pizzas and other meals for 6 dollars. Very good deals.
Very tasty italian food.  Wonderful service.  Everyone is so thoughtful.  The food comes out perfectly.  It's great for a celebratory lunch or for a full stomach!

I've been here quite many times and I enjoyed every meal! The bread they serve before the main dish is nice and warm, the food tastes great and they also have nice wine. Sometimes the service is slow, but that's not that bad. I must admit that I give them 5 stars grudgingly because apparently my favorite and regular dish there (I don't remember the exact name, but it's the pasta with mushrooms) is seasonal :( However, there are nice alternatives such as the Cristina pizza.

This is a terrible restaurant.  Upon first glance it looks very nice and clean but the service and food are both lacking.  I ordered sea base which was to be deboned at the table.  By the time my waiter, with hands shaking so badly you would have thought we were in the arctic, finished deboning my fish it looked as if it had already been eaten and regurgitated back onto my plate.  My dinner guest ordered lasagna which was cold in the center and flavorless.  The time that elapsed between ordering and food arrival was more than 40 minutes with other tables nearby being served before us even though they had arrived after.  I give one star only because the yelp forces me too.  I write this in hopes that fellow travelers will beware and go somewhere else!!
Another yummy meal!! Sweet Betty took excellent care of us tonight. My pasta was perfect and her wine selection was spot on.
Love their coffee!  Always friendly folks, clean bathrooms and a beautiful restaurant.
The gnocchi was more like mashed potatoes. Had to chuckle at the irony when I saw the bill and it listed 'gnocchi cooking courses.' Maybe the cook should take one? Service was great though!

Very clean environment, cozy good for a date or casual lunch. Food is good, some dishes better than others. The portions are smaller these days and flavor is a bit less than their first years of operations.

We were married in downtown SF last month. Many of our guests were staying downtown so we decided to host our rehearsal dinner at Il Fornaio. After an extensive search for the right restaurant we chose Il Fornaio for the location, the space and the price. We hosted 50 of our dearest friends and family. The outside patio area was a great space to host a cocktail reception followed by a plated dinner. Working with the restaurant was easy. They accommodated just about every request we asked for. The only complaint, which was outside of their control, was building work on the Levi's building during the dinner. Speeches unfortunately were impacted to some degree. As mentioned, the restaurant had no control over this.
Looks like the Tuesday evening B-squad was on the floor...
My friend and I were in the area today and stopped in for pizza. It's a good thing we weren't starving because we did have a very long wait.

Service by our waitress Natallia was excellent (worth a 5, for sure):  she knew the menu and what was in the food; checked on us several times to see if we wanted our tea, coke, and Arnold Palmer drinks re-filled; conveyed to the kitchen a couple of specific requests to slightly change one dish my brother ordered; and she was a pleasant person.  Water service was excellent.  Food was very good.  We had kid's pizza piccola $6.99, vegetarian (adult) pizza $15.79, and other items.  In sum, we had 3 entrees, and two non-alcoholic drinks for $63.74 plus tax and tip.
Clean, good service and yummy food!

....Giving some thought to the review process...why do some rate low and most fairly high...not just Il Fornaio, all the others too...A few years back I was in LA...always saw this small local Mexican place always with long line in front...got to be good...We have been going to El Cholos for 30yrs...since their pitcher of margaritas were $3.95 and they were in a small bungalow...So anyhow we wait in the long line at this other place....the food was God awful...i called the owner over to our table...what's up with this gosh awful food...this Mexican food ain't rocket science...why don't you just go down to El Cholos an copy what they do (for last 50 years)....Here's the honest answer he gives and it applies to most restaurants....See that line outside...as long as they come I don't have to change a damn thing....So much for 4 star people...

We got the Cataloni Alforno and the Pizza Cristini. The pizza was wood fired and really good. The Cataloni Alforno was amazing. I liked the Cataloni better than the pizza. It had a good sauce and a better filling. All the dough is hand made and tossed. It was pricey but it was worth it.

I find the regular menu to be a little overpriced. The HH however, is one the of the best I've encountered. $3 drafts and great $6 pizzas (usually a $15+ pizza!), hard to beat! Only downside is you have to stay in the bar area for HH prices to be valid, and it gets pretty crowded.
Been here a few times for large parties and aside from not getting things right away when you request it, the service is solid, the menu has something for everyone especially during brunch.

I have been coming to Il Fornaio since I was young, and the food and service has always been consistent and really good. My dinner there the other night was great. The olive bread that they make in house is delicious, the olive oil/balsamic vinegar tastes like candy (so good!), and the Pollo Toscano is always my favorite choice on the menu. For dessert I recommend Tiramisu and a decaffeinated coffee.  Their wine selection is also excellent, and their brunch is wonderful too.

Besides the fact the wait was ridiculiously long, and we came before 12noon on a Tuesday, I think overall my chicken breast entree was decent. The chicken was on the drier side, but I like my chicken dry and chewy. The spinach was delightful, but the potatoes were too oily and greasy.
Came here last night for my prom dinner.  I ordered the Pennoni Alla Vodka and it was really delicious. I didn't get a chance to try their bread but overall, it was not bad.
Went for lunch. Good service. Good prices. Had the ravioli which I didn't like. The pennoni a la vodka was really good though.
It's a well kept restaurant. It's like if Olive Garden made it out here in the city, didn't give out a ton of free breadsticks, and charged more money. Walk over to North Beach instead.

I had no idea this nice looking restaurant is a chain! My coworkers and I came here for my birthday lunch, which was very sweet. We all ordered pasta and they all tasted pretty good. I got the penne with chicken, sundried tomatoes and broccoli. What I like about the restaurant is (1) their customer service and (2) their menu lists out the calories for each item and different portions for the health conscious folks. For dessert, we ordered bread pudding and a tiramisu. The bread pudding was amazing! The tiramisu was ok - kind of taste like store bought instead of from their kitchen. However, they gave us the tiramisu on the house for my birthday. :)

I visited the San Francisco branch of Il Fornaio with my gilfriend, one of her friends and her kid. We reserved on a Saturday night and we were seated almost immediately. Everyone of us ordered. The first person to be served was the kid who got a pizza. Then the friend was served canederli (It was the week of Trentino-Alto Adige). Canederli, or more properly, knödel, is usually served as a trio and it consists of 3 perfect spheres. For some reason the friend got 2 of them and they were deformed, small and they didn't look like spheres at all. I was then served my soup which took a good 20 minutes to come. My girlfriend was still waiting for her dish. She waited for over 30 minutes. At that point I got up to talk to the manager in charge that night because our server was hardly at our table. The manager came to our table and I expressed my disappointment for having to watch my girlfriend get annoyed and impatient. The manager understood but didn't make any special effort. Meanwhile, the conchiglie al pollo (shells with chicken) appeared in front of my girlfriend. We all ate and other courses followed. After my soup, which wasn't as advertised, I got gnocchi con sugo di coniglio (gnocchi with rabbit sauce). The gnocchi had the right consistency but the sauce or the meat was not rabbit for sure. After our meals we decided to choose a dessert. We waited for 15 minutes. At that time I ran out of patience, walked around until I found the waiter and told him to bring us the check. He eventually came back with the bill and dropped our dessert saying that it was on the house. Our experience at Il Fornaio in San Francisco is not one to remember. It was a major disappointment. The service is mediocre and the dishes served are not reflecting the true food of Italy that you would see oversea.
Food is decent and decor is nice (nice covered outdoor space). Service is good when it is not too busy. Discount for Exploratorium members. I will be back.
Good place for business lunch.  Had the potato leek soup which wasn't very good.  Had the salad with rotisserie chicken on it-always good.  Service was good.
tired, over-priced, not many customers eating that aren't on a business expense account...they should sell off the Carrera marble countertops and call it a day...

Terrible service and mediocre food. I had ordered a bottle of sparkling water, with that I asked for ice and lime. When he brought the sparkling water, it just came with the lime, but no ice. Asked for ice 3 times after that. Terrible service, I shouldn't have to ask 4 times if we are pasting top dollar for mediocre food.
Worst Italian food ever!
Good italian food, lots of choices for vegetarians and meat eaters alike.
From a bad experience down in Beverly Hills, CA I wanted to try this location where I live.
Veal Limon with side fettucine alfredo

I came here for my carb-loading dinner before my Nike's race on Sunday. I was amazed by the quality of the food and the service. They offered complimentary breads-three type of delicious breads: olive, sesame and I forgot the name of last one. I could not stop grabbing and eating the breads! They were great with the complimentary olive oil.
I've had lunch at Il Fornaio twice in the last month with 3 other people and we've all

Had the fried shrimp po' boy and it was AMAZING! Combined with a glass of beer and looking at San Francisco bay made it all the better! Also try their famous fish sandwich as well... equally as AMAZING!

Spent my 50th B-Day in S.F. last month and while waiting for our touristy Alcatraz and harbor boat trip, we spotted the Eagle Café upstairs in one of the building at Fisherman's Wharf.    We were in the mood for brunch and were so glad we ventured in.   No wait, and a beautiful room with a spectacular view of the bay.
I've only had their lobster bisque and clam chowder bread bowls, but I love this place.

Wait was short, food was meh... No sauce for the Benedict, no credit on the menu. If I ordered a side, would I not have been charged? Thought so. One of our party got sick from her breakfast. Like puke sick. Before we could leave.
Eagle cafe was just around the corner so I love the location of this place.
BEST LOBSTER BISQUE IN SANFRAN!
I have eaten here before - it was great!  Today we are having eggs that look over cooked.  My son ordered an omelette.  It's eggs cooked flat covering whatever he ordered.  Weird

This was our second visit to Eagle Cafe. Both times were very enjoyable. The first we got to order breakfast and both the crab cake Benedict and the pancakes were awesome! This past week, it was our first stop from the airport with my parents and the beginning of our Napa Valley vacation. My father's only request was to eat seafood at Fisherman's Wharf. The food was great! He and mom had fried shrimp and oysters that they both loved. We all shared raw oysters that were so fresh and yummy. I had the lobster bisque in the bread bowl and I had to fight everyone off of it it was so good. My partner had the salmon salad with blue cheese and walnuts and it was fantastic. Everything just tasted so fresh and the service was impeccable. I will always recommend this place and return there myself.

Busy little location but an absolute must if you are coming to San Fran. Highly suggest the Bloody Mary and the peanut butter and banana stuffed French toast. Service very quick. On pier 39 it is one of the first places you hit. Great for breakfast or lunch but watch out they don't serve both all the time. They serve breakfast up till bout 1130. Also a must try is their corn beef and hash. Made fresh there with wonderful flavor and even a hint of sweetness.

Delicious banana pancakes with a hefty serving. The toppings were delicious (pecans, brown sugar, and butter). Pancakes themselves were fluffy, moist, and big!) Service was great - friendly, attentive, and smiling! Loved the table side maple syrup. Loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. Everyone, guests and servers, seemed to be enjoying themselves completely!
AWESOME brunch. Mimosas were a decent mix in a good sized wine glass. I had the crab omelette which was very well done. Best part of the meal was the breakfast potatoes and fried angel hair pasta.

I went here for dinner while on vacation. The place was pretty much empty, which we should have taken as a sign, but it was only 5:00 so we figured we were just there at a slow time. The staff was very friendly, the service was efficient, and there was a great view, but the food was just awful. I had the rib eye and my husband had the linguine clams, and there was simply no flavor to anything at all. Our bill totaled over $100 (we also got an appetizer and a few drinks), which was completely ridiculous for the quality of the meal we received. I would not recommend this place and I would never go back.
Tough service at the bar. These guys should take a happy pill. They are serving tourists. You'd think they'd want to send people home with a great experience. Apparently not!!
To cap off our wonderful day spent sight seeing in San Francisco, we finished at Pier 39 to settle out of the cold sea air, and into some nice warm Clam Chowder Sourdough Bread Bowls!
Just what the doctor ordered.  Dropped in before our boat to our for a quick bite and some drinks.

My wife and I were in town the third week of August and were craving oysters. Made a serious error by stumbling into this tourist dive. They brought us the sorriest looking dozen oysters that we've ever laid eyes on. None were larger than a nickel and were shriveled. The guy next to us shook his head in disbelief and sent us to Hog Island down the road. Way better and with a great view.

Had lunch here today. Had a great meal and a great view. Crab salad sandwich was amazing and my husband had the famous fish sandwich which was also delicious. tip- oysters are pretty small. And don't sit by door on a chilly day.
I never bothered to eat here for Lunch of Dinner ,

Had an excellent lunch. Triple decker blt, dozen oysters, and a long island. All were great. Although it is clearly a tourist location with tourist prices it is clearly a gem. The drinks were great, mom ordered a mudslide and it was just awesome. Wish I had enough room left to order one for myself. I give four stars for the service and the food. My only criticism is the shucking, a little more experience or gentleness is required,  no one likes pieces of shells.
This review is mostly for the service--specifically regarding the waiter named Rodolfo.
great food, will return for breakfast again when I'm near the area.

We will definitely go back. Pleasantly surprised.  Great eggs Benedict, very good coffee, great omelettes. Plus, we liked the Old SF atmosphere inside.  It's light and bright.  This is not what we expected on Fisherman's wharf, so it was a nice surprise.
Good fish and chips but the crab salad sandwich lacked some flavor. Service was good and food came fast even on busy day.
Very friendly staff.  We did have to wait quite a while, but hey,,,, it's Pier 39 and there's like 10,000 people here!
The food is delicious and the outdoor seating has a beautiful view of the pier! Our server, Stacey, was attentive and very friendly!

Went to Eagle Cafe with my significant other yesterday and had the half steamed crab. It was divine! Let me be frank, the food was great. Now let me be honest: in my opinion crab is pretty hard to not make great, so let me tell you about what makes them such a great place to be.

Recommend this place! Was looking for a place that was quiet, oppose to a place like Chowders (since I was on a mission to find my mom a place with great clam chowder) at Pier 39 on a busy Sunday afternoon and I found this place to be just that. Casual and chill. Great service and nice atmosphere. I recommend their lobster bisque and fish & chips.

Good Food, typical tourist area. service was fine and attentive. fish and chips, clam chowder very good, portions plenty. even cheeseburgers for grand kids were huge. all in all good and would return. very crowded on a Sunday.
Since they were busy they asked us if our party of 5 would consider the tables adjacent to the restrooms. No problem we said.
How is it possible that I have never reviewed the Eagle Cafe?  I've been a fan for years--since I first visited San Francisco in 1985 and had my first Potatoes O'Brien...I can still smell it...

Whenever I visit Pier 39, this is usually the first stop.  It is definitely recommended to get a Lychee mojito.  The only place I have been to that uses actual lychee when they muttle the mint.  Another drink to try is a Wisconsin Lunchbox, which miller lite with a splash of orange juice, and a shot of amaretto topped off with southern comfort.  You drop the shot into the glass and chug away.

Always a favorite and a must stop when I visit San Francisco. The corned beef hash is homemade with a crisp texture. The blueberry pancakes were a huge portion and did not disappoint.  Service was prompt and friendly. Our coffee cups were never empty.

A cafe at the opening of one of the country's most visited tourist attractions wasn't a place I expected to find great food, so we were delightfully surprised to find that each plate we ordered was better than the one before.
The crab eggs benedict was honestly the best I ever had.  My husband had the crab omelet and my daughter the chocolate chip pancakes,  all were amazing and the service was even better.

Back again. SF PRIDE weekend was fun, but I needed to get away from the close to naked partiers and relax with a cold beer. The Eagle popped into mind, took an Uber and here I am. The bartender was friendly and attentive making sure to check if I needed more beer before it was empty. So glad I sat at the bar, because their raw bar is awesome and fresh with a great variety of oysters, fresh shucked. I had to order some oysters. How could I not? The Eagle serves it with fresh grated horseradish!!! If you have not tried fresh horseradish, do! First sweet, then that in your nose kick. I will definitely have to try the Bloody Mary, as highly recommended by other Yelpers :)

Taking a break from The Exploratorium, my family and I decided to walk towards Pier 39 to enjoy a meal together. We stopped by Hard Rock however, the wait was about 20 minutes so I did what every impatient person does: improvise!
First time here. Food was great. Service sucked. After being seated, waited literally 20 mins for service. Practically every waiter was standing around watching the game... They weren't even busy.

Just gotta love this place - fresh seafood and good drinks in a laid-back atmosphere that doesn't pretend to be upscale like many of the places surrounding it.  You'll forget you are in a major tourist spot and feel like you're eating at a local SF place.

We came here for dinner on a weekend. It was really busy so we were ok with the bar seating. We had grilled maahi maahi, grilled salmon and pasta. The service was strictly ok. The food quality was really good. The salmon was definitely a fresh catch, grilled very well with spices. Same goes for the mahi mahi. Each costed around $25.
Arrived at the Eagle Cafe for a quick drink after a long day of walking with the hope of having a good experience. I have never been so angry to spend money anywhere!!

I had the tofu dessert to go. It's okay, the tofu was not as silky as it should be. It's also relatively pricey, I think 4.50 for an order. I get that SF is a touristy place, but I could easily get double the amount at the same price in Chinatown in Philadelphia or New York.
Meh.

Not what I expected.  Thought the chocolate and the strawberry soufflés would be good, but they're not.  They looked very tasty and delicious, but was too sweet.  The sauce that came with the soufflé taste so much better.

Soufflés Cafe looks like your grandma's dining room. They have cute 50's décor, cute tea cups on the tables and such, cutesy overall. My sole purpose of going here was trying durian in some shape or form. I will get to the durian later. Our Server was nice, she did ask us if we had any coupons if we intended on using, I think you have to call ahead if you do, we did not have any coupons. We got the key lime soufflé and the green tea soufflé and some white tea. The soufflés are pretty awesome. I could see myself coming here for a post dinner dessert or for an afternoon tea with some girlfriends.

Never again! Went there and literally 2 people were eating in the restaurant and the rest of the tables had 'reserved' signs on them. We asked if we could sit and they said no because we didn't make reservations. As we browsed the menu, while standing in the corner, other people walked in off the street without a reservation and were gladly offered tables. We were told to come back in an hour for our food and when we did, all of the previous tables were still empty. Very upsetting. Souffles and smoothies were average at best. Completely disgusted with this place.

We went to Souffle Cafe at 7:30pm on a Saturday night and were pleasantly surprised that there was no wait. Note: we had a Living Social coupon and these require advanced reservations. No walk-ins. We had made reservations for 7pm but were running late and conveniently able to change the time to 7:30pm.
We ordered desserts to go - 1) mango pudding and 2) mango, pomelo and sago
Been coming here for a couple times now. Their food and service is ok. I don't like their water though! It tastes so weird..ask for hot water -it tastes better.

i think it is okay. they remodeled the whole place and turned it into a "high tea" place. they serve both chinese hong kong style food, souffle, and afternoon tea. it is kind of confuse i think. their food is okay but not like wow. price is okay, but the aftertea set is way too expensive i think. hard to find parking plus CASH ONLY.
I wouldn't bother coming here :(

OMG love love love. After years of saying, "I need to try this place," I finally tried it! My experience was just divine. Very small place. Victorian tea time feel. The decor and tableware were very elegant. Check in for free scoop of ice cream with $15 purchase. Also, from 3pm-7pm, 6 piece California rolls for $2.99.
This place is okay. Service is good for being in Chinatown

I'm a fan of this place. When I heard I could get a souffle late at night in sf and not be at a fine dining establishment ... I was suspicious. Well ironically after going to the gym, I convinced my friends to come and try this place out. Turns out the souffles weren't the whole story. You can also get food too.   Chicken wings, mussels, instant ramen and spam. Totally great for being one of the few places open past midnight. So far I have had the cinnamon vanilla, chocolate, coffee and strawberry (uses syrup but it's still good) souffles. I have tried the green tea and the durian ones, but found them not to be my thing. I had a taste of the almond souffle too and it tasted pretty good as well. Each souffle is roughly 10 bucks and takes 30 minutes and comes with a little bit of condensed milk. Pro tip, order ahead, or if you forget to do that, grab some snacks to hold you over while your puffed pastry dessert bakes in the oven behind the counter. The decor is sort of cheesy and yes it's no michelin star establishment but again, it's open late, decent price and tastes great :)
I am embarrassed to write this review because we only come here for late night desserts and food. I haven't tried most of the food because my friends and I always tend to order the same things.
This place boasts some of the most randomly eclectic (bizarre) decor I've seen in a restaurant in a long while.
I would like to think my horrible experience isn't a norm for this establishment.  Or any other for that matter.

Went here because my ex had a special one from groupon I think. Passed by there before but never tried it until then. Was an eat in special only. When we walked in the door there was a very pungent odor of some kind..what kind idk!! But a foul stank super strong one. My nose is uber sensitive & I couldn't stand it! It truly affected my dining experience. The food was good & the soufflé was divine perfection. Service eh they didn't seem to like black people or want our patronage.  I would go back just for the soufflé but I usually grab take out & due to the preparation process they require dine in only for orders of soufflé. Sucks cuz they were bomb delish!
Totally in love with this place!
I watch a lot of Hell's Kitchen and I know that soufflés are really hard to make and to find out that there's a soufflés restaurant so close to my work is awesome!! I had to try this place out!!
Souffles at 1am? Sure!

So so. I recommend getting ice cream with whatever sweet soufflé you get and if you really decide to go here for some reason or another, order and then walk around for a bit. Also the table mats and chairs seemed repulsive. I think it is the fact that I know they can't clean them easy and therefore don't.  Who knows...

Idk whats the hype about this place...like seriously. All my friends is raving how good their souffle is but to tell you the truth its okay, its not all that. Once the waitress delivers your souffle, you better take a good picture because, that souffle is going to sink right in the middle -__-  The reason why I gave it a two star is because this place is super cute (girly cute) It's perfect for a date.

I went here with my friends on 7-31-14 9:45pm'sh.  I only ordered a hong kong style milk tea for $2.95, since I wasn't that hungry after dinner.  Service is courteous, but definitely enjoyed hanging out and joking with my friends.
hong kong souffles!!!!!!! it took forever but whatever where else can you find a tin hau style souffle shop in the u s of a?!?!?!

From the outside, this place looks a little bit scary. Maybe it was because we got there at 9PM, but I was surprised to find a cute little HK-style dessert place here. Anyway, we got in and the cafe was pretty empty. We didn't have enough time to order souffles (30-45 minute wait). Instead, I had the mango pudding with coconut milk sticky rice and a scoop of mango ice cream. I really enjoyed my dessert! You can't really go wrong with coconut milk + mangoes + sticky rice. Service was quick and efficient.
The strawberry souffle looks amazing but not as good as it looks.  I still think the chocolate one is the best. It is good a la mode!

My first impression of the place, wow, reminds me of grandma's house but...smaller. It's really cramped and the decor is unnecessary. I suppose they wanted to keep an appearance of a refined British tea shop or something but dang, those dolls in the cabinets weird me out. Are the locks there to keep us out or to keep them in??? Back to the important stuff. We ordered a durian souffle. I love fresh durian but I wasn't sure what to expect. The waitress took our order and within 25 mins we got dessert. They have a sign that states souffles take up to 45 mins. It was definitely not peak hour though,  with only one other table occupied. I was pleasantly surprised with the dish. The souffle was delicious. It was quite light and airy, sprinkled with powered sugar. Not sure about their other flavors but they sound interesting.

The souffles are full of flavors, some are quite unique such as the red bean, and the black sesame, all are great, but it takes about 45 mins. after ordering, so make the order then walk around towen.
5stars for su-flei su-flei souffles lol
we waited 25-30 mins for a ham and egg sandwich, it took 45 mins for the souffles to come out.

I got the strawberry soufflé and my husband got white chocolate. AMAZING!!! The wait was so worth it and not any longer than another restaurant where they ask you to order soufflés at the start of your meal. Not that many employees working there, but they were nice and attentive! If you're just coming for desert and don't want to wait, they said that you can call ahead with your order.

We ordered the strawberry and chocolate souffles, and they were amazing. They looked fantastic, and tasted as good as they looked. The chocolate souffle had a pretty great presentation too, as the chocolate sauce poured on top spilled over the side of the souffle as he set it on the table. It was an amazing, if unintended, effect. And though I'm allergic to strawberries, my partner said that the strawberries on the strawberry souffle were definitely fresh. He also told me that the souffle itself had good strawberry flavor, not just from the ones on top.

The soufflés are AMAZING!!  Cooked perfectly and definitely worth the wait.  Bring a book or a friend because they really do take 45 minutes (like they do at ANY restaurant unless the laws of physics do not apply in said restaurant). The tea is really good as well and the girl that served us was very attentive.

Gd forbid you really have to pee...Don't use the bathroom first. They will make you order something first. The trapped my husband in the corner and secured an order before they allowed him to use the restroom. Wow.

Terrible, worst restaurant ever! Don't waste your time and money! They totally messed up my San Francisco trip. They do not have service AT ALL. I could even hear what they gossip about the customers (including me) in the kitchen. They will beg you not to blame because they will get punished if we complain LOL ridiculous!! They will STILL charge you even if you just had one bite of the dish after your complain. They will not appreciate. So complain or not? You decide. Environment is old, the dishes look old and dirty. Do not torture your sense of taste if you are looking for tasty food like me. They will definitely disappoint you.
I got a living social deal. You need a reservation.  Otherwise this is the best souffle place. I have decided this will be one of my to - go dessert places. Thank you for the deal on living social.
a bit overpriced..

Ordered a durian soufflé, first experience with soufflé. It was exceptionally tasty! I'd recommend trying this place out but their service is...actually, can't say there is any. They take your order 15 minutes later, have the chefs make it, and brings it back. You will never see the server again until you pay. The worst part, an 18% gratuity was added to parties of 6 or more. I do not think you deserve 18% tips if you don't even have the courtesy to check on us. And it's cash only. Come here only if you don't mind having no service!
If I could give this place 0 stars I would!

Yep, so I was like one of you and was browsing through the pictures and decided to come by with my friend.  The layout of the desserts are really pretty, but there are signs all around that says "Souffles take at least 20 minutes".. My friend and I were smart, we got one and shared it.  We were glad that we shared it, because we didnt want to wait over an hour for something too sweet.  We got the strawberry souffle. It was indeed really pretty, but WAY WAY WAY too sweet. The place is on the corner, but really needs remodeling done, it just doesnt look that pretty from the outside for a pretty dessert place like this.

Everything was way overpriced. French onion soup (single portion) was $15. Was it the best french onion soup I've ever had, yes; but I don't think it's $15 dollars good. Another example is a can of coke. Yes, there is a mark up at any restaurant so go ahead and charge $2 or even $3 but no, they charge $5 here.  Souffles are not as common so price point is hard to gauge. We had a mushroom and leek savory souffle for $35 (portion for two). It tasted like an omelet. For dessert we had the strawberry souffle for $40 (portion for two). It came undercooked so it was still watery in the center. We didn't say anything since it took over an hour to come out, we didn't want them to make another one and for us to wait another hour. The flavor however was great. I would come back for dessert if I had over an hour to spare.

This is our favorite restaurant in SF.  Their french onion soup is so good, other soups are jealous!  The souffles are amazing, we always order both an entree and dessert souffle, yum!  Service was excellent as well.  Our last visit was on a Wednesday night, early, with a reservation and the restaurant was not busy at all.  We parked our car in the Union Square parking garage and took a cab from the Westin, much easier than trying to find a parking spot in North Beach.  It is expensive, and worth every dollar.  Bravo, Jacqueline!

For the quality of the food, it's totally worth a try. We had butter lettuce salad as a starter, the mushroom and prosciutto soufflé and the chocolate soufflé. So full already after the main dish but I'm glad we did try the dessert. The sweetest of the chocolate was just right - not too sweet but very rich.

My wife and I dined here on our wedding night and the wait staff and Jacqueline were just wonderful.  Everything from the onion soup and the endive salad to the chocolate soufflé were excellent.  It's a one of a kind experience, but be prepared for long wait times as Jacqueline does it all herself, but it's well worth it.

Parisian, shabby chic, romantic and intimate. Just a few words I would choose to describe this cafe that brings you straight back to Paris... Until you step outside and see the steep streets of San Francisco and you snap back to reality.
Cafe Jacqueline holds a sentimental place because my husband proposed there.
Would you like to eat an amazing souffle?  Follow these simple steps:
It was my first time, and I Came here with a group of friends on a business meeting. Everything thing taste soooo delicious. My favorite is the crab soulflle. Service was amazing. Everything
Amazing!  Make sure to make a reservation. Salads are very simple. I've been there 5 times and I've never been disappointed.

One word for this place ! Rude service!  Wanted to get dessert only and a waiter told us it will take an hour and fifteen minutes although they were open tables. Of course all this happened outside the restaurant with the door almost closed with a table so we never went inside. Recommendation: Make reservation and go early!
This has been my favorite restaurant in SF since before Yelp.  Last month I got to visit again and it is as good as I remember it.

It is a great restaurant!!  It has original wood floors, original decor and beadboard but a simple style . They serve beer and wine-- no mixed drinks,  Scott was a great waiter, snarky and snide but all in good fun.  The asparagus soufflé was absolutely delicious!! Then the grand marnier soufflé was also divine.  Food as art- art as food....

This is not a comment on the food, which is wonderful.  It is a comment on the deplorable customer service attitude of one of the Cafe employees.  I left a phone message as instructed during restaurant working hours to try to make a reservation at the restaurant for the following evening.  I did not hear back until 4:30 pm the next afternoon, just hours before the requested reservation time (no table was available).  Not knowing the status of my request until just hours before the requested dinner time was frustrating.  The man who called me told me that they were too busy to listen to their phone messages.  When I commented that I thought it was poor business practice to ignore reservation requests, he said "Thanks for the tip!" and hung up on me.  Wow!

When my cousin took me here for the first time, I thought it was pretty ridiculous to take us to try a $40 soufflé. However, splitting it between the four of us was not bad at all. We knew it would be a long wait but I'm all open to try good food. We ordered the white chocolate soufflé and omg it was sooo good. Best soufflé I've ever had. The batter wasn't too sweet, perfect consistency, and the white chocolate complimented it very well. To me, it was worth $40.

We came here for my birthday, as i had heard good things and since we live in the hood.  We really enjoyed our meal.  We shared the French onion soup and a salad.  They were both fantastic.  Then came the gruyere soufflé and later the chocolate soufflé.  The meal was perfect!  At the end of the meal, we were gushing to our waiter who told us to go in the back and tell Jacqueline herself, so we did.  She was so gracious...and adorable.

My wife and I have been meaning to go to Cafe Jacqueline for a little while now and we finally got round to it last night. The first thing I would say about it is that in San Francisco, it is about as unique a restaurant as the city can offer. I can't think of any other restaurant that specializes in just souffles and has been doing so for 35 years.

There are few things better than sex.  Jacqueline's soufflé is a religious experience that transcends words.  If you are a human being that enjoys extraordinary food, make a reservation and go to Cafe Jacqueline.

Went here after reading all the reviews. It is as good as everyone says. The French onion soup is awesome. They were out of the seafood soufflé:( but we got the prosciutto and mushroom and it was really good. So fluffy and airy. The chocolate soufflé is what heaven must taste like, goes great with a nice bottle of French Pinot noir.

I've been visiting Jacqueline for over 30 years. She is wonderful and dinning here in itself is a very special occasionl. The soufflés are stellar and the atmosphere is warm.  A real San Francisco experience not to be missed.
I had been wanting to go and eat here for a long time. (Since I saw it mentioned as the best egg dish he ever ate by Alton Brown on food network).
Made a reservation and was super excited to share a souffle with my boyfriend, but in the end the meal left much to be desired.

I absolutely love this place! Make sure you go with someone who you could have a long conversation with because the soufflés take time to make. I would allow at least three hours for dinner! We ordered the French onion soup, white corn ginger garlic soufflé, chocolate soufflé, and strawberry soufflé. Overall it's pretty pricey, but you are getting such great quality of food and a very special evening. I highly recommend taking a trip to the bathroom so you can walk through the kitchen and say hello to the chef! You can see the huge bowl of eggs she uses to make all of the soufflés too. Also, before you eat there you should check out her segment on the Food Network on Alton Brown's Best Thing I Ever Ate.

My daughter wanted to visit this place for 5 years.  I had no idea what to expect and I was as pleased with the meal as I could possibly be.  The wait staff were excellent.  The food was spectacular.  I am so happy we were able to share a lovely meal at Cafe Jacqueline!  I have since recommended this restaurant to at least 6 friends.

My bff took me here for my birthday last year as a surprise after I had been talking about this place for years. Honestly I didn't know what to expect because it was in an interesting part of town (not bad, just interesting), and the place looked small and intimate but nothing like what others had described.
I FINALLY came here after having it bookmarked for years. It's probably been sitting in my Yelp bookmarks for a whole decade.

Haven't been there in years, so feel free to discount this review in its entirety. But for what it's worth, this souffle dinner & dessert was the most incredible meal I ever ate in San Francisco - and I'd go back there in a heartbeat. Plan to share your souffles so you can try as much as you can.

This place is very "old-french sheik". Its not a place you go by yourself. Friends/family is a must. Sharing dishes is a must if you're into that. They have good food here. Beware its not typical american-french food. Its soufflés galore. This last week was my 3rd time here and it is expensive for sure but you get what you pay for. Keep in mind....#1--you're in sf......#2--your'e in a very french restaurant...and #3--service can be charming to add to the experience. I know it can get busy with reservations especially on friday or saturday night so if its hectic, your server might not be in the best mood. I guess I'm tolerable of that having worked in customer service for 15 years myself. So if you're patient, the wait staff will warm up to you. Its a special occasion place for sure which is why we only come when our family from Taiwan request to come here.
Such a great place.  Delicious food and an attentive wait staff.  Great location in North Beach and Jacqueline is charming.  I can't wait to go back.

Just finished eating dinner here and it was delicious! I went with my daughter and we ordered the onion soup, shiitake spinach and basil soufflé for dinner and the chocolate one for dessert. A lot of food so we brought home leftovers and plan to eat them for breakfast tomorrow. The waiters were all attentive and very friendly - great service. A bit pricey but definitely worth it!
Ho
SERVICE- ***

The soufflé restaurant.  The uber romantic restaurant.  And contrary to the location, the miraculously very quiet restaurant. Once you step inside, there is no evidence that you're on Grant Ave. btwn Green & Union.  Amazing.  Intimate as all get out.  Candlelit, fresh roses, the whole nine yards.  Gentlemen, this is your destination when you want to romance your lady.  The deets...

Omg so good!  You have entered Souffle heaven!  Jacqueline is always in the kitchen. She makes everything herself. Food can take a while, but definitely worth the wait.   Great wine list and attentive staff.  Highly recommend!!!

The soufflé, it is all about the soufflé . The wonderful chef in the kitchen is strait from France and is so charming. She makes magic withe the flavors of the season. The savory soufflé is rich and wonderful while the sweet is tasty and like flavored air. Yum!
Oh My God!!!!

We really enjoyed Cafe Jacqueline. We loved eating leisurely like you would do in France. After eating and sharing the endives with roquefort and onion soup (gruyere was wonderful and glad they used it instead of swiss cheese) with my husband, I wasn't sure I could eat the souffle. You get one souffle for two and that was good. We had mushroom and prosciutto souffle and it was delicious. It was nice to digest the  salad and soup first. So, when the main dish souffle came, we were able to eat again. We had the chocolate souffle for dessert and I'm glad it took its time. It was the size as the main course. I thought I could only eat part of it but we both scoffed it up and nothing was left. It was so light. I loved that we were not rushed to eat. We were able to savor each bite of our dinner. If you plan to go, plan only for this dinner. This is a "NO RUSH" restaurant.  We were at the restaurant for two hours and we could have stayed a little longer if we had more coffee.

I am really confused where to start overall experiences was awesome . It's like life time remembers meals what I had there soufflé . If had enough time only u can go service was top notch. I really looking forward to go there .

Soufflés were unique and delicious. Tried the crab, mushroom/basil/garlic and black diamond truffle for savory, as well as strawberry and grand marnier for sweet. French onion soup was also authentic. Each soufflé can easily feed 3-4 people. 6 of is split all of these... Lots of good, but no leftovers!
Now that I've finally tried Cafe Jacqueline, I can't wait to come back and try more of the savory souffles.
A return visit.

Just ordered a pizza to the bar that I was at. Arrived 30 minutes late -- par for the course with these guys -- and when I made it outside to sign for it, the driver insisted I give him my card. As I had explained to the manager who took my order, said card was open behind the (extraordinarily busy) bar and thus it was not physically in my pocket. Not a problem, he said, I'd just have to sign.

I had such a pleasant experience here!!! I love the atmosphere, food and staff. The cashier took my order with care, walked my food out and helped me box it for home. From start to finish it was great. I really recommend this joint if you're in this area (:

GREAT DELIVERY SERVICE! I was attracted to the $10 delivery minimum... Food got here in under an hour and it was still hot. I ordered the eggplant parmagiana and meat toasted ravioli which they gave me in a cake box... Interesting but when I opened the box everything was nice packaged. They even gave me napkins, fork and knife, crushed red peppers and Parmesan cheese, and 3 slices of French bread with butter. VERY impressed with the level of effort.

The service here really sucked. I had to keep getting my waiter's attention because he was texting the whole time. My wife and I ordered pasta, which comes with bread, and I ordered an extra garden salad. The salad was literally iceberg lettuce that was still wet and sliced carrots and cabbage on top. It just looked like they threw it on a plate. I had to remind the waiter about our bread. I got the spaghetti and clams and it looked and tasted like they put 2 cans of baby clams in it. There wasn't much flavor. The most disappointing this is the service. It was just really annoying to have to be the person to wave the waiter down.
We were staying at a hotel in downtown San Francisco, and they were kind enough to deliver.

My mom and aunt have been coming here for years (back when it was across the street) and have taken me here quite a few times. Best. Pizza. Ever. Great prices and good service. Only criticism is that they don't carry the Antipasti salad anymore :(
If you know how to SPELL pizza, you need to go here. Seriously! I have been going here for 15 years; nothing beats it.

This place is the room service option if you want lunch or dinner while staying at the Tuscan. We ordered cheese and zucchini sticks, pesto ravioli, side salads and I wanted a cheese ravioli with 1/2 red and 1/2 white sauce. They wouldn't do that. I asked for the ravioli to come with no sauce then and give me the two on the side. They wouldn't do that either for quite a awhile then decided they would and charges me extra to do it. The food arrived an hour later, the pesto was good, the salads your typical boring side salad, and my ravioli all covered in red sauce. So much for paying for each so I could make it a 1/2 and 1/2. They eyre good but not great. Cheese and zucchini sticks awful and soggy.
Food 5- stars!

Ordered for delivery. Waited two hours!!! Pizza never came. Called to cancel and get a refund. Did not get an apology and the bitch had the nerve to ask if I wanted to wait. I am starving and already waited for two fu@kn hours! I even called them after an hour of waiting and they said they'll call me back. Nope. No call back.
We were staying around the corner from here last week and stopped in a few times to grab some slices.  This is what pizza should taste like omg so good compared to the chains back home.
Good pizza and fast delivery on a week night.
If you would like a cold pizza delivered 2 hours after order and a pain to get a refund... Order from here!

Ate here for dinner yesterday (8/24). I wanted pasta and ordered the ravioli. On the menu it did not specify whether the ravioli was meat or cheese, so I assumed it would be cheese since it's like that at most Italian restaurants. When my ravioli came out it was meat. They took the meal back but with some hesitation. The pizza we ordered instead was amazing! Unfortunately, they do not have a kids menu. As a  suggestion from our waitress, we ordered a full size pasta dish and divided into two plates for our kids. That worked just fine.

We loved this pizza. Flavorful and thick crust pizza with rich toppings falling off, and excellent service. Authentic spot with the attitude to prove it!  A medium pizza filled 3 of us up with 2 slices to go - don't overlook North Beach Pizza for Tonys (which had a 3 hour wait!)!
Great tasting pizza, but promised 1 hour for delivery and it took over 2 hours. WOW, should I go again or not??

I used to order from the Grant and Union location, but the other day I saw one of their drivers completely blocking a nearby alley, and the driver was screaming obscenities at a woman who lives in the alley who was asking him to move his car so that she could get out. She told me that they've had an ongoing problem with the drivers blocking their alley, and the drivers have gone from surly to rude to now downright aggressive. So, in solidarity, I'm going to stop ordering from them. It's sad when a neighborhood institution becomes a neighborhood nuisance.
Ok it's really 4,5 stars ... but it sure as hell is not 3 stars.
The pizza here is boss.  It's all I've eaten here.  Better to get a whole one than slice usually. Love it though.
WOW! Even though I didn't get the chance to eat the pizza straight out of the oven. The pizza was amazing! My girlfriend wasn't lying when she said this was the best pizza she ever had!
Pizza & eggplant parmigiana were excellent. Pinot Grigio was good. Service was average. Parking sucks.
I wasn't impressed with pizza. It was soggy and running in the middle.
=/ I wasn't impressed, pizza was ok but service and drinks could have been better for the price.
Ok for some reason it's not cool to say your favorite pizza in SF is North Beach if you live in SF.  You have to say Tony's, Golden Boy, Za, blah blah blah.
Good stop for a slice!

Came here one day with some friends for lunch a month ago. We were immediately in a sunny afternoon. I believe we ordered one North Beach Special and one with half Golden Gate Special and Cable Car Special. In around 15 minutes or so later, the pizzas came. It was very fresh and hot but the Golden Gate one tasted kind of salty for some reason. My friends tasted the same thing so it wasn't just me. The North Beach one tasted fine though. It was an alright experience, nothing too excited about. The waitress was kind enough to offer refills on water without us flagging her. Definitely a solid pizza place but I think there's others that can rival their quality.

INCREDIBLY good pizza. A little greasy, but that's what made it good :). I had the Coit Tower Special. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in SF. Slow service, but to be fair, there was only one waitress and they were SUPER busy. Definitely recommend.
Definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had. Had a pizza with a creamy garlic sauce on the bottom instead of tomato sauce. Stunning.

I would give zero stars if that's possible. I have never written a review to date, and also have never had such terrible pizza in my entire existence. Really wishing I walked to the corner store, bought a digorno, and saved myself an hour at least 20 dollars. This bread was flavorless, cold, chewy, slice was sauceless and the sausage was dried out and cold. The minestrone soup was basically chicken broth and veggies, no noodles and no flavor. I have never been more disappointed with a delivered meal in my entire life. Asked for the pizza cooked "crispy" like they mention on their site, little did I know that would mean burnt and carcinogenic tasting. Still hungry and now out 30 bucks.
So great!!! love their pizza. Love that you can get a slice or a whole pizza and they deliver!  They were always fast even when it gets super busy.

North Beach pizza used to be so good, not anymore. I popped in for a slice, ordered the white cheese pesto. I asked the girl behind the counter what was in it, and she said pesto, that's it. Well it was terrible, no pesto, no cheese, only some cream sauce and spinach. But what was so gross was the girl had a cold, wiped her nose, then was wiping down the counter with some dirty rag, taking money and handling the food. The only time a glove came on was when she took something hot from the oven. The guy in the back was opening packages of salami, putting it out also no gloves, and doing other tasks as well. Maybe they need a visit from the dept of health...
If you want great pizza made fresh this place is a must. We had the North Beach Special and it didn't disappoint. Great place to sit in the window with a glass of wine and enjoy great pizza.

Just ok pizza. We tried to get into a couple of other places nearby but the wait was too darn long. No wait here should have been our first clue. Waitress was NOT good and pizza was just average. There are better places out there and I would venture elsewhere if I could do it over again! Not all that good.

Is it possible that this place has gotten worse with time? I think the owners have changed. Regular slice is too thick. I'm looking at it now and it's about 1/2"! Ordered the wings and it was Costco brand. How do I know? I just bought some a few weeks ago. Frozen and microwaved. Soggy and disgusting. Disappointed. After being a customer since I was a kid, I have to say good bye to them.
