Ordered at 11AM - took over 2 hours to get delivered.  When I called to check (3 different times), each time the driver was 'around the block'.  Pizza arrived cold, no apologies, no one cared AT ALL.  Don't order from here if you're actually hungry,
Online ordering/delivery service definitely needs improvement.
Hey North Beach Pizza, WHAT HAPPENED. You used to be great. Now you SUCK.
This is the first time I have order a salad from this place. We'll let me tell you, it is nasty!

I've been a customer of and have ordered delivery from North Beach Pizza on multiple occasions.  I have to say that this time in particular was a MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT and FAILURE.  The order took SEVENTY-FIVE MINUTES (75!) to arrive, and when it did FINALLY arrive, the pizza was COLD, SOGGY, and SPONGY.  I ordered a side of wings.  They were atrocious: RUBBERY, COLD, and BLAND.  The breading was virtually non-existent; wings are supposed to be CRISP and HOT.  These were neither.  I won't be ordering from North Beach Pizza based upon this LOATHSOME experience.

I don't know why I keep doing this to myself. I stopped ordering on-line from NB Pizza because they kept screwing up my order. I successfully ordered a few times through a 3rd party service (Seamless). For some reason I still liked their food, it's just not worth dealing with them anymore.
A Potato/ fries shop where instead of frying they back the potato. The brand is vegan and organic friendly.
I'm hooked. Potatoes, sauce, soup, ice cream--and the owners--are awesome. If you haven't gone...you should.
Very friendly AND amazing vegan Ice cream :) if I lived in San Francisco I would totally come here more often ! :) must try the swirl
I give this restaurant 5 stars because the food is great, the service is fast, the people are friendly and most importantly because it's great to find a healthy place to eat I'm fisherman's wharf.
I'm completely sold on this idea. Who would have thought such a concept with do so well?
Omg!  So good and good for you. You will never of potatoes the same again. Great environment and great food/service. Who could ask for better? Looking forward to going again.

This locally owned organic Baked Potato-Fries company defiinitely thrives on its creative approach towards organic sustainability. 3 Potato 4 supplies a potato super food in an eco-responsible and sustainable fashion that re-introduces the potato for its merits as an anti-oxidant and mega-doser of vitamin-A!  All this, accompanied by unique dipping sauces and a fun, 1950's Sci-Fi atmosphere make each visit an adventure.

French fries are perhaps my favorite food, much to my husband's dismay. But these fries are different and even he approved. They're truly organic and baked, leaving the nutrients in the potatoes. And best of all, they're delicious!! I had the potato wedges and sampled a number of sauces and salts. I liked the garlic pepper mayo sauce and the Hawaiian salts.

Great little place! Perfect customer service; quick and courteous! Good price, healthy choices and filling! Perfect for a quick meal on the go. I took it back to my hotel room and it was hot and tasted scrumptious!
Dairy free ice cream in a gluten-free cone, not what I would choose, but perfect for my wife who hasn't been able to enjoy such a simple pleasure in a long time.

Ran into this tiny food place and tried their potato chips and it was awesome so tender and tasty. Price was on higher end but they serve organic food so that justified the price. Will be coming back in future to try out other stuff in their menu.

Absolutely awful! We are so disappointed that we wasted a meal in San Francisco at this restaurant. The service was slow and the waitress was very rude. She did not apologize but instead laughed when we reminded her that one of the drinks that was ordered well before the appetizers (which we had already finished) had still not arrived. She did not ask if we wanted another round of drinks or how our meals were. My sister's pasta was over cooked. The crab ravioli was so incredibly salty that it was nearly inedible. When we finally waved down a waiter to let him know how bad it was he gave us $3 off the $23 meal. He said they tasted it and agreed that it was on the salty side (which a rediculous understatement) but said we should have told someone earlier. We had already all tasted it which basically consumed half of the extremely small portion size. Out of the the 7 meals and two appetizers that were ordered by our party, we could say the one appetizer (the calamari) was the only good dish.
No bottomless mimosas as still advertised on their website and if you want a mimosa, small one will cost $10
all the crew is great, and the food magnifique Sergio is a good Supervisor and Eddy make great Palomas

Terrible service, and there was a flea on my food. We sat around and waited for them to bring our bill for almost 10 minutes. Never asked if we wanted refills, and they weren't even busy. Not worth it.

My first trip back since I moved out of state, I was looking forward to the mac n cheese after a devastating Giants loss to the Dodgers. My party ordered some olives drinks, and a pizza, as we were told they no longer served my beloved mac n cheese. We ate the scorching hot olives and then got our bill...without the pizza. It was forgotten, and we were the ONLY people there. I'll cut them a little slack since it was nearing closing time and maybe the pizza was "forgotten" on purpose. It is no longer on my "must visit when I'm back in The City" list.
If you're staying at the Best Western, you can't beat this location for a breakfast, but the service is anything but quick.

As locals in the neighborhood,  Pescatore is not bad for a hotel restaurant.  Tourist places can often be "one-fers" meaning a place does not have to care about repeat business because their location alone gives then enough revenue.  Pescatore does better than that.
After a long day walking around town nothing sounded better than a hearty Italian meal. This place certainly delivered!  Best crab cakes I've ever had and the pasta was top notch!

I feel like the food portion should be bigger for the price. I ordered the crab ravioli, the menu didn't include a lot of the things that were on the dish and I found out it was pickled (ew). The staff was pretty courteous and was in a convenient location for us.

I had family visiting from out of town and I am glad they picked this place for all to eat.   Food was tasty and fresh.   Pizza/ bread/ Spaghetti/.... Everything was good.   I would go again.    Thanks.
Loved the capello pomodoro! Very nice ambiance! Service is excellent!  They have a nighly special, like Salmon tonight.  Recommend it.

I stayed in the hotel connected to the restaurant so it was just a little walk to dinner. The hostess is very welcoming and they have quite a lot of staff. The service was pretty fast, and the food overall was excellent. I would come here again, even if the atmosphere is particularly loud.

Slow wait staff at first but very pleasant. They got more attentive as meal progressed.  Food was very good. banana pancakes were best ever. veggie frit at a was good. pains were delicious.  overall a very good experience.
First me we went it was ok. The service was slow, but I believe that's because the got very busy all of the sudden ad were short staffed.
Returning natives.

Very pleasantly surprised. I was alittle frightened by the so-so reviews I read,  but I can honestly say we enjoyed our lunch. The bread and olive oil were very good and my green smoothie was great. (Pricey though). We both had the tomato polenta soup which was very tasty. I had the veggie panini and throughly enjoyed it. My hubby had the chicken parm (which they let him order as a panini) and really liked it.

Looking for a place to have breakfast before our duck tour and we decided on Pestatore.  Breakfast portions was more then plenty.  I very much appreciated since I opted for the $17.00 mimosas.  BUT BEWARE!!!!  they added a 19% gratuity for a party of 5 and a $5.00 SF mandatory charge.   What the heck???  I know I was drinking bottomless mimosas but I can still read my bill.  When we questioned the  waiter he said $5.00 was due to Obama...?? Then he took the bill back and brought a new bill with the gratuity off an the "SF Mandatory" removed.   I guess no longer mandatory.

Nice restaurant, great ambience in the evening. The food was good, I wouldn't say it was amazing, but delicious. The marinara sauce tasted a little generic, in my opinion. The bread was pretty tasty. I can't remember the name of the dish I had, it was angel hair pasta, tomato, basil, garlic and evoo. It was good, but there was so much garlic that it really over powered the dish. I would definitely go back, just to give it another shot, I think it would be worth it.
I decided to order a few appetizers instead of a big entree for lunch.

We had breakfast here while staying at the adjacent Tuscan Inn.  I had an omelette, my wife had scrambled eggs.  (My wife would have appreciated a lighter option rather than the whole offering, as she wanted just one egg with toast.)  Food was good and service was good as well.  Nothing outstanding but nothing disappointing, either, which is about par for a hotel restaurant.  Three stars = A-OK.
Worst recommendation ever. I took the fish special and the greens included were so bitter that it ruined the entire meal. I wish I hadn't taken it to go and tipped 25%. I'll never be back.
The food was delicious but the service wasn't that great. I went with a party of 9 people and everyone thought the food was delicious. I enjoyed the bread and olive oil brought out when we sat down.

well, let me say at the outset that i had checked their menu online and was impressed with their breakfast menu. this menu changes at 10, when it is shortened to abt 6 items. so we got up in plenty of time to arrive early.

Nice, bright, comfortable little corner diner a block (or two) off Fisherman's Wharf.  I think I would have enjoyed it more but I found it a little pricey for a quick breakfast before heading out.  But they do have a few suitable a la cart items to fill the void until lunch in Sausalito.  If you're ok w/ $20 per for breakfast, well worth the stop.

The food leaves a lot to be desired. It is not bad by any means but it did not blow me away like the Hollywood cafe which I just around the corner. I ate breakfast here because I stayed in the best western that's attached. I wouldn't eat here again but I would stop by the bar for a cocktail. I had a Bloody Mary with my breakfast and it was one of the best I've ever had.

the green breakfast smoothie was very good. expensive ($8!) but substantial. and i'm going to assume for that price that all the ingredients were organic. let me have that one :) 4 stars for breakfast smoothies!
Good for breakfast. Had the crab benedict. Prices are reasonable. Short walk from our hotel and the pier

After years of dining in SF, I have had 95% mostly positive food experiences. Maybe some bad service here and there. A hair here and there. During these times, i stayed strong and even though I thought about creating a Yelp account, it just didn't seem worth it after a few hours.
Great crab cakes benedict!

I was so disappointed to have wasted one of our San Francisco meals here. The reception by the host was weak. We had a reservation via Open Table, but he hastily tried to prep a table right next to the door for us. (Perhaps because we had teenagers with us?) We had to ask at least twice before they gave us a different table. The restaurant wasn't half full. One of these days I will learn to recognize these early cues and have the guts to walk out.

The food was great and the staff was very friendly. If you appreciate great customer service, you'll appreciate the staff of this place. They are quick, check up on you often, and since we were new to the city our waiter gave us some great recommendations to check out. We ordered some drinks and happy hour menu items. Don't know how their other food is but must be good. Had a great experience! Must check out! You won't regret it! Charles, the bartender was amazing and made our experience really great. Thanks Charles!
Really enjoyed the fun/friendly staff.  Bartender had me cracking up, and let me have the tv remote to watch Warriors game.  Will definitely be coming back.
I dined here twice when I was staying at the Sheraton across the street for business and was too tired to go much farther.

It saddens me that I am actually forced to give this establishment any sort of star. I feel as though contributing any amount of stars is somewhat of a crime against taste buds.  I recently moved to the neighborhood and thought it would make sense to try this seemingly normal looking quiet spot for dinner. We ordered the spaghetti, caesar salad, crab cakes, and clam chowder. I once bleieved that spaghetti was impossible to mess up... I stand corrected. The salad actually had no dressing, and included two anchovies that were the scariest shade of wrinkled purple. The crab cakes weren't cooked and tasted as if they had recently been thawed, and the clam chowder had the consistency of a room remperature glass of water.
We came here for breakfast.

Went to cafe pescatore this past saturday with my wife and mother in law. We had out 2 dogs with us so we asked a waiter outside if we could sit outside with the dogs and he said yes, he'll be with me in a moment. I let my wife and mother sit outside while i waited at the front of the restaurant for about 20 mins. No one came to me, there was no host and the waiter i talked to earlier would not even look in my direction. I went and grabbed menu's on my own. Waited another 15-20 minutes at the table and still nothing. My wife went in to ask a manager for service. Finally a manager came out to take our order. We got our drinks in about 10 minutes, however after another 45 minutes, no food. All we ordered were 2 appetizers and a soup. There were a few tables occupied inside and 2-3 occupied outside, hardly a lunch rush so not sure why we were so neglected. After about 50 minutes, the waiter finally came and asked how we were. At that point, why bother, he hadn't so much as said hi in close to an hour! So we waited about about hour an half in total and still no food. I asked the manager to check us out as we could not wait anymore. She was nice enough to comp the 3 drinks we had, however not enough for us to ever consider this place again. The waiter acted like such a jackass, and had such an attitude problem that no comp would ever make up for such a bad experience. My mother in law is in town visiting so wasting an hour an half on nothing just sucks. Luckily there was a Trader Joe's close by and we picked up food to go home. Cafe Pescatore = Never again!
Don't waste your time! Recommend to come here by the hotel we are staying at, that was a mistake. There are too many good places around. Not going to bash the place, just don't waste your time!!

We went here for breakfast and probably because it was morning the service was really slow (our server was nice and polite though). Food was ok - in general it was delicious but because of the slow service it came to us a bit cold. In general french toast and homemade granola - delicious, crab benedict - ok.
Dined here tonight,  party of nine.
Average. Service was adequate. I had the Proscuitto & red pepper panini which was suprising too bland. My husband had the Margarita pizza which was ok. Pretty interior.but would probably not return.
I love the crab fried rice!~

Horrible experience. Flies buzzing around our table the entire time. The Pad Thai dish I ordered was not edible - either the shrimp was rotten or the cook over did it on the fish sauce. Either way, I ate one bite and almost threw up. Instead of taking the dish off our bill, the waitress only agreed to take 10% off our tab??? Wasn't expecting 5 star dining as this is more of a café setting vs a restaurant, but this was down right awful food. Wouldn't recommend to anyone.

Inexpensive local San Francisco Bay Area Thai chain restaurant serving Thai-style noodle dishes including stir-fried noodles and noodle soups as well as appetizers, salads and other Thai dishes.  The recent remodel has greatly improved the look and feel of the restaurant.
Everything we ordered was too sweet for Thai food. Food is not great, but what the f@@k. Who adds 18% gratuity to a 4 people dinning. They also wanted tip to top it off. F off is what I say.

Horrible service. After sitting for about 20 minute someone finally decided to ask as if we were ready. The food is not worth it at all!  If you're in group, the food doesn't come together. If you wanna enjoy a good Thai food, there is another one just less than a mile away. Easy walk!

GET OUT OF HERE. KOTN on the wharf has changed the menu, raised the prices about 40%, and spiffed up the place. (No more grim overhead lighting and counters by the door looking out at the passing parade.) The worst part about it is, it's PACKED!
Got in and luckily got seated right away on a busy fourth of july because a group just got done. Heres what happened on our order:

This used to be a good King of Thai until the ownership change. Way to increase all the prices on the menu after your remodel. You're suppose to be a cheap Thai restaurant. And if you're going to go from $8 to $11 on the Crab Meat Fried Rice, then put more meat! Not less! Never get take-out here as well, you will get a 3rd less than what you would usually get eating in.

I have been to various other King of Thai Noodle locations around the city and have always had really good food and a good experience. This location is just the worst. They don't have nearly as an extensive menu as the other locations. They don't have any dessert. And forget about any ambience. I don't usually care about the ambience but it just felt awkward to be in there.

Come to the place all the time, food is decent. Came in tonight to grab some food after work and was told they were closing in 10 minutes and if I wanted something I had to order for take out. They're advertised to be open until 11PM. It was 8:45PM. I could've been in and out within 20 minutes.
Ok this location the food is jus SO SO.. Pad Thai was not tasty n only 3 pieces of shrimp ??!! LOL
Today I had a cashew chicken with the most awful chicken I have ever had. So tough it was almost like fried chicken jerky. I swear they refried leftover meat.

This must be one of the few decent and cheap places to eat at Fisherman's Wharf.  Had the usual pad thai and it was very good.  The fried tofu appetizer with the sweet orange sauce was just OK.  Very casual inside.  Service was OK.

sometimes I eat at places where I question the cleanliness and its not a good feeling.  this was one.  I ordered a noodle soup and I think I saw the lady preparing it take the fishcake to her nose to smell.  several things disturb me about this:

Awesome location and food!  This place was empty and I'm not sure why, maybe because it is new?  I though it was great for what is is, essentially a Pho restaurant.  Nice and cheap, $8 and you will be packed full of noodles, broth and beef!
First visit. Tried the seafood fried rice and Guay Tiaw Lord. Both were very good.  Ingredients were fresh and tasty. Will return.
We ordered the red curry, thai fried rice & pad see ew, good food I only wish it was spicier otherwise very tasty.

Just opened as I haven't seen it here before. Same purple walls as in the other locations. Fast service and served steaming hot. I ordered the fried rice with pieces of roast duck and it was very good. Apparently no restroom in the restaurant; you must go outside and use the complex public restrooms.

Veggie noodle soup had almost enough veggie, but the noodles had BACON on top.  They probably put these crumbles on them everytime, but shouldn't put them on my noodles if I ordered veggie...   Quick service.
Cheap and cheerful, and probably the best quality cheap food on Jefferson St in Fisherman's Wharf.

This Thai restaurant had  surprisingly good food with fresh ingredients! What is even more surprising is that it is cheap (by any standards) and in the touristy area no less. The servers were super-friendly, too! We only ate there because it was open late and the Yelp reviews were positive. Everything we ordered was good!
So so. Got a tofu green curry to go. The portion was fairly well-sized but there really wasn't much tofu in it at all (and too many green peppers). That being said, the papaya salad was quite good.

Awesome food.  We went for lunch on Friday and we knew it was good when we saw a lot of non-tourist locals there.  Service is tough with only one or two serving a full room, but the food was worth the wait!
We ate here on Easter Sunday while out exploring the Wharf area. We were going to eat at Chipotle, but they were closed for the holiday.
hmmm... I'm a HUGE fan of King of Thai... but this place?

Service is not too great. Food is not great at all. I don't recommend this place at all. My girlfriend got sick after eating the fried rice. It's cheap, but if you're San Francisco and want Thai food, this is not the place to go.

My husband and I found this place after searching extensively for an affordable dinner in Fisherman's Wharf. The service was great- very fast and friendly. I had the beef noodle soup and he had the Padang curry. Both were great, especially for the price (around $8 per dish). I also had the thai iced tea which was great!

the food was delicious ! generous portions ! i had seafood noodle soup, my fiance had wonton noodle soup and our friend got chow fun, it was delicious ! they make the food pretty fast. this is the place to go after doing a bay cruise on a boat in SF ! will be back :)
Quick visit, nice service!

Portions were small and music was so loud it was hard to enjoy my meal. I asked those in charge to please turn the music down and in spite of asking 3X they refused. :(  Will not be coming back to this Thai place....there are plenty of other great Thai places around!
Decent food, good pricing for lunch, and service time was quick.
i think this is my place for pad see ew.

My girlfriend and I were exploring Fisherman's Wharf seeking a weekend event that we were eventually quite late for.  We had been walking a while and really needed to get some food soon!  Luckily there was King of Thai Noodle next to In-N-Out where we could rest our feet over a hot meal.
i came to this place on black friday, it was the only thai restaurant on powell that still open at 4 am. It was quite busy too.
I ate here with my coworkers from Argonaut sales team for lunch.

Good spot for cheap and good eats. The sliced fried chicken with sweet and sour sauce over fried rice, sliced chicken noodle soup with bean sprouts and egg noodles and fried rice with BBQ pork and Chinese sausage or my go to items, but almost everything on the menu is good.

Had the crab fried rice, delicious, but the crab is not the reason, pad mee Mao delicous rice noodles with ground pork and petite long green beans and won ton soup which was below average.  Nice service and good size place opens early 10:30am for lunch.

My experience here was not a pleasant one. The restaurant had a very unpleasant atmosphere, even for FIsherman's wharf. While the food came to us quickly, the service was slow and not very engaged in serving customers.

Decent overall, but pales in comparison to their location in North Beach: not only is the menu at this location much smaller (and more expensive), but the vibe that makes the other spot so much fun is completely missing; this place feels like a cafeteria, except with great food. Once they get your order right, that is.

We ordered Red Curry, Duck Fried Rice, and Beef Pad See Ew. It was absolutely delicious too bad we didn't have enough stomach to finish it. My only complaint is that they gave us water without ice, we had to flag down a waittress to get ice while the table next to us automatically got water with ice? And it is kind of confusing on how to get here. You got to ask the locals to navigate to this yummy restaurant.

I am setting up a birthday event here and so far the employees have been very attentive. Brian and Johnny are the general managers and they both have been very helpful, very friendly,and make sure your accommodated. The place looks really nice, I can't wait to bring my group and enjoy the entertainment/vibe.
Place was horrible. Rat was found and we caught it for them. Customer service sucked as they didnt help with anything. Oh and i posted this before but someone deleted that review.
I said I wasn't going to do it, but oh well. I'm writing a review on Penthouse. Here we go.
So much fun

Worst customer service of any bar/strip club in SF on Broadway. Bartender tried to rip us off and short changed us $20 for our $45 drink order. When we spoke with the manager regarding the issue he simply walked away mid-sentence. Very unprofessional and had no care towards customer service or the mistake they made. Yes, it is a strip club, but they should still treat customers as if they are at a regular bar.
Suzy is the best . She is the only reason I come here. Best bartender in sf :) and the strippers are nice too
As a man, I am inclined to write this as a 5 star raving review.
Angel, the hostess was freaking awesome. Food was good and the managers took care of us. Girls are freaking hot!

Dinner was absolutely amazing.  Steaks were just as good as any top steakhouse in SF.   Our hostess Thalia was the best and I would definitely recommend to anyone that's looking for a nice spot to dine and enjoy beautiful entertainment.
Awesome place to eat. The filet is off the hook. Management is top notch and knows how to show their customers a great time. I'm going to frequent this place more. The Girls are cherry on top.

I had a great time out with the fellows at Penthouse. This is the nicest club in the area by far. The women there are beautiful and incredibly talented. The stage has a two story pole and its quite remarkable to check out the acrobatic feats these women pull off seamlessly and effortlessly. The club is ultra high-end and I really liked how friendly and attentive the staff was. I was especially impressed with Jonny, the club manager. He made sure our party got a great table and made a point to check in to see how we were doing. I'm pretty sure everyone in my party was thoroughly entertained. Looking forward to checking out their Happy Hour soon.
Boring place... only topless!

Would you believe   the best Happy Hour and the best looking bar in North Beach is in The Penthouse on Broadway and Montgomery.  With $2 import beer, well drinks and no cover Monday through Friday before 5pm (they open at 4pm), you really can't go wrong.  The scantily clad smoking Hotties strutting around doesn't hurt either.  The Penthouse has, without  a doubt, THE nicest bar/club in North Beach.  I've been a customer of this location since back in the Boy's Toys days and it's never looked better than it does now.

This a great place to perform and show my art, dancing. I like the clientele type and their generous tips. Older men rock! I like the opportunity that it offers to a girl like me from Ukraine who is trying to make it in a foreign land away from my family and best men.
Nice, fun place with beautiful girls! I been there with my boyfriend and we had a great time!
Johnny the manager treated us like royalty!! Thanks Johnny. Great night celebrating a birthday with these pretty ladies and nice gentlemen. Totally better than the manager at McDonalds in Vallejo!!!

One word, RATS! Do not go. Owner didnt comp anything horrible management  we asked for a round of drinks and he said no, that's too expensive for him! His argument was that nobody got hurt.... We were the biggest party there. Highly disappointed.

Good lord if I could give zero stars I would, ouch this place was really that bad I'm sorry. It was forty bucks a piece to get in at 10 o'clock. Yes you read that right. Most expensive cover I've ever paid. But we thought hey lets give it a shot we always pass this place and have never gone in.
Call to make a reservation for 12 guys- I am advised to go to

They said I could order food and they closed the damn kitchen 5 seconds later!! The girls are ok, but the actual club is super cute. The scheme is set up just right, and for $800 an hour you can get a basic chic to grind on you. The stars are for the bartender Elena... she was great!

Mehh... I came here for a friends birthday.. Party of 30 people so we had the whole upstairs to ourselves. I mean I guess it would be a different experience if it wasn't such a big party.. the food was... bleh. It took forever to come out and I CANT EVEN SEE WHAT IM EATING. One server for ONE WHOLE PARTY? They were screaming out our food and how on earth are we suppose to know whose is whose! Well anyways, lets get to the strippers , they were pretty and had nice bodies and also very fun ! So there goes the two stars for HOT and FUN strippers! Will I be back..? eh.. I doubt it.
Who wouldn't wanna have their birthday at a strip club?!!
pretty girls, tall pole, good pizza.  kinda pretentious, but that's how all the corporate-run clubs are in this city.  at least there wasn't a $20 cover, like at gold club.
not a fan

Loved it. The food was pretty good and the show was fun. I've been to the Sapphire in vegas and this was def much more fun! The drinks there are a bit on the traditional side being not too many exotic/innovative drinks. The service is great. (Could also be that my bf & I got there around 9/9:30 so it's a bit early). Loved the ambience. It's kinda hip ...though on the sleazy side. lol The canopies are a fun touch.
Definitely a good place for a guys night. The dancers here sure are fit and healthy looking, and more attractive. And, they seemed to enjoy working there, more often than not.
STOLE FROM US!!  SKETCHY PLACE AND OPERATORS
Wow, went here on a Friday night, and my first thought was "Why are all the B girls here?"

Went on a Tuesday for a Coworker's bachelor party. I don't know much about strip clubs but I have been taking pole dancing classes for a few months now and the dancers were a bit disappointing. The majority of the dancers were doing moves that we learned in day one of my pole dancing class. There was only one that I was impressed with and gave her money which was exhilarating.  Otherwise I wasn't impressed.
I'm not going to lie.....I like coming here.....

My man and I went to this amenity some time ago to enjoy our time together. It's nice and clean but it was empty, the girls were ok. I personally didn't like any of them, but it's fun to watch and it's fun to be there in general. We got several lp dances and drinks as well. The drinks are way over priced but it s what it is.
OK...had a friend who worked here...it was better when she was there.
My review is probably a bit generous due to going on the free night, heavily inebriated.
last yr for the bday boy we had dinner and strippers in vegas.. this yr it was the same except in the city..

Where else can you meet a dancer who forages for mushrooms and knows about copyright law? Seriously. Yes, I know I'm supposed to go in and be simply tantalized by sculpted bodies and ample breasts. And it is true that I do find that titillating. But someone who has an opinion on open data? That moves me from lust to smitten.

Came here for New Years and it was one of the most disappointing experiences I've ever had. No open bar, and the environment didn't feel very "moulin rouge" like they advertised. There was a photographer, but none of my friends (in total a party of eight) had our pictures taken ever. The guests were all trashy (a couple grinding heavily at 8pm), practically no one was dancing, a couple of old guys (read: 60) fist-pumping around young women. And there was no champagne toast like they promised in their advertisement. Lesson learned: don't pay $50 for a NYE party without an open bar.
Best happy hour in city! I can't believe there is still a place that serves $2 drinks till 7pm in San Francisco! Kind of dark inside (duh, I guess), but staff was nice and like I said, $2 drinks.
One of the better strip clubs in SF. It doesn't come close to LA, let alone Vegas, but the girls here are usually decent looking.

Came in for a peak and spent the nite!!! Had an awesome time with great company!! The bartender was certainly beautiful as sport smart!!  She kept me on my toes with fun convo!! And little Chelsie , the cocktail waitress also kept me full with the delicious beef springrollz!!! And lets not forget the acrobatic cirque de soleil, miss joy, for finishing the night with an awesome experience!! Lived in vegas for 18 yrs, this felt like home!! Happy hour beer was at $2 a bottle...can't pass that up if ur in the hood just wanting great company n ambiance!!! Definitely will keep coming back!!
What a rip off.  U want the real thing contact me. I'll show you. These guys are fakes and stiffs

Don't be fooled by all of the yummy crab sandwiches in the window. We ordered a shrimp and crab sandwich and both were super super salty. The bread was tough. It was not worth the $10. I'm glad we didn't splurge for the $16 dungeness crab!
Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2014 #155 - #365

Well if you want to push through the crowd on the corner to get a over priced what looks like crab and mayo sandwich, this is your place. My son and husband had a crab sandwich and they said it was better than it looked. I got a hotdog!

My sister and I stopped here to share a Dungeness crab sandwich.  We decided it was just ok.  We did like that the Dungeness crab sandwich had bigger chunks of crab than the rock crab sandwich.  Also, the chucks of claw meet on top were nice too. However, the sandwich was very mayonnaise-ey and hard to eat given the very firm and chewy roll it was served on.  The sandwich was served with a lemon wedge so we used the acidic lemon juice to balance out the fat of the mayo a little better.  It was fine but not something  I'd crave. I would probably rate my experience with only two stars except I know that growing up on the waters of the Chesapeake Bah my standards for seafood are unintentionally high.
I've had better clam chowder and bread. Should've just walked over to Boudin. But the staff was nice.
Size is pretty big. It does seem a bit watery. If you are in a rush it's probably faster than other places. The staff is nice.
Total rip off.  Get the chowder breadbowl, its a piece of shitty sourdough with a few tablespoons of hot potato cream.
I have walked by this row of sandwich stores in the past a few times but I forget every time I'm in the area because I always want a sandwich but find myself to be too full. NOT THIS TIME.

Guardino's, touted to have been there since 1908, has obviously lost the family recipe for clam chowder. If you have ever in your life had real New England Clam Chowder, you will spit this out. Or if you are really hungry, you will chalk it up to a poor choice and finish the tiny bowl not worth its price or even half of it. The consistency is way too watery, the clams (if you can find them) have to be canned and there is no attention to the actual flavor whatsoever.

I dont know what all the bad reviews are about I have been here twice and both times I got served by the same person we remembered each other and I got served the exact same tasting food I take my hat off to businesses that don't change when the times change this is awesome I hope that they stay here for many moons to come check it out They have my favorite bread bowls bar none they exceed the expectations of something just so simple
We were looking for a quick snack... and knew all these stands were tourist traps.  We chose Guardino's because it had the longest line.

I'm not very picky with my clam chowder. I love clams and often eat them straight from the can. So I was happy when my clam chowder bread bowl had lots of clams in it. Unfortunately, it was barely dug out so it was mostly bread with maybe a cup of chowder. Perhaps I got a bad bowl. It was good while it lasted, which wasn't long. A few birds gave me 'the eye' when I threw all the extra bread away - next time I'm on the wharf I'll probably give another place a try, even though my gaze usually catches Guardino's first.
DO NOT get the clam chowder in sourdough bowl from here, it was more like a clam chowder flavored sourdough.

Solid crab chowder. I didn't get the bread bowl because I knew I wouldn't eat it, and I was stuffed after my 8 oz. cup plus oyster crackers, so it was a good decision. There are lots of chowder options around here, and I can't say whether this was better than others, but I liked it. Grab a seat at a picnic table by the water and enjoy the view while you eat!
They're a decent place for a bread bowl in Fisherman's Wharf area. Nothing special, but most of the places aren't in my opinion.
I love crab but this wasn't the season and the crab just wasn't as good as I hoped.
First station on the block yet it was completely dead...hm wonder why?

Great station.   The crab is perfectly prepared and the ambiance of eating and enjoying a beer on the sidewalk is unique.   The butter has a perfect hint of garlic.   The bread bowl clam chowder is also a hit.   Crab has been $12.95/pound forever so one whole crab is just about $20 and worth the experience.   You'll have to move through the heavy tourist crowds and put up with the occasional onlooker that is intrigued by eating curbside or trying to figure out how to eat a crab top to bottom.
Excellent fresh whole crab. Expensive but you're on the wharf. The clam chowder was good but so are most of the neighbor shops. Good service.
I visited this place at their walk up counter for a quick bite to eat. I have to say, for the price, you're really getting some pretty good food.

I ate a couple of these little crab stands on the warf over a 1 week period.  Guardino's was the best.  Much of it is  due to the rotation of the food. I ate at The Crab Station next to Guardion's also but Guardino's did a better job cleaning the crab and were far friendlier.

I ate a large, delicious, inexpensive crab sandwich (along with a refreshing Anchor Steam) from the stand out front while sitting on a bird poop covered bench whilst watching a shitty street musician. It was awesome! So was the backpack toting, cigar chomping rapper busting rhymes beside me. I would eat more food from here.

A San Francisco staple is what I was told. Great fresh seafood to munch on while walking around the wharf. Service was quick and the food lived up to its reputation. I will stop by next time I'm in town.

Seafood festivities will definitely occur once you hit Guardinos! They have everything from cups of calamari to lobster salad sandwiches. It's fresh, flavorful and a lot of fun. My boyfriend (of 12 years) and I decided to partake in the "Night Street Food" experience and Guardinos was one of our stops. We tried the mussels, crab, calamari and the lobster claw. The calamari was marinated in a balsamic vinaigrette sauce. The lobster claw meat was moist and the crab legs tasted just like the ocean.

On any given day, and even any given time of day, some of these wharf fish stands will have food that looks mediocre to you, and sometimes they will have something that jumps out at you & screams, you must eat this! Maybe the fish has been sitting out for a bit, or maybe brisk business means they're continually reloading the displays with something just prepared.

The clam chowder here was okay and nothing too special.  The big downer here is that there was no where to sit down.  All the vendors had a small area to sit down.  I had to go with my friends and find a random spot near the pier to put the food on the platform like a table.

Totally and utterly unimpressed! I'm surprised that so many Yelpers said this was one of the better clam chowder stands because honestly, the soup tasted like a can of freaking Progresso!!! There was a very odd fishy flavor, which still makes me cringe, thinking about it! Even the bread bowl couldn't save the soup because it wasn't even special bread, ugh! This definitely does NOT compare to Pike's Place Chowder in Seattle, which is THE best chowder I've ever, ever, ever had! This place sucks!!!!

The location and experience can't be beat.  Authentic clam chowder steaming hot in a delicious bread bowl right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  However, the clam chowder had barely any clams, and you can find more flavorful chowders at other places.  But regardless you still have to get one from this spot anytime you visit Fisherman's Wharf.  Just make sure to get a second one somewhere else.

in my opinion, THIS is the only place to get your clam chowder bread bowl in fisherman's wharf. sure, you can get one on every corner in a 10 mile radius...but there is something about the no frills street stand experience in the heart of the fish market. legit.
My first stop in my self styled four stop lunch tour of the outdoor stands of Taylor Street.

We were walking around San Francisco in the wharf district.  We asked a doorman at a fancy hotel a street over, where's a good place to get clam chowder or a crab sandwich on the street.   He said this place.  So we went.   We got the clam chowder in the bread bowl.  It was noisy what with the seagulls and the crowd, and the guy yelling about this and that, but we loved it.  The clam chowder was good.  The bread was good.  The drink was cold.  It was memorable.  Don't change a thing, Guardino's.
Not the best chowder I had at Fisherman's Wharf.

To be honest, the rest of this review would be more praiseful if I had not been attacked TWICE by seagulls who wanted a piece of my "crab" sandwich. After trying to scoop out the dents made by bird beaks, I decided not to pit my immune system against whatever nascent viruses they had left behind. So, I can only review the sandwich based on looks (bread: well-shaped, crab: white shavings of something compacted into an unappetizing loaf). It made a satisfying thud when I tossed it into the garbage.

The food was a little overpriced, but the food was good.  The people running the show were super friendly and stopped what they were doing to get my giant dog some water, without me even asking. 5 stars for service, 4 for price (comparable businesses were about a buck cheaper), and 5 stars for domestic beer prices.

First time I had clam chowder in Fisher's Wharf and choose this one.  It was very hot, not too much potato, lots of clam, very tasty.  The guy feel up the pint cup to the top and the lady give me two extra spoon without me asking.  Very observing.
Atmosphere:

Ok, so it's crawling with tourists and it's seriously overpriced (hence 4 stars), but it is SO GOOD. Every time I come here I get the same thing: Clam chowder in a bread bowl, crab on the side, and a beer. The clam chowder is made fresh every day and the crab is amazing. Top it off with the beer and I am one happy San Franciscan.

Quite frankly the reviews in here complimenting the Clam Chowder using metrics like "even better than Progresso!" mean that this place is rated higher than it should be for people that are really serious (call me picky! I am definitely picky in this regard) about their clam chowder.
Oysters tasted fresh.

Growing up whenever we went to SF we always when to Guardinos for their clam chowder bread bowls so naturally when I returned to SF years later I went straight there and I have to say I was very disappointed.  I had their seafood combo sandwich and while the seafood was good I DID NOT like their tartar/mayo sauce.  Their Whole Crab & Clam Chowder may be good but I'll go elsewhere for a seafood sandwich.
You cannot, must not visit Fisherman's Wharf and miss out on eating clam chowder.

I wasn't a fan of this place. I had the crab chowder and it was fine nothing special might have had a couple pieces of crab. I find that using the bread bowl it doesn't give you very much chowder. I had a cocktail with fresh juice, it was ok... lots of pulp, seeds, ice,  wedges of lemon and orange just taking up space in my opinion.  Service was good but I don't think I would waste my time here again.
I was very disappointed with this place. disgusting food and horrible service. cashier girl was extremely rude as well. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Very nice place. The Fish and Chips dish was pricey, but really good -it was made fresh to order, both the fish and the fries were excellent, and the staff was friendly. They have an outdoor seating area (maybe indoor as well), and it's a great location. -A fun place to go if you're a tourist or a local, the food is great here, and there's a very good vibe. I have been to three fish and chips places in the area, and this the best one (for the Fish and Chips plate).
Great atmosphere, service was above standard, Bloody Mary was outstanding and good was great. Definitely worth going and well priced
You know, for a place called "Chowder Hut" you'd think their chowder would be awesome. Nope, it blew more chunks than my chowder had in it.
We stopped by for drinks, and the bartender Jessica Marie was so attentive and sweet, she took care of us so well! That's the kind of service we will come back for!
Came here with some friends while visiting the wharf in SF. The venue was outdoors and had really nice views of the wharf area.
Terrible portion of the crab sandwich. There was a teaspoon of crab. Terrible. I will never return. Go across the street to Alliotos to get a much better sandwich.

The food was good, a little pricey but considering the location that is to be expected. I wouldn't recommend the fish tacos, they didn't have much flavor. The fried calamari was good, and the garlic fries were delicious! The waitresses were very annoying, complaining about another server during our entire meal.
I had the Crab Chowder and thought it was amazing. My mom had the fish tacos  and said they were super good. I would definitely come back again.

Was gonna do one star but (never mind) one star. I can't think of a single reason to give this place two stars...Oh I got it - their menu says they make their own cocktail and tartar sauce. So I will give it two - assuming that statement is true.
Best food in town!!!! Such great customer service!!! Came in from SD to visit & wouldn't choose any other place to go! Perfect view & even a heater since its outside!

Jessica the bartender was great, she was super busy but I never had to wait for a drink or to order. I had the crab chowder and the street cocktail. I loved the chowder but the cocktail was just OK. Definitely not terrible. I was alone and enjoyed the atmosphere and didn't feel out of place.

Not sure how this got three stars. Finding a seat was like a needle in haystack leading us to believe the three star falsehood. The bread bowl (made by boudin) Was good  yetfilled it with a clam flavored milk they sold as chowder. Fish tacos were disappointing. Del taco has better! The spicy fried fish sandwich fell also to the wayside. The bread also made by boudin was the best part of the sandwich with the complete lack of actual fish throughout and the only heat was contained In a single bite. The fish and chips where so so but we can find better fish in Vegas.  The highlight of the meal were the frickles but who can  mess up fried pickles. Oh yeah and the tea tastes like they pulled it from the bay.
I was there the other day.  The two of us wanted 2 things, clam chowder in a bread bowl & a dungess crab.  We walked thru the seafood shacks along the strip & price wise I chose to go here.
Started off with a pitcher of mojitos. The pitcher was filled with ice, which is totally annoying, I took science, I know about water displacement, and I know you are being cheap.
Visited this place on Friday and it was great! Busy of course, but the chowder is what won us over! Beautiful view and great service.

I'm gonna give one star for the amazingly kind waitress. One star for the location; beautiful view. One star for the fact that the food was edible. That's it. We got the clam chowder and lb of garlic shrimp. The chowder was average, borderline good. The garlic shrimp wasn't flavorful. There's on the peel, but once you get to the shrimp its very bland. They should marinate it or something. Location was great, though. We got a nice seat outside.

This is my usual go-to spot when I'm in the Wharf. Classic clam chowder, with your standard sourdough bread. They have 2 sides of the outdoor restaurant. One self seated area, and other with a designated server with a bar as well. They also have a crab chowder which is really rich and flavorful and has a little kick of spice. Service is great and the environment of sitting in the middle of the Wharf is better than standing up and eating. (If you haven't been there you won't understand how nice it is to sit and eat at the Wharf.) Fried shrimp and fries are awesome, portions are decent, but if you're a big eater like I am you'll need to get extra. Overall good place.
the greatest Crab Melt sandwiching the world and they didn't charge me to upgrade my fries to garlic.

I knew better.  I knew the food would be average at best, or as in this case, barely edible at worst.  Unfortunately for me, on a Saturday night at 8:30, they served day old fried calamari.  It wasn't even served hot!   Never again!
The best part about this place is the outdoor seating other than that it really isn't that great. The service was sub par and the food was just about the same. Was just not a fan of this place.
my boyfriend and i ate here for lunch while at fishermans wharf. we both ordered the spicy fish sandwich, it was delicious! the serving portion was good. i got a mojito, and that too was good.

Had the fish and chips and chowder bread bowl. Both were very solid. Service was great given the influx of tourists and the place had plenty of tables Located in the heart of the wharf and close to many activities, would recommend.

We went to the Chowder Hut last weekend when we were in Fisherman's Wharf.  It is located right across from Alioto's and The Grotto and all the sidewalk food venders.  As we were with family and had walked a couple of miles, the thought of getting some crab sandwiches, Clam chowder and other great seafood was dashed by the mobs of tourists that filled the sidewalk.  Then my Aunt spotted the Chowder Hut.  "It even has tables" she shouted happily.  And indeed it did as well as those heaters that keep all the outside diners warm.

Date of visit: 7/22/14 Good food at a good price! Everything in San Fran is pricey and sometimes you just can't spend $14 for some clam chowder. We all had the chowder and fish and chips. All of it was served up quickly and was really good. They also had fountain drinks with refills.

OMG no! Overpriced and that was NOT a half pound of shrimp! Too much pepper, slimy and just plain gross! Was way better on our last trip 6 years ago. Clam chowder had.... well, the potato soup was okay. Yes I had like two clams in my chowder. So what exactly did I just pay for? Should have saved some money and had a quality burger across the street at In n out!
Terrible service. Waited 30 minutes only to learn that our food was served to another guest. Small dishes and highly priced. Would give it 1 star but the clam chowder was good.
Great selection of drinks and finger foods. Cute little place right on the Wharf of you want a quick meal at a good price. Great clam chowder and fish and chips. Good waitstaff and very friendly!

Service and atmosphere were great! I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl. Bread bowl was fabulous, the chowder was okay. I've had better. It was worth the stop I had the chance to watch a live performer across the street while I ate and had a cold beer. Which you need after all the walking!

Service was good, but they're hotdogs are mediocre. Far from the best hotdog you've ever had. It's also not served on a French baguette as the menu specified. Best to go with something else on the menu.
I only came in for a few drinks and to watch the soccer game. The service is great and the drinks are awesome. Ask for Tessa she's an amazing bartender. Very friendly service and good prices.
I LOVE clam chowder!
Great fish and chips, burgers and bread bowls.  Drinks are pricey.
This place has great prices for really good food! Service is pretty quick. Nice spot right by the water to hang out and have a beer with friends.
Visit Date 6/20/2014
Got a chowder bowl that had hardly any chowder finished it within 3 minutes eating slow didn't even fill me a bit this is not a place I'd recommend unless your on a diet

If you're at Fisher mans wharf and you wanna spend a little bit of $ then this is the place for you. Happy hour provides you with cheap appetizers and dishes especially cheap beers under 6$. I'm not a big fan of seafood: clam chowder, prawns, lobsters, fish, etc. and this place was perfect!

The waitress was actually pretty funny. She made fun of the people at our table. Like when she called my mom "big meanie." And only because my mother ordered like 17 diet cokes. Hey, they said "free refills, don't be so stingy...this ain't Europe."
Was here for a work event on a Wednesday night.

So first I'd like to start off by saying that besides freezing our asses off the whole time, the atmosphere of the restaurant was pretty nice. Good music, and an overall nice set up.. We went there on a Monday for a late lunch/early dinner so it wasn't busy at all, just COLD.

The drinks here, best Ive had in a long time. The shark bite and the fun stuff the staff does is fantastic! !! Synchronized dance is adorable. And Heeelloooo their server Sebastian was perfect. Like literally perfect.  After horrible wait time and then gwtting skipped over on the waitlist even tho we were in the bar (being served by Devin who was also perfect), the 2 guys saved a bad review and made the experience everything awesome.  Besides the front checkin area, this place is soooooo fun! 4 adults travellimg from Central WA state had a great time in San Fran.

Had a wonderful family experience on a busy Saturday afternoon. Our sampler appetizer was excellent. The cocktails were tasty and beautiful. Besides the awesome food our server Josh was always around and made sure our experience was a memorable one. We will be back.

First time there And i think the best thing about this place was the view. THATS IT! Food wasnt all that GREAT And BATHROOMS were disgusting!! You would think with so many employes one of them would be able to at least clean it up here and there.

My BF and I come here every time we're in Frisco. We actually wait outside for them to open at 11am. They usually sit us by the window so we can look out into the ocean and see people walk by down below.

Horrible place to eat! We are not tourists...happen to be in the area and wanted something to eat...remembered Joe's from other cities so we stopped into this one. What a mistake! The Long Island Ice Tea looked and tasted like Sprite only! Rum and Coke was waterdown Coke...no RUM! Ordered the Sampler...only item hot was the dip..all other items were cold from being frozen...worse experience...Lobster pot pie tasted more like Old Bay seasoning than the lobster and crab...don't eat here because you will be sorry!!!

Oh my, this place needs a better leader. I asked for seating away from a loud crowd and the hostess offered me a booth by the bar, really it was three feet from where I requested a table. Server comes for drink order. Soda, smoothie and water. Got two out of  three and when I asked for the water I get it with attitude. I guess if you don't pay for you don't get it with smile-or a clean glass. Two servers for as many as 18 tables doesn't make sense. I loved when she came by and said 'Oh, you finally got your food'

I really loved it here, I came here with my sweetheart for valentines day last year and I definitely want to return someday when we have a chance. It was totally queer friendly, which was wonderful for us! You'd expect SF to be anti-discriminatory, but you'd be soooo surprised of the assholes who gave us bad looks while walking down the pier. I loved the uniforms and the servers and hostesses personal touches on their outfits, like cute little bow ties or rainbow gear. I loved seeing an establishment that doesn't discriminate how their team members dress.

We stop by here for a quick dinner......... service not good at all took really long time to order and then really long time to get our food...... and they were not busy at all just look like no one even care for this place....... food was not even close to be average.... will not go back here ever again.
Ah ha, me hearties! I be Cap'n Bloodsnatch and I'll tell ye a pirate tale if yer of a mind to hear one!

Never got a refill on my drink so no drink during the meal plus had to walk to another table to grab ketchup because the waiters were Nowhere to be found. Food sucked and management needs to step up there
Don't recommend it was ran down dirty, to scared to eat there.

Food is ok. Nothing to special. The reason I gave two stars instead of one is because of the friendly receptionist. Now as for the overall service they are nice but my waiter served all his tables first and then cams to mine last so they got their food faster than mine even though we were there first and ordered like the same stuff. Lol. BTW they messed two of the orders repeadidly 4 times in a row, so that ended up being to go food.

Poorest service I have experienced at a restaurant. Very unorganized and the hostess kept saying she would seat me next after waiting an hour but they kept calling other peoples names. Then I asked how many people are in front of me she said 7 after 7 names were called we asked again and she said 4 more.... Also they kept losing where they left off on the guest list and kept starting over repeating same tables that they already called. Very inexperienced and unorganized hostesses. The food wasn't bad, but not worth going through the awful experience to get seated.

My boyfriend loves this place so when ever we get the chance we go to this restaurant.  Recently, I had the cedar plank salmon which was delicious.  But later, I got sick with possible food poisoning. But then with the way the woman's bathroom looks, I should not be surprised.  It appears that the staff are too busy catering to the customers that they can't clean the bathroom.  I mean the bathroom is filthy and appears to be truly neglected.  It makes me wonder, as the staff use this bathroom, how sanitary is the food that they prepare?!?

My wife and I stopped in here for lunch after the Alcatraz tour. After days of eating mostly meat-heavy dishes, I fancied something that was more seafood-orientated. Of all the seafood places along Fisherman's Wharf we could have tried, we stopped into Joe's.

Pretty much the only place open by the time we were looking for food and we were so hungry we gave in but this place is just horrible. Tables were kinda sticky, food was slapped down in front of you and service was slow. I had a platter and was really underwhelmed with all of it, left most of the limp fries and undercooked onion rings. My friend had the snow crab which seemed fresh enough but they don't provide wipes or anything, just a big roll of kitchen towel when we asked for napkins. The place itself is just a mass of overstimulation.
Tourist Trap. So many things wrong don't know where to start. I just copied and pasted a letter we sent to their corporate office.

Oh my gosh!! Where to start!! Well I didn't really eat crab but my boyfriend really wanted some so we have both heard of this place and seen friends have gone. So we decided to try it. It wasn't very busy we got seated right away but then we're almost forgotten about. The waitress was asking us when we were seating and if we were seated before another party. How would we know?  Anyways, as I said I don't eat crab so I got a drink and mozzarella sticks which were fine except that my drink took forever and came after we were done with the mozzarella sticks. When my boyfriend ordered food it took FOREVER to come out. And they kept telling us it would be out in a minute. I think it took 20-25 min for I don't even know what because the food looked awful when it arrived. Fries and some fried shrimp and crab. Clearly it was frozen and out of a bag. It was just awful!!!!!!  We got the check and bounced.

We were there on a long weekend and the wait everywhere else was crazy, so decided to Joe's crab shack. Should you be going here if you are a tourist? - no. There are better places that the tourists should visit when in SF. Should you go here if you are a local and just need some food and the lines here are not long? - yes.
Such a let down. We were super excited for crab-ness and it didn't seem like a lot of restaurants around the pier had them, but I'll have to look again.

I must say I was very disappointed with this place. Joe's Crab Shack was referred to me by a friend. The food was outstanding especially the calamari and clam chowder. Unfortunately I would have to rate customer service a "0" zero. I highly recommend management to retrain MOST of the staff. Most were unprofessional, disorganized and not very attentive. I'm not at all a picky customer or ask much from servers but the gentleman we had that evening looked irritated when we asked for a cup of water. Really?!?! That should have been brought out without us even asking for it:(  After that we never asked for anything else except for the check. I really hope they do something about it because  I wouldn't want my first visit to be my last.
Service is slow and it was a struggle to get a hold of someone not all the utensils were brought to our table and our table was to small for five people the food is good  but takes a long time

I'm not sure if the waiter delayed on bringing our plates but the food was cold!!! Not a bit warm at all. He always took forever to bring anything we asked for.  There was an item he never brought and we were so upset we did not ask him for it again since it was obvious he forgot about it.  Will not go back
Joes

Went for my first time yesterday ,very busy and long waiting time for a table they will tell you 30 minutes but waited an hour .Finally got seated and put in our order and the shrimp came out raw way under cooked it had no flavor and King crabs were very thin  . I left very disappointed and hungry. We asked to have my raw shrimp taken off the bill and waiter said manager refused to take it off the bill, so my boyfriend spoke to manager and said the waiter never asked to be taken off... The only good thing that happened was we got the shrimp order taken off. Never again will return back ..I am sticking to  Boiling crab or Crabaholics..

We came here for my mom's birthday, on a saturday. There were about 15 people waiting for a table, half of the resturant was empty. We were a party of 5 adults and 1 child. The hostes, Charde (spelling?) said a 10-15 min wait. We asked for a booth. Knowing they only have 2 booths to accommodate 6 people. One was empty. Everyone was seated before us even ones that were just walking in,  granted they were parties of 3. It was getting busier they decided to seat people on the empty side. We waited about 20 minutes, the hostess pointed to a table. I told her the booth was open. She said the booth wasn't  available. I told her it had been empty the whole time we were waiting. Not knowledgeable and rude I asked to speak to the manager about the booth. He said it had been reserved for 2pm. If they would have sat us when we first walked in we could have been in and put before the party arrived. anyways... we took the table because it's my mom's birthday and she wanted to eat here. The damn table was open the whole time we were waiting!

Such a let down. It was our first night in San Francisco so we wanted out experience to r special. The service was extremely slow, which is understandable when a place is busy but this was just the start. The good finally came, they forgot my sisters meal, plus half the meals weren't correct. I didn't have the correct sauce , and all of our burgers were cooked so well done they were hard as a rock. And trying to find out server to get the things we were missing or to ask anything for that matter was impossible.

What makes Joe's Crab Shack dining experience fun are the waiters and waitresses when they put on a dance show and also they make your birthday a lot of fun. Yet while doing all this I have had GREAT service with friendly waiters and waitresses every time I have been here. I have never had bad service here.

The service in this place is slow and sporadic.  It's loud. Not fun loud but annoying loud.  The food was okay, but seriously why the hell were we even eating seafood from a chain in San Francisco so close to better local restaurants.  I don't see myself going here again.

Thank you soooo much Michelle Hennings for making my son's first time at Joe's an enjoyable and memorable experience!!Today we visited this location per my son's request for his 11th Birthday!  He wanted lobsters so we ordered the Artic Bay steam pot but 20mins later our server comes back to ask if we were ready to order. We reminded her of our order she took so she said she'll check to make sure they started it.  Needless to say, she came back 5mins later to say they no longer had lobster which ruined my son's bday mood :-( One of the Managers, Michelle was walking by and we told her the situation and she quickly apologized and said whatever my son's meal was it would be on the house! We were glad about that but what made my son's birthday extra special is how Michelle kept coming back to check on us, talking to my son, having him join them in their dance in the floor,  sing him happy birthday while he ran around the place AND give him a birthday card with a free meal on his next visit!!! By the time we left my Son was sooooo happy even if he didn't get his lobster because of the time, genuine care and attention Michelle Hennings provided! The customer service she provided was exceptional, she truly went above and beyond, she is AWESOME!!!!!!
Food gross* service sucked. There are to many other restaurants around the pier that u can enjoy great crab and food.
Loud, obnoxious, touristy. Boring and expensive food. Really no reason to ever go here. Plenty of better seafood places around the wharf area.

I wish I could give no stars. We went to Joes tonight for dinner. The wait time was 30_45 mins. We waited standing for 50 mins. There is no comfortable waiting are nor seating while you wait. While we are waiting we watch a group of 4 or 5 hostesses and a host, goofing off, being rude to other customers and obviously not caring that there were about 40 people waiting just watching them. Once we were finally seated, we waited 15 minutes to even be approached by a server. Once we ordered we again waited. At one point our server came to the table and just matter of factly said "your food is not ready yet". No apologies. The food once it came 45 mins later was utter crap. The food presentation was horrible. We asked for a manager. Who had to be dragged out from hiding. She was zero help. We were so beyond belief that the service and food was so bad. We will never go back.
slow ass bartender.. obvious she didn't go to bartender school!!! took hella long to make simple ass cocktails!!!
Long wait, a waitress that doesn't care... Took 20 minutes to get water... Entire staff stops to dance in the middle of the restaurant when everyone has been waiting hours for their food!
Don't come to this tourist chain if you're visiting the Bay Area with limited time - there are surely far better seafood joints here!

Is nothing special. We got a pot for 2 with crabs and shrimps (reasonably priced). The food was OK, not good but also not bad. Great for large crowds. Mostly filled with tourists.  The service was OK as well.

Pretty nice place to get take-out dimsum. They always have a huge selection of fresh baos (some of which to this day I still have never tried before), and of course all the dimsum is hot and fresh as well.
Blue Sky's Custard Tarts are the only ones that come even close to Golden Gate's. Nice flakey crust and delicious custard.   I can't wait to try the red bean pancake!
$0.50 bao?! yes please.
The gigantic steamed buns in the window caught my eye. Blue Sky had handwritten menus in Chinese and English. Older Chinese guys hang out here (usually a good sign).
Specialty are the baos and pastries, but the dumplings, while limited in variety are great.  This place is better than You's.

come here at 8am anyday of the week for best fresh dimsum and baos.  seriously i've had dimsum in hong kong and the top places in the bay area like yank sing, hk flower lounge, etc.  those places are of course going there with you family and enjoying nice long dimsum sunday lunch.  here at blue sky, you can get a pint of jook (thousand yr egg and pork) for a $1.10??? really???  and its better than some restaurants that sell jook for 5-6 bucks.  their rice noodles are good as well as baked baos.  the lady is super nice too.

I hate writing bad reviews for places I like.  I usually come here every Sunday to buy food for our 10 minute party at church.  The buns are good and cheap!  I come here to eat the dim sum as well.  Recently, one of my friend told me her sponge cake had mold on it.  No way!  She was right!  GROSS!!!!!!!
Delicious!!!  The lady is super duper nice!!!
Old-timer Chinese hangout.
This is the second dim sum counter that I've been to in a row that microwaves my order, in front of me to boot, before giving it to me...
I just came here to get a quick bite.I brought three stream choi yaik  buns.  It a nice relaxing place to sit.

This place calls itself a restaurant but to me it seems more like a one-room tiny hole-in-the-wall cafeteria. They have dim-sum items and other hot foods. It's located just five blocks from my place, so I walk over often to buy a fast cheap bite to eat. Usually I buy the little egg custard tarts at $3 for $1.75 or the shrimp dumplings at about the same price. The lady behind the counter doesn't speak much english but I can point!!! The place is always filled with asian retirees, and have seen tourists inside eating too.

Yuck, disgusting!  Ok, we passed by this place - mostly empty or table of older Chinese men sitting drinking coffee and eating buns.  It seems they are supposed to be famous for their flavored rice.  Appear to have some dim sum pieces and baked buns.

I was just walking home from across town and I was hungry for a little treat. I stopped in to this corner joint that says "you get best dim sum here" in english. Low and behold that is exactly what ends up happening. The usual linguistical chaffing occurred during the ordering phase of the transaction; especially with my heavy NY "what?" and her not really giving a shit if I got the exact five or six 40 cent dumplings that I wanted. Not sure if i specifically order it or not, but steaming hot and fuckin on point is what I got. Which coincidentally enough is all I am really looking for in a chinatown dumpling; whatever the little buggers are stuffed with is inconsequential if they are tasty, and I'll be damned if this wasn't the best mother loving dim sum I've gotten to date. The icing on the proverbial cake is that it is cheaper than a quick toss in the -loin if you know what i mean...huh.... huh.... huh.... .....ahhh you know what i mean.
A new over-the-counter dim-sum place for me.  They also have tables, so you can sit-down for a quick, nourishing meal too.
2+ 2 +2 deal was amazing . Good quality of pizza with a very tasty sauce . Delivery was fast . 2 liter coke was nice n cold. Thank you Paris pizza .good job

Let me start my review that saying there simply is no better place to go not only in search of great pizza, but their salads, specialty pizzas and sandwiches, like the grilled chicken panini, are outstanding!  I have worked on Broadway for nearly 5 years and this place has always treated me with respect, great customer service and bomb ass food.  The added plus is that they deliver and are open until 3:30-4am everyday, yes even weekdays.  The staff is a;ways polite, personable and caters to your every need.  Considering employees at pizza places commonly do not make much money, they have always set a standard by which great customer service and a friendly atmosphere is measured. No matter what time it is, unless your howling at the moon all night long(haha), there is one sure place where your search for great food during the day or late at night will be a "no brainer", and put simply that place is Paris Pizza.

Absolutely pathetic excuse for an establishment.  I ordered pizza through this company online.  There was a one hour delivery time, which seemed a bit long since it was Sunday and nearly 11:00PM.  Nonetheless we waited.

Best best best pizza in town... No pork wish is amaaaaaaazing even the ham is turkey. The pizza taste so fresh and the staff is supper friendly. Im so happy I found this place I will sure be coming back over and over and over again...
It's one my best pizza places in the city. Love their Chicken and double cheese pizza.
Deliver service is awful..they take their time and are rude about it. First and LAST time I order here. Good job guys.
"Please cut pizza yourself"
Had a slice of Pizza, which tasted good even if it was heated up.
A very good phillycheese sandi. Pizza was a little thin but tasty. Nice outer crust but not deep dish. Good quality ingredients. They delivered and I would order again.
Had this for delivery through seamless.
Best in north beach very friendly people very good price for pizza thanks you guys keep it up !!!!
I ordered from Paris Pizza very late on a Sunday night, like 2am late, through

Read a review saying their pizza dough was raw but they said they ordered at like 1:45 am so I figured it was a one time thing. Nope. Ordered my pizza at 7pm and it took and hour and a half and the dough was raw. There was very little sauce too. Whoever is in charge over there needs to take notice. You got a systemic problem dudes.
Among the worst pizza I've had in the city,and that's saying something since I am a self professed pizza aficionado.

Besides their great slices of pizza, they have such an amazing fettuccini alfredo!!! Nice prices, very friendly people, and very good service.  The quality of every single product is what does this place a great place to go either for noon or evening.  Also, they have an efficient delivery service!!! And if you are lucky you can try their homemade tiramisu which is delicious! I go often and I never been disappointed either with their service or products!!!! Great job guys!!!!
Nasty pizza! What's even nastier is the guy collects my money n than goes back to kneading the dough bread with unwashed hands!
I like their panini and their pizza...
Quality product. Great crust. Friendly staff. Their pizza is one of the best I've ever had.
best for  ever , I ordered many time from paris pizza I didn't get any problem , have  delicious pizza , amazing burger and Panini, fast delivry , helpful  guys  ....... thanks

Hole in the wall pizza shop. Pizza was decent, but I've had much better. But if you want a quick bite you can't complain too much. Small dining area so not the best idea for large groups. However, place was empty when my group of 4 decided to try out th place.
Five stars for amazing post-clubbing drunk food... But sadly that only earns three stars when sober.

Ordered a "deep dish" pizza, and it was the thinnest slice of pizza I've ever seen. Called them back afterwards and they said thats how it is. Unbelievable. The crust on the deep dish was decent, it was thick with cheese in it, but it definitely did not hit the spot. I'm not sure how the rest of the menu is, but we ordered delivery and it took about an hour to arrive. In conclusion, don't order this pizza if you're looking for a nice dinner. If you're drunk at 2am and you want pizza, this may be the spot for you.

These guys are pushing a surprisingly good cheesesteak.  It's Angus beef, mushrooms, bell peppers, and red onions tucked into a soft roll doused in nacho cheese style American. Extra cheese at no additional charge.

This place has burgers, fries, pizza, and pasta.  None of it is particularly good, but none of it is particularly horrible.  There are so many better options in the neighborhood; the only reason to come here is if it's late, you've been drinking, and you just don't feel like trying anymore.  It's slightly better than the almost identical place two doors down.
Not the best reheated pizza in the world. I want to like this place, but I got a terrible stomach ache after eating there. I have yet to order a fresh pizza . . . stay tuned.

I don't understand Johnny's problem. This pizza was delicious. The pepperoni was halal, which is awesome if you don't eat pork. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pepperoni with pesto hits the spot on a weekend drinking night.
Nice and quick late night delivery. Double meat philly cheese steak was solid, so were the crunchy fries. Cheese cake was a bit small and felt a bit frozen. Would definitely order again.
Best burgers!!!!!!! Terrible pizza:( It is very strange, but I always order from them and the burgers arrive hot and absolutely delicious!!! I'm in love....
Being new to the city, we had no idea who to call for good pizza, so I searched
Ordered a pizza with chicken in it. Pizza was not cooked, to the point where the dough didn't hold together - it was falling apart! The chicken wasn't cooked all the way through!

I dont think the person above got the right place.... I live next to it and ingot here all the time, their pizza is very good and cheap, there always very nice to me, they DO have a restroom, I think the guy above was just a stupid drunk at 2am and I wouldent let him used it either. They have amazing pasta and other dishes proper football on tv and free wifi so I can't recommend this place enough!

I've always said that bad pizza is like bad sex: even when it's bad it's still pretty good. However, Paris Pizza is the exception to this rule. They've managed to take delicious ingredients like cheese and pizza sauce and turn it into something absolutely unpalatable, even at two in the morning. Worse, they are downright hostile to their customers. No bathrooms, even for paying customers? Is that even legal for a restaurant in California? Skip this place and go for one of the many other late-night places in the area.

After a three-hour long trip on the cable cars (it's a long story saved for another day), my family and I were hungry and needed to eat dinner. So, we decided on this hole-in-the-wall pizza place for dinner since it was literally across the street from our hotel.
This is a good pizza place when you're too tired to walk any further. Definitely not a place to go 'out of your way' for but if you need something quick to eat- this hits the spot.

This place is disgusting, don't eat here if you  are a tourist. I live in SF and got caught at this place for a nearby TaskRabbit gig and couldn't have been more disappointed... 10 dollars for 2 slice of sub par pizza sucks too!
Great big tasty pizza slices open late at night, run by a friendly guy with a smile on his face - what more do you want.  Anyone giving this place less than a 5 is an asshole.
