I'm trying to figure out why this place is given 4 stars. It's just teeming with fat and the crust becomes inundated with oil. On top of that, the paper plates also get soaked in oil. It tastes good, cheap. but it's just greasy.

If you come in here without sky-high expectations, you won't be disappointed. If you're like I was -- hungry after a baseball game, staying at a nearby hotel, and not wanting to bother to go to someplace fancier -- then Pizza Zone will be more than adequate.
I'm gonna get a slice of cheesecake and a bottle of water. Oh hi Susan.

Went to fisherman's wharf today with my daughter and tried this place out fair prices food was good for the price it's not strong pizza very mild but has good flavor I would recommend it for somebody that's looking for a good deal the fellow behind the counter was pleasant to deal with.
Pizza is great but DON'T GET A SALAD!

Went here only because of close proximity to our hotel. Bought a slice that was pre-made and sitting for a warmer for who knows how long. The pre-made slices are cheese and they add toppings and throw it back in the oven for a few minutes. Decent pizza, but not fantastic. Would be better if it was cheaper.

Ordered a cheese for the kids and a ham and onion for adults.  Both pies were good.  Quality cheese with fresh toppings.  Onions we're cut huge as slices of white onions.  I was concerned by the other reviews on the dough but found it to be pretty firm and good.  I'd hit this again for a pie up to the hotel room.

Amazing service and a great deal for "one slice" of pizza, it's really more like two slices.  Which was great because I was hungry.  And the guy working there was very nice to us and we didn't have to wait long for our freshly cooked pizza slices.  :D

Pizza was freshly made when you placed your order. The crust was really good but a little too greasy. I ordered the meat combo and I liked it except the sausage pieces. It just didn't taste very good but everything else was. Would try again.
A friend of mine has fond memories of this place so we had to grab dinner here.
I recently stopped into this place after a long day of riding public transit and walking around the wharf. They sell pizza by the slice, and also whole pizzas.

Horrible service & horrible pizza! I ordered a medium pizza with half ham and pineapple & half pepperoni and they charged me for two pizzas! Each half counts as a whole pizza...wtf! I ended up paying $52 for a medium pizza, 3 drinks and some buffallo wings...and the pizza and the wings were not even good...Never again! Plus I had to get up to ask for a refill and to get my check because our server never came back to check on us once we got our ridiculously expensive pizza.
Pizza after a long night, why not?

Rather pricey for a piece of pizza, at least the slice was pretty big.  (I was actually shocked at how big the slices were.). As for quality it was decent pizza nothing amazing but more then serviceable to hit the spot.
High prices - four bucks for a slice of plain cheese. No local discounts.  Nothing is made fresh, its all sitting out getting old.
Excellent pizza and food. Great customer service. I highly recommend this place i come here every night!
Come on! Give me a piece of pizza! No! It's 1 minute after one! Forget this place.....go across the street to PIZZA ZONE!!! Outstanding customer service there.
We were disappointed with the quality and taste of the pizza.  It was well below expectations and wouldn't go back.

Fairly quick service on a busy day at the Fishermans Wharf.  Pizza was pretty good, although pepperoni a bit greasier than most...  I would come here again though, it was the closest pizza by slice at the wharf and less of a wait than other fast food places nearby.
Pretty damn good pizza, nice big slices you can fold.
EEK-if this is considered good west coast pizza, I sincerely feel bad for the entirety of the west coast.  Being a Philly kid myself, I know good pizza.  And unfortunately this is not it.
Good down and dirty street pizza. No fu fu no frills, just good pizza.
Kind of a small place but with seating.  Bottled soda only, no refillable fountain.
Standard pizza, standard price, standard service.  Nothing great but makes a nice quick and cheap lunch.

We needed a quick snack & it's located really close to our hotel (yay for convenience) so headed across the street.  $3.75 slice, fountain drinks $1.85, 16 oz (boo) and $1.00 refill (double boo). Veggie slices?  Awesome.  bell peppers, tomato, cheese & onions. the crust was perfect (i'm a crust girl) - slightly crispy but not burnt.  the owner (who helped us) seemed nice.

I was visiting San Francisco this weekend and it was freezing cold so I was craving something warm like pizza. I didnt know of any places to eat pizza, but this place definately hit the spot. The gentleman who helped me who looked like the owner was really nice and provided great service.
Been here twice. Crappy pizza but sometimes u gotta eat. I do like that they have garlic powder.

I didn't have such a good experience here. Me and my mom came here for lunch and it seemed like an okay place to eat. After we ordered, the table behind us got their pizza and immediately they started freaking out. The longest piece of hair came out of the cheese, i felt disgusted. When we got home to eat the pizza, my mom realized they charged her for a salad that she didn't get and the pizza taste like pure salt and grease. Not to mention, you can get the exact same wings at safeway but cheaper...

THE WORST PIZZA I HAVE EVERRR HAD.  It may have been because it was late at night.  For 3.75 a slice, it was a rip off.  Tthe guy took a piece of pizza that had been prepared earlier (not made fresh) threw some mozzarella and uncooked mushrooms on it, and finally just threw it into the pizza oven.  It was absolutely the worst meal so far on my family vacation.
While out searching for lunch at Fisherman's Wharf, the smell of pizza caught our attention and we wandered over to Pizza Zone.
courteous service, hot food.

Considering this place is in the tourist part of town, I was pretty impressed with what we got for about ten bucks.  My daughter and I each got a piece of pizza and a soda and were out the door for almost exactly $10.  The pizza isn't fabulous, but it's not bad either.  The slices are large and one piece is definitely enough for a meal.  I do tend to dab off the extra grease with my napkin before eating it, but all is all, not too bad.  This isn't a place I'd go out of my way to get to, but if we were in the area and looking for a quick and cheap bite to eat, I'd go back.
Like everyone else, i was surprised that a chinese guy can make such good pizza.  It was about $7 for a slice of pizza, salad, and a drink.  a pretty good deal.

After a night of partying, there's always that greasy-food craving - that's how we ended up at this pizza joint. As my friends and I made our way of The Parlor, the only thing open and walking distance from where we were was Pizza Zone. Quickly, a line formed where we had our choice of plain cheese or pepperoni.
my favorite part about pizza zone is that your slice of delicious pizza comes with a second, identical slice of pizza. so they won't be lonely in your stomach at 2AM.
Chinese people make good pizza for $5 per slice.  Ballas!

Such a disappointment. I called to make an order for delivery on the companies' website and got an email confirmation. I waited for an hour and nothing came... so I called and the guy was extremely rude. I would have loved to have tried the food as I was extremely hungry, but I don't see how this can even get one star with its horrible customer service and no shows.

Excellent authentic cuisine!  We were impressed that we could get a table on a Saturday night.  The service was excellent!  We haven't had this authentic of Pakistani food since we dined at Mirchi, in Calgary.

Not All you can eat, too expensive, not worth it. Went for all you can eat lunch. All you can eat only includes 1 naan; 'more is extra'. So not actually all you can eat. Pretty surly, seemed to not really enjoy having customers. 11.95 for lunch buffet is expensive - I think they've raised their prices since they've opened. Was very empty inside. Palak Paneer was OK, Chicken Tikka was terrible, very runny and too heavy on the tomato flavor.

I go to the lunch buffet occasionally, and they always have a vegan option, if not two. Eat as much as you want, including rice (and if your not gluten free, naan) Not many gluten free vegan options in the warf, so I'm glad this is here.

I recently had dinner at this location to catch up with my girlfriends after work. It was busy evening on a weekday but we were seated in a prompt manner. I was really pleased with the service. They were helpful and attentive to our table of four. The price for the main dishes to the side orders were reasonable. The unique interior colors and décor adds a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere to LAVA. The catchy Bollywood music videos on TV kept us entertained while we waited for our meal. The food arrived in a timely fashion on our table. There was a cute guy behind the cash register so we had plenty to giggle and blush about! I'm really OCD when it comes to clean utensils. Everything was spotless! I absolutely love the location!!!
Just had lunch.  Great food.  Here on vacation, seen it walking by yesterday, and knew we had to try it today.  Very friendly help.  Loved the thickness of the naan they served here.

A MUST TRY!!!! Had a fantastic meal tonight at Lava!!! The Lava Special Lamb with extra vegetables was to die for!!! I am very hard to please when it comes to Indian restaurants, but I will surely be back to Lava every time I come to visit San Francisco.

The food is of excellent quality, well priced and with large portions. I think it would be considered North Indian cuisine. My friends had Beryani and I had chicken Jalfrezi along with paneer naan.   All was rich in flavor and very fresh.  The store doesn't look like much from the outside and is basic inside but the food is great. I hope they are able to make it as its in a competitive touristie area where people are more like to eat at an Applebee's or Joe's Crab Shack than authentic Indian cuisine.

Fantastic food. I had the paneer tikka masala chai tea and rad malai. The flavored are rich and tangy. Prices are reasonable. I especially enjoyed the chai tea with the tasty spice dregs at the bottom obviously not from a mix! The service was excellent, friendly and just overall a great vibe in this place.
The food here is great! I eat a lot of Indian food and the food here is by far the best and most authentic!!
Not sure why this restaurant has two different Yelp pages!
Here I found indian and Pakistani specials like lamb keema naan,panner tikka masala,chicken tikka masala,fruit salad,rice puddy etc..there are many special items are very tasty...

I went there for lunch and I ordered lava special chicken and butter chicken both dishes were very delicious I never eat like these before and service was very good and restaurant was very clean and employees were very friendly I will definitely go there again

Food is less then average. It all tastes the same. Malai kofta were hard and veg tikka masala was blend. But has same gravy. Appetizers aren't even worth mentioning. The worst part was when we wanted to split the bill the host said they would charge $.50 per transaction.  Restaurant looks run down place but repainted by a person who probably didn't even bother to check a youtube video of how to paint. Over all avoid it if you can. Not worth the price. $11.99 for veg entrees. Rather drive a few miles and goto ViVA GOA.

I can't say more on the environment, the clientele, the look, the feel, the food, BEER selections, the soups, the bread, the decor and feeling of being in a mini SF quick diner, but has a restaurant feel, they will serve you! Outside seating with heaters for a high wind area. Fantastic job bringing some SF outside of SF feel, and a clear view of the bakers, amazing everything here, and when I feel the need to taste some Sourdough with an edge of hard crust and delicious flavors, this is your spot, this is the place to go for Clam Chowder Bowls, and The Chili here is breathetakingly delicious. I cannot speak on how delicious everything on the menu is here. Bring on more items and varied selections.
Clam chowder is barely a good. I would say 2 out if 10.  Not sure why people say it's good it's is below average in my opinion.

This seems like the place to go for a clam chowder when you're in SF.  Just not the place for me.  The one thing I did enjoy here is the bread bowl.  The sourdough bread was fresh and fluffy.  And it had the sourdough taste that I come to expect from a great bread bowl.  However the chowder itself was just subpar.  I didn't get that many clams in it.  I do prefer a chunkier chowder.  And this place felt it lacked the creaminess and meat that I would like to see.  It seemed almost watered down.
The manager saved this review from being a single star.
Totally not worth the money ! Long lines for nothing . Can't keep the place clean , very expensive , I'll pass next time
Come to San Fran to eat clam chowder and come across this place. I would recommend on a very cold day to warm your bones

One of the great places in San Francisco that never fails to impress me. We met a gentleman named Andrew who was absolutely amazing and even danced with my father in law doing his famous dance. Great personality and superb customer service.
What can I say??? AWESOME! We had the breakfast here. French toast was amazing, of course...

Loved this place. We bought a 1.5 lbs pound of sourdough bread to take back home. This location was packed with tons of tourist and tons of bread. We did eat here one night - we ordered the pizza margarita and a sandwich, What we did not like was if you sit inside (upstairs) the price is double what you pay for eating outside. This might be ok - if its not cold outside but the price difference is not what I would call ok. We like the product sold but not the difference in prices if a customer sits inside or outside.
The soup bowls are amazing! I had the chili, clam chowder and tomato soup. Can't complain about any of them and the bread is to die for.
The bread bowl was superb, but the clam chowder was certainly lacking. Also, I found it a bit absurd that we paid $50 for 3 soups & a sandwich.

Figured I would try this place since it is San Francisco's sourdough. I got the combo, half a turkey and havarti sandwich with the rustic tomato soup. I enjoyed the parmesan and croutons in the soup and also the sourdough bread the sandwich came on. My only complaint about the sandwich is that the bread was super tough as though it may have not been fresh. My experience was pretty mediocre, nothing to write home about.

We ate here twice during our 3 day stay, and we love the sourdough bread bowls with clam chowder and even the sourdough tortillas for the fish tacos. The seafood tastes so fresh, it doesn't have that fishy taste to it. We also had breakfast, and they put a veggie scramble in a bread bowl too! Take the Boudin Museum walk upstairs, its neat reading all the facts about this bakery.  Waiters are friendly, but the front hostess people need to work on their attentiveness.
5 stars for the sourdough bread bowl! 3 for the clam chowder. This is a must-visit spot when traveling to San Francisco.

Nothing special. The bread bowl clam chowder was okay, the free bread was tougher then normal, and the pizza was greasy.  I might have been more disappointed but we weren't very hungry when we went, we only went to meet a friend. Catch the bread making "show", no need to stay for the food.

I don't know what it is about this place, but I absolutely crave it.  Every time I'm in SF, my mind always comes here and I always get the chowder in a bread bowl.  I know it's touristy and I know it's neither the best bread or the best; chowder, but it's the best to me!  It's the best to me!

Tasty food! No need to pay for that silly tour, just show your receipt from the upstairs bistro to get in for free. You could also watch the demos of the bread being made from outside on Lincoln (facing the Wax Museum) for free, that was enough for us.
Boudin seems like such a San Francisco staple. Gotta love that sourdough!

Been here a few times. Had the bread bowl breakfast dish a couple years ago...which was ok, nothing to write home about. Had their clam chowder, which was kinda meh, and I've watched the fun alligator, teddy bear, and turtle shaped bread making process several times. Always a fun, but busy place to visit. I definitely think their signature sour dough bread is good, but their food is always meh to ok.

This iconic spot on Fisherman's Wharf has delicious soups, sandwiches, and salads. The bread is fresh and tasty whether you go with their famous sourdough or another variety. All fresh, all delicious. The wait was not too bad on a crowded summer afternoon - maybe about 10 minutes from the time we got in line until we got our tray of food. Their bakery treats are immeasurably delicious as well. The macaroon cookie and the almond paste cookie with chocolate and the chocolate chip cookie - all really yummy. I would visit here again and again and again for a quick bite while strolling the wharf.

this is a tourist trap---but you knew that because it's the fisherman's wharf. walking through the fisherman's wharf is like walking through macy's the week before christmas. it makes you really hate fat white bearded men.
Service was extremely professional, the oysters were fresh and the crab cake sandwich was quite awesome!  The crab cakes were not overdone so I could actually taste the crab and it's quite fresh!!

I'm not sure why everyone is hating on Boudin so much- they are fantastic!!  It's this huge awesome building right in Fisherman's Wharf (which, yes, does make it another tourist trap but that's because it is so fun and delicious!) They have a nice selection of sugar cane soda and also their delicious bread bowls.  Sure, you can go somewhere else and get one of these bad boys- but Boudin's is part of the experience and definitely is something that should be done at least once.

We had the shrimp, the clam chowder bowl and the chili bowl and this was the best place we ever had that has the clam chowder and chili bowls we wanna try other places but we had to get back to Los Angeles.

I see some of the reviews are fairly harsh but if you are have a quick meal on Fishermans wharf this is great! It is outside but that I think is part of the atmosphere. I went through the sidewalks with the other vendors and it was so crowded and people were pushing and shoving and standing to eat their chowder. This was great cause you see all that but you are able to grab a seat and eat. I had the lemon garlic shrimp and it was awesome!!! I am not a fan of chowder but the gal I was with had it and said it was the best she has ever had. I think if you are in SF you need to go to one of the Boudin locations, they have wonderful bread and make it in some very cool shapes.

The few times that I tried this location, I could smell a faint smell of chlorine on my food.  Perhaps it was the utensils or the plates, but there it was an unmistakable whiff of chlorine. I thought it was may be just once, but when I had it on my other visit, I mentioned it to the staff.  The visit after that, same thing.  The food is just OK for me.  The bread can be a little soggy sometimes and the turkey doesn't taste as fresh as it can be.  They are convenient and fast and they are open fairly late, so if you are nearby and there is nothing else, you can give them a try.
I love clam chowder, and I actually like Boudin's.  I end up eating the entire bread bowl and then regretting life afterwards, but I eat it just the same.
My nephew turned 32 years old today and all he wanted was to go to Fisherman's Wharf and have chowder in a bread bowl. His ultimate wish since he has never had it that way.

I felt like I was on display eating in here behind the clear plastic windows while other folks sat outside on the cement block.  Rebel that I am I still snuck in my bread bowl of clam chowder purchased from a different vendor, but bent over to Boudin's by purchasing pizza and a soda.
Today I realized how pathetically delusional I am. I thought the NEW ENGLAND clam chowder in San Francisco would compare to the stuff in NEW ENGLAND. Nuh-uh.
"Oh, here's the shortest chowder line! Let's go here!" The WORST chowder I've ever had. Even canned chowder tastes way better. D'OH!
I felt like this Boudin is a spinoff and unlike the other Boudins.

Why has this not been rated yet?  Oh yeah, because the employees are rude, the food surprisingly tasteless, and prices which are even worse.  This location is by the west end of the embarcadero parking lot, it's the large octagonal building with the public bathrooms attached to them (clue?).  Apparently, anybody who knows better does not go here.  I was naive once years ago and thought why the hell not?  Big mistake, then about early 2007 I decided to give it another shot.  Well that took care of that.  I will strongly advise anyone against going here for anything other than to use the tables for eating another restaurant's food.
Great quality at great prices! The food always is prepared as before!

Service was great, food very tasty with generous helpings.  The only issue we had was that they close at 9pm and by 8:50 or so when we wanted another cup of tea they told us they had already thrown it out.  Otherwise it was great!

I'm Vietnamese , this place sucks . Bad service , they are not even close to qualified to making pho .  This place would ruin  Cup O Noodles ! No parking . No drinks on the menu were available . I have nothing nice to say about this dump .
Love it! Cheap, fast and good.
Totally unpretentious and good value. No need to worry this place will not get overrun with gentrifying hipsters(Gipsters?)because it is too real.

I la la la la looooove this place. Their seafood pho is the best I've ever had! Their bbq pork chop is really good and their beef and broccoli. That what my family and I get whenever we go. I'm kinda sad that one of the waitress quit. She was my favorite. The new one is okay but I just go for the food that's it.
3/7/14  Lunch

The food quality is pretty decent. My parents and I usually eat here when we are in the Chinatown area. I have gotten their bun bo hue and I enjoyed it. My mom got the seafood pho which was supposed to come with shrimp and she only got a puny one. She told the waitress and she got some more for her so I guess that was nice. No small or large, there is only one size so prepare to be full afterwards. However, the service is a tad slow. Usually have to wait about 20 mins for the food to come out after ordering.

Good reasonably priced food.  Good portions and straightforward menu.  CASH ONLY, though, so be prepared.  They also are closed Sunday.  Beef & Chicken Phos are faves, but BBQ meat plates are also yummy.
This place is usually open late, so if you are looking for late-night Pho, this would be one place to go to. Also, the Pho does taste pretty good.
I'm a big fan of pho, both of the South Vietnamese and North Vietnamese variety.
Stopped in randomly on a nice day with the boyfriend.
The sweet smells of cinnamon and star anise always seem to seep out the restaurant as I walk by in the evening so I was excited to stop by for some pho on this chilly day.
This is my go-to Vietnamese restaurant whenever I'm in the area. Portions are big and the food is CHEAP.
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Food tastes so good and cheap. I probably come here more than three times a week. I would say Pho Vung Tau is one of the best restaurant in North Beach area.
All of the noodle soup my family ordered are so bland...this is waste of time and money...just so happened to pass by it and was so hungry but our hunger did not help make the food taste any good...

It's pretty good here! Their bowl portion is SO big, omg I could barely finish my bowl of pho, and I LOVE pho too. It's bigger than my head D; But overall, it taste so good, I'll be coming back here more often. My favorite pho place in chinatown :)

north beach casual meal...returning to find pho vung tau...replacing chic-n-noodle-do vietnamese...returning with locals...taking recommendations...chicken and beef satay noodle soup requested...hot, rich and flavorful...good size and filling...the fried egg rolls on the other hand...decent, but quite thin...small and long...tasting mostly fried skin and very little filling...get a rich bowl of noodle soup at pho vung tau...
Vietnamese omelet is very interesting.

I only come to this place because it is conveniently close to work.  Last Friday I ordered Bun Rieu and walked out smelling like Korean BBQ.  Their Bun Rieu is not authentic.  They give you half of a tomato with overcooked pork meatballs.  I don't remember seeing any tofu and question if there are any crab meat in this noodle soup at all.  Their imperial rolls are also really tiny, probably the size of an index finger for comparison.

So we order a squid salad to start and share before our 2 bowls of pho. The salad comes out and it smells like an overnight trash bin from a seafood market. We point this out to the server who was very apologetic then the female owner or manager comes out and starts yelling NOTHING WRONG WITH SALAD, YOU PAY, YOU HAVE TO PAY. It was like a frickin" comedy skit, quite hilarious. I left and had a great lunch a block away at Yuet Lee.
Food - CHEAP! Most things under $7 and huge portion size.
no service and cheat customer's tips.

This place serves one of the best Satay Beef Noodle Pho I've had in a while. The place looks pretty clean and service is average but nice. Serving size is above average for San Francisco. I'm impressed.

So I've only came here to eat the pho usually since its close to where I get my hair cut. I don't have any complaints here since the pho seems decent here and the portion is well sized for the price. I may try the rice plates and other things since that is what other people seem to talk about. But the broth isn't overly salty and the noodle to meat proportion seems equal, not too much of anything. Ingredients like the bean sprouts seem clean and fresh. Overall the food here is pretty good, service is okay. For a place in Chinatown though, it's pretty darn clean! I still probably won't eat off the table if something fell, but it's cleaner and not sticky like other places in Chinatown. Overall, worth a try!
Great food taste just like home cooking. But beware they always seem to run out of ice??
shrimp roll is good and thats all i get wen im here lol. im pretty sure the food is good and will come back since its in the neighborhood my friend lives in
Good food, good service = 5 stars.

Happened to take a chance on this place. Doesn't look like the cleanest restaurant but that's usually the type with the best food. Ordered the shrimp rolls, Dac Biet bowl, and wifey got the seafood jean mein. Surprisingly, the entrees were pretty good, but the shrimp roll bordered on bland. The mein came out shaped like a bird's nest so that was unique. Don't order the viet sandwiches as there's more bread than meat in it. Prices overall were on the low end. Good place for lunch but watch out for rude chinese patrons. We'll still be back.
The vegetarian spring rolls are awesome! I've now had them twice.

Finally tried this restaurant after passing by it so many times. Came on a Saturday around 1 and it was pretty packed. There was a group ahead of us but we got seated  right away. I doubt the authenticity of how Vietnamese it is since the waitresses were Chinese but maybe the chef is Viet? Ehh who knows. We ordered a #27 and what would be a #1 in other pho restaurants but here, it's #20 or something, and a Thai iced tea. #27 was a spicy beef stew with egg noodles and it was alright, but there was a layer of oil floating in the soup and it wasn't spicy :( I tried some of the #20 and the noodles weren't as chewy as I like it... Their tea that they use to make the Thai iced tea must've been steeped for too long because the color of the drink was wayyyy too dark. I  guessed that they didn't have time to make it right since they only have 2 waitresses working.
For the low prices and fresh tasting food, I would definitely return.
Had rare beef Pho the broth had a unique cinamon/anise type of flavor that I could not pinpoint not in a bad way just unique.

I went to Pho Vung Tau for the first time and ordered what I normally order at Vietnamese restaurants, the #1 Beef noodle soup. It was pretty delicious. At least delicious enough to make me want to drink the soup. The service was not bad either.
After dropping by semi-consistently over a few months, I finally got a smile out of the owners! HAHA!
The place was pretty packed whenever we came in for lunch, but we got a table quick. Mom got the Special Beef Pho while I got the BBQ Chicken Pho w/ fishballs.

The mung bean and coconut milk drink was a wonderful and refreshing introduction to what I was about to experience.  The enormous, piping-hot bowl of BBQ beef pho arrived before me with all of the necessary fixings; I only wish it were smaller so I could have had room to try more items, like the delicious-looking Vietnamese sandwiches.  The staff was attentive enough to cater to a consistent ebb-and-flo crowd as well, and the free green tea was a lovely gesture.

i've been coming to this place for a long time and they don't disappoint!! i usually  have dinner there but my hubby decided to have lunch.OMG the place was packed but it was a short wait . the food is as good  as it was. the seafood noodle soup the broth is the DA BOMB!!!

It's a hole in the wall place, but it's a standard spot for me and my roommate. Everything there is super tasty and we've always had good service. It's also really clean and the prices are great. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Chinatown.

There are those times when I wish I rely less on Yelp and more on instinct for my dinner here turned out to be a huge mistake.  First off, the customers dining in when I visited recently were all non-Asian.  At a peak dinner hour that should have raised a red flag, but I stayed anyway because I was hungry and I was curious.  I had just hiked down from Van Ness Avenue and Sacramento Street after volunteering at a One Brick event, and not having had lunch I was starved.
Great margaritas, decent food, San Francisco prices for sure (but it is Pier 39), great view from out on the porch.

Decided to give this place a try, granted, probably not the best place to try when visiting the pier but the family I came with doesn't eat seafood and is quite bland in their food selection, needless to say, we tried it and it was "cool", everything from the food to the service, was just "cool", the items they sell aren't hard Mexican dishes to butcher, though they do offer some more authentic items and dishes, we all played it safe and went the normal Mexican food dishes, ie: carne asada, quesadilla, carne asada burrito and the mango guacamole(which is literally guacamole with mango cut up put on top lol) would I come back? Eh prolly, but it won't be my first choice in this area, but this place holds it's own and it's not terrible...

Took 15 mins to get a water.  Had to find a manager to as about where our chips were- that we PAID for. Tortilla soup wasn't tasty, tortilla themselves were gross and the fajitas didn't come with cheese and the meat was bland as heck. Will never return.

Visited on Tuesday, 11/04/14 around 6:30 p.m. Was a little skeptical at first because place was pretty empty, but chips, salsa and drinks sounded great.... We were blown away. We had phenomenal service. The food was fantastic. I would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone in the mood for mexican food. My husband and I don't eat meat, and asked if there were other options. We got the taco trio (veggie version) and wow! Amazing!!! Everything was right on!
One real treat when it comes to Mexican food! great attention and great people! the perfect place to have a meal in front of the sea and enjoy San Francisco.

Awesome location as well as good service and a fairly reasonable menu given the prime location. Drinks, especially Margaritas are pricey! $10.00 for  standard up to $18.00 for a specialty drink with top shelf liquer. Al in all it's a good deal and they run Groupon specials as well as a deal on Yelp

I would give this place zero stars if Yelp allowed it. The place was pretty empty when my family and I arrived, and that should have been our first sign. No chips and salsa were served, which is the main reason people love mexican food. I got the tortilla soup, which came with my meal, and it was terrible. It was watery and looked exactly like it was taken out of a Cambells soup can and they added sour cream. I had the waiter take it back and switch it for the Cesear salad. It was less than great as well. There was parmasan piled on top of it that was clearly not fresh, and it had tortilla strips randomly placed on top. Now to the main meals...my mother had the carne asada, and it was clearly some reheated, dry, week old meat. It was laughable that they called that food. My daughter had the chicken enchiladas and they were even worse. It was cold in the middle, which showed it wasnt fresh and was some frozen food topped with red sauce. There was 4 of us that ate and we had no dessert or appetizers and our meal cost us over 90 dollars. I didnt want to punish the server for the terrible food so we still gave a good tip, but to pay almost 100 dollars for food that was something I wouldn't feed my dog was ridiculous.  Worst Mexican food that Ive ever had...hands down

me and my husband chose this restaurant because we love mexican food. I had the enchiladas and he had the carnitas platter. We loved the view and we also loved the margaritas. Great waitress and nice staff
Great view! Fajitas were very good!!! Good drinks!! Nice patio with a view. Fun atmosphere.

They wouldn't seat us on the deck, though they had plenty of available tables and the couple after us got seated on deck with a view of marina. We weren't asked if we wanted our beverage refilled. Salsa was good but chips were  the tri colored mass produced  sitting in boxes around the restaurant. We struggled to get our bill so we wouldn't miss our ferry. Food was ok, the mango sauce on the burrito was interesting and unique, too bad they didn't put more on it, it was the best part of the meal.

Bought the Groupon because it was our cheapest option on the Pier, but was a bit nervous with the reviews. The service was super fast, nice & the food was great! Once we presented the Groupon though, our server didn't really tend to us anymore. I want to say through, I'm sure most people only tip based on the groupon discount (unfortunately) & they just get disappointed with the lack of tip. Just present your groupon as late as possible so they don't get disappointed & provide bad service! ;)
Not bad for what you pay for. However it's nothing special. The service was good and they have a lot of options for each dish, but nothing thrilling. Large portions.

I have been there three times but the first time was the best was about two or three years ago when the blue angels were in town and i went there with my husband and some friends. They had these rum buckets and they were $5 and they were totally awesome. They don't seem to have them anymore but they were sooo good!! The food is pretty good but they have gotten more expensive since the first time I went there.

We got great service and the food was touristy but decent and tasty. What more could you expect? The margarita was delicious and the mango burrito is huge! Totally worth the price while sitting on the pier.
Horrible experience.

My girlfriend and I were visiting San Francisco on a vacation. We stopped here because we had enough of the local fare and were missing Mexican food. I wish we never would have stopped here, it was the worst Mexican food we've ever had, not to mention they charge $2 for chips and salsa (wtf?) We did get the chips and salsa and the salsa was very good.  The meat is gross, fatty and looks and smells like dog food. I got the nachos with half beef half pollo asada, they were both bland and gross. My g/f got the queso fundido, it was gross and had meat in it, we've never had queso fundido with meat before. This place was so horrible we stopped eating our food and started eating the fruit we bought at the little farmers market down by pier 39 while we were walking around.

I had the fam-bam visiting so of course we did the tourisy stuff on the Pier and Fisherman's Wharf while we waited for our "Ride the Duck" tour. Wanted to grab something to eat so we choose Mango's. Also found a groupon so it that was a bonus because if the food was not up to par, at least I wouldn't feel that bad using a groupon!

My first trip here during vacation was awesome. Please ask for Carlos. You will be treated as if you are the only ones there. He is very personable, friendly and attentive. Obvoiosly, because of him we came a second time. We were not fortunate enough to get him again, but low and behold he showed up for his shift to be a bus boy and watching from afar he started clapping at the start of his shift engaging other coworkers. Awesome! He later spotted us and remembered us and came over to say hello! Oh, by the way the food is awesome too! You have to come here!

Rude and disorganized staff that don't understand how to provide simple basic service for hungry customers. Management hasn't taught or empowered staff to provide quick simple service for basic requests.

Here at Mangos at the moment enjoying some delicious enchiladas and a Michelada to quench my thirst :)  Love this place!! The service is always great, drinks are refreshing and on point and the food is delicious!! Have no complaints!!

The food is good. The service needs work! I order a platter of 3 tacos and at the top of the menu it shows the different meats. I asked for two shrimp and one steak and he told me ship is extra???? At the top it show shrimp as one of the choices of meats and no mention that it will be a 1.50 extra per taco I thought that was lame and 2.00 for chips and salsa was lame too! I had to keep asking for things instead of our waiter asking us if we needed anything.
The food is exceptionally delicious and the patio atmosphere is the greatest location on the pier. I recommend the shredded pork tacos Delicious!!!

After a long day in the city we happened upon this place as the wait at most of the restaurants on the pier were over an hour or longer. This place is not very big, but the hosts did their very best to accommodate our party of 11.  The chips and salsa were adequate, but the entrees were actually quite good. My wife ordered the mango burrito, however it was a little sweet for her taste and when she told them that she didn't like it they quickly removed it from the tab and replaced it with some nachos. I had some fish tacos and they were quite tasty, my daughters carne asada burrito was also very good. Our server was very attentive and the fact that he didn't charge us for the food my wife didn't like was a plus to the service of this place. We will definitely go back to this place in the future, and try some of the other delectable entrees that are available on the menu.

A bit expensive especially for mediocre food. You can definitely find better Mexican food in the Mission District of San Francisco. However, my roommate and I were pleasantly surprised by one thing on their menu-- the churros!! You get about eight half foot churros for seven dollars. They are cream-filled and come with a chocolate dipping sauce, so they actually end up tasting a lot like boston cream pie, but with cinnamon! So if you do go to Mango's, GET THE CHURROS.

Service is terrible. Some of them talk trash about the customers in Spanish, because for whatever reason they think people can't understand them. I also heard them laugh about how they messed with one person's food after that person made a request to change it (that time in English, because they thought they were far enough away from the customer.)

I'm being really generous to give this place 2 stars. The food was great, that isn't the problem. It's the service that sucks!!!! Not only does the service suck but they calculate the bill with the gratuity already included and we must pay that amount! I did not see a sign posted anywhere saying that the tip was already included. The waiters didn't even deserve a tip because they acted careless toward our table. My friend had asked for some Splenda to 2 different waiters and they said okay but neither of them got it for her. Don't recommend.
We chose to laugh and not cry from our experience there so we could avoid ruining our night. Maybe this will make you laugh too.

Bad things happen to you when you cheat on a diet; you end up eating useless calories and none of them are worth it, even a tiny bit - That happened to me at Mango's. Mango's food is very very blah. It is a bummer that they have such a great location and they don't utilize it to its best. They have a great patio area with amazing views. The greatness ends here though. I must give a special mention to the chicken tortilla soup here, it is the grossest thing I have seen and tasted in a long time, its watery, has sour cream floating in it like globs and tastes like canned broth. Bad Bad Bad - Mango's! The chicken fajitas were ok, nachos were ok'ish too. Long story short, it is one of the places that serves mediocre food in a great location. You would be better off getting some sour dough bread and butter from Boudin and eating it while watching them sea lions.

Mango's is one of my favorite places to dine at Pier 39. The view of the Bay is great on a sunny day. The customer service here is always on point, thank you to Alan for always making my dining experience enjoyable. The workers there are always polite. The food is great and the ceviche is amazing!
My family and I had lunch here today . Alan was our server and he was great . He was real attentive, customer service was excellent and the food was great. Thanks again guys !!!
4 words: Do not go here!

Service was slow, but the place was really busy. I thought the mango burrito was delicious, but I couldn't finish it! Also, we liked 50% of the margaritas we ordered. Not the greatest, but not too bad.
I think they are trying get back good image. The were very nice and fast  there was only 4 other tables full. Food was in abundance   Taste was middle of road.

We had a Groupon for this place. I usually wait til the end to say I have a groupon because they will treat you like crap if you do but I feel like he already knew. I immediately noticed he was not very friendly. I let that slide hoping the food would make up for the rudeness. After we ordered our food I realized I wanted a Fanta and I noticed people had chips. It took him 15 minutes to notice that we needed something. Then another 10 minutes to get our chips and salsa. When I asked for chips and salsa he rudely said that'll be a $2 charge. I said yes of course that's fine. What Mexican restaurant charges for chips and salsa?
To preface this review, I'll say that this is based off of only one experience. But when your first experience wasn't so great, what would make you want to keep coming back?

My group had a reservation for 8 people. When they arrived they were told they did not have a reservation and they could not be seated. Shortly thereafter I got a phone call asking why we had skipped out on our reservation because there were lots of people there who wanted our table.

This place is what pier 39 needed, it's one of the only Mexican food places around there. The service is good and the waiters are attentive. I had the mango steak burrito and it was absolutely great. Their mango sauce had a unique and authentic taste to it. I would definitely go back.
Horrible service. Chips and salsa are a paid add on. The heaters on the balcony don't work. They also don't allow checks to be split. It has been a while since I've had this bad of an experience.
The food was pretty good, I did not like the sauce and the waiter kept forgetting our items. It was not overcrowded which was nice to find on the pier.

Great place! Ariel and Allen at the bar definitely take care of you. Food is really good and tasty and their portions are pretty big. When the weather is nice, the outdoor sitting in the back gets pretty busy. This would be my everyday spot if it was in The Mission.
My family (of four)  and I went there and on a Saturday night after a long day of exploring the City. We were seated right away but that was the only thing that was quick or decent about our visit.
Undercooked pizza. This was disappointing, the service was good and the pizza could have been good if it was cooked more. Only one bathroom toilet for women.

I was a little grumpy when i stepped inside Luigi's. I was none too happy to be visiting a pizza place while on Pier 39, and a touristy pizza place at that. But that was what the group wanted. While it wasn't the greatest pizza in the world it wasn't awful. The crust was buttery with a parmesan and herb dusting but the pie was a bit undercooked. The Treasure Island (italian sausage, ground beef, mushroom, bell pepper & onion) was bland. The meat lovers was not. Anyways, Luigi's turned my frown upside down.

Wow! What a disappointment! We visited Luigi's on Aug. 21. There were six of us including two of my grandchildren. The place is dark and dreary, the bathrooms disgusting, the service horrible and the food lack-luster at best!!
No strollers allowed. Pizza was greasy and flavorless. The waiter was pretty nice though

Ahh...after sitting in traffic over 2 hours coming from Hayward we ended up at Pier 39 and saw they had a pizza place, considering we wanted to try a pizza place further out in SF and we were so hungry.

This place was definitely so randomly put out of somewhere at the Pier 39 and nowhere as good as a Pizza Hut down the street. The food was just OKAY and If it were to be the last place opened out here, would I only go.

Me and my significant other came here; got seated; waited for 10 minutes while servers walked past us... On my way out (after not being able to wait any longer, as my stomach was growling) I spoke to the manager about the lack of service received,  he said "thanks for telling me. " That was it.
Was meeting up with my fiancé's family, who was visiting from out of town. They wanted pizza on the pier and I knew I had been to a pizza place before but I thought it was Pizza My Heart.

I was really hoping for some GOOD Italian food, wings WAY too salty, portions are REALLU small for their prices. Another thing too, is the BATHROOM! Looks like it hasn't been remodeled since it opened.

So I'm not gonna lie, Luigi's was not our first choice.  In town for business, a buddy and I decided to hit the crowded Pier 39 for dinner. Bubba Gumps was our destination but, after seeing their sign, we made a detour.

After a long drive to San Francisco, we were tired, hungry and most other places at Pier 39 quoted 30 minute to 2 hour waits. Despite the lower star rating for Luigi's, we decided to try it. And thankfully we were not disappointed.

We went to Luigi's Pizza as kind of a last resort - it was late, we were tired, hungry and a bit cranky.  We wanted a sit down restaurant where we could get a bite, a drink, and not wait for 30 minutes with my little girl.  Luigi's fit the bill on all accounts.  My wife and I ordered pizza while my mom had a salad.  The pepperoni that I ordered was some of the best pizza that I had eaten in quite some time.  I demolished my pie in record time, and I would have eaten more, had I ordered a larger pizza - it was just that good.  My wife raved about her pizza too.  Not a bite of pizza was left anywhere on the table when we were done.  And the cheesy garlic bread that we ordered as an appetizer (and to give some to our 16mo old daughter) was very good.  The view was pretty good, which was also not something that we expected; we had a nice view overlooking part of the harbor where some local boats were docked.
This isn't an upscale place whatsoever... it's super causal to the T.

Service was good! The buttermilk calamari was excellent. My father LOVED the pizza, he is a deep dish/lots of toppings kind of guy. This pizza was good but I favor thinner crust lighter pizza. The pizzas was loaded with toppings so if that's what you like go!! I would give Luigis a thumbs up. Very casual, not too expensive, three of us shared calamari and a medium pizza with three drinks for $45. The view of the bay was pretty great too!

Came here while I was waiting for a tour on Blue&Gold Fleet which I don't recommend. Anyways the wait wasn't bad but the service was considering I paid $40 for an appetizer, pizza, and sodas I was expecting more. The waitress was in a pissy mood and was extremely rude. We needed boxes and she delegated the task to someone else. Food was okay nothing great you can get the same quality pizza from dominos or somewhere else. Go to a different restaurant. I'm pretty sure the only reason they are in business is because tourists do not know what's good/bad and they are overpriced so that's what keeps them afloat.
Food is good. The customer service is awesome. Our waiter knew we were from out of town and took the time to recommend places to see.
The pizza was alright.... we ordered a large pizza which wasn't so large. I mean c'mon really? Ugh
Service was fine and fast, food is good, but "Luigi's" must be Italian for "over-priced". If you're looking to drop $7 for French fries, and $13 for a personal pan pizza, this joint is for you!

I ate here once with a girlfriend about 12-13 years ago, which we had a great, friendly service and the place was busy during lunch hour then. Present time, there wasn't a lot of patrons dining here, but the taste of food is still flavorful and service? Friendly as I remembered many years ago.

If I could give 0 stars I would. Waited way too long for our server to greet us. Then, the cheesy garlic bread looked like it came from a microwave and had a hair in it. The pizza was freakin disgusting. Again, looked and tasted like it came from the microwave. The workers were all as rude as can be! They obviously don't care about customer retention because they know they work at a tourist trap. Don't waste your money or time. Too damn expensive for food you can buy in the freezer section at the grocery store and heat up in the microwave at home.

Came to San Fran to visit my fiances family. We were all getting hungry & my fiances fam wanted to eat at Pier 39. Being from Miami, I knew these types of places were tourist places & usually not very good. My fiancé & I wanted to eat somewhere else, but we were already in the area & didn't know where else to go. We decided to get a quick bite here. BIG mistake!

I ate here for the very first time and I loved it! Yeah it was packed and loud but only because there was a birthday party there so I wasn't disappointed or complaining. I share a large cheese pizza with my sister and aunt, and by far the best cheesy pizza I've had! Also the service there was friendly and great!

I usually have Yelp open BEFORE I step into a new restaurant, just to see what other Yelpers think about it and..just in case it's a place I should avoid going to. However, this time I was with my uncle, younger brother and cousin. They were visiting from LA and my uncle wanted to check out Pier 39. The two youngsters were complaining and complaining that they were hungry/dying and demanded pizza and/or pasta. So, we were walking down pier 39 with the rows and rows of shops/restaurants and saw the sign for Luigi's Pizzeria. So, we walked in and I got my phone out to check in. I was pretty shocked to see the 2.5 stars! I didn't want to say anything out loud but I was thinking.. man, we didn't make the best choice of eating here for lunch.
Bruschetta was better than the pizza..
Very let down from this place. Can't even do a pizza??!!! Raw veggies and sauce wasn't great. Also ordered the pesto pasta with chicken. But came with no chicken!
The front desk girl was so nice. And the food was food. Love love love the view from the windows in the back.

My husband had pizza and said he's had a better Hot Pocket. I had spaghetti and meatballs and the meatballs were dry. The pizza was made wrong the first time and the prices are the highest I have ever paid for pizza and pasta. Won't be returning.

I love this place for a quick bite to eat at the Pier.  Family friendly with lots of meals to choose from on the menu.  I have ordered everything from pizza, to pasta and it is all delicious!  I will always return!
This has got to be some of the best pizza I have ever had. My wife and I eat here ever time we come to San Francisco

Great location! Below average food, less than average service.  I guess I should have not gone to a Pizza place on the Wharf expecting anything close to good clam chowder in a fresh bread bowl.  They even served me my Anchor Steam in a Stella glass.  The frozen Mozzerella sticks were not what I expected either. And the worst thing was although the restuarant was pretty empty with more staff than customers the bathrooms were disgusting.  Outside of all that it was ok.

The only reason why I am leaving one star, is because I can't leave zero stars! I am so incredibly disappointed with this restaurant! My family and I traveled 3 hours to San francisco to do some sight seeing and shopping for the day. We were in the mood for some yummy pizza, so decided to give this place a try. The location is great, with a great view! And that's about it! We are seated and aren't even greeted by our server till 10 min later. I go to the bathroom to wash my hands to see a filthy slippery nasty bathroom. I come back out and our server finally shows up, we order our drinks and didn't get them till 15 min later, and don't even get our complete drink order! This entire time, the waiter wasn't even good enough to give us an explanation as into why it was taking so long. It is now 25 min that we have been there. Oh... BTW, we put in our food order with our drink order. We ordered one cup of clam chowder, one order of hot wings and a large combo pizza, kids spaghetti and a kids pepperoni pizza. We got our appetizers (wings and soup) 45 min after later! The wings were an absolute JOKE!!!!!! They were the smallest wings I have seen in my life!! And covered in Reds sauce, nothing special. The clam chowder was tasty, but wasn't your original clam chowder you go to Thee City to eat. It is now one hr and we are still waiting for our pizza! I finally see our waiter, and ask him how much longer it would be for our pizzas and spaghetti and he says he didn't know, but he'd go to check. He comes out 10 min later, with our large pizza and the kids spaghetti and tells us the other kids pepperoni pizza would be out in 5 min. Well it wasn't!!!! We waited 15 min and NO PEPPERONI PIZZA!!!! At that point, I just asked the hostess to get us the manager. As the manager comes out so does the pepperoni pizza. We tell her what's going on and how disappointed we were, and she didn't seem to care, she didn't take the time to talk to us about it, we didn't feel like we were valued costumers,instead she deducted the $24.99 that was the cost of the large pizza! ATTENTION to you LUIGIS PIZZERIA! We are NOT there to get free food! We are there to get GOOD food and GOOD service! She never came to check up on us after that. The pizza was bland and disgusting! I can get better pizza from a box at my local grocery store. The spaghetti gave my daughter a tummy ache and the wings were meat less! They asked us of we wanted a box to take our food home, ummm...No thanks!!!!!We were so angry that out of all the thousands of great restaurants in San Francisco we end up eating at the worst!!!! What a shame to them! I would suggest to Luigi's owners  that you take these reviews very serious, train your staff, train your managers, clean your bathrooms, fix whatever leak you have going on in there, and cook good quality good! I will never ever go here again!
Definitely had better pizza....it was full of oil and on the expensive side. Was here on vacation  and was looking for a good pizza place... Would recommend looking elsewhere

The food was okay, not too amazing and so was the service. It took a while to get our drinks, food and check. The place was pretty okay for a monday and we ended up paying 54-56 dollars for a large pizza and the tortelini with alfredo sauce and chicken. It was good and tasted good, but i don't think i'd go back next time we're Frisco.
The staff is very busy all the time, so dont expect great service. But overall its a good place to eat at the pier if you are on a budget and with a family.

We're in this restaurant at the upper level of the pier.... sitting above water.... and are served FROZEN calamari?????  Yup.... that said it all.  We ordered the calamari appetizer; the calamari had freezer burns on them!  Needless to say, it was not very good.....
The pizza was mediocre at best, especially for the price. The view was lovely. The service was pretty poor. The location is fantastic. In the end, the location/view is it's saving grace.

Not sure about the other locations....but the Pier 39 location had poor quality food, dirty restrooms and a score of 80 (out of 100) on the city health report out front. The city inspector must have felt generous on his latest visit. Avoid this place!

Very mediocre pizza, more of a touristy spot , not a place to go if your looking for real traditional pizza.  Servers are friendly but could be more attentive. Tourists definitely go, the average local it's not worth it!

Not a bad place to grab a bite to eat. Staff was friendly and didn't have to wait to long to sit. Oredered the mozzarella sticks and created or own 10"  Italian sausage and feta cheese pizza. Food came pretty fast for how busy they were. Sticks were pretty good and the pizza was cooked just right. Not a bad meal but a little pricey for what we got, it is on pier 39 though......
this place is closed!

it's great to have another deli in no beach besides molinari's -- especially one open on sundays. great service, huge sandwich, reasonably priced and well made. not very many deli items -- but that's what i go to molinari's for, cheese, meats, olives, and deli items -- not the sandwiches. this is my new panelli bros.

Came here on a monday afternoon which was yesterday... In the past... I have been to Molinari's to many times just to order a sandwich!!! It was time for a change... So I went to try GEPPETTO'S sandwich... The sandwich that, I ordered for the first time at GEPPETTO was a Black Forest Ham, Roast Beef, Mortadella with Swiss Cheese and some pickles on a Sourdough Bread and it was huge!!! Just check out the picture and you' ll know what... I am talking about!!!
Tried a few sandwiches from this place since it opened for business months ago. The sandwiches were edible. But since Molinari is just around the corner, I will not go back.
Great food, awesome and knowledgable staff, this is probably at the top of my North Beach eatery list. All of the food here is tip top quality.

BF suggested Italian Sub. We walked from Russian Hill to NB only to find out that Molinari was closed on Sundays. So we scoped out the menu here for a sandwich. A guy was also checking out the menu and told us that this was a great spot for sandwiches and that we should try it. So we did. One Italian Sub later we were full beyond belief. The sandwich was HUGE. Packed full of meats, cheese and oil and vinegar. Wow. BF and shared it and each portion was so big. I barely finished mine. The guys in the shop are super nice and knowledgeable. Offered free samplings of their deli items. Highly recommend.

Finally a deli in North Beach/Chinatown that matches the flavor and quality of the old Pinnelli Brothers deli.  Worked in a deli for almost five years so I am a bit of a stickler when it comes to buying Italian Deli sandwiches.
Came by with hubby and shared an Italian Hoagie ($7.75) and grabbed a can of the San Pellegrino in blood orange ($2?).
2 friendly guys

Me and my girlfriend decided to try La Boulange while we waited for Tonys Pizza to open up, We didn't realize that we were a couple of hours early lol. So we decided to have some pastries and maybe a cup of coffee. So after walking around we landed on La Boulange, has nice decor, has a modern feel but not over top. When we saw their pastries we knew this place was gonna be good! I got the strawberry and blueberry Danish I think my gf got the chocolate croissant, not sure...But my Danish was so good! vary tasty, the strawberries and blueberries tasted fresh not old! WAY better than what other coffee shops have!

Good neighborhood Boulange.  They would have gotten 4 stars, but they don't have Wi-Fi...I mean whaaaaaaaaaaaaat...?!!  Seriously?  They need to get that in the North Beach neighborhood....c'mon man!  Their coffee is decent...and the food is typical Boulange fare and quality, so no complaints there.  I had most recently the ham/cheese quiche and a latte...both were good.  Staff is friendly (and they also are surprised they don't have Wi-Fi, BTW!).
My very 1st lunch here on my 2nd day, my friends sure know the right places, as to be expected ;)

I was coming here once a week and would occasionally get the blt. Today the roll was different shape from before. It was some the most stale bread I've ever bit into. I hope this is not a sign of things to come.

Let me start by saying I love la Boulange on polk st. This location however does not have a high standard for themselves. I tried a variety of dishes for breakfast, and each disappointed.  I usually strike gold with the croque Madame so decided to explore a sandwich with Lorraine eggs on a pastry with potatoes for a side. Eggs were microwaved, pastry was spongy, potatoes were undercooked in the middle, most likely also microwaved.
The line is out the door, and this place is famous as I've heard of it outside of San Francisco.

I love this place.  They don't have the best coffee in the world, but it's good.  The team that work here are outstanding (I wish I could hire a crew as engaged and dedicated).  I come here every once in a while on the weekend with my daughter and order a coffee and a walnut baguette - and indulge in the FREE Nutella.  Last weekend, I didn't even have to order, Cristina (I think that's her name) had my large coffee and walnut baguette waiting for me on the counter - that's the kind of service I might expect at a very expensive restaurant - certainly not a $2.00 coffee shop that I don't frequent very often.    The almond croissants and open face sandwiches are also delicious.

Coffee was amazing and for breakfast I split the egg sandwich with bacon on a croissant and the hazelnut chocolate croissant. The hazelnut chocolate croissant was warmed up and it was crisp on the outside and gooey and warm on the inside. Delicious! Would definitely go again!

We come here almost every Sunday. Really relaxing because no one bugs you. You do meet interesting people from all over, if you feel chatty. At least on two occasions the person moved here from Roma's across the street; the same reason we, and other friends did.  The pastries are great here, especially if you ask them to warm it up for you.
The atmosphere is adorable, but the food was disappointing.
Had the Croque Madame - made for an excellent breakfast!

La boulange is a super cute coffee shop! My favorite is their tasty pastries, cutely packaged goodies, and ambience of a high end coffee place. If yelp had half stars, id give this place a solid 3.5. There's no obvious major reason why it's not a 4, the service is just not at a 4-star level and it's disappointing that it doesn't gave wifi!

Cute place for a coffee date. I'm glad Starbucks hasn't completely taken away the small business feel. Almond croissant was to die for! Also good were the chocolate croissant, raspberry/lemon/red velvet macaroons. Hard to find parking and seating, but one can always buy to go, and picnic at the park down the street. I wish they were open later though. Thank you for good pastries and friendly service!

Stopped here for lunch drawn by the Zagat rating and good Yelp reviews. Extremely disappointed. Open faced tuna melt boasted apples and celery tomato and cheddar cheese. Tomato wasn't ripe. The apples and celery were minced so finely as to be completely undetectable. All you tasted was tuna and cheese, not worth the $9 price tag for what was essentially a simple tuna melt. The open faced turkey had very little in the way of turkey spread over not even two full slices of bread. Again, extremely overpriced for what you're getting. Maybe the desserts are better but I will not be going back to find out!

Quiche, pastries, and espresso drinks are good. Sufficient seating most of the time. There's sidewalk tables, and a counter against the windows to people watch. My only problem with this place is I can't find the tip jar.
Awesome stuff! I can see why Starbucks partnered up with them.
Solid coffee, nice outdoor seating, good food, friendly staff. Everything about it is good, not spectacular. I'm happy to have it in the neighborhood though.
Great Breakfast! Really felt in France at the Heart of San Francisco. ;)

First time in North Beach area on December 31st, and I was hungry. I browsed thru the line of restaurants along Columbus, and I noticed these people eating on tables and chairs outside like Parisians, with great views of many other stores in North Beach and great people-watching [tourists, primarily].

There are a bunch of these places in SF but just because it is a small chain didn't mean they had lost a real personal feel.  I was just hustling through the city on the way to a conference and it was a very convenient place to stop by and get a quick and tasty pastry.  Friendly employees, good prices, and a wide variety of pastries, coffee drinks, etc.

Bumped into this place looking for brunch and it's quite nice. Food was delicious and a bit pricey but well worth it. A bit noisy since the door is open and the street has a lot of traffic. The people working here are very helpful and provide great service. Wouldn't mind stopping by next time I'm in town.

I like the fact that they have almond milk and great pastries, but had a beet salad that had moldy tasting lettuce one day and returned it.  When I told them about it, they gave me a refund, but they didn't bother looking into their lettuce.
My family and I were in town from San Diego and actually tried to go to Mama's nearby, which was too crowded. We drove around looking for another place and found this cafe!

This doesn't get the best reviews. I wasn't too impressed by it. I thought it was overpriced by 1-2 dollars for every item including pastries. I tried "La Combo," which is a half-open faced sandwich and soup. I got a smoked salmon sandwich and French onion soup. I thought it was okay, but not filling. I also got a lemonade, which was fine, but again overpriced. The pastries didn't seem that amazing, but I'd still like to try them out sometime.

Cute coffee shop in North Beach. It's a great place to stop in and get a pastry and a cup of coffee. I got a chocolate croissant and a small cup of mocha. The croissant was warned up so the chocolate was nice and gooey. The mocha tastes like how it should taste. Both of these items together was kind of too much chocolate for me. My bf thought it would be a good mix.

Good place to get a pastry and cup of coffee to stay inside from the cold sf nights. The place has large windows for people watching. We had a chocolate croissant and a mocha. They both were delicious. I enjoyed the atmosphere and will come again when I am waiting around in North Beach.

I had just left City Lights and walked by, then turned around because I got good vibes from the place.  The manager was super friendly, we chatted about being baristas (though I, on the other hand, work for a corporate place.).  I needed less coffee in my life at this point so I opted to go with an iced chai; she suggested to make it sweet and spicy -  I did.  Took a drive up to Coit Tower and sipped on my delicious drink, this wrapped up my experience on a great note.  A pistachio cookie was a yummy treat to snack on in traffic as well!
Okay place for food... Great place to grab a latte.
Great goat cheese salad. Lovely atmosphere. Don't get the French onion soup. Good for a casual brunch with friends.
"Meh" about sums this place up entirely.
I've never tried their brunch/lunch/dinner menu, but I had my loyal customer cards to prove how many times I have came back here for their coffee (and sometimes pastries).

Visiting SF for the weekend from Orange County and we ordered the fruit, yogurt and a few pastries and all were amazing!!  we don't have anything this good in OC.. atleast I haven't found it.  I am very picky and found this place to be excellent.. really fresh! We had great service too.

Maybe it is just because I hail from the sun-challenged city of Seattle, but I was in absolute awe of the great open air feel of this place from the large open window I sat in front of...the incredible people watching as pedestrians ventured to the nearby park added a lot to the experience as well!
Super fresh breakfast. Had the frittata sandwich and egg sandwich. Loved the pesto and potatoes w the frittata.

This place has been kicking butt as of late. The food has gotten much better without any price increase (they have quinoa salads now!). After some solid miles and lifting, I come here to just sit and people watch as I eat a grilled cheese (delectably crunchy and gooey at the same time) with a super large heaping of quinoa on the side. The pastries taste softer now as well, and the service is still fantastic. The tables are always clean, and the cashiers are entirely friendly and helpful.

It was a great experience visiting this place! Very nice service, the boy that was working there really seemed happy to work there and was very nice with visitors. The cake we've got was pretty good too.

Cute cafe. Went by to just pickup their mini macarons. My sister and I got the passion fruit mango and pistachio macarons. The mango one was so soft inside and so perfect with the crunchy mango pieces on the shell. The pistachio one was very fresh tasting of pistachios. Will be back for more and to try other pastries!
Had lunch here today with my girlfriend. First time visiting this chain. Did not get a first impression.

A very reliable SF chain of restaurants and the location in North Beach is one of their more average stores.  Much more pedestrian traffic and a bit more cramped than the others.  However, the food is always good and the service is pretty quick.  Their prices are a little steep for salads/sandwiches in general, but I always know I'm going to get something I like.  Highly recommend the smoked trout salad and their open faced sandwiches.

I really like this place a lot.  Today was my first time and I ended up getting the goat cheese and mushroom open face sandwich.  It came with a mixed green salad with a vinagrette sauce.  The sandwich was savory and good.  The salad was okay. My friend got a sandwich with their potato chips.  The chips were fantastic.  I think they were seasoned with rosemary.
*Note: this review is long overdue, but I stumbled across this restaurant page, so I thought I would post.

My boyfriend and I came here because when we walked by the door it smelt amazing... and we weren't let down!!  We shared the crab melt and it was delicious.  It is a little pricey, but the portions are big and the taste is great.  The service was INCREDIBLE.  My water glass was never empty, yet they weren't in your face all the time either.
Asked a local and they said come here.
3pm-6:30pm starts a decent happy hour.  $4 house wines and well cocktails are always welcome in my book.

Great food and even better service ! Our food was fresh and delivered quickly to the table . Waiter was quick with our drinks and was very attentive . Crab Salad was good but not great . The crab cakes were heavenly and the crab bruschetta was an amazing treat. Salmon was salty but still very tasty .

II don't know why I keep giving these restaurants on Jackson chance after chance because I'm always disappointed. My daughter is a picky eater so fish is out, which limits her options so we generally stick with Italian.
Drinks was good; food was okay; service was terribly slow.  Waited 15 minutes.  I had to finally get up and ask the front desk gal for some service.  Costumer shouldn't have to ask for service.

This place was nice. Not the same feel as the rest of the area, because even though it says grotto, it looks like a typical Italian restaurant.  I got the fettuccine gamberetti which was good. There were a lot of tiny shrimp and the sauce was a light cream sauce, pretty tasty.

We visited just for drinks in their happy hour. Rude waitress who seemed like she wanted us gone asap. Ordered a Pinot Grigio, which didn't taste like a Pinot. Couldn't be bothered to argue as it would have involved talking to the rude waitress. The drinks were pretty cheap though...

Having decided to use my iPhone's Google Maps application to explore San Francisco by foot, I set off from the hotel at Market Street for the famed Pier 36 before arriving at the Fisherman's Wharf. Thus, I was tired, famished, and in real need of a power plug to power up my phone. Upon hearing my plight, the hostess sat me at a table next to the bar where the wall plugs are. As it was the World Cup season, I managed to enjoy the match between Brazil and Uruguay live on their TV screen! The service was prompt and was served freshly made bread with butter before I was presented with the menu. I watched Brazil score before ordering my bowl of Fisherman's Stew which tasted awesome! Thanks for your great service. I am sure to come again the next time I am here at San Francisco! :)

Sunday night dinner after long day wandering the Exploratorium and surrounding areas.  Arrived at Fisherman's Wharf a bit tired but after a stint in the antique arcade, we looked for a place to rest and fuel up.  First picked Joe's Crab Shack due to location but quickly discarded that idea after seeing 2 star yelp rating plus it looked a bit fast foody when we checked it out.  Decided on Pompei's over Lou's by 1/2 star.

We were in town for the weekend, and of course wanted to sample the local seafood.  We love Fisherman's Wharf and stopped in to Pompei's Grotto.  The food and service was great!  Very fresh food, and a good selection of seafood.

One of the best clam chowders I have ever had. Oysters were super fresh & cheap too. Other dishes in the party were calamari pasta, fried fish & Grilled fish. All were tasty & fresh. Prices are reasonable considering all the other competition in the same street & around. Service was decent as well.

Great service. Great food. Great restaurant. From the reservation to the check, this place was wonderful. I worried because I read some 1 star reviews but I easily give it 5 stars and I am very picky about food and service.

Only the chowder in a bread bowl was passable. Everyone else in our party received food that was simply awful. Fish and chips, kid's shrimp plate, chicken parmesan and crab sandwich were all poorly prepared and flavorless except for the salt.

After driving for an entire day we stopped at the wharf, which is just a block from our hotel, looking for a place that was still open. We stepped into Pompeii's Grotto because it was the most inviting. The wharf has many Italian restaurants. Unless you know the area or want to do the research, it's not easy to pick one over the rest. If you're looking for the usual Italian favorites, this is a nice stop though there isn't anything that stood out from our experience. Good service. Attentive but not overbearing.

Decent. We were seated immediately. Friendly service, but our poor waitress had the majority of the tables. She was working hard, but still managed to be as attentive as she possibly could. Clam chowder was amazing. Some of the best we've ever had. The rest of the food was decent. We had the chicken Parmesan and salmon. Nothing too special and somewhat overpriced. Don't regret going, but wouldn't go back.

Not a bad place for a quick bite to eat. We both had the lunch special (soup and salad). The chowder was pretty good and they give you lots of shrimp on the salad. Sourdough bread was yummy. Our server was goofy and made sure we were taken care of. We wanted some good clam chowder for lunch and that's exactly what we got.

Ewww- pretty sure all the food we were served was frozen. The clam chowder bread bowl was the only good thing at the table and they likely got it down the street for 1/2 the price. So disappointed. We should have just gone to in-n-out or Chipotle...

Had a wonderful dinner with my wife at this great family restaurant! Food was excellent. great atmosphere on the wharf in the middle of all the doings! U can relax and have a great bowl of clam chowder!

I have to say, my experience was not a good one. The customer service was poor, the servers need to learn to smile. The salmon I ordered was dry and lacked any type of flavor or seasoning. The veggies were ok?. The price point for the menu seam fine but again there food was bland. This was my first time eating here and it will be the last.
Pompeii's Grotto... More like Pompeii's Ghetto.

Food : Ordered crab salad & cheese sandwich w/Italian coleslaw. Tasted of only mayo for most of the sandwich- waste of crab, and that the part of the crab I did taste was not sweet, not fresh. I had shell in my crab as well.

if there had been a service issue, there was not evidence of that when we enjoyed great service and delicious cuisine on a very busy fourth of July.  In fact we returned the next day for lunch and enjoyed more warm hospitality, great service, and a delicious crab sandwich, clam chowder, and rock cod.
Overrated in my opinion...
Crab sandwich had pieces of crab shell in it, wait staff was more interested in the  World Cup  Game than the customers.

Came here on the recommendation of a friend. This place would have gotten 5 stars if it was just based off the food but the service and atmosphere was so atrocious (on our anniversary night no less) that I had to downgrade it severely. It was a long wait but because we were on fisherman's wharf, kinda goes with the territory, however there was only one small bench and hardly any standing room while you waited and about 4 groups were waiting at all times with no offer to go to the bar while we waited. Plus, constantly being bumped by the staff and other guests made the wait seem longer. Finally got a table after roughly a half hour wait and the blonde server was completely frazzled, confused and rude. In the middle of our wine bottle order, she yelled at us to hold on and she would be back which she did finally come back several minutes later still looking disheveled and not remembering our order.
