I thought if I mentioned it was our anniversary that maybe she would have realized it was an important night for us but she didn't seem to hear me and definitely didn't acknowledge it. She took our appetizer order and said she would be back for the rest of our order later. The appetizer was a crab sampler with a crab cake, crab bruschetta and crab legs and it was tasty and well made. But she never came back to take our main course order. We finished our appetizer and two glasses of wine each as we watched her frantically move around her side of the room but accomplishing very little. I finally had to say as she bumped my chair from behind that she still needed to take our order for the rest of our anniversary meal, thinking that mentioning it again she might do a better job finally. She didn't. Instead, she took our order in a huff with no apology. We both had the fish and chips (on recommendation from previously mentioned friend) which although doesn't sound like I high dollar item it did run $17.95 per meal. The breaded cod was crispy and not fishy and the fries were adequate but quite frankly the dinner had been ruined by our servers appalling behaviour. I kept wishing we had the other brunette server who was working our area as she was doing an excellent job. At the very end of the meal, I think our server tried to do damage control before bringing the check as she brought a small scoop of vanilla ice cream with a candle in it. Honestly, I was so irritated by then I didn't care what she did to get a better tip. It was very apparent why she changed on a dime 5 minutes before she brought us the almost $100 bill. I understand that severs can have an off-day but this was way beyond that. Even my husband who is pretty patient man was appalled at her lack of ability to do her job.

Best linguini and clams u ever had. The big poppa IPA beer was great.  Gave it 4 stars for quality,  but some of the waitress was very unprofessional.  Looks like they meet up at the bar and start dirty mouthing their customers.  Overall the restaurant recommended

If it was middle school, it would be an A- restaurant, only because it isn't the best place in Downtown San Fran. I got the Crabjacks, which is crab grilled cheese. It was an excellent choice, but it was very messy! It was an above average restaurant, and I am over all glad I went.
Great overall! Amazing fisherman's stew! So,so scallops and shrimp with pasta. Loved the atmosphere. A perfect dinner for our first meal in San Francisco.

Pretty dang average.  Was busy as can be on Saturday.  Service was fine.  Nothing special.  Steamed Mussels didn't taste right...they were big...just tasted burnt...weird thing to say about something that should've been steamed, I know.  Fettuccine was a bit below average.  I make some bomb Alfredo sauce at home.....their sauce was a bit musty.  Left my debit card there....was excited to leave and forgot it.  My bad....but wasn't it really their bad?  I wanted to leave because the environment was schtick and I was just ready to not hang out there any longer than I needed to.  Didn't feel that way at Lou's down the street in November.

NO STAR!  This has got to be the worst restaurant in the whole fisherman's wharf.  We were seated at the restaurant at 6:21 PM, which is still during the happy hour.   The waitress came to our table at 6:31 PM.  We asked if Happy hour is still available since we were here for 10 mins before happy hour ended.  Her respond was "you weren't here for 10 mins, but okay you can order it" with a really bad attitude.  I was in shock to hear her respond.  I'm in customer service industry and have never experienced such a rude experience in my life.  I told her if there is a manager that I can speak to....and her respond was "NO".  I went in the back and look for the manager to complaint.  And of course there was a manager available at the time. After filed a complaint, I walked out and would never ever come back there if these are the type of services that they are providing.  No one should pay for a meal and get treated that way.  If I can give a negative star, I would!
tasty rock cod. bread and oil is good. glad we came here instead of lous next door.

Horrible, horrible, HORRIBLE service. We sat on the patio for happy hour and an appetizer. The server was atrocious. Took forever to get anything. They weren't that busy. Maybe that should've been the first clue.
It's average.

I have been lucky enough to come to San Francisco approximately 4 times in the last 9 years.  The last three times I have visited I make sure to visit this restaurant, near the wharf, to sit at the bar and have my last (and best) San Francisco meal.  And it must involve Dungeness crab.  The past two times I ordered my martini (whatever kind they make me it really is a good, professionally made martini) and a crab sandwich.  This past time, I went for something different, a crab salad, with double crab meat.  I started with a special martini that the bartender Paul, made just for me and met the lovely manager, Fetenzo (sp?) who is from Sicily and just the nicest person, next to Paul the bartender, in all of San Fran.  I told them my story about how consistent this place is with their fresh crab and thus must be my last meal every time I visit their lovely city.  The manager went into the details of how they make sure it is fresh.  The salad arrived.  It was perfect.  And Paul didn't even think it was weird that I asked for drawn butter too!  So I ate half with Louie dressing (which tasted totally homemade and yummy) and the rest with butter.  I loved how they talked about this restaurant and it's owner who I believe they said her name was Nancy and how it is really a family run restaurant.  No corporations involved!  The decor is old school, and don't be frightened off that it isn't going to be good because it is near the cheesy Fisherman's Wharf.  This place could teach Scoma's something about fresh food, fresh ingredients, happy customers.  God it was so good.  And always is!

Clam chowder was not that good.. It had a loooot of celery in the soup. Bf had seafood pasta which was good, just a little bit too oily, i had the basic calamari with fries lunch combo. Calamari was delicious, well battered, and fresh! I was disapointed with the clam chowder...

great little place for dinner in the fishermans wharf/pier 39 area. The prices are not over inflated like many of the restaurants in the area, and the food was great. This place has a great atmosphere very cozy and relaxed. They were pretty busy for a weeknight  but we got great service and were very happy we came here.

Highpoints: Clam chowder is tasty and some of the best on the wharf. Sourdough is awesome. Kids menus are well priced and the portions are enough to feed an average 10 year old. Small crab salad was anything but that with a nice heap of dungeness crab.

Went in for happy hour.....staff was very rude....waitress kept coming to the table saying "you done? Want something else??? Wine was cheap....box wine....too many places on the wharf.....wouldn't come back
Huge portions...great service...free pizza bread? LOVED it! Our server Wyatt was awesome.

Located just inside the shopping area of Pier 39.  A very relaxed surfer-themed restaurant to get American style burgers and fries.  Sit inside or outside.  They have a really nice bonfire area near the front entrance if you are lucky enough to get a seat there on a chilly Fall evening. The hostesses were especially nice and accommodating.
I disliked eating here, the utensils were not properly cleaned, the tab was somewhat high, the staff is somewhat hard to access. Too busy for the amount of people working.
Nice central location. Good menu selection. Good drink selection. Nice bay views at seating. Fun atmosphere. Nice staff.

Place is awesome food is good and big portions atmosphere is just like it should be for being at the bay... Great beer selection witch is always important to me... Def bring other people here when I come back ... Service was good didn't bug us just did her job
The location was great and the restaurant is placed at the beginning of the Pier, so easy to find.

My go to spot on the pier for a burger and a beer.   Burger was hot and beer was cold.  Stopped by for breakfast and was not disappointed.  Simple breakfast burrito and mimosa's.  Burrito was hot and, you guessed it, mimosa was cold.  Service has always been good here for me.
David was an awesome bartender.  So friendly and fun. Made the perfect drinks for me and my friend. Definitely  coming back to wipe out because of him !

I'm a tourist from Milwaukee. Loved the overall environment and outdoor patio. Coconut shrimp was delicious but I was really in the mood for calamari and I felt it was way too breaded. I could barely taste seafood, just fried breading.

We had to find a place to get a validation for Pier 39 Garage. So we happen to go to this place because this place is the first place that you see when you enter the Pier 39. You need to spend $15 in order to get a validation. So we ordered Clam Chowder with bread bowl and Garlic Pizza Bread which was perfectly $15.
Everything was perfect, we enjoyed our lunch here.. Burgers were amazing!  My son also enjoyed his cheese pizza, it was pretty big for a personal pizza but he wasn't complaining.

I ordered the scampi and fries. Fries were ok but seemed refried. The scampi did not taste nice. Service was good though. My girlfriend ate the garlic olive chicken sandwich which was dry and tasteless. We don't think we'd eat here again.
We were walking around Pier 39 and just happened to walk into this place.
Ordered a Hawaii 5 oh pizza to go....it was decent. Nothing special about the experience, but no complaints

Oh Boy!  Great food.  Very trippy bathroom.  The servers dress like surfer-bums, which is a nice touch.  Our server, Allen, made my grandma's day(it was her birthday).  He is HILARIOUS!  Thanks, Bro.  I will be back for more fish tacos soon.  Better than Scoma's!

After walking up and down San Fran looking for night life we ended up back at Pier 39 and since it was the closest to the entrance- it won. Overall, it was ok-ay. Lots of specialty drinks options and all the ones we ordered were great. We didnt get food just chips and salsa and wings. Wings were pretty tasty! Chip and salsa- was chips and salsa.

Mediocre place with bad food. We went there for dinner and ordered calamari and chips and some pasta. The staff was friendly, however the food was was awful; pasta was under seasoned and the sauce was watery... it almost seemed like microwaved pasta. The meat in the sauce was dry and tasteless... obviously frozen.  My dish, calamari and chips, was not better but at least eatable. Calamari was a little chewy and seemed fried in old oil. The fries were OK...
Fun ambience, food was good with good prices, and the service was great.
Food was very average bar food but the drinks were great. Carnitas were over cooked and lacked seasoning and the salmon sandwich was soggy.
Only had beers and clam chowder... And it was great! Fun atmosphere. View of pier shops and fun people watching.

Great choices on the menu. Had the Hawaiian Burger and the pineapple plus the teriyaki glaze added the right sweetness.fries were hot and plentiful . My food was brought out quickly. All in all awesome service

Unlike a lot of folks on here I had a great experience. Sat at the bar and was served immediately.  Drinks were great....ordered some appetizers. Those came out very fast and let me tell you.... you get a lot of food for your money. Bar tender constantly checked up on us and overall a great place to hang out, have drinks, and eat!
Alcohol beverages have no alcohol. ..order shots or a beer.  Customer service was crap.  But hey the fries were good.  Not coming back for sure.
Customer service sucks BIG TIME!!!

This is a typical American restaurant, but the draw is the location at Pier 39.  I prefer to eat at little kitschy, local spots, and this place isn't like that at all.  It feels like an American chain, but it's ok.
Food is not good...everything is fried and it's all very bland. Server didn't write down our order and then predictably messed up 2/4 items we ordered.
Came in starving.
I love the ambiance. This is a great place to go if you're looking for a good burger and fries without having to pay too much in its famous, touristy Pier 39 location.

Came here at 730 on a Wednesday & were seated right away. Had the calamari for appetizer.. Loaded with batter. For dinner we had the fish tacos & pesto pizza! The pizza was fantastic!! however, the tacos, I only took one bite out of! Waitress wasn't too attentive. The cucumber Moscow mule was pretty good! Too many restaurants in sf to return here
One of my favorite spots 2 eat at Pier 39. The food was delicious and highly recommend ordering the tacos.
THEIR PIZZA "SLICE" is LITERALLY HALF THE PIZZA!!! It's crazyyyy. Only $4.50 for cheese and $4.95 for others. Such big portions! Service at take out line was slow! Fish and chips were aight.
Food was gross, and the beer was watered down. Like literally watered down, it was ridiculous. Prices were too high.

Sophia and I got nachos and one of their wipeout margaritas. Overall the restaurant was not exceptional compared to other grills I have been too, but as a tourist trap I did not expect a five start restaurant! On a side note, the waiter was very engaging and prompt!
RIPPED OFF      RIPPED OFF.

Not bad at all. Probably the best teriyaki bowl I've ever had (steak and shrimp bowl over coconut rice). Awesome people watching if you sit outside. Super touristy and noisy though.  Margarita was yummy. Would totally come here again.
Ordered two tacos, one fish (Crispy Baja Fish) and one chicken (Grilled Chicken) tacos. The salsa sauce was really nice and a bit spicy. I like the fried fish a lot and it went well with the sauce.
Great food. Great Margaritas!
Yes it's touristy, and tacky. But the service was good and all the food we had was decent.

Ugh. Went here with my husband and 2 kids for lunch. We ate outside and it was very clean and our server was very nice (hence the 2 stars). Unfortunately our food was soooooo bland! The kids meals were ok (pizza and a burger) but kids will eat anything. My husband got the fish and chips and i got the fried combo plate which includes calimari, coconut shrimp and fish.  The breaded fish had no flavor whatsoever and the tartar sauce was extremely bland. Then the bill comes and they add 4% to every check for some reason I didn't even get (nothing to do with saving marine life or anything like that. Our bill was $60!!!! For 2 entrees, 2 kids meals, 1 beer and bland food?? Never again.

Came here after receiving horrible service and blatant disregard from the manager at Luigi 's in Pier 39. Wipeout has great service. Fast kitchen. Tasty food. (Sidenote: Someone who isn't our server literally just walked by checking in on us). This should have been our first and only choice. Great place to try, whether you are a tourist or local, like myself.
Excellent, fresh bagel sandwiches and never a wait. My goto for a quick morning meal before commuting out of the city.
He poured too much cream in my coffee I asked for another one and he wanted to charge me ! Very rude

This place has AMAZING breakfast sandwiches!! I had the breakfast croissant with turkey jalapeños and avocado. My mouth is watering thinking about it and I already just ate one! The other restaurants nearby are all just a hype. Come here if you want a very delicious breakfast bagel of croissant sandwich!

The food was delicious. I had a breakfast bagel with cream cheese, bacon, egg & avocado & a great iced soy mocha. This is definitely a laid back experience, came here on a Sunday with some girlfriends and we sat on the patio.

I ordered the French toast here, it was pretty good but the rest of my food was slightly bland. The service was fast, almost to the point of being rushed. It looks like they also have a small selection of pastries. Overall, I would come again for an easy and inexpensive breakfast.
Maybe two.

Justa Bite has an interesting menu that includes, salads, sammies, omelets, Chinese food,  and pastries. So what does one order at a place like this? The chef salad. It was ok, everything tasted fresh, I added avo to it, which was good.

I was meeting friends...so I got there a little early and, as I got two feet in the door, the gentleman behind the counter  (whom I could barely see) yelled:  YOU WANT COFFEE? got up to the counter and said, O I am waiting for some co-workers & will wait for them to come., and sat down in EMPTY cafe.  After a minute (maybe less), he said:  You cannot wait in here.  So I stood outside the door to wait for co-workers in the cold.

Worst place ever! I live down the street and decided to try this out one day. Walked in to 2 old Asian people who were very rude. We ordered a sandwich and fries and threw it away. It was impossible to speak to the owner about how wrong the order was and i gave up. I honestly don't know how they stay in business- they probably have owned teh building for ages in their family and have low overhead. Its always empty and if someone is inside its either a soon to be disappointed tourist or little Chinese kids after school.

Stumbled upon this place walking through North Beach and saw that they sold ice cream...So wandered in, placed an order, and was very offended by the proprietor's lack of customer service. Then when you coupled that with me paying $8.50 for three extremely small "Dixie Cup" (Two separate cups) scoops of ice cream...I knew I had made a dining error...And to top matters off, I asked for a couple of napkins and he gave me "TWO!" Never dining here again!
I don't know why I decided to come here when there's a gazillion other (BETTER!) places in the North Beach area.
This place is where breakfast goes to die. No, where ALL FOOD goes to die.

Local mom n pop cafe. We had a decent breakfast (a bit too oily, use a napkin to take the excess grease off :p). Fast attentive service...it u want a quick bite to eat, feel free to stop here n support local businesses!
I had a great latte to go the other day. The service was quick and friendly. They have a $10 minimum card limit so I was glad I had some cash with me.
This place was soooo bad.

I didn't have much time, no cash, and I wanted justa bite. I saw the Visa logo in the window and the menu looked okay so I went in. I wasn't sure what I wanted so it took me 5 to 10 minutes to choose. The man a the counter was friendly and patient  until I pulled out my Visa card. "No, $10 minimum for credit card" What! my order was nearly $7 and didn't most places stop doing this in like 1998? And even then it was usually $5 and sometimes $3. So I told him to "forget it" in a firm but polite tone. This angered him, "fine!" Clearly is was my fault that he has a dumb ass credit card policy.

Cute little North Beach Cafe! My Raspberry Cappuccino and breakfast croissant sandwich was very good! Service was especially attentive. My only complaint was the cookie that I got to go for later was stale and fairly tasteless. Given the large selection of homemade cookies that they carry, I was expecting more. Place lacks in atmosphere but the service and food it good.

A cute, quaint, chinese-owned cafe in North Beach. I don't know why, but I was suffering from a really bad cold, and I had their lemon ginger tea. For some reason I felt so much better sitting there, sipping it. It's a small place, great to watch the rain fall. I did not try the food so I could not vouch for that. I did see that they have a plethora of cookies and mitchell's ice cream.  The woman behind the counter was very nice to me... but I can see how she might be a bit surly, as she brushed off some people who tried to come and get quarters in change to pay the meter. Yet and still the pastries and coffee in this cafe are probably cheaper than you wll get in the Italian cafes in North Beach, so if you just want to go in for a quick coffee, tea, or pastry, I guess it's a pretty okay place.
I have only been here once, and it was for coffee and toast but I had a good experience unlike so many others.
DO NOT EAT HERE!
Free wi-fi is the only plus at this bare-minimum coffeehouse. I went in for the wireless and felt compelled to review.

I am completely APPALLED by this establishment. My dad and I came here on Father's Day to get a little lunch after taking a tour of Telegraph Hill. We ordered a bagel sandwich and a couple of drinks (not cheap) and then sat and ate and rested.
salmon deli sandwich. meh. not the worst ever, but I definitely can make a better one with canned fish.
Very average steak sandwich.  The menu claimed the steak was lean but it definitely wasn't.  Overall it's not a bad a place, but nothing special either.  Also, not much ventilation inside.
their breakfast is very delicious. i loved their homemade hashbrown.
nothing too cool but at the same time i ordered the coolest thing ever.

I had a roast beef sandwich here.  It was okay.  The bread tasted a bit stale.  The cashier lady (owner?) didn't seem too honest.  She didn't want to give me back my change.  I gave her a $6.00 for my $5.10 sandwich and she closed the register without giving me back my change.  I was the only customer so unless she hasn't been sleeping for days there's no excuse for "forgetting" to give me back my change.  I can tell when someone conveniently pretends to forget to give me back my change.  Having to ask for my change back...that's negative 5 stars!
worst grilled cheese. ever.

I am suprised at the bad review. I thought this little place was great. They have one of my favorite breakfasts. Food is always hot and the service is usually very prompt. Great addition to North Beach. The prices are slightly high but that's okay with me. All in all, I do recommend checking it out at least once.

Seemed a bit pricey for a microwave sandwich. I think I was expecting something different. The breakfast sandwich was good - but I would not say I would go there every weekend. Cafe Roma has a power breakfast sandwich with hard boiled eggs and tomatoes which while different feels much healthier and is cheaper.

I defintely like the family-owned vibe they have going on (it looked like the owner's daughter was working). The food was good and hot (breakfast croissant with bacon, egg, and ham). My only complaint was the prices were justa bit too high for a small sandwich and drink...
Probably the best chai I've ever had (I'm a vanilla-y chai fan though). And the mini eclairs are heaven.

Went for Lunch while hanging out in the city.  The positives: Great View, Great Service, excellent sourdough and dipping oil, and good clam chowder.  The negatives: Dungeness Crab Sandwich was fishy, fish and chips was very greasy and mediocre for a seafood restaurant.  I had dined here in the past and hoped for much better.  I hope that they read the review and get back to the old family quality that this place used to have.

Don't know why they only have 2 stars this is a five star restaurant I  have been to a lot of great sea food places being from Florida and this one is at the top of my list in fact I have 2 more days here and I will be going back for lunch and dinner.  The piano bar is a great place to spend happy hour from 3-6.  I love an early Happy Hour while on vacation.

We ate at Castagnola's on Fisherman's Wharf Saturday November 8, 2014, for an early dinner. Our party was seated right away. I ordered a cup of clam chowder for $6 and the petrale sole dinner for a very pricey $31.95. I have NEVER commented on restrooms in my reviews before, but this one MUST NOT go unnoticed with such a pricey menu and prominent locale. After I ordered my dinner, I went to use the women's restroom. There were two stalls. One was occupied, and the latch was evidently either missing or broken. I proceeded to the unoccupied stall, closed the door, went to latch it, but the latch was broken. As I quickly went about my business, someone walked in, when I felt compelled to announce "the latches are broken, both stalls are occupied, please don't come in." The woman in the other stall and I both emerged, talking to the third woman who entered and the woman from the other stall said something about the toilet not flushing and that she used her hands to try to flush. Not quite sure what she meant. My point is why on earth would a restaurant that charges $31.95 for petrale sole not provide adequate restroom facilities for its customers? As for the food... the clam chowder was good, not great. The sole was thin and overcooked. I do not recommend this restaurant. I will not be back.
For the last 4 years, my wife and I have made a point to stop at Castagnola for three reasons:
Not sure why 2 stars but came during happy hour.  Gr8 wait staff,  very friendly, music was live and awesome, drinks were definitely worth it and I would be back.  Not a 2 star score but didn't eat.

Went in here and sat at the bar for drinks. The drinks were slightly overpriced and the bartenders did an okay job. The bartender that was originally serving us left without notice so when we needed our bill and couldn't find him, we had to ask the other bartender on duty. Kind of unprofessional in my opinion.

We went here on a Sunday, and were seated immediately.  The decor was decent and they had AC which was nice.  The Waiter was fine.  The bathroom was a bit smelly and dirty but normal for san francisco.  The main dishes of this restaurant are about 20 - 30$ each plus tax and tips.  The linguini with Clams were okay, and had a bit of a spicy kick to it.  The french fries seemed to have been cooked a while ago, they seemed to hard and not freshly cooked.  Our ceaser salad was okay, but the sardine on top, nearly ruined it.

This place is awful. They charge 15.95 for a cheeseburger that comes only with lettuce. If you want anything else you have to ask for it. The seared scallops and grits had no flavor. The gnocchi and meat sauce was absolutely tasteless the gnocchi is out of a package for sure. I recommend going any other place then here. There are much better options to the left and right of this spot. If you come near this place keep walking.

Absolute waste of money.  Cheap, tasteless food.  I ordered the steak and it might have been one of the worst steaks I ever had.  Covered in gravy to hide the cheap cut.  The garlic mash is disgusting.
Came her with my family. Food is delicious and service was excellent. Our server Taylor was very attentive and swift to bring us anything we requested.

Prime real estate in the tourist zone. A sad place none the less. Went here before dinner for a couple of beers with some co-workers. They had a piano player in the bar area trying his best to liven up the group. It just was not happening. Might have even put off a few of the international customers who walked in. Prices were ok for beers, but the place just seemed dead. The decor was sparse which would have been ok if every seat had a view of the wharf. The "U" shaped bar just looks at a pretty uninspiring display of booze. We split after 2 drinks and went somewhere else. Maybe the food is killer? I can't speak to it.
Very dirty, service very bad, food taste very very very bad. Will never come back again and suggest everyone donot ruin your trip by going there.
Service was okay food was greasy and bland. Bird poop all over the floor where we ate. Next time I will try another TT.
Absolutely best service. First time San Francisco experience and servers very knowledgeable about surroundings and desired hot spots. Gilbert was soooooo sweet!!!! And Airec very professional!!!!
Lousy, overpriced food, lame service and bad music. This is truly the "DMV" of seafood restaurants.

The happy hour might be good here but keep away from the food here! My nephew got sick from his food and my oyster po'boy was inedible. The bread was moldy and when I sent it back all they did was reheat the bread and bring it back out. I tried to just eat the oysters and they tasted very old. I never send food back but this was awful. Not to mention the prices were outrageous for the amount of food you receive. After complaining the manager never came over to check on us and our waters were never refilled. There are so many better places on the wharf.
This is the first time I've sent back both main dishes and wished I'd sent the soup back too.

I wish we had read the other reviews.  Don't make the same mistake.  There was 5 of us and no one like the food.  The soup was the worst.  How can you burn soup and still serve it.  The wait staff was either to busy or just didn't care.  We waited for the hostess a long time and she was not friendly.  We never saw our waiter and had to ask someone to flag him down when we needed anything. After the experience at the door we should have walked out.
I felt like a maverick eating at this place.  Hell, Yelp even told me because once I checked in, I got the "Maverick" badge for dining at a low rated restaurant.

Do not eat here! Service was ok, food was terrible. The worst crab cakes I've ever had, and I've eaten a lot of crab cakes. The lobster was overcooked, the filet minon was overcooked. Only good thing is they didn't charge us for the crab cakes.
Absolutely horrible. This is a tourist trap. Bad food with extremely high prices.

Food was average. Not really worth the price. Location is great on water with nice view. Decor was a little shabby. Thing like worn chairs with ripped cushions. I can't recommend this place because service is awful. Takes forever to get waiters attention. We watched one couple be seated. Not be greeted for about 15 min then leave very upset.

Came here for HH truffle fries and was super disappointed. The fries were dry and tasted nothing like truffle. They were so dry I asked for aoli which was horrible.. Tasted like seafood water, weeds and mayo.The bloody Mary's are good if you like black pepper(which I LOVE)! Overall the service was lacking. Bartender was not friendly or helpful and the hostess was very pushy.

Had spent the whole day in the city and with the dinner hour approaching before heading back to the east bay...came across this place. Walked right in, no wait...we were debating on a few other places on the wharf. But everything seemed to be so crowded. The service was great, our server was attentive. Food was yummy! The view was good, our table was next to the window looking out at the water. Minus 1 star for the pricing. A little steep, if your gonna be charging fancy smhancy then the bathroom could have been cleaner... it seemed like NO employee stepped foot in their to check in on it or restock the whole day! Other then that, I'd say not a bad experience. BUT I will be checking out other spots before going back. With my fam of 4, I'd like something more within budget. That'd definitely be more a date night spot next time.
Great location, food was terrible, service was ok.  I had chicken marsala which was too salty and chicken was dry.  Disappointed for sure.

Not good! The only thing that saved face for this place was our waitress who tried to accommodate all the kitchens screw ups! My son ordered their steak and lobster "deal" for $75 and the lobster tail was a huge tail but it was RAW! My daughter ordered a ribeye that looked like a skirt steak and was full of fat! Food presentation was horrible for the price! Both kids meals came with mashed potatoes and rice was put on the plates because they ran out of mashed potatoes. The pasta was ok and edible. My son left without eating dinner because we were all done before his food came out. We were told that the kitchen was under staffed and both steak meals were taken off the bill. It was our last night in San Francisco and we saved the night for a special dinner that sucked. I felt bad for the waitress so we tipped her according to what our bill should've been. Disappointing and expensive.
Thank God I had a discount certificate.  This restaurant is the posterchild for why Gordon Ramsey does the TV show, Kitchen Nightmares.
DO NOT STOP HERE! Worst food experience of my life! There is a smell we couldn't quite decipher, but settled on the thought that it was mold.
Came here on 7/19/14 for lunch while we were in the Fisherman's Wharf area of town. Food was decent and nothing special. Clam chowder was good though.
Absolutely the most horrible place I have eaten.  Over priced and just shit food.  Should have went to In & Out!

Came here for Fourth of July and sat in the cocktail lounge area with my family. Just planned on staying for one or two cocktails but ended up staying the whole night. They had a guy on the piano that was the life of the party. He had everyone in the room laughing and having a great time. We ended up staying the whole night because of him and  our waitress Taylor did great I never had a empty beer glass in my hand and she stayed on top of our table the whole time.  Good job Taylor. We had a couple of appetizers such as the clam chowder, scallops, and garlic french fries which all were (especially the scallops that were on top of corn bread). Bottom line great service great food and had a great time. And to top it off me and my family were able to watch both the Oakland and San Francisco fireworks at the top of the dock upstairs. Next time I come to the west coast I will be sure I stop by here.
Overpriced and bland. Just awful.

On June 15th, 2014, I downloaded the menu which said that the wild salmon was $25.  I made a reservation, but when we got there on June 20  it was $39.95.  When I complained, the hostess said that they changed their menu and offered no recompense.  We left and had a lovely salmon at $22 at the Pompei Grotto-2 doors away to the west.

Good location but that is all this place has going for it.  Saw staff members chewing food as they were walking out of kitchen area.  We were there for an early dinner and the place was not very busy.  I actually lost my appetite when I went into the men's restroom.  Why wouldn't they make the effort to clean it more frequently? Ordered calamari and it came out within 5min cold and rubbery.  Scallops in the sautéed seafood platter were cold and undercooked.  My wife had crab caked which looked like frozen and burnt deep fried patties.  I'd say it was overpriced, but it's probably what you'd expect on the Wharf.  A little updating and a bathroom cleaning schedule would go a long way here.
Ok so first off... WTH is with the smell ? I went to the bathroom and felt like I was in some ghetto Mexican restaurant.

Wow! Amazing lobster ravioli and combination Louis salad. The food presentation was on point... So good I didn't have time to snap and picture and dug right in!! I will be sure to stop here on my next visit! Also, the piano player on 5/28/14 was a great guy, very friendly, personable, and he made our dinner experience the best we have had in San Fran.

you guys need way more staffing. saw some chaos across the waitres, even the host said he didnt have enough menus so we thought its busy inside. lol it wasnt even!! so we got sat, and they were confused on whose gonna take our order.  i understood because i been a waitress before. and the food wasnt eevn all that. the fries tasted good though, cuz theyre fries. but im not even picky and we were starving and it just didnt cut it at all. i hope the old guy got his tip though becuase the asian guy came and stole his table, and never really checked on us!! we tip well but he better have shared with the older man.

The food was horrible, mistakes on every plate, over cooked and under cooked each dish. Bathrooms were scary gross and we went empty on drinks for a while with no one in sight. Not worth the prices at all!!!
Service was friendly and nice. Food was cooked well. Clam chowder was the best out of three resturants. Drinks were strong but tasty. Clam app was on point as far as quanity and taste.

I would totally recommend this place! The server Arthur was great and let us sit right in front of the view! Beautiful view! Food was great and the service was wonderful! I guess to each their own experience but I brought the left overs home and it was delicious for lunch! Wish I could give them more stars! Definitely coming back ! Thank you all for the great experience!!
Good prices and great selection of food. Got a big bowl of patata bravas/alioli for $5. Thank goodness for the full bar. Beer and cocktail prices reasonable for the city
Food: 3

Considering this is attached to a kids discovery museum I expected more kid friendly options. I ordered a clam chowder which tasted nothing like clam chowder but more like celery and water. Also it was incredibly expensive for food that was not good.

Overpriced and mediocre quality. I get that the point is to exploit captive visitors (including children). But can they at least learn a little bit from the zoo, California academy of sciences or the bay area discovery museum? Both those places deliver quality (and quantity) to match their pricing. I advise families to pack a lunch or eat before you visit the Exploratorium (which is awesome).

Full bar inside a museum, nice!!! I love the glass counter tops at the bar with dry ice in the water underneath which creates a nice effect. Great place to get a science and drink fix with a nice view of the water.
Only came in here because I wanted a snack and a little break from the Exploritorium.
After reading all these reviews, you'd think they would have changed their unorganized system!

The roast chicken and carrots were amazing!  Wow, delicious flavor and moist chicken.  The brussel sprout and kale waldorf salad was good too.  I had a great mushroom pasta there the week before.  Everything was yummy and I didn't mind the prices too much.  By the time they pay for rent, staff, etc. the prices seem fair.
At first glance you had me. At first bite you failed me.

The food is very good. It is a bit pricey, but the ingredients are fresh and organic and of high quality, so overall, I feel it is a good value. I've been here three times, twice with my family and once alone. The food has always tasted fresh and delicious to me. The quarter chicken is a favorite of my kids. The vegetables that you can get as a side with the chicken are always fresh and tasty. I really like this place for the food, the view and the proximity to the Exploratoreum and the Embarcadero area.

I wanted to eat at the Ferry Building before coming here, but my friends were not hungry yet. We bought our tickets to the Exploratorium and I was really hungry by this point and decided to go to the restaurant first and go outside, rather than barge our way through the inside and get distracted by the exhibits. There were lots of employees letting us know that we needed our hand stamped before we entered and several times while waiting in a very long line. It would have been useful to give people maps of the food layout before we entered the food area so we didn't have to wander around until we found what we wanted to eat. This really needs to be fixed and knowing where to queue would be nice too.

I disagree with reviewers who have panned the food here.  The food is good.  I had fried chicken sandwich today which I liked.  My daughter loves the roasted chicken, pizza is solid and my Father-in-law had sushi and enjoyed it.  Is the food the best in SF? No, it's the Exploratorium restaurant so of course it's not.  Is it far better than most museum, zoo, theme park food? Hell yes!  It is great by museum food standards.  Is it too expensive? Yes.  But, what do you expect from an attraction restaurant on the SF embarcadero?  Most attraction food is overpriced and far less edible without the spectacular bay views.  So, I think the food complaints are overblown on here.

I expect to pay more in SF especially being at the Exploratorium but $9 for miso soup is ridiculous!  Ordered the sushi and for a mediocre sushi roll, it was $14.50.  The restaurant really needs to re-evaluate their pricing.  There is no way I would EVER eat here again.
the good thing about having a bunch of guy friends, you get to be their default dates for events like weddings and holiday parties.. my friend's holiday party was here
If I could give zero stars, I would.

Get here by 11 am if you want to avoid the lunch rush (and, for that matter, go to the museum upon opening to avoid the mad horde).  I always get the tuna poke with a side of potato chips.  Glass of wine, oysters, what a treat!
Well, let's start from the beginning of the line.  There was about a 20 minute wait to enter, but that was somewhat expected as we were coming from the Exploratorium.
Given that this is a cafeteria-style restaurant in a museum, it's decent.  The food is not great, but pretty good.  The prices are high but the restaurant is clean and modern.
The restaurant is cafeteria style where you can stop by about 5 different stations with a variety of food.  We tried the tempura fried green beans and a salmon roll.

I don't really see anything wrong with Seaglass that would make it deserve a 1 star review.  I get that it may not be a kid-friendly restaurant and the prices are a little high, but at least the ingredients are fresh and the food is good.  My friend and I had dinner here once and while she had the Roast Chicken dinner, I ordered a Chicken Kale Pizza.  We shared both and they were really good and the portions were pretty generous, especially for the Chicken!  By the end of our meal both of us were stuffed!

My daughters and I had a great lunch here and had a perfect view of the America cup race. We tried pizzas (very good) vegan chili (also good) and chowder -much more than I would hope for at such a place and we were quite happy sitting outside on a beautiful afternoon!
Seaglass must have been designed by Microsoft.It is just wrong in so many ways but at least it looks slick.

This restaurant is has a good variety of food and has a chef to make sushi for you on the spot as well as putting together your meal for you. I really love the presentation of the whole restaurant and their round trays (very light) to carry all your items. Very clean, good is good, but the price I thought was a little expensive. I got a quesadilla with just cheese for about $7-$8 and I requested if it was possible to pay extra to add on some meat. Apparently they can't add things on and for a grilled tortilla and cheese that seemed a little pricey. 2 small tacos was around the same price an adding avocado will cost you extra too; nice thing was that it was basically make your own small taco. The Roast beef sandwich however was quite good and tasty. If it's a warm day out then try to sit outside to eat. Beautiful view.

I don't get it-why does the Exploratorium, and before it, the California Academy of Science, hire a brand-name chef to feed an audience of overly stimulated children and their harried parents?  I don't care about the price; I just want to sit down and not have to wrestle three kids in three different lines. For each of my (non-fussy) children, the food was such a disappointment that no one wanted to finish it. My 14 year old, who ordered the chicken dinner and milk complained that his food was lukewarm before we got seated, an so was his milk! My 12 year old got a turkey sandwich that came with raw onions on it-surprise! And had so much bun and a weird red sauce on it, half lay uneaten. Even the dill pickle was awful, with an acrid, vinegar taste that is absolutely not what a pickle should taste like. My 9 year old took one look at the dry pork tacos and suddenly wasn't feeling well. Her milk was warm, too.

I know this restaurant is independent of the Exploratorium but I am confused as to why they make no effort to cater to the younger palate.  Do they know the majority of the Exploratorium's visitors are under age 15? I was completely disappointed that there was not one item my 4 yr old son would eat. Fancy pizza, raw oysters, sushi wasn't going to work.  I have been to many upscale restaurants with him & they have always had something he could eat. There are ways to make healthy kids options.. the place also feels like a slightly better cafeteria with higher prices. Too bad... the proximity to the Exploratorium would almost guarantee a restaurant a ton of customers but parents will leave and find another place to eat if there isn't anything for the kids (and I did see a few families do that)
Worst place ever! Food has no flavor. Not kid friendly. I would not suggest anyone to eat here. Bad move exploratorium!
Food was okay. Price was a bit high.

This chaotic restaurant was a disappointment during our recent visit to the Exploratorium. While the food looked delicious, it wasn't very easy to grab some quick lunch with my kids and was not very family friendly for a museum crawling with kids. At first we wandered around and looked at the various choices. My 10 year old was happy to get some mexican, salad seemed like the best option for me, and my 8 year old didn't see anything he wanted. We stood around frustrated for a while, deciding which of the three lines to stand in first. Our solution? We plunked down our trays and walked 10 minutes down the street to the Ferry Building and bought lunch there.  I think this restaurant is trying to be something that it's not. True it is on the waterfront in a sophisticated, foodie city, but they can not ignore the fact that is in inside what is essentially a children's museum. Perhaps they should visit the California Academy of Sciences for inspiration. They have similar layout and gourmet food options, but at the same time, have more grab and go, clear marking of where to line up, and they offer a kid a hot dog and fries if they want it.

Would recommend not eating at the Seaglass Restaurant at the Exploratorium.  Better to take a break and head either direction for a better selection of restaurants.  The food was costly and had no flavor.  The sandwich we had was full of these hard bits of bacon (I think).  If I was not careful I could have possibly broken a tooth.   The pizzas were okay (kids will eat anything) but again no flavor.    It was chaos inside as well while we were there, no clear lines or where to order the food as people were just standing everywhere.     Not pleased and expected more so next time I will head down to Pier One to the Ferry building for lunch.

This restaurant is typical of San Francisco. The food was local, slightly uppity fare, and prepared half-way decent for what is basically a cafeteria-style restaurant. My issues with Seaglass is that it fails to cater to its primary audience, which are families with toddlers and young kids in tow.

If you can get over the relatively high pricing, the food is pretty good.  Ribeye sandwich was nice.  Meat was excellently prepared - sliced medium rare on a decent roll.  Coud have used some horseradish.  Roasted chicken was also good and so were the rosemary roasted potatoes.  Clam chowder was average at best.  Pizza was passable.  But the fried green beans were awesome!  Must have those.

Definitely the easiest option for food if you're going to the Exploatorium, but unless you're with young kids, it's worth trying to find something outside of the museum. We came here with family while at the museum, and unfortunately hadn't checked the reviews of this place before...

Terrible idea for a restaurant that mainly caters for families. A number of food stations serving overpriced, overcomplicated, slow to produce food. Queuing makes it impossible to see what each station is offering.  No ticketing system, it was chaos. Try doing that with 3 kids in tow  and its next to impossible. The pizza station doesn't even serve a basic cheese pizza! Who comes up with these ideas? Advice to families, eat somewhere else before you arrive.

The food is cold and unappetizing. Pizza is not melted cheese. Tacos are cold. Prices are high. Roast beef sandwich was good. But just meat nothing else on the sandwich  Expensive bad tasting food.  No member discount either.

We were disappointed with this place. We had kids in our group and wanted to find a quick place to eat. The lunch was very expensive and not tasty. The lady at the checkout over charged me (I should have paid attention.. oh well).  Next time, I will walk to Ferry building to grab lunch.
Kind of disappointing. The SF Chronicle article sounded promising but it ended up being like a half-sized imitation of the Moss Room, except you could get sashimi and oysters.

I just got back from the Exploratorium and stumbled upon Seaglass Restaurant while there.  I had trouble between giving 1 or 2 stars but giving 2 since I didn't get to sample everything they had to offer.  This place looks like a cross between a mall food court meets Whole Foods.  It definitely looks better than it tastes IMO.  Here's why:
Sake & oysters while entertaining my sons at the Exploratorium!  Great parenting moment
Here's the drill

Not what I would expect for a restaurant at a museum. It was very fancy with a nice view. The restaurant has many stations. There weren't many choices for my daughter who is a picky eater. They made her a cheese pizza. My friend's daughter ate chicken. We went with 2 families so we all ordered something different and tasted each others. The potatoes, polenta, and green beans were all delicious. The green bean dipping sauce was better than I expected. I had to go back to get more. I ordered tacos; they were very good. My husband ordered a pasta baked dish. That wasn't very good. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food except for my husband. This place was very pricey for food at a museum. Each side dish you order will cost you. (One place you tell your kids "no you can't have veggies") And not very kid friendly for being at a kids museum. I enjoyed the water dispenser. They don't have those in So. Cal.
This is one of those places where if you want cheap and fast Chinese, go for it, but there is much better in the city. Their chow mein has no flavor, and their egg rolls are pretty greasy.

I work in the Fisherman's Wharf area so the food nearby can get a little redundant. I had been struggling to find some great Chinese food until I walked into this place by the Safeway in the North Point shopping center. It's a fast-food style sort of place, where you get to choose between fried rice/chow mein/steamed and a few entrees. The first time I opted for chow mein, sweet & sour pork, and egg rolls. These were amazing!! They actually MAKE their own eggrolls, and the sweet & sour pork was some of the best I've ever had. Also, I'm not used to the friendly service at most restaurants like this, and here I am always greeted with a smile and I feel welcome each time.
so good! its like.panda and they let u sample whatever you want before buying. the fact that its asia chinese just adds a little kick to the normal chinese food
I couldn't find good lunch stuff at Safeway (locates nearby) and I was such in a hurry, so I tried here. I got beef, broccoli and steamed rice, which is less than $6.
I was working and I needed quick fix for Chinese. Luckily I found this place. I was shocked at how good the food was. It's way better than panda express. Try it out !

I passed by this place many times when i went to safeway and i saw many people eat there made me curious,so i decided to try this place despite negative reviews at yelp, 7$ 2 items with rice or chow mein. it's cheap, fast, big portion and surprisingly delicious. i ordered tofu and garlic chicken wing. the tofu is just so so, however the garlic wing is sooo delicious!! I will come back here again to order the garlic wing. the staff was honest, it happened to the lady before me, she forgot her shopping grocery, the staff took his time to get her stuff back.

I'm actually really surprised by all the bad reviews. No, this isn't going to be the best chinese meal you've ever had but when you're craving some cheap, greasy, fast chinese food this place always hits the spot! Try the made to order items, they're pretty good.  Sometimes, instead of getting fried rice or chow mein with your meal you can get beef chow fun for free! Try tho place out!
When they have the words Asia Chinese together thats not a good sign.  I should have trusted my fatty instincts.
Who doesn't like to see there food thats been siting there for hours under a heat lamp microwaved right in front of them.

Ouch, no love? As another review said, this is like Panda Express. It's like $6 total for rice and two items. If you give their made to order items a try, you'd be pleasantly surprised. It's a lot better than their hot bar items and better than the Chinese place around the corner, which costs a lot more. That said, it's obviously just something you'd eat for convenience in the area.
Fast Chinese food located in the North Point Shopping Center. Very casual, convenient if you are hungry. A place to eat, not a dining experience to cherish.
Good greasy Chinese fast-food. This is the equivalent of Panda Express and is a 7 dollar lunch.
Not bad Chinese food. Great if you're in a hurry
BAAAAAD. I ordered the Rice or Noodles plus 2 sides. I had the sweet and sour pork and some sort of chicken and they were either too salty/odd flavors or flavorless.

Food isn't too great.  They pop it in a microwave and yet, the food is sitting there on a steam table.  I think they might as well just get rid of the table.  Service sucks b/c the people behind the counters keep looking at people come out of Safeway trying to figure out what they bought.  What the hell?

I ordered the small hot & sour soup at Asia Chinese Food after a shopping trip to Safeway. I was so impressed with the $1.50 price that I could not resist. However, when they packed up my soup, I understood the price. The soup container was about the size of a normal sauce container. I have NEVER seen a soup that small! It tasted alright (nothing special) but was definitely only a soup serving fit for a little mouse! Plus, it was kind of a waste to pack the baby soup in a paper bag with napkins, a spoon, and chopsticks when there was so little of it!

I moved to this neighborhood a couple months ago and this is one of my favorite restaurants. The price is reasonable, food is good and customer service is great.  They give a lot too. It is a fast food Chinese restaurant with varieties of choices. I am addicted to thier Orange chicken and Gralic Spicy wings ever since I tried them. Now I am a regular customer especially when I am lazy cooking or getting tired from work. I notice some bad reviews for this restaurant and I can't understand why. It is just the fast food Chinese restaurant which sells their food with very good price.  As long as the price, food and service is great, I will keep coming back. Keep up the good job!
Uh.... no.

Craving Chinese food with not enough time to head over to Chinatown, I found myself in this grungy hole in the wall on my lunch break many months ago. Stood in line for a few minutes, thinking  that a crowd is always a good sign. Then...my order of pork fried rice and whatever else (doesn't matter) from the steam table, mind you, was dumped into a STYROFOAM container, then MICROWAVED for a couple of minutes. Seriously? SERIOUSLY?!!!
This is probably the best Chinese fast food chains I've come upon.

I was just hungry one evening after a exam I had to do nearby. As much I've been around this North Point Shopping center and seen this place, I never had the chance until today. I was deciding whether I should get a sandwich from Safeway or some chinese food (supposely it's cheaper..??).

I do occasionally appreciate greasy 'n sleazy Chinese food, but this place is pretty darn bad.  I think that one of their problems is they don't get enough business and the steamtable items get stale.

Except for the Mitchell's Ice Cream, this was the first time I had actually come to eat.  It's cafeteria-style Chinese food, they have some Filipino food like pork adobo, and they're now boasting Hawaiian style food.  Don't fall for it, the chicken katsu over rice was extremely dry...a slice of white Wonder bread with sauce would've tasted the same.  My friend had some of their chinese food and was disappointed.  The only reason I gave them two stars was because of the Mitchell's ice cream, the ESPN, and the service was nice.

This place is absolutely disgusting. I don't know how they even call it Chinese food. My boyfriend got the bright idea to pick up carry out from here when he was on his way to pick up something from Safeway. He got orange chicken with fried rice, and I got wanton soup.
My girlfriend and I went to Da Flora for the first time tonight to celebrate our 6 month anniversary!
the food is super delicious, so there are the two stars.
Oh my stars, this was good, good, good.

My husband and I recently moved into the neighborhood and a friend suggested we try this restaurant. I'm so glad we did. It's everything you want in a neighborhood restaurant - great food, nice ambience and friendly staff and owners. The gnocchi and focaccia are amazing and our main dishes were delicious as well. Looking forward to our next meal there.

I've been going to Da Flora for ten years and in all of this time has never failed to delight.  Favorites are the sweet potato gnocchi in a garlic cream sauce starter. The squid ink risotto is always good, and they are one of the few Italian restaurants to put liver on the menu - last visit I had chicken livers, cooked to perfection.

Da Flora is the best Italian food I've ever had (outside of being in Italy) and some of the best food I've had in SF period. My Dad discovered this gem a while ago and we've been going here as often as we can ever since.

Walked in to get a quick meal as recommended by someone I was staying with. I was not greeted when I walked in despite a staff member looking me directly in eye. I asked for a table for one and was told to take a seat. As I was just pulling out my chair, another waiter came and told me I would need to wait 45 minutes as they would like to fill the restaurant up with groups instead. It is a small restaurant, but there had to be at least 6-7 empty tables. I have never been refused service for being a single customer - when I told the waiter I will look elsewhere he shrugged his shoulders and just said "yeah, probably". It was embarrassing and I do not recommend this place at all - judging by other reviews they are clearly just a Money making machine and do not value the importance of their customers' experience. Zero stars.

This is a bit of a hidden gem. A piece of old school Little Italy if you will. One of my college friends swore by it and dragged me here retty much ever since they opened. I think it's evolved a bit. Nowadays the gnocchi/bread are the stars but back in the day I remember having a great carbonara. It's rare that an Italian place in NorCal will focus mostly on an area and the Venetian bent here makes it worth going to for that regional flare.

A wonderful intimate Italilan restaurant with an amazing, unique menu. The sweet potato gnochi is amazing! WIne list is primarly from Italy and surrounding regions with some excellent choices. Staff is very friendly and attentive. The food is fabulous!
This place is a real find. The ambiance is charming. The staff delightful. The food is spectacular. A must go
Absolutely unique and delightful. 10/10

I have found the Holy Grail - quote from my dinning companion and the absolute truth!  The food was AMAZING!  The service and space was just as good.  Can't believe I have walked by this Jem so many times and never stopped in.  The bread was so delicious it brought tears it was so amazing.

I selfishly want to keep this place to myself, but I will share it because they deserve the business. My lady and I live in LA, but every time we are in SF, it's a MUST for us to eat at Da Flora. This is a wonderful mom and pop restaurant. It's the best Italian food we've ever had and I'm Italian! The bread before the meal is so warm and fresh and perfectly oiled and spiced, it could be a meal in itself.  We always get Mary Beth as our server and she is amazing. Eating here is like having homemade food that your Italian grandmother would make. Jen the chef is not just a chef, she's an artist and the menu is handwritten and Jen changes it regularly, so we're always looking forward to what delicious creation she'll come up with next.  You must try the sweet potato Gnocci; it's out of this world! The ambience, the intimate environment, the people, the food.....you get the whole package here!
Sadly ... or experience had some extreme highs and lows. I cant recommend the place.
Excellent gnocchi.  We appreciate that they were able to accommodate a party of seven on short notice.  Proprietress was very pleasant.

Ok - this is tough as IT REALLY deserves 3.5 stars - not quite 4 as I just gave that to SPQR and reserve 5 for French Laundry types - second time here prior to seeing comedy show - good food, very, very nice service, but just not OUTSTANDING - prices insinuate a bit more to the food, however, still would come back.  Small and quaint with very friendly service - food is interesting but lacks that PUNCH one would expect - needs a bit more on simple seasonings like salt/pepper - quality of the food is great - the gnocchi is REALLY good and the ceaser was exceptional - the Manicotti was actually the best part of the meal which was layered in wonderful cream and basil sauce that complimented the rich, velvety interior of the manicotti itself!!

I must admit that the first time I visited Da Flora I was not that impressed but I had a good enough time to return. The second time around everything fell into place. It's that kind of place. It takes a little getting use to. The owners are very friendly and the their recommended wine was great. I can't remember what it was but the four of us had three bottles.

Had a dreamy night here on my birthday - possibly the best birthday dinner of my life; though I have to confess that the company factored in. Bottom line is, I grew up with my Grandma Carmella's gnocchi as the gold standard. I've been on a quest to find gnocchi that measured up my entire life, including the 9 months I spent studying in Italy. The sweet potato gnocchi here measures up; in fact, if I were being entirely honest I might even say it surpasses my grandma's (please don't hate me, Grandma!). In addition to that, Da Flora is the epitome of romantic. The lighting, the paint, the restroom, the hand written menus,  the tables - all fabulous. Thank you for an evening that will always be among my favorite memories!
If you'd like to be ignored and receive the slowest and likely the worst service in the city give this place a try.

Can't even give this restaurant one star - but this app is making me.  We live in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try this place for years.  Based on some great yelp reviews we finally planned and made reservations.  We were excited to try this local spot...

Around the corner from where we live, the folks at da flora put out lovingly made food that's delicious but probably not low-cal (bacon gnocchi to die for). The place is warm and inviting and definitely not a tourist trap.
Truly a gem! A small, cozy place with a small menu of food made well.
Food=scrumpcious, real, fresh, local. YUM
This has been my favorite Italian restaurant ... and favorite overall restaurant ... in SF for several years.  Both are big statements, and Da Flora lives up to them easily.

Da Flora is quite unique. The atmosphere is quaint & friendly. Several people that walked through the door were greeted with a hug from the owner. They prefer cash & ask that you don't use your cell phones (I'm a fan of the no cell phone usage during dinner btw). The menu changes daily, but the one thing that is always available is the homemade focaccia bread. This was hands down the BEST focaccia I've ever had. I would go back just for the bread alone. It was crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, had a hint of salt, and was lightly coated in olive oil. We ate two full plates of it between the two of us, and for once in my life I didn't feel guilty about the carbs because they were worth every bite. We had the stuffed artichoke for a starter. I expected it to be served warm, instead of cold, but it was still really good. The crunch of the breadcrumbs and the tender artichoke heart was a great contrast. My dinner companion had the halibut served over asparagus. He thought it was a little bland. I had the risi bisi: risotto with fresh peas. Great flavors & texture. Not too rich, and very filling. Overall I really enjoyed the meal and the ambiance. The prices were on the higher side, but fairly average for NB. Go try the focaccia!!

We've eaten at Da Flora's several times over the years, and until last night I would have given them 4 stars consistently.  Bread excellent, fabulous even; ditto gnocchi and desserts.  I thought the entree was so-so, consistently.   Also, as noted by other reviewers, the two women running the place lacked a little something in the area of class and good manners.
I've had my eye on Da Flora for awhile now - I live in the neighborhood and I keep reading and hearing great things. I decided to take my parents here while they were visiting.

With so many fabulous restaurants in San Francisco, I can't imagine why anyone would put up with a grumpy, unwelcoming place. The food was nothing special. They don't like you to pay with credit cards.
Pulled in by the great ambiance.
I've been coming here for years. Cozy, romantic restaurant with tables spaced acceptably.
**3.5 STARS**
Great place! The food was excellent. The staff is so matter of fact. It's hilarious. Loved the atmosphere.
The best restaurant in the West Coast!  Flora is such a great host -- no winning and make sure your cell phone is off though... Trust her with the wine selection.  The gnocchi are out of this world!

This hidden local Italian restaurant is a gem!  And our tradition in North Beach.  Far and away the best Italian food, and the best wines.  MaryBeth makes the best focaccia and desserts, Jen the best gnocchi and pasta ever, and Flora is hands-down the expert on Italian wines.  We simply tell her she's in charge of our wine!

This restaurant is the best high-end Italian you will find in the city.  The food is excellent, the wine is excellent, and the atmosphere is a pure delight and a welcome escape from the sterile, flat-screen peppered trend traps that seem to be taking over the universe these days.  I am a concierge, and I regularly recommend Da Flora to my guests, especially when they are planning a birthday or anniversary dinner.  Not one of my guests has ever been disappointed by the cuisine or by the service there.
This is the best restaurant I have ever been to.

Ok walked into the place on a Saturday night at 9:30 pm and was turned away with 5 available tables. To add salt to the wound, it was my birthday dinner. DO WE NOT LIVE IN A MAJOR US CITY?  I now give up on this place, the food is amazing but Shrek, owner #1, and the other fat lady provide the most horrible service that I just cannot go there ever again

Their foccacia bread & sweet potato gnocchi with bacon were absolutely unforgettable!!   Unfortunately, so was the offensive service and attitude we received from Flora and the rest of their wait staff (as many others have pointed out).  Definitely the worst I've ever experienced. EVER. We will not be going back, and will not be recommending this restaurant to any of our friends.

It was just okay. The Caesar salad was good, but the linguini with onions was a bit dry.  We had to ask for our check as we waited a long time for our plates to be cleared. It wasn't crowded at that point. Only 4 tables left. The woman that sat us was nasty.  It was as if she didn't want our teenage sons in her restaurant.  Overly expensive for portion size.

What a find! Had a truly unique and amazing meal -- delicious all the way around. The food was simply superb - Venetian Italian with Hungarian influences. The decor felt sumptuous and elegant yet cozy enough to drop in for a week night meal. Fantastic Italian wine list. The staff was very friendly and informative. I will put this one on my "regular" list.

Came here for breakfast today. I love the five dollars breakfast. It includes milk tea, pancakes and your choice from a huge list including porridge, sandwich and noodle.....The place is clean and roomy, free Wi-Fi. I think everyone should know about this hidden gem. Very close to the Vallejo parking lot. I have lunch here before, not bad.

For a Hong Kong-style restaurant, this one is quiet and clean. Though, I may not know the Health Department score. I do feel optimistic on the cleanliness since this café is still located in Chinatown.
Pretty good HK food place--not sure why everyone is hating on it!

Horrible service. I ordered for delivery (estimated 45 minutes) and they called me over an hour later saying that were busy but would start making the food then. Very unprofessional and the food isn't even that good.
Asian style cafe

Ive always been afraid to go to a cafe during my lunch break due to slow services that I have experienced. But this place was quick and easy! I ordered the curry chicken with rice.. Oh boy.. IT WAS SO GOOD! The chicken was very very tender ! Service was also good. I was seated immediately when I arrived and greeted with a warm smile! Definitely will be back ! (: My new go-to spot on my lunch break !

Not the best but definitely cheaper than Washington. If you want something quick. This place is ok. I was here before the change of ownership and it used to be a lot better. But now, my friends hate it. I think it's ok.

This place is disgusting. I was staying at the Hilton in downtown and decided to order delivery. First, the delivery man didn't want to come across the street into the hotel. He kept calling me phone, telling me to come outside and cross the street to get the food. ??? Weird.
Not bad, not great either. Call this Plan-C, when you absolutely cannot find any other place to eat.

I only come here for breakfast since it opens hella early. I love to get the satay beef ramen here but the quality of it varies. The first 2 times it taste amazing but the recent time noodles were soggy and stuff.
I gave them a shot after the change of the ownership of this place.  The service is okay.  Unfortunately, their food are not up to the par.  I really miss their tasty dishes from their previous chef.
Little Garden has new owners! If you remember this as a hole in the wall kind of place, give them another chance! The restaurant is clean and welcoming, and the food is delicious!
This place embodies "Meh".

If you're on a budget, this place is CHEAP! They have very large portions for a good price...usually ranging from 4-7 dollars. I ordered the groupa with the sweet cream corn sauce and I did try this dish at another hong kong style cafe, but this place was a lot better! It was very yummy and fattening!
First time here, this place has the Hong Kong cafe feel when you walk right in with so many ads of menu items taped on the wall and the tv on the corner near the door.

The kway teow (Singaporean-style fried noodles) had some nice heat to it from the red pepper flakes, but I was confused why there was spam involved. The shrimp was the usual touch, but the spam strips? While tasty, it made the whole dish a little greasier tasting than it should have been.

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to eat at a Chinese version of Denny's?  This place has it all.  From the screaming kids, bad service and extensive menu, it makes for an unforgettable experience you would never want to repeat.

i was with some friends after walking around ct in the summer and i got thirsty. (this is actually a late post). i was really craving a red bean ice, so i got one. it was... not good. the red beans were chewy and not soft; there was no flavor; it was pretty much ice; the price was a bit high, kinda. point is, don't order that here!
I'm bumping up to four stars for the following reasons:
My friend really likes this place. He goes there all the time. I love cream of mushroom soup and my friend said this place had it.
The waitresses are nice to you if you give them a big tip.
the proportions are not big. i can get this food mostly at anywhere. it's a OK place to eat.
This was an average HK tea house. Being chinese, I eat this type of food on the regular. I had the Stewed ham and chicken spaghetti  and it was yummo. Always a good place to grab a quick bite.
What the F. The first time we went, it was horrible. It wasn't the food exactly though.
Is cheap and I love Hong Kong style food, I am from HK, we always call for delivery. Good place to eat and price is cheap.

Typical Hong Kong style cafe with decent Chinese food. I usually come here because it's right across the street from the North Beach Garage and it's convenient. I order the satay beef ramen which comes with chewy (not the best) slices of beef, bell peppers, onions, and bits of pineapple. Comfort food but undoubtedly packed with MSG. Fiancé orders Ma Po Seafood Lo Mein which is noodles with squid, shrimp and tofu, which he loves and quickly devours. Their hot milk tea is made with the perfect amount of sweetness. The service is decent for a Chinese restaurant. They get you what you need. The waitress there recognizes us so she jokes with us.

Cheap, but I've had cheaper. Decent at best. Definitely a local's spot. If I lived in the area, this would probably be one of my regular spots, but I don't, and it's really not worth going out of your way for.

It's about asking for what you want.  They actually do it when the place is not overcrowded.  I love steamed and stir-fried veggies ... hold the rice, spice and grease.  I said anything that's fresh.  I said to the waitress, "Make a large vegetable plate the way you would want to eat veggies for your self.  I know it'll be great.  Lots of veggies."  I loved it.  It was cheap.  It's right across the street from the cheapest garage in Chinatown.  No where near Portsmouth Square, right next to North Station Police Department.  It's perfect.  Then you take a walk to the Filbert Steps by way of Montgomery.  Watch the parrots fly.  Walk to Coit Tower to see the Diego Rivera murals.  Life is good.

Beware of this place... there is no parking at this place 1st of all, and the prices went up for the parking lot so i wouldn't wanna park there... when i ate here once... i had a bad experience... i had a fat ass stomach ache  right after ate their food. never coming back here again

My friends and I were all craving for Chinese, and my best friend (who lives in the Bay Area--the rest of us are from the Sacramento area, though I did grow up in Daly City) recommended  this place.  All I gotta say is wow, the food is affordable and yummy!!  I ordered a beef satay with enoki.  The noodles on the bottom were still crunchy, but the sauce softened it up.  The beef was savory.  The portions are just right; not too big, not too small.  We also all had milk tea, which tasted like a latte without the extra sugar and the stomach runs.  The service was fast, and the owners were friendly.  My only complaint was that when we got tea (regular, not milk tea), it wasn't hot.  Just lukewarm.  Oh well.  I wanna try many amazing restaurants to try in San Fran, but I wouldn't mind coming back.
Food: 2 Stars

Came here to eat with the grandparents who enjoyed the Chinese takes on western dishes like rack of lamb. My pork cutlet was pretty tender, and big portions like you would expect in C-town. They also have a lot of other more traditional Chinese noodles and soups deal. Family-owned places like this always makes me feel the food is more homecmade, especially with all their children watching cartoons at an unoccupied table like its the daycare corner. Very affordable, simple restaurant.

I came here because I realized after living near Chinatown for so long , I've never came here to eat . When I first walked in , it reminded me of D&A but a cleaner version . They have a TV and a specials menu . The regular menu is really long . The prices are pretty fair but the quality is ehh . The food itself is mediocre . The first time I came here , I ordered a steak which tasted okay but kind of bland in a way . The second time I came , I ordered fried soy sauce noodles which tasted good . I also ordered curry deep fried oysters which was a complete rip off !! It was just deep fried oysters and some blandass watery curry sauce on the side in a separate dish . I also ordered a iced lemon w/ honey which wasn't sweet at all .

I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  It reminded me of D&A when I walked in.  We ordered the clams in black bean sauce which were delish and only $7.50!  They were flavorful and the clams were huge!  Also, the oyster clay pot was yummy as well.  I'm alwayz afraid that when ordering clay pots that the food will be overcooked, but it wasn't.  A complaint I do have about this place is that they like to serve a whole table before moving on to the next, so we had to wait a while before getting our food.  Once one dish came, the rest were right behind.  Prices here are pretty good.  For 3 people, we ended up spending around $35, which included tip.  All in all, a great bang for your buck!

Wanted Chinese and to try somewhere new - saw that they have the 3 dishes for $15.99 special and decided to give this place a try.  We've walked by this place plenty times given it's next to the police station and the parking garages.  Over the weekends, this place was pretty busy but the evening we were there - there were 2 other tables, 1 with 6 and another with just 1.

Being a fan of D&A or VIP Coffee, it was hard to pull me way from the gravitational force of those two, but we decided to mix it up.  we ordered from the chinese menu (you know - 3 dishes for $16 + soup).  the food here is pretty solid, and really tasty compared to other places in chinatown, so i'd definitely go back.  but the menu is freaking incredible.  in my experience, too large a menu = too much indecision on my part.  but it gets 3 stars b/c it's not necessarily a compelling restaurant, but something that is a reliable fall-back.

The food is all right and the service is typical of Hong Kong eateries.  The menu is massive, but items are cheap.  We ordered the fried squid, stir-fried noodles with beef, pineapples and Enoki mushrooms, and the Ma Po Seafood Yee Mein.  The beef noodles were good, but quality of beef is average.  The calamari was delicious and fresh.  Then the Ma Po noodles were just bad!  I'm into new Asian dishes, but this was something I could not enjoy.  The noodles were like a white sponge texture and the sauce was brothy & spicy hot, but some how bland.  The dish's seafood was good except for the scallops used, it was just off for some reason.  For a cheap spot, I guess you get what you paid for.  I recommend for all patrons to stay away from the Ma Po noodles.
I would've never entered this place if it wasn't for my friend. It was very... eh.

Great for what it is - a tourist destination for those who aim to do a lot of drinking. They hosted a great event for some volunteers and the staff and management could not have been nicer. Alas, just not my cup of tea.
hello hardrock.start with a Long Island iced tea . Followed by a margarita. I'm trilled ！
