My 1st time ever eating at Hard Rock and shockingly it was really good for a chain restaurant!  Free appetizer if you check in on yelp! Got the bruschetta and it was yummy. The ceasar salad was one of the best I've had in a long time, very garlicky! I had their steak and shrimp fajita which was also so good. The beef was super tender. Both the steak and shrimp had yummy marinade. And molten chocolate cake to end it was perfect.  Very shocked how good it was and service was excellent.
Friendly attitudes but extremely poor service. We waited 5 minutes at the entrance as there was no host present. We waited considerable periods of time for service throughout our meal.

I've always been a fan of this Hard Rock. I usually get the BBQ bacon burger and its always excellent. The potato skins are also very good. This place gets crowded from its location so expect a wait and sometimes service can be a little slow.

I love hard rock cafè because it resembles my musical interest. I went there several times and each time had a very different experience. Whenever i dine in, i feel like it is just another american style burger restaurant but when i go to drink it is awesome. They have very limited drinks, so they should improve the menu.

Ok. First off.....props to Bree (sounds like the cheese only not spelled the same.  I realize the month+ old reservation was for a party of plus 35 and that explains why nothing was ready waiters working other tables at the same time etc. At $25 bucks a pop the tip is already there. She still her job.  In fact she did an excellent job!
Loved this place!!

Came out here straight from the airport on August 21st.  Hosts Evelyn and Carly were awesome!  Let me charge my phone and took care of me while I was meeting up some friends.  Food and drink was cool.  Def would head back here.
yum yum yum!, great food, great service...love the decor!

Nice place to go after work to spend some time with coworkers. Everything on the appetizer menu was half off which was great. So if you wanna relax and have fun this is a great place to go while on the Bay area. Oh and it's on Fisherman's warf so you can go around before or after.

Same as every other Hard Rock. Waiters were overworked with the high traffic and as a result a bit short tempered. Our waiter was fine but we saw some of the other staff be downright rude to customers. Food was good, drinks overpriced but fine.

I had the cowboy rib eye medium/well and my daughter had the swiss mushroom burger.  My steak was perfect....mashed potatoes lukewarm on the outside hot inside....blue lake string brings bland but cooked perfectly and tasted good after I put some of the herb butter that was on my steak on them.....I tasted my daughters burger and it was hella good too!

Following up,Barry, the manager at the Hard Rock in San Francisco, contacted me immediately and apologized. He was very understanding and sent me two gift cards to visit them again. It was nice knowing that they cared and tried to fix the problem. Thank you for responding back and caring what your customers think.

I took 11 of my little girls friends here for her 10th birthday party. Not only were the staff accommodating, they went out of their way to make all of us feel welcome and enjoy our visit. The General Manager Barry Cales went out of his way to greet our table and wish my daughter a happy birthday. Barry e mailed me the week before our arrival with all the details and put together party bags for all of the kids. He made sure that our table was very well taken care of and really went out of his way to give us a great experience. The staff was so friendly and on point all night. We could not have enjoyed our experience anymore then we did that night. Really!!! ABOVE AND BEYOND! Thank you

The surrounding is pretty cool, but for dining it's not that great. the food was and probably still is awful and overpriced. I saw our server 3 times throughtout the whole meal and it didn't help with that crap attitude she had. This place needs a lot of work.

I intended to just get appetizer and dessert. Wait time was long especially for the time it was because there was barely anyone there. A different waitress brings us our appetizer. We get our appetizer, perfect. Sweet small wait. We finish our appetizer. The waitress never comes to ask us anything and doesn't even approach us at the table once. We wait about 30 minutes and then finally she comes to let us know that she's going on break and a new server will come. We wait about 10 mins and we see our new server socializing with a family member that came to sit right next to us. The waiter finally comes and takes our order and goes back to the family member. In total it took us an hour to get 1 app and 1 dessert.
The service sucks here!!  Douchbag, hipster, Gen X wash out...  Very rude people working here!!!  I will never ever come back to this location..  Beware!!!!
I like this place but it is for the tourist so get your merchandise and burgers. I'll get the ribs!
$17 Nachos. What?

This place is home to the weakest drink I have ever had. I expect that when I order a drink I'm actually going to consume alcohol, not just throw away calories drinking a stupid soda. I ordered a Long Island ($10) which usually has the most bang for your buck and is sometimes even a little strong for my taste. Not here. Tasted nothing, felt nothing (on an empty stomach!) still not convinced the bartender actually put anything in it. I can only imagine what their other drinks are like. They would probably make you LESS drunk.
Came here for some good burgers because I remember eating here a couple of times before and have memories of really delicious burgers. Today wasn't one of those days which is really unfortunate.

It's Hard Rock, so you're coming for the atmosphere.  Here, on Pier 39, it's pretty fun and worthwhile.  If you've never been to Hard Rock, the food is good, but I've stuck to burgers and nachos.  Everything else is too expensive for what I'm in the mood for when I go to HRC.  The kids also like their food.  But, it's fun and I love seeing the memorabilia. The kids also like it which helps!  The waiter was nice and we were able to sit right away at about 11:30am.

When we first walked in there was no wait. We were seated immediately. They seated us near the bar at the high seats. When I asked to sit at the booth, the people at the front that takes you to the table, told me that they couldn't sit us at the booth without a reason. I let it go since I was on a date. A couple minutes later they sat two people at a booth.
Pro's

My family and I ate here on a Friday evening. Got a table right away. The greeters were super friendly and our waiter had a laid back (but attentive) demeanor that was perfect after the hectic vibe from walking Pier 39. Our food was prepared perfectly, and arrived just as we were finishing our appetizer. Drinks were refilled promptly. Bathroom was in slight need of repair and some fresh paint. Otherwise a perfect experience. Oh, and $10 off our parking with validation!

Hard Rock has great service and a wide selection of drinks and good food however I dont feel they embrace the local fish, fruits, veggies that California is known for. They need to embrace California and reach out on the food menu. They should "OWN" the Wharf.
Cool music.  Use AAA card for discount and get parking validated. Good food. Fajitas and Tupelo chicken are good.
Awesome music! Awesome setting! Came here with my friends and the waiter was super friendly and funny. It was pricy but we got a lot for our money so I guess it was worth it. Definitely was good.

We came here  starving after taking the tour to Alcatraz. There was a 15 minute wait which seemed unnecessary when we were eventually seated - there were several empty, set tables. Our waiter was great - very attentive and friendly. The food is decent and the atmosphere was good.
Great place lots of fun fast service and nice staff. Drink were always full and the food was as we ordered it. Also the check in deals are great.
Had the nachos with beef brikets and guac. The chips were crunchy. Plenty of food for four as an appetizer.  Fast service.

This update is based solely on the amazing customer service response.  I was contacted and offered a gift card and was given an apology by the manager directly and that is huge.  I am a fan of this attention to detail and am excited to give Hard Rock another chance!

We stopped into the Hard Rock Cafe around 3 p.m. after a boat cruise for some delicious guilty carb pleasures, since a disappointing visit to the nearby Corn Dog and Churro Kiosk left us wanting more.

As a local, I rarely venture into the Warf but for sake of spontaneity my girlfriends and I decided to embark on a little sailing adventure (Shout out to Adventure Cat). Post sail, we found ourselves in need of a beverage and snack (and a mirror to fix the birds nests on our heads created by the whipping winds of the bay). Once the wild nests were contained, we belly'd up to the bar and were greeted by Lauren, an awesome bartender with contagious energy. As she fixed us up some fancy margs, she assisted us with the menu and made some fantastic suggestions! We decided on french fries and potato skins! And not just your run-of-the-mil tato skins. She made em extra sassy with the addition of some avo and extra dipping sauces. We had a great experience! Well done Hard Rock Cafe and well done Lauren! We will be back soon!

Touristy, noisy, bland food and mediocre service. We were here with a large party and booked a price fix menu. The service was slow and not particularly warm. Refills of drinks rare. The "legendary" burger was quite ordinary.

The Hard Rock Cafe is a theme restaurant just like Planet Hollywood or the Rainforest Cafe. That means that it is something you go to once, knowing that it's all about the theme and little about the food. And in Pier 39, where there are no locals and half a billion tourists waving money around, why not? The theme restaurant is a good genre for one out of every ten thousand times you enter a restaurant. I went for a birthday of mine.
Aside from the loud music, the food is pretty good! For the price we paid it did fill us up, but most of the dishes aren't anything special. Mostly burgers and steak and such :)

I came in at about 945 when most restaurants would have said they're closed. They let us get two entrees and gave us the appetizer free when we mentioned the yelp offer. They also did not bat an eye or give us any special time of day limited time offer BS on trying to get any free appetizer or dessert we wanted. Its really free. Any one you want. I got the chicken tenders. High class chicken tenders alright. Thats for sure.

Awful service! Waitress  Fuzzy ignorent and not friendly. Forgot about the salad I ordered, couldn't get her attention for 20 mins, friends were halfway done with their meal when she came up. Charged us for an extra appetizer we didn't get, and didn't get refunded because she pretended not to see us. I just got upset and walked out, which I regret..should have asked for a manager!

I work nearby and finally decided to eat a slice of pizza. There was NO ONE in line behind me. About two people waiting for their full pizza order. I ordered a single slice of cheese. There were plenty of them right there in the front. I had to wait five minutes because the woman at the front (there were at least four others there, and two were not specifically doing anything). Is it so hard,  instead of standing there doing nothing,  to put a piece of pizza RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU on a plate? I can only imagine what a joy this place is when it's busy. Worst customer service I've seen in a while. Hire employees who aren't lazy,  or if it's a policy thing, let the freakin cashier who's doing nothing anyway plate a piece of pizza. It's simple. Maybe then I'd come back.

I was at this restaurant last night around 11:30. The woman at the counter who took my order was so rude. When I asked her nicely for a bag, she practically threw it at me. It's bad enough that aggresive panhandlers come into this place and bug the customers. It's bad enough that this place is very small and the customers are always bumping into each other. So why should we have to deal with unnecessary rudeness from the people who are taking our money. You know what I mean. I'm done with this place for good.
Exactly what I asked for, a slice of pepperoni. What I got, a slice of tasty pepperonis and an awesome, crunchy crust. Loved it. I'm going back tonight.

On our first night in San Francisco we decided to head out for a late night snack and came across Pizza Prada.. We go in and order 4 slices of pizza and 2 drinks for take out.. We asked if you have boxes for take out, the gentleman behind the counter said yes.. We were not informed that we were going to be charged for the boxes. As a paying customer you would think you would be informed of this prior to paying, not... It was discovered the next day after looking at the receipt.. So if i would have stayed and ate in, would they have charged me for the paper plate ?? Will not be going back to pizza prada on my next visit to San Francisco....
Came here in the middle of the week for lunch. Good deal, good pizza!! Definitely coming back here! I even think its better than Blondies!!! :D and my fave, good customer service!
I know the reviews are sort of mixed here, but I actually really enjoyed it. The price is right and the slices are HUGE. Crust was enjoyably crispy and plenty of toppings.

It's a little steep for one slice that's clearly been sitting out there for a while and the toppings taste kind of stale. But it's in a convenient location and late at night when you're craving something random, it isn't so bad.

I was completely wasted (from Gold Dust next door) when I took a bite out of their pizza. It was the best f-ing slice of pizza I've ever tasted in my life. Hey, maybe it was because I was intoxicated, but my pepperoni slice had large amounts of mozzarella (that's all I can remember).
Alert ! Charge 25 for a box!
It's okay if you're hungry.

We came here because Blondie's was closed (at 9pm), and I was disappointed because I really wanted to try their pasta. However, no mistake coming here. $4.11 for a slice of pizza, but the best I've ever had in my life. Why? Because the crust was BOMB. I love my pizza thin, crispy, cheesy. Tomato slices on top were devoured before anything else.
I'll keep this short and sweet.

In full disclosure I've never been here except about 15 mins before it closes nor have i had this pizza sober... its conveniently next door to the wonderful gold dust and open til about 2:30am (ish). I've always gotten the pepperoni, sausage & olive pizza. its about $3-4 for a HUGE slice of thick crust and tasty sauce and toppings.. they warm it in the oven once you place your order so it tastes fresh/crisp.  tasty tasty :)
Decent pizza by the slice.. pretty quick and prices are good for what you get.. I got a combo meal: slice of mushroom pizza, Cesar salad, and small refil-able drink for $6.95!

I'm surprised this place isn't rated higher. Maybe cause it's too touristy and people just seem to hate tourists for no reason? Granted, the pizza is super-doughy. You can literally taste dough with every bite. But they pack on the cheese over delicious sauce, still making the pizza very tasty. They also give a huge slice and a soda for $4 something. Can't complain with that, especially in Union Square. If I have the choice, I still choose Blondies every day of the week. But they close so early for some reason. This place is open til the wee hours of the morning. Gotta love it. In fact, I'm bumping it up to 4 stars now...

My BF and I love the pizza from here! We stayed at the Westin St. Francis and it was so close and convenient! It's open late, cheap and delicious! My BF especially loves the crust, crispy and just the perfect thickness. We had pepperoni and sausage pizza and they were both so good. Great cheap pizza!! (don't be fooled by the storefront...it shares a space with  dinky chinese restaurant).

Walking down Powell Street looking for places to blow his paycheck, my boyfriend stopped in his tracks when he caught the strong whiff of melted mozzarella. "Pizza??"  My only experience with good food on my last SF trip was Golden Boy Pizza (
I LOVE THIS PIZZA!!!!! its so good me and my friend did a small competition to eat with alot of hot sauce on it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!AND IT STILL TASTED GREAT!!!!
LOVE this pizza!! Huge slices, great choices,very delish!!! I always grab a slice when I'm in town:)
tourist trap - but in this neighborhood - more than does the trick... by trick i mean - get enough unhealthy food into your system to stave off a hangover the next morning...
If you like a good slice of pizza, this place is NOT for you.
That 4th star probably has way more to do with the rest of evening than anything this pizza and hot dog joint had to do with it, but...
Is this the best pizza?  No, not even close.  But is it good enough?  Yes, it is good enough.

First Time eating there and it shall be my LAST! Extremely rude workers. I ordered Pasta. It was the nastiest pasta I have ever had; when I opened the box my friend jerked his head from the stench; the bread stick that came with it was hard as well. I decided to try it anyways and took one bite, which tasted disgusting, so I wanted a refund. So, I walked back up to the counter and asked for one. First she said No returns after 6PM and it just so happen to be 6:06pm. Then she said her manager was not here to do returns. So I asked for an exchange maybe 3 slices of pizza.. only because the pasta was 12 bucks... not even a serving size worth. I wasn't satisfied with my food. The lady at the counter was rude. She didn't want to give me a refund. and she had the audacity to say she wasted 12 bucks when I brought it. I understand that they have to toss it. But It was really nasty. So she said I can have two slices of pizza. which I was ok with that. But I wanted pepperoni, which they had two old pieces and I notice a fresh pizza coming out of the oven, and it just so happen to be pepperoni. So I asked for the fresh slices only because the old slices had Mushrooms on it and I am allergic to mushrooms and I didn't want to die. She gave me the biggest attitude on that note... getting my pizza and throwing it on the counter... I will never eat there again. They don't even have enough seats for their customers. Their pizza is priced tooo high anyway. I'd rather have gone to Blondie's or something like that.

When I was a little kid , I used to prefer this place over Blondie's for pizza but I remember coming here last time ( I don't remember when exactly ) and not liking the taste of it . I came here the other day with my friend and ordered a hot dog combo . The hot dog didn't tasted all that great .. it really lacked flavor . To be honest , I'd rather purchase a hot dog from the hot dog stand . The fries tasted alright but I felt like they were not really salty . They don't allow refills .. can you believe that ? Btw , I think this place is linked to the Asian takeout place next door so you can sit inside ..

I guess I'm in the minority here amongst my fellow yelpers because I actually really like the pizza here! I definitely prefer this pizza over Blondies, as it's not uberly greasy and not completely tourist infested.

Not bad but not great either. Claire P and I were feening for pizza tonight but didn't want to walk all the way up to Uncle Vito's. We passed by Pizza Prada and we said "why don't we just go here?" I had a slice of their mushroom & olive pizza and Claire had cheese & pepperoni. We were satisfied but we still knew we probably could've gotten a much better slice at Uncle Vito's. Next time I'll be sure to take a longer lunch break so we can make the trip up there. =)

The pizza did taste decent, but the service was def not great.  They have no option for a combo with any type of pizza other than cheese or pepperoni.  Because of this, I decided I would simply get one of their overpriced slices without a soda, and ordered a water instead.  She wouldn't even give me a water in a cup, instead she wanted me to buy a bottled water (same thing as city water but with more carcinogenic plasticizers).  Then we ended up eating at a table next door since they had no seating at the restaurant and decided to get away from the cranky server anyhow.
Well, the good news is that if you're lucky this is the worst pizza you'll ever eat.
If you are tipsy and craving pizza stop reading this and just go already!

I saw the little mexican woman (Yet her name is HELGA) that works in the front actually put her finger in the nose and then proceeded to touch a pizza with her hand.  This pizza was then sold to a customer.  GROSS!!!
Great for late night munchies and that's about it.
5 stars for satisfying my late night fix

Try finding pizza within a 10-block radius late at night.  Seriously, your only option is to get delivery from Mr. Pizza Man, which is awful in all respects (except that it's 24 hours...)  3 stars for the location/hours alone.
My first impression of this place was, "Eww, not another fast food place with mediocre food."
I like the pizza cuz it's uber doughy lol come here a lot at 1am.

Yuck!  This place is perfect for tourists because they don't know any better.  I got a lukewarm (even after heating) pesto / tomato slice which cost near $4 with the $0.23 box fee.  That fee sucks given that the place has no tables and chairs, so you really don't have much of a choice than to take it to go.  I also second Tyler W.'s comments - it was pretty uncomfortable to have to wait in the 3 foot deep customer area while random people begged us to buy them a slice.
meh.
Decent for a quick bite when you're doing the tourist thing, but in reality this is no place to go. The wait is about 4-5 minutes to long no matter what you order.
I've never been to Blondie's but this place is ok. 2 slices + one soda = about $6.50. It's have to beat that. The pizza is decent though the crust is way too thick and the line moves relatively fast.

I'm a plant-based mountain local and wish someone would open one in Reno or Tahoe! We have no vegan options on the North Shore. How insane is that? If you like veggies and Chinese food, you can't go wrong. Had the Eggplant Tofu & Thai iced tea. Great as always.

I went here with a group of friends a week ago. The food was great (thank you happy cow app). The Pad Thai I got was so delicious I'm going to make a point of getting more next time I'm in San Fran. The crispy noodles my friend ordered were really good too. The orange chicken was pretty good, though a little crunchy for my taste. You shouldn't order the #2 spring rolls as they're really dry and taste like nothing. The bathroom was a single and kind of dingy.
"fast-food" vegan.

What an amazing treat it was to eat in a vegan restaurant with an amazing array of Asian dishes.  It was great to contemplate ordering from a menu without worrying about hidden animal-based ingredients.  My daughter and I came for lunch, and saw a tantalizing buffet.  Still, we both ended up ordering generous portions of vegetable wonton soup with noodles, since it is impossible to order vegetarian wonton soup in the area where I live in the Northeast.  From the first sip of the delicate broth, I was hooked.  If I hadn't been so full after eating my soup, I would have ordered a slice of vegan coconut cheesecake.

This is a review based on my take out order. I was feeling lazy and didn't feel like cooking after working a long day so I decided to order for take out. I ordered the chow fun and the bun bo hue. The chow fun had good flavoring but lacked mushrooms in it but that's just in my opinion. There was soy jerkey, asparagus, carrots, bean sprouts and an Asian veggie. The bun bo hue on the other hand.. omg where do I start?! It was so fucking horrible. They separated the noodle and the soup like any good restaurant would. Broth pretty flavorful but the noodles.. one bite and I almost threw up. Ever had a restaurant that messed up an order, had it sitting there for quite a good amount of time and recooked it or.. like when you have noodles on the stove top for so long and totally forgot about it? Yeah, bottom line is my noodles were SO mushy I couldn't eat it. The noodles are sitting in my fridge right now and I literally had to make my own noodle soup.. disappointing because I ordered the noodle soup from the loving hut in the Westfield mall a few days ago and it was soooo delicious. Be forewarned if you order from here do not I repeat do not order the noodle soup, save your momey and order it from the Westfield location even though parking is going to be a pain..

This was probably the worst meal I've ever had at a restaurant. It was a plate of bell peppers in sweet and sour sauce. I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered that, but it was disgusting. None of my friends were happy with their meals either.
I went looking for love and found it! Iove this place! But first, I am not a VEGAN. I lift heavy at the gym and I need my Protein. However when it comes to "Eating Clean" this is your place.
I tried it again and even though they don't have the awesome cake they used to have, the food got much better!! Really good actually! I had the eggplant again and I loved it.
Healthy and yummy

My Father, a Vegan, recommended this place for a quick lunch whilst in SF. Had to give it a shot! Really enjoyed the "seafood" tofu tempura and basically everything else. The only thing, was the price. A bit higher than you'd want to pay if you're looking to order a few things on the menu. Overall - GREAT EXPERIENCE. Love the Loving Hut.
Service was excellent. Food was very good and I am a super picky eater. Was clean and will def be coming back when I visit.
Loving hut, I'm loving you! (I'm sure I'm not the first to use that pun).

I really like this place and very importantly they use organic tofu so you can be sure that you are not eating nasty genetically modified soy, which largely defeats the purpose of eating vegan since you are in essence torturing the Earth by doing so, not to mention poisoning yourself. This place is not quite as good as Golden Era Vegetarian Restaurant was, the selection is not as broad but alas, Golden Era is now closed. This is by far the best of the 3 Bay Area Loving Hut locations. It's very tasty and a good value. I absolutely love the location at the edge of Chinatown and North Beach, it's a genuine cultural experience, the customers are a mix of folks living in Chinatown or nearby looking for healthy food and tourists from all over the world looking for vegan options. The lunch special is a very good value but the pricing is very reasonable overall. The jasmine tea and likely the other teas are organic also. It's small but has great light and awesome views of the street scene of Chinatown.
My wife and I stopped in here for a bite after visiting The California Academy of Science and deYoung museum in Golden Gate Park.

This place is almost too quiet and serene, like a spa rather than a happening restaurant, and the food was just ok. Tried the orange meatless chicken which was sweet but not tangy enough and had no real orange slices in it. Also had the kale and Goji berry dish and a tiny portion of rice. I think the reason it's affordable is that you get so little food in each dish. On the plus side, there are tons of items on the menu so I think it's worth another try. Sounds like the lunch special is worth checking out.

We came to this place for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup, the Spicy Noodle Soup and the Vietnamese Fragrant Claypot Rice. The wonton noodle soup was in a delicious and refreshing clear broth and the wontons had a bite to them. The Spicy Noodle soup or Bun Hue had all the right flavors of the traditional non-vegan Vietnamese Bun Bo Hue. I had never tasted a vegan Bun Bo Hue that so flavorful but be warned that it is very spicy. The Vietnamese Fragrant Claypot Rice was the highlight of our dinner. It was definitely fragrant and so flavorful. We left this dish for last to ensure we get the crispy layer of slightly burnt rice formed by the clay pot. If you see this dish on the menu, you have to get it. The portions were just the right size that it allowed us to explore and share three dishes between two people, although I think I ate slightly more than my friend did. My friend, who wasn't vegan, still loved the food and was glad we gave this place a chance. I can't wait to come back and try all of their other dishes.
Was really excited to try this vegan spot!! They were very accommodating as I arrived at about 2:58pm and they still let me order off the lunch specials that end at 3.
Overpriced and portion are small.

Tried this location while on vacation.  Fast, friendly take out service twice.  My husband really wanted to try the banana split (not availavle for take out), but we couldn't eat in either time due to sleeping children.  Went once at night and once around noon.  Parking both times was not easy and at lunchtime, a pure nighmare.  He just let me out, I ordered and he circled and picked me up.  He enjoyed the veggie burger.  I ordered my favorite soup I get in Norcross, GA which is the Pho soup.  There was a flavor in this particular soup I was not use to and did not like.  I was unable to eat the soup.  :(  The lemongrass and the Orange flavored meals were delicious.  They have a large screen to show menu items.  I do not believe it is used as a tv.  Special lunch menu consist of a 4 choices.  Three different soups and veggie burger.  Each cost $6.95 at lunch time.

Such damn good wonton soup and a serving of fresh spring rolls. They were out of fresh juice but the guy offered me organic jasmine tea (he emphasised the organic factor). Delicious meal in relaxed atmosphere. The go vegan propaganda in the windows is pretty funny. I learnt that a lot of hot celebs are vegan. So that's good. The service was terrific - quick and attentive. Thanks, loving hut!

The Crispy Chow Fun is excellent!  A nice, rich bed of crispy pan fried flat rice noodles smothered in a sauce with vegetables.  The crispy noodles were the highlight of the meal and I'd return for them in a minute.  The sauce was a bit weak and the veggies not so impressive.  My friend had the Kung Pow Wow and told them to make it very spicy.  It looked good but had a thick chili powder aroma that turned me off and my friend wasn't overly excited -- he thought it was good but nothing spectacular.

My kids and I ate dinner here twice this past week. We really enjoyed our spring rolls, won ton soup, chow mein, pho, pad thai, and deluxe vegetables. We really wanted to try the burgers but they were out. Two of us are pescatarians and the other two carnivores. We all loved our dishes and I will try the Loving Hut in our neck of the woods.
delicious. stopped here with family. eggplant and tofu with brown rice. radical! chow mein was mighty tasty too. and very reasonable prices.

We tried this place as a group c. 2 weeks ago, having heard it was under new management. The wait staff was super helpful and sweet but the food is still so-so. I loved the two different soups we tried but the main dishes were quite bland and generic with overcooked veggies and annyoingly synthetic fake meats and "seafood". Not what I'd hope to see at a vegan place that could make so much of fresh veggies and an Asian influence. Good value for money though and I'll be back for the soups.
Hot STeam table lunch is now $6.95, finally after 5 years it went up $1, which is still a great deal.

Loved my experience here! It's run under New management now by a lovely family that really makes sure the customer is happy. I had the Bun Hue spicy noodle soup and as a meat eater I was quite impressed. Not only was the soup delicious, but I felt great eating it! No guilt for eating a tasty, spicy noodle soup and thinking "oh theres msg in here.." but wait theres No MSG!

The Loving Hut chain of restaurants has an impressive assortment of dishes, including Asian and "Western" fare.  One of my favorite dishes is their vegan fish and chips; the batter they dip their fries in is to die for.  The vegan pho is fantastic as well.  There are a lot of fried and greasy dishes on their menu, so I only eat here on occasion.  The prices are very fair and the service is good. Be sure to check out their desserts if you still have room in your stomach.
I'm far from being a vegetarian but I loved the food here.

I ate here in May 2013 and definitely love the food.  I had the grilled soy jerky in skewer (#6) and the spicy cha cha (#63), a shrimp-like dish. I have to say that both dishes had a meaty taste that I miss in other vegetarian foods. I will definitely visit again.
Delicious food, in a peaceful, bright interior. Everyone was very friendly and the food was worth the hike.
Was grabbing dinner with a vegetarian friend and stopped here.

The food is very salty. The service is bad. The waitress recommended me to have a mango smoothies, which was very very sour and tasted badly. I guess they just wanted to clean out the expire fruit. So don't listen to their recommendation. Also, $9 for a little bit of "beef dish", that's not worth. It's my 2nd time to go, I thought they would improve but so sad they are going badly.
Weird, vegan, good.

The food is decent, the restaurant is cramped and feels sterile. The service is so-so to downright lousy, the lady most likely to take your order or ring you up for take-out is always distracted or indifferent to you.  The reason to go if for pretty decent vegan food, but if you are eating here for any other reason you ought to pick any of the dozens of places selling decent food with Great service in the area.
I have had lunch at this place for a few times now. I have always enjoyed food here. The service is bit slow at lunch time (which can be improved).

I still remember my first Loving Hut experience (out in Virginia.) I seriously fell in love with the food and their mission. Fast forward years later and I'm still fond of the Loving Hut chain. However, their mission is starting to take over - my friend whispered that this place is turning into a cult when she stepped foot inside this location. I don't blame her - with all the booklets and pamphlets, in addition to all the facts listed ON the menu...it's a bit much.

I'm really happy that in Chinatown, there's an MSG-free vegan restaurant that I can go to. This Loving Hut is my go-to location for lunch when I don't want to risk getting any traces of meat or MSG into my system from other restaurants that supposedly have vegetarian options. Their lunch specials are very affordable and delicious.

I never thought I'd ever say this but vegan food isn't so bad. What I hate is when places try to imitate meat when obviously the real thing is better. This place does that, but they also serve a lot of other dishes that doesn't try to be what it isn't. Service is also excellent, especially for Chinatown standards.

Walked in because they had vegan cupcake flyers on the table outside and Peta magazines. Of course meat guilt overwhelmed me and I had to go. I actually love meatless 'meat' so I enjoyed my sweet and sour 'chick'n' and brown rice.
I'm glad I'm not a vegan.  But, if you miss the real stuff, not sure how having fake textured soybean products will make up for it???
Different sized water cups, doesn't ask for how we wanted our eggs done. Very rude service. Dirty silverware

Terrible!!! The hostess treated like we were some animals in a zoo and she ran the place! Gave us big time attitude.  Food is super overpriced. When called to get a take out she said they dont take it!!! Dude this not Mexico, this is US!!
Don't come here! Service terrible & not to mentioned the food...save your time & money and go else where.
Way over priced! Food was substandard and we were overcharged by $15.00 on our gift card. Waitress did write down our order and of course forgot half of what we ordered. Avoid like the plague!!

Not worth 1 star. This place is a total ripoff! The prices are an average of  $5-$10 MORE than regular Dennys! The food is luke warm at best and my kids plate was undercook!!!!  Almost $10 for half a sampler!!! Over $22 for a t-bone breakfast while $15 at other Dennys.Service is slow and terrible. Staff are too busy talking and on their phones. No wonder it was empty. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I don't care if this is a tourist spot. If you are going to overcharge than regular diners at least have fresh , cooked food and good service.
been here a few times over the last year. All is like Denny's except the pricing which is just over the roof. For that price level there are better options around (like Hollywood cafe).
Good food. Great staff. Fast service. Next to fisherman a wharf. Usual Denny's food. .......
Slowest and most expensive breakfast in town. We thought we'd stop in for a quick breakfast. We sat immediately but the food takes over 25 minutes and is way more expensive than any other Denny's.
I went there for 4th off July , and the restaurant was FULL people was waiting on A line....but they were very organized .

Worst Denny's I've ever been to. Overpriced, bad service, and most of all the the food was not as described on the menu. We ordered a zesty nacho and all we got were stale transparent tortilla chips with some meat on it. Never going here ever again and I hope my review scares everyone away!

Denny's is Denny's, this is at the bottom of Denny's chain. This place is terrible. The food and service weren't even up to Denny's standards. This place would give your local choke and puke a bad name. Do yourself a solid and go to Walgreen's and by a wrapped meat sandwich.
There was no waiting to get seated. But once we sat down I had to go ask to be waited on. When other tables sat after us. There were servers just walking around filing glasses.

Worst than ever!! We came here (sf) from L.A  flight only took 1 hr. But we waited longer than that for the food !  That's very ridiculous!!!! And 12 of us, the waitress got the 6 orders wrong!   The food are over cooked (burned) , the club sandwich has no bacon, alvocado salmon salad has no alvocado no salmon but gave me a over cooked chicken on top of the non-fresh salad! Who would eat that ! It is not for human but animal.  At the end, they even mass up with the check !  I like Denny's. But will never come here for it again.NEVER!

Yeah don't go here, they're going to want you checked out of the place so fast as soon as your bill/check appears, as if they had lots of people... yeah right. Noob workers, awful waiting times, prices were higher than normal but since it's San Francisco I'll let that pass. Either way, the bad outweighs the good (as if there was any good here). Smh just don't go here; thinking about it is bad enough. Try a different Denny's.

we stopped here for late lunch/early dinner as a last resort. the fish & chips place we really wanted to eat at was packed and we were unwilling to wait. a restaurant attached to a local hotel had a lousy menu and outrageous prices and we were unwilling to pay for something we didn't really want.

Worst service I've ever gotten. Went here with some of my friends during a convention and the place was near empty. We were ignored for ten minutes until we got our drink orders in. I leave to go to the bathroom, come back, and everyone has ordered except me has ordered. Ah well, they'll swing by. I was ignored and everyone had their food brought out. It took me pointing out I haven't even ordered and that our table had no utensils.

So I have to admit that I was pretty biased against Denny's prior to eating here while I was in SF. I am from Long Island, the land of awesome diners and live in Queens, where there are also awesome diners, and Denny's goes against everything I stand for. However I was sick at a Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf and there was a Denny's literally in the lobby open 24/7. I had no choice. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised, and ended up eating at Denny's 3, count 'em, THREE times during my trip.
Booooo Boooooo a thousand times Booooooo!
DONT EVEN GO HERE... the cashier here was super RUDE

This is not a place to go for cheap food. The prices are higher than the Denny's in other parts of the Bay Area, let alone the rest of the US. But no surprise there: it's San Francisco and it's next to a major tourist destination.
My boyfriend and I are on vacation here in SF and we decided to get some food on a whim. This Denny's was around the corner so we went...bad idea.
HORRIBLE Customer Service!  Everything was Priced 2-3 dollars More then any dennys ive been too...
Sticky floors
Dang, I have gone so many Denny's in my time but this one was bad. It's saddening because I remember coming to S.F with my parents back in the day and it was decent.
I really like their double cheeseburger here.
Come on folks, it is Denny's, a known quantity! I will refrain from commenting on what we already know about this chain.
4 stars solely for late night / overnight 24h service. That's really the only time you should be going to a Denny's while you're in San Francisco.

I'm so tired of people, especially self proclaimed san franciscans that give chains bad reviews because it's a chain, it's a franchise, meaning the chain doesn't own, regular ass people like you and me own it. One thing out of the way, yeah, shits expensive here, it's in fishermans warf, a tourist trap obviously and if your really a san franciscan then you KNOW this, you don't like paying a little more then go to Daly City where it's corporate. It's a chain restaurant but you judge a chain to chain standards not some hipster spot, thusly this place isn't too bad for a chain. If you have half a mind to pay attention to details you'll notice the servers are as attentive as they can possibly be under the conditions. No everything was not absolutely perfect, when is it ever, but instead of yelping like it makes a difference, grow a pair and suggest directly to management, I mean aren't they ultimately responsible right? Some things are inevitable, like "Mark S" complaining about his check, well I don't know if you know this but at all Denny's you pay up front, and if your still stuffing your face they give you the tab so they don't forget you  during a lunch rush and you can go up and pay. Maybe it's just me that gets how it works here but it seems pretty clear to me.

Worst place I have ever been to. I have eaten in many places on Earth. And I'm a big fan of late night snacks. This place is terrible. The food is bad. I mean simply bad. They always bring you the wrong sauce with your terrible food. Service is awful, it could have been operated better as a self service restaurant. You have to wait for 15 min until a frowning waitress comes to your table to ask for your order and for another 15-20 min until she brings the wrong food.
Located at the edge of the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf, this Denny's has something that nothing else in Fisherman's Wharf has. 24 hour operating hours.

I came here again to eat dennys and was once again disappointed. This has got to be the worst Dennys I have ever been to. Worst customers service. Bought some chicken strips dinner and they had no ranch. How do you not have ranch dressing? They also forgot my friends sausage. Horrible horrible horrible.

Terrible customer service. Food is ok. It's Denny's ya know. Server brought our check before we were finished eating. No suggest sell, coffee, pie?  Nothing. So i pulled money out and it sat on the table til way after we finished our meal. It's no wonder they have a 2 star rating.

This place is awesome! Not only are the prices a lot higher than any other Denny's I've ever been to, but what a great treat it was to have live entertainment during my meal! We had front row seats to Not one, but two fights! With no security and all the employees running to cower behind the counter, watching someone get knocked out at my feet was an awesome treat! I guess that's why the prices are higher for all the live entertainment value you get.. And then on top of everything we had a waitress that messed up our orders, and never refilled our drinks. And then as a special treat, the cashier barely knew how to work the register and tried to short us over 10 bucks! Awesome place!!!

Went to Denny's expecting to go to Denny's instead we found a hotel add-on that wreaked of 80's decor, old carpets, and years of damage from operating with walls visibly damaged or stained. The prices were 50% higher than any Denny's I have ever been to. Most of the items were $13 or more. Outrageous!! For 13$ I'll go out to a real restaurant and get a real meal. Denny's food is usually a 2 star establishment if you're lucky and get a good server than maybe 3 stars tops but this Denny's was cold inside, not the servers, not the overall feel, the facility was legitimately cold - the thermostat near us said 61 degrees. At least it isn't December... Oh wait?!!!  the service was slow and wasn't great. It took 9 minutes to get a glass of water and there were only 3 tables full in the entire place. To further my disappointment they were out of two of four menu items we attempted to order.

0 stars. Walked in and a waitress said she will be right with my boyfriend and I but instead continued to dig through her purse ( because that's more important) then walked away.. I stared at the other 5 employees walking around to try and see if anyone would acknowledge us ( there was about 4 tables seated in the whole restaurant) and no one did. There was one waitress in particular laughing and stuffing cheese sticks in her mouth with a customer. After that I walked out called 10 minutes later to complain to a manager and the girl who answered said they didn't have one....good job you should all be proud of yourselves for being so horrible at your menial job..stay miserable

I'm not a huge fan of Denny's but this place takes the cake.  First it feels like a dungeon, dark and not your typical Denny's  second I order their original grand slam and received the worst burned dried out breakfast ever.    I would say this place need a full remodel and new management but the location is just not good for it, period.
What you would expect from a denny's. Have lovely healthy selections with moderate portions.
The last place on my Birthday adventure.

Bad service, too many people, only 1 waitress. All the rest of the workers are just chillin, taking it easy. When we were seated, we only received one menu for 11 people. I asked for water and it took way too long and when we got out water they only gave us one. we waited 20 minutes to order and they said they would be right with us. Never came back.. we got fed up and left.
3 stars.
My favorite Italian restaurant. If you love pasta seafood and lots of garlic this is the place. I think they have a patent on the white garlic sauce!!!!
Another really yummy dinner at Caffe Sport! My husband and I enjoy coming to this spot from time to time for a not-so-formal yet delicious dinner.

Worst dining experience we've ever had in North Beach. Service was horrible and slow, waiter very inattentive and forgetful. Place was not very busy when we arrived, which was strange because we couldn't get an OT reservation time until 8:00 on a Sunday night. Many open tables in the place. Took over 20 minutes after we were seated to even get bread or offered of a drink.
Great seafood and pasta.
Great ambience, good service and flavourful dishes. No pizza in the menu.

Caffe Sport to me has lost its soul. Never a good sign when there is no Italian working in the place. I've been coming once a year or so since the late 70's and I've never had anything but a great family style Sicilian meal until this summer of 2014. Maybe the owners are in Italy who knows or maybe they sold out. But for me the meal I had was drab & dull.  Sad for me because I'm a Sicilian American and I really looked forward to my visits here. On the bright side the waiters were very nice.

The food was good and the dining area is warm and comfortable; decorated with unique Italian antiques.  The service was above average as well.  The menu is filled with Italian American staples -- pastas and scampi that are well prepared, but unfortunately lack originality.  Also, "restaurant-style" seemed to mean the food was served with a larger spoon for sharing.  This was fine with us and we had plenty to eat, but don't expect huge portions.

Was recommended to visit this place by my aunt and uncle, and boy they were right about how good the food is. If your looking for good classic Italian food, Caffe Sport is the classic ethnic food hole-in-the-wall place, and not the common tourist trap here in San Franciso.  I came here for lunch, which was served family style; Italian bread with delicious dip, delicious seafood entrees with sauces to die for (not to mention Antonio's secret sauce that has been a family secret for decades), and a great dessert; not one thing was bad.  The best part of the meal was the dessert, especially the tiramisu.  I make a mean tiramisu myself, and this one sadly might be better. Highly would recommend a visit to Caffe Sport.

My family, coming from Florida, Illinois, and Southern California, decided to make dinner reservations here for our a weekend family reunion dinner. The reservation was made weeks in advance and was confirmed up to the night before.  When our party arrived, we were informed that due to a black-out we needed to make reservations elsewhere. Okay, I get it... $*&t happens but we would have expected at least a phone call in advance informing us of the situation. We were left trying to decide what to do next and where to make reservations in such short notice to accommodate the number of people.  Luckily, someone in our party is from San Francisco and through her quick thinking she was able to make reservations at Caps Corner (Nice place, btw...look for my excellent review on this one).  Bottom  line.... we should have been notified by phone sooner by management instead of being left out on the street without a paddle.  Will I give it another chance ? maybe not...first impressions matter. I wasn't impressed.

We brought out of town family here because of the reviews and the 'North Beach look' of the place-- wine bottles, etc.....BUT the service was so erratic I would think twice about coming back.  We had six people-- each ordered something. They brought two dishes and then twenty minutes later brought one more-- then another about five minutes later. Six plates arriving at thoughtlessly staggered intervals was unacceptable.  Also, we went for twenty minutes at a time without our waiter.  Not good.

I came here on a date and was really impressed by the atmosphere, service and especially the food! We ordered eggplant involtini and mussels. I liked it so much that I took my parents here when they came to visit, and they loved it too.

My first taste of aioli was here many many years ago.  I've heard that when Caffe Sport first opened, people lined up around the block.  It was THE place to go.  In my opinion, it still is.  The aioli is homemade heaven.  I always tell them to give me whatever is their freshest seafood with aioli sauce, and it's always killer good.  If you're not a garlic lover, stay away.  But it you like Italian the way it should be, heavy on the garlic, you'll love Caffe Sport.

Our group of 17 ppl made a reservation in mid-July to eat dinner here on Friday, July 25.  My brother even called to confirm the reservation on Wed, July 23.  It was very important to meet here because we came from all over the country.  When we arrived, we were told that they could not serve us because there was an electrical blackout.  Blackouts happen, of course.  What was inexcusable was that they did not take the time to call us to let us know the status.  That was really inconsiderate.  Luckily, one of the local cousins knew of another place  to dine.   Food taste is an important part of the dining experience, but so is courtesy and hospitality.

I have been coming here since I was a little girl, once every few years, and the meals never disappoint. Family style dishes are the way to go. Their wines are delicious and all of their dishes leave you feeling full! Quality Italian food for sure.
This is my favorite place in north beach. If you love seafood and the sauce of Italian food, you will love this place. A few of my favorite dishes:
Haven't been here in ages and the interior looks the same. Really crazy looking and eclectic! Food was okay, but no more white sauce pasta with calamari on the menu. Really sad about that...
We were trying to go next door to Sotto Mare but it was packed so we ended up next door at Caffe Sport and we were not disappointed.

What is it with people saying "it's to DIE for!", "you MUST try it before you DIE!", "I'd KILL for it!" when describing food? I mean, I get it, but I'm more on the side of life. So, if you're looking for a reason to live, or for something to make your life more enjoyable, stop in at Caffe Sport for a decadent, filling, and flavorful meal.

5 stars all the way. Good service, great food, good wine and family dining. Shrimp scampi was wonderful, chicken parm was epic.!pesto was a+ and then there was the rustico. Scallops and shrimp galore...

After decades of hearing great things about Caffe Sport we finally got a chance to try it out due to a birthday dinner invite.  First of all, getting to this restaurant is challenging like all others in the North Beach area.  Well, we finally figured out there is a parking lot a couple of blocks away.  However, as to the restaurant itself it is in a word I suppose 'eclectic'.  I understand that the owner made and collected the knick knacks that are posted all over the walls.  But the décor was not the problem.  The food was.  Firstly the menu is terribly limited and the prices are very expensive.  The wine list is also limited, but we settled on a bottle of pinot grigio.  It was terrible tasting and did not taste like any pinot grigio I've ever tasted.  It was very brash and horrid.  The food itself was not anything spectacular nor tasted too good.  For one thing the cioppino was overpowered by too much garlic that was still raw.  The other dishes like the pasta con vongole were just ok but overpriced for what was served.  I am sorry to say that the desserts are really nothing but two choices:  House made tiramisu and cannoli.  And if you are unlucky like our table was all of the tiramisu sold out leaving the only choice of cannoli. The problem with the cannoli is that it's not fresh.  The guy just took some from a cardboard box and filled them with some sort of cream and dried fruit.  It just did not taste good.  And it's not cheap either at $8/each.  In short, it was a very disappointing meal from beginning to end including wine.
Food was very bland. It arrived quickly but tastes like they emptied the sauces from the cans and heated it up.
Absolutely the best Italian food in Northern California, all others pale in comparison.
Very good food That's all that needs to be said you won't be disappointed. We had a party of five and ordered three p
Prepare yourself for a true Italian, garlic heavy feast.
their prawns all Antonio is great and we usually get the pasta with the meat sause and mushroom.we love this place.
This place was really bad. Don't know if it was because we came in with a party of 6 or what but was definitely one of the worst dining experiences here in the city.

This is an awesome place for groups.  One of my good friends loves it, so I've been here a couple of times.  I really like the atmosphere - it's decorated with some of the coolest art.  The food is incredibly fresh/delicious with huge portions, and the service is always great.

Garlic lovers - this place is for you! We enjoyed a dish of mussels and a dish of various seafood (crab, clams, mussels, etc) and both were smothered in a delicious garlic sauce. Save your bread for this!

YUMMMMMM the place is amazing.  We've eaten here a few times and it's always so good.  What I love about this place is the pasta.  In most places, the pasta is just a carrier for sauce.  Here, the pasta actually have a crave-able taste and texture.  Perfectly al dente.  The sauces are great.  Instead of just olive oil to dip bread, they bring a spicy, creamy red/white sauce.  Wine selection is delicious and very reasonably priced.

Cute, kitschy place. My sister picked this place out, as she had a friend recommend it, and they wanted to eat in North beach. Our table wasn't quite ready, so the waiter told us to go have a drink next door & he'd let us know when it was. And sure enough, he actually walked over to the bar next door, told us when it was ready & even brought our glasses back for us, so we could finish our drink in the restaurant - nice. The food is family style & large portions so definately a share place. I thought the food was pretty good. Not the most outstanding flavors, but very fresh and it was reasonably priced. We had the crab filled ravioli's , the house salad, the red sauce ciopinot & an eggplant appetizer. All were very tasty. I would say its one of the better italian restaurants in NB for the price, & quainter than a touristy place like Stinking Rose & about on par with Francino's. The funky decor makes the place.

Went here awhile back and thank heavens they tell you that the food is served family style or man  would we have ordered to much. We shared the seafood Alfredo and it was delicious.  I loved that ot was so fresh and seemed like a old homemade recipe. The service was great and the alfredo sauce was amazing! !!!! Im so glad we went because it was perfect and ended up being less than 25 dollars for the whole dinner for 2. And you certainly cant beat that in the city
What an awesome place.  I am picky about Italian and my girlfriend knew that.  We came in and had a great time with great food and service.  I look forward to going back to the city.

This place is great!  It's a quirky, cozy Italian place with great food, large portions, and good service.  It's a tad garlicky so make sure that's ok with you.  The cioppino blanco was excellent and the seafood was unbelievably fresh.  The caponata was amazing.   We will definitely be back!
My friends and I have been coming to Caffe Sport for nearly two decades now, and not once have we ever been disappointed. The prices are great, the portions huge, and the sauces superb.

I haven't gone in for over 20 years! last week I went in and the food is still as I remember it! The Scampi All' Antonio is out of this world! If you love garlic, try this dish!  It is smothered in a white sauce with zucchini strips.

The food was fantastic and fresh (garlic, garlic, I was in garlic heaven).  The portions were large and sharable for two.  Our server was ultra polite and accommodating to our questions and offered recommendations.   Visiting from San Diego, we inquired about a good Italian joint and the bartender two doors down recommended this place.    We were not disappointed.  The decor leaves your eyes entertained throughout the entire meal.  We tried the Shrimp Al Antonio with the house salad.  The house salad was delightful, unlike some house salads that use only iceberg, a few lonely tomatoes, and perhaps some shredded carrots.  The meal was perfectly paired with a wine that our server topped our glasses off with toward the end of the night.  What a fun place.

My very favorite restaurant in North Beach! The food is just delicious! Very yummy sea food and decent portions. They use a lot of garlic ( Which I personally LOVE), so you better let them know in advance if you are not a big fan of garlic.

My family's go-to italian restaurant. If you're going to have italian food in north beach, you MUST try caffe sport. Their mussels are amazing! We always get two orders of them! And the meat pasta and pesto pasta are delicious! And the service is always great! They always treat us like family!

Been coming here off and on  for  over 30 yrs. Went last night to celebrate my son's big day! Food is wonderful, waiters are up beat and friendly, fun ( not snotty). Had gnocchi and Sicilian meatballs.... Swear the best I have had in a long time!!! Skip the latest trendy ones and stay with what I like!

Great decor and service is good - friendly and helpful staff. I had the cioppino and thus I received a big plate full of good seafood (there was everything, including crab), the sauce was watery and tasteless practically see people are praising the pasta, have tried out one several years ago and I remember it was good (that is why I decided to return) but the cioppino was disappointing....
I ordered takeout on a Sunday night at 5:45 because I felt lazy. My order promptly arrived at my doorstep in only 25 minutes! Wowza, I'm loving the Eat24 app. Note: order minimum is $15

Ordered Chicken Salad and Vegetable rolls with strict instructions not to ring the doorbell. They took well over an hour to deliver the food. Chicken was covered in fat, vegetable rolls were cold and yep you guessed it they rang the doorbell multiple times. I won't be going back.
People were nice and the delivery was quick.

Extremely fast delivery, within 25 minutes.  (I think ours came in 15-20).  It did arrive lukewarm (Chinese restaurants throw extra oil on the food to keep it hotter).  I've never known any Vietnamese place to deliver so this was just awesome in my book.  Notice the name is A Taste of Vietnam--which infers it's a fusion restaurant.  It's an East meets West kind of menu; so keep that in mind when you order and it'll taste just fine.  The garlic noodles is actually pasta with garlic butter; kind of interesting with the honey pork.
Worst vietnamese food I've ever had.

I ordered Saigon Noodle with Honey Pork and Vegetarian Rolls and curry puff.  The noodle was a little too soft but the rest was pretty good and the portion was more than enough.  I couldnt finish it.  Delivery was quick too so overall I recommend this place.
I've ordered delivery from them twice.  It's been alright, not my favorite viet food ever, but good.  Prices are ok.  10% cashback from eat 24 is definitely a plus.

Just got my first delivery from here.  Ordered shrimp imperial rolls and chicken noodle soup.  Wish I had yelped it first, because I spent $20 and it was probably the worst meal I've ever had for $20.  The soup was awful.  The eggrolls were alright, but nothing special.  I'm still hungry and I am out $20. :(  This was literally the worst food I've ever had in San Francisco.

I'm really wavering here between 2 and 2.5 stars.  Tried time for the first time for delivery a week ago.  Not a true Vietnamese place, but a fusion of neighboring countries.   Got the veggie imperial rolls, garlic noodles, and the lava beef.  Honestly, this should have been enough for two people.  I don't think we are porkers, and our appetite is healthy, but splitting appetizers, a side, and a main should have been enough to fill our bellies.

Boo. Boo to A Taste of Vietnam. 2 stars for having very fast delivery and for being edible, but that's about it. Total rip-off in comparison to other Vietnamese restaurants/any other restaurant.  I could tell right away when the delivery guy handed over the bag of food that I was being gyped. It didn't have any heft to it at all.  You know why?  Because half of the take-out box was filled with a pretty (useless) [and fake] green "salad." I wanted garlic noodles and honey pork, not salad!

They came within 25 minutes.  That is FAST in my world of delivery orders.  It may be because they're not that busy yet, but that was certainly promising.  I had the garlic noodles, lava lamb, firecracker chicken, and duck imperial rolls.  Can't speak to its authenticity, but all of it sho is tasty.  And I wasn't even hungry.
This is a review of delivery from "A Taste of Vietnam".

I love their outdoor seating. Their dining area was also great, I love their utensils. From that elegant glass to their spoons and fork. Then I asked my self, how is this place was in the Food Stands category? They're more like a restaurant to me in any aspects.

After being dropped off in Little Italy we had no idea were to eat get food. So we asked a local who recommended this place. I had the meat lasagna and that was the best lasagna I had ever had in my entire life no exaggeration. My friend got the Fettuccine Bolognese which I tried and it was soooo good. Expect high prices which was totally worth it however they are decent size portions. Marco was an awesome waiter. We sat outside which had a beautiful view of the park and Cathedral. Must try these dishes if this is what you crave.
Ok food and the most expensive coffee and tea we've encountered on our trip in the US. We should have checked the reviews on Yelp first and gone somewhere else.
Surprised to see the other reviews - best espresso I had in SFO...serious.  I guess I got lucky with the guy making it.

Luke warm drinks and weak tasting coffee.   We pointed out the problem to the person at the espresso bar and he told us how the foam for the lattes came from a pitcher in the fridge (huh?). Looks neat but I won't give it a second chance given all the other options in the surrounding area.

Several of the Italian restaurants near us on a Sunday afternoon San Francisco stroll were closed and this was the only one in walking distance that seemed open...plus we were all starving. I was pleasantly surprised though as the food was delicious:
food was ok , probably tasted better because we where starving after waititng 45 min for our food!! they didnt even apologize . dodge this place

Good location and big signage so it is easy to see why unsuspecting tourist would wonder into this establishment. I thought the food was just OK. The portions were quite small like tapas considering the full size plate prices. Wait staff was a little weird - friendly but jaded. I suggest to try a less cutezee cafe down the road because there are lots in this area.
We has 2 appetizers, caprese and Funghi portobello. Absolutely fantastic with Pagui Sangiovese.  To die for!  The bread service with amazing olive oil was divine. Famtastico!
Ok, double cappuccino ($3.00) on a sunny afternoon as a few tables outside ...dry pastery for (3.00).  Which was probably ok in early morn.  Many other places abound in SF.

Waited three hours for a pizza, called three times.  First time they said "it's in the oven, oh wait it's on it's way" second time "your names not on the board (which means nothing to me) so it should be there soon" third time "the delivery man left 10 minutes ago"

Upon passing by I inhaled this fabulous aroma of the pizza emanating from this quaint Italian pizzeria. It was that  aroma that made me stop and order a slice of asiago,mozzarella, gorgonzola, pizza. This was a mouth watering experience on thin crust with just the right amount of sauce. One word " Delicious".

Food is less then average. It all tastes the same. Malai kofta were hard and veg tikka masala was blend. But has same gravy. Appetizers aren't even worth mentioning. The worst part was when we wanted to split the bill the host said they would charge $.50 per transaction.  Restaurant looks run down place but repainted by a person who probably didn't even bother to check a youtube video of how to paint. Over all avoid it if you can. Not worth the price. $11.99 for veg entrees. Rather drive a few miles and goto ViVA GOA.

Splendid, personally I think this is the best place to have good food. It's good place to dine in and the price is affordable. Good place, great customer service and most importantly tasty food. Will definitely recommend other to visit the restaurant and have a delicious meal.
Tried kheema naan, lamb tanduri, karahi chicken,naan and chicken tanduri.
Supub..  Taste... I really like the taste
Delicious! Well spiced with fresh ingredients.  Simple decor. Inexpensive. Will definitely come back here!
Wonderful view from second floor restaurant, however this does not make up for the following:

Though a local I have become fond of regular trips to Fisherman's Wharf, both because the area is actually better than people say and because I have a sense of humor. While on one of those regular afternoon trips recently we discovered the recently opened Applebee's and since then just keep coming back. Between the outdoor patio with excellent tourist-watching and the bar area staffed by people like KJ (awesome), I like the physical space quite a bit.

This Applebee's location has an amazing view!!! The service was great. Our waiter checked on us often and our food was hot and prompt. The bourbon street steak was even sizzling on the platter when it was set in front of me. My sister got the pasta and it was perfect. Usually when I get the perfect margarita at other locations it's very tart and not well mixed, this margarita was perfection and tasted like actual fresh lime juice was used in the mix. The restaurant was clean and we didn't have to wait long at all. Best Applebee's experience ever. Someone is doing something right!

Just look at the photos I attached for the awful meal I had at this place and you will know exactly why I gave it 1 star. To be honest our server was great.. Well except for his recommendation of what I should get because the food was disgusting. I was very disappointed to have spent over $50 on something that tasted and looked like it was scraps.

My family and I went to Applebee's to have dinner last weekend. When I went to put my name on the wait list the hostess Veronica with attitude told me it was gonna be a 40 min-50 min wait, which I didn't mind. We went to walk around fisherman's wharf, came back 20mins later and asked how much longer.  Veronica gave us attitude and said they had already call our table! I gave told she told me 40 mins and it's only been 20mins?!  After arguing with her she still had our table available. After ordering our food it took over an hour to get out food. When we did receive our food it was cold and half the items we ordered never got to the table.  The waiter said they messed up our order in the kitchen. Finally I asked another hostess Kathy if we could have our bill, she told me I had to wait, went to the hostess stand and started checking her phone, Then just kept talking to the other hostesses and they all were on there phones. I just decided to get the bill myself. So annoying. It took another hour for us to get the bill and pay it.  I will definitely not return to this Applebee's restaurant again. The staff is too unprofessional! Especially Veronica & Kathy!
Great food, same original menu with a lot of variety - and wonderful, fast service. Good experience every time I go there, and food quality is always up to their standards!

I've been to plenty of Applebee's before but none like this one, the view is amazing! You can go up stairs and sit at the outside bar section and over look the wharf but beware cause it can get cold just bring a jacket and you should be solid, service was great we only drank beers cause being in sf you have to eat places you never been too

I love Applebee's and would not think of going to one here in the city with all the other places that are around to try.  I was tired of being disappointed by trying new places and decided to stick with an old standby.  They did not disappoint me at all.  I had my favorite the Napa Chicken and it was excellent as usual.  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great, and the view was remarkable.  Great food, drinks and service was a wonderful way to end an amazing day.

I love this Applebee's location. Finally San Francisco has an Applebee's. I went here for dinner and a had a great time. Only four stars because this Applebee's does not look like your typical Applebee's. There is not old stuff on the walls like at other locations. They need to do that at this location.
if I could, I would give NO STARS! maybe .5

This was my first time coming here. Overall, I am a fan of Applebee's but I can live without it. The place is located near Pier 39 and on the second floor of a store, so you can imagine the views you get! GORGEOUS! If you get seated next to the windows you can great views of the pier and Alcatraz and all the buildings around. The hostess was nice and sat us quickly. Our server took awhile to get greet us and take our drink orders. It took about 5 more minutes after that to come and take our food order. We ordered appetizers which took forever to came. When we got them, it was a small portion and wasn't that great (too salty).

We enjoyed the food and the view was perfection. However the server David was extremely rude to me and my son as we came in for a lazy lunch one afternoon. We were in need of some small appetizer plates and I patiently waited for his attention. As I said excuse me please, he gave me eye contact and a look of contempt... Ignored me and approaches the table next to us! He has been avoiding me now and is acting as if I offended him in some way. Horrible customer service and worse than that horrible humanity in general. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the food was actually good. But the way we were treated makes me feel unwanted here. How about some advice Applebee's executive- coach this rude and demeaning server before he really does damage to your customer base.

I went here with a girlfriend of mines and had a blast for a pre birthday dinner. The Manger Steven was great and nice and the fellas at the bar where great and we got Erick it was his first day but I think he did  a great job on his first day .
Service has left very bad impression. From the order of two people they just brought us one drink... Another drink and food were simply forgotten.
Great location, nice view but the food was really horrid that I can't justify giving 3 stars. I wasn't impressed with their food at all. And service was okay.

Service: the restaurant is euipped with personal tablets and waiters. It was pretty confusing on which method we should be using to order food. Waiter preferred us ordering through her though. The waiter Wendy was very attentive and friendly. She always made sure that we were well served throughout our dining experience.

Was here yesterday and its food quality is unworthy of an Applebee's. As far as the service remarks of others, Applebee's on this location has an electronic ordering system on the desk (which I used for 3 out of 6 orders) and that delivery was fast. We ate ribs but they were dry and the Mozzarella sticks were greasy. The times we saw a waitress she was helpfull and service was good (thats why the two stars). Luckily there are lots of alternatives in the area.

Come here if you want to be ignored.  Had 3 bartenders walk past me.  One finally took my order from halfway down the bar whilst talking to his friend.  20 minutes to find our waitress, who has never heard of 1000 island dressing...let's see how the rest of this goes

Awful awful service. Our waitress asked us if we needed something at least 5 times (at points we clearly didn't need things) and seemed to ignore us when we did need assistance. Our waitress also messed up and somehow charged us for both our food/ drink AND another tables food/drink. What?! Will not be returning to this establishment ever again.

Beautiful decor outside fishermans warf and the water. But my coffee was completely cold, never had that before, disgusting if you dont expect it. My husband got a new one for me, they came back with the same cup dirty from pouring the cold coffee out and now hot coffee in, they forgot to tell our waiter what happened.
This was the worst service and the yuckiest food I've had in the city. But the reason they get two stars is because the manager comped our meal.
About 2% of all of my reviews have ever been rated one star. I try to be charitable to give consideration to innocent mistakes and look for the best aspects in a dining experience.
Another visit and still bad service. I wish there was another Applebee's near by that I can go too. But for now I'll deal with the bad service to get the good food
Waiter forgot our drinks and after I complained, the drinks were watered out! Food was the same like usual. "Ok"

Worst service ever!!!! Server forgot us....didnt come back til we were about to leave.Needs a major change to make it in this city; especially in a tourist area like the Wharf!!! Management seem not to care about the service or food / customer concerns.  Will never go back and this is the third time same terrible service and lack of management.
Dull atmosphere, below average food and service. I stopped there because I've been at and enjoyed other Applebee's restaurants but this one is just not worth the visit.

I never would write a bad review, but this place is by far the worse place to go to. The service is awful! Was seated right when we got there and no one attended to us until I had to wave someone down after 30 minutes of waiting. A server finally comes and takes our order. Waited 20 minutes for our drinks. Food then comes, but our appetizers never came. Server said she forgot to put in the order and that she doesn't serve this section. So why were we seated in a section where there were no servers? Bad on the host. And just because u don't serve this section doesn't explain why you didn't put in our order. Bad on the server. I recommend no one to come here! Worse service of all time.

Went here with my fiancé on the 4th of July to have dinner. It was completely packed. I think this place is recently new because the last time I went to the Wharf was probably at the beginning of this year and it wasn't there before. But I digress.

Food is so so is already well known about Applebee's. But what is worse is not about its food quality being so so but its service is being so terrible. My friends came over from oversea to visit San Francisco and they wanted to try something American. They found the name of Applebee's so interesting so no matter how I stop them from going there, we are there at the end. My last visit to Applebee's was about 10 years ago when I was still in LA and I didn't have much good impression of its food.

As someone new to the USA of course I have never been to Applebee's before...I was ushered on by some friendly and very helpful staff and given my menu. I was pretty much blown over by all the choice on offer but I eventually got to choosing my food.

I come here alot but I never been  happy as this time,  and the reason is the bartender Mathew he welcomed us with a very nice smile on his face and he was so professional, he kept checking on us ,the drinks he made were out of the world he is really one of the best bartender I ve ever seen, I love applebeez more now  and I love how they care about their customers

Oooookay i love love love this place I almost come here 3 times a week. The view of the bay is amazing the outdoor seating is super nice and today i got to meet the best bar tender ever " Mathew" he was awesome helpful and smiling all the times.... I would come back here over and over just to chat with him and get the best service ever.
