I only give a one star cause I can't give a zero.  This is the second time service was dreadful and food and drink below average.  Server had no idea what the menu is about.  The server said he would get the manager, yep, never showed up.  They must be embarrassed of the company also.  Only highlight is the hostess, she was awesome.
I was there once. Average chain-restaurant
Suck awsome  people at this location customer service was 6 stars food matched that!!
The only person that deserves to be mentioned is KJ. Upon entering the bar area our seats had water on them and he stopped us from cleaning them ourselves and cleaned it for us.
Rating based off of bar area only:
Our drinks stayed full but the food was kind of slow even though they were only about 1/2 full.  Our waitress was helpful and considerate.

Sfo's first applebees-A DISAPPOINTMENT.first off we came here to celebrate my little bro's bday since we were in town going around the pier; guy downstairs didnt even know if they had any specials for birthdays.so anuway,after je called to ask uostairs and they said that they DONT SING HAPPY BIRTHDAY but they do give free dessert tothe celebrant.whwn we went upstairs,place looked trendier than your regular applebees since this one was showcasing the view.we politely reminded the girl again that we had a celebrant.we ordered,food came with decent wait timea.but the pasta...2 servers came at once.asked whose was whose.gave us a split second and our server dropped it on oir table yelling "its hooot!" Without apologizing that he dropped it.i mean fine.given it was warm but he seemed very annoyed that we didnt answer-when they didnt even give us a chance to respond since they both spoke and asked at the same time.regular applebee's size serving.food wasnt spectacular.not that i expected it to be amazing.but have had better at other branches. Getting your soda and water refilled,you have to wait to make eye contact with somebody so they can do it.And worst?! No free dessert. Even with the reminder of my brother's birthday.not evwn because its free.its the principle.
Why a 5? To offset some of the haters. Probably closer to a 3.8-4.

This place is the best AYCE I've ever been to. They don't use too much rice on the nigiri, the fish melts in your mouth, and the service is super friendly! I recommend the HAMACHI, maguro, and sake nigiris. This place sparked a love for nigiri that may burn in my body for a long, long time. I have been here three times in the past couple months and I will be back very soon!

I love this place and have probably eaten here over 30 times in the past 2 years. It's not the best sushi in the SF but it's pretty good and the price is not crazy like other places. The all you can eat menu is my jam. 5 stars!

Meh.  Sushi Hunter would be in the bottom quartile of San Francisco sushi restaurants, more akin to something you would see in Kansas City (both the vibe and the food).  The all-you-can-eat menu is full of the typical cheapies, all done with a maximum of rice and a minimum of fish.  And the fish you do get tastes a bit like the boxed arrangements at Whole Foods--not terrible, but not particularly flavorful.  Once you have ordered, expect to wait a while to get your food, even if the chefs do not appear to be particularly busy.  The wait staff at times is not particularly attentive, sometimes requiring a lot of hand-waving to pay attention to you.  Everything screams "bargain," from the mediocre wines to the kitschy interior.  If you are looking for great sushi in North Beach, try Katsu on Columbus (a short walk north of Sushi Hunter).

I love this place I've been coming here for years and the food is amazing. Great sushi, great environment, and great people. The only difficulty is parking but what do you expect this is San Francisco.
I ordered the hamachi nigiri and it was so chewy I had to spit it out. :(
They did the calculation of tips for you , which is 26% ,and kinda half force u to pay it .

Casual all you can eat sushi ($25) and unlimited hot sake ($11). All rolls and appetizers are made to order And fresh. They aren't the most extravagant rolls but are flavorful . The staff was helpful and accommodated us even though we came near closing time. I think this would be an awesome group spot. I will certainly be returning .

Great buy for all you can eat sushi in San Francisco! For less than $30/person, you can get all you can eat sushi and appetizers.When I arrived at Sushi Hunter, I was wary at first because the restaurant was almost empty, but I guess I just arrived early because within an hour it was completely full with a line of people waiting. The sake and beer wasn't as extensive as my friends, who also came to drink, not just eat, would have liked, but they decided on a cold sake that the waitress recommended and they loved it.

Saddened by the 2-hour wait for AYCE Korean BBQ in Japantown, my friend and I ventured here for consolation. Of course it was packed on a Saturday night - the servers were definitely stressed out from accommodating customers' requests. Since they were preoccupied with serving tables with 50+ piece sushi plates, it took us 10+ minutes to get seated (despite there being 2 tables readily available). We could have just seated ourselves, gotten our own menus, and saved everyone the trouble...

Some what disappointed. I don't mind paying $55 for sushi and sake but make it quality sushi and/ or sake. The sake was light in alcohol and the sushi was 90% rice and low quality fish. For what I paid, there are at least 10 better restaurants in the area let alone in SF

Not the best and not quite the worst either. If average was a spectrum they would be somewhere in the lower middle. However, two of the items we ordered were unavailable and they informed us of one after other items have already come out and theother unavailable item was informed at the end of our meal. Bottom, theres a ton of other choices in north beach, dont bother with this place!

I normally don't write good or bad review unless it's really good or really bad! This place is the worst sushi place I never been to! $28 for a BS sushi buffet, and only couple choices of fish, ok fine, so I was expecting for some good fish, but WTF, the fish tasted like shxt, I can't even put it close to my mouth, those weird smell, OMFG! If I can give negative star from -1 to -10, I will give it -10 no doubt!
Best Sushi spot in North Beach. Nice fun atmosphere with all you can eat options, good for groups. Try the Hunter Salad.
for 25 bucks all you can eat sushi, pretty good quality. Great service too.
I had Katsu Curry chicken on Aug. 29, 2014. I have been a curry freak since living in Japan in the 70's. I can and do make better tasting curry.

Sushi Hunter is one of the few AYCE Sushi joints I've found (I'm not counting those horrid buffet places where patrons gobble up all the good stuff as soon as it's put out, and their kids manhandle everything else- like Kome).  The AYCE menu is, not surprisingly, somewhat limited-  more so than their regular menu.   For example,  there's no salmon roe nigiri,  but there's enough other classics, and if the pieces seem  small, you can always place another order.    There's a larger list of rolls, but by swapping out avocado for cucumber or tuna for salmon you can see how combinatorics leads to a huge list with very few base ingredients.   They also provide a wide selection of other items (tempuras, salads, gyoza, etc), so you shouldn't run out of things to try.

Just went in to buy a beer so I could use the restroom.  The waitress was so rude to us that we started calling the place c@nter sushi.  Avoid this place and go spend your money someplace run by nice people.
So i must admit that it's not the best sushi, however they have my card on file and know my order every time I call so they must be doing something right since I keep coming back for more.

Went for the first time tonight and had a great dinner! All of the servers were incredibly nice and helpful, never making us feel rushed even though we took forever to decide what to get from the AYCE menu at first! The food felt like it was consistently made with care, and everything was served hot and fresh (well, at least the warm items!). I really enjoyed the sushi - I've been to other AYCE sushi places where they attempt to disguise lower quality fish, etc. by dousing rolls in strong sauces - thankfully, that's not the case here. I also really appreciate the variety of non-sushi appetizers on the menu, because as much as I enjoy sushi, I love being able to choose from a range of other Japanese treats. I had a really lovely evening here, and will definitely be back!

I'm rating this based off the All-You-Can-Eat option. There are definetly better sushi restaurants in SF but I don't know anywhere else in the city or near SF for made per order all you can eat sushi. I think fish quality is fresh and good. Have been 4-5 separate times and never had issues with quality of ingredients. Like ordering the seaweed salad, miso, gyoza, and then the nigiri and rolls. Hamachi nigiri great as well as tunas. Wait staff very friendly. Good value, good food, nice location, and best about eating all you can eat at sushi is you're not going home feeling sick or going into a food coma but you still fore sure get your dollar's worth. Highly recommended! Also, they do bottomless house hot sake for a good deal if you feel like getting a cheap buzz!

My roommate and I both got the all-you-can-eat sushi from here. It was probably the biggest mistake of my life. First, we both got sick. Additionally, their all-you-can-eat sushi menu is horrible. They claim there are 31 options but it is really just made up of 4 or five options that are slightly modified. STEER CLEAR OF THIS PLACE. it also did not taste good at all.

Great place for all you can eat sushi and sake.  I usually sit at the bar.  Despite the sometimes loud large drunken groups there the acoustics are such that the space itself doesn't get unbearably loud.  The service is great.

The nigiri was just OK. I think I was disappointed because I assumed being so close to the Marina the raw fish would have been better. It was not as cold as I would've liked it to be and that kind of threw off my opinion from the start. However, for 25$ all you can eat I definitely got my money's worth.

surprised to find myself giving 3 stars for all you can eat sushi, which concept I dislike, but for $25, it wasn't bad granted I ate mostly non sushi items such as the spinach, broiled mackerel, tempura, gyoza, etc.

BEWARE: "All you can eat" is not available when they are busy. We made a reservation to get our fill of sushi but was told it's not available to us even though EVERY other table had it available to them. Apparently it's up to their discretion even though it's clearly advertised outside. And they don't inform you until you place your order.
One of my favorite sushi places to get take out from. The wait time is always reasonable and they're open late! Rolls are good and they have BUTTERFISH:)

Our default pick for sushi takeout. The rolls are all pretty decent and delivery time is reasonable. I'd say a bit on the expensive side, in terms of the value you get for your money. Being in a high-traffic tourist area, I can see why that's the case. Still, definitely better than any sushi places in China Town.

I've eaten here several times.  The sushi is good, the staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and I love the atmosphere.  My boyfriend and I usually go for the sushi platter for two.  It's a good amount of food and good variety of sushi for two people.

This place is great! There aren't that many AYCE sushi places in the city and sushi hunter has a great selection for the price. The service was great, our waitress always came by to see of we wanted to order more.  Not only do they have rolls and sashimi, but you can also order things like tempura, miso soup, teriyaki, and all sorts of little dishes! My favorite was the sake nigiri. I could probably eat 50 of those in a sitting.
Very good food. Price is pretty decide for SF. Everyone there is very nice and friendly. Can't really beat all you can eat sushi, and it's fresh!!
There are a lot of wonderful sushi restaurants in SF.. this one was ok.
Chose the All you can eat Sushi. It' was just ok for me. Clams had sand in them. Spider Roll - Barely any crab. Just the legs... Nigri style fish was ok fresh. Weekday nights not as busy as weekends

I always have a good time at AYCE sushi places because, hey, lump sum + sushi forever = good times in my tummy. But I'll preface this by saying I've been completely and utterly spoiled by Toronto and its mecca of AYCE sushi places that defies logic, both in terms of price (soooo cheap), quality (soooo good) and quantity (this menu is how many pages long and they're ALL included in the deal?)

Regular customer - Always satisfied with the AYCE menu. Rolls are carefully made with good ingredients. Great non-sushi selection in the AYCE menu to complement the meal. Knocked 1 star off because service can be a little slow sometimes - but not to the point where it is a major inconvenience the experience.

Had not been here in about 10 years, but in the last 6 weeks have been back 3 times!  They have an awesome all you can eat menu with over 60 items with choices from Tempura to Sushi, for $25 it is an awesome deal.  Their Gyoza is really good. They bring it to the table which is nice but service can be slow on the down side.  All in all if you are in North Beach and want Sushi this is the place to go!

It's been a while since I been here. Maybe 5 years or so. I was coming maybe twice a month. My how the quality has gone down. Let's start with the green tea. Which was neither green nor tea. More like luke warm water. Then the sushi rice. With any sushi, the quality of the fish is important, but without the base. Without the sushi rice, nothing matters. The rice was more or less just white rice. Somewhat sticky but that was it. Terrible. I couldn't even finish my Chirashi. Only ate the fish and that was it. Maybe they're cutting corners due to their $25 all you can eat. But that's not what I ordered. If you can't get your sushi rice correctly, they you have no business running a sushi bar. I will never come back here again. Sorry guys.
I should have gotten the all you can eat when I came here.
I recently moved to SF and was excited to try sushi here, as everyone told me it was very good in the Bay.  Well, after about three duds, I found this awesome restaurant!
Have only come here for the all-you-can-eat @ $28.00 per person.

Very slow service. We definitely needed time with such a large menu but was way more time then needed and they could have at least taken our drink order. Sushi was ok but with all the other choices in the city I'm

We go to this Subway all of the time. It's fine.Sometimes you have to explain to the girl behind the counter a few times what you want, but so what? Me and my employees work in the area and it's a good value and pretty quick. We LIKE it.

took my money and gave me the wrong food. When I went back they refused to give me the right food or give me my money back. Will never come back. Worst service I have ever seen at a subway. Hope they close down.
For some reason this location no longer does the $4 lunch special. BUMMER.
Standard Subway, not the best and not the worst.  Friendly workers put the flow of the store seems a little lacking.
This place is a sh*t man!!!

All I can ask for with Subways is that they are clean with fresh ingredients. This one is both. It's an easy lunch time go to for a marginally healthy meal. I can't resist the chocolate chip cookies. Nothing on Specialty's but consistent.

This is a fast and super cheap spot for lunch! This location is new so it has a lot of two for one coupons that they are constantly handing out. They are pretty consistent with the sandwich making. I don't mix it up much. I always get the vegi on honey wheat and it usually tastes fresh and good. The service has been very quick and the lines moves at lunch. A couple of the sando-makers are a little slow but I chalk it up to them being new. They are all very friendly and one guy went above and beyond to find me my chips in the back when the shelf was empty. Overall, a quick, cheap place to grab a sandwich.
Quality Control is not their strong point at this location...

I had a sandwich there last week. No problem; regular six inch and a drink. It was good.  At checkout I paid for the sandwich and received a coupon for a free sandwich. The coupon stated I could get one of equal or lesser value with purchase of any sandwich and 20oz. drink.

We stumbled upon this place because the restaurant on our planned itinerary was closed. What a gem! Freshly prepared, nothing short of spectacular- we had the carpaccio, cozzi vongole, polenta and funghi, and snapper focaccia. Wow! I highly recommend this place!

went in for a salad which was delicious. I substituted chicken instead of anchovies. The salad ended up costing double ( $20 for a Caesar salad is ridiculous). The server should have mentioned the dramatic price increase for a substitution.

The food was fantastic! We went there with a fairly large party, and was given great service from beginning to end. The hospitality was spot on, but even more importantly, the food was authentic and tasty. From one member of the party, "best ravioli - hands down!"

One of the best chowders at the pier! Sure - you can be touristy and go to Boudin Bakery... but their portions are small and I feel like they kind of force you to get the bread bowl. The little stands at Fisherman's Grotto are great as well, but this has to be my favorite place to get chowder. Only $6.95 for a big bowl of chowder. The chunks of clam in there are huge! The boyfriend, who is from Boston and knows his chowder, always wants to come here when we go to the city. And that in itself should say enough.
This place was really busy this weekend and it was mid afternoon! They have a great location on Pier 39.
Awesome good!! Rough finding a place to actually eat it!! Birds everywhere... Ready to attack and bomb on people!!

Pier Market Stand used to be my favorite place to get calamari. Now, the important thing about why I am currently in search of a new place to get calamari at Fisherman's Wharf is not just because the quality of the calamari has taken the turn for the worse, it's because of the inadequate staff as well.
The food is eatable, but I will not return to eat here again. The bankok bread was breaking apart while I was eating it, there was capper with cream. Not worth the ten bucks with a drink.

The service is somewhat quick depending on what you order. While my friend and I got our clam chowders immediately -- the crab cake and the calamari took a while. But hey, deep fried things take a while so we weren't ones to complain about the 5 minute wait. The clam chowder was very tasty and the crab cake was delicious. My BF had the calamari and fries and while I only sampled a bit, it was quite good. This is a great place to grab something quick, on the go.
Pier Market Stand is located in Pier 39.  I had the crab cake.  It was packed with crab as opposed to being made mostly of starch.  It was delicious.

This is one of our favorite stops, having been a dozen times or so in the last 10 years. Place a walk-up order, pick up, and eat on the Pier benches. The best dishes are the crab on bannock bread, or the crab and shrimp on bannock bread. Both are absolutely spectacular.

Very good food.  2 of us got the clam chowder bowls and 2 of us got the pulled pork sandwiches. All 4 of us loved the food.  Service was really quick and waiters were friendly.  It was a little pricey, but what do you expect on the pier in SF?

I tried the clam chowder in a bread bowl for roughly $7.50 total. Service was extremely quick - I got my food about a minute after ordering (probably because all they have to do is ladle pre-cooked clam chowder into a bread bowl), though my friend who got calamari & fries had a wait quite a while.
3.5 stars. They're super busy, but they get the food out quickly. Got their fried halibut and chips and crab cake. The fried halibut was soooooo good. Crispy and tender without being overly oily.
Awesome chowder and sweet n sour calamari.
Overpriced and quality of food isn't great. Ordered a salmon bread sandwich and bread was awful on it.
More like a 3.5.
Crab and shrimp on a bannock all day, everyday.

We were hungry, needed to refresh our drinks as the flask had run dry...had the chowder bowls, typical..nothing special..the bar b que honey grilled shrimp were tasty, but could have used a few more green peppers and onions in the saute..we could have done without the Patron costing $11.50 for a short shot, or $25.00 for a "top shelf" Margarita's..my fault, I read the menu..but I would have expected a better pour..our first and last visit here..no so much as the food was bad, just way over priced for the quality.
Fast take out, ordered a clam chowder bowl and ate it next to the tulips :) Yummy chowder with bacon but bowl was kind of stale... so i just munched on a side of it....
Good oysters on half shell.
Since we were waiting at the main restaurant, we ordered a salmon burger, a chowder bowl, and a crab sandwich.

Ah yes. Pier Market Stand. For some reason, this has become my go-to place whenever I am on Pier 39. To be honest, every bowl of clam chowder that I've ever had in San Francisco has been pretty good with very little variation in quality. I guess the reason I keep coming back here is purely familiarity. Their chowder is good and I know I can get a quick Sourdough Bread Bowl of it from their outside counter. Take that chowder over to any of the pier's seating areas and enjoy the view.

There is definitely a difference between going into the restaurant and grabbing your food at the outside stand of the Pier Market.  It's cheaper and quicker in most cases.  I always stop by here for chowder bowls and crab cakes when I'm at the pier.  The chowder is mellow but flavorful and creamy and the bread is always soft and fresh.  The crab cakes are great but I wish they were a little bit bigger.  Otherwise the quality of both the cakes and the chowder bowls is wonderful!  Next time I'm gonna try the Salmon Burger... keep hearing good things about it.

Everytime I have visitors that want to go to the Wharf, this is my go to spot for clam chowder bread bowls and salmon quesadillas.  Ive been inside the restaurant too, but its cheaper outside and more fun wandering around.  The one time I did eat inside the restaurant my salmon quesadilla had pin bones.  Definitely go to the stand.  Fast, cheap, and good.

A few yelpers have mentioned this takeout stand as part of the Pier Market reviews, but I think it warrants it's own listing. Anything with a separate menu and cash register deserves it's own yelps in my book. And like others before me, those yelps will likely be good. I had the salmon burger, which for $7 is a pretty good deal at Pier 39. Freshly grilled right before your eyes, it comes with lettuce, tomato and a slice of lemon, I was saving it for dinner. and a quick reheat and a couple of  delicious bites later, definitely considered myself a fan.
Your average bad Chinese food restaurant. You don't go expecting great food and service. But you leave tummies full and craving satiated.

Have to be honest, I thought the food was pretty greasy. Also it was hard to tell the difference in the dishes because of the liberal use of chili flakes. The restaurant is a little musty and grimy. Staff are a tad unfriendly too. Other than that, it's got a lot going for it :-)

Went here for lunch with some coworkers, seated quickly and impersonal servant handed us some menus and walked off. Took orders served weak green tea and tap water. Food came quickly, But garlic chicken had a burnt after taste. Not appetizing at all, ate a little of it and asked for the check. They shuffle people in and out, quick service but the food sucked.
The New York Times periodical and I agree!

They serve food fast. The service is above average compared to other Chinese restaurants, very efficient. I'm Chinese so the cooking style and flavor don't bother me. So far didn't see any rats (fingers crossed)
I am going to boycott Henry's Hunan from now on. I was craving for Honey Glazed Chicken Wings like
After seeing that it was the best chinese food in the world, I had to try Henrys. The location on Sacramento closes at 5 pm. Therefore,  I tried this location. Marty's

I came here yesterday for the lunch special and ended up pulling a shard of metal out of my mouth. It appeared to be from a cooking instrument of some sort and probably would have required surgery if I had swallowed it. I let the host know about it and she brought it to the kitchen, however I was surprised that they didn't offer to pay for my unfinished $8 plate.

Dreadful experience. The service wasn't that nice. We ordered two different dishes - one with shrimp and one with scallops. Being two distinct entrees, there should have been a few differences. They looked and tasted identical. I'm not sure if the shrimps were fully cooked and the scallops were the worst I've ever had. On top of it all, it was very greasy and the soup kind of flat. To make matters worse, a mouse ran under our table. I've had much better food for far less. You're taking your chances by eating here.
Forget the rest of the review, as we were in the middle of our meal, a huge RAT ran by my feet!  Let the management know right away, and she gave me the lip service. Ugh.
I am wondering why Yelp doesn't have a ZERO STAR option. I will NEVER go to this rude restaurant again!!!!!!
Love the food here. Each dish has a nice kick. I first ate here back in 1988, I love to come back for the pork with celery and the bean curd with meat sauce! Yum!
I got four words for you: Greasy For No Reason

Well my family and I have been going to Hunan's since the 90's!!! (So yes they know who we are when we come! Lol) This is THE best Chinese food ever!!! My favorites are Diana's meat pie, Hunan Shrimp, Beef & broccoli and Garlic chicken (in that order! Lol). Every time I visit the city I have to make a stop here and will continue to do so!!!!
This place is awesome!!  We've been coming here since 1984.  The best hot and sour chicken and shrimp, and fabulous Mongolian chicken. Not to mention the Marty's Special. You can't go wrong here!!!

Yesterday eve, I went in for an interview half a block away from this place.  After the interview, I decided to have dinner here.  The woman who greeted us was extremely short, but we love Hunan.  I go to the one on Natoma and Second all the time. Love them.  My date asked for another plate, and she swapped it out and stood there looking at it.  He said, "it's dirty," and she said, "it's not dirty it's just been washed too many times."  Weird.  Just take the plate.  What gives?  Our food was decent, and she packed our little to go box.  He paid the bill with his card, and was going to tip her in cash.  She grabbed the receipt and stopped after taking a step, she turned to him and said, "you know this is for the food cost only.  It doesn't include tip." It was so freaking rude.  He said, "yeah, I know.  I have cash for the tip."  It was so upsetting.  She was so rude, and I really love this food, but will never visit this place again (even if I do start working half a block away!)
Best Chinese chicken salad in the city! A wonderful dive in the expensive city and financial district
I've been coming here since I was old enough to remember, back when Enson worked here and showed a 7 year old me how to use chopsticks and not get food all over the floor.
This my favorite place. Everything is good.  Start with something like Onion Pancake and have dish like Hunan Chicken.

I eat here 3-4 times a month since it's 2 blocks from my office.  The food is always excellent.  The service is fast, even when they are crowded.  The Diana's Meat Pie is so amazing, I've actually gone there because I've been craving it all morning.  The food is well seasoned without being salty.

I suppose if you need cheap, non-offensive food for dozens of people and are already standing within 8 feet of Henry's Hunan's front door, then go for it. Otherwise, I can't see a single reason why anyone would go to this place.
Came to this location for dinner because Sac Street only serves lunch.  We had a large party on a Friday night and Henry's food satisfied everyone.  We loved the kung pao and the sauteed green beans.

My office wanted to try this restaurant since this particular 'branch' is so close. Co-workers have been to the other Henry's locations and had good experiences. Somehow I knew better. A restaurant named Henry's Hunan is not screaming out 'Authentic.' Having dated a gal born in the Hunan province, she took me to real authentic Hunan restaurants (surprise surprise), so I know what to expect.

Ordered for delivery on a Saturday night. The order confirmation was to be at 8:56 pm and literally the doorbell rang at 8:56pm!! Amazing!  The shrimp Kung pao and Mongolian chicken were great!  The broccoli and beef was a little disappointing as was the mixed seafood soup, which was very gummy and thick.  Overall the meal was satisfying and reasonably priced with quick delivery.
There are a couple of Henry's Hunan in San Francisco. We only tried one and was very pleased.

They say, go to Henry's Hunan is you like a) spicy and b) quality Chinese food. Well, I dig both, and this place fell short of expectations repeatedly. First of all, here's what "spicy" means here: it's chili flakes and seeds with a side of food. I was shocked to open both my refried rice and "vegetable delight" to-go boxes and see nothing but red from how many chili flakes they had put in the food. This was for a "medium spicy" request. Well, it's not that it's too spicy, it just completely RUINS any other potential flavor that you could taste. And chewing on dried flakes isn't particularly appealing either. I didn't think it was quality food. The "8 Vegetable Delight" was mostly onions with, like, 2 broccoli and 2 beans.
We always go here when we come to San Fran! Downes meat pie is the BEST!

Avoid the chicken. Weird aftertaste. We've been doing takeout here for years, but not any more. We special order the Kung Pao chicken with white meat, very hot. Also order the garlic chicken. Both were inedible. This is the second or third time we've had problems with their chicken. Gave up on the beef dishes too because their meat is tough.

Though I have eaten in countless Chinese restaurants, this is the only Chinese restaurant where I am able to find a dish called Diana's meat pie!  It consists of thick ground pork combined with a tangy sauce, topped with shredded iceberg lettuce, and sandwiched in between fried bread.  This bread is thin but at the same time puffy and floury.  When you bite into a Diana's meat pie, it is still hot and sizzling from the fryer, tastes scrumptiously crunchy, and the ground pork is soft and moist.

I LOVE this place.  Been coming here since '98.  Diana's Meat Pie.  Henry's Seafood Special.  Dry Sauteed Stringbeans.    Best Hunan in SF.  This location, a former garage, is plenty big; it can accommodate big groups.  Fast, friendly service.

I thought the food was fine for the price, good but not great. I would come back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so. I liked the space, which was funky - Chinese restaurant in a warehouse. I would have given four stars, but had a sketchy experience with the tab: Put down $60 on a $37 tab expecting change so we could pay the tip and they never brought us anything back for 15 minutes (and the place was empty, they were just sitting in the little cashier room). I finally had to go up the the cashier and ask for the change, she asked how much I gave her and then gave me the change. Really? So I could have told you I gave you $100? I don't think so...

OMG.  Those who think the food in this restaurant is good have never had good Chinese food or are related to the owner.  Of course, I will allow for both to be true.  The restaurant is in our neighborhood and Zagats rated so we thought we would give it a try.  Yes, only half the restaurant had the lights on and yes, there was a dingy and greasy smell and very few people.  Maybe this is a hidden jewel, we thought.   So disappointing.  The hot and sour soup was inedible--cold and favor less would be an apt description.  OK so maybe they don't make good soup.  Let's not prejudge.  We asked the waitress for her recommendation of Henry's best dish.  She strongly recommended Henry's special.  OK let's give it a try with the spareribs.  Both sauces were identical and had a the same amount of grease and burnt taste served luke warm.  Maybe the microwave power setting was on low.  In a city with great Chinese food, what a disappointment.  Best thing I can say about this place is we didn't get food poisoning yet... Of course, it's only been an hour.
I've been coming here for over 25 years and still my fave Hunan in the world.

This place was just okay. The food was so-so, the decor and space was underwhelming. One tip: don't order both the meat pie and the onion cake at the same time - the meat pie is basically the onion cake with ground meat in the middle. Not bad, but definitely very very salty.

Meat was raw. Very unhygienic. Bad customer service. Unclear water. Oily and very greasy. No taste in the mood whatsoever. The meat was very slimy. Dumplings didn't look or taste like regular dumplings. Restaurant is always empty. No wonder why. Uncomfortable atmosphere and very unprofessional service.

i cant believe all to low scores for this restaurant. ive been coming here since i was in the womb! I LOVE HUNANS! my parents have been eating here for over 25 years. and we always go there for birthdays or when we are in the neighborhood. Dianas meat pie is AMAZING! and the Dumplings OMG!

I just cannot believe anybody has anything bad to say about this place, unless you don't like spicy food.  If you don't like spice, probably go to the next chinese restaurant.  But if you like spice, this place is the best.  Get the Henry's special #6 with pork and spinach and a #36 Henry's special with seafood and chicken.  The #6 has no spice at all but #36 will be spicy unless you say otherwise.  My dad actually cannot tolerate any spice at all and I order it for him FLAT and still very good.
NASTY, I ordered the combo chow mein and soup.....
Food served was cold. We still gave her 10% tip. To my horror, she asked for 4 bucks more saying that she makes 15% as tip from every customer.  Wouldn't ever go again.
Still a family business where you get great food without much waiting. Been coming here for twenty some years and still my favorite. Marty's special is the best!
May have changed ownership because the service/food has been terrible. Stay away. Over two hours for delivery and food was cold

I used to frequent North Beach Pizza when I was in the neighborhood.  Now, I will be hard pressed to ever go back.  The service has been really bad recently. There are plenty of other places that seem happy to have my business.

We went to pier 39 tonight decided to get a bite there. We ended up at North Beach pizza. Well don't bother with this place. First off they moved all the way in the back 2nd floor. By the merry go round. The maps said it's in the front??

I'll have to be honest I thought this pizza was fantastic when I last went to San Francisco in September 2008 I honestly thought it was great pizza. Coming from San Diego all there really is to eat is expensive steak restaurant.

Disgusting place! Went here for dinner one night with my Fiancee & it was just downright nasty! Everything was watered down. The salad had water at the bottom of the bowl, the tortellini tasted like it was bought for Safeway & the Alfredo was from a can. The cheese garlic bread was bought & had cheese power sprinkled on it. My fiancee blamed me for picking this nasty place. Not worth the $30 we spent here. DON'T EVER GO HERE, IT'S NOT WORTH IT!!!!

I honestly feel it is a little pricey, but EVERYTHING is at the pier. Honestly, do not order-out, always eat in with this restaurant to make it worth the price. The service is generally great and they have good pizza (not the best, but good). The desserts are also delicious. Only thing I could complain about are some of the other customers.
These folks make really awful pizza.
Pizza by the numbers:
Oh man, I can't tell you how bummed I am. I feel betrayed, lost, and most of all, queasy.
Maybe God is telling us to stop eating at Pier 39. Again we found ourselves looking for grub in a tourist area. Nothing seemed "mm mm good," so I thought pizza was a safe bet.

I obviously have no taste because I've never seen so many 1 star reviews before in my life. Oh well, I thought the vegetarian pizza was excellent. It was fresh and delicious...not soggy or greasy at all. We didn't go for the buffet so maybe that's why the pizza tasted so darn fresh...Very delicious fresh vegetable soup as well (with fresh cut big chunks of veggies...nothing from a can or sitting around rotting for hours ...impressive!) . Salad not so hot. Just average. Dog friendly, people friendly. Loved it here. I could've eaten a whole pie here by myself...that's how much I loved it.  I guess being from nyc I just don't know good pizza..ha ha...

Terrible and gross. I am pretty bummed that tourists unloading off cruise ships are funneled into this place on Pier 39 stating that it is "The Best Pizza in San Francisco". I know, I know, traveler beware and all that. If they won't make the effort to seek out quality joints then it's on them. But even they don't deserve to eat at this place, that's a little too much punishment for being lazy and scared. I have been served rotten food and have given up getting more slices after waiting 20 minutes in between the restocking of the "all you can eat" pizza lunch buffet. I have been here more than a couple of times because I work in the area and people in groups somehow end up here. Rotten old food, terrible service and a strange rip off all you can eat buffet. They lucked out that I got too busy at work to file a complaint with the Health Department.

North Beach Pizza was our fallback. My girlfriend wasn't feeling 100% and didn't feel like our scheduled seafood dinner before our Alcatraz tour. North Beach Pizza had been recommended to us by a friend of a friend down in Santa Maria when we were there earlier in the week.

The only decent thing about this place was our "waiter" who was friendly and talkative. The claim that it's "San Francisco's Best Pizza!" is a blatant lie and honestly the most appalling thing I have ever heard. As everything else on Pier 39 is excessively overpriced and we could only go somewhere to validate our parking we went here. Initially we thought it wasn't absolutely the worst thing ever, but it was. The "cheesy" pasta was so dry it hurt to swallow. The sauces were way watered down and were worse then the cheapest pasta sauce you could buy in a jar. The pizza was okay but extremely greasy and made you feel as though you were about to die. The salad bar was mediocre but I was really concerned at how long the stuff had been left out for. Also, the salad lettuce container had inches of water in it! They don't even dry the lettuce! The dressing was weird and not the best. The whole restaurant was dirty and the bathrooms were kind of gross. I could not understand why the women's restroom had two toilets in it but no door to separate them. Are you supposed to pee next to someone else sop you can watch them the whole time?!?!? CREEPY! I felt like I would die after this meal and would never come back here. I would rather pay $30 for a plain Cesar salad from an overpriced eatery.

We went here as a second choice for lunch and I was less than pleased with my experience. First, it took forever for our waitress to come over and she didn't seem very happy we were there. We had the buffet which was just OK, personally I thought all of the pizzas had the same flavor. We only saw our waitress twice at our visit, to take our order and bring our check, the rest of the time she was yelling at the bus boy in front of customers. C'mon now... The bus boy spent more time with us taking our plates and getting us a refill, I hope he got our tip and not her.

They have a buffet which is a great idea so you can have pizza, pasta, salad, bread sticks etc. Unfortunately everything was cold, looked like it had been sitting out for a long time, etc. It was quite disappointing b/c I really like the other NB Pizza in NB.
When you get in.
Well the service was excellent, my server was very energetic and quick to help us. The prices were very nice too.

Well, I've learned one thing from this dining experience. Never go out to eat on vacation without checking yelp first. North Beach Pizza is a decent looking restaurant on the outside, 70's pizzaria feel on the inside. We were at Pier 39 and wanted to get some good food for our last night in SF. I was prepared to just eat at Bubba Gump, which is right next door, but then we saw a sign for a pizza/pasta buffet. I was starting to get hungry, and a buffet sounded far more appealing to my friend and I. Wrong, wrong, wrong decision. Let's just cut this into sections, shall we?

So my friends and I decided to take some people from Denver out on the town. We planned to go to Bubba Gump's but ofcourse it had a long wait..then someone saw North Beach Pizza. The price for unlimited buffet was $12.99. I thought "Ok that price is good for me"

This location used to be really good back in the day.  Great view of the bay and validated parking, what more could you ask for right?  THIS WAS HANDS DOWN THE WORST PIZZA I'VE HAD IN A VERY LONG TIME.  My school cafeteria serves a better Freschetta pizza.  First off the dough seemed way undercooked.  I like it when my pizza can support the toppings and the only time that a weak support system is acceptable when there is wayyy too much stuff on top of it.  Service was HORRIBLE to say the least.  We ordered the combo pizza (whatever it was called there) and the garlic twists.  The garlic twists came out and they were burnt beyond belief.  I can't believe that they had to nerve to even try to serve that.  After I sent them back I noticed one of the waiters come out and stand there eating them.  I really don't care but I don't want to see you standing around eating not doing shit when it's obvious that waters need to be filled etc.  Afterwards the horrible pizza came out and it wasn't until we were almost done when the garlic twists came out AGAIN.  I had canceled the order just prior to them arriving at the table because seriously, we were done with dinner already and you just now bring out the appetizer???
Pizza here is to real pizza as pier 39 is to San Francisco -- It's an expensive greasy mess and the bathrooms are dirty.

We were visiting San Francisco and stayed @ Fisherman's Wharf and the concierge at our hotel recommend this place. We were shocked at how pricey it was. The Cesar salad was the best part, and it was pretty run of the mill. The pizza was ok. Nothing special, especially considering the price.
Came by with the wife & grand kid for a quick meal. The place was packed on Valentine's Day. We did the buffet and kids under 4 eat free!

If i could rate this restaurant anything lower than one star I would. I went there today with a friend for lunch and each ordered a dish off the pasta menu and some soup. The soup was awful and it looked and tasted like it came out of a can. The pasta was the worst though, we each tasted out dish and couldn't eat more than two bites. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone so save yourself the trouble and just find something else.

If you like greasy pizza (and I do, though it's not the only kind I like), then this is the place for you. My friend and I split a large pepperoni and sausage pizza; the pizza had a nice crust, but it was quickly marred by the greases from both meats soaking through to the pan. While I didn't mind this, others who prefer a crisper crust may be turned off by this.
NB Pizza... we woulda gone to NB, but it was too far to walk and we didn't know if we'd make it without biuying another bus pass.  Yes, we're poor.

Two stars for being there when your hungry and all else might be to pricy when you want to buy other stuff in the city. Their pizza wasnt bad nice tasting crust. Their pasta sucked and they had a typical salad bar but nothing special. Everytime we went it was very packed. They are on their toes. You can watch the owner/manager yelling at ALL the staff, everytime I went he was yelling. They are brazilian i think. They do have a really great view of the bay and boats etc. If you get a table near the window....OOH its nice. But if your not at the wharf for seafood come here if your starving...  to a pizza buffet around 12.00 per person.

So one night on the wharf my boyfriend and I decide to get a bite to eat. I have had NBP before, so I felt it was a safe choice.....WRONG! First off, they have the absoluted unprofessional service and the hostess was rude. I know it isn't a 5 star place...but seriously, how hard is it to be courteous and polite? Another, their "buffet" was cold, un-inviting, and the pizza was nothing like the signature NBP I have come to know and (previously) loved.
Synopsis:

i totally agree with anthony y. i will only eat it if its there/free and just cuz it has melted cheese on it. on par with fat slice and other cardboard esque establishments. go to little star, patxis, or zacharys and see what pizza tastes like.
ok here's the situation my parents went away on a weeks vacation and they left the keys to the brand new porsche would they mind hmmmm well of course not...

Pricey for a pizza buffet but overall it was good. The salad bar is mediocre at best ranch was really thick and weird. Their marinara sauce was kind of runny. But the pizza was pretty good I'm a pizza fanatic and i thought this was ok. I had a hawaiian slice & pepperoni w/ sausage slice of pizza they were both good. Not alot of sauce which i enjoy but my boyfriend hates he LOVES sauce haha. So overall this place is good but definitely not worth the price. Make sure to grab the $3 off coupon
Took a little trip to SF and of course, they all wanted to go to Pier 39.  Personally, I've DONE Pier 39, so I'm kind of over it... BUT I have NOT done North Beach Pizza.
Wow... Possibly the crappiest dining experience I've ever endured. This place is ridiculously overpriced, and the food ranges from mediocre to inedible. Don't go here. Just don't.

This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to in my life.  It is located in the Fisherman's Wharf Sheraton.  I know, I should have never been in Fisherman's Wharf in the first place, but I did a time share tour and received two free nights at the hotel.  I ordered the black angus 10 oz. new york steak with creamed spinach and mashed potatoes.  Let me start on a good note...it's pretty hard to fuck up mashed potatoes.  Even bad ones are still usually edible.  And these were edible.  The creamed spinach...it was a bowl of lumped together, soggy, previously frozen spinach with a half pint of cream poured on top.  It was gross looking and tasting.  The steak.  I asked for it medium...it arrived well done.  Okay, everyone makes mistakes.  I took a bite and it was fatty, gamy and so heavily salted, (to mask the putrid, foul taste I'm sure) that I had to spit out the bite.  Needless to say, I sent it back and sat with my arms crossed, refusing to eat another thing they served.  I am not a picky eater but this place wicked sucks, big time.

Ordered via seamless for dinner and I was pleasantly surprised. Their spring rolls (summer rolls) with shrimp was so incredibly fresh and delicious that I was inspired to go back home that night, learn how to make spring rolls from my Vietnamese mother, and then eat more spring rolls that same night. I cannot say I enjoyed the Chicken Satay at all (very dry and zero flavor). Despite only taking a bite of that chicken and throwing away the rest, I would come back only for the spring rolls.
Food was delicious. Totally made up for the bad service. Price was great for the portion sizes.

I've only ordered delivery from this restaurant on Seamless Web. I got the spring rolls with prawns and the five spice chicken with vermicelli noodle. The spring rolls were very overpriced and had very little shrimp. The five spice chicken with noodle was very good though. Chicken was tender and had good flavor.

Ordered here via Seamless for lunch, and the food was pretty good! Pricey for what it was though-- I ordered honey pork with garlic noodles (kinda sad there was no option to get white rice instead), and my friend ordered garlic fish with garlic noodles, and our total was $25 before tip. Our quoted arrival time was 45-60 minutes, and it came right on the dot at 45 minutes. The food wasn't as warm as it could have been, but hey, it's delivery.

I don't know why reviews are bad for this place?!  We always order for delivery at work &  food is freshly prepared, & delicious!  Now for the first time, I finally get to dine in with my fam & everything we ordered on the menu (surprisingly had a great choice of both Vietnamese & Thai cuisine) were all scrumptious! Come & try for yourself!

Another horrible delivery experience similar to those below.  Decided to order through Seemless.  The delivery window was from 30-45 minutes stated by A Taste of Vietnam Noodle Bar & Gril.  Placed the order and waited and waited and waited and waited some more.  I gave them a ring after an hour and a half.  I received an abrupt "Oh the delivery guy just left.  He'll be there in 15 minutes."  Nope.  Another 35 minutes later we receive our food.  It took us just about TWO HOURS to receive our delivery.

Ordered from seamless and the food came late, and not worth the wait. The spring rolls were tiny and greasy and the 5 spice chicken was more skin than I could handle. I'm not giving it 1 star, as it was passable. Won't be ordering again though.
i seriously don't know what the other reviews are about.
This place is appropriately named.  While it kinda tastes like the Vietnamese food I know and love, something's a bit off.

Ordered in again. Not great this time around. Food tasted like it was sitting around for a bit and the steam effected it. The noodles from my honey pork tasted off. The honey pork was good but a bit tough. The vegetarian rolls weren't crunchy but a little soggy. Disappointing since the first time was so good.
Quite good fast delivery in the middle of the day (3PM) via seemless.
The food tastes like Thai food.  King of Thai is cheaper and better even without the 20% off coupon from seemless.
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!
UGH... Cash only?! No yellow egg for sub? The lady doesn't know how to make the sandwiches, even though she has a cheat sheet posted two inches from her face?! .......

Very rude staff and totalllllly dirty!! I could see the staff take off cheese from the chicken sandwich and place it back into the cheese tray because the customer said he did not want cheese!! Please dont ever go here-spoiling subway's reputation!
Dirty. Rude staff.

I don't go to this location often, but have to agree with the other reviews. They got everything right, but when I said, "spicy mustard", the lady puts Honey Mustard. Messing up my order! Don't expect me to come here often!!

So, i work nearby and come here once in a blue moon when i feel like spending alot for a sando that fills me up for like....5 min. the employees there are ALWAYS yelling "BREEEAD???" "CHEEEEEEEEESE?" "EVERYYYYTHIIIING?" "TOASSSTTED?" "YOU WANT CHIPS AND SODAAAAA???" as if you cant hear them....just go there and see for yourself!

Today I was here at this Subway Restaurant on the Wharf the place was packed because of today's Pride Weekend anyways I ordered a Personal Pizza with Pepperoni okay the Pizza was cold although it's been in the oven over 2-minutes and Cashier who was older Filipino woman she grabbed my 20 dollars I'm sorry she snatched my twenty dollar bill one I'm half Filipino she is lucky I did not take my cold ass pizza and dumped on her old ass. Show me the respect like she would wants the respect from others. DONT BE SNATCHING other people's money especially from me. PERIOD.
The rudeness of the guy was unbelievable:

Ate their for breakfast while on vacation. It is a small location but not real busy. The breakfast sandwich was good and I also went with one of their muffins. Service was not bad or good. Also I didn't see any homeless people begging outside of this location (very typical in SF & Fisherman's Wharf area especially) .

I wanted subway for a while so I came here instead of the one near in n out because it was close to where I work. The space is small and there's only two lady behind the counter. My food was fast and still hot by the time I got back to work. I only took some stars off because there always seem to be a homeless man sitting inside or right outside. The food is okay though.

Even with the strangers outside sweet-talking you, its a pretty quick trip in and out. They have more than one person here making the sandwiches, so I got out there quicker than the annoying man before me who kept changing his mind. Although the woman who kept asking me whether I wanted this and that or that annoyed me a little bit and made me feel she was stingy, my sandwich came out to be pretty huge. I mean, what kind of question is "do you want cheese"? Do I look fat to you?! I would never give up my cheese! And is the cold cut combo supposed to only have ONE type of meat? Hm.. I always thought it was more, but I could be wrong. $5 footlong and nothing more. Subway used to be one of my favorite foods (I know.. shut up) but not anymore lately. I'm semi-sick of it (after having 2 footlongs within a couple days) and I'm glad. Next time I don't feel like spending my whole paycheck on fine dining, I'll just have it twice in a row, and there you go..
These last three reviews are totally right. I've been to this Subway numerous times, and most of the time, my sandwich is just slopped together with no love!

Basically they just throw your shit together here. There's no care or love at all. It's like they're doing this for court mandated community service. If you really want Subway go to the one three or four blocks down. Jared would approve of the exercise.
Good Meatball Marinara sub sandwich, LOUSY service.  Ugh, enough said.
Great hot dogs, friendly staff and open when you really need a hot dog... at least for me 10am. :)

Twice the price of a Costco hot dog but only (at best) half as good as one.  Moreover, their chili is kind of watery too so your chili ends up breaking apart as the bread, which is also pretty meh, breaks down the bottom.

I usually get a quesarito when I come to chipotle, and recently I have been disappointed. This one was especially good though, they didn't overcook the tortilla when melting the cheese. A lot of places do.
Consistent inexpensive Mexican food; the restaurant uses fresh ingredients and classic culinary techniques.  Enjoy customized burritos, tacos, salads, chips & guacamole and more!
Echoing some other people... Chipotle is usually pretty good but this place seems off.

I would never begin to conceive that Chipotle was anything more than Americanized Mexican food. That said, I deem this particular store the worst of all the Chipotles I've been to. Reason #1: They ran out of the cardboard takeout containers. 2. They were out of the mild sauce. Like, not just for the time being. They were out for the evening. 3. My friend and I weren't hungry but we knew we needed to grab food at some point in the night, so we went to the most convenient place in the neighborhood. To feel adventurous,  we ordered from the "secret menu." Quesarito (burrito that was first grilled with cheese) and nachos were our choice.  Get this: they don't melt the cheese on the nachos. They said, "there's no way for us to do that." Really? Nachos is quite the misnomer for the dish, don't you think? The takeaway here is: secret menu is not always awesome.  Ordering off the Chipotle secret menu has been thus far 100% awful.

First of all I'm pretty sure this Chipolte does NOT close at 4 pm as listed as I just got back from eating there and it's 8pm on a Sunday. I thought the food was very good!  I had the steak bowl and it was fresh and tasted great. I'd definitely go back!
Dear Jose manager,
Worst chipotle I've ever been to. The girl gives you half a spoon of meat.. She's probably new. Didn't know where the bowls were and didn't even bother looking for them. They were right under her..
Food was good enough but I had to clean the table myself because it was very wet from when they had cleared it. I had to use 3 napkins. Not very professional.
So I love Chipotle.  Just love it.

This place doesn't know their proportions!They basically give you a little bit of everything you want. The staff are rude and they don't make eye contact at all. It seems as if they hate their job. The place is a little messy and there is always a line. 15 minutes  the most waiting in line for your food.

Worst dining experience of my life. Waited for 15 minutes with three people in front of me. When it was my turn they were out of rice, meat, and beans. Waited another 10 minutes. When I was frustrated the server decided she was going to "skip me" as I was frustrated. The place was filthy and the employees/manager were the rudest people I've ever met.

This place is really gross. I'm a guy who really likes chipotle. This was not chipotle. The restaurant was very dirty both in the seating area and behind the counter. Though the place was moderately busy, the staff refused to make eye contact with me while I ordered the burrito and ignored much of my order so I was repeating myself a lot. All of the beans were waaay down in the bottom of a big brown pool of liquid so I got plenty of that in my burrito too. They didn't seem to understand proportion and slopped the toppings/salsa on with a disdain that reminded me of the free lunch I used to get in elementary school. I ate about half of the burrito and I'm not sick so I'm not too upset but I would recommend avoiding this place.

Slow service for chipolte. Tables are dirty. The workers seem as though they are slammed, but aren't. Maybe this chipotle doesn't uphold the standards of some from Colorado chipotles. Not going back tho this one, also not a good impression for tourists.

We eat at Chipotle in Paradise Valley, AZ ALL THE TIME and they are amazing! The service and attitude at this location left a lot to be desired--and, frankly, the restaurant is really dirty. Tables needed to be bussed and the serving area was also very unclean looking. Finally, we have severe food allergies and when I told them this, they looked at me like I had two heads. With only one exception, the locations we have gone to are so well-trained on allergies. NOT this one. And, the manager of this location just stood around and ordered everyone else to do the work. Managers at other locations are totally engaged with the customers and the tasks that need to be done. Totally unimpressed with this location and not surprised by how UNcrowded it was.
I went to Chipotle Mexican Grill last week, and the restaurant was full because of all the people who came there for the delicious food, fresh ingredients, and something healthy.
Just had lunch here. Without exception poor service from each person behind the counter, starting with the person who took my order to each person asking what I wanted.

This place was HORRIBLE!!!! We were VERY disappointed & frustrated by this place.,  They had NO BEANS & NO DRINKS! What mexican place has NO BEANS?!?! They didn't apologize or try to at least compensate, they filled meat burritos with rice & barely put any meat on it. They chinsed on the kids meal, apparently it was supposed to come with beans, rice & chips, they only gave us the quesadilla & drink. We ordered chips & salsa, they gave us a handful of chips & filled the salsa halfway. The staff all seemed very put out & were not only un-friendly but were rude! I will NEVER come here again!
The place was pretty full. I would go again.

Cold horrible food. REALLY tall guy was totally uninterested in helping customers. Totally interested in pop celebs, talking bad about customers behind their back, talking about women rudely and loudly whistling.. I will never come back. Disgusting.

I went there on the weekend and the line was quite long. The server tried to add lots of rice and beans and skimp on the meat like stated in other posts. I ordered a chicken burrito and the guy prepared a carnitas one without knowing the difference.

I really dislike this place! This is the second time in my life I have tried Chipotle ...I thought I would give it one last go. I work around the corner and wanted some tacos. I wish I had taken a pic of the portion the woman put of Barbacoa in the taco, because it was so disproportionate to the size of the tortilla that I gave a big laugh out loud.

Horrible. I asked for less rice in my burrito bowl and the woman dumped it in then she game three small peppers. I told her to give me more veggies and she got pissed. She stormed off leaving me with no food. Someone had to fill in for her and he was even abrupt. I just wanted a high veggie low carb bowl. I should have just got a salad. Which by the way they should offer something other than watered down sour cream as a topping. Also no seating. You have to fight for it here.
I was excited when I first heard that Chipotle would be opening close to my job. I went once... and now I'm not excited about it anymore.
This place is just wrong. A disgrace to the fine cuisine of Mexico. After all, it is owned by McDonald's, so what did I expect?  I take responsibility on this one.
I have been to this location several times before...but this time will be the last.
The burrito is all rice.  The chips here are way over salted.  I have enough water retention.  My belly is constantly swollen.
Service was less than desirable. Most workers did not want to be there, and it showed. Food the same as other Chipolte's.
Cut to the chase: My bowl was so empty it could've had a flat lid!
even though there's a line, the staff worked fairly quickly.

This has to be one of the worst Chipotle's in the Bay Area. The employees are slow so ordering takes forever, there seems to be a high turnaround so there's always an exceptionally slow employee being trained that ineveitably makes your food wrong, and it's so hit or miss with the quality. I work in the area and have eaten here several times over the last 6 months as a last resort. This afternoon was the last time I'll make that mistake. Yuck.

With so many great locally owned taquerias in SF, why go to Chipotle... Well if you're like me and accidentally found yourself in Touristman's  Warf surrounded by only chain restaurants, Chipotle is a pretty good option.  overall: Simple yet customizable menu, fresh ingredients and clean.

Worst Mexican I have ever had in my life! How do you mess up a steak burrito so badly?? With so many good cheap taco/burrito places in SF there is no reason to go here. I have been to other chipotle locations and remember thinking it was good. Other reviews have said the same thing, that this particular location just isn't good.   Most of the people that gave it a good review, just look where they are from, places that don't even know what mexican food is. The staff was friendly but Bottom line it tasted terrible and cost $12 for a burrito!
need fast food on a road trip that is reasonable in price and healthy....we love this place...simple

Solid Chipotle location in Fisherman's Wharf. The restaurant is very clean from the times I have came here and I have yet to be disappointed. Service here is very quick and the employees here look very eager to help out the customer.
Great fast food, clean nice people, well priced in the middle of Fisherman's Warf

I come here once in a while when I'm in the area and their burritos are just ok. The staff here is great, but their burritos are on the small size. I've to serveral other branches, but this one's tight with the meats! Just wish they're a bit generious, like the others.
I love Chipotle. This one is well placed, and the staff were very friendly. The manager even walked rough the tables and made sure everyone was enjoying their meals.
LIZ WAS AWESOME!!!

Incredible burrito! I had the grilled chicken, fajita vegetables, cheese, romaine lettuce, salsa, and cilantro-lime rice. I wish they had Spanish rice like Freebirds do though. That's my ultimate favorite. I ate half around 7pm and saved the rest until around midnight it was still good, didn't need to be reheated at all.
Some might say this isn't real Mexican food (and it probably isn't) but I don't care!!!  I love the burrito bowl that seems large enough to feed a small family :p
Food quality is low. Hamburger was stiff, bread was still frozen. Location is good but it's not enough to get 2 stars.

As I'm sitting here in the pizzeria, I'm deciding whether I should even bother carrying the left over pizza home. It's just bad. The crust is bland and unremarkable. The dough is probably frozen. The toppings, pepperoni, onion, bell peppers, are all cooked to different consistencies, which means that the cheese base and components were probably precooked separately hours ago and then assembled. My husband said it tastes like the pizza you get at amusement parks. You're better off buying a Red Baron pizza and staying home.
San Francisco Indian Summers are amazing.

I would have gave 4 stars because the pizza is good in the neighborhood but the service is horrible. They are rude people walking around with attitudes. Always looking mad. Never a smile. I posted a picture of one of the female workers who actually hung up the phone on me twice. So I went in after and took her picture to put her ass on blast. She makes everything about that place very uncomfortable. The prices are too high but of course it's made for the tourist.
shittest pizza ever. Bad service! Horrible waitress. Charges 1$ for a small ranch while sitting there eating. Will never eat here again.

If there was a way to give zero starts, I would. My fiancee and I went here to grab a quick bite and though what better than eat pizza at a Pizzeria. Guess, we were wrong. We ordered their medium (13") vegetarian delight. It was anything but delightful! The pizza was soggy and plain bad. We had a pint of beer and the total hit $40 with a 10% tip. It's been a while since I've paid so much money for such terrible food. Don't go here. It's not worth your money or time.
The pizza was soggy in the middle. Paid $36 for horrible horrible pizza.
Worst service in the world. .. waitress acted as if she was kim jun whatever from north Korea... just mean and racist. .. the pizzza was awsome tho. Good! !!
This review is for the same visit where the cashier demanded her tip.

The reviews suggest that this pizza is the absolute worst thing most people have ever tasted, but I personally didn't think it was all that bad. The crust was a little doughy, but it still had a nice flavor. Additionally, the pizza was very greasy, which I LOVE in pizza because it adds a lot of flavor. Those who don't like greasy pizza won't like this pizza. All in all, not a bad place, but definitely not the best pizza for the price or in comparison to really good pizzas.

The waitress was nice, but the pizza took an hour to make. It was not worth the wait because it didn't taste good. The pizza was very greasy and I really had to pat that down with a few napkins. And the worst part is that it was expensive. Because of the wait they gave us small fries on the house and one free cheese cake to share with the other 5 people that were with me. Everyone was getting frustrated and tried for waiting so long. I know; I should have left earlier, but we were tried of walking. This was not a pleasant experience.

We were walking by and the smell was incredible. The pizza smelled fantastic.   Unfortunately the service was HORRIBLE, there is trash on the floor and whatever you do, do not order the calamari.  It is sooo gross. Very very disappointing!
Don't even bother to go to this place...

This place is bomb! They have a bar and their pizza is really really tasty! It was so good I ate half of the entire pizza in like 3 minutes. Tasted fresh and smelled amazing. I will be back. Service is really good too. The second I walked in I was greeted and sat. Then my order was taken. Maybe price is a tad high but it's San Fran, practically on the water - I'm sure the overhead there is insane, so I get it. Thank you, FP - see you again very soon!
Amazing service and great food! I highly recommend it. You can sit wherever you like and it only takes 15 minutes for the pizza to be delivered to your table.
It is a great place.  I love the taste of the pizza of this Pizzeria.

I would give this place NEGATIVE FIVE STARS if it was possible!!! The taste and quality of the pizza was the worst that I've ever had!!! I spent $31.10 for the smallest and tasteless pizza ever!!! And on top of that, the idiots who work here waited until AFTER they brought over my husband's pizza to tell me that they didn't have the fish and chips that I ordered. Why the hell did they wait until then to tell me that?!?! How did they not know way before then that they were out??? They should've been notified by the cooks right when my order was put in. So after they brought my husband's pizza 15-20 minutes after being ordered, a tiny pizza that barely feeds one, they ask me if I'd like to order something else. Yeah right! Then I'd have to wait ANOTHER 15-20 minutes, which by then my husband would be done with eating his food already, which I'd have to end up eating alone and making him wait for me to finish, so I said forget it. We pretty much ended up sharing this stupid tiny pizza and still felt starved afterwards. Do yourself a favor and skip this place when you're in SF. We were better off eating at In N Out instead. Oh yeah, their pizzas are also soaked in grease and falls apart when we pick it up to eat. You can't even eat it properly.

Ordered a meat ball sandwich and ran out of meatballs, on a 3pm on a Saturday. The guy cooking pizzas was drinking and eating at the same time he plunked the pizzas in the oven. Got a sausage sandwich that was disgusting , microwaved marinara sauce and poured all over the bread. Then some burger which they claim was angus beef, no way in hell. It was definitely frozen and ground and weeks old. Never coming back here again.

From out of town and didn't even get to eat or experience full service here.  I stayed at the Holiday Inn, a block away from this place.  First time we walked in, it was later at night and it was really busy, but no one cared to seat us.  Okay, no problem, we thought, they're just really busy.  We tried going in another day around noon.  The doors were wide open and there's this guy who's just sitting at a table and talking on his phone, no customers.  When we asked if we just seat ourselves, he rudely tells us they aren't open.  I guess it wasn't important enough for him to stop his phone conversation to let us know as we walked through the wide open doors. And it was noon - why aren't you open for lunch especially with your doors wide open?! So for the rest of our stay, we just avoided this place.

Wow. Just wow.  I purchased a Groupon which clearly states just to present it to this place and order. The woman behind the counter was BEYOND rude. She insisted I pay taxes on the groupon. As a consumer I've NEVER had to pay taxes on a groupon. It's ALWAYS included. She said I couldn't make substitutes when the groupon stated that I could. NEVER WILL I EVER VISIT THIS ESTABLISHMENT.
$33 for a large pizza. Check the wall they have a 62/100 on their health code. It's below satisfactory at "poor" and on the report the agent underlined "use of toxic substances".
Horrible we were seated watching the tv and one of the workers kicked us out for not ordering fast enough when we walked in he seemed eery and unfriendly horrible...
I walked in expecting to order a slice. FYI - they dont do slices.

This is the worst pizza ever. It's totally soggy and just came out of the oven. The cook was talking to another employee while watching football. The place is dirty. He was touching blinds and tables and then going in touching tomatoes on pizza. Gross. The health dept needs to make an unexpected visit.

Today we drove an hour to stop here to eat pizza on the way to a museum.  We asked for a quarter of it to be pepperoni for our son and they said sure.  The pizza was under cooked and most of it was pepperoni on it. The server asked if it was okay and said they could remake it which we agreed to that. The server talked to the cook who was watching football at the time since we were the only people in there at noon.  He argued with the server  loudly about how he wasn't going to do it.  We decided to leave and pay for drinks.  We make a remark about why we were leaving and the cook just arged and when I made a comment the gentleman rudely told me that he was talking to my husband and he wouldn't look at me and from his comment and his mannerism it was telling he wouldn't because I was a female.  Never been so insulted by a anyone.  He didn't care and funny thing is they didn't care that they were empty at noon on a busy weekend.   We have loved this place in the past but I will not go back of this guy is working but looking at the reviews I don't think they care.  Best advice go across the street to the pizza by slice.  Very good service

Service was a bit slow but pizza came out fast. We came early evening and the owner refused to close the door because he doesn't have an open sign so he probably wanted it to be more welcoming but all the customers including the waitress was wearing jackets and scarfs. Pizza was good and the topping generous but it wasn't as spectacular for the price. I rate it on the dough and the dough was something you can get at a fast food greasy diner place considering we paid $28 for a medium three topping pizza. If you want to come for a sports game they have two TVs on each end of the restaurant but it's not much of a sports bar atmosphere. Not sure what ambience they want to set ....

Based on previous reviews it seems like this place is a hit or miss. I came here with a group of 6 people around midnight on a Saturday. The service wasn't as bad as others have stated, but who knows since I'm not a regular here.  The restroom situation is a bit challenging since it's outside and down some steps in a hallway. The code that we were given didn't work and thankfully there was a restroom attended cleaning that allowed us in.
Service, eh. Drink was small and it was 2.70! Plus dollar refills! Wtf! I can only imagine the pizza. Shit. Better come with a massage! Overrated already!
Where do I begin?

The pizza is made pretty quickly, so if speed is more important than quality, then this place will be great for you. Otherwise, I'd pass. The crust is good, but the ingredients are sparse. For the money I've done much better.

The SERVICE WAS OUTSTANDING!!! Our waitress was this little strawberry blond girl, she was delightful and on top of things! The city that we live in needs to take note of how to treat customers! The pizza was good and we would go there again!
No ice with the iced tea, service was crappy, pizza was crappier.

they need to shut this place down! the lady was all in my face when she was the one who got my food wrong!! this lady was out of her mind. I will be calling the manger tomorrow!! im so upset with how she treats costumers there was a family that had to bring the cops there when I was eating NOW I SEE WHY please dont eat here!
The Spaghetti was Great, I rdered a Small Pizza with Peporonni & Extra Jalapenos. The Pizza was great, thin crust, and ther where not shy with the Jalapenos..

i visited thisplace on saturday May 18, 2013 and the service was horrible.  It was my wife, my in laws, and my dughter of 13, daughter of 10 and my 10 month old baby. They counted my 10 month old baby as a person and charged me $15 as service charge for a party of 7.  I argued with the asian young lady about this and she did not even care.  I advised her that my son does not eat pizza or pasta at his age and she could care less.  To be honest, this service, thise fraud ruined my evening and trip.  I have been upset about this and i will file a complaint with consumer affairs.
Expensive pizza, taste ok at very best. No bathroom, you have to leave the store, walk down the street to use a very dirty restroom.  Look somewhere else for food.
Service was okay, however the pizza was very "dough-y" and I didn't enjoy it. However, it was the first pizza place we saw!

Ok, I'm going to be very bitter in this review. I ordered a burger, my friend ordered fish and chips. My burger took at least 25 minutes to arrive and it came well after my friend's fish and chips. The fish was slimey and some of it was raw.

This place was great. We were staying two blocks away and wanted good, quick pizza. The calamari was huge, the pizza was delicious, and the staff was really friendly. We fed two adults and three kids for about $50, compared to $250 at the other restaurants close by. It's not fancy, but the pizza was delicious.

I don't know why the low rating, but I figure it's because SF tends to have really high expectations from their restaurants. Anyway, pizza was pretty darn good, but then I was also pretty darn hungry.
This place is not what I expected. I bought a groupon for my birthday. The only thing good about this place was the fried calamari. Not the italian that I am used to. Not very happy.
I am a North Beach local and the best Italian restaurant I frequent is Volare.

The food was yummy, excellent service. We will sure come back again. The calamari was the best tasting I have ever had. Very fresh and delicate. The veal and scampi were tasty. We had tiramisu and panna cotta for desert and they were fresh and delicious.
Love their food, carpaccio is excellent, ambience is nice, price is good, we spent $90.00 for 2 meals, a glass of wine, appetizer but overall this restaurant is good.

This is one of my most favorite restaurants, ever. I wish it were closer and more convenient. Every time I go up to the City, I stop here. It is the most authentic Italian food, I've ever had. The gnocchi with the bolognese sauce is my favorite. But I've also had the lasagna, which was yummy. The regular gnocchi, and I've tried a few other pasta dishes. You honestly can't go wrong here, I love it and I love the staff!

Went here with a groupon which got us an appetizer, pasta and dessert. Everything that we ordered was mediocre at best -- I am not really sure they made their own "handmade pastas" since they didn't taste fresh. The real reason I am taking the time to write this review is to say DO NOT ORDER THE CANNOLI. It was literally the most disgusting dessert we've ever had.
