Either the filling was supposed to have a tinge of acid (lemon), or it was so old that the cream filling had spoiled --- it tasted like the latter and please do not order it if you want to end your meal without having to go to the local gelateria near by to cleanse your palette. There are admittedly a number of Italian options in this area but none have been great in our experience, thus far. This place is like the rest -- overpriced and underwhelming.

Delicious food! The appetizers are a bit small, nothing to write home about, but the main dishes are amazing! Definitely go with the cioppino. The service is also wonderful and the place has a very mellow family vibe. All in all a good experience.

Casual atmosphere. Menu is seafood and fresh pasta centric. The sweet chewy bread served up front w oil & vinegar was great enough to make a meal! Enjoyed the fresh spinach salad, nicely dressed. The Cioppino was beautifully presented in a glass bowl. Nicely spicy tomato broth. The whole dish was slightly overlooked but on balance nicely done.  A very dry house Chianti topped it off- Nice!

I have to admit, I'm surprised to read the less than appealing responses; my friend and I had such a wonderfully memorable dinner here last night.  As others have mentioned, we were greeted with the bruschetta at the door when deciding whether or not their menu fit our taste.  The bruschetta was delicious, so in we went.  We split a bottle of the house red which (not being an avid wine drinker) exceeded our expectations of a typical house red; had more depth to it.  We were provided a basket of warm fluffy bread with olive oil and balsamic for dipping as well as herbed olives.  I typically don't eat olives but managed to put away half of what was provided.  We ordered the bruschetta (wanted more of the deliciousness we'd just had), and decided to share the homemade pasta in pink sauce with salmon and the seared salmon entree (both of us love salmon, can you tell?). The salmon entree came with rosemary potatoes and an eggplant ratatouille type side.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and had this delicious sear to it that my friend declared was the best salmon she's had.  The pink sauce pasta and salmon was also delicious with generous portions of fresh, well-cooked salmon. The sauce was rich and had a lovely flavor profile of delicate tomatoes and cream.  Sounds like an odd mixture, but it is delicious!

I was a little worried to visit Volare Trattoria when I read some of the reviews. I had purchased a Groupon awhile ago to the restaurant, but it had expired. My family and I went to Volare trattoria to just use the face value of the groupon.

Used a groupon to eat here once. Ordered 2 sets of cioppino. Salad was okay. The cioppino was good. Also had wine. Overall food is not bad. That's why I gave it 2 star instead. Seems like if you aren't their type of customers they don't treat you good. Out service was not good at all. Nobody wanted to seat us for 5 minutes. Asked for water twice. No recommendations. Very ride when we mentioned the groupon.

My wife and I had dinner here on a Sunday some time last month. From my observation (tables around us), most people came here because they've bought the deal on Groupon (so did I). The server had forgotten to bring us bread and we had to ask for it. The bread was hard and stale. The fried calamari appetizer was under seasoned. I ordered cioppino. There were a couple small pieces of salmon in my soup and the scallops were smaller than the size of a dime. Wife ordered the grilled salmon and it was served with some cold eggplant - didn't like it. As for dessert, we ordered the tri-color ice cream/ spumoni. It was more like a two scoops of ice cream cos all we could only taste the strawberry and chocolate flavors. It was definitely not a spumoni and did not come in vanilla, gianduia and mango-sorbet flavors as stated on the online menu on Yelp.

The groupon for this place is an obvious scam. When you buy it they say your salads will be of a value up to $16. Um.. the salads we got were simple greens. The Cioppino online is listed as 23ish dollars on most menus I could find, but in the restaurant they list it as 29. The wine is cheap. So, for the $40 groupon plus tax and tip - which they reccomend you pay at an estimated value of over $90 worth (LOL!), you definitely do not get your money's worth let alone a good deal. This is my definition of a scam. My partner didn't have a claw in his cioppino but I did.... not that it mattered. It was like picking out crab claw from soup... with your hands. Hella messy. I was not given a cracking device for the crab legs until I asked someone walking by because the waiter was not very attentive. The ambience is pretty tacky too. I just want to be like yo!, step it up a notch people! This is not the first time I have purchased a groupon for food and been totally let down. Seems to me this restaurant is desperate.
Got seated quickly and food arrived quickly. Food was very average; there are much better Italian spots in North Beach. And our server was actually one of the rudest servers I've ever had.

Consistently deliver quality food and service.   Pizza, pasta, salads, wine . Desserts and coffee too, as you would expect. All fresh. All good. There are more trendy and hip places along Columbus, but don't be fooled.  Volare's  is old school and a little well worn, but the quality and service and price point makes this a top choice for Italian in North beach .

after ordering the waiter lost all interest in us. it took 10 minutes and a reminder to get the wine and water (and some bread). after being in the us for almost 2 weeks, being served without the overwhelming friendliness of american waiters, it was as if we were back in germany, in the service-desert as we call it half jokingly.

It was easy to make reservations a few days in advanced for 5:30pm, unfortunately we were all late. We called and they were accommodating. The downside was they wouldn't seat us until we were all over, but that's okay.

Don't write reviews very often, but felt I had to do this one.  Below average food, below average service, below average wines by the glass, highly overpriced.  I think we got "touristed".  Would never go back there again - stay away.  Should have realized it wasn't very good when it was the only place on Columbus in North Beach that had any seating at 7:30 on Sat. nite.  Live and learn.
Went for dinner last night with a reservation using a Groupon.
came here with a groupon and would come only with a groupon.

So went in the other day it was kinda slow I had a groupon  and decided to check it out.   Food was ok but when I got my bill the waiter added gratuity of 5.31$ umm where did that come from. So I didn't say anything since I would have given more but it was late. I definitely won't be going back and I kinda think that is illegal. I was a party of one and gratuity is something you earn not just expect.
Just finished the most wonderful meal at my new most-favorite restaurant! There were eight of us - and we had the groupon deal for six: amazing value - so we got to try a lot of things.
NOTE: We went here about a month ago.

What lured us into Volate Trattoria was the kind gentleman standing in front one sunny afternoon who observed us looking at their menu that was posted on the door. He kindly interjected and told us what their specials were that day. We listened and pondered if we wanted Italian or not... I asked the gentleman if they had caprese salads there, and he confirmed with a smile. I opened the door for my boyfriend and we took a seat.

The food was really delicious.  The lasagna is really outstanding.  The pasta in the lasagna was perfect and the sauce could not have been better.  Then it goes down hill.  There was no bar back.  No bourbon or any kind.  No Bombay Gin. Empty bottles decorated the shelves.  The waiters and bar tender argued constantly.  We were sitting at the bar.  Very, very unpleasant.  We will not be back. Other places offer delicious food and help you enjoy you evening.

So lovely! We used the groupon and got GREAT service, really light n tasty calamari, eggplant Parmesan and the cute little cannolis. Everything was real satisfying, including the complimentary olives. Oh jah, mama likey.
We went here tonight with a groupon coupon. The service was excellent. They knew we had the coupon too. The food excellent. We had the veal saltamboca, chic Marsala, lemony chic dish and gnocchi.

This is an excellent place to stop if you are in the North Beach area.  The Brushetta is loaded with fresh ingredients.  The pasta dishes were all cooked to perfection.  The service was attentive and the establishment is one of the more Groupon friendly with the exception of limiting dessert choices for Groupn users ( ie no cheesecake offered)

Never been here before but came because of Groupon. Hey, it worked, we'll go back. They never blinked an eye about using it and the waiter, Nico, was the best!!! He made suggestions for the meal and wine which were spot on. The food was great, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was pleasant.

We went there on a nice day for some drinks and apps. While the service was actually pretty decent, we were very disappointed with what we ordered, and the drinks were over priced. The prosciutto e melone was not very appetizing. The melon was very cold, not ripe, and crunchy. The bed of arugula that was advertised on the menu was just lettuce. It goes against everything Italian that I know. If it's not in season and delicious, then don't serve it!

Good and bad. The food was incredibly tasty. The owner warmly welcomed us in as we looked at the menu outside. Our server Rai is who failed. He messed up my daughter's order (he didn't write anything down). He offered two of us parmesan and only one of us cracked pepper. We asked for more bread which he didn't bring. I asked for more parm for my daughter and he sat it on the table and put his hands in the air. He came up when we were done eating and said, "So you're ready for the check"? We would have gladly had dessert and coffee had it been offered. He brought the check and within 2 min came back to process it. We hadn't even had a chance to get our wallets out! We only left a little over 10% which is rare for me since I've been a fine dining server for over 10 years. Weirdest  dining experience I've ever had. We really felt like Rai was annoyed with us from the time we sat down. I'm giving 3 stars because the owner was so kind and the food was INCREDIBLE! Service unfortunately failed big time.
I went here for dinner, it was pretty empty at 6:30pm on a Friday. We were immediately seated and the waiter was very friendly.

I came here over the weekend with the boyfriend because we wanted cioppino and found the Groupon deal.  The $35 deal gets you two salads, two cioppinos, and two glasses of wine.  I regret passing up on this option because we ended up getting the $29 deal instead (an appetizer, two entrees, and one dessert).

I was a little apprehensive after seeing the mixed reviews about this place, but overall it was a great experience. I went with a friend and even though we were 45 minutes late to our reservation, they were very generous about it. In addition, they reserved an earlier time for us so that we wouldn't have to wait as long.
Great gnocchi, the fettuccine was freshly made but the Alfredo sauce was a little more on the dry side. Overall really great taste & casual environment.
First lets talk about how we epically failed on forgetting to order any pasta at this place!

I went on a Groupon that included 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and 1 dessert. I was very skeptical of this place based on the negative reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised. When I called to place my reservation, they were very friendly. The waiter greeted us at the door and gave us an excellent seat by the window. He said we could order anything from the menu, even though the Groupon has limitations.
The food was excellent. We had the bissteca (which is Italian steak). My son loved his Alfredo pasta.
No.

Our waiter was friendly and accommodating which made the birthday celebration most enjoyable. We loved the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce and ravioli. The gnocchi melts in your mouth!! The eggplant appetizer anti-climatic and resembled cat food. The chocolate cake was to die for!! The restaurant has a strange old smell that can be distracting. I'm glad we used their groupon deal, would not have tried it otherwise.

Not recommended for delivery.  I ordered via GrubHub, and the estimate was 50-60 minutes.  My food arrived 2 hours later, and when I called after 60 and 90 minutes to check for an update (I was very polite), the person who answered blamed GrubHub for sending the order late.
Ordered pizza for delivery and it arrived cold. Decent enough food after heating it up but nothing spectacular.

One of the best pizzas in town. We always order Favorite with prosciutto, garlic and veggies. Although it tastes different every time, we always devour it with delight. We will be definitely back to sample more dishes.

I've been here twice and their food is delicious, the portions are good and the ingredients are fresh, the decor is a little weird ( the ceiling is full of fake dry grape leafs) other than that definitely coming back

Ordered the "Viva" Pizza for home delivery...it showed up with just pepperoni...that's like ordering a Big Mac and you got just bun and patty, but by the time you've realized this, you're too far from the cashier to complain...not cool

For being the first time in SF, eating at this restaurant was amazing! It may be a bit deceiving if the restaurant is empty, its the complete opposite. I ordered the Tortellini with the 3 cheese sauces. Let me tell you, that was to die for! If I were to be able to eat a second plate, I would !!!l haha

This was a delicious pizza! We had the one called The Favorite which had prosciutto, tomatoes, onion, and artichoke hearts. The bread was crispy, still yet soft inside. The sauce was very delicious, and zangy. We had a glass of cabernet which was pretty decent actually. Parking is very challenging in this neighborhood for the most part, so good luck to you. The waiter was slightly pushy about taking our order; he came back to take our order like twice in 5 minutes while we studied the menu. I think our bill was about $25.00. Great pizza!

This place leaves a bad taste in my mouth, one that can only be matched by the borderline horrendous food they serve. I tried this restaurant out of wanting to get a bite after a long day of walking. First off, I doubt the owners are Italian. I'm part Italian and was mostly raised in an Italian household, so I know how Italian food is made and tastes. Viva did not cut it for me.

The worst Italian food I have ever had. I ordered the chicken pasta to be on the safe side, but the pasta sauce and chicken were extremely bland. I also tasted the eggplant parmesan and cheese ravioli, both of which tasted awful. These latter two dishes are some of my favorites at other, decent Italian restaurants too. Don't let the nice sitting space fool you.  Avoid at all costs.

The staff seemed irritated and annoyed by my girlfriend's and my presence. The Caprese Salad was a mess. The tomatoes were hard like apples and the mozzarella shouldn't have been allowed to be called cheese. It was rubber city. The pasta was terribly weak. The sauce bland. The dishes seemed microwaved. The place mats were essentially parchment paper with grease stains from the previous customers. So basically you could say it was a pretty crummy experience. With all the amazing food in San Fran, you simply must pass on this restaurant.

We picked this place as our usual spot was not open due to a private party they were hosting. The salad was ok but the lasagna and the chicken cacciatore was excellent probably the best I've had to be honest. Service was ok and considering that the place is located on a main busy street you see people and hear a lot noise, we were used to it. It is located in North Beach after all.
The food was good, but not excellent. It was definitely affordable but I feel like I could get better quality for my money at another restaurant on Columbus.

No starter(s), but my entree, P.B.S., pesto, broccoli, spinach, garlic, green onions was very tasty. Tiny bit oily, but tasty. My other half got the Chicken Risotto. He thought it was "o.k." Service was fine, decor a little odd.
The red and white sauces tasted like it was a from a can. This place is cheaper but for a few bucks more, I recommend other places.

Ymmm lunch time lamb chop I allway order this it favor and the service is very good and other than that it's not crowded it right now and I have try everything on the menu the best chocolate mousse ice cream dessert is so ymm give it a try will it warm an nice day hope all of have good afternoon an get home nice an safe
Been there probably 6 times. Once was so-so. The rest were great. This is not a Michelin 5-Star, it is a quaint neighborhood Italian restaurant with very good food that is reasonably priced.
Incredible four cheese pizza......and people, if you love a good mediterranean salad the you MUST go here for one....wow!
We really liked this place. Friendly and fast service and very tasty food. I thought the house Cabernet was good as well. We had a good experience.

DO NOT GO HERE WHATEVER YOU DO! We ordered food from here and can't even believe they had the nerve to serve this nasty stuff.  You've got to try really hard to make pasta taste like dog doo. The noodles were cooked days too long. I would have preferred can sauce over this flavorless "sauce." We were really hung over and honestly just about anything would have tasted good. We had to throw it away, we couldn't touch it. It was that bad. We called Eat24 (the place that delivered it) and they called the restaurant. The restaurant had the nerve to offer us FIVE dollars off our next order. You would have to pay me 100's of dollars to ever order that stuff again. I told Eat24 this and they said they would throw on another 5 bucks. HELLO, WHY WOULD I WANT MONEY TO GARBAGE!?  Ugh, I got ripped off. Don't go here. If it's bad when you're hung over, it's got to be AWFUL when you're feeling fine.

The pasta pescatore was probably the best I've ever had. Fresh salmon, muscles, clams, calamari and shrimp (I think I named them all), cooked perfectly, along with a great tomato cream sauce. Overall, amazing. Oh and it was big enough for two people and less than $20! ($17.95) can't beat that. I will definitely come again and would also recommend the the tiramisu, very good.
Meh. I neither hate nor love Viva...it just doesn't live up to the better spots in NB.

I have tried a bunch of Viva's pizzas and pastas and I now understand why this place has a solid three star ranking on Yelp - it's just smack in the middle of the spectrum of mediocrity. None of their items are particularly great, and yet, none are truly terrible to justify anything other than 3 stars.

Really nice place, good atmosphere, cheap food and drink, including daily specials. The food is very good, not amazing, but very good bang for your buck. We've come back many times and brought friends.
I still have dreams about this restaurant.

I had a horrible experience with delivery here. I accidentally got the address wrong for my order. I called and gave them the new address, my pizza came THREE HOURS later!! I tried to call and cancel before then but the owner told me he was not at fault because they had already tried to deliver. When the pizza finally arrived I found out they had purposely pursued other deliverys from people who had called in well after me with orders, so rude and unprofessional! Everyone makes mistakes, I didn't purposely mean to put in the wrong address but I felt like I had been punished for it. Even after my apologizing, the delivery guy threw the box on the table and evily muttered "enjoy your COLD pizza.."
This post bar crawl pizza really hit the spot. Quick service, totally yummy and they even had ranch dressing! Sweet!

The staff was friendly, the house wine was a value, the food was pretty good.  Chicken piccata was good but a bit too much lemon.  My husband ordered a meatball on the side, and it was dry with no sauce or anything.  The salads could use a tad more dressing.  Otherwise, everyone enjoyed the food, and it was a good place to stop without reading reviews first.

After over a decade of going here I still don't think I've had the pizza, but I pretty much always leave with a smile on my face, even after a hard day. I love all the appetizers & I've tried half the pastas, and it's the only place I drink Chablis! :)

I've never had a bad meal here.  I don't go to North Beach often, but when I do, I try to eat dinner here.  I've ordered everything from the baked ziti to pizza to eggplant parmesan; they were all delicious!  Plus, the portions are huge and the prices are fantastic.  I also enjoy the bread too.  Furthermore, the servers are nice and attentive.    I have no complaints.
This sucks and I hate to re-edit my review again.

If you want REAL Italian food from REAL Italian Restaurant while you're in San Francisco, you have to go here. Servings are large. Food is tasty. Get the garlic appitizer of roasted garlic cloves. They are soft and spread like butter. So good. If the fake vines hanging from the ceiling from the chicken wire doesn't show you that this hole in the wall, that's been there for OVER 25 YEARS isn't real, nothing will. Not fancy. You won't impress your first date here. But you will impress your friends that you found this hole in the wall restaurant with the great pizza and great pasta.

This place is awesome!  If you're looking for a solid option for traditional Italian food in North Beach.  Plus the price is on average 3-4 dollars cheaper on average than the surrounding restaurants.

Went there for lunch. Excellent pasta & great sauce. Excellent service & good quality for low price in comparison to other local restaurants. I wanted lunch & lunch prices. Other restaurants only had dinner prices. Very pleased with our selection.

We ordered delivery from here and it was seriously inedible. The pasta was so over cooked it was like mush. The sauce on both dishes didn't have flavor at all. The chicken was too scary to try. We couldn't eat any of it. The pop was the only good thing. I literally just threw away 60 bucks.
Pros:  two small pizzas, soda and an appetizer for about $30.  So lots of food.  Big glass front where you can sit at the table and people watch.

Oh dear. All of the good places were 2+ hrs wait. We should have gone to a grocery store and picked up a wrap. Instead we ate here. Big mistake. Unequivocally, the worst professionally-prepared food I've ever eaten. Our waitress was friendly. The wine tasted watered down. The pizza was burnt, and disgusting. We would have complained, but we're British, so we soldiered on, stoically.

Stopped in after walking by. The place looked nice so we gave it a try. Service was great and had multiple people checking in on us throughout the meal. Food was very good. Lots of leftovers. Good portion sizes.

Two star for friendly service and yummy shrimp alfredo fettucini a friend got, I went with the chicken primavera with red sauce I hated mine but loved my friends food. The girls were nice but would not recommend and won't be back.
Felt like having pizza, but then saw the calzone on the menu, so ordered the small (12").

I've come to Vivia a handful of times over the last few years. Every time I come, I always have a lovely experience. The staff is attentive and friendly. The food is absolutely delicious, and the value is great!
No. Parklets are just plain stupid.
Sad that the parking spaces are being privatized for the benefit of elite local businesses. This has also been done in a secretive fashion  --  with no proper notification to neighbors.

Check out this wonderful new public space in North Beach!  The Columbus Street Parklet #1 has benches, café seating and landscaping at this, the City's third Parklet project. Bamboo used for the surface decking is an environmentally friendly renewable resource and all landscaping used are low-water species. Café Greco has agreed to provide daily maintenance, although all seating is free and open to the public.
The family and I recently spent three days in San Francisco. The main reason we chose SF was the food. We love seafood!

Try to avoid this Holiday Inn restaurant..  Decided to take a chance in here today (just was tired of the rain and we were staying here) with my kids.  We thought we were on MTV's Boiling Point or Food Network's Chef Wanted -- 'cause the dinner service sucked (the weather did too so I was patient tonight).  Would have given less than 1 star but manager comped our entire meal, so 1.5 stars.

Definitely stay away from this one! Rude staff, terrible drinks. The prices would be reasonable if the drinks weren't tiny and light handed. My drink was supposed to be shaken according to the menu but was poorly blended leaving my tiny cup mostly full of ice.

So I brought my three kids along with me while traveling on business, I thought I'd take up the "kids eat free" offer by the hotel restaurant downstairs. I don't know which had less personality, the food or the waiter. The waiter literally walked up to our table and proceeded to ask us what we wanted with no introduction or welcoming phrase whatsoever. His personality was as dry as the Mohave desert. Ordered the buffalo wings, which were just as dry. When we asked for more sauce, he wasn't shy to tell us that they come frozen and pre-packaged with that amount of sauce. I couldn't believe we just paid $10 for 5 dry skimpy chicken wings.

There was a time when the quality of the nightly seafood buffet in this Holiday Inn dining room was such that it ranked among the better eateries in the Wharf area. Over the years, however, it has deteriorated into a hit-or-miss proposition - there are times when its sins are venial and easily forgiven, others when no amount of penance will make things right. If the fish isn't fresh, extra seasoning or lots of melted butter won't disguise its age. Their downward slide has brought them to a level where, with so many outstanding restaurants a brief walk away, there's no reason to take a chance on this one.

A good meal. I had the petrale (sole) cooked with lemon butter; sweetness had the petrale portofino (stuffed with crab). Both very tasty. It came with potato and a spinach type vegetable-kale maybe? We don't drink, but the wine list is extensive I understand. Service was a bit rushed, but our reservation was honored on time on a busy night. Seems there were important locals on the night we were there-lots of handshakes and Italian spoken. It was pricy, but not crazy pricy. I enjoyed the meal, but probably won't be back. Not because of anything bad, just not anything great.

Fantastic dining experience this evening as our work team of nine visited the North Beach Restaurant!!  Loved the 2011 Petroni Pinot Noir.  All our entrees were perfectly prepared and the service was very attentive and personal.  Treat yourself and friends to a special meal here.

This place is a fantastically convenient location for a pre or post dinner if you're seeing Beach Blanket Babylon... it's a short walk from the theater and has good food. It's pricey but is almost worth it due to the proximity to the theater alone and the portions were surprisingly large. An added bonus is that they're an Italian restaurant that offers more than just pasta dishes; they had a pretty extensive menu. I had the Chicken Toscana-- good sauce and the accompanying veggies and potatoes were pretty good. Classic Italian atmosphere complete with great hosts and waiters that seem to enjoy their job. Although the food and service was good, I'm only giving 3 stars because the food wasn't anything special... It was good Italian food, but not anything unique or worth telling everyone about.

The server was Luis, amazing!! Old school professional. Great service! Food pretty good. Old school good Italian. Wine list impressive but a bit overpriced. The owner is a total D Bag. Prejudice, rude! I had an unfortunate date and had to cancel the food before it was made. The wine my date ordered wasn't touched. The owner made me pay for it. Even though he saw my date leaving and not touching it. If you want good reputation you don't do that. Let your staff do the work sir. You have no business being in customer service! Beware of the owner!

Wow, my wife and I loved our first dinner here. Service was outstanding. Appetizers were fresh and excellent. Our entrées were fabulous, one a special and one a variation  of a menu item offered to my wife when she asked questions about the menu. We will come back again next time we're in the city. I can't believe this place has such mixed reviews. Hopefully our next visit will be as good.

This is probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time! I've traveled the world lived in Italy and it is the closest thing to Italy as it gets the food is homemade everytime I come to San Francisco I try to go to North Beach restaurant several times during my stay. If you are fortunate enough to come to the beautiful city of San Francisco I highly recommend coming to North Beach restaurant for lunch or dinner and as well the staff is excellent I really have nothing bad to say only great reviews for this restaurant

There must be far better places to eat Italian food in SF.  Our appetizer plate was decent, although the veal shank was a cold terrine, which was not at all expected.  The entrees were decent.  My wife had the pasta bolognese, my friend had the osso buco, which was also good.  I had grilled lamb chops.  They were cooked fine but could have used a little sauce or juices on the plate.  The veggie was some mysterious combination of mushrooms and I'm not sure what else.  The desserts were bad.  My tiramisu tasted strongly of rum and espresso, which overpowered the dish.  The warm zabaglione was just gross, but that was my first experience with zabaglione and maybe it's supposed to taste that way.  Not an awful experience, but clearly there are better options out there.

Went there last night with friends from out of town. We selected north Beach Restaurant based on what I heard about the food. The location was easy to find. The staff for the most part was nice. Our waiter was a young man, probably only a few days on the job and this is where the experience starts to decline. We ordered one appetizer for the table and he brought three, the tiramisu was like a cold soup. It could even resemble the desert because it was so soupy. When the bill came we noticed we got charged for a Burata that was never ordered. We also got overcharged on each entry. We got charged for six when we only ordered three, charged for two prawn cocktails when we only ordered one. When we brought it to their attention, no came to apologize. all they did was grab the bill and bring back the revised bill with the Burata still on the bill. Needless to say we are not going back. With all the fine restaurants in North Beach this place should be embarrassed to identify itself as the symbol for a great neighborhood of San Francisco

I was 100% surprised. I cannot tell you how many times I have driven or walked past this restaurant only to dismiss it. From the name it's too old, too touristy and just too much of a trap. I was completely wrong.
I strongly do NOT recommend North Beach restaurant because the waiter stole from us by increasing his own tip, and because the food was mediocre and overpriced.
As a transplant from NYC, I am an Italian food snob.

This was a special occasion for my folks 50th Anniversary & even though the food was very good, they have a bit of an attitude there that was definitely a turnoff. Booey, who I think was one of the Maitre d's said he would take good care of my folks & I since it was their 50th. I bought a special bottle of wine in, which I was charged a $30 dollar corkage fee, ok that I could see with their great wine selection, but they don't do substitutes. Charged $10 dollars extra for an ordinary linguine with olive oil n garlic. Now mind you we ordered drinks at the bar as well as deserts. Nothing special was done for my folks there for their 50th, which I thought kind of sucked. The waiter we had also had no personality as well of a bit of an attitude. All I wanted was to make this a special evening for my folks since it was their 50th anniversary & it's like they could've cared less. Probably my last time ever going back tot this establishment again!!
This restaurant was chosen for my birthday dinner simply because it's one of the few places that serves Veal Parmesan by our hotel.

Came here on a recommendation. Needless to say, my experience did not meet the hype. Honestly, it is a great venue with good decor and a nice Italian environment. Average service with an Italian service who describe the special well. However as the evening went on, I began to feel rushed or ignored.

Salty, touristy and corny. My hotel suggested I go here because I wanted fresh pasta. They had fresh pasta but it was so covered in salt I couldn't taste it. Three things on their standard menu were the "specials" for the night. Wine was overpriced based on experience elsewhere and the food bill should never have been well over $200 for 2 of us. Disappointing.

The atmosphere was a bit somber for a Friday night.   Their wine list was very extensive.  Had the Pasta Della Casa, not a fan of veal, pasta was a little too firm for me.  However, the wine sauce was really good.

Over 25 yrs. this restaurant has been our five star fav. You will never miss with  it in dining, service and ambiance. This time our waiter was D---. We won't mention the name not for his service or wonderful on the mark  suuggestions. But when it came to paying  I gave him two hundreds and the billl  was $ 150. I told him to give me back $20. That would have given

Absolutely amazing food and service!! This was our first dinner while visiting in San Francisco and after it came recommended by multiple people, we decided to try it out. There was honestly not one thing we ordered that we didn't enjoy.

Do it.... GO!!! We were a bit overwhelmed with the restaurant selections in San Fran.... We just knew we wanted something local.  We met a group of locals and they all said GO to north beach!  We were lucky enough to get reservations for the next night.  The ambiance was nice, quick paced, and extreme customer service!  Then there was the food...... Omg,words can not express how delicious it was.  I had the salmon and my husband had the sole stuffed with crab & shrimp.  We both licked the plate!  Had to try the tiramisu for dessert and it happened again.... We licked our plate! :)

Not sure why they have such a low star rating. Every time I am in SF, somehow I always end up back here. Family run, stellar wine list and one of the few places a solo water can grab delicious did with great company at the bar. Never had a bad meal. Highly recommend. The owner, peter, he can hook you up with a tasting at their winery in napa. They are the only US maker of Brunello wine.

The food is great, but this restaurant is really set apart by its service. The place is pure old school charm. Every time I come here the staff goes out of their way to make me feel like I'm part of the family.

Went there last night for a friends anniversary dinner.  Surprised by the terrible service for a $$$ restaurant. The warmth was pretentious and waiters condescending. We like our food but don't need the attitude.

You'll never go wrong here.  The maître d' will welcome you with genuine warmth.  Waiters are knowledgeable, efficient and friendly -- they won't hesitate to make you a recommendation.  This place is not trendy --  it's old-fashioned Italian food, freshly made and full of flavor.  Great pasta made daily, with an assortment of sauces.  Wonderful Petrale sole from their own boat.  Delicious calamari vinaigrette and succulent caponette.   An excellent "California Brunello" from their own vineyard.  And the lightest tiramisu on earth.

First of all, the main person who took my reservation was very gracious and accommodating.  I had trouble finding the location but after calling to let him know I would be late with my date, the gentleman said, "NO PROBLEM, seniorina... "
Possibly my most favorite Italian restaurant from anywhere. Wine list fantastic. Get the Veal! Oh my.

We had dinner a few weeks ago for 6 people--We have been there many times and found the food about a B average with high prices. We had a bad experience on the corkage fee$30. For a few years the restaurant had waved the corkage fee if a customer brought in Petroni Wines the former owner's  winery. At dinner after Lorenzo's the owner's passing we were told no waver of corkage fee. When I questioned the change in policy--someone from the restaurant who indicated via email that they have been with the restaurant over 40 years and knows of no such policy ? So I guess over the past few years I was IMAGINING IT ! After this treatment--I don't think we will be going back to the North Beach Restaurant for some time. Too bad Lorenzo has passed on he was the heart and soul of the restaurant.

North Beach is the perfect example of Little Italy!  The lasagna melts in your mouth and the appetizers with the house cured prosciutto and melon are an incredible treat. Everyone at our table ate every bite and was still raving about it this morning! This is always the first dinner we have when in San Francisco and usually the last as well! The service is over the top and the ambiance can't be matched. Enjoy!

Wonderful experience--great waiter, extremely knowledgeable and friendly and personable.   Awesome appetizer (prosciutto was superb, with tomato/mozzarella, melon), followed by lamb lollypops, and then lemon sorbet.

For the price, I was expecting incredibly delicious food.  The food was fine, nothing special.  The service was not great.  I had asked the waiter to bring a slice of cake with a candle for my partner's birthday after dinner and he didn't even get that right.   I was disappointed.

Cozy and traditional Italian restaurant. Food is great and staff is friendly and attentive. I have dined here for ten years and have brought family and friends. Highly recommended for both lunch and dinner.

You are entering the world of very authentic Italian restaurant with old traditions and very on point kitchen. From the moment you enter a very welcoming host in Italian greets you and if you speak Italian you can keep up a full conversation. Everything is perfect from a great wine list selection to appetizers  and main courses - also New Yorkers keep in mind - California is moving very slow and I find it very annoying in regular restaurant in Cali to wait for an hour to get meals. It's different here - everything is on point - the food the atmosphere and an outstanding service - must have a dinner spot in San Fran!
Outdoor tables on the sunny side of a (relatively) quiet street in North Beach makes this a pleasant, dog-friendly place to have a delicious meal and people/dog watch.

The food is amazing and never disappoints. The house cured prosciutto is amazing and you must ask to see the meats hanging in the basement. The burratta was also a nice treat. The only downside here is the wine list. Prices are across the board and have little rhyme or reason to them.
We visited for drinks and it was okay, but a tad boring.
4 of us, dinner on Saturday night.

I have two favorite restaurant in San Francisco and this one is one of them. Every time I visit SF I make it a must to eat here. I've been coming to this restaurant since 1978 when my father use to take me as a young kid. This is the first place I learned to eat escargots and I make sure to always order it as my first appetizer  each time I come.... No words can describe how delicious the food is. The waiters are excellent and so much fun. BTW, they cure their own prosciutto down in the basement. You have to try it. If you come here ask the waiter to give you a quick tour downstairs you're going to love it.
Needs some updating with the decor, but the food is some of the best Italian I've had in San Francisco. Great service and very accommodating!

Great place. This is the kind of old-school Italian place we've been looking for, which we've had trouble finding anywhere else. When you walk in and the waiter has a great Italian accent, that's definitely good sign.

Came here for my boyfriends' graduation and loved it! We had so much food that night and it was all very lovely. The servers were extremely nice, I loved that one of the servers really wanted to get a good picture of all of us and kept changing the lighting to make our pictures look good. I'm definitely planning on coming back!
The North Beach Restaurant is like having sex in the back of a Rolls Royce with the valet of Bertram Wilberforce Wooster seated beside holding a tray with The Macallan.
*_disclaimer_: this place has closed.*
"Hmm, I'll take a burrito... Oh, take forever and make the burrito awful as well please."
This is an example of something that would be the greatest place on the planet if in Fells Point and would get three stars in the Mission.

A disgusting spot in SF I have ever had. Horrible, bland and expensive food with a terrible staff that are yelling over your head and while they are serving you. And when you see the chefs, you will get even more disgusted. Restaurant is unsanitary, a big bowl of cheese is passed around the entire store for customers to add on their food. Everyone breathing on it and touching the same spoon and it sits on the side without being covered. This place needs to be shut down.
Delicious pizza

What a great idea, offer free glass of wine  by the hostess that is standing out front telling us to come inside and grab a bite to eat.  The server brought a glass of wine and some bruschetta. I really enjoyed the complimentary appetizers.
Wow. Worst meal I've ever had in San Francisco. They gave us a plate of gummy bears for dessert. The food was bland and terrible. Least I saved money on the tip.

My sister was visiting me from out of the country and ate here while in the city.  When she told me about her experience I was very upset.  Aside from the food being served cold when they were leaving they asked the Maitre D for directions to Union Square.  He told them to walk straight up Union St and it would take them to Union Square.  Well anyone who knows the city knows that this is not true.  They got extremely lost.  They were on foot and had to hire a cab to take them back to their hotel.  I thought that this was not very nice at all.  This may be due to the fact that they complained about the food being served cold. Anyways we would not recommend this restaurant at all.

I wish I could have enjoyed my experience here better. The pasta (I ordered the seafood) was something I could have made better hungover. The tomato sauce was super watered down and the portions were tiny for the price. Sadface.

Hey, I won't deny it. The place is a bit kitschy.  The hodgepodge of statutes and replicas of other famous Italian artifacts make this place look like it's trying too hard. But then, you walk in and you are pleasantly surprised that they aren't trying to hit you over the head with Italy, it's all over the top with humor, love of the homeland and unabashed pride. So who cares if it's a little kitschy. They're not trying to be the new next thing or anything that they are not.  And when you take a bite of their homemade tiramisu all is quickly forgiven.

We were visiting San Francisco and wanted Italian, so walked up Columbus looking for a good place. We were lured into Michaelangelos from a guy outside, and though we had our doubts due to this and due to it being really empty, we went here for dinner. Although the waiter tried to make it seem that he was giving us special appetizers "on the house", it was very obvious that they gave the same free appetizers to everyone. However, free bruschetta, olives, and a bigass bread basket is still totally worth it! Our meals were delicious too - amazing tortellini and spaghetti with seafood. One of the servers was the owner, which was impressive, everyone was very attentive. Then, we ordered a tortufo that was HUGE and also got free cookies and gummy bears. Delicious! And for an amazingly low price!! We loved the food, service, free apps, and ambiance. Would come back again!

Two of us went after ckg online reviews.We were not disappointed. Small quaint place with cool artwork - copies of Michelangelo's famous pieces. All seats have wonderful view of Washington Pk and Coit Tower.  We joked that it was like being in Italy across from a grassy piazza and the Pisa Tower. The service was outstanding, efficient, and friendly, going out of their way to please. I always order veal when I see it on a menu, and had the veal saltimbocca which was OH! so tender and plentiful accompanied by potatoes cooked like I'd never seen before but delish! Enjoyed a btl of wine and free bread with olives, bruschetta, cookies and gummy bears! Prices are excellent! We may return again this visit (so much great stuff on the menu to try); if not, it's on our list of places to go whenever we're in town!

ZERO, ZERO, ZERO, ZERO, ZERO. I would never return. We went despite the fact that it was pretty empty. Our first mistake. Our server treated us like the building was burning down and he needed to serve everything as fast as possible to collect our dinner fee. We ordered multiple appetizers but were only served one. We assumed that they would at least take these expensive items off the bill but they brought us a very expensive bill for sub-par food. We had to have them correct the mistake. The calimari was hardly cooked and inedible. When one of our party asked to have her untouched pasta boxed up, the server instead threw it away! When 10 mins after we settled the bill, I still had not received the leftovers, I inquired as to where they were, the Manager insisted that he was very sorry and would make a whole new dish! We waited and waited AND WAITED for the dish. When it finally came it was literally 1/8 the size of the original pasta dish.  Terrible service, terrible food and very expensive.

My friend and I were searching the streets for some good Italian food at a reasonable price and wandered by Michaelangelo's. After a warm invitation from the manager Tony, we ventured in and had a delicious meal, served with yummy bread, and a taste of their bruschetta. I would definetely come back for their authentic food and good service.
Food got funny taste to it kind of like soap. My gf order the chicken parmigiana. She did not like it at all. I taste my gf chicken parmigiana it had a funny taste to it. I Would not eat it.
If only the food was as half good as the sales person getting you through the front door...

Tourist trap ...What do you expect if they hustle you in. .. followed test of por group against better instinct and had all my fears materialize: cheap may house wine, old bread, tasteless pata with cold scallops, mini portion for the milanese chicken. We had been promised no-pay if we didn't like the food but had eaten too much of it, basically because I didn't believe in that drivel anyhow. Lesión learned and confirmed. ... There are so many other great looking places around where we could have spent les money for better food.

Walking through San Fran on a Friday night with a large party (13 adults and 1 child in a stroller) we were wooed by Tony at the door of this smallish restaurant. He said he could accommodate our group immediately AND HE DID! We were in and sitting in 5 minutes.

Does not earn a single star but required to post. Tried this restaurant with a groupon so we were mot sure what we get but... Italian restaurant with the obligatory olive oil for dipping, however, as I was dipping and eating my bread I noted that the bottomed the olive oil container looked cloudy. Picked up the bottle looked at it from the bottom then tipped it but could not get a clear view so used a piece of bread and gross-  mold in the oil. The table next to us. .. same.  Disgusting!  We told one if the wait staff who took the bottle and never came back, we told our waiter and he did not seem to understand English suddenly.  All I'm dying is IF you are dirty enough to leave something like that in plain view then I am super concerned about other issues that may be worse or even dangerous. Stay away.

If you are thinking of buying the Groupon for this place=DON'T. The guy at the door hustles you in (of course) tells you that it's the best food in North Beach. So my girlfriend and I are starting to eat our (not the best) bread, with the olive oil and balsamic supplied at the table. After eating a few pieces I happened to focus on the bottle of oil and noticed something on the bottom. It was large chunks of mold! When I showed this one waitress she just kind of shrugged it off and removed bottle. The other table next to us appeared to have the same issue, had a hard time not pointing it out to the people eating the bread.

If you are the kind of person who expects to be waited on hand and foot and is hella picky about service from an American point of view (i.e. a waiter at your table every ten minutes interrupting your conversation to make sure "everything is fine"), this is not your kind of restaurant. If you are looking for a hole in the wall Italian restaurant with great food, bread on the table, and an overall warm, delicious culinary experience at a reasonable price for the quality of the food, do yourself a favor and come here for dinner on a weekday. The place is not packed, the food will make you happy, and you will leave with a smile on your face. Also, complimentary marinated olives, red wine, and gummi bears. Can't wait to go back!

Ugh. Not another bad experience! The fried calamari appetizer was lukewarm. The Caesar salad was bland, how do you screw up Caesar salad?! I need to know.. The gnocchi was undercooked and the sauce in which it was drowned was supposed to be pesto? It didn't taste like it at all. I noticed the guy next to us took a few bites of his and didn't seem to like it either. I hate to admit but I was suckered in by the guy in the ponytail too, I should have known better. I need to know.. Don't order the steak! Omg. I can't even put words together. I will say that the waiter was nice and sweet, I took a liking to him maybe because he looked like  a homeless Marc Anthony. I need to know...tell me baby girl cuz I need to know...

The service was great and one of the reasons we went in. The free bread was great and had a good taste. However the ravioli tasted like they were bought in a supermarket and not even fully cooked. Very disappointing. The sauce was fantastic but couldn't make up for what was missing. The pizza my friends ordered looked very small for the prize but didn't taste too bad. The place itself was nice and had the World Cup on which u enjoyed. They did seem weirded out that we didn't order anything but the pizza and ravioli. Maybe they are not used to poor college students? Not my first choice but it was fine that one time.
Food was medicore-service was quite UNattentive. Not worthy of recommending other than the complimentary brischetta.

We walked past four times on walking tours and during exploration of North Beach and each time a nice young lady greeted us with a smile and a hello.  My wife decided if she was nice again, we were stopping.  Persistence paid off and the fifth time was the charm.  Food was quite good.  Service and personal experience was better.  We were served by Sal, the owner, and he was great.  The door guy was friendly too without being pushy.  Having lived near NYC for years, we knew the Little Italy experience there and there's so much pushy upselling to get you in the door.  This was not the case at Michelangelo's.  We got all the goodies others have written about.  Complimentary bruschetta that my wife went nuts over.  Gummy bears and cookies at the end of the meal.  We were even treated to a complimentary tiramisu that was delicious.  Sal told us about the business, the ups and downs, the story behind the gummy bears, and we just felt like guests and not just another table. I'm sure there are other places with similar food in North Beach but we won't need to go further up the hill if and when we are back in San Fran.  Sal and the door man shook my hand on the way out and thanked us for the visit.  Wife had the veal, I had the pollo valdostana and we were both very happy with the quality and size of the plates.  Overall a great experience at Michelangelo's with great service and attention to detail.

Came here for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised. The hostess was friendly and attentive. Olives, bread and oil were served as I waited for my meal. I had the special carbonara which was a delicious, generous serve. I would definitely recommend.
Great food and they gave us a free appetizer and haribo gummibears for dessert. Would definitely visit again.

Came in with a groupon and we were not impressed.  The veal saltimbocca was small and had a funny flavor and the Veal Marsala tasted off too.  Expected more since we are in North Beach.  The service was good and they were good to our kids and split their gnocchi.  The creme brûlée was great and highlight of the meal.

Got lured in as well...even being on expenses. The house wine was very drinkable.  Service friendly and good.  Had the lamb chop special- nice quality on the meat...I'm from the midwest and pretty particular about the chewiness.  All in all a very enjoyable meal.

I have my favorite Italian Restaurant (Enzo's) here at home in Portland, Oregon and I would have to say that Michelangelo's is my favorite in San Francisco.  Granted, I have not tried any others, but I like to go where I know the food will be delicious.  This was our second time in a span of about 7 months. The Tiramisu is divine and the complementary Amaretto Cookies and Gummy Bears are a plus.

We chose this place as a recommendation from the gelateria just up the block.  It may not be as swank or as pretty as many other of the Italian joints up and down Columbus, but Michelangelo definitely gives great value and the owner definitely knows how to hustle.  The food though was spot on.  We too received the complimentary bowl of briny olives (which is always a plus in my book) and bruschetta appetizers.  Beef carpaccio was excellent, tenderloin shaved paper-thin on the ice-cold plate, garnished with just lemon, a few capers, and shavings of nutty sweet parmigiano reggiano. I had a craving for spaghetti alle vongole, just like the kind I had on the island of Ponza so many years ago, and Michelangelo's did not disappoint.  Al dente spaghetti served in a white wine and clam nectar, some garlic, chili flakes, parsley and a generous half pound of manila clams.  She ordered the Fettucine Mari E Monti which was absolutely fabulous.  The seafood was incredibly fresh and there were some nice hunks of portabello mushrooms all melded together with that rich creamy tomato base.  The Amaretti cookies were a nice complimentary touch at the end of the meal, and the free gummy bears were humorous and somehow in their strangeness reminded me that somewhere inside of me there still lies that child who can never be too surprised.
Food was good, but the chef was a little rude when we asked if we could basically get another mug for sharing a cup of coffee.  He also seemed in a hurry to hand us the check.

It was late we just caught the showing of "Beach Blanket Babylon" enticed off the street to come in.  What amazing people that work/own this place. It was late we were the last people there and were treated like royalty!!! We shared a dinner of Pasta bolonese that was so fresh and tasted amazing!  The view of the beautiful Catholic Church all lite up in the back ground was breath taking! We had the opportunity to talk extensively with the staff who were so warm and easy going. Not at any point did we feel rushed even though they were closed! Luv luv loved this place!  Go check it out!

The host is a very nice man that persuaded us to eat there and he made our night. The food was excellent. My grandmother was from Italy and my mom uses her recipes to make dinner every night so I know real Italian food and this place has it. The service was even better than the food and the owner it's the chef who was born and raised in Italy. This place is defiantly a must try and you will want to come back.

As an Italian who grew up eating Nonna's cooking for 25 years, I am very picky when it comes to Italian cuisine. My friend and I headed to North Beach on Sunday and studied most of the restaurants along Columbus Ave before deciding on Michelangelo.

My family and I made reservations to celebrate my sisters birthday.  When we arrived they had our table ready. The service was great from the beginning to end and they were very friendly. We had a really great time there. Thank you for a great service and making it welcoming. We will be definitely coming back soon :)

These people are trippin!! Authentic everything. Spaghetti and meatballs to die for. Meat stuffed tortellini in cream sauce tasted like they made it today!! Spinach and cheese stuffed ravioli in tomato cream fabulous thank you! Custard yum Spinoni yum. My new fave place in the city!!!!

Michelangelo's is an absolutely wonderful place to take a  guest, especially an out of state guest. My husband and I took my Vermont sister to Michelangelo's and, boy, did we have a great time. We were looking for an Italian North Beach experience and we got it. The decor is intimate and the wall statues make you feel like you are in Italy. Our waiter was the restaurant's owner, a real Italian born with genuine accent. He was filling in for an absent waiter and he was tons of fun and gave us superior service. He spent lots of time talking and joking with us. When I switched my order from spaghetti and meat balls to eggplant parmigiana, he brought me a big side of the spaghetti and meat balls anyway, for no charge. They were the best meatballs! My sister's and husband's dinners were also excellent. After olives and bread, a large delicious antipasto, entrees+, dessert and the tasty house chianti, we had to take the finale gummy bears to go. We used a Groupon coupon, but it was well worth it without the coupon. We will return to this fun and delicious find!

Best food in Little Italy and phenomenal service. I was wandering looking for a place for dinner and the greeter invited me in offering a free glass of wine (red or white). When I sat down he decided to give me the best bruschetta I've ever had, on the house. I had the pappardelle which was phenomenal. All the staff have Italian accents, adding to the authenticity. One of my best dining experiences in San Francisco.

Wonderful service and food. My fiancé and I wandered into this restaurant 30 minutes to close, and the staff were all so warm and accommodating. We both had salads to start, and the food was obviously fresh and the dressings are made from scratch, even so close to closing time. The bread was also fresh and perfectly warm and cooked. We would HIGHLY recommend the crab and lobster ravioli and the tortellini. The pasta was made from scratch and the portions we perfect. All the staff are originally from Italy, and the chef Salvatore himself came to the table after we finished our meal to thank us for our patronage and to ensure we enjoyed all of our food. Massimo was our server, and personally made sure we knew a good way to walk to our hotel from the restaurant so that we would be safe. Best Italian food I've ever eaten.

I ate here on a Groupon and had a great time. I'd go back without the Groupon.  If you are looking for white linen fine dining then go elsewhere. For a clean, tasty and  reasonably priced ($15-$19 per plate) Italian dinner I really enjoyed this place. The restaurant is located right across from the park in the center of North Beach.   I called for reservations and Tony said to just come by and ask for him. I showed up a few minutes late and Tony was there to greet me on the sidewalk by name. He got me a good seat and even though I was on the Groupon he asked the chef to send out some Bruschetta for me while I waited for my fiance. This was in addition to the olives and endless bread. He then kept an eye out for her as she was arriving by bike and greeted her by name as she pulled up. We had an enjoyable bottle of Sangiovese, Ceasar, eggplant parm and a chicken dish with fontina and ham that was very good.  The white chocolate/dark chocolate dessert cup is fantastic and I'd call it a must order dessert.  At the end of the meal we were surprised with gummy bears and cookies on the house. Throughout the meal we chatted with Tony and the staff, learned about the history of the place and North Beach.  It was a very personal dining experience. If you want to be  left alone and dine in solitude I'm sure that's an option but where Michelangelo's shined was good priced, good tasting food with a fun bit of socializing with the crew.  Some have commented on the idea of someone working the sidewalk as pushy.  I like that there is someone who wants to bring you in and while you are eating wants to make sure it lives up to the billing he gave it. I like that the owner is there and the people working feel a sense of ownership and pride in the place.  I'll take that over a restaurant the staff just shows up to work at and goes home with nothing personally invested but time.

Tourist trap! It was a cold and windy day, and we basically settled on this place. The guy outside was working the door trying to entice people to come in by offering a free appetizer. That should of been red flag number one. Any great place wouldn't need to push so hard. It reminded me how the people push things when your vacationing in Mexico. But as I said, it was cold and windy. We are seated and soon after he takes our order. The food arrives, but we never receive a table check the entire time we are there, not one! My wife's salmon is cold, the broccoli had no seasoning what so ever, and the rest was just OK at best. If your starving and everything is closed, this place might do the trick. But if your planning a trip to San Francisco, and your looking for a cool/great place to eat, well, this isn't it! I enjoyed my food at offthegridsf food trucks more then this place. Keep walking down Columbus and find another place to eat at!

The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere is very "real"... looks and feels like a real Italian restaurant, and hearing the staff actually converse in Italian is a good sign, so after eyeing a few in the area, we decided on this place. It was a good choice.
Plastic food for real food prices.  Are you freakin' kidding me.

Massive restaurant. We ate early when the MLB game was on so it was really quiet. Our waitress was very attentive and took our order quickly. Mozzarella sticks to share - 5 large sticks with salsa. They were good. I had the philly steak stacker and my daughter had a bacon cheeseburger. The food was good but pretty standard, not special but tasty and cheap. The restaurant was clean,  the service was good and the restrooms were tidy.

While on vacation, and staying next door to the Ihop restaurant was a real relief when you have a tight itinerary and making sure you get all the thing you wanted to see or do. I will tell you that this place can make my meal just right. I've been to a lot of places for breakfast and this is one place that can make my eggs, over-medium and make it perfect, wow. Thank you, to the cooks. Great job. We will be back, just for the good food, and making it right!
Forget Mama's that line was 2 hours long. Come here instead!
My distasteful experience here revealed grave training & management problems at IHOP.
The manager On duty the 31st Of july 2014 was a terrible person, we where there for a family vacations and:

First, let me just say that once we got seated it was a pleasent experience. Our waitress, SQUIGGLES, was very kind and apologetic about the wait and the food came out quickly and was very delicious. I order the spinach and mushroom omelette, and the holaindaise sauce was amazing.
Extremely slow service; snell pace would be a complement.
Best service we've had at this IHOP.  Thank you Erick.  Food not the best, but service made up for it.

I was seated right away which was good but then we were in limbo for a while after receiving our drinks. I was about to get up and leave when the waiter finally arrived to take our order.  We were asked if everything was alright by at least four different servers after receiving our meal.  I prefer two at the most.  It became a little annoying to get interrupted so many times by different servers.
Four stars for extremely friendly service. Food was just what I expected. Not greasy at all. Coffee was good.

we stopped in for a late breakfast and left with totally mixed feelings. my country omelette with bacon, cheese, onions was scrumptious, but the scorched hash browns inside were totally nasty. once i scraped them all out, it was fine.  hubby's quick two-egg breakfast was very good EXcept for his nasty scorched hash browns. so, the eggs, omelette, sausage, bacon, toast, hotcakes were delicious -- just not the burnt spuds.

The worst experience EVER! I will never attempt to eat here again! This past weekend, I went to breakfast. I was put in a "closed" section of the restaurant with two servers. I placed my order. A half hour later a completely different server brought out my food that was cold. When I complained the food was cold they took it away returning less than five minutes later. I truly believe they just brought me back my original order because the food was still cold. I asked to speak to the manager. All he did was apologize and offer to remake my food. I told him it had already been remade and it was still cold. He apologized again and that was about it until I commented that I was going to give him a poor review on Yelp. Then all of the sudden he was following me back to my table and offering me  30% off my meal. 30% off of cold food that I'm not going to eat? I don't think so. If you want a breakfast that's hot, fast and tastes good. Go to the Hollywood Cafe a few blocks away and bypass IHOP all together!
IHOP!

The IHop was next to our hotel so we decided to try it out for breakfast.  The price of the food was excellent due to the volume of food provided.  We tried their new French Toast specials which was included with our egg orders.  The food was very good and was served quickly. The manager was observed talking with customers to ensure they were satisfied with everything.   The waiters and waitresses were all pleasant and appeared to work in teams.  During our four visits that week we experienced 2 episodes of dirty dishes due to mass dish washing.  Should rinse better to avoid in the future.  Overall it was a good experience and we would dine there again.

I was in San Francisco on a one day business trip I eat here early in the morning, this place was so busy I guess a lot of events was going on up here, I did not want to wait for an table so I sat at the counter and learn a few things all the staff is so attentive to your needs sitting there,IHOP do have juice dispensers for the orange juice and apple juice they pour the juice from minute maid cartons to the glass like I do from home,service was OK  but kinda slow for three pancakes.
I give it one star because first they took to long to get the food ready. Then there was no steak in my steak ommelete! Last time i come here.

Their original pancakes are delicious!  They are quite fluffy but filling, something I didn't expect.  However, I do wish they were a bit sweeter on their own.  I kept drowning mine in syrup and feeling the guilt crashing over me in waves...

This IHOP location just a few blocks from my house is enormous. Seldom a wait to dine here at breakfast time as long as the restaurant is properly staffed.Good pancakes, yummy bacon and sausage. Especially love the future
Hidden away on Beach Street, this city branch is my favorite of the lot.

Chicken and waffles filled me up exceptionally well, artfully crafted with an exquisite crunch that is unforgettable. Goes great with a splash of Tabasco sauce and delightful dunk in their ranch sauce (you have to ask for the ranch and Tabasco).
Really good pancakes but be prepared to bring enough time... Long waiting line on weekends
This review is for this location of IHOP:

We got there so early like about 3am. So we were tired and needed some coffee. I guess many people were getting out from clubs, and so this restaurant was quite busy. But not to the point that the waiters are not able to handle orders. I saw them kind of walking around and passing by my table several times and still not stopping by to take our orders. It took a long time for us to order AND to get our food. This should be the worst IHOP I have ever been to.

This is an interesting IHOP.  Far different from the IHOPs I've been to in Southern Cal.  It just seemed more ergonomically designed.  Being that it was a late night trip, I had a chance to experience the city and the pier from a different perspective.  I can only imagine how busy this IHOP gets in the morning and during the holidays.

Very friendly staff (at least the waiters), and standard IHOP food, which is something to be expected. We had a a breakfast for dinner option, and the berry waffles were pretty awesome, just enough sweets for the early evening.
It's good when I'm early for class or got out of class early. I usually stick to the breakfast items.

its a tradition for my brothers and i to eat at iHOP after midnight at least once a month where we have our breakfast for dinner and i decided to make this a tradition in my family too so i took my husband here for the first time. We had our breakfast plates with eggs, hash and the works and for desert... TIRAMISU  PANCAKES which were DELICIOUS. i couldn't eat it all of course so i took it home and ate it for breakfast the next day :) the service was awesome, our waitress really took care of us and we also took care of her too ;) (ahem, with a nice tip) Only spent $30 on an appetizer, 2 breakfast plates, and 2 desert pancake plates because 1 of the plates was free! they have different specials depending what day you're there i think we were there on a Friday so it was buy one entree get the second free.

I didn't sit at a table, but was directed to sit at the bar type. I waited 3 min, got up to get a menu, then they said a menu will be right there. Person served me water and that someone would be back to take my order. Another 8 minutes go by. Waitresses just walking past me. Another 3 minutes go by. I left. I even told the hostess that I was leaving. And they didn't offer anything like to actually get a waitress or even just take my order. So I left.

If it wasn't for this place being right next door the Radisson hotel we stayed in we wouldn't have went. We waited about 15-20 minutes for a table. Then sat at the table for 15-20 minutes before anyone even took our drink orders. We had 3-4 different people stopping by our table with orders or drinks etc so I am not sure who our waiter was. The food was meh...your typical chain restaurant stuff. Nothing special. We left a little frustrated with the service. Wouldn't recommend going if you are not planning on waiting around for a while in a very noisy restaurant.
If it was cheaper to eat here, I'd be here more often.
They forgot the bananas in my Banana Nut Crunch Pancakes..

This is the WORST ihop ever! Do not come here. I'm not a picky person but waiting over an hour for food is ridiculous. Not only that but We also had to wait for the drinks, and finding the waitress to help you..,good luck with that! Totally Unattentive service. I mean for crying out loud its 4pm on a Saturday with 1/3 full restaurant get with it!!
It was a nice little "normal escape" from all the eccentric places we have been frequenting since being in SF. A break from the fast life with good food and great service.

So I just ordered the sampler breakfast... ate the whole meal saving pancakes for dessert, my pancakes had residue from the previous person's strawberry breakfast, I sent them back. Ten minutes later I was asked how my meal was going....my boyfriend had finished his meal, all other plates were gone.... I was assured they were on the way. Five minutes later they were, my waitress carried them around the corner and chatted. I got up and left. After watching a few orders of pancakes go out I was pretty annoyed, the free breakfast however was delicious minus my pancakes.
THE GOOD:
How can anyone not like iHop? They prepare excellent breakfasts, and always service with a smile! I love their chicken and waffles, so affordable, too!
Simple. Fit. Delicious.
Tasteless omelette! Bad service, cold coffee!
Hard to review I HOP being a chain instead I'm going to give you some tips
I know where it's located and expected less because of it, but my wife and I enjoyed the place very much.

The view is spectacular. The service was friendly and attentive. We thought the food was very good. They were flexible, as our large party was running late. They were great with the two small children as well. I would highly recommend it for a lovely meal with sailboats, ferries and seals sailing and swimming by. Thank you Neptune for making our daughter's birthday fantastic!

The view is nice. The food is eh and overpriced. Also, I kindly asked the staff to put the Chargers game on, which they said they said "wasn't available" and then proceeded to put the Raiders game on (even though the Chargers game was on for a second when we walked in).  For such a prime location, I would expect a lot more.

The view is amazing. Get a seatnear or at the window. Food is good, and a bit pricey. The ahi sandwich was preety food. My partner ordered the crab louie. Way more louiethan crab. Not a bad place to treat yourself.

This place was great. We had their oysters and steamed clams. The oysters were good, but the clams were phenomenal. Its a bit spendy, but it provided great views of the bay and of Alcatraz which was pretty amazing as well. Wait staff also very friendly.
I don't know what everyone else on here with bad reviews ordered, but our meal and everything was amazing.

Really bad experience. Got food poisoning from the clearly frozen seafood. Missed a week of work. On top of that completely overpriced. Beautiful views though. Should've just waited for scoma's.  Tourists with really strong stomachs not afraid to gamble on dubious seafood only.

We booked a table here 2 weeks ago and we were very much looking forward to our evening. Unfortunately, the price we paid did not reflect the quality of the food or the service we received. When paying triple figures for a meal for two, a basic level of table service is expected, however Neptunes seemed to stumble at this for example, my girlfriend's plate was taken away before I had finished my own meal, our main course was brought out whilst we were still eating our starters and as we left the hotel, staff were too busy talking to each other to even say thank you or goodbye to us. This left a bitter taste in my mouth with the restaurant.

Wow, what an experience.  A BAD experience. I had some relatives in from N.Y. and brought them to the pier to see the sites. We went to Neptune's to eat and got some of the worse service I've seen in a restaurant. Or easier was good bit we were egnored at the bar before we got a table.  When we did eat (long wait for the food) only one of five dishes were edible enough to finish.  All this didn't come cheap.  Even with the starters being comped it was more than it was worth. I should have read some of these reviews before going there.

I've visited here more than twice. Frankly the food is quite tasty for me. Service also not bad. Kinda expensive. There's a view of Al Catraz, you can see tourists on the ferry, sunset of Golden Gate Bridge. I've nothing to complain. Try the lobster and lemonade al Catraz

I visited Fisherman's Wharf after a seminar I attended for work and usually the word "waterfront" jumps out at me. I decided to drop by for an early dinner and had the shrimp scampi with a glass of white zinfandel. I enjoyed the meal and the waitress and waiter I had were very polite. It was about 5:30 PM on a Wednesday night so there weren't more than about 10 guests there, so I was able to get very good seating and my food came out quickly. The view was great and I would love to see what it looks like at night or around sunset time. I'll for sure come back but I might have to do it on a date night, it's pricey! This particular meal I was able to write off on an expense report! :)

Great view at the end of the pier! Can see Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, and the sea lions! No wait, very friendly staff, and great food. Price was not bad at all either. We spent $50 after tax and tip for two people.

I hate to say it and I waited a couple weeks before I decided to write it, but Neptune's was the worst excuse for food I have experienced. My wife and I went there after the giants game to have a romantic dinner overlooking the bay. As we ordered the waiter stated they didn't have any of what we wanted on the menu. So, we ordered something else. Well the seafood was average. and my wife ordered a combination seafood cioppino or something. It was supposed to have scallops. there was 1 scallop. and crab, there was no crab. there was a lot of white fish and a couple of shrimp.. I dont even want to comment on my meal. its not worth it.

This place is for tourist. Price is high. You pay for the view. They made you wait for 25 mins even though someone have given us their spot and still told us we still have to wait for 15 mins? There were many empty table?. They want you to buy the drinks while they made you wait for half an hour. That is how they make the money. Don't bother.

We actually love going to this place inspite of the mixed reviews. We like the oyster dishes, the clam chowder and the steak. The service also has been great whenever we've gone there including accommodating a request for window side table while being late for our appointment.
The rating here is pretty accurate. The food is just average. Location and view make it what it is.
Bar absolutely worthless

My husband and I ate here prior to an Alcatraz tour.  The restaurant itself was nice and has great views.  We could see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. The service was good as well.  The food was subpar with an expensive prices tag.  Clearly you are paying for the views.  All in all a good experience though.

Food wise I'd give it 3 stars.  It's good seafood,  a bit on the expensive side but still good.  The views I'd give 5 stars.  Stunning views of the water and the boats are fun to watch while waiting.  Even though our waiter wasn't very talkative he was great,  i sure appreciated him. I'm not a big fan of overly bubbly wait staff and we tipped him appropriately for that.
