This is a regular spot to visit when playing tourist in the city. Usually we have guests visiting from out of town. The primary reason for going is the nostalgia and view of Alcatraz.
Awful!!! Awful service... .. Would probably say awful food but the waitress brought us our check after the salad and completely forgot our entree...

This place was great! My husband and I walked around for quite a while around the pier and finally settled on this place. I quickly read the reviews and thought it would be mediocre, but it was really yummy! My husband had a burger and I had the bronzed swordfish. The swordfish was awesome, and the crab bits on top definitely made it that much better! We had two staff members (I think one was an owner or manager) come and ask us how our lunch was, and check in on the experience. Our waiter was really nice and helpful. And the VIEW! Our table was next to a window overlooking the bay, and Alcatraz. There are so many windows. It's gorgeous!

Not worth the trip.  Way overpriced and the food was horrible.  The service and staff was not friendly.  It appears that they rely on the tourists for their customers.  I can't see any locals coming hear. It was way overpriced.

Went there today for clam chowder in a bread bowl, it was good but they could've done something with the bread bowl. They emptied a bread round and filled it with soup, didn't toast it or anything. for $14 dollars that wasn't worth it.
Save your money. Food was mediocre at best. Great views with a sun burn if needed.  Sun shades would be a great investment.

I'm surprised at all the mediocre reviews. Yes, this place is expensive but it's location makes that expected. First, we arrived on a Sunday evening at the height of tourist season. We were seated immediately. The service was exceptional. My husband had the special which was a swordfish dish and he loved it. I had shrimp scampi that was to die for. We ended the meal by sharing the duet chocolate cake. My only complaint was that it was a little small to share. But that's also because it was so yummy that I wanted to eat the entire thing myself.

For being a higher end restaurant on  Pier 39 I expected better. We came in and just had appetizers and drinks in the bar area at a table.  We were greeted almost immediately and given menus. Within two minutes asked if we were ready to order. We asked for a couple more minutes. I meant as in five minutes max. I would have been able to make up my mind. The waitress didn't come back for 25 minutes. We almost walked  out but didn't  want to fight the crowd at another restaurant. We ordered drinks and appetizers. I had a glass of house Pinot my BF a non- alcoholic beverage. The drinks were fine. However the calamari and lobster bisque was awful. The calamari had no flavor to it. It almost didn't have any batter on it. It was this small skimpy portion for $15. The lobster bisque was cold as heck. Smelled kind of fishy. My BF wouldn't even finish it. I was starving so I finished mine and we just got the heck out of there. Two appetizers, a non alcoholic, and a glass of house wine $52 not including a tip. Poor service. I wont be back. Thanks but no thanks.

DONT EVER COME HERE NO MATTER HOW HUNGRY YOU ARE ;( I have never been so dissapointed at the point where I didnt even finish the food. They taste bad and are so PRICEY. The only good side is you can look at the ocean view thou.
Good seafood, great scenery, and a pleasant environment.  The views from the restaurant are magnificent!

I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked my meal at Neptunes. I was walking around fisherman's wharf with some out of town friends and we decided to have dinner at Neptunes on a whim. I was hesitant at first because I thought it was going to be an overpriced meal to scam tourists out of their vacation dollars. However, I thought our meal was reasonably priced.

I enjoyed the view more than the food. Their menu is pretty pricey. We paid $8 for a cup of clam chowder when the restaurant nearby was much cheaper. The food is average, nothing to rave about. For being so expensive, I would like the food to taste like their prices. Also, their menu was somewhat confusing to read.

For the price$$$$$ the food is just okay. It's not great or stellar. Nothing to brag about. The waiters did a good job but were sort of pushy with wine, appetizers and desserts. None of which we wanted. The view was beautiful facing Alcatraz. We saw a couple pelicans driving into to water for dinner. Sea loins were out due to mating season, but that's okay.

We were here June 24th. Service was great! Perfect weather---perfect view!!! I had Ahi Sesame steak and it was the best! My kids enjoyed the seafood platter and the seafood pasta, hubby had grilled swordfish :) Restrooms were clean!

My son's engagement party Sunday afternoon at Neptune's Waterfront Grill was spectacular! All of the staff was so kind and gracious. The food was wonderful. The view is amazing. We had delicious calimari, shrimp, clam chowder, swordfish, and ahi. The wine selection is excellent.

Great place to eat. Beautiful view of the Bay and food was simply amazing. We had coconut shrimp, strawberry salad and BBQ chicken pizza. Service was terrific too. They gave us a corner booth that over looked the entire bay and Alcatraz
As others have mentioned, the view is unbeatable. Two stars for that. The rest of my experience there was off-putting, to say the least...
The food here is amazing. The atmosphere and views are spectacular too. James is a great server and made our  entire dinner wonderful.
First time here today, June 7th. Myself and my fiancé were very impressed. The restaurant is nice and very clean, great waterfront views all around. Not dark, lighting was perfect.

Neptune's motto is: "Come for the food ... stay for the view."  I suggest that you:  "Come for the view ... stay for the food."  The food is fine, but the excellent views of San Francisco Bay, including Alcatraz, are hard to beat on a warm day when the bay is bustling with maritime activity.  The service -- while friendly and earnest -- is quite slow.  Although Neptune's was nearly empty when we walked in shortly after 11 AM, we waited quite a while to order and even longer for the food to begin trickling out from the kitchen.  To its credit, Neptune's provided complimentary desserts for the whole table.

Hideous. I haven't sent a meal back to the kitchen in years. The $29 swordfish dinner was very raw twice then over cooked. It ruined our dinner because I waited so long. The restaurant and bathrooms are dirty. The Caesar lettuce was brown. The bread was stale. The food is icky and expensive!!!!!
Where is Basta Pasta in Berkeley?
Good italian food. let me tell you basta pasta is the best italian restaurant in berkeley, and i'm italian so i know the real mediterranean cusine.
Decent Italian. Nice atmosphere. Sausage is spicy. Liked the linguine and clam sauce, but nothing extraordinary. Good lunch place.

I can't remember how many times I went to this establishment and was treated like family!  Everyone of the staff members were terrific, the food was awesome, great atmosphere and AFFORDABLE!  Great date place, not pretentious.  I've been away from the city for years and was almost moved to tears to find that it had closed.  Farewell Basta you will be missed. :-(

I'll add my own ten year old review, since this place has probably been gone that long. They had the best pesto I've ever had.  Reasonable prices in SF..amazing!  Guess I know why they closed.  It was indeed very good.
I used to work here.  Franca Orsi was one of the most gracious people I have ever worked for.  Great manager.  Laid back but got the job done............well.
Love this place!
iv'e been there a hundred times but did i ever really like it?

Friends from out-of-town visited and we sat in my living room and talked until 10 PM. Now it's time for supper. Where to go? Basta Pasta. Service was superb, food excellent. Didn't kick us out until after 2 AM. San Francisco is one of the finest restaurant cities in the world and Basta Pasta is one of the finest restaurants in San Francisco.
Good Italian Rest in North Beach (Grant and Vallejo). Good place for Late night Dinner.
Stopped here because I wanted seafood and there weren't many fast options for that on the pier.

We have been here twice and have always liked the creamy clamp chowder in bread bowl. The fried prawns and fish and calamari were not that impressive. Best to stay away from fried stuff. Service has been quick. It is always crowded and we have been lucky to find a seat/high stool inside...sharing a table with others. This place is a good option when you are in a rush and don't want to spend a lot. However, it can be messy and unclean.

My shrimp & crab chowder was missing something. But my seafood combo was GOOD.  The octopus was crispy and light fish perfectly cooked with yummy shrimp. Note if you order a pitcher of beer the is a $3 deposit.

If I had a choice I wouldnt even give this place one star. This place has NO CONSISTENCY!! I ordered a wrap the first time and it wasnt bad. I was excited to come back but the wrap had no taste and it was just falling apart. No wonder this place has such a low review. Dont waste your time and come here....SPEND YOUR MONEY SOMETHING THAT IS ACTUALLY WORTH IT!! DO NOT COME HERE :)..

Very disappointing. If I weren't so hungry and rushed to dig in, I would have remembered to take a picture of the sad excuse for my order. I ordered the fried calamari and the garlic fries.  I wouldn't be so critical if it weren't for the fact that I settled on this establishment when there are so many others I should have looked at. I paid near $10 for a small serving of 7 pieces of what they must have considered to be calamari.  The fries made the small pieces look ridiculous.  Also their "slaw"...it was like the portion you would get in a ketchup cup.  Those small paper ones.  I didn't even touch it. It was such a disappointment.  The only thing that kept my mind off of it was the cold beer they had on tap.  $16 for a pitcher of Dos Equis amber. By the way, they do take a $3 deposit for the pitcher so you're obliged to return it at the register for that money back.

Don't fall for this tourist trap.  I made the mistake of not checking yelp before coming here :( fish & chips for $10 was so small,  2 small pieces of fish& stingy chips :( soup bowl was stale bread & cold soup
More like a 3 minus....Food was decent ( I enjoyed my fish and chips, and the soup in bread bowl was great ), and my Goddaughter enjoyed her shrimp dish.
Awesome food! Great selection of seafood, yummy blend of flavors, and fun atmosphere.  Highly recommended this place if you're looking for a little bit of everything Pier 39 has to offer!

Wow, why did I eat here? Mostly, why did I bring my kids to eat this crap? It looked like the food would be ok walking up but as soon as I got to the counter I wanted to walk out but my husband didn't want to because he was being hungry and impatient ( yes, he's like having a 3rd child at times ). But that impatience got us stuck with a horrible meal at extremely unclean tables. The food was super greasy yet flavorless. They're were pigeons pooping all over and begging. Just nasty. Never again.
Poor service. Paid $10 for a plate of shrimp that included 4 shrimp and a bunch of soggy fries. Avoid this restaurant!!!

Nothing special and I'm going to keep this very brief. Don't order the clam chowder bread bowl. But if your want to try the other stuff the go right on ahead nothing special it's all deep fried food..

This place was just average for me. They don't give you very many shrimp for the price you pay. But the shrimp was very tasty and good so I rate them 3 stars. They need to be more clean tho. The tables were dirty and I had to clean mine myself

Grabbed lunch here before catching the boat to Alcatraz.  The food came out quick and it was good.  The kids meal was big.  I had the fried shrimp it was great!  Their slaw was good.  For a quick meal I thought it was great and there was plenty of seating inside and out.  This is a fast food type place and it is in a pricey tourist location.

I'm not sure why reviews are so low here, this is a classic FastSeaFood joint. It looks like most people are expecting something magical while ordering deep fried comfort food. This is not a restaurant, but a quick bite place.

Hungry for fish & chips and ate here after I found Cod Mothers closed. It was ok... nothing standing out really good or bad. Fish was pre-breaded frozen variety. Fries and slaw was good. Service was blah. It was run by a crew of young people that seemed to care less about you or your food. There are too many eating establishments on Pier 39 to settle for this.

Got fish & chips, the batter was a bit hard and the portion was quite small, mostly made up by the chips. The chips themselves were simply not up to par - frozen, dry, and served lukewarm. Quite expensive for the quality.

I was craving chowder so I grabbed a cup of shrimp and crab chowder ($6.45) and a side of slaw ($2.50) to go and went in my merry way. I was content at the fair pricing in an expensive city (and an expensive part of an expensive city). When I arrived home I unpacked my light dinner. My first impression was that both items were surprisingly greasy looking. The chowder had a "slick" of oil on it. Although the soup was salted and seasoned to perfection, I was not pleased with the oily texture and total lack of crab and shrimp :( The slaw was un impressive as well. It was pretty oily and not very crispy due to not being chilled (like on ice or kept in a fridge). In the restaurant's defense, I will add that the slaw is typically an add-on to sandwiches and wraps as a condiment or a garnish for dinner plates. I will try another seafood stand next time-- I know there's some badass chowder in this town!

This is my second time here and I love this place. I read some of the reviews and I have to disagree. I had their combo basket the first time and their shrimp wrap the second and loved them both. What attracted me to this restaurant was the actual clientele eating inside. Very relaxed feel to the restaurant and an inviting atmosphere. Great for a quick lunch or hang around and share a pitcher of cold beer. Friendly staff and clean kitchen. I honestly cannot complain about this restaurant. Keep up the good work!
Ordered clam chowder on a sourdough bread.
Wanted to try a new fish and chips place besides the place I usually go to (Pier Market Seafood).
After sitting at mangos for 40 minutes with no drinks or acknowledgement we came here.
Salmon plate was very nice; fish & chips ok as well. Give it 3 stars because every table in the place was dirty & the prices are quite high.
My co-worker and I had gone for a walk down the Embarcadero - it was a beautiful day out, sunny and warm by San Francisco standards. We ended up at Pier 39 and found ourselves in want of some food.
Wtf? $11 got me a couple shrimp, awful calamari, and Costco fish. How can you not have fees fish on pier 39? Never again.
Came here for lunch.

I was hungry, and meandering around Pier 39 looking for something to eat. I figured I'd get something fishy. I was on the pier after all.  The sign for this place intrigued me. I know I'm not supposed to 'judge a book by it's cover' but this 'cover' was neat, and I went in to eat. The outside tables were full, and the inside tables were also full. It's a pretty crowded place! I guess they're doing well.
Service was awful!!! These Asians were rude!!! But on the bright side the fish tacos were yummy!!!!
Came here with friends today despite the scorching heat. Inside was like a toaster since outside was so hot!

if i could give it negative stars or 0 stars i would. We get there its super crowded so we assume that its popular and good. No just popular and im assuming its only because of the attraction of feeding nasty diseased pigeons that swamp at you for your food because the food couldnt have been the reason so many people were there. The price couldnt have been the reason so many people were there because you pay and arm and a leg for fish and chips alone. The customer service couldn't have been the reason because they were either busy rolling their eyes at you for a simple request of "please clean the bird crap off the table so we can sit" or they were too busy texting. Super rude!!
Hooked.

I'm wavering between a 3 and a 4, but the 4 it will be.  Mostly because the customer service was really nice -- and it is surprisingly a bit difficult to find a clam strips dinner in the SF area.  It was gourmet, but hit the spot, and the fries were really good too.  Wish they had slightly more comfortable tables to sit on, but all in all -- a good spot.
Walkin around the wharf one day and we got a bit hungry. Since we've never tried this joint we decided to give it a go.
Don't go, stay out!

This was one of the one places my friends and I saw that served both a crab chowder and clam chowder. It took us a while. The crab chowder was a crab and shrimp chowder that was tomato-based, and it was really good. I still liked the original clam chowder, but it was definitely worth a try. I thought it was a little cheaper than some of the other places on the pier.

As I enter the establishment first thing that pops out is their Crab Chowder. Instantly of course, I HAD to order this.  There was also clam chowder which was tempting but I was set on the Crab Chowder.  My mouth was watering, the anticipation of that first taste was killing me. I continuously blow on the chowder on my spoon, making sure I don't burn my tongue & ruin the experience.  Finally, I taste it & it was... dull.  Grabbed the pepper, surely the pepper will make a difference... Nothing.  *Sigh. This sucks.  I should've checked yelp first.  One of the very few times, I don't check reviews on yelp & I was very disappointed!!  Normally, it's whatev, right?! But it cost an arm & leg that I was sure I was going to enjoy it.
This place was recently remodeled and I must say that it looks way better now!
Compared to other places on the pier, this place is very cheap and its a good place if you want something quick and filling to hold you off until dinner time.

This place blows! Dirty, nasty place. Tables weren't clean. Food was overcooked and overpriced. $30 for fish and chips and the 8.5 oz sodas that we got ripped off on. Once I realized they had fountain soda, I tried exchanging them which turned into fiasco. And the soda was flat and they wouldn't change the CO2. When we asked to just get the bottled sodas instead, they said there was a price difference. 16 cents!! We had to douse the fish in vinegar and tartar sauce to eat it. Nasty. Don't do it!
Standard touristy fare but priced low by Fisherman's Wharf standards.

This place is slow and inconsistent.  The chicken fingers basket is way too expensive ($8 for two pieces and a small amount of soggy fries).  Fish & chips has equally soggy fries and okay tasting fish.  It's a better value with three pieces for $8 but I can get better tasting fish and more fries from Carl's Jr. for three dollars less.
The name and the look of it may be deceiving, but the food was GREAT.

I usually come here for lunch. I've tried the spaghetti and meatballs. I've tried the Monte Cristo which I really like. I'm hoping to try some of the other daily specials in the near future. I really liked the spaghetti sauce as well as the portion.

Wonderful, traditional Italian-American restaurant. Friendly service and food that tastes like what Nonna would make at home.  This isn't the Tuscan or Ligurian food you'd get at an upscale Italian restaurant, but delicious Southern Italian food (Calabrian, Sicilian) you find all over the US East Coast. If you live in the West and have a craving for spaghetti with meatballs, Veal Marsala, or great Chicken Parm....this is the place!
Love this place. I didn't catch the server's name, but he has been there a long time, knows the menu inside and out, is very friendly and makes good suggestions.

Ordered delivery which was posted as 45-60 mins delivery time.  2 hours later, I was the one who had to find out where my food was and where it wasn't at (my home).  So strike one.  Shame to because I was looking forward to trying a new place.
This is where I go for an Italian lunch - and here is why:

I read the reviews and totally confused. This place was horrible !! My pasta Alfredo was so bad no flavour and pasty:(( cold bread with packaged butter !! Maybe for some this place is quality  then they need to up the bar alot and try somewhere else to see what their missing .
Love love love this place.  Great history, friendly owners.  A must stop when in little Italy. Great price on the lunch menu. Outside street seating was a plus.
I've been here twice now and all the people I go with seem to love it every time (and have been coming here for years) but I have been disappointed both times.

This place used to be a couple blocks up the street on the corner some years ago, then it moved to it's current location. It's been a San Francisco staple for over half a century. The food is excellent, their calamari is the best you'll ever eat, I promise!!! Pasta is excellent, I've never had a bad meal here in all the years I've ate here, and I've been coming here since i was literally an infant with my family.

This was my first time here.  I came with a large group. It was wonderful. The wine was flowing. The fish plate appetizers was amazing. It had everything.  The Pallele was great.  I had the chicken Marsala and enjoyed it.  Everyone loved their meal.

In town for business - I walked for a while then decided to eat here racist it was getting late 8:15 - disappointed - stale cold bread to start - small $7 salad - then wait..... Wait.... Still waiting for my chicken parm - it's now 9:05 and they are closing around me?

Amazing! We were recommended to eat here as my fiance and I were looking for a caterer for our wedding in September 13'.  They typically don't like to cater, but the dinner we enjoyed was beyond delicious and anything else we had tried, and we asked Gespare very nicely, and he graciously agreed.  The food delivered to our wedding was perfect; warm, tasty, and very much enjoyed by all of our guests.  We continue to return and eat here, and the food is constantly great, and beyond expectations.

Flavor was good, but the quality of the ingredients could have been better, especially when it's seafood so close to the pier. Overall - I would say 3.5, but Yelp doesn't do half star ratings in reviews.
I've been here a few times and have enjoyed every single visit.

Excellent service. excellent food. the only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is the butter is served in foil packets. My wife had muscles and their were twice the amount as any other restaurant I've been to.
Sometimes one tries a restaurant, for no other reason than you're standing in front of it!

I know this place has a lot of history, and I wanted to like it...  The service was good.  Prices OK.  Ambiance kinda average.  But I just wasn't that excited about the food.  Nothing to write home about.  Meh.
First let me state that I only tried two items here: panella and meatballs as we visited Original US as part of the food tour.
five stars because everything we ordered tasted excellent and prices are very good.

We ate here on a Friday night and on a bit of short timeline. The waiter did a good job moving our order through, although he did misinterpret our request to split a kid's meal and brought a split adult meal. Other than that, the service was great and the server was really friendly. The food was good, I had the baked rigatoni which I thought was delicious although a little dry. My wife ordered the half antipasto, which was just meats, cheese and veges, no salad, but she liked it.  The kids' spaghetti and meatballs were good, but they asked for more ragu' also. We would go back again when we have more time to explore the menu a little.

Bus boy seated us after standing in front for a couple of minutes in a very quiet Thursday evening... manager was at best in different to us being there... Served us the wrong wine... Food ok... Felt very cold and not very friendly
I am writing this review after removing a one star review of the Original US that I had posted in April of 2013.
Very, very good.

Bread was not fresh. Mozzarella sticks were overlooked. Not sure how that's possible. Our main course took over 25 minutes to be served. The Chicken Piccata sauce was tart and chicken was chewy. Chicken Parmesan was burnt at the bottom and red sauce was watery. Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken had chewy chicken which seemed to have been microwaved. The pasta and sauce was okay.  Kids Pasta with butter was okay but fries were dry. Overall it was disappointing coming to Little Italy for such an awful mean.

This was one of our stops during our sidewalk food tour (which was fantastic by the way). We sampled the panelle (garbanzo bean fritters), the meatballs, and an eggplant dish. All were delicious, especially the panelle, which I've never had before. The texture is light and airy and completely original in flavor. I would come back just to taste these again! The meatballs were very good too. Meaty but not fatty, and very moist. The eggplant was good too, but I'm not much of an eggplant fan.
NORTH BEACH EATING PART V: SICILIAN CUISINE

My grandparents are first generation Italians, and always used to eat here whenever they visited SF. Just went back for the first time since I was a little girl, and was more than pleased. The gnocchi gorgonzola was, by far, the best I've ever had! Melted right in your mouth! Definitely looking forward to going back again :)
A small place with good quality food and great service...love their carbonara. WIll certainly come back here.

The food was decent, but the whole evening was overshadowed by the horrible service. We waited over 30 minutes for our entrees, and had to nag the waiters several times to get our food. They were in attentive and unapologetic. Then it took forever to get a bill! What a disappointing experience.

I so love this restaurant in North Beach. Their fish is SO fresh and delicious, the pasta is delicious and the staff is always so friendly. For a true Italian-San Francisco experience, don't miss Original US Restaurant!

This place was more fun than I expected based on the cheesy name.  The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was entertaining.  Italian was spoken everywhere including most of the customers.  It looked like a ratio of 10:9 Italian to non-Italian customers.  And the main guy (owner?) was charming.  Glad we stopped in!

Went here for dinner after trying their meatballs (Spahettie Polpette) on the Sidwalk Food Tour of North Beach. Tried everyone's food at our table (there were 6 of us) and everyone had yummy items! The special for Thursday was a spinach and ricotta cannelloni, and it was my favorite thing to try (...I ate a few bites from my grandma's plate...sorry grandma). I ordered the Penne Arrabbiata, which I tried in Rome last year - I knew it would be a little spicy, but I swear when I ate it in Rome, it was not too hot. At Original US, it was blazingly hot and I was crying and snotty from the heat - it was so good I kept eating it, but I could not believe how excruciatingly spicy it was! spaghetti polpette, the ricotta and spinach cannelloni, the spaghetti pesto trapanese , gnocchi bolognese and even the corned beef and cabbage were all top notch. This felt like a place that a lot of local Italians frequent, it seemed like everyone knew each other and the owner kept greeting people off the street that he knew! I'd come back here for sure.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in SF. We live here so have many great places to try out. When we want to stick with "tried and true" we come here-a lot! The salmon is always good, the meatballs are excellent, and the service is friendly.

I have been to most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach and US Restaurant is by the the freshest, most authentic Itallian restaurant. It is my new go-to restaurant. The quality of food is excellent and the cooking style is not heavy. The prices are very low compared to all the other restaurants on Columbus which is another big plus. You can't make the dishes at home for the prices they charge. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants good, fresh Italian food for a good price.

This place was recommended by a local friend and then, later, by a touring couple who we encountered while dining there (on their second visit in two days :P). I loved it and even my other friend, who knows his Italian food, gave it a rave review.
From 8/2011

My parents, husband and I were walking around North Beach looking for a good place to eat. My mom asked a man on the street if he has any suggestions and he suggested this place. His recommendation was right on point!
I love McDonalds...lol Its cheap and fills the tummy!

I once saw a guy dressed up like a Bounty Hunter patronize this McDonald's. He was very big, white, with a shaved head. He was wearing all black; his black, military-like leather vest sported a patch on the breast pocket that read "Street Ready" and he had a pair of handcuffs attached to his belt.
Came in around 10pm and place was clean and run well. Fast service and hot food. Nothing like an american hamburger after a week of fish and chips, and clam chowder.

For McDonalds this one does OK. Service isn't great but it's not the worst. Even though it's on the wharf it never gets too busy. And clean! Even the restrooms stay nice and clean which is saying something because everyone and their mother uses them. They also make the food faaaaast!
Came here to get an iced coffee.

Review ur orders b4 leaving the line. Ordered a #4 w juice& #6 w coffee, got 1 sandwich 2 hashbrowns & 1 coffee. Wtf? Let them know there was a mistake  & they said that was a lg #4. So did the guy assume I was just babbling about the #6? Idiot! Saw at least 3 more orders go back. Beware!
Meters are on til 11pm even on a fucking sunday.  The food here is very expensive.  I hate the wharf therefore I hate my condo.
I mean its Mc Donalds. So your probaly wondering I am writing a review about this place. It is because this place stood out. This play it actually worth getting that double cheeseburger at. Go Here.

Today after my 5.4 mile walk from the Mission District and today I chose the #1 The Big Mac Special with Large Fries and Drink I enjoyed coming here although today my burger looked smaller than usual hmmmm..... why is that anyways the fries was fresh and hot and additional Hot Mustard Sauce for that fries and the Coca Cola needs more Carborantion. I believe they are two locations I like to go in San Francisco this place and the one in the Financial District near the Embarcadero Center. And some are ok I guess not these guys they are the best place inside the city limits.

I'm not reviewing the food because really they all taste the same at every Mickey D's in the world.  I am giving it 4 stars for alternate menu items that you can't find at any MD's but here!  We dropped by for a snack and I found out that they were offering their version of the Java Chip Frappucino. They also sell ice cream cones hand dipped in Magic Shell.  Prices are reasonable considering the neighborhood.  One drawback - they do not automatically offer napkins.  I had to go back to the counter and ask for them.

Usually so busy with Tourists who can't find a decent place to eat anywhere else in the Wharf. However when its not. and I am the only one there, I am waiting forever for my food. And by forever I mean at times up to 20 minutes just for a Mc double!!! and that's right folks, I am sometimes the ONLY one in the store!
Sujuan yen manager is rude and uses harsh tone. Rest is good
They usually repeat your order, but a few times, they didn't & they messed up my order.
This place is probably the fanciest Mc Donald's I've been in the city. It looks nice. Bathroom is cleaner than other ones. Nice space.
Very cool mcdonalds in the heart of San Francisco !
This place does not even deserve a star!
Still has the Dollar Menu at a $1, not $1.39 like other places..

i'm sitting here at work with two mcdoubles with one patty in each of em!!!! this an outrage. half of the time theyre quick and accurate, the other half either somehow slow or something like this happens...

The McD's at Fisherman's Wharf is probably the most efficient and well operated store in the city. The staff is always trying to keep the space clean, and management has zero tolerance for aggressive panhandling.
the food was good, but i think the prices are not normal like is it more expensive so they can hustle the tourists or what because i know a #2 is below $6 atleast.. not in this mcdonalds.

Yuck is all I have to say about this location. From the filth that covered the ordering/eating area to the kitchen filled with a staff that looked like they failed to shower or remove their blue tooth earpiece. Cold fries and dirty hands. Yuck!
Thank g-d for consistency.  Where would we be without it?  Isn't there some comfort at eating at Mickey Dees?

After getting kicked out of the Rainforest Cafe we came over here and had a good time.  The staff was glad to have us and the kids loved my friends green wig.  Many happy meals and much fun where had.
Being that it was this close to the Pier,it was the only thing that was open when we arrived to SF long about 8:30 am.We walk into a full house,and I dont mean a two and a three-of-a-kind.

Ugh.  I'll 'fess up to eating here.  It was Fleet Week, and with less than 30 minutes to get food and make it to our special place to watch the Blue Angels, my friend and I had some tough choices to make.  While I would have preferred In n Out, the line there stretched out the door.  This McDonald's got us in and out in less than 5 minutes and I am grateful for that.

Haha silly that I am the first but the reason why I am reviewing this place is that my friend and I found a coupon for this particular Mcdonald's in the SF Guide for Buy one extra value meal, get one free. Heck, we are in the area and we jetted to Mcdonald's in Fisherman's Wharf. It is a tourist trap so my advice is, come after 6pm when metered parking is free, grab one of those SF Guide books and maps which can be found on every corner and bring a friend along for a very satisfying Mcdonald's meal. For less than 6 bucks, my friend and I got two chicken nugget meals and I am definitely not complaining. Service is quick here and this Mcdonald's is super busy and crazy. But if you want to save a few bucks, follow my steps and you'll just be as happy as I was hahaha. Oh how I love Mcdonald's chicken nuggets, funny I just had some a few minutes ago lol. Bathrooms are token use only but there is a longgggggggggg line and it isn't clean. Staff is quick and friendly as well.
It's probably the cleanest McDonalds you'll ever go to, thanks to the homeless man who incessantly cleaned all the tables (he cleaned the table next to me that nobody sat at at least 3 times).

have you heard of SanFran Tales of the City...this is for the newbies with bleeding hearts cuz they came out from alabammy wid da banjo and their needs, recognizing ohhh mcddezzies oh donchacriesfomeee:

Okay, so blast me with a thunderbolt for having wandered into this major major tourist trap.

Food is good, prices r great for the area/most of sf. But employees seemed ghetto. One employee who's handling food is talking obviously to a friend wile standing over the fryers and is not minding her language... I get it, it's not a 5 star restaurant but a little more professionalism could be had.

Very normal prices for those of us not use to spending a ton of cash on food.  We unfortunately arrived on an evening when the sewer was giving them trouble.  Seems to be a reoccurring theme for the restaurants of San Francisco.  Anyway, to rate the store.  The staff was very polite and answered questions with a smile.  Very important because we were there pretty late.  Our food order was small.  We wanted to sample a few things since we were only looking for a snack.

Big positive is that they charge normal prices like two tacos for $0.99. Most places in this neighborhood gouge the tourists. Even the McDonalds down the street got rid of their Dollar Menu and jacked up their other prices.

We ate here twice on a  recent weekend trip to Fisherman's Wharf (OK, it was half a block from the hotel so it was just too easy to drop in).  The food was fresh and the service was friendly and quick.  It's a newer store as well.  Thumbs up if you're looking for a quick cheap meal in this neighborhood.
Wow after long time was able to find some thing yummy in this area ... was tired with same in and out burger:(

Do not come here.  Like many for how it looks.  Kids managing the place.  Radio is loud and mostly pink noise. Not clean.  Does open even though is cold.  Smell is not good.  You won't have a good time here.
Oh good service, ultimate cheeseburger is the best over at this jack. Best Jack in the city.
